55.description: I haven't tried too much on the menu but their fries are good. However, I haven't been back there in a very long time due to the perverted cooks that gawk making me feel uncomfortable

9.description: The best Italian beef in Chicago! It has gotten pretty pricey over the years, so I don't come as often.

26.description: Best beef sandwich you'll find around the hill-less Chicagoland area, people inside the place love and know what they're doing.  God blessed our earth with two things: beautiful men, and Mr. Beef.

25.description: This is a great place if your are craving an authentic Chicago Italian Beef or just want awesome pizza. The giardiniera they use on their Italian Beef is amazing and they don't skimp out on the meat they put on their burgers and sandwiches.The pizza is delicious with great quality in the toppings and they'll even put giardiniera on your pizza if you want. I wish they also served Deep Dish Pizza, but you can't have everything I guess. If you eat in you'll find an upbeat place thanks to it's 50's style pictures on the wall, friendly, and clean. So enjoy a full Chicago Italian Beef!

12.description: Best beef in town and delicious pizza. Cordial service, drink refills, bbq beef on Saturday for $1.90. You cant go wrong here.

59.description: wow. i have eaten a lot of italian beef over the years, much of it is mediocre (usually not very tasty, or low quality of meat).got a lb over the weekend. the taste was excellent, as was the quality of the thinly shaved meat. this is going on my regular place list!

21.description: Mr beef has the best beef in Chicago once you've tried one of theirs you will never want anybody else's Pizza excellent also

17.description: This is a great place if your are craving an authentic Chicago Italian Beef or just want awesome pizza. The giardiniera they use on their Italian Beef is amazing and they don't skimp out on the meat they put on their burgers and sandwiches.The pizza is delicious with great quality in the toppings and they'll even put giardiniera on your pizza if you want. I wish they also served Deep Dish Pizza, but you can't have everything I guess. If you eat in you'll find an upbeat place thanks to it's 50's style pictures on the wall, friendly, and clean. So enjoy a full Chicago Italian Beef!

10.description: BEST BEEF PERIOD. Size,flavor and texture. Great value and excellent customer service. Karen and Johnny ROCK

5.description: Rosa J. has started doing what a Chicagoan is supposed to do: eating hotdogs, burgers, and sandwiches around towns.  Blissfully, she has been doing so on her days off from work.  Today is MLK Day, and Dr. MLK Jr. would for sure be happy to consume some tasty Chicago-style Italian Beef sandwich, if he had the opportunity.  I would also kindly remind him to add some sweet peppers as well.Rosa J. did the exactly the same: ordered an Italian beef sandwich with sweet peppers (50 cents extra).  I wasn't expecting much from this place, but they obviously know their stuff!  The sandwich was delicious!  Their beef was tender and flavorful to every slice and string.  I can honestly say that it was $6.50 well-spent.  Hubby ordered the cheese pizza and regular-sized fries.  Be aware of that "regular-sized" fries; it was a fairly large serving.  I was glad that I didn't ask for fries; otherwise, I would need a spare stomach.  Their fountain drinks are re-fill able.  Just respectfully ask one of the dudes working behind the counter.  It's freakin' ironic that Wen*y's and Kentucky F'ied Chic*en are the next-door neighbors.  Do not go there, please.  Come to Mr. Beef & Pizza instead.  They also have parking available.  Though tight and congested, the parking lot is ample for the city standard.  It's also very close to the HIP.  Let me tell ya; Harlem Ave. in Chicago is really the road containing some of the best food in the city.

3.description: My family and I used to go here for many many years back in the day and we loved it.  Great beefs hands down UNTIL one day we're in there enjoying a beef and happened to use the restroom and noticed one of the workers DID NOT wash his hands after using the restroom. I almost tossed up my meal and decided from that day forward never again. I don't know if they've enforced that sanitary rule since but I'll just keep enjoying Portillos. For that reason alone I give one star.

35.description: Mr. Beef is the newest edition to my list of top beef joints. While not as good as my favorites - Al's and Jay's - Mr. Beef boasts a quality sandwich. If you're a fan of particularly fresh and crispy giardiniera chock full of celery, than Mr. Beef is the place for you. These peppers are in the same style of Jay's, but with more of a vinegary bite. Overall, the combination of thin, tender beef, a nicely-seasoned au jus, unique peppers, and a soggy Italian roll, makes for a great example of an authentic Chicago beef.

19.description: My fiance and I decided to come here to eat pizza. We've ordered the cheese with beef. I have to say, it was really good. You can tell the sauce is homemade. It's a good sauce made with oregano, cumin, and a bit of sweetness. The beef is juicy and well prepared. It wasn't overly salty or greasy. The decoration and atmosphere is very retro and comfortable. They even serve beer, either Miller and MGD. I should've tried their Italian Beefs!  We'll definitely try their other foods in the near future.

28.description: Best beefs in Chicago. Better than Al's, Jay's, Portillo's, Johnnie's, etc, etc, etc. I'm a beef expert. Seriously THEE BEST. Their pizza is pretty good too. Not "the best" pizza, but yummy enough.

45.description: This place is awesome. Great food. And the service is great. I always get the pound of beef with bread and peppers and a few Italian sausages on the side. It's enough food to feed an army. Highly recommend mr.beef over als beef any day. And they have great customer service. I always feel welcome when I go there.

33.description: They are absolutely the best beefs in the world. When I was pregnant I had to have one weekly and believe me I could still have one weekly but I don't like in Chicago anymore(even though its in Niles it close). I moved an hour away but every time I'm there I get one maybe two. Everyone I've taken there have loved it as well.

43.description: My fiance and I decided to come here to eat pizza. We've ordered the cheese with beef. I have to say, it was really good. You can tell the sauce is homemade. It's a good sauce made with oregano, cumin, and a bit of sweetness. The beef is juicy and well prepared. It wasn't overly salty or greasy. The decoration and atmosphere is very retro and comfortable. They even serve beer, either Miller and MGD. I should've tried their Italian Beefs!  We'll definitely try their other foods in the near future.

2.description: As good as it gets!  Beefs are tops, fries are plentiful and tasty, pizza is really really great! Whenever we are in town we stop in for our Beef fix.

18.description: One of the best beefs ever! Its juicy and flavorful. Better than any other spot I've been too! Highly recommend this place. There pizza and chili are delicious too.

41.description: The best beef , the best sausage pizza and everything else . Great portions . Been coming here since 86 . The staff there is awesome . Can't stop eating there about twice a week at least my kids love it too.

52.description: I ill never eat there again, this place IS NOT kid friendly, they don't have any high chairs, I didn't know this until after I ordered my food, every restaurant has high chairs BUT THIS ONE, if you don't want children in your restaurant PLEASE PUT A SIGN THAT STATES NO CHILDREN!!!! WILL NEVER EAT THERE AGAIN

50.description: After going to see a foreign film on Sunday afternoon I was craving an Italian beef. I didn't want to drive all the way to Portillo's but now I regret not going to Portillo's for my Italian beef fix.  I should have driven to Portillo's and could kick myself in the ass for not doing so since I ended up throwing out most of my food from this joint. Many, many years ago, I heard about this place from a former student who took one of my courses in graduate school.  He always raved about "how fantastic" their food is especially the "Italian beef sandwich." Every now and again he would arrive with a beef from this place, inhale it before the class started, and then belch, burp and fart throughout the entire class time.  Disgusting and disruptive...but I digress....I finally got to try this place.....here's the low-down and the breakdown: When I get my beef dipped at Portillo's the bread does not fall apart or crumble in my hands. I can actually eat the beef with both hands without it ever falling apart.  This was my experience with the bread holding the Italian beef from Mr. Beef & Pizza restaurant. I had to use a plastic knife and fork to eat this mother sucker. WTF, who does that with an Italian beef?  I ate less than half of the beef, because the beef and au jus itself was oh so bland. Where was/is the flavor for this beef?  I was really disappointed. However, the positive is that the beef is lean (not fatty), and it is loaded with 1/2 lb. of beef, so they don't skimp on the meat.  I really, really wanted to like the Italian beef sandwich here. I will not be returning. Another positive is that the service was very friendly and the lady behind the counter greeted me enthusiastically asking "How are you tonight? What can I get for you?"  The service was decent. Positive. It was fast. Positive. This joint does not have a drive through so you have to walk into the restaurant. Not having a drive-thru in 2014? I guess it reflects the "mom and pop" image of the old days. However, today this is considered outdated. The parking lot is small and tight with patches of ice throughout the parking lot. Dangerous. If you slip and fall and get hurt in their parking lot it is a law suit waiting to happen for this business. I am not a french fries fan, but thought maybe they would be like the fries from Portillo's. Wrong again. The positive is that the fries are enough for three people to share -- huge! The negative is that the fries tasted frozen (definitely not fresh). I ended up throwing the fries in the garbage after eating two or three. The bread was like a freakin' sponge. It was probably the worst bread I've ever had (the texture was very weird -- sponge-like and it fell apart).  The Au Jus was tasteless. I couldn't even eat the entire beef.  I gave my dog, Annie, a little bit of the beef meat. She seemed to enjoy it more than I did -- but she'll eat anything!  Unlike me, Annie cannot tell the difference between Portillo's beef and this joint's beef.  The rest of the beef went in the garbage too.  What lesson did I learn?  I learned that I WILL drive out of my way and get my ass over to Portillo's the next time I want an Italian beef sandwich -- wait a minute -- the BEST Italian beef sandwich is at Portillo's. What the hell was I thinking.  This place had some positives and negatives, but for me, it was mostly negative. My expectations for this place were high, but in the end, it was a huge let-down. Would I go back again?  Did I enjoy my food? Was it flavorful? I've answered the questions already. Enough said!!!

4.description: Love Mr Beef and everyone that works here is always so nice ! My favorite neighborhood place.  They have the best beef sandwiches in Chicago in my opinion .

6.description: Not too much to say...They have the best and most consistent beef you will find...Ive been to Johnnie's, Ive been to Al's on Taylor St., both solid beefs but its just not Mr. Beef. Now Ive heard Baris's Italian Deli makes a mean beef, but until I try it Mr. Beef is the one. Its juicy, flavorful (oh that oregeno) , those peppers and it all stays together on the bun. Find me a beef that beats it.

22.description: To start off I've been coming here for about 20 years and not much has changed but the the attitude of One of  the people working there, I don't know what I did but he was  VERY RUDE and kept mumbling under his breath when I walked away all because I didn't get my gravy bread which I know I ordered and it's no big deal because I paid for it and didn't get anything free or even ask for it free. I'm not slamming the food because everybody has a different taste but I am slamming is the customer service that I received was very unacceptable and if he doesn't like his job or serving people he should not work there anymore and he's been there a very long time if they read the yelp reviews they will know who I'm talking about the lady was nice and apologize for his attitude but he say another word not happy at all with the service I received... Pizza I would get four stars beef I would give to but that's just my personal Opinion everybody has different taste buds

15.description: I used to come here for the cheese slices in my fatter, processed food eating days - had to eat something in a hurry Saturday because I was running low on energy and needed some protein fast - opted for a dry beef with hot peppers. Decided only on one bite of the bread since I didn't want the crappy white flour carbs. Trust me, I could have eaten it all!!!The beef was AMAZING!! Haven't had one in years and MUCH BETTER THAN JOHNNIES ON NORTH AVENUE AND A BIGGER BEEF!Very Lean, great quality and flavor, and LOTS OF IT!This is what a Chicago Beef is all about!!!

57.description: Pick up time was less than 20 mins. Good luck getting home with all that yummy goodness! Noms :D

20.description: I been coming here for 20 years and the food is still great. One of the best beef &sausage joints in chicagoland. They also make a killer pizza. They sell slices daily. Great neighborhood 50's diner serving consistency every day for decades. They have a great menu for all ages and they sell ice cold beer of the tap .nice seating,good parking. Affordable and a must try on your bucket list you won't regret it.

36.description: Not too much to say...They have the best and most consistent beef you will find...Ive been to Johnnie's, Ive been to Al's on Taylor St., both solid beefs but its just not Mr. Beef. Now Ive heard Baris's Italian Deli makes a mean beef, but until I try it Mr. Beef is the one. Its juicy, flavorful (oh that oregeno) , those peppers and it all stays together on the bun. Find me a beef that beats it.

14.description: This is my favorite place for Italian Beef as I have been coming here for years. Yes, Johnnie's and Jay's are pretty good as well, but Mr Beef is always consistent. Their hot peppers goes hand in hand with the Italian Beef. I will be coming back for sure.

28.description: Went over there in April for a mani/pedi.  Not a bad place, but don't let Jimmy work on you!  I don't think he has much experience--fairly rough (my heel was actually scraped and raw--which I didn't realize until later).  I too wasn't sure about the condition of his tools, either...shouldn't the cutting edges/what comes into contact with the customer be in the blue stuff?   But he did get all of the callouses off my admittedly bad feet (hence the scrape), and applied the polish precisely.  But they didn't provide me with the little flip floppy things until AFTER the pedi--I had to walk across the floor in bare feet.Price wasn't bad and the color stayed for a couple weeks, though.

1.description: My sister recommended this place to me & my hair was treated wonderfully by a supremely expert stylist who understands hair of all types ( mine being very Puerto Rican curly with Keratin);My hair has never looked so good and i have travelled the world over and paid $$$ for great experience.If you are in Chicago do NOT miss this location, when i return i will definitely go back.Honestly i still think about that hair style she performed on my hair which never behaved so well.

9.description: Just called to see if they had an opening. The answer was "no", because "Lindsey was in last week". Ok? I'm assuming that she is the only stylist, but I have no idea because it would've been my first time there.So I said no problem when is the next opening? "Next week." and then they basically hung up.Ok, thanks for the help. Lindsey good luck with your clientele with your appointment desk being so friendly.

29.description: While the hospitality from the gentleman at the front was superb I was completely disappointed with my manicure and pedicure.  Two friends raved about their service so I thought to check it out. First and last time.  My names were shaped crooked and so much nail polish was slapped on with each coat.  Needless to say as soon as I walked out my nail polish bubble up. Must have been the mixture of oil residue from my pedicure and manicure and the massive amounts of nail polish on my nails. Hospitality rocked, nail service was a complete bust. I was so sad and late to a wedding.

23.description: The first time I went here, I was a little skeptical since it seems almost invisible. I had no idea it was there and I literally live within walking distance. But I must admit, I am very happy I went. They were very helpful with picking out the right shade I wanted for my nails. Since my fist time, I've been back a few times and I don't plan on going to any other places soon.

5.description: Love this place !!! Have been coming here since 2007! Family run and consistently great work! I get my hair, nails, and eyebrows done here!

31.description: The best customer service I have ever received at a nail salon!! Very friendly receptionist! He's great to chit chat with while my nails dried.  My first no- chip & Le did an awesome job.  Loved the natural color she helped me pick.  I'm so happy I finally found a place!! Sticking with Le from here on out! I will definitely go back here to get my hair done with Le's daughter Be.... The lady she was working on looked very happy with her cut.

25.description: Lindsay is the best of the best on haircuts and color!

12.description: I just got my hair done here by Lindsey. I got an bayaloge ombre. After searching and searching for months for someone who can master this technique I stumbled across Le and Be on Yelp. Lindsey had so many fantastic reviews especially about the ombres. Everyone had stated that they were extremely happy with the outcome of the color and the placement so I decided to come and give this salon a try! There were even pictures of the ombre that she had done and they are stunning. As soon as I walked in the salon it looked a little worn down. Lindsey had so many positive reviews I looked past the wear and tear. The staff were super friendly. They offered beverages and made you feel comfortable. After meeting Linsday i felt confident about getting my hair done here. She sounded like she knew what she was doing and had stated ombres were an every day thing for her. I felt at eased. Everything went really well until I seen it dryed. It seemed alittle brassy at first. Then she curled it and it looked cute. Everything looks great when its curled. Today the curls fell out and decided to blow it out to see the final product. Its awful. Its orange and brassy. The bayaloge ombre is very spotchy and looks as if an amateur had done my hair. I am a hair stylist myself and would never allow my clients to walk out of my salon like that. I am very disappointed in the amount I paid and for what my hair looks like now. I recommend going to Gallery of Hair across the street. I will not be returning back. I had high hopes for this salon as well as for Linsday. I gave it two stars because they were very polite.

37.description: Le & Be is the hottest new hair and nail salon in town!  There are not many salons where you can get amazing hair services AND really amazing nail services, this salon gives you the best of both worlds.Lindsay Le is the genius behind this hot new salon, and I had the pleasure of having my haircut from Lindsay Le herself!! Not only did she give me the most amazing hair cut I have ever had (EXACTLY what I wanted), but the service was incredible. Their private quiet shampoo room in the back is just so relaxing, and the scalp and shoulder massage that comes with your special shampoo experience is simply unbeatable!! They also have an amazing color bar and are totally 100% Paul Mitchell! This upscale salon is just what this neighborhood needed.My mani/pedi were incredible as well! The most amazing spa pedicure seats with a built in massage, and the oversized super comfortable chairs for getting a manicure at each station made me feel just too pampered. If you have not tried Le & Be yet, you are missing out!! Another bonus, their website has a full menu with pricing so you can check out the amazing value you will get at Le & Be. (leandbe.com)Best hair cut, manicure and pedicure I have ever had. This is DEFINITELY my new salon.

21.description: My sister recommended me to go to Le and Be and now it's my go-to for haircuts, style, and color. Lindsay takes the time to sit down, talk about what you want done, and explains what she plans to do. Furthermore, after a little shampoo and conditioner wash, she gives an awesome scalp massage. As she cuts, styles, or colors your hair, she talks through tips and advice to style your hair and upkeep, as well as a great person to have any subject conversation with! I have thick hair and she was able to lighten the feel of my hair without making taking away the look of volume. Plus she showed me some work hairstyles that I can do in minuets. As for pricing, for me, I usually don't like to spend too much on hair, and Le and Be is a little on the high end of fairly reasonable, but still worth it!! Hands down - I would recommend Lindsay and continue to go to her.

16.description: This is exactly what I would hope for from a salon.  Everyone was so caring and attentive.  I felt like a princess from the moment I walked in. I am an impatient person. I HATE being stuck in the salon all day. But here was amazing! It's very well planned out.  A haircut starts with a 15 minutes hair, head, neck massage while they was your hair. Then the stylist really takes time to find out what you want. How you want your hair, not only look, but feel! Amazing! The stylist is truly gifted.  I also got my eyebrows dyed and waxed. Perfection. And the experience was Sooo good that I got my nails done! Amazing! Other than my wedding, I've never wanted to do them because I dislike so many things about other salons. Kong killed it on my nails!! They are epically gorgeous!!! AND!!!! For all of this, the total was $73!!! What?!? Crazy!! I'll be back for sure! And you should go too. Seriously, why get treated like crap at a chop-shop when you can be treated like royalty here.

17.description: I have been seeing Lindsay for the last three year and have never had a bad visit. She is a color specialist with affordable prices. I love her and will never trust anyone else with my hair! Thank you Lindsay for always giving me the perfect color and cut!  All you need is parking lot.

10.description: Absolutely the best pedicure I have ever had! They are not only attentive and very detailed but they ensure you are relaxed throughout your experience. I will definitely be back for a manicure!

11.description: I absolutely love this place. Its family owned and everyone of them is super nice. The place is beautiful. I've had my hair done here many of times as well as my nails done here. Total relaxation here just like a salon should be. You can get everything done all in one place. I've been coming here before they added the hair salon. Nails always come out perfect,  as well as my haircut and high lights.

26.description: This place was awesome.  I was a client of gallery of hair but stop going because I couldn't take the pretentious attitudes of the employees.  Le & Be is so much reasonable in price and did a fab job on my hair. Lindsey is great and the hostess was also awesome.  For new clients you pay 35$ for your first cut awesome!! Its true what one of the other reviewer stated the shampoo massage is wonderful.  You enter a washing station which seems like a spa and you get the best shampooing and head massage, literally you will fall asleep.  Lindsey is also great she took her time and also showed me some styling tips.  I've never had a stylist before take time to teach you so much from how to manage your hair to styling tips.  Great place!!!! They are definitely much better than gallery of hair. I'm definitely coming back !!!!

27.description: If I could, I'd only go to Lindsay for hair cuts everytime.  Too bad, I do live 2k mi away from Chicago.  Why the rave about Lindsay?! Lindsay take the time to ask you what you want, explain what she plan to do for your cut, and she just make it look so darn easy each time!  She's one of those professional hair stylists that really know what she's doing with her clients, hair types, and tools!  Pros:- fantastic shampoo massage every time- friendly staff- perfect cut every time- post-cut grows out nicely tooCons:- I don't live close enough to visit every 3-month for trims

35.description: The hot weather made me search for a nail salon nearby my house instead of commuting to the Norridge, especially when I don't have a car. So, I decided to give a try to Le & Be salon, especially after reading great reviews. I scheduled appointment for pedicure and manicure and when I arrived on time, I was still waiting 10 minutes and then was put on the chair for pedicure for another 10 minutes. I started getting irritated, because I don't really like to waste my time. While I was waiting, I was watching the guy what he was doing for the girl on the next chair and I started thinking just walk out. He seemed to me that he does not completely know what he was doing. When he started with me, instead of relaxing I really want to be done with. He was taking the tools looked them, literally touching my toes instead of cutting cuticles etc etc... Actually, I'm glad that he didn't put effort into it because all the tools, towels and stations look so dirty!!!!The pedicure tools were in the dirty glass in the liquid that looked not being changed for a while. I hope I didn't catch any skin disease!!! After the  disaster pedicure I still had to stay for manicure since I scheduled appointment for both. I just wanted be fair. And honestly I should leave after pedicure because was the same story with the cuticles that I still had them after having manicure!!!!The job was done so sloppy.!!!He didn't even wipe the polish on the skin around the nails and on top of everything he performed so-called massage with oily disgusting lotion. Btw, next day the polish on one of my nail already chipped.I'm very disappointed and I learned a huge lesson. I rather suffer a heat exhaustion than go back to this salon. I'm going back to my regular salon. Maybe because was the special the service was lousy, but it wasn't even worth it this $27 plus tip...yes, I still tip but they won't see me there again..In my opinion one star for this salon, especially nail-wise is too much.

8.description: Highly recommend this nail and hair salon to everyone and anyone. I read reviews on this place and I knew everyone recommended this place for a reason! Everyone was great. For example, I am a young male whom never had a mani or pedi before. I was sort of shy and nervous at the same time. While I waited in the chair, I was asked my beverage preference. That was awesome having free coffee or tea!! I was introduced to Jennifer who completed my Pedi. She was amazing and is an expert at nails/massage. She also has a brother (only guy who works there) that is great also at pedicures! My manicure was taken care by Kong who is the brother of Lindsay (part owner) Kong is a going friendly humorous gentleman who is also an expert at nails. Best hand massage ever!! Lindsay is the best at doing hair, even though I didn't get my haircut from her. Please come visit Le and Be!!!! AWESOME TO THE EXTREME!!!

0.description: Been here a few times for coloring and have failed to write a review - what's wrong with me?First off, come here if you need to find a great colorist/stylist.  My girl, Lindsay is 'thee' woman!  Not only does she give orgasmic scalp massages when you get your hair shampooed by her, she is a coloring genius!  Be prepared to show Lindsay some pictures of what you are looking for because lets face it, we're not all that great in describing what we want.  I love that Le & Be uses great products on my hair so it doesn't damage even more like these other salons out there.  I've gotten the balayage and peek-a-boo highlights with Lindsay and I absolutely love her - she's fun/witty and talented.  Prices are definitely reasonable considering all these other salons in the Chicagoland area that can be a hit or miss.  And there's free parking directly across the street from the salon in the parking lot!  #winningI definitely recommend coming here!

20.description: I FINALLY FOUND A NAIL SALON!!I came here Saturday for an acrylic take off and manicure.  First of all, when I called to set the appt, the woman on the phone was super nice.  When I arrived, they sat me down right away, asked if I wanted anything to drink and the nail take off was the easiest/least painful one I ever received.  While I was getting my nails done, the one younger guy asked me how I was and if I needed anything.  Everyone there is very polite & speak perfect english!!  My nails still look great & I will definitely go back.  On top of all this, all I paid for a take off and manicure was $20!!!  You can't beat $10 for a manicure.I've been looking in the area for a nail salon for almost a year now and haven't been satisifed until now.  The other thing that is nice about Le & Be is that it's also a hair salon.  The girl who does hair seems very nice and shows that she loves what she does.  I may possibly go here in the future for my hair as well (prices aren't too bad).

19.description: My mom went in for a manicure... Honestly, I could have painted them better for her then they did.

33.description: What a GREAT nail place! Not expensive at all & Le does awesome pedicures! (No rushing here) Nice customer service :-) What a plus!!! I will be coming back! Ladies and Gents if you enjoy relaxing, you'll like it here!                        PS: Love that the salon is open on Sunday's till 5pm!

2.description: Went in for the color cut special, and will not go anywhere else.  Wonderful haircut, amazing mani/pedi. Great color that is lasting.

34.description: My daughter and I recently got a spa pedicure and manicure at Le and Be salon.  The staff was friendly and made us feel quite welcome.  Both services took a little over an hour and my my was it relaxing.  They even added a nail design for free.  We will definitely go there again.  Great services go a long way and this nail and hair salon do provide upscale salon services for a reasonable price.

32.description: Got a hair cut today and I have to say it's the best haircut that I have had in years.  Lindsay was awesome and really pays attention to any waves you may have in your hair to make your hair "play nice".  I highly recommend this place.  I've had many a bad hair cut and I was not disappointed at all!  Not only that it is very affordable.

18.description: The first time I went here, I was a little skeptical since it seems almost invisible. I had no idea it was there and I literally live within walking distance. But I must admit, I am very happy I went. They were very helpful with picking out the right shade I wanted for my nails. Since my fist time, I've been back a few times and I don't plan on going to any other places soon.

13.description: Wanted a nicer, more relaxing place to get a pedicure and I found it. The ladies and gentleman all had wonderful personalities and they were all kind and welcoming. The minute I walked in I was offered a beverage, and the man at the desk had an adorable attitude. The lady who served me was upbeat and carried an amusing conversation the entire time. I definitely will be returning-its so close to home!

4.description: Lindsay really knows hair!! I absolutely recommend going there. She really knows her stuff!! My mom has really thinning hair and is embarrassed about her lack of hair.(she hadn't visited a hair salon in years)My brother was getting married so  Lindsay styled her hair beautifully made her feel confident for the wedding!!!

24.description: I went to Le&Be today and got my hair colored the ombre style by Lindsey and it came out picture perfect. The colors flowed beautifully just like it should. When I arrived, I was met with smiling faces and was offered a cool glass of water. The scalp massage was such a nice perk when I was getting my hair rinsed. Everything was reasonably priced for anyone on a budget. Over all I will be returning to Le& Be and telling my friends to stop by because it's a gem in the northwest side of Chicago.

6.description: I returned to do another Balayage Ombre, and as the last time, I am in love with how it came out. Lindsey is the best, and I will continue to come to her. May I mention, she gives the BEST scalp massage during the hair washing portion; very relaxing. Thank you so much Lindsey, I'm already receiving numerous complements on my hair.

22.description: I saw Lindsey and she did my hair color ombre style!! Also got a cut, blow dry, and style for unbelievable reasonable price!  I was taken to a spa-like room for my hair wash and awesome scalp message, loved it!  Lindsey and her brother made me feel very comfortable. They also gave me tips on how to style my hair at home.

15.description: I FINALLY FOUND A NAIL SALON!!I came here Saturday for an acrylic take off and manicure.  First of all, when I called to set the appt, the woman on the phone was super nice.  When I arrived, they sat me down right away, asked if I wanted anything to drink and the nail take off was the easiest/least painful one I ever received.  While I was getting my nails done, the one younger guy asked me how I was and if I needed anything.  Everyone there is very polite & speak perfect english!!  My nails still look great & I will definitely go back.  On top of all this, all I paid for a take off and manicure was $20!!!  You can't beat $10 for a manicure.I've been looking in the area for a nail salon for almost a year now and haven't been satisifed until now.  The other thing that is nice about Le & Be is that it's also a hair salon.  The girl who does hair seems very nice and shows that she loves what she does.  I may possibly go here in the future for my hair as well (prices aren't too bad).

7.description: Walked in and got right in for a pedicure. Lee did a fantastic job and the receptionist was very cordial. He helped me choose my nail color by painting my 3 choices on his nails and showing me the results. They should spruce up the salon - a good deep clean would do wonders! And poinsettias are not good in the summer! Checking out was easy. I will be back as pedicure was excellent!

36.description: Le & Be is an amazing hair and nail salon...Lindsay is my favorite hairstylist ever!  She is super friendly and takes the time to talk to you and figure out exactly what you want.  She always tells me what she plans on doing before she starts cutting to make sure we're on the same page.  Then she'll take you to the shampoo room for a relaxing and soothing shampoo and scalp massage.  Probably my favorite part of the experience =)  I never worry when getting my hair cut by Lindsay...she knows what she's doing and I know that it'll look great!They use Paul Mitchell products and seem to have a pretty large color bar where you can see them mix the color in front of you.  They also offer manicures and pedicures (but I haven't tried it out yet).  I did take a glance at their nail polishes and they have tons of colors and some Essie polishes too (which I love!).The entire salon is very clean and modern looking...and great prices!

30.description: I came for mani and was glad I don't have to wait in a line.  The lady who did my manicure didn't seam too happy and was kind of roughed . I ask the simple question if the instruments they use was sterilized before she start the service for what she answered "yes, and if you don't like  my instruments you can bring your own next time".. Really??? Next time??? I don't think so!! I wasn't arguing but the opposite was very quiet. There was one more person getting her nails done and one lady   waiting. They offered a cup of tea/coffee to those two but completely ignored me!!!! It's not that I care too much about a cup off "complimentary" coffee that I don't like to be ignored. I am the same paying customer and would of love to have equal treatment . Also when they were about to paint my nails  they asked me to pay firs, I understand it's easier, but not when you pronounce it like "You gonna pay me first!"   Relax lady , I'm not going anywhere!!!! Would of be much better to say "Would you like to pay now so you don't smash you color"? See the difference!!! On top, when she run my credit card and gave me the receipt to sign there was no line for Tips, I asked if I can add the tip for what she roughly answer that I should of think about it before she charged me! And how would I know ma'am that you credit card machine doesn't let you add tips????? !!!!!Then she left me for another customer and  made me wait for her coworker to finish The job she did (she had a customer at the moment) and come to paint my nails... Okey...  The last, that lady who did my nails on the first place already start working on another customer next to my table. She was removing the fake nails and one chipped off and  flew straight on me and hit me in the forehead.. Pretty disgusting !!! I know she didn't do it on purpose but I would expect a little  more than just giggling .. Unprofessional !!! Horrible customer service!!! Will never go back!!! Giving 2 stars: 1 for new furniture and 1 for a color on nail polish I picked.Even tho I like the color on my nails, it doesn't look too attractive on my finger tips ... 6 fingers out of 10... I think I would of done better job at home...

3.description: I have been coming to Le and Be salon for over 3 years for haircuts and the occasional manicure or pedicure.Lindsay is not only one of the nicest people I know, but she gives a killer haircut! Haircuts include a great shampoo with scalp massage, cut, blow dry, and style. The salon is family owned and operated and the staff always greets me by name. When I got married I brought my bridal party to Le and Be for nails and had my hair and make up done by Lindsay the day of the wedding. I normally don't wear nail polish but occasionally get pedicures and have always enjoyed them there.

14.description: I would like to preface this review by saying I've been to ALOT of nail salons and before moving back to Chicago had found the most perfect of them all so maybe nothing will compare.  However, I DO NOT recommend this salon for nails.  I can't speak to the hair stylist as I did not have services done, but she was there with another client and seemed to be pretty attentive and knowledgeable to that client.PROS:They are a friendly place and had time for a walk in / non-appt.They did offer me a drink, but it was in a glass. Given this is a place where dust and debris is airborn, I prefer an enclosed lid on my drink.They had the big massage chairs and the chairs seemed to be in good working condition.Did I say they were friendly?CONS:I got  probably they're 'backup' guy for being a walk-in.  He was terrible.His nails were unkept and dirty - I thought I was in a nail salon?He mumbled - I couldn't understand a word he saidHe was a poor masseuse - too fast and inconsistent, non-attentiveHe used LYSOL to "disinfect" the instruments - WTF? This is a chemical that is harmful to your health AND all he did was spray the tools in the air - no washing whatsoever - GROSS!Poor painting job - I will have to redo myself again at homeLotion used smells like grandmas old perfume - I've scrubbed my hands 3 times and can't get the scent to dissipate.He filed my nails with a used nail file - Absolutely should not happen.The jar of tools had that blue solution in it and the bottom of the glass looked like a science experiment.Their floor and surrounding equipment was dusty and dirty. While it might be regularly swept, you could tell it was not regularly scrubbed clean. I was grossed out during my whole visit.I cannot believe they're still doing nails.  For someone that has gotten infected nails twice by salons - this one ranks second to last on my list of nail salons and I would not be surprised if another one came my way after this visit.I really like to give small businesses a chance and know a business like this is hard to maintain, but if you can't do it, then you should be in another business.I canceled my third service because the whole experience just grossed me out - I had to leave.While they were nice, nice doesn't keep your salon clean. #grossedout

58.description: my hubby introduced me to al's pizza by the groupon he bought. i like their thin crust pizza. we usually get the mushroom thin crust. i'm a fan of spaghetti and meatballs and i like to try them at all the pizza take outs i go to.  and i agree with cindy n. that their marinara and meatballs are very good.  and s&m is their saturday special at $5.95!  their garlic bread is fresh. you can literally see the fresh garlic slices and it's nice and toasty crunchy just the way i like garlic bread to be!  my husband enjoys their chicken parmesan dinner.  i would't recommend dining in. there are only two small tables.  al's is definitely a take-out place and/or delivery place.  next time we order take out from al's i'd like to try their stuffed artichokes and lasagna.

56.description: Had flies in my pizza went to handle the situation with owner and phone girl they were absolutely rude said I was lying helped me with nothing, not even an apology as I was filing a complaint with BBB he kicked me out. The food was not even good. And now on to yelp with all the other bad complaints.  I I not  them at all...

29.description: Pretty good Cesar Salad! I always do take out. Their staff is really friendly, I'm in and out In no time.

42.description: Real good thin crust pizza . It's kept together well, cut great... It was tasty! Also they had the fried dough with powered sugar and cinnamon as a dessert ...mmmmm will b back!!! Plus the staff was really friendly..

23.description: Beware: they charge for plastic forks and after ordering with credit card from this place, my card number was stolen.

47.description: Always enjoy Al's pizza when we order. we always have it delivered and its fast and hot. Groupon deal makes it even more enjoyable as I like saving money. Give Al's a try.

8.description: What happened to this place? They used to be so great! They updated their interior and expanded, but the food has been on a decline. The pizza is extremely greasy and when we took a bite literally all the toppings and cheese just fell off. The appetizers are all gross I had their bruschetta and it tasted like I bit into a raw onion on some soggy bread. We also ordered the calamari which tasted like it had been frozen. I'm disappointed to say, I won't be ordering from here anymore.

31.description: When it comes to ordering pizza in my neighborhood I am a HUGE fan of Al's Pizza. I've ordered the Pizza King (HUGE) 3 times for delivery to my house. The deliver guy is always nice, even once when my doorbell wasn't working and my phone was off, and he was standing out there for a few before I realized he was there. He was still very nice! I took my sister in law for dine in to try the Chicago style stuffed pizza. I ordered ahead, so it was all set to go when we got there. The pizza (sausage/pepperoni/spinach/mushroom) had the perfect cheese-sauce-ingredient-crust ratio, and I am super picky when it comes to stuffed pizza. I love the sauce that they use here. The appetizer sampler plate was hot and crispy. The older lady (owner?) was so sweet, and even gave my daughter a chocolate chip cookie as we were leaving. When it comes to getting my pizza fix around my house I am skipping the chains and ordering from Al's!

34.description: I love Al's pizza!  When we first moved to the neighborhood we tried many pizza places and Al's was by far the best!   I can't believe Al's only has 3 stars on yelp.  They are way better than 3 stars.

16.description: As a AL's frequent customer, I'm used to excellent pizza. But today's pick up was terrible. I get that it's mothers day and it's a higher demand but under cooked doe, lack of ingredients of choice and fistfull amount of olives just dropped on one quarter of the pizza made this special day terrible. In stead of pleasant suprise and a delicious meal we got a bad pie.

13.description: I have ordered so many times from this place excellent pizza! Today didn't want pizza so I ordered some sandwiches barbecue beef (delicious) and chicken parmigiana sandwich (awesome)! Just to remind some people that this place is no about pizza only! I also love their pizzas!

11.description: Al's, are you kidding me? Your food isn't good enough for your questionable service. We spend 67 dollars for a delivery only to have you forget some of our food. Not only did you forget, but you then had the nerve to call back and question me to make sure I have checked all the bags? Are you kidding me? Your staffs incompetence, and rude attitude is sad. Never question a customer over a few dollars worth of food...ever

39.description: Got pizza by the slice and it was only okay. I wasn't a fan of the red sauce. Seemed like it came from the can. I am going to try a full pizza next time and possibly edit my review as I know the pizza by the slice tends to sit in a hot box for a while. Staff was extremely friendly.

37.description: This is our go to pizza joint ! They are super friendly and we always get a HoT pizza ( but we do live half block away). They also have a great catering menu, which we received so many compliments on the food we ordered for my daughters birthday party. If u can def try this out. Oooo and how can I forget... The MEATBALLS are so awesome . Please add an order !

0.description: I have ordered here only twice, but will definitely will be a return customer again1st time: ordered their beef giardenara pizza.   YUMMMMMM!!! I am not usu a fan of thin crust, but their thin crust is LIKE NO OTHER2nd time: ordered their chicken caesar salad. I wish I cld just order their croutons as an order!!! airy garlicky perfection (as I CANT STAND hard croutons that can chip your teeth)Delivery gentlemen have always been prompt and nice!Thank's Al's!!!

38.description: We used to order lunch from Al's weekly. The spaghetti dinner was tasty, & inexpensive. However, had lots of trouble with orders taking way over time quoted to arrive. Often times items were missing, or delivered with wrong modifications. Owner was always unapologetic about it, but we often let it go because we were strapped for lunch options that delivered to our location! Final straw was when the girl taking the phone orders asked us if we wanted to sign up for their email rewards & get coupons sent out as a thank you for frequent orders. The first time we tried to use a coupon to apply towards lunch, the owner argued that the offer was expired, even though we had just printed it out from email with an expiration date that was like a week away. He then said that the company that "handles" the coupons was a based out of Vegas, & they had put the wrong dates on the offers...That excuse came after he was so completely rude & pretty much accused us of trying to rip him off! That was our first reward for joining their email club, & it was our last. We officially broke up with Al's.We have not ordered from them since, & have been getting our pizza/pasta fix at Suparossa on Central. We've ordered from Suparossa a dozen times so far, & have not had a single problem yet! Good riddance, Al's...

51.description: I can't believe the ratings aren't higher. After my family's favorite pizza place went out of business we struggled with finding a new place that offered us the same great quality pizza. We finally found Al's and have our new favorite spot.

27.description: The food is great but your delivery drivers don't know how to drive. I'm sick and tired of driving down irving park and getting honked at by one of your drivers behind me. They speed up and cut me off and they keep doing it to everyone that's in front of them. It would be a shame if the way your drivers treat fellow drivers on the road would makeme not want to come back.

32.description: I love Al's thin crust pizza...taste, amount of ingredients, how it is baked, thinness of the crust, lack of grease...everything about it! If I don't get it once a week, look out. They're a friendly group over there - from the nice lady who answers the phone, to the charming older man who usually delivers to us. The ingredients Al's uses must be good quality, because we've never received anything less than a great pizza. The delivery time is always under what they estimate, and everything arrives nice and hot. It makes me happy. I hope to one day change this to a 5-star review, because I wish their wings were just a little bit better (I hope the owner is reading this request). I must admit, we're lucky to have Al's in the neighborhood.

54.description: Another groupon is out there from Al's Pizza, so everyone, stay far, far away and SAVE YOUR MONEY!! Their service is HORRENDOUS and when you complain, they say it is not their problem! REALLY??? No accountability, no customer service! Last time it took almost 2 hours for ONE pizza, while saying it was just coming out of the oven, and even though I live only 6 blocks away, it took another 20 minutes to deliver! Sherri the manager is useless, and the owner is a JERK!!!!!!!!

48.description: I ordered a thin crust pizza with mushrooms and sausage. It was delicious. Delivery was fast and the driver was polite. This was my first time ordering and I'll definitely be ordering from here again.

44.description: We are on a quest to try all the pizza places in town to determine our new usual....our old one for years and years has fallen short, sorry Annette's.  In reviewing now, I am trying to review after going to a place more than once.  I think more people should do the same.....better picture of the place.We ordered a standard 18'' cheese and sausage thin crust pizza the first time we were there.  We ordered it for pick up like always.  Timing was normal.  Pizza was hot.  Got home and started to eat.  Outside pieces were great...cheesy, crisp, right amount of assume and sausage was good.  As we ate and ate and reached the middle, the pie was soggy and stuck to the cardboard....a result of the super light crust that was soo good in the beginning.  I would still give the pizza 4 stars.  It was good the next morning.We ordered another night...  Meatball sandwich on garlic bread, beef sandwich on garlic bread and fries.  Fries stunk...cold and mushy...yuck yuck.  Meatball sandwich was good, the garlic bread really stood out.  I love lots and lots of garlic, but it was small.  Beef also.  Both sandwiches were small.  My husband and I split each and they were only a few bites each.I will go back.  Not sure yet if this will be my new super favorite...I'm still looking.  I will let you know when I decide.

24.description: Where else can you call to complain on a thin crust pizza that took two hours to deliver and the manager hangs up on you. I know you might be busy, but for a very loyal customer, I will never order from you again.

7.description: This is your average Italian/pizza take out place.I ordered takeout from here and had a groupon in hand. We had the Italian beer sandwich and a full slab of ribs.The total was $28, so just a tad over my $25 groupon value. And we got a TON of food. Honestly, sharing the ribs and the coleslaw and fries it came with would have been more than enough for my husband and I to share. I thought the ribs were good, flavorful, juicy, and not at all dry. The meat was good too - it wasn't very fatty.The beef sandwich wasn't great. The beef cuts were good (again, not a lot of fat), but the bread didn't taste 100% fresh. I ended up dunking it in the juice to eat it. They also didn't give us the giardinara my husband ordered. We didn't notice that until we got home, and at that point, we weren't going to go back out in the rain.I'd go back for the ribs.

49.description: My new favorite pizza place. You can't beat it for the price,  and it's always hot when it gets gets. In the 4 months I've been ordering here there's only been one slip up with my order but it was fixed and replaced in 20 min.

40.description: Ordered a cheese pizza once because of all the good reviews I seen but it turned out to be nasty. Never ordering from there again.

53.description: It just floors me that this place hasn't gotten better reviews.  The pizza on the NW side is uniformly underwhelming.  Al's is really good!  I haven't found better up (out) here.  (Marie's is good but it doesn't travel)

30.description: I love this place. Pizza is always meaty and cheesy. Have also ordered the linguini with clams in oil and garlic sauce. Omg! I love that they remove the clams from the shells and chop them up for you. Feeds into my "lazy and just want to eat right away" soul. I've had the wings, calamari, mozzarella sticks, and the appetizer sampler. I got the hot wings and boy were the hot! My face was red. But that's how I like my wings. I always complain wings at other restaurants are never hot enough and Al's did not disappoint.Everything I've ever ordered from there has been really good. I've ordered from the Al's on Irving park and the one on Lawrence ave. Same good qualify.I gave it 5 stars but I do however have one complaint. Whenever I order a large pizza pie with appetizers, it takes no later then an hour. The last time I ordered, I got a small pizza pie, linguini with clams, 2 tiramisu (yes all that food for just me!). It took about half hour.Either way my one complaint won't stop me from ordering from Al's in the future. I just order ahead of time now.

46.description: Ok, so I had a really bad day yesterday...only thing I had to look forward to was using my groupon deal for Al's Pizza...Sooooooo glad I did.  I ordered for  pick up, woman on phone was really nice and helpful, and order was ready and hot when i picked it up...The customer service was totally awesome...very nice people and you can tell they care about providing great service...Got home and we absolutely LOVED this pizza...Had a half sausage, half pepperoni...Seriously some really great pizza..Even love the way they cut it,  the size of the slices is perfect...The mozzarella cheese sticks were sooooo good.  And the cheesy garlic bread was a hit too...So at least my day ended on such a positive note after all...Thanx AL's...and I will definitely be back or ordering for delivery...

1.description: I've been meaning to write this review about the poor customer service Al's Pizza has. Let me start from the beginning I ordered two pizzas from them on a friday night well needless to say I was dissatisfied for two reasons one both the pizzas tasted like their pizza cutter was left in sanitizer water that's ppi was set too high and (yes I know what sanitizer water taste like after getting splashed by it when doing dishes at my restaurant) two the combo platter we ordered mostly everything was semi burnt. Of course I'm naturally going to call to complain the chick and yes I will use that imcompentant little girls name Samantha informed me there was nothing she could do since Mike the manager wasn't there and she would have him call in the morning. So you see the problem with this is one she couldn't even offer to make the pizzas over and 2 when asked about it she didn't have that authority she basically said you are out of luck and we are keeping your money in otherwords. Then she ends up putting me on hold and then hangs up after 20 minutes what kind of establishment is this no wonder why you constantly have a now hiring sign up your employees are basically garbage with no customer service skills whatsoever. On top of that she also informed me that you guys don't use chemicals at all just water to clean which I know it has to be a lie otherwise this establishment should've been closed a long time ago for major health code violations. So in a nutshell don't buy from here.

55.description: Great pizza and fries! My boyfriend and I order from there a lot and it's always great! Delivery doesn't take long and they're always friendly. We usually do cheese and the occasional sausage/pepperoni, but cheese seems to be our favorite by far!

9.description: Food was good, however it took 20 min to get a hot dog, I only get 30min for lunch. I had to hurry up and scarf it down, usually hot dogs are ready to go.

26.description: Delicious pizza but watch out for delivery drivers they don't drive good clearly no use of speedometer or turn signal.

25.description: This is your average Italian/pizza take out place.I ordered takeout from here and had a groupon in hand. We had the Italian beer sandwich and a full slab of ribs.The total was $28, so just a tad over my $25 groupon value. And we got a TON of food. Honestly, sharing the ribs and the coleslaw and fries it came with would have been more than enough for my husband and I to share. I thought the ribs were good, flavorful, juicy, and not at all dry. The meat was good too - it wasn't very fatty.The beef sandwich wasn't great. The beef cuts were good (again, not a lot of fat), but the bread didn't taste 100% fresh. I ended up dunking it in the juice to eat it. They also didn't give us the giardinara my husband ordered. We didn't notice that until we got home, and at that point, we weren't going to go back out in the rain.I'd go back for the ribs.

12.description: The food is great but your delivery drivers don't know how to drive. I'm sick and tired of driving down irving park and getting honked at by one of your drivers behind me. They speed up and cut me off and they keep doing it to everyone that's in front of them. It would be a shame if the way your drivers treat fellow drivers on the road would makeme not want to come back.

59.description: Took 1 hour 40 minutes to deliver. Pizza was cold. They said would deliver another only if the first was uneaten. I couldnt wait another hour to feed my hungry, young children. I will never suffer ordering another pizza from Al's again... neither will my friends!

21.description: Some of the best Italian food on the north side. Ingredients are fresh. Awesome sausage pizza. Quality cheese. YUM!!!!

17.description: I love this place. Pizza is always meaty and cheesy. Have also ordered the linguini with clams in oil and garlic sauce. Omg! I love that they remove the clams from the shells and chop them up for you. Feeds into my "lazy and just want to eat right away" soul. I've had the wings, calamari, mozzarella sticks, and the appetizer sampler. I got the hot wings and boy were the hot! My face was red. But that's how I like my wings. I always complain wings at other restaurants are never hot enough and Al's did not disappoint.Everything I've ever ordered from there has been really good. I've ordered from the Al's on Irving park and the one on Lawrence ave. Same good qualify.I gave it 5 stars but I do however have one complaint. Whenever I order a large pizza pie with appetizers, it takes no later then an hour. The last time I ordered, I got a small pizza pie, linguini with clams, 2 tiramisu (yes all that food for just me!). It took about half hour.Either way my one complaint won't stop me from ordering from Al's in the future. I just order ahead of time now.

10.description: Stopped in on a Sunday after a long work day, ordered the Veal parmesan and soup of the day, bean and pasta.The service was quick and food delicious, big portions. The pasta was done very well and veal almost melted. The side garden salad was very fresh and was perfect with the meal.Soup of the day, wow, on a cold day like yesterday it was a treat.I will be stopping more often.This was my second time ordering from Al's, first time we ordered a pizza and wings. Again awesome food and quick service.

5.description: What an embarrassment ordered dinner on a Sunday night at 6:30pm. It is now 8:15pm and still have not received my dinner. If I could give less than 1 star I would. Needless to say this will be the last time I order food from Al's. Now just got my order and it was messed up. Did not give me mozzarella sticks. 2 hours for a delivery order and then cannot even get the order right. What a joke!

3.description: Al's pizza is really good,fresh,hot,tasty and a great thin crust.I been ordering here for about a year and they never disappointed me or my entire family. I have a family of eight and we get their huge pizza called PIZZA KING . Let me tell you it's the size of a sheet of plywood. We have it delivered and its always on point. Fast delivery,great service,affordable prices

35.description: We had Al's Pizza from this location about 1 month ago.We were really happy with the pizza crust and toppings, the Italian Beef was tasty, and lasagna very good too.Decided to order another pizza tonight.Called and was told 45-50 minutes.I arrived 55 minutes later to pick up the pizza and when I arrived home pizza wasn't even lukewarm.I called and spoke to a girl who put me on hold.Minutes later a woman got on the line and I told her how pizza was.She said,"She told you 40-45 minutes and you came in an hour." I corrected her, and she had nothing to say.I asked the best way to heat it and she told me.No apology or any attempt to be nice about cold pizza.Great pizza, but terrible customer service.Definitely won't be back!

19.description: Ordered a pan pizza,  cheesy garlic bread and a combo appetizer.   The delivery came sooner than the estimated time and everything was delicious.   The combo appetizer was huge!   Way bigger than I would have expected for only $7.95.  I would suggest ordering extra dipping sauce, but other than that it was great.   The pizza crust was thick and loaded with cheese and toppings.   Everything was so good and so much bigger than we expected.   Definitely got our money's worth.

28.description: The food is as fresh as it gets it is made to order there is nothing frozen, and the sauce is made with only the freshest ingredients with their own family recipe.When I am back intown i usually order from their Irving park location, i introduced the thin crust from als when i was back home to my 11 year old daughter and that is the only thin pizza she asks for as soon as we land in Ohare and it is superb. Not a pizza chain this is totally family owned its DELICIOUS!

45.description: I purchased a pizza king size with chicken and onions.pizza was over cooked and when I picked up a slice there was no Dow underneath the cheese certain pieces about 85percent was not eaten cause none of my family liked the taste I went back 2 days later told lady behind counter but she said I had to report it the same night. There was no resolution. Prior to that night I recommended the restaurant to my daughter and she ordered the 2 slice special one cheese and one pepperoni. The cheese was old hard and the pepperoni was made by taking a cheese slice and throwing pepperoni on top of cheese slice and reheating well slices of pepperoni were sliding off. Tried to order 2 sandwiches there skirt steak and pork loin supposed to be 2 of there best but on Saturday night they had neither. Needless to say the pizza is not worth going back for and since they don't carry the 2 sandwiches I am not going back. To be fair I have been there 4 times and have been dissatisfied 50 percent of time. Don't plan on taking another chance on going there again.

33.description: No stars. Food is mediocre and nothing I would recommend. Added a star only because it won't let me post without a star.

43.description: Looking for a new thin crust pizza joint now that Leona's has changed owners and I'm guessing the owners have taken their pizza recipe with them! Sadly, Al's did not do it for me. The cheese is nice, soft and gooey how I like it, but the other areas of the pizza is where it falls short.       The bottom crust was soggy, almost no sauce (if any, and don't tell me I have to order "sauce",) and the ingredients (Al's special - Sausage, Mushroom & G.Peppers) were bland, tasteless and on the skimpy side. Come to think of it, I don't recall any mushrooms.     If not for the Groupon ($12 for $25!) this would have been a very bad experience. But an 18" "3" topping pizza and an Mozzarella Stick app (standard/fare) and I only paid the taxes extra, not bad. With the Groupon deal I give is 3 stars. I would only go back if I had a Groupon, and right now they are available and I have no desire to purchase another.

2.description: Owner  is the biggest  jerk chicago  a big city he can keep his  pizza  and sit on it

18.description: Seriously, The best eggplant parmagiana I've ever tasted. I make this at home and after trying their's, made exactly the way I asked them to make it, I may never make it again...I'd much rather dish out the money to buy it from this place. Delivery service was good too. Quick and food was piping hot.

41.description: Went to have lunch with my wife ordered 2 slices of pizza. Half way through my wife eating her slice she noticed something black on it when she moved it it was a dead fly. We took it to the owners attention and he said what do u want me to do about it very rudely. We asked him if he can just refund her slice. He said no ill give u another slice and u have to leave. I say to the public do not eat there bugs in food and horrible customer service. That was the owner wow.

52.description: Very rude staff,asked for a side order of pasta and OMG I thought I said a threat,the owner got on after the so called mgr could not answer why I cannot buy a side of pasta with an complete order of other food,and he just ripped into me we don't do that and that's it! OK cancel my order BIG SHOT! How about a little customer service in a day of none. My  neighbors are also offended by their attitude's.

50.description: I was afraid that the people were going to be really mean to me based on the reviews but I was relieved that they were very kind and professional.Unfortunately I can't really say many good things about the food. This was my first time ordering here so I thought I'd go with one of their special pizzas. I ordered a small thin crust Margarita and some appetizers. I was told it would be ready in 35 minutes so I showed up in 35 minutes. It took me about 3 minutes to get home. The pizza was ice cold and the cheese had hardened like it was sitting around for hours. The tomatoes were little cherry tomatoes and it looked like they just sprinkled basil from a spice jar or something. It had no taste on top of being cold.The other appetizers were just plain too. Nothing great.We'll probably give this place another try to see if it was a fluke but expectations aren't very high. Maybe I'll go in 10 minutes earlier than they say just in case...

4.description: Having ordered a few times now they're pretty consistent in their delivery items.Their thin crust pizza has a great crispy/flakey crust and it's always sliced all the way through for every piece.  There's a good amount of places in the area where you don't just have to pull apart some slices of pizza because of the wonderful cheesey goodness but you need to recut it because they didn't even cut it all the way down to the crust.  Not ever a problem here!  Which seems like a minor thing to compliment on but I've never experienced it with regularity from any other place before.The sauce on the pizza is also excellent, not too sweet not too spicey.  And definitely a unique blend from the other (also good pizzas in the area) places, like Vinces, Bijes, or Skores.

6.description: We ordered the fried chicken and baked clams for delivery.Everything was awesome.The chicken wasn't greasy and the clams were real whole clams,not the chopped up in breading kind.They were generous with bread and butter.Not like the usual hey, only for one but dinner for three.Everything was there .Bread,butter,ketchup ,coleslaw and a cute tiny bottle of hot sauce.The person that took the order was pleasant as well as the delivery guy as it was our first heavy snow day he still had a great disposition.I will recommend this place to my neighbors and friends.Great job to all at Al's

22.description: We love their food, especially the wings. However, I will never understand why I can't have a quarter of my $35 pizza made 'cheese only' for my son. I'm paying for toppings on the entire thing. Incredibly frustrating.

15.description: I was afraid that the people were going to be really mean to me based on the reviews but I was relieved that they were very kind and professional.Unfortunately I can't really say many good things about the food. This was my first time ordering here so I thought I'd go with one of their special pizzas. I ordered a small thin crust Margarita and some appetizers. I was told it would be ready in 35 minutes so I showed up in 35 minutes. It took me about 3 minutes to get home. The pizza was ice cold and the cheese had hardened like it was sitting around for hours. The tomatoes were little cherry tomatoes and it looked like they just sprinkled basil from a spice jar or something. It had no taste on top of being cold.The other appetizers were just plain too. Nothing great.We'll probably give this place another try to see if it was a fluke but expectations aren't very high. Maybe I'll go in 10 minutes earlier than they say just in case...

57.description: If a person calls to order a pizza and makes a specific change to one of your pizzas, in this case substituting black olive for onion, even though your menu says "no substitutions", the price of the pizza should not go up $8. This is ridiculous.  To make matters worse, it is inexcusable for your staff not to tell the customer of the outrageous extra charge while still on the phone.  Could the staff tell that the customer was a senior citizen?  It surely makes one wonder.Furthermore, when that customer calls you to discuss the issue, quit falling back on your built in excuse "it says no substitutions".  This type of chicanery shouldn't go unreported.We liked the pizza, however, each of the families at our house tonight won't ever be giving them another chance.$31 for a family size sausage, green pepper, black olive and mushroom?  No, I don't think so.

20.description: you can not find any better Italian food, this is the best Italian food on the north side there pasta is all homemade and great. not only a pizza place they are a great Italian eatery. try it all I have !!!  they have some of the best homemade soups around too.

36.description: Excellent thin crust pizza in an unpretentious atmosphere with great service. We called ahead for dining in and they had our pizza ready when we arrived, along with a corkscrew and glasses for our BYOB. Definitely a must-try-pie, if you're in the area!

14.description: Love love love this Pizza...Always have it delivered..The customers service is excellent they are on point...Polite helpful great people... ..

36.description: Very small (like Chinese take-out) place in the center of a strip mall.  The inside isn't decorated with anything on the wall and quite frankly, felt like a side room behind the kitchen (which I liked for some reason)  They were selling pizza by the slice (cheese $3.50, sausage $3.75 I believe) and got one with the sausage topping.  Service was above average as the kid gave me an extra slice, on top of giving great service but, didn't recall if the price included 1 or 2 slices.Pizza wasn't too bad.  Definitely more on the doughy side than anything else with hardly any sauce (if that's how you like your pizza).  I could definitely see them attracting a lot of business due to their cheap deals and wide selection of other offerings.  Got a minor stomach ache after eating 3/4 of a giant slice.  Other reviewer was right about it being very rich.Pizza 2.5Service 5How I felt afterwards 2

29.description: I cannot find a better Pizza place in this neighborhood. I love their pizza, not the individual slices, but when you buy the whole pizza, it is at your door hot and fresh with each piece cheese stringing off. It's great, Glad I found you.. :-)

42.description: The pizza is very tastey!!!!!  The barbeque chicken is also good!Everything else is... "eh".  Typical stuff... bland pasta, fried crap, blah blah blah.

23.description: I absolutely LOVE this place! My family only orders our pizza from here! When people come from out of town and want true Chicago pizza, I always order Colutas. Two of my coworkers who are out of towners were dying when they tried this pizza! They said this is their new spot! The best pizza sauce comes from here, their crust is amazing, and their cheese is perfect! It does get a little pricy but it is so worth it!

31.description: Not impressed.  Sure it was a pretty big slice and wasn't too pricey but I hate having to dab the pizza with a napkin to remove pooled grease.  The sauce wasn't anything special either. I won't be back here.

34.description: I've ordered Pizza from Colutas off and on over the years, it's average to me and not my first choice. I will usually get it when I'm with someone that likes a thicker dough crust and lots of sauce/cheese because they tend to load it on. If you're like me and use paper towels to soak up the cheese grease be prepared to use alot! But on the plus side it is reasonably priced and I've always gotten good service.

16.description: I love the pizza here.perfect sauce, right amount of cheese, crust not to much. always cooked to perfection!  cheese fries outa this world, and subway turkey sub is same price as here and it's 100 xs better fresher perfect. overall this is where my pizza place is going to be for now on since I moved and it's closer to my house.hands down awsome prices a very reasonable.

11.description: Gross. We ordered 2 pizzas from this place for the 1st time last night. The pizza was awful I wish we would of saved the $45 bucks. I would of rather got 9 pizzas from little Caesars it was that bad. I have all this extra pizza left with 5 adults & 2 kids because no one wants to eat it.  Waste of money. My hot sauce wouldn't even cover the bad taste.

39.description: On Saturday night with a small family pachanga (Party) going on it was decided we needed some pizza to help with all the drinking that was going on!! Yes thats how the cooters roll!!  SHake & bake brotha shake & bake!Miller Lite, Leinenkugel Summer Shandy, Corona! We needed a pie!Lo and behold the PIzzas arrived! I totally  flexed on that "Special " Its green peppers, onions, sausage, mushrooms, the works!Fantastic!The sauce on this pizza is good!Not in my top 5 BUT good enough!SHake & bake seal of approval!

37.description: I have ordered only a few things from them, but have enjoyed them all. Their thin crust pizza is a hearty thin crust - but not too thick. Everything about the pizza is solid, and it can stand up nicely to a "garbage" topping option, which many super thins can not. The beef and tomato is pretty good as well. Their dinner specials are a nice change of pace, and their ribs, while not a must-have, are solid if someone has a taste for them and everyone else wants pizza.

0.description: The only bad part of their pizza is the last 1/2 inch of crust (the handle), which gets pretty hard. That being said right up front, here comes the good stuff. They give you great pizza value.They are a bargain. Their sauce is excellent. Their spices are on point. They are very generous with all of their toppings, especially the CHEESE. Their sausage slices are the best. Their slices are big enough to fill you up. They are easily better than any big pizza chain like Domino's or Papa John's. In fact, they are the best out of 5 local pizzerias in my neighborhood and I walk on over to them when I feel like getting myself a real treat. Their place is always clean & neat. Their staff is fast & friendly. They play pretty good music while you are waiting for your pizza.

38.description: When you want a quick meal without a big deal, what are you gonna fix? Hot Pockets! Jim Gaffigan forever tainted the hot pocket for me so when we needed a quick meal we thought pizza. We've never tried this place but they always send us flyer's and it was on my BF's way home so they win! Overall: Pretty good,tasty sauce, very Cheesy! They definitely don't skimp on the cheese so don't even think of ordering extra cheese. Not at all oily and in need of blotting before eating, which is good. Priced right for cheapies like myself :) If you live near or have family/friends in the area (me) then check it out!

27.description: Love this pizza!  They never disappoint!

32.description: Good pizza for the price and seems like everytime I have an urge they have slices hot n ready!

13.description: Best pizza I've ever had. That's all that is needed to be said.

24.description: This place is a hit and miss with me. Their fried mushrooms are delicious as well as their chicken Parmesan dinner. But I ordered the BBQ chicken dinner and the chicken was undercooked. The entire inside is all pink, they don't give you enough BBQ sauce on the chicken and its all soggy. I lost my appetite after seeing the pink chicken (will never order at least chicken from them). The garlic bread is amazing! Tortellini is delish. But they really need someone to make sure the chicken is cooked correctly because people will get sick. Also, there was a young girl taking phone orders who was very rude.

7.description: My favorite pizza in the area. The Coluta's special is the ideal supreme pizza. Soooo much cheese. Ribs are good too.

40.description: I've been eating here for about 18 years. The food is very reasonable, and always great. Haven't had one bad experience in 18 years, what more to say?

30.description: This place is fantastic! Great pizzas and they even sell them by the slice! Great delivery too.

1.description: I've been here three times. Every time for the Caesar salad. The Caesar dressing is out of this world!!! Idk what it is about their dressing but it's amazing!!! I crave their Caesar all the damn time. It's even good with the pizza! I personally think $7 is a lil pricey for some lettuce, cheese and croutons but I gladly pay it for the dressing. I've ordered the cheese slices pizza before and it was ok.I went back recently and dined in. We had the veggie pizza and chicken Caesar. The whole pizza is better than the slices. My friend was dipping her pizza in the dressing and I was like huh?! That can't be good, but I tried it and it was amazing!!!!! I will continue to come back just for the salad tho. I prefer other pizza places pizza.

9.description: Love their shrimp basket!!! Pizza is ok. But, can't beat their sunday deal of their bbq ribs! Comes w fries, side salad and bread! Great place. Have been ordering here since 2003!

26.description: After a major fail with Sorrentos my bf and I decided to give this place a try after reading good reviews. We ordered a 18" pizza and a order of fries.
