The pizza was AMAZING, I've read that it's too cheesy and maybe it is but it makes it that much more delicious. The crust is not really as crunchy as I'd like but the taste of the pizza cancels that out. The bad thing was when I asked how much it would be, it was nearly $40 when I used to pay around $20 at Sorrentos buying the same two things, and at Giordanos I spend around $30 so I thought that was a huge downer. I loved the pizza but that's too high for me :p

25.description: Great mom and pop local Italian take out place. We ordered the chicken Parmesan which comes with 2 large lightly breaded breasts, pasta, soup or salad and garlic bread for under $9. Tasted really good too. My wife had the Tortellini which was really good too. Very professional staff on the phone. 5 stars for a take out place. Haven't dinned in yet.

12.description: For the neighborhood pizza place, Coluta's is where it's at.After reading many of these reviews, I realized that a few of the reviewers either forgot how much they paid for their pizzas or they are lying about the expense. I have an actual menu in front of me and for an 18" cheese pizza its $17.50 plus $2.25 per ingredient. So unless you ordered a good 6 extra ingredients, there is no possible way that an 18" cost nearly $40. Also, a slice of pizza is $2.25-$2.50. Now that I've cleared that up, a good friend of mine is the hood and duct cleaner of over 500 Chicagoland restaurants, and he said that Coluta's is on his top 3 list of cleanest kitchens. It's always reassuring knowing that my food is being prepared in sanitary conditions and not a roach infested dump. Not to mention, the employees are always super friendly and down to earth.On top of reasonable prices, a clean kitchen, and awesome service... they have solid food. Their caesar salad is the best that you can possibly get delivered, thanks to the fresh parmesan cheese and creamy dressing, and their homemade croutons are better than any croutons that I've ever tasted in my entire life. I could go on and on about every menu item I've have had over the years, but I'll leave it at that. Check this place out!

21.description: Colutas is definitely a must! The pizza is ridiculously good and so responsibly priced ! A bacon bbq pizza or bbq chicken from here are to die for.

17.description: Delivery was fast and driver wasn't afraid of my dog. Pizza was outstanding. I moved north from.the Southside so I was a lil nervous about ordering. I will be ordering again.

10.description: The pizza is good but not good enough to put up with the rude service from the short skinny girl with black hair at the register who on numerous occasions talked poorly to customers and to to the people she works with.  Management should really do something about this before they lose more customers

5.description: I prefer a thinner crust. Too dense for me. Cheese and topping were ooook. Good customer service though. Still looking in Chicago a pizza that really wao me. The best in my opinion is Freddy's in Cicero. It was another good one in Logan Square, but it close.

35.description: Coluta's pizza is pretty good, but WAY too cheesy.  They pile on an inch of gooey cheese, which overpowers the taste of the pizza completely.   The cheese is of the rubbery and relatively flavorless variety, which doesn't help.  They are very generous with the toppings and the crust isn't too thin, which helps a little.  Still, after eating here I feel like I might not be able to go the bathroom for a week or two.

19.description: Coluta's is the bomb!  Great pizza, good sammies, friendly delivery personnel,  everything is great.   Been ordering from them forever, but have to go through the entire name, address, etc.  Wish they would implement the system whereby they have your address in their system, plus a total on the delivery order.

28.description: While their thin is good, this place has the BEST STUFFED & PAN pizza anywhere!  No place else will load the toppings on like Colutas.  Price is right, food is great, and the delivery is always quick!

3.description: This was my FAVE pizza place when living in Chicago. My hubby and I would always get the double dough half cheese and half sausage. Man, I'm drooling just thinking about it now. Their pizza's are always the perfect ratio of sauce, cheese and toppings. Also, they have single slices available which were always fresh and delicious. Every time I'm in the city, I always stop by for a slice or pick up a pizza to take home.

33.description: This is my favorite pizza in the city of Chicago. What more can I say?

43.description: Good inexpensive pizza. I like the thin crust and the delivery is super quick! They usually twrow in a 2-Liter of RC with a large pie.

2.description: This place is very inconsistent! One day your food will be great the next time you order your food maybe cold and gross! Their burgers are great and ribs special and fried chicken specials are great! However there pizza has gone down hill! The sauce and dough just lacks flavor and sometimes just seems frozen! A few times they have been out of chicken and few other items which is understandable once, but a few times is really pathetic! The customer service is real shitty! And the skinny girl at the counter is rude as shit ! This place needs to be more consistent and have better customer service after all your in business because of your customers !

18.description: Not impressed.  Sure it was a pretty big slice and wasn't too pricey but I hate having to dab the pizza with a napkin to remove pooled grease.  The sauce wasn't anything special either. I won't be back here.

41.description: Colutas is great, cheap pizza! The one on Diversey is better, though.

4.description: Thin crust pizza is so good here. They do not skimp on cheese. Local pizzerias seem to outdo some of the heavy hitters in Chicago. This is definitely on the top of my list along with Lonnie's on the north side.

6.description: Really good pizza. We have been there 40+ times. We take them down south. They pre-cook them half ways. Freeze them. I really like the roast beef and hot pepper pizza. We live 10 miles away and it's worth the trip. We are getting 3 pre-cooked ones to take to friends.

22.description: Lou Malnati's what?I had been ordering from Caluto's via GrubHub for about two years. As you can tell, I'm a satisfied customer.  So I decided to go in one evening for pickup.Fried ravioli. Buffalo chicken wings. Medium pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage pizza. Still a satisfied customer.The fried ravioli is the best. The wings were plump and the pizza puts most walk-in pizza shops to shame. I'll go so far as to add some brand name pizza restaurants to the list of shame. Caluto's is on like a light.

15.description: Since moving into the neighborhood, Coulta's has been my favorite place to eat/take out. Good pizza and I'm crazy about their fried cauliflower. Yummy!Their caesar dressing is delicious. I think they put their lettuce on ice. The last time I ordered a salad, there was a bunch of water at the bottom of my container. Over all a pretty good place with good prices.

20.description: Since moving into the neighborhood, Coulta's has been my favorite place to eat/take out. Good pizza and I'm crazy about their fried cauliflower. Yummy!Their caesar dressing is delicious. I think they put their lettuce on ice. The last time I ordered a salad, there was a bunch of water at the bottom of my container. Over all a pretty good place with good prices.

8.description: Lou Malnati's what?I had been ordering from Caluto's via GrubHub for about two years. As you can tell, I'm a satisfied customer.  So I decided to go in one evening for pickup.Fried ravioli. Buffalo chicken wings. Medium pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage pizza. Still a satisfied customer.The fried ravioli is the best. The wings were plump and the pizza puts most walk-in pizza shops to shame. I'll go so far as to add some brand name pizza restaurants to the list of shame. Caluto's is on like a light.

14.description: Always fast always hot. Prices are cheap. Not super thin crust but i like the sauce and seasoning. Small place in a strip mall. Plenty of parking. Definitely worth considering if youre in the area. Theyve been here forever. Cant comment on the pizza toppings since i only get cheese on my pizza. I know, im weird.

1.description: Decent place for a quick mani-pedi. Quality can vary a lot depending on who you see that day. But service is speedy and the staff don't over complicate things. I usually see Cindy and she's quick and does a decent job- not too rough, doesn't get polish everywhere, keeps chatter to a min. I usually go here if I am in a pinch or running behind schedule. Mostly it is a convenience thing. But one can get better for around the same price elsewhere.

9.description: Great service, friendly faces! I come here all the time and I'm always happy never a unsatisfactory visit! Annie is my favorite but everyone is great!!!

12.description: Do NOT GO HERE! I came her a few times before but it wasn't until the last time that I really got upset when I got badly burned while getting my eyebrows waxed. The manager did them, immediately saw what he did (the wax was too hot and kept on too long) so he said "no charge" and rushed me out of the store before other customers could see. I went back when the burns and swelling got worse and he told me "just cover it with make up for a few weeks until it's gone this just happens sometimes". I am absolutely appalled and disgusted with this place and their lack of responsibly for that service and their negligence to make sure the wax is at the right temperature.

21.description: This nail salon is a 2-hour vacation away from home. The salon is very dainty. There is a front section and a back section in the salon. The front section is for the manicures, and the back section is for the spa pedicures. I love how the back section's walls are painted a beautiful pink pastel. They have very relaxing pictures on the walls that takes you away from everything going crazy in normal life lol.I came here with a bunch of girlfriends for a surprise b-day, and I had a blast. In order to have the private party, the nail salon had to close just for us 8 girls equipped with the music of our choice. We were also able to bring our own food and drinks to this nail salon! The owner, Theresa, was so kind to make us a huge tray of her delicious Vietnamese egg rolls. These egg rolls were super awesome, really! (Sidenote: she sells these huge trays of huge Vietnamese egg rolls for about $25)If you think the egg rolls were great, the mani/pedi was superb. They start you off in their massaging leather chairs with your feet in the relaxing, hot, blue water. During the spa pedicure, they apply a beaded scrub to your calves and feet. And, this nail salon has been the first one to ever apply a scrub to my legs, which was awesome! After the scrub, they apply a citrus-grapefruit lotion on my legs equipped with a mini-massage. They did a fantastic job with cleaning my cuticles and applying the polish, which they have an extensive array of colors to choose from. (OPI included!) They even offered to do a design on my nails.If ever you need a private party for your girls or even a pedicure to show off in your cute sandals this summer, this nail salon is the place to go! Teresa's nail salon is clean, spacious, and professional. So check it out! Le's Nail Ltd is located right by Harlem & Irving plaza.

16.description: I wanted to get a french manicure, and noticed that this salon offered no-chip french manicures. Awesome! I work with kids, and wash my hands about a thousand times a day - I need something to last more than a few days. They've redesigned the salon since the last time I was here. And I had a great experience the last time I was here, because it felt just a little more private per nail station. The front of the salon is still for manicure stations, but instead of individual tables, there are two long tables, with a UV lamp/fan attached to each station. That's pretty nice, and prevents that whole clunky machine from being put on the table. I personally hate the setup, as I'm on top of other people and technicians. They don't even have a front desk anymore, just a tiny table with something to show the menu and prices, and barely enough room for a clipboard to sign in. The register and credit card machine are in a little nook in the corner. I sat down and was told that my technician was finishing his lunch, so I would be waiting for a few minutes. WHAT? I definitely understand someone needing to eat their lunch, but to tell me that is awful. Who wants to feel like they are rushing someone's lunch, especially because when they finished, they had to do something for you? There was one technician there (with very short hair), who was clearly popular and had personal relationships with some of the other customers, but they did not (do not) have one with me. I don't want to hear another technician refer to another person as a b****, because I don't know if she is talking about a customer or another technician. At one point, I misheard my technician, who didn't speak loudly, and this technician first laughed at me, and then had their customer laugh at me as well. She had the audacity to ask me if I'd been drinking too much. They also started talking about the big turnover in technicians. Kyle (my technician, at least that's the name I caught) clearly looked uncomfortable at this exchange, so brownie points for him. My nails look nice, but not how I really wanted them to look. I wanted a thinner line for the white polish, and my nails aren't square or round, but kind of like softened trapezoids. My cuticles look great, though, and they're usually my biggest problem. A forearm and hand massage was a part of this manicure, and I'm glad I was asked to pay when my manicure was dry. I will not be back to this salon - the rude technician ruined this salon for me, and I would never want them as my technician if I do another walk-in appointment.

17.description: Anne is very good and remembers what you like.does a great pedicure and massage on your legs. Great place very clean and updated.Theresa is nice and the rest of the staff also.

10.description: i had to park on the side street, but that was ok. Located in the strip mall across Irving Park Road from the HIP mall. Very busy salon. Very clean. Loved the massaging chairs and the jet foot bath in the pedi area. Did not like that someone brought their kid to work that day and she kept crying for her mama......Finger nails filed a little rough, and that caused one to start chipping as soon as i got home, but i hit it with my own file and a quick coat of clear saved the day!I would go back and try them again and hope for a different nail tech.

5.description: Update your yelp page! We drove 45 minutes only to be turned away because they were closing, yet there were still other customers? It says you close at 8pm, not 5pm. What a waste.

11.description: This place seems to be clean.  I've had better luck at this nail salon than the others by the hip...the only time I'm not happy is when I get one of the guys...it's uncomfortable....sometimes my no chip last the full two weeks and sometimes just a week depending on the person. I've never loved any of the nail techs to make appts...but I'd like to start in order to not get the guys.Bring cash for tip.

3.description: I am incredibly annoyed with the quality work from this place. I had come here because Google showed me a pretty good rating on the place and assumed that I get a good quality of work done. After having my nails done, you can tell that the work done for the acrylics wasn't done well. It already looked as though the nails would fall off and or it wasn't set to fill the whole nail. I was in no rush, nor were there any customers waiting after me for the lack of detail on my nails to be acceptable. I have gotten acrylics done many times from different places and I have never been as disappointed as I was with the work done here. The filing was rushed and incredibly painful that I had had open cuts from the filing on the tips of my fingers. My cuticles had not been pushed down or properly attended to to make the job look clean. Some nails turned out to be longer or wider than others. Had I known the quality work that I would be getting before going in, I would have just gone to the Walgreens down the street to buy the fake stick-on nails there since that's what the work looked like. I will not be going back.

0.description: Servise was amazing,they are so professional!!! I walked in last minute,they stayed and finished my nails so detail and with so much patience like it wasn't after hours..I would definitely recommend this place and i ll come again

20.description: I took my sister, and 2 of my good female friends there for pedi and mani's and everyone loved it!  They all said it was great service as well as very clean and the ladies were fun!

19.description: I love this place, they always are courteous, do a great job and find time to squeeze you in if you are a walk in.  They often stay open well past their business hours to accommodate their clients.  Theresa (the owner) is the best and does the best free style nail art you ever seen.  The other staff is good too, never had a problem.  The others who complained here, must have went on a off day or to a different nail salon not affiliated with this one. A lot people confuse this place (Le's Nails) with the other Lee Nails (which are a chain & horrible).  Le's Nails has loyal die hard customers like myself and is always happy to take on new patrons.   Better than any nail salon around in this area.

2.description: Do not follow the pricing that is listed under services. It is completely wrong and is almost 2x more expensive than what is listed. My actual pedicure was decent, the gentleman who did my pedicure was very nice and it wasn't until I went to pay that I was over this place. I asked the lady who checked me out why the pricing was different on yelp than what I was being charged and her 1st response...That is not us! Ummm yes it is, this is your address, right?! 2nd response...That is for the junior pedicure. Whatever, I do not plan on returning.

18.description: I've been going to another nail salon in the same area and felt like the people really didn't know what they were doing, and didn't really care. I decided to go to Le's because I wanted my nails to look better than they have in months. I went this morning and Theresa gave me a mani first, and then a pedi. I like that my fingers had time to dry while she did my toes. I'm the kind of person who ends up ruining their nails grabbing their keys or phone. So i was kind of nice to relax and let them sit.My nails turned out great. No streaks, no bubbling unlike the last place. I've been so happy about my nails all day that my friends have started teasing me. It really made my monday. :)

13.description: I saw Linda today.  She did a good job on my no-chip manicure.  I'm new to the area and went to Nail Tech up the street the last two times but as much as I like the ladies there I couldn't go back after my last appt. for a no-chip took an hour and a half!  Le Nails has a really nice atmosphere.  Seems pretty well run and organized.  I'll go back again if I don't make it to my lady downtown.  I feel like downtown they are a little more on trend with new colors but if you know what you want then this place is great!  There wasn't parking in the lot today as it's a small lot but I found easy street parking around the corner.

4.description: I don't know how they work here but maybe you should change the hours on yelp I just walked up and it's closed a waste of my drive thank you I know it's Sunday but it says they close at 8 PM and it's 6 o'clock now...

6.description: They didn't do the order right of how they are supposed to prep the nails before applying anything! Didn't push my cuticles back at all. Some of the sides of my fingers were cut from super harsh nail filing. The shape of the nails was uneven when I compared hands. It was very rushed even though there were no customers waiting. My friend wasn't happy with her nails either.

15.description: This nail salon is a 2-hour vacation away from home. The salon is very dainty. There is a front section and a back section in the salon. The front section is for the manicures, and the back section is for the spa pedicures. I love how the back section's walls are painted a beautiful pink pastel. They have very relaxing pictures on the walls that takes you away from everything going crazy in normal life lol.I came here with a bunch of girlfriends for a surprise b-day, and I had a blast. In order to have the private party, the nail salon had to close just for us 8 girls equipped with the music of our choice. We were also able to bring our own food and drinks to this nail salon! The owner, Theresa, was so kind to make us a huge tray of her delicious Vietnamese egg rolls. These egg rolls were super awesome, really! (Sidenote: she sells these huge trays of huge Vietnamese egg rolls for about $25)If you think the egg rolls were great, the mani/pedi was superb. They start you off in their massaging leather chairs with your feet in the relaxing, hot, blue water. During the spa pedicure, they apply a beaded scrub to your calves and feet. And, this nail salon has been the first one to ever apply a scrub to my legs, which was awesome! After the scrub, they apply a citrus-grapefruit lotion on my legs equipped with a mini-massage. They did a fantastic job with cleaning my cuticles and applying the polish, which they have an extensive array of colors to choose from. (OPI included!) They even offered to do a design on my nails.If ever you need a private party for your girls or even a pedicure to show off in your cute sandals this summer, this nail salon is the place to go! Teresa's nail salon is clean, spacious, and professional. So check it out! Le's Nail Ltd is located right by Harlem & Irving plaza.

7.description: Nikki is my go to person. I used to just walk in but some people arent as good and charge more. Luckly I  would get her often and my nails come out perfect everytime when she does them. It was meant to be! Now I make sure to make an appointment with her even if its for the same day... or in my case 30 minutes from now and she's always available. Prices are great too. I'm happy I found this place and nail tech.

8.description: A friend of mine referred me to Le's as this is her go to place. After my experience I can confidently say this will NEVER be my go to place. The owner needs a serious attitude and customer service re-assessment.July 30th was my first visit. I selected an OPI infinity shine polish (a $10 up charge) and I appreciated being advised up front about the additional fee.During my pedi and mani my cuticles were cut down to the point of bleeding. They are completely peeling now. Painful! The next day my cuticles were peeling, looked as though I had never gotten them cleaned and my nail polish started chipping. I went this morning to get them re-done. My 2nd visit was the nail on the coffin for this place.I  walked in at 9am and was greeted by Jenny. I shared with Jenny I was in 3 days prior and my polish was already chipping after paying extra for the polish. She asked who took care of me and when I identified him she had me sit in his chair and shared that he would take care of me. Painless. The gentleman asked which nails needed touch up and I shared they all did. I thought he would re-do them. No, he added a coat of color and layer of top coat. I might as well have just done no chip! I went under the dryer and my nails looked like crap! He went to service someone's pedicure so I asked Jenny (who had gotten on her cell with her headphones) and when she responded to me I was fuming!First, who answers a customer with "what" when they signal for your attention!?! I started sharing that my nails looked bad - she cut me off and said "come here". You tell your customer to come to you? You're two chairs over cutting paper towels into strips, having a ball on your cell while your employees are working and you can't go to the customer? I walk over, she looks at my nails and her only solution is to RUDELY say "well, go tell him to fix them" twice. WTH!?!?! The customer is supposed to go to the nail technician, interrupt them during their current appointment? He must have heard how loudly and rudely she was addressing me because he came scurrying toward me. She gave him a look of death. Poor guy! I mean I was upset because of the nails but having witnesses this atrocious demeanor on behalf of his boss I felt very bad for this guy. I wouldn't have had to go an be a "nuisance" to her if my nails were done properly in the first place. Things happen so I had to go a second time. Don't treat people like crap for crap jobs.I will NEVER visit this place again. This review shouldn't even get one star!

14.description: These girls did my nails even though they were closed!!  I couldn't find anyone open after 8!!  So grateful!!  Thank you!!!

29.description: I switched from Lurvey's because they began to be just as expensive. Pesches IS very expensive, which is why 4 instead of 5 stars. However, Pesches plants are superior... Healthier... The soil that the plants are packed in is much better and plants are less rootbound than any other garden center in the area. As others have noted, the selection is the very best. I love the doggone place, in fact. its a beautiful greenhouse and in the spring its a joy to just be here... Yes, even in spite of the crowds on the weekends... Especially crowded around Mothers Day. They are very organized, though, in helping you to get a parking place, and the cops help direct the traffic coming in so ive never had a problem. The staff are usually wonderful but you can get a grumpster or two... Usually they are the middle management. ... Wally, who is their resident expert is very helpful but tends to push the dr. Earth products. He can be arrogant but he also can be extremely nice and hes very fair if you have a legitimate complaint.  the guys that help you to your car and the ones who answer questions... The seasonal help... Are terrific. i dont like the no return policy... But i can understand it... If you speak to the owner Chris Pesche who is often there at the peak season... He is a nice person, also fair.... If you make your case they will be flexible. Unfortunately, some of the managers dont convey this as well as they might.  If you arent a regular customer and dont know the ropes, you can get a bad impression. And thats a shame, because Pesche's offers real value.  I buy my perennials and larger plants here and all but the most common annuals, as well as houseplants and gifts.  If you just want run of the mill stuff you may want to go elsewhere though,  if cost is a factor.

42.description: An amazing selection and huge place to just walk around and drool. I especially liked how they listed who ("Chris Peske") had planted the seedling. We were approached in pretty much every area about finding things or needing help - everyone was very friendly. No idea if their knowledgable, but when I noted that they got some of their plants from Monrovia Nursery (which I had been to in SoCal when I was growing up) the person explained that they got stock from all over: Michigan, Ohio, East Coast and Monrovia. They do seem to know their stuff!We ended up buying birdseed for a feeder we had bought earlier at Wild Birds Unlimited - they even had the squirrel-proof feeders. Maybe even at a lower price! Ooops!

23.description: I am giving 1 star for reckless driving. I was following their van just today from Glenview road to Dearlove road  and eventually this van turned left on Dee road. This driver should not be driving, swerving, blowing horns if driver in front too slow for him, giving F finger to every driver! I don't know what was his problem! He was rude, reckless and accident waiting to happen. He do not care if the van he was driving has the company's name and telephone number written all over it. He is a disgrace to this good company. I called their office about this driver so I hope he will be reprimanded with his actions!

47.description: I still love you,Pesche's,but you, my dear,have gotten very expensive.I went last night to gather the remaining plants needed for my garden. I did not buy a few items that I normally would have,because I knew I could get them for a lot less elsewhere. I did get my herbs and veggies,as I do love your selcetion and quality,but some other items are going to be purchased elsewhere.Sorry,but gotta watch prices these days.

8.description: Pesche's has an excellent selection of the best flowers available in the Chicagoland. I come here every spring (mid May) to get the best choices of hard to find flowers for the garden/landscaping. The prices are very commensurable to the quality, meaning what you get is what you pay for and that is quality plants/flower. I have ordered many bouquets for birthdays and special occasions and I was NEVER disappointed. No where else in Chicago or the Suburbs have I see the precise quality of these flowers. I've never had them deliver anything, because I usually don't trust any delivery types. Overall great place to get high-quality flowers for an occasion. Another favorite nursery of mine is Platt Nursery in Bloomingdale on Lake Street if you're in the western suburbs.

31.description: I had Pesche's supply the flowers I needed for my wedding. Because I had a dear friend make my bouquets, I only needed to order the flowers for the bouquets. I mostly had Orange Gerber Daisies. These flowers were beautiful! Plus, Pesche's charged $1.50 less per stem than Busse's Florist. Thank you Pesche's for helping to make my special day VERY special!!!

34.description: Terrible customer service. Sold a hanging basket with broken bottom which won't hold the water and it made the plant die.  When I brought it in, all they did was to give me an old empty basket and told me I killed it by not watering it.  Refuse to replace the plant saying they don't have the plant anymore.  Didnt even apologize and actually had the audacity to say i was lying.  I worked so hard to care for the plant, watering up to 3 times a day and I wouldn't take it back if I killed it. Go to home depot or Lowes instead.

16.description: Stumbled on this place while looking for a different garden center, and am glad I stopped.  I had a pretty weird list of plants that i've had bad luck finding at my regular places.  But Pesche's had much of what I wanted, and a few things that i didn't know about but were better than my initial ideas.  So yea, HUGE selection.Only minus is there's no shade perennial section.  They had a few stretches of them, but the were spread out among sun-lovers.

13.description: DO NOT order from this place. They failed to deliver flowers to my mom on MOTHER'S DAY of all days. When I called, the individual who said she is the supervisor placed me on hold for 10 mins, hung up on me when I announced to her my disappointment and when I called back she had no sympathy or remorse whatsoever. Plain rude and unapologetic.  Jaw dropped. Cannot believe them. Continued to say..."what do you want me to do? If you want i can send flowers with an apology note" in a snobby way.  Any good and professional establishment would do that regardless without being disrespectful. Giving you all fair warning.

11.description: Nice selection of flowers and shrubs BUT horrible service. Much of their staff knows nothing about plants. They also do not accept returns on their plants nor do they offer a warranty on the plant for the first year. My advice go to Knupper's nursery in Palatine they know their plants.

39.description: As a husband who gets constantly dragged to garden centers by his horticulturally ambitious wife, I've found Peche's to be one of the most tolerable. OK, sometimes I even enjoy it...slightly. Their prices are good and fair, and plants are visibly healthier than most. Customer service is friendly and knowledgeable (unlike the big chains like Home Depot).  They also have their plants grouped in helpful categories, for those creating gardens (grasses, annuals, perennials), not that I'd know what any of that stuff means.I just dig holes and put the plants in them.

37.description: Great plants. Knowledgeable staff - Walter knows all about tomatoes and shows you pictures of his garden. Not cheap, but worth every penny.Don't miss their wonderful fresh flower division. It's the only florist I use for deliveries. They are the best and their flowers are really fresh.

0.description: Pesches has a great selection of flowers and plants at good prices. I've also had great service every time ive gone there.

38.description: A lot of variety and big inventory....but fairly expensive.

51.description: If you ever happen to be driving up river road & rand in the spring, and get in a traffic jam, it's most likely Peche's customers buying this year's garden plants.This place gets packed.. they have traffic directors to help with the congestion. Pesches is a bit of a drive for us. And one day while I was in the area I decided to stop in. And we have gone every year since. I was in AWE. The selection, the quality, the SELECTION. Ohh my goodness. It is just amazing.We plant a large vegtable garden, as well as have many hanging flower baskets.  Depending on where and when you find your garden supplies, there can be limited selection. But Pesche's is stocked through the planting season, and the quality of these plants justifies the price. Downside, is the crowd, but you can always go during the week... would not recommend the weekend during the spring!

27.description: My husband and I bought our home a few months ago and took out every hedge and bush in the front, we were left with a plain white house and needed landscaping badly.  We made a few trips to Home Depot and walked out empty handed, they were all sold out of what we needed, I called 3 other HD's and still no luck.  We paid a second visit to Chalet but like the first visit the staff was unfriendly and no one even acknowledged us, they were too busy chatting amongst themselves.  We decided on Pesche's and I'm so glad we did.  In reading the other review about being dressed down and ignored I don't get it, we had been painting our house and covered in paint and did not look our best but that did not stop anyone from coming up to us and asking to help us.  We were there for about 2 hours and worked with Tyler, he was awesome, he helped us every step of the way and was super knowledgeable.  I will upgrade to 5 stars once I know my shrubs will not die :)

32.description: Stumbled on this place while looking for a different garden center, and am glad I stopped.  I had a pretty weird list of plants that i've had bad luck finding at my regular places.  But Pesche's had much of what I wanted, and a few things that i didn't know about but were better than my initial ideas.  So yea, HUGE selection.Only minus is there's no shade perennial section.  They had a few stretches of them, but the were spread out among sun-lovers.

48.description: I bought some plants there,  it was alright.   They had this guy Charlie working at the check out line.  He was well-groomed and polite.

44.description: We bought some plants from Pesche's in the spring, planted them, and come summertime, they aren't dead. Woohoo! Some of this might be because we followed instructions when planting and have good soil, but even with those measures taken, if you buy an unhealthy plant, it will die no matter how well you care for it. Also, we have a reputation around here for killing plants, so I am now convinced that Pesche's sells only healthy, hardy plants to its customers.Unfortunately, there's a lot of emphasis on and promotion of non-native, invasive plant species, just like at most garden centers around here. I understand the "tropical" department is really meant to be houseplants, but there were plants like Japanese Barberry that are meant to grow outside but are invasive and dangerous to grow in your yard, as they'll likely spread to other areas and crowd out native plants. They do also sell non-invasive alternatives to these plants--for example, Ninebark is similar--but I haven't seen employees actively promoting these better alternatives. In fact, there are signs encouraging people who want to attract hummingbirds and butterflies to purchase flowers from a list Pesche's has devised, and on that list are several invasive flowers alongside native species. I understand that there's a demand for these dangerous plants, but I feel like if garden centers actively promoted local species (and after talking with the staff when planning our own flowerbed, we know they are knowledgeable enough to do this), the demand for exotic invasive plants would decrease.Aside from that, Pesche's is a great place with a lot of history and a lot of inventory. Coyote problems? You can purchase humanely-harvested coyote urine to scare off the furry critters from a rack right underneath a picture of JFK taken when he was in the area for a parade. Need a trellis? There are many to choose from, and while you browse you can wonder if a German prisoner of war stood where you're standing during WWII , because down River Road a bit there once existed a prison camp who used Pesche's for their work program. (That's right, if you lived in Des Plaines in the 1940's and had flowers delivered to you, the delivery man may have been a Nazi spy.) Do you need window decals to decrease bird strikes? You can buy them here while contemplating the hard work and dedication that goes into handing a business like this down from generation to generation.This place gets crazy busy at certain times, and you'll see police directing traffic in and out of the parking lot. My advice? Stay away on those days. Somebody is likely to tackle you in a greenhouse over the last petunia tray on Mother's Day. You can come back next weekend; there will be more. In fact, if they don't have what you want, you can ask in person or call to find out when what you need will be in stock. We, for example, showed up two weeks before they put out their coneflower sproutings, and they told us exactly when to come back to get some.Overall, I'd like to give Pesche's five stars because I love family-owned businesses with excellent service and great inventory, but I don't think I can as long as they're encouraging people to buy plants that destroy local ecosystems and/or require excessive chemical fertilization and watering to survive in Illinois. Signs or pamphlets promoting something like xeriscaping instead could drum up just as much business without imperiling the environment.

24.description: This is my go- to flower and garden center. I refuse to buy flowers from chain retailers because they charge a ton for ugly flowers- mostly just convenience fees. Pesche's is your quintessential "ma and pop shop" that offers excellent customer service and beautiful products. I placed an order today and had prompt delivery- and the arrangement was gorgeous. My friend sent a picture of them and they looked exactly as they did on the site. The ordering process was fast and flawless. They didn't subsitute the flowers for cheaper ones, as Teleflora or Flowers.com does, and the flowers looked healthy. The basket wasn't an eye sore- it was beautifully done. I didn't expect the arrangement to arrive same day- I will continue to order from them. You won't be disappointed!!!

7.description: Sorry I have to give it a star at all. Last week called and had flowers sent to a wake. Six days later they called and said there was a problem- they were never sent! Absolutely unreal. Every excuse in the book. "Problems with that computer". Really???Doesn't count, too late.

49.description: I always end up walking people around here when I bring them home. This place is nearly as big as some other city's botanical gardens, and they have a big koi pond and outdoor garden center.Unfortunately for me I worked here one spring in 2003 and hated it. The customers are very rude and have a holier-than-thou-im-buying-$600-in-perrenials attitude.

40.description: Pesche's has the best flowers  and selection I have seen in the Chicago area.  I have been going there for over twenty years and never have been disappointed.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  I would recommend Pesche's to anyone looking for high quality flowers!!

30.description: RUDE.  Called today to inquire about spending a couple hundred dollars on some indoor plants.  Was just looking for some suggestions on ideas and before we came out there this weekend and before I could barely get my question out, was cut off and practically hung up on.  "We have a lot in our greenhouse, just come in ok?"Answer to that question...nope.  Won't be coming in.   Just got off the phone with Lurvey's where they were exceptionally friendly and helpful and were more than willing to talk to me about my order (which will end up being around $600 BTW).Thanks for nothing.

46.description: My family has gone to Pesche's for at least the last 15 years.  Their nursery is great with excellent variety and a wonderful staff that really goes the extra mile to help.  When I moved out and got married I started coming here too, although being an apartment dweller I now come for houseplants and decor. Their houseplants are excellent and they have home accents for every style and budget.This last year we added some beautiful ornaments to our Christmas tree from the garden gift shop. Highly recommended.

1.description: Stopped by here to get some flowers and indoor plants. This place is super overpriced. Flowers that cost  $6 in Jewell cost $18 here for a small bouquet. Disappointing. Not a big selection either. Indoor plant selection is not bad but definitely not as many unique or modern options although it depends on the season. On the weekend this place is pure insanity. No parking, police coordinates traffic. They have a. If outdoor setup but the parking lot cannot accommodate the traffic. Just not a good layout. The store itself is relatively small and doesn't have as many products. The decor items like fake plants are extremely overpriced. 1 glitter stem is $18 WHAT???Try to come during sale days so you can get 50% off on select items

9.description: This just happened right now. So I was walking to the metra station. In Des Plaines as I always do going home from work and I walk by this garden center. I just moved into a new place 4 days ago and wanted to buy some plants for my Sun room. I decided to stop by to see what types of plAnts they have. They were closed. So I looked around to the plants they had outside. Out of no where a lady in a white SUV starts yelling at me to get off the property or she will call the cops on me!  This was the manager or owner of this store yelling at me. I wasn't doing anything wrong! I was planning on spending several hundred dollars there but not anymore! I mean, who does that?! You need customers to keep your business alive yet this crazy lady is threatening people who are merely looking at the merchandise!

26.description: Amazing....and I'm not just talking about the plants...the service is outstanding.  I had heard about them from some friends....so when I needed some special assistance with a native restoration project....I had never been to Pesche's before.  They readily and happily agreed to help me and even loaned me some space.  So where did I go to buy plants for my patio this year?  Pesche's.  Where did I go to get native plants for a friends's garden?  Pesche's.  There are several large garden centers MUCH closer, not to mention numerous big box stores if you're into those...but none have the SERVICE, selection and fair pricing.Thank you Pesche's!

25.description: The worse customer service!!  We went looking for a bird house for a memorial service for a priest that had passed away.  Our church buys all of their plants for the church here and it was just the place to go to look for a bird house. We found one that was already built and decided to purchase one just like but had to be put together.  Upon setting up for the memorial we opened the box and items from the box were missing.  The instructions were so faded we couldn't make out any words.  Also the main posts that piece together to hold the house up had a knot right where the two met and ended up breaking off making the post useless.  These two pieces had to be glued together.  We then had to find similar screws to continue to put the house together.  Some of the wood pieces were chipped and others chipped when screwing it together.  We ended up just nailing the wood pieces together because the material was so cheap it could not be screwed.  I called Pesces to inform them of the poor quality of this item.  Annette, the manager was extremely rude to us.  She said that the buyer inspects all the product and that there was no missing pieces and that there were no refunds or exchanges because the bird house was on sale.  So.......... we should have known because it was on sale it would have missing pieces and would poor quality?  I wasn't looking for a refund.  I was looking to exchange it or even just an I'm sorry you must have gotten a lemon.... Anything but the poor customer service we received.  Needless to say we won't be coming back here.  Poor, poor customer service.  Lack of appreciation for the customer especially when we give them so much business year round.  Extremely disappointed.

12.description: I ordered a gift card online and couldn't believe there was a "delivery charge" of $14.95. Has the cost of stamps gone up that high!  That's just crazy.

21.description: Poor customer service. I called to get price quotes on shrubs and was put on hold twice for a long time and then hung up on. The third time I called, they took a message and said they'll call back. At this point, I'd rather take my business elsewhere.

17.description: My wife and I had a tropical themed wedding. We bought three hibiscus plants which didn't bloom. The flowers we ordered for the wedding were shorted. All they delivered were corsages. I decorated our cake myself with flowers bought at Jewel.

10.description: This place is pure garbage. Plants die, flowers die, deliveries are late and to top it all off they have absolutely horrendous customer service. I don't know how they stay in business.

5.description: This is probably the only garden center in the Chicago area that has quality flowers for planting beyond July 1st. Many of us need to fill in space and rely on Pesche's for their high quality. The geraniums are unparalleled. It takes me about 40 min to drive each way, but so worth the effort. And pay no attention to the previous reviewer that says that the staff doesn't know anything. They are very attentive and informative. And, a big plus- they'll be glad to put plastic in your car and load it up.

3.description: I had a special request for funeral flowers: I wanted them to include Birds of Paradise. Pesche's Flowers was the only shop that I called that had them available. I was so happy to work with Maria after contacting many other flower shops. She was very responsive, clear, and consice, and she was able to answer all of my questions. I called other local flower places as well as FTD (abosolutely aweful customer service). It was just so nice to work with someone like Maria!The flowers for the funeral were unique and absolutely beautiful. They had tiger lillies, maroon gerber daisies, and other flowers. I was so happy to see that they could provide this beautiful creation for the grieving. However, when I noticed typos on the note, I was somwhat upset. There were misspellings as well as bad grammer. I contacted Maria again and showed her the photo of the note. She apologized and gave me some credit back. What excellent customer service!A tip for future orders: keep your notes short and simple. I think some of the folks who work at Pesche's may not be the most profficient in English. I would recomend Pesche's, and I look forward to getting flowers from them again.

35.description: There are many wonderful and interesting plants here. The staff is great especially at the help desk; they've helped to save many plants!  There's a great fairy garden inside too!

19.description: Amazing....and I'm not just talking about the plants...the service is outstanding.  I had heard about them from some friends....so when I needed some special assistance with a native restoration project....I had never been to Pesche's before.  They readily and happily agreed to help me and even loaned me some space.  So where did I go to buy plants for my patio this year?  Pesche's.  Where did I go to get native plants for a friends's garden?  Pesche's.  There are several large garden centers MUCH closer, not to mention numerous big box stores if you're into those...but none have the SERVICE, selection and fair pricing.Thank you Pesche's!

28.description: I had heard wonderful things about them.  On arrival, the entire place looked extremely impressive.  I approached an associate and explained I was looking for yellow rose bushes for my mother's memorial.  She waved her hand and told me to go back to the other side of the building.  I did find a rose section, however, I can't tell a rose from a leaf of grass.  I tried to get someone to help me for over an hour before leaving empty handed and going else where.  Associates here, are rude, uncaring and make absolutely no attempts to hide that!  Yuck!!

45.description: OMG this place is great. Great plants and great service. The variety is very good. You'll find a crowd most days, but just go ahead and shop!

33.description: Goodbye pesches you have lost your job as the Malloy family's go to flower place. Let me start by saying what my sitch was. My ex's mother who I was EXTREMELY close with (lived with for 6 years in her basement.) called me and told me that she had pancreatic cancer and was having surgery and just wanted to call me and let me know how much I meant to her *tear :'( * so clearly I was very upset and worried. I ordered a beautiful vase with a teddy bear hugging it and pretty purple flowers. I found out that she would be getting out early so I called pesches early in the am and they assured me that if she was not there anymore they would let me know. So that was December and I waited to hear how she was doing for months and figured it was rude to ask her if she got my flowers so finally a few weeks ago I write her a Private message to ask how she was doing and inquired as to if she liked the flowers and of course she hadn't gotten them. She is from Alabama and definitely has southern charm so I knew if she had gotten them she would have thanked me OR something! So I call pesches and explain the situation and she tells me OH well that was in december...... Me: ok well I payed for them and this lady wouldn't lie about it.  Her: well it's gonna take some time to figure this out I'll call you a different day.So she calls me like the next day or so and says ok well we can send something and I tell her no you will send what I payed for that you didn't deliver on. After dealing with a TERRIBLE TERRIBLE attitude she says ok. I was happy to hear from my friend and she told me that she had received them, yet extremely pissed to hear the guy freaked her out by basically hounding her for a tip do bad he nearly walking into her house behind her! What really got me was that I worried this whole time if she was ok and do not talk to my ex so I just had to wait it out then deal with that tude! In the words of stephanie tanner.....HOW RUDE!

43.description: If you use a Garmin like I do, be  prepared to turn the corner onto River Road to enter Pesche. It's an enormous nursery with several greenhouses, outdoor lot full of plants, and a multi-room indoor store to which is attached another greenhouse/room. The size was almost overwhelming, but by this point in the season, most of their plants are either gone or have been moved. The staff was extremely helpful and nice, from giving me and my sad purple thumb directions on what plants to plant when and where and how, to pointing me in the direction of the tropical plant section which had been moved to the greenhouse-room. They appear to have everything from the planters to benches to fertilizer, and from indoor tree-plants to cacti. Don't be shy to grab someone and ask for help!Overall: While the accoutrements seemed expensive, they have good sales going now on 99 cent plants to %'s off their pots or discounts on all perennials. They've got great variety and friendly staff.

2.description: This is an update to the 1 doz. purple & yellow roses my husband bought for my 30th...they didn't even last a week! Save your money and DEFINITELY go elsewhere. Jewell, Walmart, Walgreens and even Aldi has prettier/healthier flowers for less than half the cost of Pesche's flowers. Boo.

18.description: Great varieties of plants. We spend over $2k there in the past 2 years. Just simply can't stop going. Very addicting.The garden staffs are nice and knowledgeable. However, not everyone know where everything is. Probably because they have so much plants there. I asked for sweet peas plants and one staff said they only have seeds. Luckily I saw 3 trays of sweet peas plants as I was walking out. Other than that, great garden staffs.The cashier staffs, on the other hand, are horrible. No greeting, no smile, no nothing. The older ladies are nice but the younger ones are horrific. I spent over $300 on veggies and flowers there last week, and they managed the whole transaction without saying a word to me.

41.description: They sell lots fo flowers, and nice place to look around, and big parking lot, and services are ok

52.description: Great place to get all your flowers and plants for the summer garden. The plants are always beautiful and the help is helpful.

50.description: Whatever gardening thing, plant, or shrub you might be looking for, chances are you'll find it here. The place is enormous, spanning most of the triangular region bounded by River Road, Rand, and the train tracks. The bedding plants are always nice and not wilted or pre-killed, as usually you see at Jewel, Home Depot or other chain store. I would not buy their overpriced soil or mulch, but I love their potted perennials, hanging baskets, and wide variety of decorations for the garden. It is also great to come in the fall and pick out spring bulbs  - one or many, rather than settle for the 6 or 12-packs of mixed bulbs in other stores. For a hardened gardening enthusiast like myself, this is Nirvana, like Patty V says.

4.description: As far as flowers go.  I love this place.  However, I was there on the off season because they sell 'fairy homes'.  My daughter really wanted one.  There was a beautiful fairy home on display that was slightly damaged.  All fairy homes and accessories were 50% off.  The fairy home in question was not marked with a price.  I approached an unfriendly employee about the fairy home.  She immediately took the fairy home away from me, said she could not sell a damaged house.  And refused to talk with me further.  I. Was. Pissed.  I went and found another sales lady.  Spoke with her about my previous encounter.  She said if it were up to her, she would be more than happy to sell me the house, but it was not in her section.  Last I checked, everything is for sale.  I wanted to buy this fairy house.  Broken or not.  I will never again enter the indoor store for anything but to purchase my annuals.  So disappointed.

6.description: Their customer service is poor.  I was in their shop over the weekend because they had sent me a customer appreciation sale email - great!  So, I go in and find out that the advertisement for an additional 20% on sale items is misleading at best.  In the checkout, I tried speaking to Lynnet about the true cost of some items that I had picked out, and really received poor customer service from her.  She was at another register, couldn't be bothered with walking over to where I was checking out, even though there wasn't anyone else checking out ANYWHERE, and was haphazardly yelling / explaining to me how the sale works.  She had a really poor attitude as well.  Really!?  I drove 40 minutes to specifically go to this store.  Go somewhere else for your plant needs!  Speaking with one of the manager afterwards on the telephone for 15min, she stopped short of apologizing for my experience, and said that she hates doing sales, as they always have problems with them, and don't normally do them.  Save yourself the time and go to Lurvey's for a more professional experience.

22.description: Everything I could have ever wanted for my garden I've found at Pesche's! I wish the prices could be a little cheaper but paying more for great quality is worth it.

15.description: They literally have any type of plant, flower, tree, shrub, lawn decoration, etc..you may be looking for.  It is extremely large with multiple green houses.  Employees are very friendly and helpful.  It is very organized.  In my opinion, they are a little pricey with some of their plants and flowers, but they are all wonderful quality and you will find things here that you won't find somewhere like Home Depot.  It's definitely worth a visit.  We choose to buy all of our vegetable plants here.

20.description: I was looking for a specific shrub that nobody seemed to carry.. Found Pesche's online, called them, got knowledgable answers on the phone and went there today to buy my shrub. They have an enormous selection of all sorts of plants. Gigantic! Not the cheapest though. It was very busy today but still the customer service was great. I was asked if I needed help multiple times. Everybody was very friendly. Well worth the drive for me.

36.description: I ordered flowers here for Mother's Day at my Mom's recommendation.  The reviews looked good, and after talking to a very friendly, helpful person when placing my order, I was feeling good about the decision. They provided a very large delivery window, but hey, I understood since it was one of the busiest days of the year.  However, my mother NEVER got the flowers.  They did leave her a few messages to check to see if she received them, so it seems that perhaps they suspected something was up, and they were trying to be proactive (they get points for that).    When my Mom told them she never received the flowers they did offer to upgrade her delivery, but sadly, she told them to just credit me for the order.  I don't think they should have allowed her to decide that since I was the one who ordered the flowers.  I wanted her to have flowers, so they should have asked ME whether I wanted the order credited or not (subtract points for that).(In their defense, we have had delivery problems before from another flower shop that tried to deliver to her house---I'm not sure if there's something weird about her address, but it seems that flower shops can't find her.)

14.description: I usually go here in early to mid June. I also go here for their Martha Washington geraniums, because they offer a great selection of colors. These bloom all summer long and look fantastic as a stand-alone in a large container or large urn. Their prices are not "cheap" so expect to drop some serious $$$ at this place. Also, you can find unique plants that you will NOT find at your local Home DePot garden center. I am passionate about gardening, creating unique and beautiful containers myself, and doing my own hanging baskets. I get this passion from my Dad who is an award-winning gardener (in the area of roses). I love their variety of perennials and annuals, which provide a pop of color when nothing else is blooming. The lines can get long at the end of May and even the day before Mother's Day, but they move quickly and they have plenty of young college students helping out at the registers. I do not know of any professional nursery that will "Guarantee" their trees or any other species and provide a money-back guarantee. They have beautiful, lush, healthy hanging baskets and sell lots of "Proven Winners" (these are annuals). I love the variety of Coleus plants too. Last year, I combined the dark maroon with lime green coleus plants for a pop of color in a small area of our backyard garden. These do very well in early morning sun and need shade in the afternoon. These are lush and grow to 12 inches in height. They look fantastic in our garden.  If you pinch off the flowers they will bloom again throughout the summer months.I purchased a white fragrant Japanese crab apple tree from here about 10 years ago. My father helped me plant it and it is the centerpiece of our front yard. We have several mature trees on the side of our house (we have a corner lot that is huge in Chicago). This crab apple tree blooms beautifully every Spring. It is now a mature tree. Every time someone walks by our house I notice people standing there admiring it and taking in a deep breath to get a whiff of the light, sweet fragrance that it produces. The flowers are white with a deep pink center. Every time that tree blooms I think of my Dad. I also purchased a deep purple Peony Tree (which is now 5 ft tall and 4 ft wide) about the same time. The flowers are about 10 inches wide (they look like giant pom-poms). Both have thrived in our front yard, and have provided years of beautiful blooms. I know Spring has officially arrived when our crab apple tree and peony tree burst open with beautiful blooms. I have never experienced any issues with anything that I have purchased at Pesche's Garden Center. This is a family-owned business that is now in their fourth generation. It was started over 50 years ago, and it is still going strong today. If you have never been here, and are seeking high quality unique items for your yard and/or containers or "hard to find" items, check it out. Christopher Pesche now runs the business along with his brother. He also has a son that works here. The Fifth Generation is already being trained for the future.

3.description: We were having a block party andI was in charge of getting donations for our raffle. Well I called up Dunkin Donuts and asked them if they would generously donate something (keep in mind that whenever companies donate their goods to something like this they can always take it off in taxes as long as they have recipts) I was told by the manager that someone had already been in and they had already recieved something for the block:LIE 1!! The block party rolled around and I asked the other person who was getting prizes if she went there and she said that she had and they told her someone else had already been in and got the donation LIE 2!! I am sorry but if they have to LIE  about something so trivial then they obviously don't want my business; it also makes me wonder what else they are lying about cleanliness? Freshness of the food? What? I got some other prizes and the block party was a success. People dont waste your money here there is another NICER Dunkin Donuts at Dunning Square.

1.description: Very rude staff. Never a hello, thank you, or have a nice day. They need to learn customer service skills ASAP

2.description: Service horrible! Customer service rude! Got my order wrong smh! Talk about starbucks now!

0.description: i like this place cause it's down the street from my house, but the service is HORRIBLE. Going through the drive though is like pulling teeth. It wasn't always this bad. I remember last summer when service was super quick and efficient. I'm not sure if they got new management, but if they did, they need to change it again. A lot of the workers are rude, and seems to have no courtesy whatsoever. i think i'd rather drive the extra 5 minutes to the next one just to avoid them here.

58.description: A pretty good menu for a independent store. Good cup of tea and sandwich. A place I feel comfortable bringing a bit of work to do. Really nice staff.

56.description: Quintessential small business that everyone in the neighborhood should come out and support. A true family run local business that takes great pride in giving personal service and an expertly brewed cup of joe for a fair price. They also have tasty pastries and a light food menu that is rumored to be growing soon. Can't wait. They also have a retro vibe that feels genuine, unlike all those chain restaurants that are art directed. A needed addition to the neighborhood and a must try spot for anyone on the northwest side.

29.description: A really great find! Loved the iced chai and the ham, egg and cheese sandwich. The staff was friendly and I loved the atmosphere.

42.description: So glad they opened this cozy but classy cafe. The vibe is incredibly warm and welcoming and coffee and tea offerings are top notch! Food menu is worth mentioning with great options for breakfast sandwiches as well as lunch offerings. (Cubaski and Chicken salad being specially noteworthy.) The owner operator makes sure that, even if you're just grabbing a cup and running, you are treated like family. This place rocks and its a much welcomed addition to the ever growing list of awesome things going on in our new and improved Portage Park neighborhood.So thankful they are here, bringing a Wicker Park vibe to Portage Park, and see all of you here!Alex

23.description: This is definitely my favorite coffee shop on the NW side. It is cute and cozy and a great asset to the neighborhood. I also love that they showcase artwork from local artists.The coffee is strong and delicious. It is much stronger than at chain coffee shops. I particularly liked the caramelocha (caramel and mocha). All of their coffees are available hot and iced and they offer cold brew as well.Unlike most coffee shops, Perkolator offers sandwiches for both breakfast and lunch. The bacon/nutella/banana sandwich is to die for.

47.description: Very nice place, nice staff, and decent menu.  I"d visit again.

8.description: It's happened. I'm officially a hipster; can hipsters be plus size? Do they usually surround themselves in this much color? Can they be dorky and clumsy? I'm not sure, but in any case, those are all me, and yet I feel like a hipster (in the best way) in this artsy coffee shop/cafe. Perkolator is like my version of hipster heaven. Or maybe espresso nirvana? So yes, atmosphere is everything. First off, great tunes played over a great sound system or speakers.  I love the vividly colored & wallpapered walls adorned with local artists' work for sale, and the bright, open feel of the dining area, and the creaky wood floors. I love that there are games and toys for kids to play with and board games for adults (sorry, no adult toys, this ain't that kind of place). I love the friendly and patient baristas and staff as well, always inviting. And before I get into the menu, if all that wasn't enough atmosphere, this just put Perkaltor over the top for me: they've opened an adjoining (dare I say Sci-fi) retro lounge area in the space next door filled with vinyl records and books to peruse! If playing with old clunky typewriters, turntables and telephones are your thing, you will most certainly appreciate the decor and retro lighting. Oh, did I mention the Ray-gun? There's a ray-gun, people!! And Star Trek posters, and a huge spaceman Martian and spaceship painted on one wall. If they had comic books, I'm quite certain the Big Bang Theory characters would hang out here. I may be mixing genres, but I just don't care. Enough-- on to the menu. Think breakfast sandwiches (which recently got a nod on Chicagoist, check it out), pastries and also bistro lunch options such as soups, greens, grilled cheese, paninis, and so on. Btw, these are some of the best scones ever. I suggest you seriously check out the pastry case.As for coffee drinks, I believe they have their own Perkolator brand in a variety of blends, in addition to sometimes featuring guest roasters (past ones have been Intelligentsia, Dark Matter, Metropolis, etc). Can we talk about dairy & non dairy options for a minute? They have got them all. Does your local barista offer HEMP milk? No? Well they should. I'm all about options and that's one you don't often see. (P.S. I tried it in my latte and enjoyed it.) They have all the usual suspects of dairy, plus, soy, almond, macadamia, coconut and hemp milk. This makes me happy. Not into coffee? There's also cold and hot teas, Italian sodas, milk, and possibly regular soda (I've never noticed)? Trust me when I say, this little place is a winner. Quaint, charming, retro, roomy, interesting, tasty. What more do you need? Wi-fi, maybe? Shut up, hipster. Duh, they have that, too.

31.description: I was craving some hot tea and luckily I found this place. Walked in and immediately fell in love with the atmosphere. Hidden gem! Love the vintage look.

34.description: Sometimes you stumble across a place in your new neighborhood that makes you glad you moved there. That's how I feel about Perkolator. I went in for the first time and said under my breath "what a little peach!"Incredible coffee. Knowledgeable and catering staff. Delicious eats. Cool and chill space. What more do you want? I'm gonna peel through the menu and try everything... so far my recco is the Mochanut! Mocha and Coconut ... together ... as one. Heaven called and it wants its espresso drink back.

16.description: You've probably walked or driven past it countless times, but the next time you pass by you've gotta stop in! I find it amazing that they are hand making the breakfast sandwiches and burritos as you order them. Eggs freshly cracked and perfectly crafted. The coffee is great, the Frozen Perk even better. I always roll my eyes at reviews that talk about the "ambiance" but I've gotta say this place has a great ambiance too. You honestly can't go wrong, and I highly suggest it.

13.description: This is definitely my favorite coffee shop on the NW side. It is cute and cozy and a great asset to the neighborhood. I also love that they showcase artwork from local artists.The coffee is strong and delicious. It is much stronger than at chain coffee shops. I particularly liked the caramelocha (caramel and mocha). All of their coffees are available hot and iced and they offer cold brew as well.Unlike most coffee shops, Perkolator offers sandwiches for both breakfast and lunch. The bacon/nutella/banana sandwich is to die for.

11.description: Came here today with a friend and I LOVED it! It is a very cute, relaxed, cafe. It feels very welcoming and home-y, they even have couches! The decor is cute, they feature paintings that you can purchase from local artists which is a big plus. Another awesome thing is that I think it is independently owned. They have SO many drinks! It was hard to decide but I chose a hot tea(all organic, awesome!). I usually never get lattes or any type of coffee because of the dairy and the limited options but here they have a variety of milk to choose from! Hemp, almond, macadamia, soy etc. I plan on going back to try one of their coffee drinks asap!! I decided on the pepper, egg and cheese sandwich on a croissant, Delicious would be an understatement! And a tomato bisque to go along with it (so yummy! It was not too thick and not too watery it was perfect). I also ordered a baklava for dessert, a little hard but delicious nonetheless. I enjoyed everything so much I grabbed a bagel with cream cheese to go. Definitely coming back here! If you're in the area you have to stop by! And if you're not make your way over anyways! They also have a separate area where you can purchase books and records or just sit there and do your work or drink your tea, or coffee! Definitely encourage people to stop by this place! Vegetarians and omnivores included! New favorite of mine.

39.description: First time here was awesome. Recommended to me by a friend of mine and he was spot on. Great pastries and coffee, excellent vibe and awesome music selection. Fast wifi too. Being a part time musician, I appreciate a place that has a vast selection of music playing that doesn't sound over commercialized. This place reminds me of old school coffee houses in Chicago like Cafe Aroma and Kokomo. What's great is its on the Northwest side! Keep going strong and keep it local.

37.description: I had a 2% milk latte (medium comes with two shots of espresso) and it was very drinkable (I add no sugar or flavoring). While it's not a latte to rave about, the atmosphere was truly enjoyable. Great place to sit and enjoy a conversation with a good friend. So my four stars represents that I would definitely return here regularly, but I wouldn't tell anyone it's the best latte I've ever had.I also had the red pepper, provolone, and egg sandwich. It's served on a buttered, toasted, brioche bun. It was served very hot--I actually let it sit for a bit before I could eat it. Multiple Tabasco varieties are available--I love that Chipotle flavor. My sandwich was simple and tasty. Loved the melted cheese. The red peppers were roasted and probably from a can or jar, which is ok. It's still better than fast food.My friend got the egg, sausage and cheese and upgraded to a croissant (instead of bun) for $1 and I would say it's worth it. The croissant is huge, flaky, and fits the sandwich innards more comfortably than my bun. He also enjoyed his drip coffee.Cute/convenient bonus: lending library shelf with adult and children's books. A cute kids' table mixed in with comfy chairs (for adults). The bathroom also has a solid wood changing table with a cloth mat. All in all, a very kid-friendly place, especially for a coffee shop.

0.description: What a great spot, Portage Park is lucky to have a place like this. Not just a mere coffee shop, they serve food and have a record store and bookstore adjacent to the cafe as well. They clearly serve a niche as there were all walks of life here, and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves. Cops, toddlers, seniors, families, etc. The coffee and pastries are great, and I'll be back to try a sandwich or breakfast burrito next time. The decor is unique and eclectic, with local art on the walls and even a play space for kids. A great community-oriented business that you should support.

38.description: Very comfortable and the apple crumble muffin was great! The coffee was good not great. Nice place to stop by. It feels like a welcoming community.

51.description: Wished I had one of this closer to home! Awesome place to grab a nice warm tea, coffee or chocolate and relax, read a book or magazine, stare at nothing, chat with friends, etc. couches and ottoman to feel like at home! They offer vegetable milk such as almond and soy. As a recommendation if the owner reads this, I would also make rice milk available. They have yummy brownies and I also saw muffins. I think they also offer lunch snacks, such a sandwich or panninis. Anyway, we will be back soon!

27.description: I love love love the Perkolator.  I visit about once a week.  After moving from (ultimate coffee destination) Seattle, I'd been scouring the streets for something akin to the low-key, functional-hippy vibe near my original Chicago 'hood.  This place has really good food - creative sandwiches using local produce from the area - and of courssse, most importantly, amazing coffee. Friendly staff.  A bright spot in the Portage neighborhood that's def. up and coming, giving it a nice caffeinated shot in the arm, if you will. Great space for reading, drawing, people watching - love!

32.description: reasonable prices. lots of street parking. cold brew coffee was great.

54.description: LOVE this cozy, family-owned coffee shop! You immediately escape the hustle and bustle of the city while enjoying a fresh cup of coffee and a tasty treat. I immediately feel relaxed when I enter the doors and it's just what the NW side of Chicago needs. I'm a mom too and the fact that there's a kids play corner is a huge win for me as well. Do yourself the favor please and enter this sweet little coffee escape as often as possible. It may not have a drive thru, but it's all charm and the coffee is better. Promise.

48.description: Fantastic and friendly staff along with a warm and cozy feel make this a fantastic place to grab a great coffee or pastry.The cranberry muffin warmed up is a must try.The pricing is more than reasonable and I go out of my way just to grab coffee here.

44.description: My wife and I have a new favorite spot to enjoy our warm beverages.  The Perkolator is a very cozy and charming coffee shop that provides an inviting atmosphere and excellent customer service.  Of course the coffee is great and I love the pastries from local bakeries around the area.  Definitely a Portage Park gem!

24.description: I ordered a grilled cheese sandwich with turkey tomato provolone cheese and bacon, it was delicious!! my husband had the Cubanaski. He also thought it was good. The cafe latte was fresh and great tasting, but very strong much stronger than what you would find at Starbucks. if I lived close to this place I probably would be a regular.

7.description: Great coffee, super nice people behind the counter and tasty baked goods! Sometimes after dropping the kids off at school I stop in for a cup of coffee and just sit in their colorful shop and check out the art. I love all of the vintage furniture and decor too!

49.description: Cheerful, friendly, delicious, zero pretension.  Need I say more? Enjoy a snack here after an enjoyable browse at the equally delightful Thrift & Thrive across the street.

40.description: Their coffees are robust and flavorful(Don't forget to check the specials). The owners and staff are always super friendly.  I wish i could start every morning off with their  ham and egg breakfast sandwich . The caprese panini needs mentioning also.  It's  filling and delicious!

53.description: "It takes alot to gain a customer but very little to lose one." So says my husband and in this case he's right. New to the Portage Park neighborhood, I made a conscious choice to try this small business twice last week. My latte was very good both times. On my first visit I purchased two Italian cookies. Both were stale and had that "refrigerator taste" that happens when food is in the frig too long or when the frig needs cleaning and a box of soda to absorb the odor. On my second visit I let the barrista know about the cookies. He could easily have said "Oh gosh, I'm sorry about that. How can we make it right?" He didn't, choosing instead to tell me they just got a new box of them......ooookaaaay....... Then someone who appeared to maybe be the owner came along and the barrista mentioned my comment. He said "Well, they are refrigerated......" Okay but they shouldn't taste like a stale frig and be stale. He pretty much shrugged and wandered away. Probably will make the 5 minute drive to Starbucks on Irving Park Road at Kostner rather than going back to Perkolater.

30.description: This place is so good! Incredible service. Very personable staff and fantastic prices. I had a turkey wrap and watermelon flavored iced tea. It was so delicious! The turkey wrap came with the best cole slaw I've ever had. Seriously you gotta try this place!

46.description: If you are looking for good coffee this is the place. If you want to have a snack or breakfast I would recommend to pick another option.
