I have been there 5 times, I have ordered croissant with egg and cheese which was ok, not good, not that bad but the worst was the eggplant parmesan sandwich I ordered. First I had to wait like 25min. to finally get a cold and awful sandwich. It tasted like they freeze the eggplant patties for long time and you get the frozen food taste. It was terrible. This place is a nice cozy cafe, I wish the food were better.

1.description: I stop here for coffee all the time and i'm so glad to have this place in the neighborhood. The service is always good and I don't have to wait too long. It has a laid back atmosphere where you can come and study or just read a book. I have also had the paninis from here which are very tasty. My favoritite is the one with pesto.I will definately keep coming back.

55.description: Great people, amazing coffee!! The space is nice and cozy and they even have local artists work up on the walls.. I purchase my beans here from and my lattes at home come out amazing!! I hear good things about their sandwiches so I still have yet to try them and they also have homemade soups! Great lil spot to add to this awesome Portage Park neighborhood!

9.description: The Perkolator is a very quirky and fun atmosphere. The decor is eclectic and has a 70s feel. Service was friendly and prompt. The main room is very inviting, offering old school board games for people to play. They also had a kids zone with toys. Attached is a bookstore to peruse during or after you drink your coffee. Will be back!

26.description: A great little coffee nook. Cheerful, cozy interior and delicious iced coffees. Also had an amazing scone that they warmed up and served to our table.

25.description: Perkolator gets it right.  I went once when they just offered coffee and some sweets but I've been back a few more times recently to see their food menu and I'm really impressed with this place.  It looks like the neighborhood feels the same.  The coffee shop before Perkolator would be almost empty every time I went in there but Perkolator is at least half full every time I go in.  Good Job!

12.description: Great atmosphere. Came here a very times with friends to chat over coffee, can be crowded sometimes, but not too bad. Comfy spots to sit as well as tables and chairs. Their dark chocolate mocha is amazing, and they have many many drink options. Have tried a few of their bakery treats, which I enjoyed...most recently had the blueberry scone, which was very good. Great neighborhood spot!

59.description: Awesome Cuban sandwich.  It's great to finally have a great place to get a good sandwich.

21.description: It's happened. I'm officially a hipster; can hipsters be plus size? Do they usually surround themselves in this much color? Can they be dorky and clumsy? I'm not sure, but in any case, those are all me, and yet I feel like a hipster (in the best way) in this artsy coffee shop/cafe. Perkolator is like my version of hipster heaven. Or maybe espresso nirvana? So yes, atmosphere is everything. First off, great tunes played over a great sound system or speakers.  I love the vividly colored & wallpapered walls adorned with local artists' work for sale, and the bright, open feel of the dining area, and the creaky wood floors. I love that there are games and toys for kids to play with and board games for adults (sorry, no adult toys, this ain't that kind of place). I love the friendly and patient baristas and staff as well, always inviting. And before I get into the menu, if all that wasn't enough atmosphere, this just put Perkaltor over the top for me: they've opened an adjoining (dare I say Sci-fi) retro lounge area in the space next door filled with vinyl records and books to peruse! If playing with old clunky typewriters, turntables and telephones are your thing, you will most certainly appreciate the decor and retro lighting. Oh, did I mention the Ray-gun? There's a ray-gun, people!! And Star Trek posters, and a huge spaceman Martian and spaceship painted on one wall. If they had comic books, I'm quite certain the Big Bang Theory characters would hang out here. I may be mixing genres, but I just don't care. Enough-- on to the menu. Think breakfast sandwiches (which recently got a nod on Chicagoist, check it out), pastries and also bistro lunch options such as soups, greens, grilled cheese, paninis, and so on. Btw, these are some of the best scones ever. I suggest you seriously check out the pastry case.As for coffee drinks, I believe they have their own Perkolator brand in a variety of blends, in addition to sometimes featuring guest roasters (past ones have been Intelligentsia, Dark Matter, Metropolis, etc). Can we talk about dairy & non dairy options for a minute? They have got them all. Does your local barista offer HEMP milk? No? Well they should. I'm all about options and that's one you don't often see. (P.S. I tried it in my latte and enjoyed it.) They have all the usual suspects of dairy, plus, soy, almond, macadamia, coconut and hemp milk. This makes me happy. Not into coffee? There's also cold and hot teas, Italian sodas, milk, and possibly regular soda (I've never noticed)? Trust me when I say, this little place is a winner. Quaint, charming, retro, roomy, interesting, tasty. What more do you need? Wi-fi, maybe? Shut up, hipster. Duh, they have that, too.

17.description: I had a 2% milk latte (medium comes with two shots of espresso) and it was very drinkable (I add no sugar or flavoring). While it's not a latte to rave about, the atmosphere was truly enjoyable. Great place to sit and enjoy a conversation with a good friend. So my four stars represents that I would definitely return here regularly, but I wouldn't tell anyone it's the best latte I've ever had.I also had the red pepper, provolone, and egg sandwich. It's served on a buttered, toasted, brioche bun. It was served very hot--I actually let it sit for a bit before I could eat it. Multiple Tabasco varieties are available--I love that Chipotle flavor. My sandwich was simple and tasty. Loved the melted cheese. The red peppers were roasted and probably from a can or jar, which is ok. It's still better than fast food.My friend got the egg, sausage and cheese and upgraded to a croissant (instead of bun) for $1 and I would say it's worth it. The croissant is huge, flaky, and fits the sandwich innards more comfortably than my bun. He also enjoyed his drip coffee.Cute/convenient bonus: lending library shelf with adult and children's books. A cute kids' table mixed in with comfy chairs (for adults). The bathroom also has a solid wood changing table with a cloth mat. All in all, a very kid-friendly place, especially for a coffee shop.

10.description: Perkolator is my favorite indie coffee shop in this area. It feels like a lemon yellow grandmother's living room and is cozy to sit, sip, and write. This was the first place I tried a chaider, which was delightful. I've never been disappointed by Perkolator. The blueberry scones are to die for.

5.description: I'm getting familiar with, soon-to-be, my new neighborhood.  I found Perkolator when visiting "Thrift & Thrive," the thrift store across the street.  I've heard that these two (2) stores are owned by the same people.  Well, they have two (2) stellar businesses under their belt.  According Daddy J.'s comment, they serve awesome Americano, which is also reasonably priced ($3 for a 20oz. cup, as of 09/24/2015).  I'm not brave enough to imbibe great quantities of Americano like Daddy J. does, so I went with their "Mocha Perk," similar to frappuccino, except I could taste the coffee (unlike the frappe from the mystic green-Statue of Liberty brand).  That mocha perk was, in my opinion, decently-priced ($4 for a medium size, as of 09/24/2015).   Daddy J. likes the place because he was able to find newspapers to read!  It's also kids-, mothers-, and students-friendly.  There's a toddler's corner by the front door, so children can entertain themselves while moms are munching their sammies and sipping their drinks.Perkolator is located near Chicago Public Library-Dunning branch, near Irving Park and Austin.

3.description: Great little coffee shop for this neighborhood. The service is always really friendly and attentive. If you have any questions or requests they will help you. All the drink I've had were just perfect. You definitely notice the quality in everything they do.

35.description: This place just keeps getting better! They have really expanded their food menu which is great.  So many times coffee shops limit what they sell to baked goods but this place has all the pastries, cookies, scones, etc but then ups the game with breakfast sandwiches and burritos, homemade soup, panini, wraps, etc.  This summer they are adding outdoor seating too!

19.description: Wished I had one of this closer to home! Awesome place to grab a nice warm tea, coffee or chocolate and relax, read a book or magazine, stare at nothing, chat with friends, etc. couches and ottoman to feel like at home! They offer vegetable milk such as almond and soy. As a recommendation if the owner reads this, I would also make rice milk available. They have yummy brownies and I also saw muffins. I think they also offer lunch snacks, such a sandwich or panninis. Anyway, we will be back soon!

28.description: Pretty good service, coffee and breakfast.  It's a really nice local cafe that we try to visit once a week in an effort to support good local businesses.

45.description: I stop in here every chance I get. They are very supportive of the neighborhood and the working people of the area. Everything I have tried has been great starting with the coffee.  I now have all my co workers craving the PerkOlator to help get them through a long work day. Definitely worth a try!

33.description: I love this neighborhood place. I don't drink coffee, but their teas and sandwiches draw me in anyway. In the cooler weather they offer soups which are quite tasty. The atmosphere and service are delightful. This is the first place where I've actually brought my laptop along so I could enjoy the vibe of the place while getting a bit of work done.I'm very happy to have Perkolator in our neighborhood!

43.description: Today was my first time going there and the service was great! Super chill and such a great spot to enjoy some expresso. The whole time i was there i kept repeating in my head "It's time for da perkolator!".. even though it's perculator. haha

2.description: The kids have run amok on this place. Coming here on a Sunday afternoon for a nice relaxing coffee is not an easy task. The shorties are all over the place, books and toys are loitering all over the floor, parents are scolding their kids for being crazy, daddy's coffee just spilled on the floor because little Johnny thinks he is Darth Vader and his older brother apparently stands in his way of universal domination. In spite of all the madness, Perkolator could not be a better neighborhood coffee shop. In fact it's quite impressive for the local hood. The coffee has a nice range of options. You can go hardcore with an Americano, Sweet cold drinks like the Mocha Perk, or a satisfying Hot Chocolate or Caramel Latte. The latter order was mine which was quite lovely. In addition they have several bakery items including a blueberry scone. A little bit of crunch and not too sweet, much like a typical European treat.The decor really stands out. Colorful walls littered with paintings from local artists. The paintings ranged from very mundane black and white to vicious explosions of color that reminded me of graffiti. This month It appears to be a feature of Polish American artists.Their is an adjoining room to the shop that is a record store. It's not very big but a nice collection of records, books, and comics populate this room. In the back  Is another seating area for enjoying a book and coffee. The record shop idea seems to be a winner as I saw multiple people buying several items. Overall it might be hard to get some quiet time and get some work done here because of the "family" environment. But if you live in the hood and especially have a family you should feel right at home. Despite my lack of a family, I love what they are trying to do and am proud it is in the neighborhood! Peace!

18.description: Reasonable prices, friendly staff, good food options, and wifi. It has a fun and cozy atmosphere. It's a great place to get a cup of coffee and hang out.

41.description: I really love everything about this place - except for the coffee.  The ambiance is so relaxed and kitsch, and my daughter loved the toys available.  The coffee is weak and watery.  I will definitely give this place another try after they have been open a bit longer!

52.description: This place is awesome. The owners are usually there and they have truly put their heart and soul into this cafe! Ask for a luminous latte; coconut, vanilla, mocha! Was simply delicious !

50.description: Friendly people and great coffee.

4.description: The location is perfect, nestled in the corner. I walked in and was greeted happily. I ordered a cold brew coffee. While pouring, I decided to look around. Looks like a perfect place for a study session. Will be coming back to hang out here. I did have a problem with the cold brew. I do like my cold brew to be a bit more strong. I had high expectations for it. But I guess I'm being a bit picky. The food looked great!! I will be back to try something else out! Will update.

6.description: A very colorful, cozy, cheap, no attitude spot for coffee, tea, etc.  The baristas were very polite. There are wonderful loose leaf teas to choose from including some delicious herbal concoctions.  I had a roasted almond tea with a splash of macadamia nut milk - yes - macadamia nut milk.  It's the only coffee place I have ever been to that serves not just soy and almond milk but also macadamia and hemp milk.  My husband had a cortado which he said was delicious though a bit larger than normal - more like a very good, extremely strong latté.  There's also breakfast and lunch with homemade soups.  I'd definitely return when I'm in the vicinity.

22.description: I'm getting familiar with, soon-to-be, my new neighborhood.  I found Perkolator when visiting "Thrift & Thrive," the thrift store across the street.  I've heard that these two (2) stores are owned by the same people.  Well, they have two (2) stellar businesses under their belt.  According Daddy J.'s comment, they serve awesome Americano, which is also reasonably priced ($3 for a 20oz. cup, as of 09/24/2015).  I'm not brave enough to imbibe great quantities of Americano like Daddy J. does, so I went with their "Mocha Perk," similar to frappuccino, except I could taste the coffee (unlike the frappe from the mystic green-Statue of Liberty brand).  That mocha perk was, in my opinion, decently-priced ($4 for a medium size, as of 09/24/2015).   Daddy J. likes the place because he was able to find newspapers to read!  It's also kids-, mothers-, and students-friendly.  There's a toddler's corner by the front door, so children can entertain themselves while moms are munching their sammies and sipping their drinks.Perkolator is located near Chicago Public Library-Dunning branch, near Irving Park and Austin.

15.description: This place is so good! Incredible service. Very personable staff and fantastic prices. I had a turkey wrap and watermelon flavored iced tea. It was so delicious! The turkey wrap came with the best cole slaw I've ever had. Seriously you gotta try this place!

57.description: Not impressed. Ordered a mocha and a snack. The mocha wasn't very good (I didn't eve finish half if it) and the food had a hair in it...

20.description: You've probably walked or driven past it countless times, but the next time you pass by you've gotta stop in! I find it amazing that they are hand making the breakfast sandwiches and burritos as you order them. Eggs freshly cracked and perfectly crafted. The coffee is great, the Frozen Perk even better. I always roll my eyes at reviews that talk about the "ambiance" but I've gotta say this place has a great ambiance too. You honestly can't go wrong, and I highly suggest it.

36.description: Great staff, great location, great vibes, greatness all around. Everyone has been missing regulus coffee, but the neighbors bought the spot and have brought great coffee back. The different brews and flavored have me coming back here. PS the scones will change your life.

14.description: I spend a whole work day here catching up on my paperwork. The staff are all super friendly and helpful. The americano was delicious and freshly prepared, and they had almost every conceivable nut milk available, including macadamia nut. The breakfast burrito was decent enough on its own, but they also have a bewildering variety of hot sauce is available to spice things up. Anywhere that has both Cholula and Sriracha available is amazing in my book.There is a fair amount of seating, though not so many electrical outlets. Music throughout the day was enjoyable and eclectic, and they also have a record store attached to the cafe. Definitely worth coming back.

3.description: Stopped by for lunch. I guess I came at a bad time because there were only two people working, the bartender and the cook.  The bartender was busy with people at the bar and the cook was busy cooking so I just sat there for a very very long time. I guess the bartender is also the waitress. Didn't even get a glass of water.. but I guess this being a bistro and not a restaurant you don't even get that. Also did not ask at first if I could get something to drink while I waited over 20 minutes. Ordered the chicken with mushrooms . It was all right. Not the best and not the worst. I guess also since this is a bistro they don't give you bread.  Maybe I expected this to be a restaurant. I would come back to try some other dishes. One thing I do have to say is that the atmosphere was very nice. The bar is one of the nicer bars I have seen in the area. and there is a patio in the back that looks like it would be great in the warmer months.  I think the staff has to get up to speed on service . If a person is waiting because you are short staffed, at least offer them a glass of water and maybe some bread or their drink choice.. I almost got up and left. Also the noise from the bar was a ittle loud. Some woman with a deep laugh keeping yelling. After a while it got to be really nerve wracking.. especially when you are hungry and are being kept waiting.

1.description: I heard good things about this restaurant. I came for my first visit for lunch at exactly 11 a.m.  The restaurant is adjoining a very nice bar . There was a bartender with three people at the bar and I was pointed to the bistro part which was empty. I was the very first patron. Both the bar and the restaurant are very nice inside with natural wood, exposed brick and well lit with natural light from the windows. I sat down and I sat and I sat and I sat.... . For about ten minutes before the bartender came to give me a menu and walked away and I sat and I sat and I sat and I sat for another 15 minutes. Evidently they were short staffed. There was a cook who saw me from the kitchen but she didn't say or do anything.If you have customers and are short on staff, at least give them a menu , a glass of water and at least ask what they would like to drink so they could look at the menu and have something to drink.  Both the bartender and the cook walked back and forth from the bar and the kitchen.  Finally the bartender came to take my order. And I waited some more. The the cook came out of the kitchen and handed my food and walked back to the kitchen, not even asking me if there was anything else I wanted. Then two polish gentlemen came by and they quickly were attended to and the cook came to chat with them and apologize to them for being short on staff and the long delay.That was irritating.... it seemed like they liked the men customers more than the women customers.   At least I got my food. I know this place is a bistro, so does that mean you don't get any bread? I had the breaded pork cutlet with mushrooms and cheese. It was good except I think the cheese was a combination of a white cheese with American cheese which didn't seem polish to me.Overall except for the issue of being short staffed, the food was ok.  The bar is beautiful and it leads to a patio in the back that looks like it would be nice to visit in warmer months.  I would come back again... I guess I came on a bad day and no one knew what to do.  I guess stuff happens but truly the entire staff needs to get educated on customer service.

2.description: Three of us stopped by for a late lunch on a Thursday. We ate outdoors in their very quiet and well-kept backyard garden. Our server met us enthusiastically and immediately brought our beverages. Our three dishes were delivered hot, clearly freshly prepared and well presented (see my photos). We ordered the following:- Talerz Rozmaitosci (Polish plate with potato pancake, sausage, three pierogis and stuffed cabbage)- Poledwiczki Wieprzowe with Sosie Kremowym (Grilled pork tenderloin with creamy sauce)- Kurczak Po Staropolski z Rusztu (Chicken breast with grilled cheese and mushroom)All three dishes were served with Czerwony Barszez z Krokietami (Red borscht with meat or kraut croquettes). Everything was delicious! We'll be back soon!

5.description: I live 3 blocks away. Great bar and restaurant. Im there a lot. Great authentic polish food served till 11pm! Nice and safe atmosphere!

6.description: Great food All homemade :-)  generous portions!! I don't like bar next doors when you dinning with kiddos Our server was nice and knew what to offer for us first timers.

7.description: Best polish food even tasted. Fresh ingredients.  Prepared with great care. Service was outstanding.  The chef took time to explain the dishes we ordered .love it.

8.description: Chose Polish Bistro for a family gathering, party of 10, 9 adults and 1 child.  We are Polish.  The food was well prepared, fresh, and authentic, ethnic Polish dishes.  The waitress was wonderful, and did  good job managing our table, and and our request for separate checks.   Make sure to call in your reservations.  I emailed my reservation the day before with a request to have a family appetizer tray ready at 5:30.  Since I got  no email confirmation, I called the next day.  The Bistro management did NOT read my email yet.  If it weren't for this email being overlooked, I would have given them five stars.  Overall, we had an enjoyable evening, and all of us loved our food.

9.description: When we walked in we saw a cook sitting in the kitchen and eating. She ignored us. Nobody was there to give us menus or anything. In the bar area was few people drinking. It smelled bad. I don't get why they are  advertising themselves in the polish radio and don't give a shit about costumers.

0.description: This place is awesome and has the best Polish food I've ever had and they offer it until 1 am if your in the attached bar.  I ordered the polish platter which had a piece of sausage,  3 pierogis, salad,  potato pancakes,  stuffed cabbage,  and like a cabbage in red sauce and a side of sour cream.  All of it was delicious! I especially loved the potato pancakes. The meal was also reasonably priced for the portion you received.  The restaurant is cute with brick walls,  in the summer the patio in back is opened.  There were several tables in the patio and the outdoor ambiance is relaxing and great for taking a date or just enjoying a meal with family and frIends. By the way,  the attached bar is not your typical sports bar, it's really nice and similar to what you would find in downtown or Lincoln Park area, but in Dunning. Definitely worth a visit.

4.description: Excellent food, great customer service, and beautiful outdoor garden area. Love having another diamond in the area!

3.description: Great place to come for bulk candy and nuts!I come here when we need to do a "guess-how-many-blank-is-in-the-jar" game for a party or a contest. Normally it's jelly beans, jolly ranchers, or swedish fish that we use.Good prices, good products.

1.description: To my surprise Trader Joes had a recall on their (my favorite)  walnuts recently and I've had to scramble to find a different supplier.  I tried to replace them with pecans, but they're just not the same, plus they're pricey too, a small bag for $6!  Yikes!So I searched Yelp for suggestions...and came up with Superior. Honestly, it should really be called Inferior!  First it took forever to get there, I felt like I was driving to Wisconsin.  Second, once I got there and saw their prices I wasn't a happy camper.  If this is suppose to be a wholesale place it doesn't seem like it according to their prices.  Third, their customer service.  Not very friendly and not very busy... except one of the fixtures, I mean ladies, was too busy to wait on me??  Why is it  at Superior they do everything but wait on the customer's?  That's the kind of place it is.Skip this place, I'm going elsewhere.

2.description: Wow I can't even explain how amazing this place is. It's like finding a treasure chest in the build of a building complex. This place being so much more than just candy and nuts there is heart, soul and attitude. Regular candy stores are sugar coated with people acting fake. While at superior you get real people. They have a personality and will give you they're opinion. Walked in and was treated like a prince. Being a person of color it's nice when you get the same treatment as white people in this world. This store was like skipping through a cloud with a heart full a joy and stomach full of love. 10/10 would recommend this place and people.

5.description: Holy crap, I've completely missed the best candy store in my own back yard!  In a store front of business services...I'm not quite sure what else is there - Polish shipping services???Honestly, this place has like every type of candy you're looking for - chocolate, gummy things, old fashioned...I have yet to see candy cigarettes but if I did I wouldn't be surprised.  Prices are pretty awesome too, and most of it is available by weight.Note to new people - the machine that gives you the numbers is by the door - this place operates kinda like a deli.  For the most part, you take a number and wander around if you aren't the only one there.  If the ladies behind the counter notice you, great - if not, stay close, make eye contact every now and then and wait...Be nice to the ladies behind the counter and you'll get rewarded with tastes of things and also having them pull out "fresh" stuff for you.  Being rude brings out the Candy Nazi in them, or having them ignore you all together.  I'm very excited to have found this place!!

6.description: Thanks Yelp! I had been looking for bulk orange candy for the Halloween goody bags at my kids' school. I looked online, but didn't want to pay CRAZY shipping charges. I went to the sweet factory, and they wanted $11 PER POUND for jujubees. Ridiculous. Then I went on Yelp and saw this place that is practically in my neighborhood. I found orange pumpkin shaped gumdrops for .99 a POUND! I bought 10 pounds for less than 1 pound at that stupid overpriced sweet factory! HOORAY. we also bought a couple ot Turtles and Ring pops for my kids... all for $13.25... We will DEFINITELY be back. They had everything, chocolate, bags of bulk candy, nuts, toffee, caramel corn, etc.  What a great place. nothing fancy. no nonsense, fantastic prices. GO THERE!

0.description: I just can't believe someone would give this place one star. This place is amazing, the gummy bears are the freshest Ive ever had.  The customer service is just fine I agree with the person who wrote if your kind to the ladies they will be kind back.   Btw, I live in the area and it's not like driving to Wisconsin as someone stated in a one star review (sounds like someone had a bad attitude the day they stopped in). It takes 20 minutes with no traffic to get to the area from wicker park.  I think it would take much longer than that to get to Wisconsin.  Don't let a couple of cranky pants discourage you from checking this place out, it truly is a hidden gem!

4.description: This is a fun place to go to. They have bin after bin of candy. I like the cheap bags they put together. Most are 99 cents for a lb. I think its stuff they need to move to keep a fresh stock. You can't get better prices on nuts and they're always fresh. They also have the old penny candy.

1.description: Lousy pizza. If you like Dominos, you might think this is OK. This is the typical super thick crust with scant toppings that you find in cities where people don't know how to make pizza. The fried wings were mushy and tasted like some kind of artificial mcnugget thing, but not in a good way. It was disgusting. Who eats this stuff? Why?? Horrible. I've had better pizza in super markets!

2.description: I really love this pizza! The people there are so nice and honest. As the delivery guy was delivering our previous order HE noticed and brought to our attention a coupon that was not given to us. We were told this would be on our account information for the next time (fine by us!) It had been about two months since that order and we called to order and asked if they saw  if we had a discount. The guy on the phone was super nice and took care of the whole thing. It wasn't until after we got off the phone and looked at the clock we realized we called right as they were about to stop taking orders (something I really try to avoid.) But like I said the person on the phone never let on any attitude or annoyance and was really great. We were even given free delivery along with the special buy one get one half off!  They stick to their delivery times as well which is a huge plus. Very fresh ingredients and extremely tasty pizza!

0.description: Wow, I don't know what was wrong with the stuff the other guy ordered, but I found it pretty good for a neighborhood place.  I ordered thin crust and it was thin, no problem.  It had a nice little edge of caramelized cheese the way Pequod's pizzas do, which was a pleasant surprise.  The toppings were all very fresh and the peppers had a bit of tooth to them which is how I like them.  If I have a criticism, I'd say that there was a bit too much cheese on the pizza, but it was tasty.I tried the fried mushrooms, too and they were lovely.  They weren't mushy or wet the way too many places serve them.  They came with a container of ranch dip which was tasty but not terribly ranch-like.  The pizza came with a dip too.  I chose marinara because I had to choose something.  I don't get the whole dipping-your-pizza thing, but I guess I'm old skool.My order arrived in about 40 minutes and it was piping hot.  The delivery guy was really nice, too.  Honestly, I think I got some good bang for my buck since I'll get three meals out of a small pizza and an order of mushrooms, and I'll enjoy them a lot more than some of the neighborhood pizzas I've eaten.I'd actually have given Eco three-and-a-half stars but as I can't give half, I upped it because I don't think it really deserves one star.  We'll see how it goes.  And no, I don't like Dominick's pizza.  Just so you know.As an addendum I have to say that while I understand why most of the filtered reviews were filtered, I think at least one of them is legit, and it's a very good review.  It's kind of a shame, really.

58.description: One of the best steaks I've ever had. Unfortunately, the sides weren't as good. Other than that, this place is definitely somewhere to go if you want a good steak. Also, the flan is absolutely amazing as well.

56.description: This restaurant was pretty good. The service was great, the portions were perfect and the food was awesome. We ordered the empanadas that came with a side of spicy green sauce that went perfect together & for entrees we ordered the churrasco. I ordered the half size & my husband ordered the full size. Both came with platano maduro (sweet plantain), fries, yuca & colombian style steak with chimichurri sauce, the only difference is the full size comes with another piece of steak. My plate with just one steak was more than enough, overall a very good experience, pricing was good. We will be going back for sure.

29.description: The short version: a little bit of a wait but GREAT Food! Will definitely be back!! Yum.

42.description: I don't know if it's possible to be more satisfied with a dining experience. Everything was great. It was hard to narrow down what I wanted on the menu, because everything sounded pretty tasty... and it was. all of our food was delicious and brought to us with beautiful presentation. Not to mention that the portions were generous.The staff was friendly and attentive. Even the drinks were great. The price was more than reasonable.This place had been bookmarked on my yelp account for months and I can't believe how long I've been missing out. We are already looking forward to our next trip to sample some of the other meals on the menu.

23.description: Came here on a Wednesday evening.  Restaurant not too busy, yet service lacked.  Food was definitely not what it should've been.  I ordered the churrasco (the larger portion, and it was only about 5" long...I hate to see what their small portion is!).  I did not receive neither a skirt steak or a sirloin steak (typical in a Colombian churrasco).  Whatever it was, was either VERY overcooked CHEAP beef or pork.  I had my friend taste to make sure I wasn't crazy, lol.  We also ordered an arepa which was tasted exactly like a Mexican gordita but with cheese.  Definitely NOT a Colombian arepa.  The arroz con pollo was overpowered by chicken bouillon...another fail!  My pina colada was poured from a ready made bottle and blended with LOTS of ice.  Needless to say, there was hardly any pina colada flavor in my drink!  All around, this restaurant was a total disappointment!  I will stick to the REAL churrascos of Las Tablas.

47.description: Great food, the server was very attentive.  The place is nice the prices r great. The wait is a little long to get your food but its well worth it. The server gave us free desert to make up for the wait.

8.description: The food here is pretty good, a little bit on the pricier side though. The only thing that turned me off to this place was the fact that 0 tables were clean when we walked in but they were all empty. The service isn't much to talk about either. Don't really have much else to say about this place. Not a place I would go out of my way for.

31.description: First id like to say I had been here when they first opened and the food was great. The environment was very lively and the music was great. I decided to visit today. I had called before hand to make sure that they weren't busy and that I could get a table. When I arrived there was about 3 family's total with two waitress's to tend tables. Not busy at all. We took a seat and literally had to wait 15 minutes before someone came to take our order. We were never offered water either. Thankfully my food was good because the experience was awful. Never coming back. 5/17/2015

34.description: I bought Groupon for this place and I was so excited but I was very disappointed with quality of food, which was not tasty and also served cold and overall decor and comfort. Generally this cuisine doesn't even remotely resemble Colombian food and as a steakhouse this place also disappoints. Service was fine, but it could not make for bad food. I would not recommend it and I will not go back

16.description: Had many friends talk of this place, however we found the food to be very bland and tasteless... the service was very poor and inattentive.... The waitress never did check back with us after serving us our food. I had to chase her down to pay my check. Perhaps the food is better in the dinner hours, it was 2 o'clock in the afternoon we were here. I don't know.... we must be missing something , all the reviews say it's great. we found it to be so- so, we will not be going back again.

13.description: Delicious food! Maduras and yucca are to die for! Great prices and portions. It's a little too loud in the restaurant which ruins the experience a bit. The service is just OK, not great, but the food keeps me coming back.

11.description: Very Slow service, food was dry and bland.Waitress was kind.Went there with hubby after work about 7pm, the hostess pointed at the table we could sit at. Took about 10 minutes to get the menus. The waitress was friendly but wasn't checking in at all. We finally ordered around 7:30, didn't get our food until 8:20 or so. I ordered the small churrasco with yuca instead of sweet plantains and never got them orbthe chimichurri sauce. Potatoes and tostones were very dry and hard. Didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked which was rare, asked to have it cooked a little longer, most of the meat was not edible. Will not be going there ever again.

39.description: We arrived at 7:30 on a Saturday night, and they had two ten-tops. For context, the place holds maybe 50 people. So the servers and kitchen were slammed. Subsequently, our service was subpar, but I try not to hold it against them- when you get slammed like that unexpectedly, it's hard to manage, especially in a place that doesn't have much capacity. Started out with empanadas. They were meh- the shell was good , but really thick. The inside, regardless of beef of chicken, has so much potato (in more of a mashed consistency) you don't really taste the beef or chicken (I had a hard time telling a difference between the two)We ordered two steaks, medium. It took an hour for them to come out. Mine was good, but my husbands was over-well done, dry, and hard to eat. I also ordered a piña colada- it tasted watered down, oddly. We sat at the bar for aforementioned reasons and whoever was suppose to be our server went MIA , but the manager was great. He's what kicked it up from a 2.5 star to 3. Food was good, but not great. If we lived nearby we might go back, but since we don't, we won't be. Not worth a trip out

37.description: My wife and I have eaten here numerous times and we love the food. The empanadas are delicious and fresh. For gourmet type food, I believe they are reasonably priced. This place deserves more recognition and is a hidden gem in the dunning area.

0.description: Very good food little pricey But good experience I had good time the service very polite Me and my family enjoyedI recommend this place to any body u will not get disappointed

38.description: I can't believe I forgot to review this place... This place really blew me away with how amazing it was. Appetizer was there carne Asada tostones and sweet mother were they amazing the steak was great good flavor and extremely juicy. The tostones were fried to perfection and complimented the all the toppings very well.I ordered the churrasco pequeno that's paired with a chimichurri sauce, yuca, sweet plantains and potatoes the steak was cooked to my liking medium well and was just delicious. I didn't care for the sweet plantain as those have never been my favorite. I can't wait to come back to this place being so close to home. I loved the vibe the place had and the food is to die for!

51.description: We made a reservation and we arrived we were seated by their staff. After 5 minutes they came back and the owner asked that we move because the girls gave us the wrong table. There was no where else to sit. Horrible owner, horrible service! Will never step foot there again! Don't make RSVP online because they don't even look at them or so they say-

27.description: Cute small place.  Our server was nice.  But the food took over an hour.  I felt that the kitchen didn't have it together.  It was my first time there and I won't be going back.

32.description: We arrive at this place on a sunday afternoon ,there was no greeter.we walked right in and seat ,nobody welcome us ,we did not see a sign in order to be seated...anyways a young girl came greet us ask how many ?....I said 2 well she was nice,we ordered the plates which were entraña steaks the most expensive plate in the place , food arrive at decent time like 12 minutes after,my wife got a maracuya juice wich was ok ....I ask for a bottle of water ...I got a glass of tap water.....? She never toldme there was no bottle water to offer.......why idk...well we start eating and realized there was no chimichurri sauce   she brought a small container for both of us ......portions were small even the meat ....comparing other colombian restaurants way too small....service Sucks ....after we got the plates the waitress never came back not even asking for  desserts.....staff needs more training look like a family run business ...they leraning along the way ...food was decent portions were to small...drive 1 more mile west and you get 3times better service and more food...the manager seem more attentive to her texting then interacting with patrons....floor were dirty tables greasy. ....but lack of service make me never come back to this place.....totally dumbfounded. ...by the fancy name ...total disappointment.......

54.description: The worst services. Very disappoint with this place. We wait for long time for appetizer and our food. Actually I had to ask several times for our food. I don't recommend this place. It's sad because I am Colombian (like this restaurant) but it's not a good place.

48.description: Had many friends talk of this place, however we found the food to be very bland and tasteless... the service was very poor and inattentive.... The waitress never did check back with us after serving us our food. I had to chase her down to pay my check. Perhaps the food is better in the dinner hours, it was 2 o'clock in the afternoon we were here. I don't know.... we must be missing something , all the reviews say it's great. we found it to be so- so, we will not be going back again.

44.description: We went here yesterday.  they were very busy for a tuesday night. It is much smaller then "las Tablas"  I recommned you get a reservatiion..  We sat at the bar for 10 minutes.  The chicken and rice was great.. It reminded me of my mom's cooking !!  I enjoyed the higher end steak.. I recommend that above the normal cut... the rice and beans were fantastic.  Every dish was very good.  The price was very reasonable. I will go again.  We met the owner and he was warm host.

24.description: We decided to try this place after hearing a lot of good things about it, and who doesn't love a good steak. First I ordered a "Columbian" coffee to start but was very disappointed right off the bat. It was lukewarm at best and might have even been instant. I understand this is a steakhouse but still. I ordered the bandeja paisa after seeing it on the menu as I wanted to try a lil if everything. Over 30 minutes and two cups of bad coffee we got our food. The steak was overcooked and a bad cut (had a huge vein running right through the middle of it. I've gotten better cuts of meat at Walmart. The chorizo had an odd taste and seemed to be reheated as I know it wasn't cooked for the first time that day. I think the only thing I enjoyed was the rice. On top of everything there was only one waitress working at the time and had several other tables but that wasn't her fault, the place was understaffed. I will not be returning.

7.description: After calling Las Tablas multiple times to place an order and no answer. I decided to give La Parrilla a shot. I ordered a steak sandwich to go and a beef empanada. The empanada was bomb! Well done, lots of flavor and a very good price. The steak sandwhich wasn't so great, the bread was very thick and the steak portion was ridiculous. Long story short it was mostly bread than anything. I would give them another shot tho :) Try it out guys!

49.description: This is one of my favorite Colombian restaurants. The place is nice and cozy, friendly staff. The food is so good. I had the Bandeja paisa which came with beans, chorizo, maduro frito, chicarones and rice was so delicious. Their Colombian smoothies are also so good. They also play great Colombian music. Definitely will be coming back.

40.description: My opinion is good,the food is delicious and I feel really family place,the price is moderately,the place is small but comfortable

53.description: I absolutely loved this place, my first review was 5 stars.. I'm so bummed how it has changed. Last week I ordered empanadas and rice over the phone for pick up, arrived 10min later, nothing was ready for pick up..ok I'll wait..meanwhile customers are angry because half their food has been served or they haven't received their appetizers after 30min..the lady (server) is complaining that it's not her fault, that someone called off, and that she's embarrassed but still not her fault. Okayy....an hour later, after asking multiple times and being told the empanadas were ready...still no food,..really? Something as simple as empanadas and rice?? She tells me, again, it's not my fault so I can't apologize...what?? ! I asked one more time, waited 5 more minutes, and got up and left.,the WORST device ever! I don't know if they changed owners or just hired the wrong people but come on! This was a great place!! Too bad I can't say anything about the good, since I didn't get a chance to try it! Now today, I'm calling 5 minutes after opening time, then 20 min after opening time, thought if give them a second chance..nope, no answer..how can you run a restaurant and not be there at least 30 or 15min before opening? I'm so disappointed in you La Parilla! Good luck! I won't be giving you any more chances!

30.description: I came here with my wife on a thursday afternoon and i was shock to see it empty . When we walk in we saw the waitress staring at us from the kitchen while having a conversation with the cook. We were excited to try this place.  Let me tell you we were both shocked the food was cold and tasteless. Then the waitress got lost and never check in on us. To say the least the place was dirty. Floors needed to be sweep and mopped. What a shame . We will never be back and we will let other people know of the bad experience we had. This place needs to train the entire staff first in cleanliness,sanitation,customer service there is no excuse. I ve been in the hospitality business for 25 years and i have my city & state sanitation mgr.license so i know what i'm talking about. I hope you guys pull it together but my best colombian steak house is tablas 1 mile east of this place sorry in this business you got one shot!!!!

46.description: This place is small but great food!! Also love coming here and listening to good music!!

1.description: I have been to many restaurants (Latino) and this place left much to desire. The service was slow, stingy on napkins and the menu was not accurate. I when I ordered the lunch special from the menu it advertised skirt steak special. When we received the plates, the beans had no flavor or seasoning and the steak was very rough plus not skirt steak at all. The waitress finally admitted after many rebuttals to her responses that the meat was of lesser quality. When we asked her if that's fair to advertise one type of meat over the higher quality on the menu, her response was that no one else complains about it. My sister asked for the manager and apparently there was no manager or supervisor running the place during operation hours which I can't believe. Stay away from their lunch special (skirt steak), very poor quality and not a good experience.

55.description: The place is neat and clean the food is all right , the portions are small and pricey. ..the service was not that great , there was only one waitress available and she took time to bring anything to the table. I would definitely won't come back here....instead I would recommend going to EL LLANO restaurant.

9.description: Went in with two friends with a Groupon for lunch around 12. As soon as we walked in we were nicely greeted by the server and told that we could sit anywhere. We let him know we had a groupon and he said we cannot use it for lunch specials. Perfectly fine for us, I came in for a big fat steak! We were immediately given waters, which were filled throughout the stay. Our server was attentive but didn't over do it, which I really appreciated. To start we ordered 4 empanadas, 2 beef 2 chicken. They tasted great paired with the chimichurri sauce. I ordered the churrasco pequeño medium rare, and appreciated the fact that they allowed me to omit the potatoes and opt in for more yuca or maduros. My friend ordered a steak sandwich and the other the salmon. I was too busy enjoying mine to try theirs, but they were really happy with their food. I also had a "parcha" drink which is passion fruit. I am so used to it being served as a liquid, I really appreciated the fact that it was blended like a smoothie. It was really tasty and fresh. The prices were pretty reasonable, especially for the quality of food. I will definitely return sometime soon!

26.description: No a bad place to go and eat. The chicken was great the steak not so great it teasted like it was boild the put on the grill for a bit. The waitress are nice thou it look like they can use more training....they keep toughing there face hair, and they need to have an updo. My waiterss hair was all up in my food...

25.description: This place is amazing i love there asada sandwich and there empanadas really recomend this place also has a bar!!!

12.description: We have been coming to this restaurant for quite some time and we always enjoy the food. However, the last time we were there, the service was very slow.The owner who walks around seems very nice and the fact that he uses his Mom's recipes is an added plus. (She also works there.)The place can use a paint job and retraining of the employees. We waited 10 minutes for water while looking at dirty tables and the struggles of the staff; one of the waitresses took her phone and went in the bathroom for a while. The employees really need to learn to team work and multitask. It's frustrating since we really like the food and want to continue coming here.

59.description: Food and service was top notch. The owner was very personable and attentive. Our waitress Joanna was awesome.  I will definitely come back again.

21.description: This is definitely my wife and I's go to place when we are craving some Latin food.  The staff is always friendly and have not had a bad experience yet.  The steak is always on point and the appetizer with shredded steak and cheese on top of a bread is excellent!  If you're in the mood for some live music with good food check this place out on Friday nights.

17.description: My son and Daughter in law took us here to eat I was so excited about tasting Colombian food! boy was I disappointed with Food! and the service !! Everything was tastless no salt pepper ,or spices we had the rice and black beans ugh no salt or taste our chicken was dry and we order root vegtables,that where so dry they feel apart in to dust like consisty .not worth your money we had no liquor but was charged $75:00 for four dry  chicken dinners. The waitress brang us out food but no water or utensils got bent out of shape when we ask for them wow

10.description: My husband and I have lived in the neighborhood for two years now, and always talked about coming here. I found a Groupon for La Parrilla, and we FINALLY went tonight! We were pleasantly pleased! The portions were HUGE, and the prices reasonable. We will definitely be going back again!

5.description: The short review: Excellent steak, OK appetizer/sides, super slow service, OK atmosphere.The long review:I headed here with a groupon in hand. I heard great things about the food, and couldn't wait to dig into their steak.We made reservations for 6:15 on a Saturday night. I was surprised to see they were definitely needed. We got the last table in the place. I do question their reservation methods though. I made mine through OpenTable, but they didn't even check when I announced I had reservations. A party of two came in after us and also said they had reservations, but they were forced to wait. We were seated right away at a table that had a chunk of sausage left on one of the chairs. A server removed the meat when I moved it to the table, but never cleaned the seat. Ick.Our waitress came over after a bit. She didn't speak English very well, so there was a lot of pointing to the menu. To drink, we both had the raefejo (sp?), which was a beer and a bubbly soda combo. It was good, a bit sweet, but I was bummed to see it had been made with Amstel Light and not a more traditional beer. To start, we had the tostones with carne asada. They came out about 30 minutes after we ordered them, and they were just OK. They seemed a bit oversone, as they were difficult to cut. I also wish they had been served with some kind of sauce, as they were a bit dry.Out entrees took another 30 minutes after the appetizer to arrive. For my main meal, I had the combination which was steak, chicken, yuca, sweet plantain, and potato, served with a small amount of chimichurri sauce. And when I saw "a small amount," I mean, a VERY small amount. I love chimichurri sauce, and would have enjoyed much more with my dish. The meats were both cooked well, but the yuca was dry. More sauce would have done quite a bit to the dish. My husband had the bandeja paisa, which was steak with rice, egg, beans, a flat bread and pork rind. He enjoyed his dish, agreeing the meat was cooked well, but he barely touched his pork rind as it was really fatty and very very fried.We didn't have room for dessert, so no comments there. Our total was over $60, before tax and tip. I thought that was a little much for what we got, but I would try this place again, maybe as a take out option.

3.description: I can't believe I forgot to review this place... This place really blew me away with how amazing it was. Appetizer was there carne Asada tostones and sweet mother were they amazing the steak was great good flavor and extremely juicy. The tostones were fried to perfection and complimented the all the toppings very well.I ordered the churrasco pequeno that's paired with a chimichurri sauce, yuca, sweet plantains and potatoes the steak was cooked to my liking medium well and was just delicious. I didn't care for the sweet plantain as those have never been my favorite. I can't wait to come back to this place being so close to home. I loved the vibe the place had and the food is to die for!

35.description: Fast service, phenomenal drinks and the churrasco/chicken combination was awesome.  I used a groupon but the prices seemed reasonable anyway. We will be going back.

19.description: I have been here a few times, and have never had an issue. Food is great and fresh. Good service and prices are reasonable. The empanadas are my favorite! Highly recommended!

28.description: Was here with a groupon. Slow service and then I was charged 6.95 for using the groupon. The service was soooooo slow!! I wouldn't go back for free food! Food was meh!!

45.description: I went to this place yesterday since I was in the neighborhood. I ordered a lunch special which was the grilled steak special. When I got my order the steak was not grilled, it looked like it was fried. I didn't appreciate that. I was expecting to smell the aroma of a grilled steak but no not this place. I don't know if I'll be checking this place any time soon, or maybe it was just one of those days for them.

33.description: Very good here. It's not for people who usually eat over-seasoned food. The meat is lightly seasoned and cooked beautifully. There is some green stuff to put on top of the steak plus salt and pepper if needed. My wife got the "best cut" steak and it melted in my mouth when I tasted a piece. I had the Bandeja Paisa and everything tasted good. So choose the "best cut" steak or the Bandeja Paisa for variety.

43.description: Food is great here! I got the rice and chicken which was very delicious. The plantains are the best here! Our waiter was very polite and recommended some appetizers in which was also delicious! My friend got the rice and steak and the meat was perfect. (Medium Rare) :D

2.description: Thanks for confirming a reservation with us for a groupon for February 2nd.  We arrive at 7:30 for dinner and the restaurant is closed for floor finishing??? Nice customer service honesty, you don't call your customers to let them know your restaurant is closed? Horrible customer service . Not only that, you had the nerve to redeem our groupon as used? We didn't even eat there? This is Not a good impression for new customers at all .

18.description: This place is by far the best Colombian restaurant I have ever tried in the Chicago area, my family and I went on sat. around 3pm and it was almost empty, my husband had the "Bandeja Paisa" and he said it was very good, my son had the "Carne asada" and it was very tasty and I had the "Churrasco"... And Im very picky about meat, but this one was the best piece of meat I have ever had in my life, if was very juicy but cooked all the way, just how I like it and the chimichurri (herbs sauce that accompanies the churrasco) was to die for, Jorge was very nice and asked us many times how was everything, the juices and empanadas we had as appetizers were amazing as well.We highly recommend this restaurant to any one with Colombian food cravings.

41.description: Food was delicious, had the chicken with rice and I was stuffed alongside the chicken empanadas. They are so good! When I went it was a little busy, luckily I had made reservations ahead of time. Service was an average it was a Sunday night and busy so it was understandable. It's great for groups too, everyone is really friendly and try to accommodate your needs.

52.description: I tried the lunch special for 5.99,which consisted of a piece of steak...I think rib eye ...white rice,beans and salad..good not great..il try the plantain sandwich next time

50.description: A great Columbian steakhouse, delicious drinks, excellent steak, great decor and the owner was so humble, kind and his recommendations were all perfect! I will definitely be going again.

4.description: I have been here about 10-12 times, When I first found this spot I was amazed by the quality, service, and prices... I started to go about once a month but now I am just done I have had enough last experience was it for me, My steak I wanted medium it was WELL DONE so dry and just nasty, I requested them to sub out yucca for fries and it was a huge issue? Why? OK? pretty sure a potato is cheaper but whatever, service has gone down hill my GF was given a coke and once the food came her glass was empty not once did waitress offer to refill we had to bring the cup up to the bartender who was careless as can be. I really wanted to like and appreciate this place but I cant fake the funk its just ok, Hopefully they improve....

6.description: The empanadas are delicious . I can't say I dos like this place. So far what I've tried is yummy. The chicken . The steak . Tostones, maduros. Yummy

22.description: Very Slow service, food was dry and bland.Waitress was kind.Went there with hubby after work about 7pm, the hostess pointed at the table we could sit at. Took about 10 minutes to get the menus. The waitress was friendly but wasn't checking in at all. We finally ordered around 7:30, didn't get our food until 8:20 or so. I ordered the small churrasco with yuca instead of sweet plantains and never got them orbthe chimichurri sauce. Potatoes and tostones were very dry and hard. Didn't ask me how I wanted it cooked which was rare, asked to have it cooked a little longer, most of the meat was not edible. Will not be going there ever again.

15.description: A bit pricey.. But the empanadas are top notch, as well as all the other choices on the menu, service is great. And the wait for the food is not too long. Authentic Colombian food, coming from a colombian. I approve

57.description: Nice place, great music, delicious food and reasonably priced. LOVE IT! I will definitely be back!BTW... I had the Entrana A La Parrilla, a tender grilled steak served with rice, potato wedges, and sweet plantains. Lots of food for a great price!

20.description: The food was great but service was horrible. I walked in and took a seat at the bar. It took about ten minutes before she even acknowledged me. I finally got my drink. My friend finally go there and we ordered. It was about 45 mins later and we asked where our food was. They said it was coming soon. 10 mins later we had enough and told them to bad it because I had to go home and pick up my son. We finally got ready to pay and their machines broke. They spent about 20 mins trying to get the system back up. They insisted we leave them our credit card # to pay! "not happening". also asked us to come back tomorrow to pay "Not happening". Finally we left and didn't have to pay. I will NEVER return again. I ate my food in the car on the drive home.

36.description: The short review: Excellent steak, OK appetizer/sides, super slow service, OK atmosphere.The long review:I headed here with a groupon in hand. I heard great things about the food, and couldn't wait to dig into their steak.We made reservations for 6:15 on a Saturday night. I was surprised to see they were definitely needed. We got the last table in the place. I do question their reservation methods though. I made mine through OpenTable, but they didn't even check when I announced I had reservations. A party of two came in after us and also said they had reservations, but they were forced to wait. We were seated right away at a table that had a chunk of sausage left on one of the chairs. A server removed the meat when I moved it to the table, but never cleaned the seat. Ick.Our waitress came over after a bit. She didn't speak English very well, so there was a lot of pointing to the menu. To drink, we both had the raefejo (sp?), which was a beer and a bubbly soda combo. It was good, a bit sweet, but I was bummed to see it had been made with Amstel Light and not a more traditional beer. To start, we had the tostones with carne asada. They came out about 30 minutes after we ordered them, and they were just OK. They seemed a bit oversone, as they were difficult to cut. I also wish they had been served with some kind of sauce, as they were a bit dry.Out entrees took another 30 minutes after the appetizer to arrive. For my main meal, I had the combination which was steak, chicken, yuca, sweet plantain, and potato, served with a small amount of chimichurri sauce. And when I saw "a small amount," I mean, a VERY small amount. I love chimichurri sauce, and would have enjoyed much more with my dish. The meats were both cooked well, but the yuca was dry. More sauce would have done quite a bit to the dish. My husband had the bandeja paisa, which was steak with rice, egg, beans, a flat bread and pork rind. He enjoyed his dish, agreeing the meat was cooked well, but he barely touched his pork rind as it was really fatty and very very fried.We didn't have room for dessert, so no comments there. Our total was over $60, before tax and tip. I thought that was a little much for what we got, but I would try this place again, maybe as a take out option.

14.description: We arrived at 7:30 on a Saturday night, and they had two ten-tops. For context, the place holds maybe 50 people. So the servers and kitchen were slammed. Subsequently, our service was subpar, but I try not to hold it against them- when you get slammed like that unexpectedly, it's hard to manage, especially in a place that doesn't have much capacity. Started out with empanadas. They were meh- the shell was good , but really thick. The inside, regardless of beef of chicken, has so much potato (in more of a mashed consistency) you don't really taste the beef or chicken (I had a hard time telling a difference between the two)We ordered two steaks, medium. It took an hour for them to come out. Mine was good, but my husbands was over-well done, dry, and hard to eat. I also ordered a piña colada- it tasted watered down, oddly. We sat at the bar for aforementioned reasons and whoever was suppose to be our server went MIA , but the manager was great. He's what kicked it up from a 2.5 star to 3. Food was good, but not great. If we lived nearby we might go back, but since we don't, we won't be. Not worth a trip out

3.description: Great Dive bar by my house...I walk in take over the jukebox and pay $2 for beers,where does that happen?My gf was so shocked she didn't know what to do with the change lolgood times

1.description: This place is awful, what a dumpster fire . Only been there twice. There is a bartender that double charges you, then when point it out she screams like a raving lunatic. Another bartender will steal your cash right I front of you then say that it was her twenty dollar tip for bringing you three beers.

2.description: decent polish dive bar. If you are near by its definitely worth the look at least because of their cheap prices.The main con to this place is how long it takes, sometimes, to get the waitresses attention. But their specials help make the experience much more tolerable. Be careful on coming on a busy night with a larger group though. they have fairly limited seating available.Ill definitely come back when im looking to go somewhere other than the usual and spend less money

5.description: It might go up to four.  Dunno.  Remains to be seen.I was there for a Fire watch party.  I liked the atmosphere, the beer selection was mainly macrobrews, but it was still decent at that.  No food, but Bob-O's is right across the street and no one gave anyone dirt about bringing in outside food.  Clean place, agreeable decor, and yes, a good deal of the polish crowd.Note- the restrooms lack open-door privacy, meaning, if someone opens the door, you're on display while taking care of your business (though the men's room stall offers visual privacy.  The urinal is an on-and-off peep show.They have 7, 8 TVs, but my only downer is that they are a bit small for watching soccer.  That aside, I'd go back for the atmosphere and decent drink specials.  Maybe it'll earn that fourth star.  Three for now...

6.description: This is actually an updated neighborhood tavern that used to be one of the best "old man" bars on the NW side before most of the regulars died off. The current clientel is mostly Eastern European 20-30 year olds.

7.description: I saw a weird mix of old male Americans and young Eastern European Euro-punks on Halloween night after stopping here from a relatives party nearby. Maybe some of the old geezards are still alive, but it is mainly a Polish bar with a nice tall sexy bartender.

0.description: Don't pass this place by! It looks super small from the outside but looks are deceiving here! Super cute and nicely done patio/garden! So cute and relaxing! Full sports bar inside with plenty of sports for any man! The perk for me is that Staropramen is on tap and they are so proud to have it here! From the sign on the door to the glass ware everyone fights over! Great people, great staff & a darn right cool bar! Don't miss out on this one.

4.description: Best dive bar in this hood. Drinks are cheap and the quality is pretty damn good. It's the best deal in town for drinks really. They have bar food, but haven't tried it. Bartenders are nice (though they do have to deal with jerks sometimes).  Women's bathroom is super clean- major plus!! Clientele is usually older lone men or younger European guys. Cozy and dark, just how I like it! It's nothing fancy, though they seem to be trying to give it a more "cafe" vibe (stick to the divey bar vibe, don't fix it if it ain't broke).

3.description: So I love this place.  It's attached to my favorite coffee shop-Perkolator- so I can grab my beverage of choice and walk through the doorway into the record/book shop.  What fantastic place to hang out.  There's a listening station so you can spin some vinyl, lots of great books that are well organized, and a small amount of cool seating if you want to visit with friends or get some work done.  Free wi-fi, cool music and excellent atmosphere.  The vinyl and book selections grow every day.  I am there A LOT and always see them adding new product.  No CD's or DVD's!  But if that is your scene you can just walk across the street to Thrift and Thrive which is owned by the same family.  Did I say, "family owned"?  Yes I did!  Locally owned and operated which makes me even happier about spending money here.  So.  If you love vinyl and used books-this is your place.  If you love great food and coffee-this is your place!  It has it all people!

1.description: "Sputnik Books & Records" doesn't have its own entrance.  It's part of the Perkolator coffeeshop and the store is adjacently attached to it.  They have tables and chairs for coffeeshop patrons, interesting book, vinyls from various genres, and a listening station just in case you want to find out what a certain vinyl is exactly about.  There's a section of "fresh this week" for people who frequently pop in and are looking for something new.  Prices are pretty good for used and new records.  Hubby has purchased vinyls from a random Irish band and alternative bands.  Pay for the records or the books at the Perkolator register.  You will see me around since Portage Park is my hood and Perkalor is a quality, family-friendly coffeeshop to hang out or to get work done.

2.description: Sputnik is the perfect partner to the Perkolator coffee shop next door.  The space is well laid-out and very tidy.  There's even a listening table where you can take a quick listen to the vinyl you picked out.  And there is lots of vinyl to choose from--all kinds of genres, different eras and even 45's. The shelves of used books also show a great variety of genres and all the books seemed to be in great condition despite being owned previously.  The prices seemed very reasonable too.  There is some seating here so you could definitely take your drinks over here as well. Great addition to the block!

0.description: Super cool little record/book shop in Portage Park, adjacent to Perkulator. Glad to see a place like this in the neighborhood, it brings some unique character for sure. Vinyl selection is good, genres are fairly broad but there was plenty of variety. Soul, funk, disco, jazz, country, rock, psych, punk, new wave, punk, electronic, hip hop, etc. Most were used but VG quality or better, a few sealed reissues and new releases, including an extensive back catalogue bin of Trouble In Mind Records. I found a handful of gems at great prices...the average price was $3 for the used LPs/12"s I picked up. A couple for $5-6 and one for $10, found at least 5 for $3 which was great.The listening station was a nice touch, and the staff from the cafe were extremely helpful with hooking up the cartridge and balancing the tonearm. Check it out if you're in the area, it's a fun place to browse after getting coffee.

28.description: I spent 45 minutes at Galos Cave Spa, and it might have been the quickest 45 minutes of my live.Today was my first visit to Galos Cave Spa. My friend took me as my birthday present. This would be her third visit.You call to make an appointment. We chose 3pm because there were no other reservations at that time, so we would have the place to ourselves.When you enter, you are asked to remove your shoes and leave them outside the spa room itself. You also should turn off your cell phone. My friend advised me ahead of time to wear white socks, because you pick up salt dust.The room itself is dimly lit with salt lamps. There is about two or three inches of thick salt on the floor. The pillars are made of salt blocks. Stalagtites (stalagmites? I can never remember which is which.) hang from the ceiling. There are about 15 patio chairs which can recline. One corner is separated and asks like a sand box for children, even equipped with a couple buckets and shovels, but it is full of salt, not sand. Soft music is piped in. There are also several light blankets piled on one chair, so you can cover yourself if it gets cool (temperature is about 70 degrees), or you can do as we did, put a blanket on the salt-covered floor and just relax.When your hours starts, there is a voice-over giving you simple instructions. It suggests you walk around the room for 5-10 minutes to get accustomed to the salt, and maybe even just hold some salt in your hands while you do so. So, we did do that.Afterwards, I reclined in a chair for a few minutes, but then I decided to lay down. Now, I had taken a nap for over an hour earlier in the day, but I still was so completely relaxed, my mind just went floating away. It was like being in a deep meditation. At the end of the 45 minutes, the soft voice comes on again. A few minutes later, the lights come up.The whole experience was like being in a deep meditation. I was definitely in an alpha state. No way, no how, did it feel like 45 minutes had passed. But they had. Almost three hours later, I am only starting to feel like the peace and relaxation is starting to fade. I got a lot out of this experience, and will definitely be back.It was $15 for a single visit. They have packages available for someone who plans to visit on a regular basis.

1.description: What did Rosa J. do when she had a Sunday off?  She started her day slow and relaxing at the Galos Cave.  I purchased a groupon awhile ago.  A groupon costs $35 for five (5) individual sessions ($70 value).  Each session lasts forty-five (45) minutes.  I was trying to get some inside scoops on what exactly this "cave spa" was about, yet all the Yelp reviews on this place so far were somewhat "incomplete" in my opinion.  I finally experienced this this morning with hubby. I felt comfortably relaxed.  Was this therapeutic for real?  Perhaps, but I would keep an open mind since that was my first time being exposed in this environment.  Before the session begins, you should1) make a reservation: call the # listed on their Yelp business page.  The earliest appointment starts at 1000 hour.  I booked for two (2) adults, but there are pricing differences between children and adults.  I believe that senior citizens get 15% discount between 1300 to 1600 hours on Wednesdays.  2) ensure you have white socks: I'm not talking about the baseball team on the south side of Chicago.  You should bring clean white socks with you.  If you forget these, I assume that there are some "hospital booties" available at the receptionist's desk.  Otherwise. TJ Maxx is across the road in Dunning Square if they are open.  3) arrive at least ten (10) minutes early: give yourself some time to check in with the receptionist, pay for the session or redeem the groupon, use the washroom, change socks, and put your jacket or coat away because you won't need it!  P.S.: the entrance is located on Natchez, just off the Irving Park Rd.  When you're situating yourself in the cave, you should1) turn off your electronic and cellular devices.2) not engage conversations so that everyone can pay attention to the computerized PA announcements (with introductions and disclaimers) and start relaxing.  3) adjust the chair according to your comfort level because those lounge chairs make some significant noises.  Let the session begin...They played some classical music mixed with sounds of waves and seagulls in order to simulate the "Oceanside" environment.  Some people were taking a brief nap; some were mediating; some were playing with the salt.  The temperature and humidity were just perfect.  It was approximately 70 degrees Fahrenheit.  Wearing a tee or t-shirt would be appropriate.  There was no children in our session, but I noticed a little "salt playground" on the corner with some toys. I was getting sleepy toward the end, but I was fairly awake the entire time.  I played the salt and held some in my hand.  That felt great, and I found more paper cuts that I never knew!  I saw a client walking around the cave quietly, which was definitely allowed.  I rubbed my feet with salt (of course with socks on), and it was fun.  Then we heard the PA announcement again to remind us that session has ended.  Everyone then grabbed his/her belongings and exited the cave.  How does Rosa J. think of this cave without a caveman?  "I would definitely visit the Galos Cave again.  Although the experience wasn't extremely fantastic, I thought the price was affordable and was able to clear my mind, release my stress, lessen the tension during the session."  I will be calling to make my next reservation with hubby.

9.description: Who knew semi- public napping could be sooo relaxing?  I think I have found a new habit!  I love it.  I am already a pro napper, put me in a great relaxing environment and hey- this is something that I can TOTALLY excel at!  When a friend who is into alternative energy and healing asked me if I wanted to try the salt cave, I thought why not? I love caves, I love the ocean, this sort of combines the two.  The worst it can be is cheesy (it is not).  We ventured WAAAAAAYYYYY FAAAAARRRRR into the northwest side of the city to get to the Galos Cave Spa.  It was well worth the drive. That is not something you will normally hear coming out of my mouth. We got there, ditched our shoes in the cubbies, hung our coats, paid the modest fee, and entered the salt cave.  It really was pretty cool. Tons of salt crystals crunched under your feet, they felt great.  Stalactites were all over the ceiling.  Yes, they were manufactured, but they were made of salt.  The room had ambient lighting and the most comfy reclining beach type chairs I have ever sat in.  There were only a few of us there, we spoke briefly before we all got comfy, had our blankies, the lights dimmed, and a recording about the benefits of salt in the air played.  I forgot exactly what they had to say.  So many minutes in this cave is equivalent to 2 days at the ocean, blah blah blah.  Then Pachelbel began to play.  I kind of wish they would have stayed with classic composers, but they went with more new age music.  About 40 minutes later the lights came on, one of the guys in the room apologized if he was snoring and our session was over!I felt relaxed, energized and happy.  Totally unexpected.  I really enjoyed the session, was comfortable and am looking forward to going back.  What a great place!

29.description: I had the cave to myself last night...so peaceful and cozy...I almost fell asleep!I I am really starting to love this place. I may buy a package of ten sessions next time.Very relaxing and serene,if nothing else. I do feel much better,but that may be due to the meds as well. No down side to going,so what the heck?

23.description: Granted, I've only been to one other salt cave so I'm no expert on salt caves but I do know that this place needs some adjustments.Positive: - They're not sticklers to the start time of the cave experience if you made reservations and it's not busy.- Very pretty cave.Negative: -Too much lighting. I'd like it a little darker. -The opening and closing sound bite is a tad bit too loud. The guy speaking does not have a soothing voice. It's boarder line annoying and he talks for way too much time.-Receptionist is very aloof. I guess they figure you know why you're there so they just point at the door and off you go.-It can get loud with all the squeaky chairs and snoring guests.
