I would suggest bringing ear plugs or your mp3 player for a more serene experience.

5.description: I purchased this with a Groupon. I am trying different ways to take better care of me. This is close to work, so could not resist. This is my second time in the Cave. I hope Batman does not get jealous.

31.description: This place is so unreal!  People have done a great job on here of describing the salt cave, but you have to go to fully understand!  I just went yesterday, and me and my friend were careful to make an appt. during a "kid-free" hour.  It was just us and 2 other women on Friday morning.  The lounge chairs they provide are super comfortable!  My only complaint is the music.  Kinda cheesy, and my friend thought it was a little too loud.  I think next time I go I may bring my iPod.  I agree with other reviews that the "salt healing" is suspect, the reason to go is to chill out in a totally surreal environment!

25.description: Go ahead and just read Collen C's review, she nailed the particulars of this place.  I'll just add that it's totes worth the $15 on experience alone and if for no other reason than to say you did it....but then you actually do get the added benefit of being fully calm and relaxed in a way that's hard to describe (i know, right, wtf am i on yelp anyway?)Another thing for first timers, the canned audio explaining everything at the start of the session doesn't mention that you benefit from walking around in the salt for the first 10 min, until, well about 10 minutes *into* said canned audio....so we were already reclined and laying down from the beginning (it's that inviting, you really have no choice but  to lie down. immediately.)  So we got up, walked a few loops and then took to our desired positions.  While the reclining chairs were nice, I preferred to lie down on the salt floor as it is nice and warm and seemed to facilitate the goal of this place, a total state of relaxation.As a final, I'd imagine eating some acid and then laying down and looking up at the stalagmites/tites? protruding from the ceiling in a freakish horror movie type way just might prove suicidal.  Would not recommend.

12.description: Another update.  All the info I wrote below still applies.  Went again today, and for $15 and 50 min of my time, I felt a lot better afterwards.  Glad I went.The only extra tidbit is their clock is about 5 minutes fast, so don't get there at the last minute like me because they start by their clock, ie. 5 min early.  Try to get there about 10 min before the hour (real time) so that you have time to pay and relax before they start the session.Also read my notes about free parking, white socks, and also requesting a kid-free session below.

21.description: You must come with an open mind.  If you don't, the whole experience IS a little strange, or  at least bordering on "new age."  That being said, with the right attitude it is an extremely enjoyable and therapeutic process.Upon arrival, you enter a very small waiting room. There are cubbies for your shoes, and it is recommended that you bring a pair of clean socks to enter the cave. No bare feet allowed. Keep in mind the whole place is pretty small, and they prefer silence in the waiting area as not to disturb patrons already in the cave. There are no magazines, and with no small talk allowed, its really best to get there fairly close (within 10 minutes) to your reservation time.The reception desk does their best to schedule "like" patrons together, so its good to mention if you are bringing kids (or not) so that they can plan the best experience for you. If you are bringing kids, there is an area in the corner with beach toys that the kids are welcome to play with. The large grains of salt have the same play quality as sand, so it can be a fun outing for even the little folks. Be warned however, the munchkins will probably be covered in fine white powder residue at the end of the session, so don't expect them to leave here 100% presentable! If you are not bringing kids, be sure to ask if there are all adult sessions so that you can relax/nap and don't have to listen to little shrieks of delight or 45 minutes of gravely shoveling noises. Adults get to lie in zero gravity beach chairs and just "rest."The cave itself is a little Disneyesque, and very pretty.  All white salt walls, ceiling and floor with multi-colored lights, piped in ocean sounds and cuddly white blankets all create a very peaceful atmosphere. The air is truly saturated with salt, and it reminds me of being at the ocean times 2. At the ocean you can really smell the salt, but here if you breathe really deeply through your mouth, you can taste it too. Since salt is an anti-microbial substance, it makes sense that breathing microparticals for 45 minutes might help the respiratory stuff that ails you.  I think the combination of down time, relaxing environment AND salt air really does leave anyone who comes feeling better than when they came.  I thought it *might* be a little gimmicky at first, but after 3 visits and reading about socialized medicine in the UK using the same salt caves for treatment of asthmatic children.... I think there really may be something to this. Its definitely worth the experience.

16.description: I have a penchant for alternative healing and random adventures. I don't necessarily require healing at this point in time, though I do necessarily need the adventure aspect. I figure the spa/relaxtion/health quotient can't hurt as an added bonus ;) I mean, really...what other reason would I have to trek out the far regions of the Northwest side in search of a salt cave? Ok, a bit of background. The Galos Cave Spa is basically a replica of a real salt cave (duh). You walk into this room, and there are about 15 beach chairs (VERY comfy, I need to get a few of those) amidst piles of salt. Think...water softener salt, that's what it looks like. There are large "stalagtites" (no idea on the spelling, my apologies) hanging from the ceiling and then lots of gem crystal wall fixtures that are illuminated in neon colors. Also, for added authenticity there are conch shells as light fixtures as well ;) A soundtrack of waves and enya like stuff is played throughout the 45 minute session. Good luck staying awake, I think I made it about  6 minutes. My first recommendation: Call ahead to see when there is a session starting. They are very helpful and nice, and will tell you if there are children booked in the session (yes, there is like a little area with children's toys, etc...this place honestly could not be any more surreal. Then...1. Wear white socks, or you'll have to put on these little hospital booty things. 2. Turn off your cell phone3. $15 for a 45 minute session. relax, breathe, let the salt heal you and think to yourself "where on earth am I?"Then go next door to dine in a salt cave restaurant...I didn't do that (yet), but I imagine it adds to the overall experience. Ahhhhhhhhh. good stuff.

17.description: You must come with an open mind.  If you don't, the whole experience IS a little strange, or  at least bordering on "new age."  That being said, with the right attitude it is an extremely enjoyable and therapeutic process.Upon arrival, you enter a very small waiting room. There are cubbies for your shoes, and it is recommended that you bring a pair of clean socks to enter the cave. No bare feet allowed. Keep in mind the whole place is pretty small, and they prefer silence in the waiting area as not to disturb patrons already in the cave. There are no magazines, and with no small talk allowed, its really best to get there fairly close (within 10 minutes) to your reservation time.The reception desk does their best to schedule "like" patrons together, so its good to mention if you are bringing kids (or not) so that they can plan the best experience for you. If you are bringing kids, there is an area in the corner with beach toys that the kids are welcome to play with. The large grains of salt have the same play quality as sand, so it can be a fun outing for even the little folks. Be warned however, the munchkins will probably be covered in fine white powder residue at the end of the session, so don't expect them to leave here 100% presentable! If you are not bringing kids, be sure to ask if there are all adult sessions so that you can relax/nap and don't have to listen to little shrieks of delight or 45 minutes of gravely shoveling noises. Adults get to lie in zero gravity beach chairs and just "rest."The cave itself is a little Disneyesque, and very pretty.  All white salt walls, ceiling and floor with multi-colored lights, piped in ocean sounds and cuddly white blankets all create a very peaceful atmosphere. The air is truly saturated with salt, and it reminds me of being at the ocean times 2. At the ocean you can really smell the salt, but here if you breathe really deeply through your mouth, you can taste it too. Since salt is an anti-microbial substance, it makes sense that breathing microparticals for 45 minutes might help the respiratory stuff that ails you.  I think the combination of down time, relaxing environment AND salt air really does leave anyone who comes feeling better than when they came.  I thought it *might* be a little gimmicky at first, but after 3 visits and reading about socialized medicine in the UK using the same salt caves for treatment of asthmatic children.... I think there really may be something to this. Its definitely worth the experience.

10.description: So, this place nails it in terms of atmosphere!  It is fantastic and so relaxing.  A friend and I went together and only one other lady was in the room, so it was great, but next time I would bring headphones just in case.  I walked around for a few minutes, and then laid on a chair, and then decided to lay a blanket down and just sprawl in the salt.  Super fun.So I wasn't necessarily going for health benefits, but rather to try something new.  The funny thing is, I had a crappy start of a cold and felt congested.  I sure feel great now and did within 30 minutes of the session.  So, I am a true believer and am going to get the Groupon before it expires!!!!

11.description: I bought a Groupon for for five sessions. This is my first appointment and first impression. I have an appointment at 10:00 am on a Sunday (March 23, 2014). I read to arrive 15 minutes before my appointment. It is now 10:30 am and the doors are still not open. I have been waiting for 45 minutes. Unfortunately, I have a busy day and can not afford to wait around. I left a message to reschedule. I hope this I not a recurring issue and receive a call back to reschedule.

26.description: An acquaintance recommended this salt cave treatment for relief from allergy symptoms.  My friend was getting a cold so we went together a couple times & we both felt improvement. The recording you listen to during treatment is kind of cheesy but does encourage relaxation. I have sent my mother, mother in law & aunt. My MIL noticed an improvement with her allergy symptoms too. My mother just enjoyed the relaxation. Its well worth the cost. I was advised to ask for a time slot without small children scheduled to ensure peace & quiet. Oh, & its a requirement to bring white socks along. I like the bags of salt they sell here to add to my bath water too.

27.description: This is one of the weirdest places in Chicago.  In the side of a Banquet facility is a place with 65,000 tons of sea salt.  Who thinks of these things?  But, I'm a brave soul, and, I had to see what the yelpers were yelping about, so I went into the salt room with the fake seahorses and giant shells on the walls, and, when the lights dimmed, I, like so many other people here, just fell asleep.  When teh 45 minutes was up and it was wakey-wakey time, it took me awhile to reacclimate myself, but, really, not that long... a couple of minutes, maybe... and while nobody was tapping a watch, it was clear that they wanted me to GET OUT.  But, come on... isn't that why they schedule 15 minutes between sessions?  To let people come out of the experience gradually before stepping out into the City again?  Well, whatever.  It's a weird experience, and it's worth the pittance they charge.

35.description: I have a penchant for alternative healing and random adventures. I don't necessarily require healing at this point in time, though I do necessarily need the adventure aspect. I figure the spa/relaxtion/health quotient can't hurt as an added bonus ;) I mean, really...what other reason would I have to trek out the far regions of the Northwest side in search of a salt cave? Ok, a bit of background. The Galos Cave Spa is basically a replica of a real salt cave (duh). You walk into this room, and there are about 15 beach chairs (VERY comfy, I need to get a few of those) amidst piles of salt. Think...water softener salt, that's what it looks like. There are large "stalagtites" (no idea on the spelling, my apologies) hanging from the ceiling and then lots of gem crystal wall fixtures that are illuminated in neon colors. Also, for added authenticity there are conch shells as light fixtures as well ;) A soundtrack of waves and enya like stuff is played throughout the 45 minute session. Good luck staying awake, I think I made it about  6 minutes. My first recommendation: Call ahead to see when there is a session starting. They are very helpful and nice, and will tell you if there are children booked in the session (yes, there is like a little area with children's toys, etc...this place honestly could not be any more surreal. Then...1. Wear white socks, or you'll have to put on these little hospital booty things. 2. Turn off your cell phone3. $15 for a 45 minute session. relax, breathe, let the salt heal you and think to yourself "where on earth am I?"Then go next door to dine in a salt cave restaurant...I didn't do that (yet), but I imagine it adds to the overall experience. Ahhhhhhhhh. good stuff.

8.description: I was told about this place and it took me a while to give it a try. I bought a groupon for five sessions and have enjoyed this experience. There is easy parking along the street or in the lot across.  Make sure you call ahead to make an appointment. Bring white socks and don't place your purse on the ground or you will have any chocolate melted since the salt emits heat. Make sure you disconnect to get the full experience. A young woman was on her cell phone the entire time texting away. This is supposed to be a treatment so take advantage of the 45 minutes to unwind. Grab a meal at Jolly inn after or what I prefer to do, walk a block west and then south to Montrose deli and buy some authentic foods and have a nice meal.

0.description: Great place. Very calming. The cave is amazing. I purchased a groupon for 5 sessions and am so glad I did. I highly recommend going. It's relaxing and you leave feeling calm and refreshed. So relaxed. It's really easy scheduling an appointment. I recommend wearing something you don't mind getting dusty. White socks. I end up turning my socks inside out so my feet can soak in all the salt that ends up on my socks. I actually laid on the floor (I was alone in the cave).

20.description: This is quite the different and tranquil experience.  I recently went to Galos Cave Spa for the second time, after not visiting in a few years.  The first time I went with my mom, and it was just us which was really nice.  This time I took my husband, and there were about 7 other people.  Everyone did their best to be quiet as requested by the man who provides a brief explanation of the benefits of salt caves on one's health over the recording on the speaker.  I did not think he talked so long that it was irritating, as one person alluded to.  I found it interesting to hear about the benefits of salt therapy, if you will.  Even if I was a regular user, I think it would be nice as a positive reminder that you are doing something good for your health (at least if you buy into the whole health benefits thing).  Anyways, my main rec. is to call ahead of time to book your apt., but not too ahead of time, if you are looking for an adults-only session.  The benefits for kids and pregnant mothers are supposedly quite good, so there are plenty of parents who do take their children there.  If you are looking for a quiet atmosphere to relax and not watch kids play in the salts, make sure you do book a session where only other adults are present.  I found that the receptionist was very helpful, in this area.  However, I wouldn't expect a call back, if after you make your reservation, a family with children booked, so just a heads up.  You may want to call on the day of your apt. to verify this, if this is very important to you.  At $15 a session, I find that it is about the right cost (I wouldn't pay much more for a 45 minute session, to be honest), even if the health benefits are a sham:), for a single experience alone.  I do believe in the positives, I just know my husband and others I have spoken with aren't as sold, so I wanted to mention that.  They could make a few seemingly simple improvements including putting padding/some type of comfortable material on the arm rests and providing pillows or padded head rests.  All in all, a fabulous experience and I will return before the end of the year, for sure.

19.description: Announcements are first in polish and then english each paragraph where they give history and advertisements for their specials, benefits and rules.  18 mins of that. Then after about 10 mins the door opened and she let in 5-6 more women who shuffled around talking about where to sit and squeaky chairs, leaving about 13 mins to try to relax again.   It's also pretty rundown and needs repair. They need to type and laminate the announcements to read while waiting to maintain the quiet calm feeling attained outside, especially if have been there before.  Never ever let anyone in once door closes on the hour and interrupt the reason you are there.   The other place you get settled in before the start and message is short, i.e. don't touch salt, or talk.

33.description: Note to self: DO NOT take drugs before going here. That being said, this place is awesome. Even if it's not "healing" me, it's nice to get away from the loudness of the city for 45 min. I'm not sure if it actually heals you, but it really does help with stress.Bring white sox.Don't talk on your cell phone.

2.description: Held a celebration luncheon at the Jolly Inn, same building. Many guests decided to try the spa before. The spa accepts 10 at a time. My group had 15  deciding to take advantage of the spa.10 before lunch, and 5 during a time period making them just slightly late for lunch. As the Jolly Inn is a buffet, there was no problem. Speaking for all, I'd say all enjoyed. In respect for all in a group, It is best for everyone to be accepting of sitting in quiet meditation. I found it delightful to open my eyes from quiet relaxation, to viewing stalagmites. The cave's temperature and air quality were excellent. We all enjoyed. I have daily sinus headaches, and I had no headache for the following several days. Today in Chicago, we have freezing rain, ice, and high winds. I'd like to return to Galos Cave to renew the comfort it provided, but being a half hour drive from my home, and the weather is now bad for driving, I'll go another day. I plan to visit Galos Cave frequently, and follow with a meal or carryout from the Jolly Inn. Free parking in lots on both the east and west side of the building is provided. Don't know how to post photos, else I would.

34.description: This place seemed to be popping up everywhere in my media perusals of late. First I saw it in the newspaper. Then it was in some local magazine. Then on tv. I took it as a sign that I had to check it out (especially since I can always use a positive health experience). According to the web site, the mystical healing powers of the Black Sea salt (imported from Poland and replaced every 2 months) can alleviate a variety of ailments, from skin disorders to "neuroses." Also according to their web site, their hours are 9 am to 9 pm, but when we called, the machine said that their "summer hours" are 11 am to something ("Summer?" it's October!  Update the website...) Got there at 11, and a group with a toddler was also there, who warned us that if we were looking for a restful experience, we might not want to go in with them, since the toddler would be, well, a toddler. Thanks! We went out to lunch and came back at noon, when we went in with a group of mostly old ladies (much quieter than the toddler, though one started hacking up a hairball halfway through the 45 minute session -- the salt air *is* supposed to be good for your sinuses...). Entering into the cave through the reception room, you feel like you're going into some Narnia world. Blacklights enhance the colors of the salt stalactites, and chunks of pink salt (like the salt lamps for sale out in the lobby) glow from the room's central pillar and the walls like huge knobs of rose quartz. You're encouraged to walk around the cave for 5-10 minutes to stimulate circulation; there's not a lot of floor space, so everyone just sort of milled around in a circle around the central pillar like people doing a zen meditation walk. The rock salt has a gravelly texture and is a bit difficult to walk on, though your feet get a nice reflexology treatment through your regulation white socks as you shuffle along. Be sure to pick up some of the salt and massage it between your palms too for the same effect. After a while everyone settled into the comfy lounge chairs (except one old lady who did some tai chi in the corner for a while), the lights dimmed except for the glowing pink chunks in the walls, and we all mellowed out. The temperature is 70 degrees, the receptionist said, though it seemed chilly to me; polar fleece blankets are thoughtfully provided. The music could have used some variety; apparently the CD we were listening to must have been something like "The Many Moods of Pachabel," because we heard like 5 versions of "Canon" (Canon with waves! Canon with seabirds! Canon with New Age spaceship sounds! Canon with moody randomly plucked guitar string accompaniment!)...and then the same CD started over again! Put something else in the changer, please.Overall, it was a relaxing, unusual way to spend an hour. Nowhere near home for me, but we made a day trip of it, so it was worthwhile. If you plan on going, I would call ahead to see if there are kids booked in the session (if that bothers you), and be sure of their hours, as what's on the web site may not accurately reflect the actual open times.

32.description: Apparently, some rich-ass Polish people imported some salt in from the Black Sea and have encrusted an entire room in it, so riff-raff like you and I can sit in lawn chairs while wave music is piped in, breathing in the healing properties of sea salt. I mean, if that does not sound like an appealing adventure to you, you're hella square and should start sanding off those edges, homie. START LIVING. THIS PLACE IS A TRIP! Get on the ride!!

18.description: I spent 45 minutes at Galos Cave Spa, and it might have been the quickest 45 minutes of my live.Today was my first visit to Galos Cave Spa. My friend took me as my birthday present. This would be her third visit.You call to make an appointment. We chose 3pm because there were no other reservations at that time, so we would have the place to ourselves.When you enter, you are asked to remove your shoes and leave them outside the spa room itself. You also should turn off your cell phone. My friend advised me ahead of time to wear white socks, because you pick up salt dust.The room itself is dimly lit with salt lamps. There is about two or three inches of thick salt on the floor. The pillars are made of salt blocks. Stalagtites (stalagmites? I can never remember which is which.) hang from the ceiling. There are about 15 patio chairs which can recline. One corner is separated and asks like a sand box for children, even equipped with a couple buckets and shovels, but it is full of salt, not sand. Soft music is piped in. There are also several light blankets piled on one chair, so you can cover yourself if it gets cool (temperature is about 70 degrees), or you can do as we did, put a blanket on the salt-covered floor and just relax.When your hours starts, there is a voice-over giving you simple instructions. It suggests you walk around the room for 5-10 minutes to get accustomed to the salt, and maybe even just hold some salt in your hands while you do so. So, we did do that.Afterwards, I reclined in a chair for a few minutes, but then I decided to lay down. Now, I had taken a nap for over an hour earlier in the day, but I still was so completely relaxed, my mind just went floating away. It was like being in a deep meditation. At the end of the 45 minutes, the soft voice comes on again. A few minutes later, the lights come up.The whole experience was like being in a deep meditation. I was definitely in an alpha state. No way, no how, did it feel like 45 minutes had passed. But they had. Almost three hours later, I am only starting to feel like the peace and relaxation is starting to fade. I got a lot out of this experience, and will definitely be back.It was $15 for a single visit. They have packages available for someone who plans to visit on a regular basis.

13.description: Granted, I've only been to one other salt cave so I'm no expert on salt caves but I do know that this place needs some adjustments.Positive: - They're not sticklers to the start time of the cave experience if you made reservations and it's not busy.- Very pretty cave.Negative: -Too much lighting. I'd like it a little darker. -The opening and closing sound bite is a tad bit too loud. The guy speaking does not have a soothing voice. It's boarder line annoying and he talks for way too much time.-Receptionist is very aloof. I guess they figure you know why you're there so they just point at the door and off you go.-It can get loud with all the squeaky chairs and snoring guests. I would suggest bringing ear plugs or your mp3 player for a more serene experience.

4.description: Got a groupon for this place. Thought the idea was neat so I tried it.Park at the Jolly Inn parking lot. You will NOT see any signs for Galos Caves.Walk around the building from the parking lot, the entrance to the caves is the third door on your left.We booked an adults only session. You should bring white socks unless you want the hospital booties Galos provides.There are no lockers, you will have to bring in your coat and purse.You are led into a salt and iodine man made cave with 8 chairs and a children's play nook. They play a recording and then you just sit there for 45 minutes.The receptionist was friendly and punctual, I had a concern having the first appointment of the day (10am) because other reviews mentioned the door wasn't opened on time, but it was not like that for me.Health benefits? I don't know. Relaxing? Sure. I would recommend this place.

24.description: Another update.  All the info I wrote below still applies.  Went again today, and for $15 and 50 min of my time, I felt a lot better afterwards.  Glad I went.The only extra tidbit is their clock is about 5 minutes fast, so don't get there at the last minute like me because they start by their clock, ie. 5 min early.  Try to get there about 10 min before the hour (real time) so that you have time to pay and relax before they start the session.Also read my notes about free parking, white socks, and also requesting a kid-free session below.

6.description: Loved going here! The staff person was very friendly and efficient, and welcomed us into the salt cave. A guided meditation with music played during our 45 minute session, and I got so relaxed, my body started twitching! :) I would absolutely recommend this for a fun gals' spa outing or just to have some "me time". The entire experience was super relaxing - I'll definitely be coming back.

22.description: Who knew semi- public napping could be sooo relaxing?  I think I have found a new habit!  I love it.  I am already a pro napper, put me in a great relaxing environment and hey- this is something that I can TOTALLY excel at!  When a friend who is into alternative energy and healing asked me if I wanted to try the salt cave, I thought why not? I love caves, I love the ocean, this sort of combines the two.  The worst it can be is cheesy (it is not).  We ventured WAAAAAAYYYYY FAAAAARRRRR into the northwest side of the city to get to the Galos Cave Spa.  It was well worth the drive. That is not something you will normally hear coming out of my mouth. We got there, ditched our shoes in the cubbies, hung our coats, paid the modest fee, and entered the salt cave.  It really was pretty cool. Tons of salt crystals crunched under your feet, they felt great.  Stalactites were all over the ceiling.  Yes, they were manufactured, but they were made of salt.  The room had ambient lighting and the most comfy reclining beach type chairs I have ever sat in.  There were only a few of us there, we spoke briefly before we all got comfy, had our blankies, the lights dimmed, and a recording about the benefits of salt in the air played.  I forgot exactly what they had to say.  So many minutes in this cave is equivalent to 2 days at the ocean, blah blah blah.  Then Pachelbel began to play.  I kind of wish they would have stayed with classic composers, but they went with more new age music.  About 40 minutes later the lights came on, one of the guys in the room apologized if he was snoring and our session was over!I felt relaxed, energized and happy.  Totally unexpected.  I really enjoyed the session, was comfortable and am looking forward to going back.  What a great place!

15.description: This is a great place! The session was very relaxing, the music was relaxing and you hear the ocean.... the chairs can be adjusted up and down. The sessions are 45 min. The air feels lightly salty. My friend suggested to walk on the salt and this is good for the feet. I will be back!

7.description: My friend's mom would always tell me about this place and it was on my list of things to do.  So, when I saw an awesome deal on Groupon, I knew I had to jump on it... so I did.  I had a horrible cold, so I decided to pamper myself on night.  I scheduled a massage and then it dawned on me... I should check out the salt caves.  I read on the website that it helped with respiratory issues and I figured it would be like a giant saline rinse to get rid of my mucus Queen status.I scheduled an appointment and when I arrived, I realized I would be the only one in the cave for my 45 minutes.  At first I thought it would be awkward, but I actually enjoyed myself even more this way.  It was very relaxing and I felt super calm.  I was ready to move on to the next spa for my massage.The next day my cold was gone!

36.description: Trippy. Very trippy. For 15 dollars you and several strangers lie on beach chairs in a dimly lit salt cave with new age music and flashing lights for 45 minutes. What Gilligan's island might have been like if it were Polish.

30.description: If you know me, you know for the past two days I have been raving about my experience here like Jim Jones trying to get everyone to drink the Kool-Aid.A few basic facts about me:1) I can be a bit tightly wound; it isn't always easy for me to relax2) My mind races a million miles an hour and it is hard to slow it down, even when I try to rest3) I cannot usually fall asleep anywhere but my own bed.After my visit to Galos, that all went out the window, for at least a little bit.  I had read about the salt caves and their therapeutic qualities, and after reading the reviews, decided to give Galos a whirl on my "Me" day off.  I called ahead while I was at breakfast, and like others have said, was warned two of the sessions I inquired after would have toddlers, so I booked the 2:00 session.  I was the only one in there, which was nice.  I spent the first few minutes walking around on the salt and rubbing it through my palms as advised.  Then I lay down in the beach chair and reclined, pulled the white fleece blanket over me, and relaxed.  I didn't feel sleepy at first and I thought, well that's ok, I will just be zen...until 40 minutes later the voice over the music told me it was time.  I had totally passed out!  It was one of the best naps of my life.  I felt refreshed and calm and at ease, my allergies and breathing felt better, and I was converted to the believers.At $15 for a 45 minute session, I could do this every week for less than the cost of one session of some of my other alternative therapies.I am now a big fan, and I am going to try to go back at least once a month.  This place [salt] rocks!

3.description: Took a friend here as a Christmas gift. We arrived about 30 minutes prior to the appointment. Greeted by the receptionist and sat in the waiting area until it was our turn.There were 5 people total in our 3pm session. We engaged in light conversation before the recording came on. Upon entering, I felt a spicy, tingling feeling in my sinuses, which let me know that this may actually work!As the session began, I purposely did deep breathing to really engage my sinuses. It was very relaxing! The time went so fast; I didn't realize that I fell asleep!I did feel rejuvenated after leaving. My sense of smell also seemed heightened.Really enjoyed the experience, and really felt I got a good value for the price ($15). I would definitely come here again of my schedule permits.

14.description: Very Interesting. I came with my mom and sister last week and we almost had the cave to ourselves at 11:00 AM on a Tuesday. The woman working there was really friendly and we were able to park in the free lot across the street. Free parking is awesome! There was a "kids only" session right before ours and it seemed like all the kids had a wonderful time. So...I had a horrible cold when I came here. I spent most of session trying to choke back coughs because that horrible part of the cold where you gasp for air had just hit me that morning and I felt like a jerk for being in public and didn't want to be loud for the two women in the cave not related to me who were trying to relax. The cave is a fun experience. I want to have this room in my house. I don't know if you can really feel that much better after one visit but laying on those comfy chairs staring up at the foam stalagmites is pretty relaxing and I am really glad I finally went there after having it on my to-do list for years.OH MAN...if you come you must check out the buffet at the restaurant in the same building. Pierogi Heaven!

0.description: A bit overpriced for the areaWas hoping for a wow factor - but didn't get what I wanted as far as my ideal cut and color

12.description: I love this salon.  I've been going there for years.  After I get a haircut or get my hair styled, I get so many compliments from people.  The stylist at the salon are so accomodating and friendly.  The service, people, and atmosphere is just great here... I couldn't be happier.

3.description: Once again the sweet gals here come through. My sitter had an appointment to get her hair done for homecoming tonight. I had a plan to secretly pay for it so I looked it up to call them. The reviews were horrid and I didn't want my sitter going to homecoming with a bad 'do.I called velentinas to see if they could get her in today, a busy homecoming Saturday.  I asked for a 4 or 5 pm appointment but she told me they closed at 3. I hung up and 2 minutes later my phone rang.  The stylist volunteered to stay for a 3 o clock appointment!  My sitter is thrilled, and has learned a valuable lesson. Check the reviews before you make an appointment!  Thanks again to the lovely ladies at velentinas!

1.description: I decided to go to Velintina's based on the reviews I found here on Yelp! and I was not disappointed.  I walked in with a vague idea of what I wanted, and Tina listened and delivered awesome results. I have fine hair and Tina gave me a cut that flatters my face and provides volume, while keeping some length, which is hard when your hair if fine.  On top of that, Tina was very friendly, and made me feel very comfortable.  I felt like I was visiting with a long time friend, we laughed it up quite a bit.  This is my favorite salon from now on. I live in the area, but if you're looking for upscale work at a decent price done by a fabulous AND friendly person, come see Tina at Velintina's.

2.description: As always a absolutely great job done by Gabby! I've been going here for years and am never disappointed! I've been to other salons in between due to sitter needs and never got the awesome results get here! I'll never go any else for my color or cut! Everyone always complements my hair every time I go here!

9.description: I always walk into a salon thinking I want one thing and since I'm not always positive about my choice, I don't know how to say what I want. Yet when I walked into velintina's, I said what I thought I wanted and walked out with exactly what I had envisioned! They are experts and I think I found MY salon!

10.description: I am not an up-do kind of girl, so when I was getting married I wanted a down-do. There is no other place I'd consider than Velintina's.  Tina did a wonderful job giving me exactly what I wanted. I received so many compliments on my hair on my wedding day and quite frankly any time I get my hair cut  there. Everyone that works there is great. You really should give them a try.

13.description: I live in Los Angeles, but I am in Chicago 2 or 3 times a year for weeks at a time. I always try to get a haircut before I leave L.A., but often end up needing one while I am here. Thanks to some very positive reviews I found the perfect place. I no longer need to get a haircut before I leave L.A.. In fact I will just wait til I get here from now on. Evelia gave me an excellent cut for a great price. Everyone there was friendly, and made me feel welcome. Excellent cut for a great price, and a  pleasant experience all the way around. After coming to Chicago for 20 years now I have made many friends here, and I will recommend Velintina's to all of them.

16.description: I would have to say my experience there was great and they were able to accomodate me easily. The stylist (not one of the owners) was very friendly. She did a SUPER job with my partial foils and they were very reasonable. In fact this is the first person to ever give me the color I actually wanted. However, my cut is rather lackluster. I wasn't 100% thrilled from the start and the longer time passes the more I am annoyed with it. I am bummed it didn't work since the color and price were great.

6.description: I've only been here once, so I'll wait to give 5 stars to see if I can get a second hair cut that's as good as the first. The barber Tony cut my hair and did a really nice job. He listened to what I wanted and did exactly that. He uses a straight razor around the ears and neck which is awesome. The place is small, but Tony and the other stylist were very friendly and it's clean and bright inside. It was $17 for the cut before tip and he's only there on Thursdays and Fridays now. I'll be going back here for sure. I used to go to another guy that I've reviewed as well, but it seemed like no matter how I told the other guy how I wanted him to cut my hair - I always got the same cut. It was good, but I like to change my hair style a lot and he didn't.

15.description: *** :) Review of One Extremely Satisfied Customer ***I recently moved back to the Chicago area and needed a new hair stylist. I am very fortunate to have found Velintina's Salon because this place is exactly the kind of salon I've been searching for! My haircut was done by one of the owners, Tina. She was very courteous and REALLY listened to me when I explain the type of cut I would like to have. She was patient with me and gave me very helpful suggestions. I am the type of person who searches for excellent customer service and I have found it here! In the past, I have been to all different types of hair salons in many major cities, as well as overseas. I've noticed that not all $100+ haircut automatically equal awesome service and friendly atmosphere. I am a bit old-fashioned in the sense that I prefer my hair stylist to be a down-to-earth person who I can trust my hair with and allows me a chance to enjoy this "pamper-me" time. I like the "friendly neighborhood" feel of smaller establishments, and mom-n-pop-shops. I don't want people to be fake to me, or pushy, to just to get me to spend money on extra services I don't want (I don't want to color my hair because I can't donate dyed hair). I've also had stylists blatantly show their discontent in front of me, simply because I don't want to purchase the hair products they are trying to push on me. I just prefer very little product in my hair, and whatever products I do have (I have a TON! I own many products from salons I've visited in the past and I'm a huge fan of Sephora & Ulta) are all BARELY used. I LOVE beauty products, but on a daily basis, I like to wear very little makeup and zero hair products. I would much rather spend that money I would've wasted on another product that sits and collects dust in the back of my cabinet or drawer, on tipping my stylist for an amazing haircut/style.That being said, I am ECSTATIC about my experience at Velintina's Salon. I LOVE my haircut (so does my boyfriend & mother) and I felt that it was a very serene, cozy environment for my retreat from the world. Tina is very skilled and attentive to my requests. She took her time with my blowdry and styling my hair. A lot of the stylists I've been to have rushed through my blowdry or didn't ask what I would want done and just went straight for the flat-iron (I have somewhat wavy hair and there is lots of it). Tina asked me if it would be okay to curl some pieces of hair, and explained what products she was adding to my hair and DID NOT become an annoying salesperson by pressuring me to purchase any products (Thank you Tina!!! I cannot stand pushy people). I highly recommend Velintina's Salon and will keep coming back here for future beauty services :)

0.description: Based on yelp reviews, I decided to go in for a trim with Gabby. I think she did a fantastic job and just went back a week ago to get a second hair cut and color. This time I cut off about 5-6 inches! Huge chop! I have naturally curly hair and Gabby knew exactly what to do with it! She is now my permanent hair stylist! 5 out of 5 for Gabby!

5.description: I found this place on yelp and live in the area, I have no idea why I haven't been going here my entire life. My hair is curly and so I usually just get it cut and then go home and style it the way I want. Gabriela first told me that she would dry cut my hair because it's curly. I was curious, but hey she's the pro. She shampooed it and then blow dried it. I've had others try to blow dry my hair and  usually I just leave with a frizzy mess.  After Gabriela blow dried my hair, my hair had never looked better. She cut it and then flat ironed it. I have NEVER left a salon without always feeling like I have to go home and do my hair the way I want. I left Gabriela on CLOUD NINE. If I could I would go here every morning before work so she could style my hair. LOVE. LOVE. LOVE.

11.description: I was referred to this establishment by a friend of mine, whose hair always looks WONDERFUL. So I am the PICKY-est person when it comes to someone cutting my hair. It doesn't grow fast, so when I get a cut...it's gonna last more than a few months! I also have very fine hair and not a lot of it (thanks to my three kids) so going to the salon has not been a favorite thing to lately.I was referred to Evelia. I really really like her. She gave an awesome cut and a great foil highlights. The establishment is not top of the line by any means...but it is very clean and they do the best they can with the space. They offer you coffee or tea when coming in, and have a water jug thingy for water while you wait. They also have a nice candy assortment in a bowl to munch on while you wait. Evelia also does great eyebrown and stash waxing. They use all the "extras" to make the experience as painless as possible. It's the first place I don't come out flaming red with, after a wax. My three daughters now go here. My one daughter who has curly hair will only have her touch her hair from now on, because she has done such a good job cutting and shaping it. It's the first time in her LIFE, she actually had a style with her "curly" hair. One of my daughters has also been seen by Tina (who is co owner with Evelia) and she did a really nice cut on my one daughter too. On the weekends they have other people come like a girl named Kim who seemed really good too. Velintinas also has an older italian barber that does all the men's hair. His chair is always swamped too!Over all, great place. I will definetly follow Evelia, because she is great! My mom goes there now, and really likes her. She is very down to earth, holds a good conversation, and very pleasent to be with.

8.description: I wanted to go somewhere local due to time restraints. I think I found a place for future hair cuts/color. I have driven past Velintina's so many times and when I read the reviews on Yelp, I decided to give it a try.Velentina's is tiny but the service was wonderful. The prices are not too bad either. They have promotions for weekday services such as free cut with color. Check before you go.

4.description: Having moved to the city for my 1st time 3yrs ago, I wanted to be a part of the Local Goodness that people have talked about for years, but suburbanization has . I have been thorugh a dozen stylists in my lifetime.......And have PAID UP for those expensive salons. This place is PURE LOCAL GOODNESS defined.Thurs-Sat you can get a REAL BARBER cut from a 75yr old Italian guy that still uses a straight razor.($15) No appointment req'd or taken!It doesn't stop there, my wife goes there as well for her haircuts, and has always been happy. When we move, THIS will be something we miss terribly. Its just something I love to say, I walk to my corner and get a haircut from a real barber! Don't let the simple exterior fool you, this is a full blown salon ready for whatever you need done! Cut, color, product sales, waxing...etc...

14.description: I think I've been going to Velintina's for a little over a year now.  I get constant compliments on my hair... which I love, of course!  Evelia is my stylist and she's great.  Like any good stylist... she asks what you like and listens.  This is a small place, but as long as your hair looks fabulous... who cares!  I've done Mario Tricoci and Charles Ifergan and paid big bucks to get a so-so look.  Evelia does a great job and is much more convenient for me!

7.description: Purchased a living social deal for a haircut, so tried it out.My hairstylist was Gaby and she did such a great job! I drive out all the way near O'hare to have her cut my hair, she does such a wonderful job. I have people at my work tell me I have the best hair :-) Very nice!

58.description: Business must be great for you guys. In fact, it must be so good that you can freely decline service. I came in earlier today 11pm, one hour before you close. I wasn't coming for a smoke or a meal (not that it should matter anyway). I actually just wanted a cup of tea. Your host told me, "We've actually stopped seating."Here's the deal. If you stop seating an hour before you close, then just make your business hours open til 11pm. Anyway, thanks for wasting my time driving to get to you only to be turned away. Maybe next time... lol, or not.

56.description: Great Food, Great Service, and Good Ambience! The waitstaff was very friendly, courteous, knowledgeable.... Everyone in my party of 5 enjoyed it!!! Will Return

29.description: ok so i'm not a big fan of smoking , and this was my first time trying hookah , it actually wasn't half bad , it was nice , definitely something you do in moderation tho. all in all had a great time .

42.description: Really good food. Firecracker shrimp are MATHEMATICAL. Really really lovely, chill, clean atmosphere. However, the hookah is so so so so terrible. I think there's like one guy who can do the packing right but everyone else must be terrible because a hookah between two people smoking leisurely lasted a grand total of 15 minutes. They need to hire people who know how to handle their hookah; I've given Hubble chance after chance to see if maybe it was a one time thing but every single time the hookah just does not last.To sum up, Hubble is really good as a cafe and terrible at being a hookah bar.

23.description: First time here and I loved it! From the ambience to the service. We will definitely be back!

47.description: Hubble is the best place to hookah and relax with friends! They have a great selection of drinks, food, and hookah. I go to Hubble often and have not once had a bad experience. Service is always friendly and attentive even when it's packed on a Friday/Saturday night. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to hookah and grab a drink!

8.description: I'm an out of town visitor from Arizona and I wasn't sure what to expect. The place is very nice looking and has a good atmosphere. The brand of sheesh they carry, starbuzz, is one I'm familiar with and it's pretty decent. The coals however are not the greatest. They use quick lights and I personally don't enjoy them. The hookah comes out ready to smoke but does not come out with tongs. The servers don't come around often enough to move the coals but will do so upon request. Overall the smoke was decent once I got the server to rotate the coals for me. Overall it was Okay.

31.description: Inside is nice, food is good, but the service is absolutely terrible. I thought the problem was that I went on a busy night, but even being the only group in the lounge it took forever to get someone to even come to get our order. They took almost 30 min to make the hookah. Also if you are a hookah fanatic you will not enjoy the cheap quality of their equipment. Hookahs are absolutely filthy and you pay 15 for a tiny head. Way overpriced. Service is rude and they take forever to get anything done. If you're in the mood for a bite and spend some cash I recommend, but if you know anything about hookah you should avoid at all costs. Terrible experience.

34.description: Awesome spot! Been coming here  for as long as I can remember. The dude with that handles the phone actually knows us. Haha . The drinks are good and also the hookah. Great ambience of the place!

16.description: Great drinks, good service and good hookah. They get real crowded on Friday and Saturday and it's not the best heated place, but other than that things are great! Food is good and the drinks (non alcoholic, haven't gotten around to trying the alcoholic beverages) are so delicious! Must get one of their tasty smoothies or lattes.

13.description: Love the vibe of this hooka Bar! So relaxing ! The food is awesome ,try the chicken artichoke sandwich !!mmm!! My favorite tea is the roasted almond with real almonds in it , so good ! Matt has been there for years he's so sweet he knows what you want and gets you rolling  Ralph is like family also appreciates his customers and is very accommodating .. Hookah are great my fav is white peach  /mint of course . I'm sure Matt knows who I am by now! Been going here for years it's like my place !

11.description: In a not so appealing location this hookah spot blew me away. The inside is so nice, beautifully designed with a romantic feel. Finally a hookah spot that has a full bar not BYOB. There are a lot of places like this in other states but not that many in Chicago. The first thing you notice when you walk in is that this place is not smoky like many other hookah places, its well vented which is great.  I didn't try the food but heard its great. This spot has it all food, drinks, teas, and hookah which all mesh into my kinda night!

39.description: So the first 5 times went here the service was good, the appetizers where decent , it was clean and well priced.. But lately whenever iv gone they've been extremely rude and would ignore us at the door. (Even when they weren't busy) I thought it was just me but Then started hearing my friends having the same complaints.. They've basically become way to cocky and I'm all about costumer service. Found a better hooka place near by just as good so never going here again.

37.description: I'm only giving 3 stars because the food and drinks were good. I made reservations last Saturday for me and a friend. We arrived about 15 minutes early and were seated right away and handed menus....we didn't see our waiter again for another 15 minutes! When he finally came around I ordered the "Sublime" BEST DRINK EVER! And "Queen of Sex" Hookah, which took another 10+ minutes to arrive at our table. Since this was our first time trying hookah we were clueless, I asked the waiter what to do and although it's pretty simple a quick demonstration would have been nice. The food was good, the hookah was ok but the service gets a big fat "F"! I will defiantly try hookah again.....just not at this place!

0.description: Great food, great hookah. What more do you want? I have always had a good time while coming here. It's not as uptight as other hookah places.

38.description: Ordered the chai tea latté and the blue mist flavored hookah and was very pleased with the flavor and the ambience of the place very chill and the host and bartenders are very accommodating first time in the Chicago area and it's a very chill place to go and blow off some steam or just hang out and chat.

51.description: The food is awesome here! I had the chicken sandwich and my hubby had the beef kabob. Both were amazing! The alcoholic drinks and coffees/teas were really good too!For hookah we had 2 really great flavors - Queen of Sex (think Fruity Pebbles) and Chocolate Mint. Both were SO good!!The staff was amazing. We asked for recommendations and were never lead astray nor made to feel silly for asking. HIGHLY recommend this place!

27.description: Absolutely love this place! The staff is very friendly and easy to get along with. The hookah is awesome and it's a great location to waste the night away with friends or that special someone. The atmosphere is relaxed and clean. I always love the music they play (they must play off of a playlist because there's a different genre every night). The food, while the variety is sort of lacking, is absolutely INCREDIBLE. My only grievance is that it's expensive, but not unreasonably so. Just expensive for a cashier making minimum wage. As far as all these negative reviews go: take them with a grain of salt. Trust me. Provided you're not being a bag of anuses, the staff will take care of you.

32.description: Hubble is awesome. Watching Blackhawks hockey at Hubble is always a treat. Where else in this city can you drink Knob Creek, watch the game, get goods eats, and smoke some Starbuzz?

54.description: Good food and hookah...nice environment..

48.description: Absolutely horrible customer service! I'm typically very lenient with servers, because it's understandable everyone has a bad day once in a while.This guy was so condescending to me and my friends. I do know how to take sarcasm but this dude spoke like a total a-hole!

44.description: We took a cab here the Weds before Thanksgiving. Our first mistake was not making a reservation, but after waiting about 20-30 mins, we were lucky to nab the last available table before they stopped seating. My sister wanted to try a new hookah flavor. (We usually stick to strawberry, my fav.) We ordered the chocolate strawberry. It was not good. Our waitress was kind enough to let us switch it out, since we let her know right away. Food was delicious. Had the falafel sandwich, & for a few $ more, substituted a green salad in place the fries. Drinks were good, but a bit pricey for this area. Our second mistake was not booking the cab back right away. Cabs are not plentiful in this neighborhood.  Wait times were 45 mins due to the holiday. The manager was super helpful, & tried to call on our behalf when we weren't having any luck. They were closing, but thankfully, he didn't put us out in the cold! Will be back with a reservation, & a ride home booked next time!

24.description: They only take reservations on the weekend and I called and called. No answer and the mail box was full. Decided to go in person, place was empty and they wouldn't take my reservation. Answer the phone!!!

7.description: By far the best hookah lounge I have been to. Best looking, best atmosphere, great food, great drinks and the best staff. Definitely worth the visit and repeating. Definitely check this place out.

49.description: Don't come during the week days because it's terrible service. We waited an hr for them to even touch and change our coal. Once they finally changed the coal the hooka wasn't good anymore.  We also had to ask several time times for them I refill our drinks.

40.description: Pretty good hookah, helpful staff, good tables. The waiting staff doesn't come around that often, but they bring the hookah out quick. The drinks are a bit inconsistent with alcohol content. Overall good ambiance and music.

53.description: What a great place! Really friendly staff, huge hookah selection, and a full menu/bar?! WHAAAAT.Will definitely make the trip to this hookah bar again, so worth it.Also, make a reservation if you're going to be coming on a Friday/Saturday night.

30.description: I bought my own hookah, don't need to go to this unpleasant, expensive place with rude staff.

46.description: This place is excellent. The service was excellent. The hookah was excellent. The food was excellent. The ambience and cleanliness was excellent. I had absolutely no complaints. I'll continue to be a customer here and hope nothing changes.

1.description: Here is what you will expect at this place:1. Plenty of alcohol2. Good service3. Menu options4. Very decent hookah5. Limited street parking 6. Delicious dessert 7. Comfortable booths and tables8. Clean establishment I enjoyed coming here. It was a positive experience and I hope to come back soon. It's different than other hookah places but I actually prefer this to other locations. The prices are also very reasonable.

55.description: Love this place! The decor, the ambiance, the servers, the deserts. I loved it all! It was my first time here a few weeks ago. We didn't make reservations, but it worked out. We ended up going to dinner elsewhere and came back later that night. The staff was very nice and friendly. Since we had already had dinner elsewhere, we decided to order a dessert. It was delicious! I can't wait to come back and taste the food. One funny thing that happened was that, as a staff member was changing the coal on one of our hookahs, we accidentally dropped it on my Bf, lol. Nothing happened, but the guy was so embarrassed and apologetic. No harm done we said. Well, when we ordered another round of a Hookah, the manager informed us that it was on the house and again apologized for the earlier incident. I plan on going back in a few weeks to try the whole experience.

9.description: Five stars for the hookah and the ambience, which is always lively despite the somewhat removed location. All the flavors I have had are delicious and the workers are good about refilling the coals. Four stars because, generally, the service isn't that great. I have come here multiple times and yet once I was not allowed in because my ID was two weeks expired. Considering that I am 21 years old, that seemed ridiculous to me. I understand it could be a liability to the place, but I showed a college ID and other proof of identification (my debit card and work ID) to no avail. The employees seem to take themselves too seriously.Still, the pros definitely outweigh the cons. They also allow 3 people to a hookah, which is great after experiencing the pain of places that only allow 2 to a hookah. Don't let the location deter you, stop by!

26.description: In a not so appealing location this hookah spot blew me away. The inside is so nice, beautifully designed with a romantic feel. Finally a hookah spot that has a full bar not BYOB. There are a lot of places like this in other states but not that many in Chicago. The first thing you notice when you walk in is that this place is not smoky like many other hookah places, its well vented which is great.  I didn't try the food but heard its great. This spot has it all food, drinks, teas, and hookah which all mesh into my kinda night!

25.description: This place was awesome. We found parking right across the street. We were seated by a kind gentlemen and after thorough discussion, decided an the raspberry flavor. Man, was it smooth. We were hoping it wouldn't be something too rough and we got exactly what we wanted. I also ordered some chamomile tea. They give out these cute packets of raw sugar with the tea and a little pack of honey. It was awesome. I love tea. Tea + good hookah = happy me.

12.description: I have been to this location about 4 or 5 times. The first time i loved it... that was before I understood anything about hookah. I was 18 the first time I went for my and my best friends 18th Birthday. The staff was kind but the hookah tasted burnt. There was no flavor. I didn't fully understand how hookah worked then. I then went for a second time and got a better understanding. The food was wonderful. A few later later I went my boyfriend on our second date. Food was alright... the shisha list was a joke and they were out of just about everything. The hookahs weren't washed really and they don't keep hookahs separate so if you wanted mint and the hookah had double apple in it before guess what your smoking? That's right it all tastes like double apple. That''s if your lucky. When we went it just tasted like flavorless smoke. So much different stuff in the base i would imagine. As i said the food was good but its so dark in there you can't see anything when the smoke gets bad. The staff was nice but the shisha selection is poor. Starbuzz is not idea for hookah owners. The staff was great, the food was great but honestly that was about it. The smoking experience wasn't at all what I expected it to be. The price per hookah is out outrageous but they do allow some sharing.I would rather go to Ugly Hookah or Prince Hookah. Or well, just stick to smoking at home and inviting friends to come here. Pros: Good Food, Wonderful Staff, Special Treat for birthdays, nice atmosphere, decent music, sharing hookahsCons: Barely washed hookahs, poor selection in shisha, dim lighting, loud music, overcrowded, expensive hookahs, expensive night outEDIT: Side note, for those who like natural coals vs quick lights this is not this place for you. They are good about switching out the coals often but if you are one for natural coals they don't have it. Or they didn't last time I was there.

59.description: The manager, the one whom which his stance seems homosexual, embarrassed me and my friend by not allowing my friend inside the hookah bar due to the fact he didn't have an ID ( he had his license/state taken away due to court). so we presented him a ticket to prove he's the age of 18. Not only does your manager know that we're good customers/tippers, but he made me drive from Chicago to Des-Plaines in search of a ID and we drove back to sadly inform him we couldn't find one. He had the audacity to say "you made a valid effort" but still declined us to enter Hubble Hookah, and then proceeded to charge us full price for three hookahs, yet there was only two people present, including myself. So not only did your manager deny us the privilege to enter your hookah bar, but he also charged a friend of mine that was waiting inside for us $45 for three hookahs that he didn't even use. I think it would be appropriate that you, as the owner, is aware of the fact that you have rude, parsimonious, impolite staff members. I have been a loyal customer to your hookah bar for quite some time, but besides the fact, I have now decided to spend my time and money at a more polite, comfortable, hassle-free hookah bar. Avoid.

21.description: I have been to this hookah cafe a few times in the past. I hadn't been here in several months, but a friend of mine was visiting me from out of the country and I thought it would be a nice way to spend a Sunday night. Normally, Hubble seems like a nice break from the more traditional old man Arabic hookah lounges. The interior is beautifully decorated and modern. It is a younger crowd and there are good appetizers, although the hookah is not always the best. Sometimes the flavors taste like they are mixed. Perhaps they do not clean the hookahs. You cannot serve double apple in the same hookahs that mint flavors have been smoked out of, but perhaps they just do not understand. All the same, my issue comes with the way customers are treated. I walked in on a Sunday night. It was somewhat crowded, but there were many free tables and spots at the bar. There were a group of girls waiting to be seated. A man came who claimed to be the manager and owner. I thought he was going to seat me and I reminded him that the girls were there before me. He told me he knew and said it would be a 25 minute wait. I asked if I could sit at the bar. I assumed perhaps all the empty tables were reserved. He told me that the problem isn't that there aren't tables, but that they are low on servers. It was a cold night and I didn't feel like driving anywhere else so I decided to wait. Then another group of people came in and as customers were leaving and arriving, we kept having to move away from the entrance. I asked the man if we could just be seated. Although they were low on servers, the polite thing to do would have been to seat all the customers so we could at least wait sitting down without having to stay by the door and be bumped into. Not only was this a rude gesture to customers by this man who claims to be the owner, but its also a fire hazard to have so many people waiting by the entrance. Keep in mind, there were about 5 empty tables and seats at the bar. Even as people left some of the tables and they cleaned them off, they still didn't proceed to seat anybody including the people who were there before me. I asked the man why. Then he proceeded to tell me that if I didn't want to wait I could leave. He also reminded me that there was a party ahead of me. This really got me mad because I wasn't being asked to be seated before them and as a matter of fact, I was even polite enough to initially tell him that the girls had come in before me when he first approached me and said it would be a 25 minute wait. I proceeded to tell another waitress it was ridiculous that they are not seating customers when there are plenty of tables and seats at the bar. I informed her I would write a review on yelp and she ignored me. I have never been treated so rudely in my life. I am a 26 year old woman and I have smoked hookah at all the cafes in Chicago. Not to mention during my many travels in Lebanon and Turkey. I think I will stick to the more traditional cafes like Ugly Hookah, Ali Baba, and Rotana. What happened tonight was the dumbest thing! Even though they were busy and low on servers, I think the customers would have rather waited at a table for 25 minutes than standing up by the entrance being bumped into by customers who were leaving and arriving. This is no way to run a business and its not nice to treat a customer badly who is planning on spending money by telling them they can leave if they like. He really showed me that my business was not appreciated tonight.

17.description: Love this place! First of all, it's easy to get to and they have tons of street parking. Second of all, it's probably the nicest hookah lounge I've ever been to-- and it's so reasonably priced. Granted your bills can become expensive (because they have hookah, food, AND alcohol!) but everything's per unit price is very low.The only thing I hate is that when you make reservations you get weird tables (by open windows, never do you get a booth, etc). If you're making a reservation I feel like you should be treated better than someone walking in from the street, not vis versa (or maybe give everyone an equal shot at the tables ;). Try their spinach/artichoke dip. It's amazing!

10.description: This place is fantastic for first timers. It's very clean and the ambiance is great! I LOVE their firecracker shrimp! Their hookahs are fine, but we did have to ask multiple times for a charcoal change. This place is good for dates ;)

5.description: I've been here twice and both times I have enjoyed the hookah and drinks, I haven't tried their food yet. The service is good and the atmosphere is great too. I would definitely go back.

3.description: Tonight was my first night at Hubble, so theres was some ups and some downs(sorry to say).Pros: - The food was surprisingly good.- The hookah was decently good as well.Cons:- Our waitress was somewhat nice but noticeably trying not to bitch at me and my friends. Also she wasn't paying attention alot to us when we wanted to order or change coals or ask for the check. We had to wait like 20-30 mins to for her to come to our table.- I ordered a vodka redbull, and it was way too much vodka. Probably next time will get a redbull.- The place to totally understaff. They should at least have 3-4 servers in the main room and an actual bartender at the bar.- Lastly, the hostress wasnt too happy being there and then we were trying to decide to get another head, she said "okay" then left. I work as a bartender and server, and I understand that you can't get to everyone at the same time however, i just had a feeling that the waitress didnt care to tend to me and my friends, however she had paid more attention to tables of men. So sadly we had to give her $5 tip on a $50 bill. I would like to visit Hubble again but i definitely don't want the same waitress again. And for sure the manager or owner should pay attention to some of the severs and perhaps hire a enthusiastic, cheerful, and responsible staff.

35.description: I've been going to this place since it first opened a few years back. Really love the interior design, the service is good and the food is great. The kifta sandwich with pita chips is phenomenal.

19.description: I've been coming here for the past 4-5 years and not once have I've been disappointed. Hookah is so clean, and full of flavors. Service was attentive and kind. Our host/server MATT was so cool and made us feel welcomed. Food is AWESOME. Drinks are also pretty amazing. Overall experience is great. Highly recommend! And if your server happens to be Matt, give him a high-five!

28.description: Love this place! First of all, it's easy to get to and they have tons of street parking. Second of all, it's probably the nicest hookah lounge I've ever been to-- and it's so reasonably priced. Granted your bills can become expensive (because they have hookah, food, AND alcohol!) but everything's per unit price is very low.The only thing I hate is that when you make reservations you get weird tables (by open windows, never do you get a booth, etc). If you're making a reservation I feel like you should be treated better than someone walking in from the street, not vis versa (or maybe give everyone an equal shot at the tables ;). Try their spinach/artichoke dip. It's amazing!

45.description: Great place for hookah! I would recommend their strawberry banana smoothie, their spinach/artichoke dip, and the blue mist hookah flavor! They're pretty reasonable. Service is good. On Fridays/Saturdays, make sure to make reservations because it gets very crowded! The service is great too!

33.description: We had our reservations at 9:30pm. We literally had to wait for more than 15 minutes to be seated. It's not like there were ppl in front of us. There was NOONE in front of us, and plenty of open tables! The workers there would pass by and wouldn't even say "I will be with you guys shortly", nothing. I had to personally go up to the bar and ask them if we can be seated. But other than that, our service at the table was pretty good.

43.description: Hands down the best hookah lounge I have ever been to, their hookahs are great, and the food is almost to die for! I recommend getting their special mix of Pineapple Express. Service is great and they don't let underage people in which is awesome.

2.description: The food is great, which is huge plus. I would of been in awe with this place but the service was horrific.  I saw a group leave with out paying and a couple ready to do the same.  We all had the same waitress and would of did the same but she decided to come to are table twice just for the check. She had onky been to our table twice before that, first to get our order, second to ring it, and twice for the money.  The service here was super bad, but the ambience is cool and comfortable.  It was a Friday night so I will give them one more chance.  The food was fatastic!

18.description: good place to hang out and catch up with friends ! lost a few stars because they use instant light charcoals and for a $16 dollar hookah it's expensive . the inside is like restaurant style seating and no music playing :( it has the potential to be a great place if they played more music and better coals . But the servers a very nice ! The service was great !

41.description: None of the people in my party were thrilled with our experience. It was extremely overpriced. Something seemed wrong with our hookahs too. One joked that we'd get more success putting cigarettes on a skillet and breathing the fumes. We all got headaches (and I'm the only nonsmoker). The flavor was gone immediately. The strawberry tea was nice. The atmosphere was nothing special. Service was very lacking. We had to hound her for the check and it took more than 20 minutes for her to bring it to the table. She screwed up big time on splitting the check three ways. Definitely won't return.

52.description: this place pricey but its very cute for dates and for just a simple night out .. the food is amazing, very tasty and the service is great.

50.description: I haven't been to a hookah bar in years, mainly because whenever I start to look them up I see terrible reviews. That isn't the case for Hubble and I got to experience why first hand last night. The food is fantastic, the drink menu has something for everyone, there are tons of selections for hookah and the service is friendly. They also had great music playing- it was current stuff, but not radio pop. Very chill. Also- there's plenty of FREE street parking (I forgot that even existed!). My only criticisms would be the swarms of late-teens that came in and that there is only one bathroom for each gender so you may need to wait. Get the spinach artichoke dip with pita chips- amazing! We tried the blue mist hookah, as was suggested by our server. It was smooth and tasty.GREAT place for a date- I'll definitely be back to try them again!

4.description: What an amazing spot! I usually don't come to this area, but my friend and I decided to meet in the middle and she's been there before.  First of all, it's a cozy hookah place, great atmosphere, dim lights, decorations and lovely vibe.  They serve hookah, alcohol and food! I guess they were there before all the laws were made about not being able to smoke anywhere there is food.  too bad.I haven't tried their food yet but the hookah and drinks were great!  it's a bit far from me but I am always driving to the city, so driving there isn't too bad.

6.description: This place is so classy! Amazing atmosphere! The tables are spacious giving room for more hookahs than you need and more food than you can eat. They have a bar, a full menu, and a wide assortment of hookah flavors to smoke.Perfect place for date night and is just extremely well done. Loved every bit of it!Brownie Parfait is highly recommended.

22.description: Haven't been back to this place for 4 months because the hookah was Burt in 20 minutes ..... Walked in Saturday night sat down ordered a hookah. 20 minutes later it came out and the taste was Burt within 30 minutes.  Took a very long time to get coals after I  asked the guy 2 times to get me some. It even took 10 minutes to get the check they weren't busy at all guess they are just slow with everything.  They put a very small amount of tobacco in the head I know this because I lifted the foil and it was all stuck to the top burt. Not worth $16 at all and they never checked on the table to see if we wanted to order food or drinks. Very disappointed now I know why I haven't gone back for so long.

15.description: This place is heaven for Hookah Smokers and foodies. Five of us were visiting Chicago from Memphis and we found this place for Hookah. It is simply awesome, they have multiple selection of flavors and the manager Ralph and his sister Angie are very cooperative to help you select the flavors. Ralph actually got boxes of flavors to our table to show us how it smells and if it meets our needs.The food is amazing as well. I am vegetarian and we got a lot of vegetarian options to help us with our dinner. They also have a wide selection of desserts and alcohol. We ended up going to this place 2 times on consecutive days. Everyone should must visit this place if  they are in Chicago or traveling there.

57.description: Great food, good hookah.

20.description: What an amazing spot! I usually don't come to this area, but my friend and I decided to meet in the middle and she's been there before.  First of all, it's a cozy hookah place, great atmosphere, dim lights, decorations and lovely vibe.  They serve hookah, alcohol and food! I guess they were there before all the laws were made about not being able to smoke anywhere there is food.  too bad.I haven't tried their food yet but the hookah and drinks were great!  it's a bit far from me but I am always driving to the city, so driving there isn't too bad.

36.description: Great drinks, good service and good hookah. They get real crowded on Friday and Saturday and it's not the best heated place, but other than that things are great! Food is good and the drinks (non alcoholic, haven't gotten around to trying the alcoholic beverages) are so delicious! Must get one of their tasty smoothies or lattes.

14.description: Just one awesome place.Great foodGreat people Hookah is good The customer service is great they're always nice The drinks are really good, the alcoholic drinks are great, the tea coffee drinks are really good too The owner is usually there making sure everything runs smooth really shows he cares about the business and his customers. The place looks really good inside they did a remodel a while back so bathrooms got upgraded and something's in the front which really upscales itJust a really good place to bring friends and hangout , have diner , have some drinks , coffee, and of course hookah Also I've called a bunch of times to just order food and pick up on my way home if I'm in a rush. Food always tastes great and fresh doesn't taste like they just microwaved something and put it on a plate. Overall awesome place always come here and is always my first choice because I trust that everything will be on point.
