1.description: Horrible customer service and there is barely any inventory at all.

2.description: great place to shop. Piotr actually knows what he is talking about. and did not try to push me into stuff I did not want.

0.description: Tony the manager is awesome. . Very helpful. . It's also a busy location,  but,  he's patient and gets to you as quick add possible.  This is definitely my new favorite store :)

28.description: This place actually deserves NO stars.  When I go to a restaurant with my wife, I don't appreciate when the host, owner or manager or whatever that greaseball is, staring at and trying to peek down my wifes shirt.  So anyways to continue, the waitress comes to the table and she asks us what we want to order.  I respond to her with 'If the owner wasn't so busy trying to sneak a peek at my wifes breasts, I'd be reading a menu instead of trying to guess what's on the menu".  He never gave us menus, he just seated us.  She then apologized and brought us menus and we ordered our Sunday morning breakfast.  We ordered coffee or as I like to call it, black colored water.  The coffee sucked. Our order comes and I really appreciate when a restaurant tries to give you salmonella through their undercooked omelette's.   Once I saw the omelette's were rare I just asked for my check and did not eat a bite.  We paid and left and went to our regular Sunday breakfast joint.

1.description: Another Yelp brunch find that we enjoyed. We were greeted and seated immediately. The place was fairly busy but service was attentive and food came out fast. My husband gave the coffee a B+ which is huge because he typically hates diner coffee. I had a scramble which was delicious and hubby had the meat skillet which he also enjoyed. Pancakes were delicious as well! The only thing I didn't like was the chocolate milk - not a deal breaker for us. We'll be back.

9.description: This place is pretty good! After church on a Sunday me & the hubby went to go eat some grub. This place is not too far away from the church & not too far away from where we live so we decided to go here. I had the minced eggs and ham & tried the cream of chicken soup. It was all pretty tasty. My hubby had a burger that had bbq sauce, cheddar bacon kinda thing & he said, I quote "it was fire!". He loves his burgers and is very picky about them so that says a lot. The service was awesome, our waitress was so kind and very attentive. Food service was quick & the best thing, we did not have to wait to be seated, as its usually at least 15-30 min wait everywhere else on a Sunday. I think we found our regular Sunday spot!

29.description: This is an all American diner. They have breakfast,lunch and dinner specials. It is a down to earth place. They serve alot of familys and locals. They seem to have a very loyal customer base. I believe they were recently remodeled. There is a great city park across the street that's a good place to take a stroll before or after your meal here.

23.description: I had to go with four stars, because I am indeed ... a fan. I have been here more times than I can count. I somehow forgot to write a review, so of course I am rectifying this oversight now.A's is not a fancy place. It is not a gourmet restaurant or a trendy spot. What I like about it is that it is a good, traditional neighborhood family restaurant. The food is decent and the service has ALWAYS been friendly and attentive.Mom and I stop here for "brunch" every time we drop our dog off at the groomers. Mom really loves the crepes here. She gets the ones with Strawberries. The portions are huge and she always ends up taking some home. She has it down to a science. Take the crepes, not the strawberries or it will get too soft. She has no desire to try anything else and comes away very happy. I'm more flexible and what I order depends on my mood. Yesterday it was a BLT Club sandwich with home made chips on the side. It came with a bowl of minestrone soup. It was all good. Was it the best I have ever had? No, but it was tasty and filling. Drinks are always refilled and the coffee topped off. We are never rushed and it is a great place to be able to eat and converse as well. Next time the dog needs a haircut, we will be back.

5.description: I paid $14.00 for 3 crepes and a side of sausage. Crepes were the WORST I have ever had. I had a coworker try them as well and she agreed with me...the crepes were salty. When I called to inform the restaurant all the man would do is argue with me. Worst experience ever and they charge you extra for carry out! Never go here again. I advise you not to as well!!

25.description: Not bad. Not fantastic. Just aaaight.  It's always a challenge to find good neighborhood spots - we don't always feel like driving 20-30 minutes for a quick meal - so that's how we ended up here.  The fiance enjoyed his Mediterranean scramble with pancakes and fruit, but I had the mediocre oatmeal with bananas and brown sugar.  Yeah, I know - why bother eating out if I'm going to eat oatmeal right?  Anyway, the scramble was very flavorful and moist- definitely something to try.  The coffee was so-so.  The staff was a tad obnoxious and loud and the waitresses were just flirting with the cooks the whole time, but still managed to refill our coffee at least once.The only thing that really irked us is that we were double charged on our credit card because of the "new system" they have.  Shouldn't "new" equal "better"? Anyway, it was decent, but the credit card incident will probably prevent us from returning again.

12.description: I'm very hungry, received the recommendation from YELP. Had my mouth watering for pancakes, bacon,  eggs I called too place my order for delivery (the website states will deliver). The lady answers the phone said no delivery ever. She said the website must be very old over 7 years.  Humm I guess the menu haven't been updated in 7 years either!!!!! Not good for bussiness.

21.description: Great food here. Went several times for lunch with coworkers and was impresses every time. Free soup with almost everything, and I loved it even if I didn't like that kind of soup. Great flavor all around, free warn bread, great fries, salads, omelets, and sandwiches. Only downside is the horrid 90's music, but it's fun reminiscing about how much we likes those songs in middle school. Highly recommended.

16.description: I had to go with four stars, because I am indeed ... a fan. I have been here more times than I can count. I somehow forgot to write a review, so of course I am rectifying this oversight now.A's is not a fancy place. It is not a gourmet restaurant or a trendy spot. What I like about it is that it is a good, traditional neighborhood family restaurant. The food is decent and the service has ALWAYS been friendly and attentive.Mom and I stop here for "brunch" every time we drop our dog off at the groomers. Mom really loves the crepes here. She gets the ones with Strawberries. The portions are huge and she always ends up taking some home. She has it down to a science. Take the crepes, not the strawberries or it will get too soft. She has no desire to try anything else and comes away very happy. I'm more flexible and what I order depends on my mood. Yesterday it was a BLT Club sandwich with home made chips on the side. It came with a bowl of minestrone soup. It was all good. Was it the best I have ever had? No, but it was tasty and filling. Drinks are always refilled and the coffee topped off. We are never rushed and it is a great place to be able to eat and converse as well. Next time the dog needs a haircut, we will be back.

17.description: The A's Restaurant is a great no frills diner. Just good breakfast food at a reasonable price with service that is really friendly.  We came in on a Saturday mid-morning looking for pancakes in the area and settled for this place.  Doesn't seem like that much outside and really old school - which could be good or bad in this neighborhood. We came in and were seated immediately by the owner and waiting on promptly.  Ordered eggs, buttermilk pancakes, sausage, and coffee.  All of it was really good and came to our table really fast.  If you're around Irving park or Portage park and want breakfast, this is a sure bet.

10.description: This is a great breakfast place. I recommend the spinach-feta omelette! I appreciate how many choices there are for the breakfast sides - different kinds of bread, fruit, hash browns, even fresh tomato slices. We arrived with a family group, lots of different tastes and special requests, and had great service. Everyone had exactly what they wanted, including the kids. Our server was really sweet and friendly. You'd never notice this place, it's not at all trendy, but it deserves its loyal following!

11.description: I just had a heavenly chicken club sandwich with fresh avocado and homemade potato chips - so much food that I have enough for tonight's dinner. Thick slices of white meat chicken were tender and moist, the bacon was crispy but not greasy, the lettuce and tomato straight-from-the-garden yummy. It also came with fresh vegetable soup that had little broccoli florets and spinach. What a treat!The server was friendly and observant without being intrusive. I'm looking forward to having lunch there again:)

26.description: Greek owners but not necessarily a Greek restaurant. They have Greek food but my family and I come for the breakfast (maybe lunch now and again). Family owned biz. The wife, daughter, and son are super friendly and we love chatting it up with them.  However, the old man is a bit of a crab.  Not sure what his issue is. Guy doesn't say a word to you but took the time to chastise my wife when our kids drew on the table a bit with their crayons (side note: the crayons we bring are washable. A little water on a napkin, wipe, and the table is good as new). Stay away from the old man but come for the skillets, pancakes, skirt steak & eggs, ham off the bone, friendly wait staff, and pleasant atmosphere. Also, very clean!  Wish this place was a little more kid friendly. They don't have kiddie cups or kiddie place-mats like some other places (e.g., Golden Nugget). Parking in the rear of the restaurant is limited but plenty of neighborhood parking.  Interesting Side Note: the men's urinal is usually filled with ice. Not sure  the purpose of that but don't let that stop you from visiting.

27.description: I didn't realize how much I missed a plain old family type restaurant and pancake house until I got taken to A's for lunch one day.  When I looked at the menu filled with turkey club sandwiches, pancakes and a list of specials like pork chops and meatloaf, I felt positively nostalgic.I' ve been there three times in the last three weeks and each time I've been happy with what I've ordered, and the consistently helpful waitresses.  This isn't a fancy place, it isn't upscale, it doesn't have trendy decor, clever names for the dishes, or waitstaff who are only working there until they get their next part.  It's just plain old American coffee shop food at an average price.  Go expecting more and you'll be disappointed.  Go for a sandwich, the occasional supper, pancakes on Sunday morning and you'll be fine.

0.description: While A's serves your basic breakfast favorites, they have done gems. There are plenty of omelette options that have avocado - one of my favorite fruits. The pancakes are seriously fluffy, though not much more remarkable. I need the recipe for however they marinate their skirt steak. It's my absolute favorite breakfast and it's done exceptionally well here. I'd live if they had corn tortillas, but they only have flour and you can substitute it instead of toast, English muffin, or pillowy pancakes. The food is predictable in a good way, however the service here is top notch! I can't say enough good things about the servers. My coffee is full, they greet you with a smile, and anything you want is yours. (Within reason) Make no mistake, this is a family owned neighborhood joint. You won't find flights of bacon or fair trade local roasted coffee. You will absolutely find perfectly done eggs, a cheese stuffed omelette, and giant burritos. There is a small shared lot off of the alley on the north side of the building. It's a little tight, but manageable.

20.description: I just went here the other day on a whim and boy am I glad. I had the french toast with pecans and caramel. I usually don't have a sweet tooth, but this was delicious! I highly recommend it. My friend had a sirloin steak skillet, which looked delicious. I also noticed that the place was VERY clean and that the servers were pleasant.Prices are average...everything is about $7-10 range and the plates are more like platters. They are freakin' HUGE.  I just wish I knew about this place when I was going to Wright college.

19.description: I just went here the other day on a whim and boy am I glad. I had the french toast with pecans and caramel. I usually don't have a sweet tooth, but this was delicious! I highly recommend it. My friend had a sirloin steak skillet, which looked delicious. I also noticed that the place was VERY clean and that the servers were pleasant.Prices are average...everything is about $7-10 range and the plates are more like platters. They are freakin' HUGE.  I just wish I knew about this place when I was going to Wright college.

2.description: Their skillet breakfast was terrible tasted like oil and way over priced. My first and the last time I will eat there.

18.description: Not bad for a Sunday morning breakfast joint.Staff is very friendly, Waitress are on the ball.The owner or his wife greet you when you come in.The food is a little better than okGreat waffles though!.

13.description: I thought this place was great. We walked in (10:30am) and it was empty and we thought Uh-Oh...but that meant nothing after we sat down. Omelet was awesome, but the service staff was incredible! I don't know the ladies name who served us, but she was a friendly person with a great smile. I asked her where she was from, and she said Romania. She is s throw back to how service people should be. I am on the West Coast, but I wish this place was closer.

4.description: This is the worst breakfast food I have had yet. I chose it because it has relatively good reviews and was close to our hotel but now I immediately regret going. I had the crab cake benedict and the poached eggs were overcooked; the yolk was not funny at all. I asked for another set of poached eggs. Once I got those, I broke into them and took a bite to find that the crab cake contained imitation crab meat. I've ordered crab cake benedicts many times and I've always received real lump crab meat, not imitation. I couldn't even finish my meal. My friend got the breakfast burrito which was okay. The biscuits and gravy, however, had extremely bland gravy. Our waitress was nice but it didn't make up for the lack of quality in food. Also, the table in front of us had a problem with their order and the kitchen staff openly was talking about them for all to hear; it was extremely awkward and very bad customer service to be treating customers that way.

24.description: I was eating out with my boyfriend at a decent place when I remarked to him, "Ya know, I don't think I eat at any place I would call truly horrible."  But than we both thought it and realized that it's not that we don't eat at any truly terrible places but that we sear them from our memory afterwards.This is one such place. And to give you an idea of how long I've seared this place out of my memory, we ate here for the first and last time 2 years ago.We were living in the neighborhood at the time and were looking for a decent dinner to go to for breakfast foods and such and thought to give this place a try, it looked decent and had parking.The service was so so, not great just unmotivated and not super friendly.The food was horrendous....and we got breakfast so you know they had to screw up really bad if they can't even do a decent breakfast.I got minced ham and scrambled eggs and my bf got an omelet. They came to our table looking like the same order, a pile of egg cake. Seriously, these things looked like an egg cake all puffy and solid looking on the outside, inside wasnt much better. To say things were inedible was an understatement. I shoved down as much as I could stomach for no other reason than hunger. My bf's omelete had more tomatoe on the inside than egg.The hashbrowns and bacon tasted like they hadn't cleaned out the grease traps in years...or maybe ever.I wouldn't reccomend this place to my worst enemy.

6.description: We've gone here on Sunday's after mass and it's such a cozy little diner! They've got the same breakfast and brunch items you would expect, but made quick for you, fresh and hot. I got the regular eggs and hash browns order which I order usually at other diners, but it wasn't too greasy or buttery, it was just right! We came here around noon so it wasn't too packed but we got seated easily and the waitress was really kind. She made sure to check on us occasionally and fill up our coffees. I would say it's a great go to for just meals that taste home cooked, for a smiley staff, quick service, and overall nice place to visit on a Sunday afternoon. Parking is easy to find and they have some spots in the back, plus the cost is reasonable for the food!

22.description: The A's Restaurant is a great no frills diner. Just good breakfast food at a reasonable price with service that is really friendly.  We came in on a Saturday mid-morning looking for pancakes in the area and settled for this place.  Doesn't seem like that much outside and really old school - which could be good or bad in this neighborhood. We came in and were seated immediately by the owner and waiting on promptly.  Ordered eggs, buttermilk pancakes, sausage, and coffee.  All of it was really good and came to our table really fast.  If you're around Irving park or Portage park and want breakfast, this is a sure bet.

15.description: i really like this place to eat for breakfast. the staff are so friendly. all their breakfast dishes are super delicious and fresh. i usually order their eggs benedict and love it.  i've had their frittatas and omellets too and they are always fresh and yummy to eat. my husband loves their pancakes and denver omelets.  we've only been here for breakfast. one of these days we will make it out here for lunch. hope you enjoy any meal here at a's.

7.description: Delicious food. The friendliest servers and one of the cleanest restaurants I've ever been to.The cream of chicken with rice soup was divine. The french fries were cooked to perfection. I must try breakfast food here next.

8.description: Super quick, friendly, reasonable, and good atmosphere! Was headed to the airport and needed something to eat. I had the chicken and cheese omelette with fruit and pancakes all for 11.00! It was great!! Highly recommended

3.description: A's definitely kept my tummy satisfied! The customer service was very attentive and helpful. I ordered the 2 egg special which came with hash browns, pancakes and sausage... WHO CAN PASS UP ON ALL THAT DELICIOUSNESS?? I will be back for more brunchin'

14.description: Typical dinner with all the favorites. Great service. Burgers are big and delicious. Pancakes fluffy and make for a great breakfast!

3.description: I was incredibly dissatisfied with my experience at this location. I had ran in (hoping to make it a very quick trip) to pick up a few cards.. I was one of perhaps 3 total patrons in the store.. it was very hot and sticky that day, and they had the doors open which did not help. I went to the register and there was one person in front of me who had maybe 3 items.. There was 1 person working 1 register.. After about 5 min of waiting in silence there were another 2 people who had stood to wait behind me.. No indication as to why we were waiting there from the cashier, just standing in the quiet heat. Finally the woman behind me asks if the register is broken "again" in which the cashier answers "Yes, I don't know whats going on". The woman behind me expressed her displeasure and stated that this is not the first time she had experienced this very situation at this location. After standing in line for another almost 10 min I had set my items down and walked out. There was no assistance from a manager, no attempt to open another register, not even any apology from the staff. I will definitely be avoiding this location in the future.

1.description: Shame shame shame!There were 9, count them 9 people in line.  The manager is on the side yip yapping with a non employee  about who he worked with IDOT in 2000.  The poor gal is checking all the people out.  Then he walks ouside with the guy and continues talking.Otherwise place was nice.  Clean, nice selection and prices.

2.description: Yay! A store that has everything I need for super cheap AND the owner takes time to talk with you! You just can't beat that. I can't tell you how many times this store has been a life-saver for me when I get into financial pinches.I've only had two bad experiences out of the countless times I've visited this location. Be aware that some employees are very young and may be lazy or even not have the social manners that they should - so don't take it personally. All the other times I've come to this location have been positive for me... and then made even better once I've reached the check-out counter and I seen how little my total is.All together, you can tell this store may not be fully matured or that it might not be on the same level of quality when it comes to customer service that other larger grocery stores are, but I can tell that the owner is trying very hard to make his customers happy! Which, you just don't see owners getting to know their clients any more these days ON TOP OF cheaper than your average groceries. Win - Win situation for me.

0.description: this store is very convenient even though i am in jefferson park (chicago) and they offer great discounts (real discounts and not jacked up prices discounted!).  save even more when shopping on a saturday with their $5 off $25 or more coupon!  easy store to maneuver around.  noticed another comment regarding lines and yes this time the line was longer, but the girl got everyone thru the line fast.  it's a small store so it's not like a grocery store w/ several checkers and it also doesn't have the high priced items like a grocery store does!  for instance i personally go thru a lot of witchazel.  at any grocery store even the house brand can be $4 a 16 oz bottle.  name brand $6 $7 for the same size!  dg is less than 1/2 the cost of the house brand and it's the same stuff!  not much you can do...with witchazel!  management as well as all of the checkers i have encountered have been accommodating and pleasant!

This place is horrible and should be closed! I was having my car repaired next door a few months ago and needed something to drink, I am a diabetic and felt myself going into a hypoglycemic episode so I went in and grabbed two Tropicana apple juices and brought them to the counter. I pulled out my debit card to pay and the cashier told me in a condescending manner that the store required a $10 purchase to merit a credit card transaction. I explained what was going on (I was sweating and shaking). and they did not care at all. So I sat right in front of the counter with the debit card in one hand and started sucking down the apple juice in the other. The cashier started screaming at me and I told him to call the police (I didnt care). Right before I finished drinking the second apple juice a nice older woman payed for my juices unbenownst to me. I wish I could thank her again. This place cares nothing about humanity and lives on greed. Avoid at all costs!

Crowded and snug shopping experience, don't wear your puffy jacket  or carry your biggest Birkin bag when you shop here! But if, like me, you are a fan of  unique Euro-beverages, this place is worth a stop. Browsing can be a challenge if its busy, but if someone slams into you while grabbing their 3 foot tall bottle of Zubrowka, just say "Bardzo mi si podobasz", and maybe you'll make a new friend.. (only say this to a member of the opposite sex) .But seriously - World-wide has a large selection of high quality vodkas many with unique ingredients or flavors, decent selection of beers, lots of unique liqueurs, brandies, cordials and aperitifs - and very good prices on everything - but what warmed the cockles of my lil German heart was seeing that they carried real Der Lachs GoldWasser (not the same as GoldSchlager). The folks at the register seemed to be the owners or family, and were very helpful and friendly. Parking lot out front is also a plus, easy access, easy loading for your party beverage purchases.

3.description: Last Friday, I had the pleasure of meeting Michal. Coming from a telecommunication/ retail background myself, I can attest that Michal is one of a kind. I was sent to this location after visiting another (less helpful) T- Mobile in the area. And I'm so glad I was. Michal was fantastic- personable, patient, informative, and incredibly helpful.Before coming in my family and I had been shopping around for a different carrier. Michal no frills sales attempt is rare to come by. He explained everything to us step by step and never once did he make us feel rushed. I will come back because of Michal, He couldn't have been more nicer.

1.description: This is a very busy place but they don't care they just stand there for hours. They take their time because they get paid hourly so you wait you wait and wait and that's what they get bad review

2.description: This is the worst cell phone company I have ever had. Not only did I not received my early termination I never received my military discount for the 10 months I've been with you guys. I've been calling costumer care for months and things never gets resolved. I know you do not care for loosing a customer because you have plenty but I had to get it off my chest because I have never felt so deceived.

9.description: The store is a pretty nice size, and the displays  are on par with any other cellphone provider you'll find.  Waiting in a two person line where there were four co-workers behind the counter playing around speaking in polish with one another was extremely rude.   Especially since only one was working.  Having been on my lunch break I couldn't stand to wait for something like this, so as i approach the desk the lovely young lady looked bothered by me interrupting.  So again, a couple weeks later I had the SAME EXACT PROBLEM.  I'm all for having fun at work, but not like this T-mobile!I've been a loyal t-mobile user for the past six years.  Until now.

10.description: If you have been to one cell phone retail store you have been to them all! The retail store has a great selection of phones available, from flip phones to PDAs. I am a Blackberry man so I am happy with the quality of services I am receiving from T-Mobile. I receive my emails quickly and without trouble which is key for me since in my line I work I receive and send out at least 600 emails a month. I use to be a Sprint carrying member but I ended up having too much trouble with their costumer service so it was time for me to move on. Through my journeys I stumbled across T-Mobile, so far so good! I love their plans, I think they are the most affordable out there, believe me, I know because I shopped around for a while until I found out what is best for me. So when I walked in I was immediately greeted (Which is always a great move) and treated like I was the only one in the store. I am a bit picky so I tend to ask a lot of question so bless the girl that was attended me because she really earned her commission! Every question I had got answered and I left there with a 2 year plan & a smile. I did have a small problem with there customer services but it all got taken care of when I spoke to someone at this store location! That is why I am reviewing this specific location.

4.description: I've purchased an expensive phone, but with the phone they squeezed a little speaker which I have no purpose to use. Of course, nothing is free and they add the price of the speaker  ($200) into the phone price. I got mad when I noticed that on my phone bill but the store management stated that I agreed to it. I didn't read the agreement and the little speaker shows up there, however, the store manager is a person who I've known for more than 10 years as well as half of the store staff. Shame on me for hanging out with a wrong people but the store rides on lies with no regrets. I would never recommend this place to anyone.

6.description: I've been here a few times but try to avoid this location and go to another location if I can.The store itself is a good size, it has everything your typical cell phone provider would have.The service is what makes me nearly despise this location. I'll start with my lone good visit out of about a dozen. I began having problems with Blackberry where it would randomly turn off it's service and would change to "SOS" mode. Anyone who has had this problem understands how frustrating it is. You can't send or receive anything, and it's not about your location, it just randomly happens. So I went in and explained my problem and the employee informed me that I was having the issue because I had an old SIM card that didn't support the new 4G network that T-Mobile offered. He switched out my SIM card and I was out in 5 minutes. That's my only good story.Beyond that, the service has been terrible here. I've never been greeted when entering even when the store isn't busy. The employees make themselves unapproachable so I'm stuck standing around looking at products I'm not interested in. As a few others have noted in their reviews, the employees will stand around speaking to each other in Polish, neglecting that I'm a well-paying customer in need of assistance. I'm an extremely easy-going customer, I'm not the type to go out of my way to complain or return something if I'm not satisfied; so for me to be frustrated by this, you know it's completely unacceptable.But again, it's a cell phone service provider, I probably shouldn't expect much huh?

12.description: Fast moving lines, knowledgeable staff - I was in & out @ lunch time.

5.description: I'm only updating my review because there is a new manager working at that location who is the epitome of great customer service & he deserves to be acknowledged for his competence & kindness. The scammer employee who prompted me to write my first review is still working there & still ripping people off so if you do go to this location I obviously wouldn't recommend buying anything from her but Stevan (the new manager) is a stand up guy who knows what customer service is all about. I hope his presence will change the mindset & attitude of the employees there as well.

11.description: Went there to get the new Blackberry and was completely misquoted. Told me there was a trade in program and everything. Now I have no phone and I've been a loyal customer for years. When my contract is up in May, someone else will get my business I will promise you. I wrote the Tribune about it as well....terrible service!

8.description: I am giving this poor review only because I am not happy with the way that TMobile and the manager of this particular store handled my recent LG G3 purchase. For my birthday my fiancé purchased this smartphone for me and added me to her TMobile account. It is my first smartphone. We initially tried to purchase the phone online but were prevented because my fiancé was not listed as the primary account holder -- although she is. Rather than trying to fix this issue online and over the telephone with customer service, we drove to the 7309 W Irving Park store and bought it there. The problem is that we lost the $24 saving and free $49.99 case that were being offered online. When I asked the store clerk whether she could give me a free case, she said that she would check with her store manager. The store manager said no, but offered 50% off a second case if I bought one at full price. This offer was useless to me, as I need just one case. I feel that this entire scenario represents poor customer service -- especially for a brand new TMobile and smartphone user.

0.description: Attentive employee Marta, greeted me as soon as I walked in.  Gave me just enough time to look around and was very helpful,  informative and have honest advice.  Absolutely convincing me that whenever I have questions or issues with my phones , I must speak with her.  I had several complex issues and she was amazing. Great experience

7.description: I agree with the rest of reviewers. Avoid this location and go to another or even better change your service provider. I renewed the contract but took new phones for two of my lines. I wanted to cancel unlimited internet but the seller said that I have to wait a few months and then I can cancel this service. I called a few months later and guess what, Tmobile representative told me that I can't cancel the service, it is require for this line and I agreed with that by signing the contract. Great. Great cheaters.

1.description: This is the worst Dollar Tree store I have ever encountered!  I stopped in today and it was so dirty, unopened boxes in every aisle and item thrown all over the place. It was so cluttered it was a safety hazard for customers. I walked out never to return ever again. Go to the one on Harlem/Higgins and have a good, safe, clean shopping experience.

0.description: I like this place because everything is a dollar unlike those other dollar stores. Other than that its your typical dollar store next to Sally's and GNC which I like :)

58.description: Every time I return from college or my brother comes back to visit, TBK is one of the food places I crave. Their burritos and tortas are so good. The burritos come really big so be careful what you order. I just wish there was one in the western suburbs.

56.description: I like the food at Taco Burrito King, but the service at this particular one is horrible. If you want to try this place out, be ready for a screwed up order, or just go to one of their other many locations in the city that can be found on here.

29.description: This place is great at 2 AM or after work when you don't feel like cooking.  It's amazing!  I heart TBK!

42.description: One of the best low budget taco places ever.The food are made to order. They keep the cooks as cooker and cashier at the cash register, but the cashier is also the drink handler and he puts the ice scooper in the ice machine. He does not wash is hands or wear gloves when he's switching between scooping the ice to handling the cash. If you need some TBK get the food but without the drink. If you need something to wash down the good stuff get a bottled soda or order the drinks without the ice.

23.description: Every time we go to the N. Harlem location they try to keep our change!!! And when we use our debit card they over charge it! STEALING customers money is NOT the way to get tips!!

47.description: Good food for the price, hint; tell them no oil when ordering n the food isn't dripping with grease and has flavor

8.description: Hooray for coma-inducing food! There are a few things I enjoyed from TBK. They have better guac and salsa than Chipotle. Our office had TBK cater a lunch, so you can bet there was plenty of good stuff to put in your tacos. I appreciate how they have both flour and corn tortillas. Their salsa actually has some good heat.The only thing I didn't like were the flautas. They may be crunchy, but really really lacked flavor and it was kinda dry. I would've liked the filling to have more flavor or more seasoning. Even though I gave this place 3 stars, it's really more of 3.5 stars.

31.description: One of the top post-party destinations. That should already sum up the type of environment you will experience. They have several locations and I have been to a majority of them. All locations are consistent with their food.I would go elsewhere if you're looking for pure authentic but this place will still do.The nachos, however, are one of the best it's delicious and loaded. My favorite here are the tortas though and they make a good horchata as well.

34.description: TBK is amazing.I can honestly say that i would have no problem eating here every day of the week.. maybe even twice a day.  The tacos are loaded up with a variety of ingredients that even make it hard to fold.  Sour cream, cheese, salsa, steak.. all rain from the skies onto your platter to create a delicious combination that is sure to satisfy your mexican craving.  Look no further for great mexican food.  TBK is the ONLY place.

16.description: TBK is great for what I've always known it to be; which is a drunk destination for eating. I've never once eaten TBK sober, but it's damn good when you're drunk. They're open 24 hours so I supposed that's why we've always made it a point to eat here after a long, late night of drinking on the town. Between the hours of 2 AM and 4 AM this place is always slam-packed with your fellow intoxicated citizens trying to suppress their drunken woes. It's a problem though, you could imagine, when you put together a bunch of drunken, hungry people, and TBK has been known to be a spot that has fights breakout on a nightly basis.The hoards of drunken partyheads that amass here in the late night contribute to some unsanitary ways. The floors, chairs, and tables tend to be a little filthy in between sittings when a group of jager-zombies run through for a meal. So that's, not cool.But the food itself, as far as my mind can inform me, is pretty good. I've had everything from their chicken quesadillas, to steak burritos, to the tacos or nachos. Everything is made really well, I've never had problems on quality, or quantity for that matter.So overall, it's an experience, I guess. The food is fine, the drunk slobs, maybe not as much.

13.description: I MUST GO to Taco Burrito King every time I visit Chicago. (I live in Wisconsin) This location is 24 hours & very clean & Efficient ! Downtown Chicago closes early like 6 FYI! The Carne Asada is great ! A MUST !!!! I get it with only cilantro & onion taco. They have a Super King burrito (15 inch tortilla for about 6$ ) & fills my boyfriend up. The tamales are AWESOME. You can see them prep your food & always will customize as requested. Such nice staff. Any of the locations are great !!!! So happy I found this place on accident !!!

11.description: The food here is good,  I would recommend the taco plate and the super nachos

39.description: The sanitation here is DISGUSTING. I always seem to get a stomachache here or there but the last straw was when it gave me the stomach flu! All around the same time as finals; thanks tbk! We've called thier corporate office as well because nobody here wears gloves or anything, so dont be surprised to find a nice thick black hair in the middle of ur meal; courtesy of the servers. Also, check where they put thier rice and other seasonings, last time we found our rice was sitting next to cleaning supplies and we got a nice splash of windex in our meal =] Eat at ur own risk!

37.description: Late night burrito got to love it lots of memories

0.description: Old Tack Burrito King or as the kids would say "TBK" fits the dunning neighborhood, and is a staple in the #44th most dangerous neighborhood in the hood. The old narrative is only come here if you're 12 Busch Lights, and a couple Jack D shots in. Well, I'm here to tell Yelp community that couldn't be further from the case. Yes, you out of towner yuppies ( looking at you Christine from EP) the service isn't that friendly, but the doors in the back right, if you can't take the heat walk out the door. The boys in back in the kitchen don't care for your nonsense they're there for your meal, and they do not frig it up. I have been here maybe 300 times around that ballpark, and I couldn't tell you one bad experience I have had here. Like most said in the peanut gallery below me, you wanna be here around 12- to closing cause that's where the fireworks are at. You never know what you're gonna see I've had the pleasure of seeing many of our local dunning legends here at their darkest times. There is a very good chance you'll see some fists flying in the alley walking out probably a 12 vs 12 polish vs Mexican battle very good stuff. Now let's get to the food, like I said you don't have to be half in the bag to eat the magical Mexican dishes the fellas cook up. Always fresh, and you're never waiting for more than 10 minutes for your meal the fellas are quick behind the dish. It's cheap very cheap 10 bucks will get your meal, and a cherry Coke to wash it down. Now here's the kicker, the seating is what brings this place all together. I've had some of the best conversations with my friends and random drunken idiots here. You're packed in tight with everyone and let me tell you something once you go here once you'll be back again. Quick side note power ranking the tbks #1 Belmont n Halrem#2 Harlem n Higgns (too crowded lotta talk no bite) #3 Harlem n Lawrence (hidden next to Rex's nothing flashy gets job done.#4 HIP location garbage the little adopted brother it's trash.#5 Niles location never been there cause well it's Niles and enjoy your DUI if you go here past 11   Thanks for your time.

38.description: TBK is great for what I've always known it to be; which is a drunk destination for eating. I've never once eaten TBK sober, but it's damn good when you're drunk. They're open 24 hours so I supposed that's why we've always made it a point to eat here after a long, late night of drinking on the town. Between the hours of 2 AM and 4 AM this place is always slam-packed with your fellow intoxicated citizens trying to suppress their drunken woes. It's a problem though, you could imagine, when you put together a bunch of drunken, hungry people, and TBK has been known to be a spot that has fights breakout on a nightly basis.The hoards of drunken partyheads that amass here in the late night contribute to some unsanitary ways. The floors, chairs, and tables tend to be a little filthy in between sittings when a group of jager-zombies run through for a meal. So that's, not cool.But the food itself, as far as my mind can inform me, is pretty good. I've had everything from their chicken quesadillas, to steak burritos, to the tacos or nachos. Everything is made really well, I've never had problems on quality, or quantity for that matter.So overall, it's an experience, I guess. The food is fine, the drunk slobs, maybe not as much.

51.description: Had a very mediocre burrito there. It was my first time there and I was disappointed at the lame quality and the indifferent service. Skip this place and go several blocks south to Super Taqueria El Taconazo on Diversey just east of Harlem. It's the real deal.

27.description: Its defiantly 5 stars when your wasted lol The place isn't that bad.. Its just like a fast food taco place.. I must rather go to a nice Mexican restaurant. But TBK is only good for those drunken nights =\

32.description: Good food plus the guy threw in a large Horcata with my burrito! Good customer service

54.description: This was the first TBK I ever went to and due to my experience here I was completely turned off to the entire chain. I had the crappiest burrito and quesadillas here the times that I went, I wouldn't have gone back had it not been for friends who wanted to eat there. Whatever they're doing over there...I'm not sure, but I've never had such awful TBK quality food.

48.description: I can't say much. If you are in the area and totally blasted on a Friday or Saturday night, this place will hit the spot! Not your typical fast food Mexican Cuisine. Quick and cheap! Best food when you're drunk!..

44.description: AWESOME authentic Mexican available 24/7 ! I'm in!!!!!

24.description: This place is just awful. The meat is tastless and the vegtables they throw on their offerings are hardly fresh. This place has a bad rep from friends I know in area and after one visit I can see why. The food is bland. You really are better off going to Taco Bell or Burger King than this place.

7.description: Ordered 2 al pastor tacos.What I got was toppings for 2 tacos and NO tortilla. This place is already terrible for "Mexican" food. Didn't know it could get any worse.

49.description: It's 2:30pm and I haven't eaten all day unless you count the two baby sized cups of juice I got on the plane.Let's be honest...this is the kind of place you eat when you're in the beginning stages of starvation and you don't really care anymore (kind of like those people from the movie Alive who ate the dead bodies). At least you know what you're getting yourself into going in. This ain't the old country so lower that standards bar a little bit if you choose to eat here.I dig the vegetarian nachos because they come with the usual nacho fixins' in addition to sauteed peppers. Huge portion! or shall I say just the right size for my post-flight appetite.Definitely not the king of anything but perhaps Taco Burrito Duke or Taco Burrito Knight

40.description: cheap food, open late. i've been here a few times drunk and hungry. Usually never disappoints. I love their chicken quesadilla. Their nachos are good. Their chicken flautas are decent, i've had better at El Alegre. Their rice and beans here are good, as a kid I refused to get anything else here besides the rice an beans.

53.description: Well, it's open late, but if I had to pick between TBK and Ino's, Ino's wins hands down. Prices are similar, but:1. Ino's has a bigger parking lot - TBK's is more like a paved passageway.2. Ino's gives you chips and salsa for free with your order, while TBK wants $2 for it.3. If you ask for water at TBK, they charge you for bottled unless you specifically ask for a cup - Ino's doesn't.4. TBK loads the shit out of their tacos and burritos with lettuce. Come on. If my taco won't fold right, it better be because of something that actually fills me up.And besides the fact that this is the only place I've ever been to that has put sour cream on a basic steak taco, without warning, which I hate. Especially since on about 1/3 of the items on their menu board have descriptions of what the ingredients are.I was feeling pretty good when I came here around 3 AM after a night at Teaser's, but not good enough to be impressed by this place.But on the bright side, they take credit and don't appear to charge a fee for being below a minimum, and the restaurant is very clean and looks to be either recently remodeled or flat-out new. At Ino's you can feel the grease on the floor as you walk.And they are open super-late during the week, while Ino's closes around 1 except on weekends.  But still, I think Ino's is a better value. At least now I can say I've had TBK.

30.description: I love Taco burrito king, the best, I love the fresh cilantro and the meat is made fresh. ****

46.description: This place is awesome if it's 3am and you've been out drinking all night and looking for some greasy late night mexican food! On any regular dinning occasion this would not be my first choice for quick Mexican food. It's mediocre at best, but close enough for me to walk to from home.  I've felt ill a few times after eating "TBK" (as it's known)  not sure if it was the food or a sensitive stomache but now on the extremely rare occasion that I do get food there, I play it safe and only order quesedillas, rice or a veggie burrito.

1.description: Hit this spot every time I visit Chicago. They're open like always, and the food is good and lots of it. Honestly, I've been to fancy Mexican restaurants and food wasn't half as good. I even fly their burritos to Washington state for my boyfriend. First time he saw a burrito up to his elbow he freaked out and fell in love with it. I'm giving 4* because the parking is atrocious. And although they filled in the 3rd world country potholes, you still have to worry not to get the back of your car "clipped" by cars passing through that alley that's also a parking lot.

55.description: TBK is and always will be the best damn taco/burrito place anyone will ever visit.I have eaten there on a daily basis almost and not once have i ever got tired of the food.The burritos are cooked to perfection as well as the taco dinners.The beans and rice are mind blowing.TBK really knows what tacos and burritos are supposed to taste like.Best damn meat i've tasted,yes a tad on the greasy side but overall it is still the best.Only true chicagoans know how to order at the counter,I've seen some posts where users claim that they are rude.When you go in to order,just know what you want and there is never a problem.The place is good when you're both sober or drunk.2 thumbs up and then some.

9.description: Haven't been here in a while and always remember it being awesome, especially late night. Tonight I went there with a friend and ordered 2 Chicken Casadilla plates with rice substitute instead of beans, to go....When we got home to eat, they put both Casadillas orders in one container and 1 serving of rice....instead of putting our orders in separate containers. I didn't think you could go wrong with a casadilla either, but there was barely any cheese, dry & it was clearly turkey meat. It was still somewhat good, if I would have ordered a turkey casadillas, but it seems someone is using leftovers right after this past holiday.... :/

26.description: TBK at Harlem/Higgins is the best TBK location. I've tried the one in Niles, IL on Touhy Ave, and on Halsted by UIC and it is not the same. Although menu and prices are the same it really tastes differently and different locations.I eat at this TBK at least once a week - King Size Steak Burrito! I've tried other foods and they are equally good - girls would like nachos grande with everything on it!Inexpensive place for very good fast latin food. Primarily it is heaven and earth difference from Taco Bell - Let me tell you that TBK is fresh and clean and the food with not bring your energy levels or mood down the way heavily processed foods do. They're busy 24/7.I'm a fan, 4 Stars!

25.description: THE BEST TBK OF THEM ALL. MY FAVORITE!  Food is always mouth watering.Cashier is always nice.Place is well maintained & clean.

12.description: Love this place. One of my favorite places. Never disappointed. Have their number in my phone book

59.description: I never eaten burritos nor has any of my family members.  Actually I don't think I know any Mexicans that eat them and I'm sure there are some but I just don't know any. So after much pressure and teassing from the in-laws I gave in and went.  I stuck to my guns and ordered a sope (a mini tostada of soft corn) of carne asada (steak) and a taco of el pastor (marinaded pork).  Everything was really good and the pastor had a sweet spice to it.  I was pretty impressed, so I brought a couple of tacos home for my husband to try.  Although he's had the burritos he hadn't tried their tacos.  Aren't we the backward pair?As for my sister-in-law he saved a bite of her steak burrito for me.  She takes hers without lettuce which left more room for the steak filling and there was no rice like others I've seen but there were plenty of beans.  I liked it but still don't see myself ordering one.  I'm a traditionalist at heart, I guess.

21.description: Tacos are pretty good. Nachos are awesome.. The fully loaded ones at least. What else can I say after a long night out anything tastes good. This place definitely wouldn't be my first choice for a nice dinner night out.. But ok for the morning after to grab a bite.

17.description: Great tacos.... Pretty clean place.... Fast food (got my order of ten tacos in 5 minutes)

10.description: This is one of my favorite restaurants.  I have been to other locations but this ones has the best steak tacos by far.  Very tasting and a very filling taco.  You will not be disappointed.

5.description: The only reason I visit TBK is frankly because I'm drunk and it's open late. I know a handful of people are on the same boat and you can see it during the late night hours. With that being said, employees really should be a bit more patient if a large group of inebriated and slightly stupid people walk in and don't know what they want. PLEASE DON'T RUSH ME OR I GET CATTY. Needless to say, I got catty and my food was less than enjoyable. My boyfriend and two other friends on the other hand, enjoyed their food. Junior burritos are regular sized and their super nachos are pretty fantastic.

3.description: A lot of authentic dishes st very reasonable prices and quick service.  Guys It Is A Real Treat.  Crowds after clubs yet a good hang out joint as well.  Check It Out!

35.description: MY GOD THIS PLACE IS GOOD!!  One might be fooled because of the value of this restaurant, but go inside and your thoughts on cheap Mexican food will be changed for life.  Everything in the restaurant is cooked right in front of you, and the ingredients are high quality and served in generous portions.  To boot, they offer a special everyday that is only $4.99 on Weekdays.  If you are looking for the BEST Mexican food in the area - look no further.  TBK is here to save the day.

19.description: TBK, why have I been craving you lately? I swear, if I wasn't so sexually inactive, or a man, I'd think I were pregnant.Much like I have the tendency to crave mediocre pizza from one of the chains (Papa John's withstanding), the same goes for Mexican food. No, my palate doesn't always require savory al pastor with fresh onions and cilantro, or juicy steak, al carbon style with fresh, homemade salsa verde piled on top. Indeed, from time to time I need that crappy "Tex-Mex" fix where some type of meat is drownded out by sour cream, lettuce, cheese and a wide array of God only knows. Suffice it to say, TBK certainly fits the bill. No matter what you eat here, good luck not making a mess of yourself. Whether you're drunk or sober and your main goal is to not be hungry anymore, TBK has you covered. You may think "well that was nothing special", but watch. You'll be back. You know I'm right.

28.description: Ewwww. the tacos were gross so was the burrito. i'm  giving this place two stars because it had good CHEESE quesadillas.

45.description: I was having a difficult day and decided I needed to ease my pain with some TBK. I was waiting for my order and another customer asked me if I was high because he was there satisfying his case of the munchies (my eyes were red because I was crying). The high, drunk, menstrual, or depressed. These are the people who keep Taco Burrito King's doors open. I wouldn't go out of my way for this place unless I met the aforementioned criteria, but at 2am it completely fits the bill.

33.description: Best Taco Burrito King chain around Chicago. Clean, bright and room.  Maybe I'm just hungry?  Whatever reason, its worth the trip.

43.description: Best TBK so far. Super nachos all the way!

2.description: Gross!The place is super dirtyThe salsa when you order "salsa and chips" was a watery bland liquid. It was more like a diluted can of tomato sauce. Couldn't eat it. Then we Ordered a steak taco plate and a steak burrito. The steak was gross! No flavor and it tasted so weird. The meat looked grey. We left our dinners and had to walk out. What a disappointment. We told the workers but they didn't care. They laughed. Oh and I ordered a side of avocado. They gave me a rotten black avocado! Health dept should really inspect this place.

18.description: I placed an order for carry-out over the phone. One of the items I said "steak burrito with ONLY cheese on it". I go in to pick it up and it has the works on it! I tell the cashier and he got an attitude with me and said "well you gotta buy another one". So no refund, no apology, no burrito on the house. I was THISCLOSE from going ape sh*t on his ass!!!

41.description: TBK, why have I been craving you lately? I swear, if I wasn't so sexually inactive, or a man, I'd think I were pregnant.Much like I have the tendency to crave mediocre pizza from one of the chains (Papa John's withstanding), the same goes for Mexican food. No, my palate doesn't always require savory al pastor with fresh onions and cilantro, or juicy steak, al carbon style with fresh, homemade salsa verde piled on top. Indeed, from time to time I need that crappy "Tex-Mex" fix where some type of meat is drownded out by sour cream, lettuce, cheese and a wide array of God only knows. Suffice it to say, TBK certainly fits the bill. No matter what you eat here, good luck not making a mess of yourself. Whether you're drunk or sober and your main goal is to not be hungry anymore, TBK has you covered. You may think "well that was nothing special", but watch. You'll be back. You know I'm right.

52.description: I think it's open late because one would have to stumble in wasted in order to fully enjoy their greasy mounds of sub-par, gentrified Mexican cuisine. I'm convinced that they use an excess of sour cream, beans, etc to cover up the fact that their meat is so gross; their chicken is almost inedible and their steak is so rubbery that it can be hard to chew.For about the same price of this place, if not cheaper, you can find WAY better restaurants in the area.

50.description: HELL.HELL.YESSSSSSSSSSSSSTHANK YOU 24 HOUR MEXICAN FOOD PLACES!Their burritos are literally the size of Subway foot longs... So what if it is not the best quality Mexican food ever? It is still awesome. The food is made to order and comes out quick and hot.The service is always pretty awesome, too.You guys should be proud of yourselves! Back pats to all of you!

4.description: This is by far my favorite burritos in town! This place is always open, they also have a daily special which is very filling.

6.description: They're very quick on serving up food. Food is alright is you're really hungry. But I would rather prefer more authentic Hispanic food.

22.description: Good Mexican food if ur drunk!! Jk!!! Lol!!! You have to like the buildings appearance!! Pretty clean for Mexican Joint!! Really like the steak Burrito

15.description: TBK has a childhood favorite of mine and staple on the weekends but the more I expand my Mexican palate, the more I level TBK with Chipotle. It is good but they just cycle you through the line and don't put that much care into whatever you order. Great example is I just ordered the king burrito and I counted at least 2 ingredients missing when my order had no limitations. The food is good, always get the steak, but don't expect anything too special.

57.description: If you are on a bulemic diet, and enjoy flavorless dog meat, TBK is for you! Yes, its open late. Coincidentally and conveniently, so is the hospital.

20.description: The original is always the classic. Stinks they don't deliver, but if you call ahead its done when you walk in.

36.description: Check yourself before you wreck yourself.Walked in 11/2 around 10:30-11.Was greeted by a guy in a goatee ponytail sideburns....He was pleasant (sarcasm)There was no one behind us but I felt pressure from him like he was rushing us to order....I realize you get the drunks around this time but RELAX because not everyone is drunk. Your attitude it not needed or appreciated.I ordered the nachos with MELTED cheese....to my surprise it was NACHO cheese (a la movie theaters.....) I asked for something different yellow nacho cheese just upsets my stomach....Well by this time I was asking for it....the pony tail guy seemed upset.The food didn't go to waste because the guy behind me ended up buying the nachos.But there was a nice guy back there that aloud me to pay the difference and order something else....watch your attitude homeboy....you never know when you're dealing with a yelper.

14.description: Check yourself before you wreck yourself.Walked in 11/2 around 10:30-11.Was greeted by a guy in a goatee ponytail sideburns....He was pleasant (sarcasm)There was no one behind us but I felt pressure from him like he was rushing us to order....I realize you get the drunks around this time but RELAX because not everyone is drunk. Your attitude it not needed or appreciated.I ordered the nachos with MELTED cheese....to my surprise it was NACHO cheese (a la movie theaters.....) I asked for something different yellow nacho cheese just upsets my stomach....Well by this time I was asking for it....the pony tail guy seemed upset.The food didn't go to waste because the guy behind me ended up buying the nachos.But there was a nice guy back there that aloud me to pay the difference and order something else....watch your attitude homeboy....you never know when you're dealing with a yelper.

58.description: Finally a decent bar in a neighborhood full of dive bars (not that I mind dive bars, but need somewhere with more then just Old Style and PBR). Thursday flatbread special is good for $5.00.

56.description: 6 stars! What a great find for a neighborhood joint with tasty food and nice vibe.

29.description: First time visit on a Wednesday night.  3 sliders w/ fries for $5 special.   Can pick from 3 types of sliders:  cheeseburger, buffalo chicken and pork.   I skipped the pork and had 2 burgers and 1 chicken.  All were good as were the fries.  Also had $8 pitchers of Miller Lite on Wed.  VERY friendly female bartenders earned the 5 star rating.  Overall pleasant experience.

42.description: Went here tonight for dinner and a drink during Monday Night Football, it was fantastic!  Clean, spacious sports bar with tv's everywhere and great music.  Excellent service and prices.  I had the $5 Monday taco special and my fiancé got the Diablo wings with tater tots, both were great.  They have plenty of tables, large "u" shaped booths and a spacious bar area.  Plenty of parking and they also deliver.  Great place, will definitely be back!

23.description: Showed up hammered with a group at like 12:30am. Don't really remember much. Seemed like a nice place. Beer was cold. I think I'll go back sober. Stay tuned.

47.description: My favorite suburb bar, been here 10+ times  I love that they are able to open their windows all the way and have tons of TVs. The bartenders are really friendly. One time we came for the world cup because they opened early.  They let us put the Ghana Portugal game on one of the huge TVs in addition to the USA v. Germany game.  Their food is really good and I am a huge fan of their specials.

8.description: I visited this place with my sister to try out the burgers, since they were $5 on Tuesdays, and was a bit disappointed. The Angus burger tasted like i'm eating charcoal, and the veggie burger had an OK taste. I can't speak for the rest of the food, but the burgers were not good. I am giving it a 2 star since it is at a nice spot, and it has an interesting looking bar, and friendly staff.They have a jukebox, which is great, but that jukebox has Latin artists with lists of their songs in English ONLY... Really? That kind of ticked me off. But anyways, I would recommend this place if you didn't have anywhere else to go.

31.description: Dunning is a food desert,  I am so glad I tried city tap bar and grill.  Every dish I have tried at this place has been amazing.  I have never been in I get it all delivered.  Thank goodness I have this place as a delivery option in the neighborhood.

34.description: I love their burgers, especially on Tuesdays.Staff has spidey senses when I'm low on beer, very quick to bring me a fresh one.Always a good time at City Tap.

16.description: Very good pretzel sticks!! Bacon wrapped wedges were good, but are probably better when you order then at the restaurant... They were a little soggy when they came delivered. I would order again, for sure.

13.description: This place is great! They have daily food and drink specials.  Even on the weekends-which is hard to find.  There's $5 burgers And $3 beers on Tuesdays. Yum!!  And they don't cheap out on the burgers. The tater tots and awesome, especially when they're loaded. The wait staff is friendly and efficient. There are some comfy booths to sit in And the restrooms are even clean. Pretty much the best bar ever!

11.description: They won't play college football game audio on Saturdays? Huh? I didn't come here to listen to dance music at 3 pm.

39.description: Brian was our bartender and he was on point. We told him we wanted to eat healthy and he told us exactly what to order on the menu. We ended up with a healthy chicken wrap and salad. They have a great craft beer selection and my girlfriend loved their wine options.  She ordered mixed drinks that Brian assured her she would like. He even offered to remake if she wasn't happy with her order. Brian remembered and called us by our names. It made us feel welcome. We stayed for a few hours and met some friendly people at the bar. Not too many good options in the area, if we lived close by, this would be our spot.

37.description: Great local bar... Nice selection of crafts and great food. Staff is nice and the atmosphere is relaxed. Worth a try.

0.description: I love love love this place! They have great daily specials and it's not too big and not too small! I've always had great service and awesome food. Love their sweet potato fries with chipotle sauce!!

38.description: Decent bar with good food and beverage specials.  I really wish they'd carry a much deeper selection of beers, especially given that they are in the heartland of brewpub awesomeness.  I love you guys - time to level up!

51.description: Excellent burgers. They have daily specials at good prices. All you can eat fish on Fridays is great. I don't drink but friends say the beer selection is good too.

27.description: I've passed by so many times finally stopped by at 11:30pm on a Saturday night. Friendly staff and bartenders. Explained their specials and well as informed us of a new beer and its origins, which they offered a sample if we wanted to try. Plenty of surrounding parking. They had a DJ and played all types of music. Every tv had something different. I loved the atmosphere. I would recommend.

32.description: Hungry after shopping, this place is just around the corner from the mall. So it's away from the shopping crowd. They had daily drink & beer specials and the food was delicious!  The burgers are done perfect! I asked for medium rare & it was perfect. And the sweet potato fries done perfect too! Brought home some bbq pork sliders that were tops! Full of pulled pork. And their buns are different. I loved them!  Will go back for sure!!  Highly recommended!!

54.description: Stopped here for lunch on a Saturday. Great service from the very friendly bartender, a few good imports on tap, local sports on the plentiful tvs.  Nice warm (but not burning hot) chili. My Italian beef was good, nice hot crispy fries.  The BF exchanged a chicken breast for a burger on his BBQ cheddar sammie (they let you exchange for chicken, veggie burger or turkey burger)  and loved it.  Recommended!

48.description: I first tried this place using a groupon and we were not disappointed. In fact, we were quite impressed. I didn't really know what to expect since I don't frequent "bar" type restaurants (at least not anymore :) I have been there several times since and each time was wonderful. Each wait staff we have had was super friendly and accommodating. The food is great, very fresh and tasty. The buffalo wings and dip was delicious. The tater tots were so crispy and flavorful. Burgers, sandwiches, and salads don't disappoint. Don't let the bar atmosphere keep you away if that's not your thing. There are booths and tables in the back with several TV's and real cool music playing. We went there yesterday for dinner with 3 little kids and felt very comfortable. They have the high chairs that fit car seats and a kids' menu. I would recommend this place for anybody-any age.

44.description: I visited this place with my sister to try out the burgers, since they were $5 on Tuesdays, and was a bit disappointed. The Angus burger tasted like i'm eating charcoal, and the veggie burger had an OK taste. I can't speak for the rest of the food, but the burgers were not good. I am giving it a 2 star since it is at a nice spot, and it has an interesting looking bar, and friendly staff.They have a jukebox, which is great, but that jukebox has Latin artists with lists of their songs in English ONLY... Really? That kind of ticked me off. But anyways, I would recommend this place if you didn't have anywhere else to go.

24.description: I like this place. Decent bar and good grub. They have specials almost every day of the week. Good service, friendly waitresses and the right amount of regulars - bless their hearts. They do a pretty good carryout business, which means the food has to be pretty tasty.I came here on a weekday for lunch. Young couples with families, some with the portable swing sets/car seats with babies in tow. Couples and friends meeting up for a drink, as well as those sneaking a beer in for lunch. This place is comfortable. I'm sure the atmosphere at night is different. Plan to come back on a Friday or Saturday. It can only get better.

7.description: I like this place. Decent bar and good grub. They have specials almost every day of the week. Good service, friendly waitresses and the right amount of regulars - bless their hearts. They do a pretty good carryout business, which means the food has to be pretty tasty.I came here on a weekday for lunch. Young couples with families, some with the portable swing sets/car seats with babies in tow. Couples and friends meeting up for a drink, as well as those sneaking a beer in for lunch. This place is comfortable. I'm sure the atmosphere at night is different. Plan to come back on a Friday or Saturday. It can only get better.

49.description: I love coming here for lunch!

40.description: I went there with my daughter and a friend to watch a football game on Saturday. Their specials are free kids meals and 12 dollar domestic buckets. The kids meal was actually very good and I would give their wings a solid B. The waitress was awesome too. For the value, I have to give this place a top rating for a sports bar.

53.description: I go here for fried pickle chips & ranch dressing. City tap makes them the best! I've eaten a lot of pickle chips at a lot of different places and so far these are he best! Check out daily specials - usually $1 tacos on Monday nights, always a $2 pint special too.

30.description: Love this local bar! Food is awesome and the bartenders are friendly...needless to say they know us by name...wears having our rehearsal dinner here for our wedding...so that should say something!

46.description: I ordered food from this place and had it delivered. First of all, I was pleasantly surprised they delivered.  I had the diablo wings which were extremely hot but very good. A bit too hot for me but the flavor was great. I also tried the calamari and it was excellent. The cocktail sauce had a very unique flavor. I am looking forward to actually going into this place for drinks and food.  The delivery driver, name unknown, was extremely polite.

1.description: Wow great place.  Clean comfortable.  Good was awesome!! Perfectly cooked wings and there sauces were amazing.  Word to the wise Diablo is fu*king hot!  I love hot foods and it pretty much had me to my limit of hot.  Much hotter would have been too much!!  As it stood loved it. Staff friendly prompt was on the spot I would recommend the place

55.description: I have been here a few times over the past few years to meet up with some friends or see a band.  Don't think they still have bands Thank god because it is not the place to really have a live band. The food is typical bar food nothing special about it.  The last time I ate here the service was so slow I waited 25 minutes for a lousy chicken wrap.  The chicken wrap was very dry and bland tasting.  Also very over priced for mediocre bar food. There is nothing special about City Tap.

9.description: We came for a Friday night all you can eat fish fry and the food was great. Service was slow, in terms of our food items, but the bartender (we sat at the bar) was on top of things. It was packed when we arrived, and then I realized why - the NCAA tournament was on, and everyone there was watching the games, which meant virtually no table turnover for the evening. Moscow mules and Summer Shandys were the drink specials. I enjoyed one of each.Music was loud, as was the place in general. I'm chalking this up ot the games, the cheering, and the yelling at the TV. Music was a factor, but they were playing many nostalgic hits from the 90's, so no complaints from me for that!It did feel like it took forever, at least 30-40 minutes for our fish fry to come out. It was during the busiest time at the bar though, so I'm sure that contributed. When my husband ordered his second helping of the fish fry (I was satisfied with what originally came on my plate), it came out in about 10-15 minutes. Maybe the kitchen was just overwhelmed the first time?Overall, I had a fun time, and the food was great. I will go back. Hopefully, it won't be as crowded next time!

26.description: Very good pretzel sticks!! Bacon wrapped wedges were good, but are probably better when you order then at the restaurant... They were a little soggy when they came delivered. I would order again, for sure.

25.description: We came for a Friday night all you can eat fish fry and the food was great. Service was slow, in terms of our food items, but the bartender (we sat at the bar) was on top of things. It was packed when we arrived, and then I realized why - the NCAA tournament was on, and everyone there was watching the games, which meant virtually no table turnover for the evening. Moscow mules and Summer Shandys were the drink specials. I enjoyed one of each.Music was loud, as was the place in general. I'm chalking this up ot the games, the cheering, and the yelling at the TV. Music was a factor, but they were playing many nostalgic hits from the 90's, so no complaints from me for that!It did feel like it took forever, at least 30-40 minutes for our fish fry to come out. It was during the busiest time at the bar though, so I'm sure that contributed. When my husband ordered his second helping of the fish fry (I was satisfied with what originally came on my plate), it came out in about 10-15 minutes. Maybe the kitchen was just overwhelmed the first time?Overall, I had a fun time, and the food was great. I will go back. Hopefully, it won't be as crowded next time!

12.description: Great local bar with great food. Love the wraps here, fun overall place. Good food great food fun little local joint.

59.description: Great place! Great Food! Will definitely come back! Shouldn't take the kids Fri/Sat, it is really a BAR atmosphere.

21.description: The food is good, the drinks are affordable and the bartender, Angela is the best :) She is always fun, entertaining, and welcoming to everyone that walks in the door.

17.description: Dang I was not expecting a home run out of the park on the first try. Food was excellent, ordered for pick up and mistakenly thought they screwed up my order (like everyone else lol). Instead I was the one that was wrong but they were polite and helpful, no attitude whatsoever, refreshing. Must say the nachos were OUTSTANDING. Def going back

10.description: Awesome french onion soupAnd food selections,  great daily food specials,  awesome customer service after we ate we moved to the bar and had av great time playing v songs on the jukebox

5.description: We came here on a Tuesday to try their half off Burgers. I had the Cali burger while my boyfriend had the 50/50 and they were both awesome. I loved the guac on top of the cheese in mine and my bf loved the Italian sausage with mozzarella, great combinations. I took one star due to service; our server was busy with a bigger table and we sat there while the rest of the staff didn't bother to step in. I would love to try their flatbreads next.

3.description: This place is legit! The food specials, the drinks and the staff! I love the flatbreads here. Looking for a place to chill and also have great food, stop by and check it out. Only con I can think of is the parking situation but otherwise you will be in good hands at city tap. Probably my favorite bar in the area. Cheers,

35.description: Awesome french onion soupAnd food selections,  great daily food specials,  awesome customer service after we ate we moved to the bar and had av great time playing v songs on the jukebox

19.description: I've past by this place a few times and never stopped in. Finally I yelped it and saw such great reviews so my husband and I decided to check it out. Tons of tv's. Great and friendly service. The FOOD IS GREAT! My husband asked if they could put the cubs game on one of the tv's and they did with no problem. Our server Lizzy was very friendly and attentive.  I had a flatbread with tomato, mushroom, spinach, and cheese. It was amazing! Great flavor and crispy flatbread.  My husband got a combo of cheese burger sliders and pulled pork slider with merkz cheddar cheese. Those are great as well. Good prices and specials too. We will be back.

28.description: I've past by this place a few times and never stopped in. Finally I yelped it and saw such great reviews so my husband and I decided to check it out. Tons of tv's. Great and friendly service. The FOOD IS GREAT! My husband asked if they could put the cubs game on one of the tv's and they did with no problem. Our server Lizzy was very friendly and attentive.  I had a flatbread with tomato, mushroom, spinach, and cheese. It was amazing! Great flavor and crispy flatbread.  My husband got a combo of cheese burger sliders and pulled pork slider with merkz cheddar cheese. Those are great as well. Good prices and specials too. We will be back.

45.description: Was with some friends on our way to catch a flight at ORD and had a few hours to kill two Sundays ago.   We wanted a spot with plenty of TVs and some good food and beer.  This place delivered.   John the owner was very friendly, wait staff took extremely good care of us (five guys) and we had all the food and drink we could handle.  I find if you seek out the owner, say hello and are not abusive of the wait staff and say please and thanks a lot, you are probably 95% better than any other customer and will get treated as such.

33.description: First time trying out this place and it was great! Heard from friends that the food was great so I had to try it my self, first off the atmosphere is very relaxing with a mix of people and age groups that complement it very well. Feels like a neighborhood bar but with great food. The service was exeptional better than most fine dining places Ive been to. Their seating is also great with a large bar, booths and tables in the center, And the music is also well mixed with a bit of everything from hip-hop to country music that will sure delight everyones style. Great spot will recomend to all my friends keep up the good work City tap!

43.description: Beer and wings, as good as it gets. The atmosphere is loud just as it should be in a sports bar, but there are booths that give more privacy. Def coming back
