2.description: I have walked past this place every Saturday for about a year now and finally stoped in this Saturday. Nice bar area with large windows that open to the sidewalk for people watching. I had the chorizo smash burger, pretty good. If a food establishment serves Angus beef or even better Certified Angus beef they seem to have their finger on the pulse of quality food with a menu to back it up, and they serve Angus beef.Also good music is played here.

18.description: Good drinks, servers are very friendly, enough tvs to make it a local spot to watch a game, you will not brag about their food but it'll fill up your belly.

41.description: The place is nice if you want to have a drink and a nice conversation, the music is not to loud, is my first time here the Burger was exceptional, the best is the price $5 and $3 drafts, is a good place to grab a bite and a couple of beer; definitely I coming back!!

52.description: Every time we have been here we get the friendliest servers! The food is always very good. Had the sliders - special on Wed. So good!

50.description: Very friendly waitstaff, as soon as we sat down, a waitress greeted us with a smile. She informed us about all the Friday drink/food specials. Great food, the jump chicken wings were smothered in Diablo sauce and couldn't have been better. The meat was as delicious as it was moist and the flavor just exploded in my mouth. The 312 and the Cane and Abel I had were as crisp as they were cold, the experience couldn't have been better.I would definitely recommend this place to anybody and I can't wait to go back.

4.description: I ordered wings and fries on a Sunday for pick up by calling city tap. I asked for 20 siracha and  bbq boneless wings. When i came to pick then up the bill was $24... I notified the waitress that they have 50 cent wings today but she said it doesnt count when it is boneless and for pick up .... Why wasn't i notified this over the phone. Why isn't this on the website. If i knew i wasnt going to 50 cent wings i wouldnt have wasted my time with this place. Even after notifying the waitress she said i would of told you over the phone but i didnt take your order. Ok ... So who's fault is it? Mine for not mine reading or yours for waiting last minute to have me come to the restaurant and pay full price with not posting saying that it is for dining in traditional wings The wings would of been good if i wasnt over charged for their mistake.

6.description: Pretty cool local sports bar. Casual ambiance, nice decor with plenty of seating.The food was very good, portions sizable and service excellent. Our server was great and checked on us often without being overbearing. Another server asked us if we don't mind if she changes the channel on the TV that was directly over our table - I thought that was considerate.The only reason that I am taking off a star is due to their small beer selection: mostly IPAs and mainstream stuff. I get that most people like and want that, but I'm a stout, porter and Belgian ale girl. I would definitely come back here for food, but will stick with my local craft bar for booze.

22.description: I am a huge fan of wings. The wings have A TON of flavor. Even the Diablo (where most places lack is to bring the heat with the flavor) Very friendly atmosphere.

15.description: This place is a great bar and grill with really good food!They have great everyday specials.Definitely recommend this place!

57.description: Awesome food. Had the grilled cheese, triple decker and nacos. Incredible waitress too!

20.description: This place is amazing best special's ever.The special on Sundays is get 10 wings for five bucks! Plus they have mamosas for 3 dollars. The beer of the month is always 3. Definitely it's worth coming here to enjoy a game or just to hang out with friends. The menu prices aren't bad at all its very affordable. They have indoor and outdoor sitting available.  Parking is always easy to find. They services is fantastic! They also have 5 dollar burger's on Tuesday!

36.description: Amazing staff, cold beers, and delicious food!  Try the Mac and cheese with chicken and the slider special (Wednesday's).  $3 draft beer of the month is usually pretty good too!

14.description: I have been curious to come to this place since they opened and finally did a couple of months ago for a date.  My date wanted to watch the Blackhawks game and I wanted a cocktail so this place met both our wants. Inside there were big screen tv's on each corner so no matter where you sit you can watch the games.  The tv's weren't so loud though that we couldn't carry a conversation with the person next to you,  which was great. The inside of this place was very nice like a sports bar you would expect to find downtown but in the suburbs. We enjoyed our drinks and they weren't that expensive (not for me at least). The server we had a very nice and knowledgeable of their drink menu and specials. She also knew when to return without being overbearing.  They have a kitchen opened late and a delicious looking menu which I need to come back and try.

3.description: I priced out new sofas, but since I really like the way our sofa fit our space, and how much we spent intially, I decided to reupholster ours which turned out to be less than half of a new one. I try to shop and spend locally, but couldn't find an upholsterer that I felt comfortable with in our hip and trendy neighborhood. I was referred to Vito's by a friend of my husband who is very particuliar. Vince estimated my large sectional sofa and told me exactly how long it would take, when he could pick it up, and updated me thru out the process. His company showed up as promised, and delivered as promised. Absolutely zero obstacles. Even with all of the cushions being replaced, the cost was  somewhat less than I was quoted by a local upholsterer without cushion replacement. Vito's Upholstery offers fabric, but I had already had purchased my own. I'm doing the dining room chairs next.

1.description: Vito's was one of 3 upholstery companies from whom I got quotes to reupholster a very collectible bedroom bench that I inherited. They were highly recommended by the company that refinished the bench, so I was surprised when their quote was the lowest of the three. Vito's small pickup/return charge on top of the low quote ($50 r/t) helped me decide to save the work of schlepping the bench up to their shop and back. They also estimated that they'd need less upholstery material than the other companies (4yds as opposed to 6 yards), and they were fine with me finding and supplying the material to them for the job. They estimated 2 weeks for the bench, and they got it done in just a bit over that, and the upholstery job was very well done.  Of course since it is so nice, I now have it covered to protect it from our pets. Good price, good communication, and a high quality job.

2.description: I had some cabinetry work done to enlarge a TV space in an existing bookcase. They did a great job. Vince came out one day and did some measurements and gave me the estimate by email by the next day! Who does that? It was such a surprise. Within a few days, two guys came out to get a paint sample and do final measurements. One week later, they came and installed. Very efficient! I had no problems at all and highly recommend them for cabinet work. I will be using him for some upholstery work when I find the fabric, too!

0.description: I needed to have two pieces of furniture reupholstered and was wavering between reupholsterinig or buying new furniture. Although I liked my furniture, I didn't want to pay through the nose for updating my well-used pieces. I requested an estimate from Vito's as well as another upholsterer in the area and found that Vito's offered the best pricing by far.  Communicating via e-mail made the experience very easy and the responses were quick.  I dropped off both pieces (saving the $100 pick up and drop off fee) and was told that they would be ready in three weeks.  They were ready as promised and when I went to pick them up, I found everyone in the shop to be very friendly.  I am very happy with the results and would not hesitate to go to Vito's again.  The business only accepts cash or check.

12.description: This place is special.  The cabbage rolls (stuffed with rice/beef) were pillowy soft and exploding with comfort food flavor and tecture.  The borscht was also delicious but I've got to try their version of the all-in-one soup (don't recall the name), I'm told.  Everything was delicious, made with care.  Small kitchy storefront, some parking in rear.  Worth the trip, 1/2 mile west of 90 on Irving Park...

3.description: I am used to Russian/Ukrainian cuisine so I'm biased as far as judging about the food. I'm just gonna say it's as good as I could expect. And having tried various dishes from many cuisines around the world, some of which were super delicious, I would still say Russian/Ukrainian cuisine is the best in the world. By variety of dishes and their unique taste. If you never tried anything on the menu you can't go wrong with the Chanahi soup. Not to diminish the goodness of other items, they're all deli. It's a small place and on the weekdays I never saw more than three people in there. However, it can get pretty crowded on the weekends so you may not find free tables. And that's where the missing star kicks in the action.. their staff is shorthanded and they were having hard time delivering my order in a timely fashion even though I called 20 minutes ahead.

1.description: It is my favorite Ukrainian restaurant in chicago. Small but very cozy and inviting. Food is delicious. Recommending to all of my friends . Thank you for keeping it authentic.

2.description: One of my favorite places in Chicago. Its so authentic and remind me home for 100 %.I know the taste of food from early childhood and it exactly the same like I remember. Isn't the highest level of satisfaction?...

9.description: Nothing fancy and it's a very small place. They only accept cash. They do not speak much English but the menu is in English, so all you have to do is point. If you are looking for Ukrainian / Russian food, this is the place to go. Very inexpensive. My favorite is the stuffed cabbage and potato pancakes (with mushroom sauce). They do not serve alcohol. Oh and I had a soup (can't remember the name) they say it's spicy, it not spicy but it was very good.

10.description: Love this place! Everything is delicious here! We keep coming back and trying something new every time and it's always a hit!

4.description: Very good Ukrainian cuisine. Very authentic. Very delicious borshch and verenyky, potato and meat are the best. And can forget to drink it with a glass of kompot. Iuna was a very good waitress attended us very professional and made sure we we're good.

6.description: Hidden, tiny place with no indication of what kind of food. Pleasantly surprised by Ukrainian food. Beet salad, pea salad were delicious!  Potato pancakes crispy and delicious! Potato dumplings were great too..but kind of a lot of oil...overall great value and great food

0.description: On a recent trip to Chicago, my (part Ukrainian) boyfriend wanted to get some authentic Ukrainian food. I've never had the cuisine before, so we decided on the Magic Jug because the menu looked the most authentic. A small space with an unassuming brick and glass store front, you might miss it if you weren't looking closely. But the moment you step inside, you're magically transported through time and space to a Ukrainian grandma's house! You can see her in the kitchen, rolling out dough, as you sit down amidst the wood-covered walls and traditional woven tablecloths. All around you are traditional paintings of smiling Ukrainian girls, poppies, and mermaids, and a little wooden Ukrainian bear greets you from the napkin holder on the table.The server brought a basket of bread and butter right to our table when we ordered. There were two kinds of bread, one looked plain white, the other was hearty sunflower seed. It had a crust of crunchy sunflowers and what tasted like anise sprinkled across the top. Then came our golubtsi--what my boyfriend calls Ukrainian egg rolls. They are cabbage leaves stuffed with warm meat, rice, and spices and served with fresh dill sprinkled on top and a side of sour cream. The golubtsi were cooked to perfection; the cabbage leaves were soft enough so that you could easily cut through them, making me think they had maybe been boiled, but there was a perfect golden crispness on top. When I get a dish colored in shades of beige and wrapped in cabbage leaves, I expect it will be pretty bland. So I was happily surprised when these unassuming cabbage rolls were bursting with meaty, spicy, herby flavor. The fresh dill and sour cream lightly counterbalanced the savory, warm filling.Next, our pelmeny were served in an earthenware jug, and it really was magical. Pelmeny are small, buttery, chewy dumplings filled with ground meat and onion. They came to us piping hot with a hearty sprinkle of dill on top. When I cut one in half, the buttery, golden sauce it was cooked in came oozing out and made everything else on my plate that much happier. About the size of a golf ball, I could have eaten at least 30 of these. I imagined myself sitting in a wooden Ukrainian hut on a frozen January day, warmed inside and out with a steaming little jug of pelmeny.Last in our tour of savory dishes was the cheburek, a fried meat pie. It was a pocket of dough about the size of a dinner plate folded in half, again filled with spicy ground meat. The meat mixture was similar to the others, spicy, hot, oniony and dilly, and similarly delicious. The dough was freshly made, with a delightful flaky texture fried to golden brown perfection. To finish off the meal, we ordered what was labeled simply as "sweet" in the English menu translation. It turned out to be two thin crepe-like pastries filled with a sweet cheese filling, fairly similar to cheese blintzes. The sweets were sprinkled with powdered sugar, drizzled with fruit sauce and served with whipped cream and chocolate sauce on the side. Even though we finished the meal feeling as stuffed as the golubtsi, the bill was surprisingly small!Come to the Magic Jug if you want to be whisked away to delightful Ukrainian flavors, charm, and hospitality.

5.description: You should try this place, it's a small family owned place, ascetically pleasing atmosphere, with Ukrainian/pop music playing in the background, but let's talk about the food. Home made, delicious and rich flavored food is what you can expect here. Chanakhy is the reason i drive here from Skokie, but everything else tasted good too, they take no shortcuts in the food making.

13.description: My latest "friend" told me about this restaurant across from Merrimac Park. It is small (10 tables) but very inviting and cozy. Well, I am not here for decor but to try Ukranian food made from scratch. The first thing I noticed is the kitchen which you cannot avoid seeing. The "lady" cooks are busy preparing the days fare. It does help to know an Eastern European language. My friend knows Belarus, Russian, Polish, and German. All of our bases were covered.She suggested we start with Pickle Soup/Solianka. Made in a beef broth are the pickles, chopped smoked beef and finely cut carrots. The bowl was substantial and delicious. We also ordered cucumber and tomato salade. Our entrees differed. My lady ordered the Pechenia, roasted prok with potato pancakes. Pork is the most popular meet in most of eastern Europe. Pigs are more abundant than other meats. I had the Shashlyc which is seasoned pork in a rich sauce with tomatoes, mushrooms, onions and green peppers. Great! We passed on the Golubtsi (Golombki or stuffed cabbage rolls) and Nalysnyaky (I call them crepes) with varied fillings. At reasonable prices, we will be back to try other items on their menu.It is that great out of the way hideaway that you don't want the multitudes to know about. We will return.JohnnyChitown

11.description: Caterina is a boss lady.  She is clearly the brains behind this place--in appearance, it's just a cedar-walled room about the size of a sauna, with some traditional folk art on the walls (it's painted on glass, with gold accents--I bought one for my parents of a couple posing next to a pig.  Caterina looked at and proudly laughed, "Hmph! These are Ukrainian people.") I found this place as a total fluke before my second semester of Chemistry on a blustery, wintery night at Wright College....I wanted something that wasn't instant ramen, and wasn't from the cafeteria vending machine.  I ended up here, just happy I was somewhere inside and warm! I ordered something called Deruny, which is like potato latkes-type pancakes, with a salty stew on top. It was phenomenal. I also got their signature, a flaky cheburek--a really wide, flat fried dough with seasoned meat inside.  It had a bunch of dill and parsley seasoning it, it was perfection! I'm not sure if it's an appetizer, because it's only $3, but it was substantially filling. I ended up going every other week, and my go-to was the half-order of pelmeny, a dumpling with seasoned pork folded inside, and either a cheburek or one of their beet salads.  If it was a really good day, I got one of their cakes and their coffee (a hint of raspberry flavor, not too obvious) for dessert.  It was always up in the air what kind of cake would show up, but they had superfine sugar decorating the plate, and some syrup on top. The flourless chocolate cake was phenomenal, but--hold the phones--a couple of times I had an all-out Pavlova-style cake, with cream filling and flakey crust. I DIED! So good. For some reason, it took me a whole year to try their borscht--why?? They ruined me for other borscht, before or after. I sadly don't live anywhere near Magic Jug anymore, but if I ever got to trip the light fantastic on Check Please, it would be a no brainer--I'd be all about this place.

8.description: Last night, my husband and I stopped in for dinner at Magic Jug at around 7 at night.  At first, we almost didn't enter the restaurant because the windows looked dark (we thought they might be closed), but when we saw the hours of operation on the door and the neon "open" sign in the window, we decided to go ahead. Upon entering the restaurant, we noticed that it was dark from the outside because it was actually quite dark inside. There were maybe 2 lights for the whole 8 table dining room, which gave the restaurant a very intimate feeling. The fact that we were the only customers there the whole time we had dinner only increased that feeling.The food we ordered was *super* delicious. I ordered the cheburek, and Adam ordered a large serving of meat pyrogy. We also had some drink that was like a fruit tea, served cold in mugs. It was tasty, and the bill at the end only came to $13! I wish I had ordered a little more because I was still a little hungry when we left, but now I know for next time.The only things that made me slightly uncomfortable was that there was no music (dining in silence is a little awkward) and our waitress *barely* spoke English (though she was very friendly). I think she may have been new to the restaurant, because when we asked for a carry-out menu, another member of staff had to show her what we were talking about.Overall, it was a good experience. I would recommend this place because of the quality of the food and the value for the price. My only suggestion would be to either come during daylight hours so that you can see your food better or order their amazing food for carry-out.

14.description: went today for lunch and it has a license suspended sign on door.Wonder what happen,was good a couple of weeks ago.

7.description: after living in the neighborhood for 12 yrs, we never noticed this restaurant because there is no real signage or anything to indicate it's a restaurant, especially with the name Magic Jug. It was a pleasant surprise. the pierogi reminded me of my mother-in-laws as well as the borsch soup. There's not much of a selection, but what they do have is quite tasty and delicious, very hardy. I was disappointed there was no Chicken Kiev, but maybe that's an american dish, just like the burrito is not a mexican dish. the waitress are friendly but service was slow. Which i don't mind, because i never felt pressured to leave. they also didn't speak the best english and at times it was hard to communicate, but it was no big deal. we will definitely go back for the stuff cabbage, pierogis, and soup

3.description: I used my Living Social deal for a mani/pedi here. My specialist was Maya, who despite being in her early twenties, blew me away with her thoroughness and professionalism. Some manicurists would just ignore slightly smeared or chipped nails, but Maya pointed them out before I could notice & redid both nails. My manicure lasted 12 days, while my pedicure lasted 30 days! I'm somewhat of a late bloomer, so I learned from her that applying base coat first prevents nail polish from yellowing your nails over time. She also gave me very useful fashion tips, since I was going to a party the next day. I'd definitely return using the 20% discount they provide for both you and a friend! They need at least 24h notice, so just book an appointment during the daytime, since it's not as safe to walk around the area in the evenings.

1.description: A+++++Ask for Sandy, she did an amazing job on my hair. Highlights, ombre and a trim and style. Price was right, she is very professional and my hair came out perfect. She also accommodated me and let me come in early when no one was in and put up a partition- I wear a hijab (head covering) and its almost impossible to find a shop that will accommodate the fact that men or male passerby's can't see me uncovered. She kindly put up a partition and worked behind it. It's not rocket science but considering the other 10 places asked like I was asking for their first born child to be sacrificed, it was refreshing she had no problem helping me. This place is the best and Sandy is an excellent hair stylist!

2.description: Very nice staff, cute place. Came in for their weekend blow out special for $15 and was in and out in an hour. That never happens in my world...ever.Small problem: Not a very chatty stylist which contributed to me getting out of there within an hour, but  silence is quite awkward.Even smaller solution: Start a conversation or turn on the radio.

5.description: Yesterday was my first time at this salon, Let me start off by saying the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The place is very nice, and looks very clean. The hair stylist from what I seen look very well trained and very professional, Went there with my cousin she had her hair colored and it looks amazing, Job well done. I believe the colorist name was Maya(not sure if I spelled it right). I had a mani/pedi  and my eyebrow's done by Sandy, and I was very satisfied  with her services. They also took care of both of my nephew's hair cut. Over all I was very happy with the service and recommend you all to check it out.  In case you are wondering all prices are very reasonable. and at the end you will leave the salon looking and felling Beautiful. :)

6.description: I bought the LivingSocial, and like many other yelpers, I was extremely disappointed. Sure the staff were nice, but the poor girl they had doing my nails seemed like she wasn't trained at all. It took a good 2 hours for a mani/pedi and she did a really bad job. It was like she didn't know what she was doing at all. She kept stopping and looking up (like she was trying to remember what came next). She also kept getting up and going to the back room for a second then coming back (so weird!). What a joke! I really think I could have done a better job on myself!!! Oh, and my nails chipped within 48 hours. Ugh.

7.description: The mani/pedi I received with a living social deal was really nice. The woman def took her time (it took 2hrs) but my nails looked great.

8.description: I found this place on living social and I must say I found a winner.  I brought my twin girls, my bff and my fiance and they all loved it.  Mya and Sandy (i think is her name) are awesome.   There's a 3rd girl there that's always doing hair when I'm there and she is Awesome as well.  I don't let anyone style or cut my hair but my daughter which is away in College so I may try her out one day.  I'm sure she'd do a great job.

0.description: Got a haircut and blow dry from here a few days ago. I love that Sandy didn't shorten my hair, she just trimmed the split ends like I asked and the blow dry was also nice.

4.description: I recently purchased a coupon through Living Social, along with my friend. We decided we would use it and made an appointment since it is by appointment only.  it was the day before Christmas Eve which of course there was traffic galore. We do call to let her know we were a little late, which she said it was okay. Let me first inform that we drove a little over one hour to get to this place.   We get there all frazzled since we had been driving over and hour. Once we enter, the girls that work there, literally turn around and gave us the meanest look. I understand it is the day before Christmas Eve and maybe they had some Xmas shopping to do, but in my book customers are greeted and treated right as soon as they enter. So, after getting the mean looks from the girls working there, they inform us that they can't take us. We explained we called saying we would be 10 minutes late and the girl on the phone said it was okay.  Needless, to say, we weren't seen. They offered to only do our pedicure but not both- mani/pedi. Well, now we have to reschedule and quite frankly, I don't even want to bother with it. I know they are a fairly new business, but maybe taking a customer service etiquette class would help them with their business.

3.description: Excellent service and great prices! Went in looking for a mattress on Sunday during Memorial Day weekend. My new mattress was delivered in less that 24 hours, on a holiday no less! I was told that this mattress would last me 20 years, so I won't be back for a while! But if my friends need one, I will definitely point them in this direction!

1.description: Laura and Christina were so helpful and provided the best mattress for us. I would recommend this place to everyone.

2.description: Very helpful and friendly service from Chad and Robert.  I told them what I needed and they gave me several options.  Delivery options are optimal and prices are excellent.  Can't wait to sleep better!!

9.description: This is an update to just clarify one thing. NO ONE EVER came to my home to inspect this mattress below mentioned, so the comment dear Kevin left is false. A bold face lie. So, to reiterate my original statement, The Bedding Experts, should change their name to "The Bedding Losers" because they have absolutely no idea how to treat their customers, have sub below par customer service, they're rude and a bunch of lying thieves. I have a way more comfortable mattress and bed now from Ashley furniture and it just goes to show you, if you're trying to save some money, just don't and pay for quality bedding. Don't go to a rip off place such as this. Thank you.

10.description: I needed a cheap full mattress to take with me. Talked to some guy at American mattress and was given the cold shoulder the minute I said I needed a cheap mattress, Tony at this location didn't have it in stock but found it at a nearby location and had the manager at the Milwaukee/Pulaski location hold it for me while I drive over. There was no pressure and he was respectful even though my purchase was relatively small. I know I'm going to talk to Tony at Bedding experts over the douche at American mattress when I need a bed for myself. Karma son!!! The service here was above and beyond anything I found at nearby stores.

4.description: I was skeptical about going in at first because the store looked small but they were really nice and inviting and had more beds than I thought, to look at. We didn't feel too much pressure to drop two thousand bucks today, so that was nice... Buying a bed is a big decision for us and we wanted to make sure we were getting the best, most comfortable/durable bed for our buck! We got great info on the beds we tried out and were even offered a water on a warm spring day! Bob is a very understanding person with a clear head, we talked about beds in conversation with a sense of humor, I would say he's an all around stand up guy. He helped us figure out WHAT we were looking for as far as upgrading from our last bed and was very informative, now it's just up to us to make our decision and I think we will go back to Bob once we've made it! Thanks for making this experience as stress-less as it can be! They even offer great financing options.

6.description: Bad kitty!  Bad kitty!I came home to find the the cat left a little present on my son's bed, instead of in the litter box.  Needless to say, it was time for a new mattress. I popped into bedding experts and found just what I was looking for- an inexpensive twin mattress that came home with me that night. Tony, the store manager, was great to work with.  He gave me a fair price , knew his products and seemed to be a genuine and good guy. Thanks Tony!

11.description: My wife and I bought a mattress set from the bedding experts store in Norridge, on Forest Preserve Drive on 09-05-09, the mattress we got it is suppose to be the best mattress they sell, but a few days after we got it home, we went back to the store because my wife and I will wake up with back pain from sleeping on the new mattress, the sales man at the store told us that we have to give it time, but after 14 days, we still have back pain. They exchange the mattress, but we still have the sane effect, now the warranty person that I talked to, is telling me that there is a 90 day warranty exchange, and we have to pay 99.00 dollars to have an inspector came to our house and see if in fact there is something wrong with the mattress. I took pictures. The mattress is not comfortable and it sags in the area where we sleep, it does not go back to its original form, (the mattress has a memory foam pillow top), and there are wrinkles as if the material stretched and do not go back to look nice and puffy.

5.description: This was honestly the most comfortable I have ever felt making a major purchase. Bob Zagone, the salesman, was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful, honest and friendly. Also, he asked all the right questions to make sure the mattress I found was the perfect for all my needs. He made sure to stay within my budget and not once did not try to up sell me! Also, they delivered the mattress on time and I got a call on the same night form customer care to make sure I got the mattress and everything is ok. I had a great experience and I recommend it to anyone in the market for a new bed.

7.description: 2007 I purchase a mattress box spring and frame and headboard, so i dish out about $2,700. in 2010 my Sealy mattress starts to have a sag in it. I go through the warranty and i pay $50.00 to have some one come out and inspect my mattress. after the inspection the mattress was found to be faulty so I go in pick out a new Sterns and Foster  and pay another 300 to upgrade to this better mattress.6 months later my new mattress is now doing the exact same thing. I pay another $50.00 for an inspector to come look at the mattress and see what the issue is. they find that my box spring is solid and my frame is fine the mattress has a defect BUT they can not change it because the warranty says the mattress must have a inch and a half sag before the warranty can replace the mattress. my mattress only had an inch and a quarter sag. i was informed after speaking to some one at corporate that i had to wait for the mattress to sag another quarter of an inch before they could do anything for me. well i understand we all have procedures but really a quarter of an inch? so Bad back and Sleep Apnea i have to try and sleep on this bed till we get another quarter of an inch in this sag. I now move into a new house and inform The Bedding Experts that i am moving and make sure that my warranty issue is still going to be taken care of because i need to buy split box springs because my full size queen box spring will not make it up the stairs in my new house. $200 later i get box springs from the Skokie location they recommend the box springs i need for the mattress i have so i buy them and get home and set up my bed.At this point i cant even sleep on my bed without actually using a pillow in this valley of a sag i have in my mattress so i stay level in the bed. I call in my warranty figure we are way past this extra quarter of an inch sag we need to complete my warranty.  i have some one come out February 2nd they were fast and really nice came out found my mattress was sagging more than 2 and a half inches and the side was caving in also. well were good for the warranty right?i hear nothing for 2 weeks i call and was told due to the holidays they were backed up and 2 weeks would be more like 4. Fair enough i wait the 4 weeks and  nothing. i walk into this location 3 months to the day and was told that my warranty was denied due to the fact that the box springs i had because they did not support the mattress i have. well how can that be when the store recommended that i have those particular box springs for my mattress? No idea. I made one call to corporate, and i have no idea what happened but once they pulled up my info up they told me they were sorry for the inconvenience but if i purchased the correct box springs for another $160 they would credit me for the ones i have now and deliver my new mattress and box springs at this point just desperate for a good night sleep i buy the new box springs and have my new bed delivered a week later. were on mattress number 3!! and if we are doing the math... I spent a pretty good penny on this bed. all i have to say is if this happens again with this mattress there can not be any excuses and i will not be buying another one or spending more to upgrade to anything else. Lets see what happens!As far as this location Gene is a cool guy and has always helped me out when i want in for my issues so i feel for giving it a low score.

8.description: I walked into this location a few weeks ago. Didn't buy anything. Tony was very difficult to deal with. Went to Sheffield location bought a few mattresses. I came back here to buy the mattress covers I checked out online. While I was there this guy looked up my order from the other store and was upset I didn't buy from him. No harm meant, I figured same company no big deal.Anyhow, the covers weren't in stock they would come in a few days later. I paid and walked out. To make a long story short, delivery date came, covers late, bought the covers online, called for a refund and this is when the trouble starts.Mr. Tony  leaves me a voicemail telling me to pick up the covers, it's been 14 days and no refund allowed. Really?  I call him back and ask for a manager (I didn't want to even bother with him, I already knew he is very childish) he tells me there is no one to speak but him. I ask for a customer service number he also refuses to give it to me. I honestly said "Please Tony, I don't want to argue with you. Just give me a manager's number to speak to about my refund." He simply says NO! I tell him that I just spent $3,000. with Bedding experts, he replies "you didn't spend it with me." So I say "ok, this is what it's all about, you big fat baby!" I threaten to call my bank, he says he doesn't care, he has a signed copy of my CC receipt. I hang up and call customer service explain, the rep Gene, immediately issued The refund and apologized for Tony's behavior.  I really have never dealt with anyone like him, be very careful if you deal with this guy.

0.description: I went in and the salesman was really nice and really explained everything really well.

3.description: There are no other words for this place other than "stay away".  Dirty.  Reheated.  Nasty.

1.description: If you like hair in your ice cubes and French fries then this place is the place for you! Let's start off by saying this is a prime location for business, and they don't deserve it. The family operated business is in the heart of the dunning area with a park and school right next door. You would think this would be a booming buisnness, but most people in the neighborhood will only go in here to get a quick Pac man game in. The French fries are never cooked through and like I said enjoy the hair on it. The burgers and hot dogs are 2.6/10. The downfall was getting rid of the poppie seed buns for the dogs. The Italian ice is the only thing this disgusting place has to offer. Also I am convinced they have a secret tunnel to Hiawatha park. Let's hope we get a new joint in here prime location, and it's getting ruined with this hot garbage they put out there.

2.description: This is a consistently good stop for burgers, dogs, tacos and fries. The fries are fresh cut fries that taste like real potatoes. Nice people good value.

5.description: I had a taste for a burrito and this was the only place I could find nearby. Now normally I would avoid places like this because it looks like it's rat infested, everything inside is outdated and screams remodeling. It was also a hot day and they didn't have an air conditioner, I thought I was going to die before I got to eat. I ordered steak burrito. It came with all the trimmings: lettuce, tomato, sour cream, cheese, and sauteed onions (I loved the sauteed onions that gets them an extra star). It was a good size and not that expensive. I wouldn't say it was the best I've ever had, but it was decent. I didn't like the salsa that was just horrible. I also tried the steak taco, it was BIG. I didn't like the tortilla it came on but the meat was good. Overall, it was ok.

6.description: OK, you figure a place in a central location on Addison & Forest Preserve, across the street from Hiawatha Park and half a block from St. Francis Borgia Church and school would be booming with business. Not if the place is a dump like Chucho's. I used to come here occasionally when I lived in the area and I recall it being better. It's a tiny dog & burger joint on the triangular island bounded by the major streets and a connecting road behind it. It existed under at least 2 other guises over the past decade. The sign used to say "Soon to be Famous." Well, not soon enough. The current sign on the back wall outside listed their offerings and I saw they had "Autentic" Mexican food too.The outside may have gotten a new paint job and facelift, but it's still a dump inside. I was with the kids in the area and after playing, so we came in for a quick dinner. I got a Maxwell Polish and my son got a plain hot dog. The baby was going to share some of our fries and onion rings, plus stuff I brought just for him. Strike 1: A high chair was not an option since they had none. There was a lone black table but all the seats were tall stools on which it's hard to sit for a kid and reach the countertop. So we thought we'd take this table instead. Strike 2: The table had a dried-up sticky spot that covered about 90% of its surface. Seeing this mess, I let my 23-month old son eat off the countertop instead while semi-standing on the stool. If he was not a stunt-baby at home, I probably would have been terrified of his eating position standing about 3 feet off the ground. He proved his balance and agility to be superb as he made it through the meal without falling off the stool.I was unimpressed with my Polish. I wasn't sure if it's Vienna Beef, as I saw no signage for Vienna inside. That's a bad omen, if you ask me. The only decor on the walls was a faded little league sponsorship photo plaque from 2000. Anyway, my bun was soggy wet and fell apart on me immediately. I mushed it together to glue it to the sausage a little.As we finished up our meal, we saw old Galaga and Ms Pac-Man video game consoles, with worn-out artwork and burned-in screens. Strike 3: The Galaga machine was really a Mappy video game in disguise. I would've played Galaga to show my son the classic game, but I guess not.Anyway, if I can give a Strike 4, it cost us almost $10 for a plain hot dog, Polish, fries and onion rings. I know other divey places like this are much cheaper.Sorry Chucho's, you won't get famous this way!

7.description: This place sucks PERIOD..i don't know why the board of health hasn't closed this dive...the fuckin hot dogs were brown in n out the fries greasy as all hell..i doubt sincerely there vienna beefs if even a beef dog period..the inside i'm surprized didn't have any roachs in it atleast..they painted the outside an did shit inside.. i'll take my biz over to BOBO'S ON IRVING PK..little farther of a ride for me but well worth it..stay away

0.description: I am still dreaming about their french fries. Good God! They were so perfect and fresh! Even my boyfriend, who isn't the biggest french fry fan loved them. The tacos weren't out of the ordinary, but I would totally come back just for the fries.

4.description: Not sure what others are seeing here. Found it to be a family owned and run business which was effective and efficient. Hot dogs were way better than Gene and Jude's as were the fries. Good price, excellent food, hope their business gets better!

28.description: I don't know anyone who can pass a Thrift Shop without at least looking in the window. I know I can't. And once I've peered through the glass, I always see something I want to buy. Once inside, I usually buy at least six or seven things, whether I need them or not! But, that's the fun part. A friend of mine used to say, "A Thrift Shop is really just a yard sale with a rental lease...and who doesn't love a yard sale?" But, Thrift & Thrive is not just a thrift shop: there's a lot more going on behind those doors than meets the eye. These people are committed to making your community a better place to live. So, please, go and visit Melissa and Joe, and see why they are making such a positive impact on your community. You'll be making two new friends, and you'll probably find a few things you absolutely must have...even if you don't need them!Vincent P. Roccosalvo

1.description: While scanning through craigslist I found this kitchen cart I just had to have. Then I realized the CL seller was a store. I followed the click bait to their facebook and was happy to find pictures and prices of all their items. I called and they confirmed they had the item in stock. While they don't do holds, the sales woman offered to call me if anyone else expressed interest. I hurried down and nearly passed the store front. I browsed through their inventory: clothes upstairs, furniture/housewares downstairs. I located the kitchen cart and it was brought upstairs for me. The entire transaction was seamless! I wish they had cleaned the item prior to selling. It was clearly from a house with a car and my allergies instantly alerted me to this. Great price, great item, great service. A must visit if you are in the market for some DIY project furniture.

9.description: I'm in love with this place!  It's super clean and the people are always friendly. I've found some amazing treasures here and their prices great.  I've even found a few brand new items here really cheap!  And...they give coupons!!!  What's not to love?

29.description: Thrift & Thrive is another awesome reason to venture to the NW side of Chicago! It's a welcome addition to Irving Park Road, and I sure hope it's here to stay for a while. It's bright, clean, and stocked full of great bargains. It's NOT your typical resale shop that reeks and looks like your grandma's closet. I found two pairs of like new pants for $11 total and it was the highlight of my week! You can tell the minute you enter the store that its layout is carefully thought out. The fitting room is essentially a small bathroom, but is sufficient as it has a full length mirror and a wall hook. Just don't drop any of your items in the toilet! ;) Clothes, jewelry, shoes, kitchen items, books, house decor, and more - something for everyone! The owners are super sweet, have great ideas about hosting community events and supporting other local businesses, and are willing to pick up any and all donations.  If you aren't familiar with Portage Park, I suggest you make a trip. Shop at Thrift & Thrive, eat at Las Tarascas, buy candy at Candy Heaven and catch a movie at the Patio. You won't regret it.

23.description: cute, quaint shop! I've been driving by it for so long i never thought to stop by until last week. I'm a daycare teacher and they had a great selection of books for me to choose from and they were definitely at a steal of a price. The owner was a nice guy, took time to tell me a little more about the store and when he opened. I plan on going back again!

5.description: This place is awesome.Friendly people, great layout.My gf and I come here atleast once a week and we almost always find something to buy. And now they have a really great coffee shop across the street.Keep it up!!

31.description: Great addition to the Irving Park Road storefronts.  Definitely fills a gap in the 'cool gently used stuff' genre (as opposed to the 'worn and dusty crap someone else doesn't want' used stores you usually see).  Super cute decor and thoughtful selection of good condition clothes and kids books. Looking forward to seeing a bigger inventory when they really get up and running, and maybe some activities and events!

25.description: This little place popped up just around the bend from my current home just about the time I decided to embrace the concept of voluntary simplicity, meaning lots of donations for me! It does not have the atmosphere many of the nasty thrift stores I've visited in my time, which are plentiful. It is very clean, well organized, and cute. It has an upscale feel with very good prices. All of the items are gently used and clean, and the folks who run the shop are as pleasant as they come. If I had to guess, I would say they will be expanding or moving soon, in favor of a larger space!

12.description: Loved this place. It made my kids and I feel at home. Will definitely be back bc my kids didnt get screamed at like in other places. For moms, its all about our kids, when shopping with our kids. Oh, and they have a wide variety of inexpensive books in their basement. Spent less than $20 and got a coupon for next visit.

21.description: This is a great store! The owner is genuinely nice person who cares about his store and his neighborhood. It is a very clean and organized shop. Definitely worth stopping in and checking it out.

16.description: cute, quaint shop! I've been driving by it for so long i never thought to stop by until last week. I'm a daycare teacher and they had a great selection of books for me to choose from and they were definitely at a steal of a price. The owner was a nice guy, took time to tell me a little more about the store and when he opened. I plan on going back again!

17.description: This place has really grown in the last year!  They have now expanded the store to the basement.  I really do appreciate the organization and cleanliness of the store.  Always think it is worth the trip and come out with some kind of steal!  Follow them on Facebook to see their specials and featured deals!

10.description: My favorite thrift store to visit while in the neighborhood. Owners and staff are friendly and helpful. Clean, very clean :) bathroom.... always clean! Love that I can try on clothes before buying. My daughter enjoys their fun selection of jewelry. Picked up a great scarf a couple weeks ago for $1.99, brand name jeans for $5.00, a couple hats for $1.00 each. It is a small welcoming store. Good to check back in often as merchandise changes.

11.description: Not much I can add that hasn't been said.  Everything mentioned in the other reviews was true, and I will be making special trips to visit in future!  Cheap, clean, well organized, super friendly, and locally owned by neighborhood people.  You can tell they make an effort to only stock items in good quality, and the stuff is also organized by size (never a guarantee when thrifting, but always appreciated).  Cool retro housewares in the basement too.  Treat yourself to a shopping spree, then enjoy a snack or beverage across the street at Perkolater - a great neighborhood coffee shop. which I also loved.

26.description: Thrift and Thrive is a great little store that I found, where else, on Yelp!  The store was tidy and well organized with a lot of different types of items as other mentioned in their posts. I was on the hunt for dining chairs and fabric.  They did not disappoint.  Not only did I find these items, I also found a nice table at a reasonable price, delivered!!  Yes folks, you heard me.  Delivered!  The owners delivered the dining set the next day.  They were very friendly and had an obvious interest in helping to revitalize the community. I'll definitely be back soon!

27.description: What a lovely little addition to the Portage Park neighborhood.I first popped in when I spotted the bright green awning! A tiny place, I've found great deals each time I've stopped by: hip records, fun books, a canning funnel and a postage scale!The personal attention to detail is unmistakable. The location across from the Patio Theater is convenient as well!The only downside is that they don't accept credit cards ... I'd spend so much more!

0.description: The great thing about thrift stores is that if you are patient enough, you might just find some really great pieces.  Walking into T&T you have already found something special. The first floor is resale clothing and accessories but the basement is where the vintage finds are at. I wandered downstairs first and found it full of furniture, home decor, clothing, glassware.  My favorite finds were a 60s era jacket in perfect condition and an armchair that just needs a bit of work. Both floors are full of items so you really should take your time if you can to really check it out. I forgot the name of the gal working there but she was super friendly and really fun to talk to. Because I had purchased a coffee at Perkolator earlier (same owners!) I received 10% off my purchases that day. A vintage Tshirt for my son (1989 is vintage for him!), a skirt and that 60's jacket for me--special finds from a wonderful store!

20.description: This place has really grown in the last year!  They have now expanded the store to the basement.  I really do appreciate the organization and cleanliness of the store.  Always think it is worth the trip and come out with some kind of steal!  Follow them on Facebook to see their specials and featured deals!

19.description: This is a great store! The owner is genuinely nice person who cares about his store and his neighborhood. It is a very clean and organized shop. Definitely worth stopping in and checking it out.

2.description: It's a cute neighborhood thrift store.  The atmosphere is very, very different from those regional thrift stores you may have known (Unique and Village Discount Outlet).  The young men who worked there were easy-going; they made us feel comfortable sticking around without being awkward.  Hubby immediately noticed the presences of vinyls to the left upon entering, so I guess he would station there while I was exploring around the rest of the store.  The first floor is consisted of men's, women's, and toddlers' clothing, accessories and footwear.  The CDs, vinyls, and cassette tapes can also be found on this floor.  They have a basement, which is consisted of furniture, electronics, kitchen miscellanies, toys, vintage clothing, and books.  They utilized the space well by merchandizing as much as they could.  Unlike other thrift stores, the basement was crowed, but I didn't at all feel claustrophobic.  It was a pleasure for me to browse through.  Coming back up the ground floor, hubby was still working on perusing the vinyls.  I took a detailed look at the clothing here.  They were pretty seasonably-priced for a thrift-store standard.  As I've said on the previous paragraph, the entire store was very-organized and prices were marked very clearly as well.  I think Thrift & Thrive is a great neighborhood shop to stop by and check out every once in awhile.  I also received a 10% Yelp check-in offer to use on three (3) vinyls we purchased.  The total was $4 and some change.  We also received a coupon that doesn't expire.  We liked the store and will be back since we live close enough to come by public transportation.  There's also a plenty of paid street-parking on the Irving Park Rd.

18.description: ok...as many times as I have been in this store...I mean it has become a weekly visit now...I am ashamed I have not reviewed this awesome store earlier...First, owners and staff are soooo super nice and helpful.  Then the shop itself is super clean and organized.  Upstairs you will find a great selections of clothes and shoes for the entire family...jewelry, baby items...some furnishings...huge vinyl album collection...also a cute little bathroom / fitting room...then you have to proceed to the basement which is stocked with furniture, more furnishings, books, kitchen stuff, toys, a small collection of cute vintage clothing...It is 2 floors of treasure hunting fun!!!  Their pricing is soooo reasonable and is such a great help in these tough economic times.  Just 2 weeks ago, I bought a pair of heeled cute black shoes for work for $3.99 and they have become my favorite pair as they get me through my day in style and comfort...And in all honesty, this became my favorite thrift store quite a while back...

13.description: Love this little shop. I take walks around the neighborhood and always pop in to see what's new! Seems like I always find something too! Very Charming place!

4.description: I stopped in for the first time on a whim. This place is awesome!!!!!!!!!Layout is great, and it is VERY organized. Upstairs is children's clothes, women's & men's clothes, records/tapes/cds. There was even a rack dedicated to Holiday inspired attire. Downstairs is furniture, games, vintage clothing, books, dvds, frames, etc.The staff is so great. We stayed an extra 20 minutes just to chat with them. This thrift store is completely out of my way, and not nearby my house, but I will continue to come back here and recommend to my friends!

24.description: Thrift & Thrive was just ok for me. Selection is pretty limited but prices are fair. It's very cramped inside, but neat. Staff very friendly and accommodating.

6.description: I was in the neighborhood at Eli's (drool) and decided to check out a nearby thrift store before heading home. I really liked this place! Small enough to give a once and twice over without needing to spend all day. I didn't notice a basement other reviewers mentioned but will look for it upon my next visit. The gentleman that assisted us was very personable and added to the charm of the place. Note to germaphobes: the changing room is also the bathroom. It's less than pleasant but serves its purpose: a locked door to change behind. Better than a sketchy curtain in the grand scheme of things.Overall I enjoyed the visit and will definitely be back.

22.description: It's a small place that is hard to miss when driving on Irving Park Rd. Inside it also pretty small but it is clean and organized. Like other Yelpers mentioned it does not smell like other resale shops. The prices are reasonable. The staff was also very welcoming, the gentleman behind the counter greeted us with a smile and was over all friendly during the check out process. I will definitely be back!

15.description: I actually have a few AWESOME decorative items from here that were lucky, vintage finds that my friends DRIP with jealousy for. A pre-1970s globe lamp and a solid wood side table adorn my home office and eclectic living room, thanks to Thrift & Thrive's cool selection of very affordable antiques. I like to pop in here after I get a coffee from Regulus and before I hit the Patio Theater to make the evening movie. Such a great stretch of land for a few hours of great fun!

7.description: Cute little shop and great customer service.

8.description: Wonderful little shop, one of the best kept places I've seen in a long time :) very friendly ^_^

30.description: Love this place! I wandered in with my sister and her newborn daughter. Not only did I find about six pair of incredible vintage earrings ($1 a pair) and a few sweet summer tops ($3) but my sister found some brand-new baby and toddler clothes in excellent condition -- also very cheap. When I was there in early August, they weren't yet accepting debit or credit cards, which turned out to be lucky for me -- I spent every dollar I had with me that day. The family that owns this shop is really sweet and helpful and they even mentioned that they are planning to host community events and classes. What a great addition to the neighborhood.

3.description: Three tips for stopping into Thrift & Thrive:1) Bring a donation! From old kitchen plates to used clothing, Thrift & Thrive will give you a coupon just for helping stock their shelves. Plus you get a tax deduction receipt. Double win!  2) For a sneak peak of furniture at Thrift & Thrive (they really do get some cute pieces), you can just look up "Thrift and Thrive" on Craigslist. I found a cute kitchen bistro table with two chairs for only $40 (it's a little beat up, but nothing a tablecloth can't fix when company is over). 3) Clothes are on the first floor, but vintage clothes have their own rack in the basement. If you are a lover of all things vintage, make sure you stop and check out that spot. Overall, this is a clean and cute place. The owners are really involved in the neighborhood, and own a coffee shop down the street called Perkolator. This is a true "Shop Local" store. If I had my way, they would move their shop to a larger location in the Six Corners strip (their clothes dept needs more space) - and put in a coffee bar. Combine those two things, and I might never leave the shop.

14.description: Friendliest thrift store staff - and the cleanest thrift store I've ever been in. Also, they have loads of neat stuff at really reasonable prices.

1.description: Chicago was devastated when our hometown Maurice Lenell cookie company was bought out by a larger corporate company. First all production was closed in Chicago and moved to Ohio in to a facility that was already producing cookies. Then the Maurice Lenell outlet store here was closed. Now we have this tiny independently owned storefront just south on Harlem from Irving.When the packaging changed I think the flavor changed too. They're still pretty good but there seem to be some supply issues on keeping full stock of Maurice Lenell cookies (especially pinwheels) and costs are a little higher than they used to be. The owners here are nice and it's nice to have a local supply for the cookies but if supply and prices aren't good I have doubts of making the 15 mile drive to get here.For now I'm only giving three stars due to being currently out of stock on Pinwheels and that prices are needlessly inflated. Upon my next visit I'll reconsider my rating depending on what I find.

2.description: You can find the Maurice Lenell cookies and other favorites here. My favorites are the Pinwheels and Almond cookies. Grab a few packs if you live far away. They also ship!

0.description: As the huge Maurice Lennel sign toys with our memories of that awesome cookie factory that used to be on Harlem, it's nice to find them here. Yes they pissed us all off when they moved the factory out of state. Yes they taste a little different. Yes they are still delicious.

28.description: The only thing better then a Polish market is an Asian market, but damn this place is awesome. I came in here b/c I didn't want to pay $5 per lbs for ground beef at Jewel. The prices are not only cheap, but the quality is great. Nice little bakery, great cheese/deli meat section and best of all their meat/fish department has the best prices in the area. $.99 for standard ground beef and only $2.50 for the best?!I also baked a cherry cream cheese pie today. It's still cooling, but it tastes delicious(shh, don't tell anyone I snuck a bite in). Be careful when buying things that are labeled in Polish. I had to spend an extra hour pitting the Cherry's, b/c I bought the wrong ones.Anyways...My bill was $16.21 and I got enough food to last two people until Monday.RAD.

1.description: I want to shop here just because of the service.I am a huge fan of locally owned and family run businesses.  Grocers are even better at this.  I came in simply for some Drano and parked in the private lot for this location in the back.  It is so popular I believe they have an overflow lot a little bit further back as well.  I can't comment on any of the produce but I can tell you that it is a smaller grocery feel with less of the bells and whistles.  This is not a knock it is just a fact that it has a much more homey and local feel.  I found my Drano relatively quickly and proceeded to checkout.  At the checkout they waved me through to the customer service checkout as they saw I only had one item.  She gladly helped me and was extremely kind.  I won't hesitate to stop here in the future and would love to test out the shopping experience.

9.description: Place is great except I didn't appreciate the attitude since I don't speak polish. Whatever I can shop at other places.

29.description: What Super H is for Asian food, Wally's is to Polish specialties. Here, you can find a vast selection of imported food and liquor, a huge deli section, and lots of fresh baked goods to choose from. Around Easter and Christmas, the store is crammed with merchandise specific to the holiday season. They even have a fresh fish table just for those weeks. Wally's has excellent home-made sausages and breads. Belmont Sausage, sold at their store, is also great. While at the deli counter, try their Canadian bacon. Wally's has great prices on deli meats, a pound costing what half a pound would be at Jewel across the street. Fresh meat is also great. They have 95% lean which I use for homemade chili that's lower fat. My only negative about Wally's is that their produce is not the best. They often have beat up, mushy kiwi, squishy mangos, wilted lettuce and bananas that are either too old or too green. Besides Wally's, there's a little indoor Polish mall in the same building. You can buy a cell phone, satellite TV, phone cards, and even a custom built computer, all for the Polish shoppers who come. The parking is usually full seemingly regardless of the hour of the day, but an extension lot across Dakin St. is usually uncrowded. Polish families love to come here dressed up after church, so come on a Sunday morning for some people watching too.

23.description: I like this location better than the one on Milwaukee Ave. Seems more spacious and cleaner. Same great cole slaw, and selection of sausages, soups, yogurt, Polish breads and so on. If you want the imported European Nutella instead of the stuff made in Canada that is standard inventory everywhere else, you can get that here also.Oh, and the perpetual Two Days Crazy Sale? Yep.

5.description: I live close to this food store. I am happy they next to me. They have food bar.  Many choices and not expensive . Many time I'm to tired to cook after work so I go to the store and buy fresh dinner from them . This store has also large choices of products like hams cheese yogurts mustards.  Good bread. The only minus are long lines to cashers.

25.description: This place has, hands-down, the best soups I have EVER tried in my LIFE.I go to the deli section and buy HUGE CONTAINERS of bean soup, barley soup, tomato soup, mushroom soup. I buy them for my friends, I buy them for my mother.  My mother begs me to go get her more. Going here is FUN. I feel like I am in another country. The staff don't evem speak Englizh. So refreshing.The products are wonderful. The Euro-cookie section spans the length of the aisle. Must, must go. A Chicago treasure. Wish it weren't so faaaaarrrr awaaaayyyy.

12.description: They don't have fresh rolls at 8pm... The rest is just fine..

21.description: Wally's is as Polish as you can get.  Not really international so dont expect to find sambal, chilies or Thai fish sauce.  100% Polish.In fact you will hear nothing but Polish spoken.  At the deli counter you have to take a number and wait your turn.  And they have a counter so you can tell when your turn is coming up which is really useful b/c they call out the numbers in Polish not English.  How do you say 79 in Polish?  I dont know.  English is rather limited at the kielbasa section.On your way out the cashiers will give you a quick look to determine if you are Polish or American.  That way they know which language to speak to you in.  Sometimes they just assume that you are Polish.  I highly recommend one of the 100 kinds of kielbasa and deli meats.  These Poles know their pork.  You can get salmon caviar for dirt cheap here too.  And the have sauerkraut in a big barrel in case you want five pounds of it.  I also like some of the prepared foods.  They do good soups like Hunters stew and others.  Pierogies too of course.  After all those delicious meats, their produce dept is really an after thought.  Every December I go there to pick up a bunch of kielbasa, smoked pork shoulder, Danish bacon and my five pounds of sauerkraut and take it down home to New Orleans to make a Choucroute Garnieen.wikipedia.or...for my parents who cant get those sorts of meats down in New Orleans.  There are a few other locations on Milwaukee ave and Mt Prospect.

16.description: Wally's is as Polish as you can get.  Not really international so dont expect to find sambal, chilies or Thai fish sauce.  100% Polish.In fact you will hear nothing but Polish spoken.  At the deli counter you have to take a number and wait your turn.  And they have a counter so you can tell when your turn is coming up which is really useful b/c they call out the numbers in Polish not English.  How do you say 79 in Polish?  I dont know.  English is rather limited at the kielbasa section.On your way out the cashiers will give you a quick look to determine if you are Polish or American.  That way they know which language to speak to you in.  Sometimes they just assume that you are Polish.  I highly recommend one of the 100 kinds of kielbasa and deli meats.  These Poles know their pork.  You can get salmon caviar for dirt cheap here too.  And the have sauerkraut in a big barrel in case you want five pounds of it.  I also like some of the prepared foods.  They do good soups like Hunters stew and others.  Pierogies too of course.  After all those delicious meats, their produce dept is really an after thought.  Every December I go there to pick up a bunch of kielbasa, smoked pork shoulder, Danish bacon and my five pounds of sauerkraut and take it down home to New Orleans to make a Choucroute Garnieen.wikipedia.or...for my parents who cant get those sorts of meats down in New Orleans.  There are a few other locations on Milwaukee ave and Mt Prospect.

17.description: Ah Polish food!  Now I am not scared off by the fact that I don't understand the language or really know what the food is-that's just a normal day with my in-laws!Seriously though, language was not a barrier at any of the departments.  I am sure we couldn't have held a conversation on how my day was going but there was enough communication to get me boneless chicken thighs and feta cheese.  And yes, we were the only non-Polish speakers there and the whole time we shopped I felt the urge to justify my presence by letting everyone know I married into a Polish family.  My husband did not have this problem.  He just wanted the good Muenster cheese.We loaded up on Perogi's-both fresh and frozen, some weird ground meat in bread things, cooked chicken, cheese, fresh veggies and some meat from the butcher.  A big cart of food for about $41-not bad!The hot perogi's were so yummy and our 14 month old loved them and the bbq chicken.  The produce department was not huge but it had some great sales and most things seemed really fresh.  We walked up and down the aisles checking out the foreign labels and products.  One of these days I want to experiment with some of the sauce packets and seasoning.I think it is a fun, non-intimidating shopping experience.  And good prices!

10.description: I come here all the time for stuff I don't want to buy at Jewel.  This mostly means cold cuts, cheeses, and breads.Wally's has their own bakery, so the bread is almost always fresh.  If you come at the right time, you can buy it still warm and fresh from the oven.  I love both the Kielecki and Zakopianski with poppy seeds.Their selection of cold cuts and cheeses is decent, nothing to write home about.  But the prices are excellent.  I can buy a pound of really good ham, Szynka Wiejska, for under $3.  Jewel charges twice as much, and the product is not nearly as good.Overall, it's a great place to buy imported Polish products, meats, cheeses, and breads.

11.description: This store has the rudest employees ever!!!  I did my shopping and the girl by the register was ordering me around as to where to put basket and the merchandise.You do not do this in America.The fresh food is disgusting and stale.

26.description: This place used to be good until Wally opened up the third store in the suburbs.   We used to shop at  the store on Milwaukee until this one opened up and had a great selection of meats.  Now it seems that he pushes the crap to these two stores and sends the best to the suburbs. The prices have gone up in the last couple of years and the quality of their food is not the best.  We rarely buy anything from the deli.  Usually, just the cheese.  We used to get the bread but a lot of times they leave it already cut on the racks and they are old by the time you come to the store,.   I must agree with Alexzandra A. about the beef, I stop here often for that too since you could probably get two pounds for under $3 here.   The checkouts tend to be long but most of the people are usually nice. Don't bother going to the "Customer service " counter or you'll be greeted by a snooty girl or guy that think they are better than any other employee in the store. I've also experienced the bitchy owner's wife screaming at the girls in the bakery and from what I hear none of those people even get paid well. The produce is okay and sometimes beats other grocery stores prices when shopping for apples and oranges, strawberries sometimes too.The salad counter is fairly good which is located by the meat section, but sometimes short handed and a long line. I don't think their bakery is all that great.. but I guess if you've never had home baked polish goods, you will find this to be good. Yes, it's a large store and you can find a lot of polish foods under one roof, but save your money and shop elsewhere for better quality. . We don't frequent this store as much as we used to due to the lack of good quality meats and rise of prices. There are a lot more better Polish grocery stores around Chicago compared to this one and you will find that the smaller deli's carry the same types of products.

27.description: This is the mecca of Wally's markets.  The ultimate place for one stop Eastern European shopping.  You can stock up on inexpensive sausage and cheeses along with a variety of fruit syrups or make your own 6 pack of beers.  My favorite item is rulki, a thin waffle cone rolled into the shape of a thick straw and filled with whipped cream, I could eat a dozen.  In the shopping area you can get your fill of phone cards, legal services, stripper shoes, amber jewelery, and all the pope merchandise you could dream of.

0.description: I don't know if you guys know that you can buy the whole polish dinner for only $3.99 at Montrose Deli every day. Meat + mashed or baked potatoes or rice + 2 different salads of veggies sides. Soup special for $0.99. Every day different meals.There a 2 locations of this store. This one on Irving Park & Narraganset and the other on Montrose & Central. Smacznego :)P

20.description: Ah Polish food!  Now I am not scared off by the fact that I don't understand the language or really know what the food is-that's just a normal day with my in-laws!Seriously though, language was not a barrier at any of the departments.  I am sure we couldn't have held a conversation on how my day was going but there was enough communication to get me boneless chicken thighs and feta cheese.  And yes, we were the only non-Polish speakers there and the whole time we shopped I felt the urge to justify my presence by letting everyone know I married into a Polish family.  My husband did not have this problem.  He just wanted the good Muenster cheese.We loaded up on Perogi's-both fresh and frozen, some weird ground meat in bread things, cooked chicken, cheese, fresh veggies and some meat from the butcher.  A big cart of food for about $41-not bad!The hot perogi's were so yummy and our 14 month old loved them and the bbq chicken.  The produce department was not huge but it had some great sales and most things seemed really fresh.  We walked up and down the aisles checking out the foreign labels and products.  One of these days I want to experiment with some of the sauce packets and seasoning.I think it is a fun, non-intimidating shopping experience.  And good prices!

19.description: Meh is right! Produce is a pass here. They stock a nice variety of polish foods, canned and otherwise, but the deli and cheese sections are lack luster. Bread made on spot is great though! And there is several varieties.

2.description: They never have enough shopping baskets circulating around the store.  Today I lost the battle and I had to carry my soup and salad in my ultra small hands.

18.description: it's been 1st time I visited Wally's Market, and I loved it. Prices are very very good. Nice viriaty of bread (they have their own bakery), meat, and (OH!) herring! Although I didn't find fresh salmon there, but maybe some other place.

13.description: I love go Wally's International in Chicago.  October,17 2012

4.description: This used to be Wallys but has been taken over by Montrose Deli. The store pretty much has remained the same and seems to be amply stocked. They continue to sell liquor which is definitely a plus for me.The best deal here is a meal to go from the hot bar. It is priced at $3.99 and you get a meat, a starch, and two vegetables.In the process the Polish mall adjacent to the store has been closed which is no surprise because it always was deserted.

24.description: I stopped here for the first time a couple of nights ago and have to say that the selection really impressed me.  A lot of space is devoted to fresh foods, and while I didn't find the produce all that impressive-looking beyond the barrels of pickles and sauerkraut, (I think Family Fruit Market has better looking fruits and veggies.) the selection of meats, cheeses, bakery and deli items more than made up for any shortcomings.  There are more frozen pirogies on display than I've ever seen anywhere else, and impressive assortments of pickles, tea, herring and even crackers including varieties of Wasa that I've never even seen in Scandinavia.  It's also an impressively clean store.On the weird side:  Nobody seems to speak English here, though I'm guessing that "pound" or "half pound" or "dozen" would prove to be pretty universal.  And while the front of the building is quite attractive, covered with large, lighted photos of various sorts of food, the entrance is half a block back, off the side street, and is less than appealing.I see some other reviewers feel that this place suffers by comparison to the newest outlet in the suburbs, but as I have nothing to compare it to, I'm perfectly content to award it four stars, with one for cleanness and one for being unique in my experience.

6.description: This place is AWESOME but you'd better learn to speak Polish!  :-)I love how they have all the deli stuff separated into different sections so you don't have to wait forever in one deli line for everything .  Meat, cheese, lunchmeat, bakery, and prepared foods are all in separate areas which makes it much easier to navigate.  They don't have any American food here so if you are looking for that stuff go to Jewel.  It's strictly Polish here.Their prepared food is some of the best I've ever had, and so inexpensive!  They have different foods every day so whenever you are hungry for something warm and hearty, stop in and get a surprise.  My favorite is chicken meatballs in a creamy dill sauce.  You can get a whole meal with side and salads for $3.99!

22.description: psss...hey you , come closer. Closer. Closer! Ok, back up.Now I have a secret but you can't tell anyone. Wally's is this great little Polish market with a fantastic deli. You know what that means? FRESH, CHEAP CHEESE and meat (if you like deli meat)! The bakery items and produce are great as well but everything else is overpriced and not unique enough to pay extra for.Wally's is located in this one stop shopping mall of sorts that i'm pretty sure the Polish peeps in the area are trying to keep all to themelves:) They have a lawyer, doctors, travel agent, etc located in this place.

15.description: Really liked this grocery store. Quite cheep and very good quality. Fish, checken and meat is fresh. Would be the shot of choice if only for long distance.

7.description: Love this place!!great nova salmon pieces!they also have a section of hot foods and a daily 3.99 special where one can choose proteins like pork chops,chicken w mushroom with choice of mash potato,rice or barley and 2 salads!!greeat..also love the 99 cent mushroom soup for a pint I believe..avail hot or in their packed cold section..great selection of European deli meats cheeses salads n breads..I'm not ethnically polish or any type of Euro blood to say the least so I do get a bit of that look frm the deli girls..like "what ru non euro chic doing here?"I do have a slight obsession with European foods also being my bf is Romanian n the food is quite similar to polish foods...if u can deal with the polish staff then I def suggest coming here for a hot,cheap n great meal to go!!!

8.description: Very well stacked deli with endless choices. Simply wonderful freshly prepared Polish food. Great take-out and catering options. Their party trays with open-face and rolled-up sandwiches were a real hit with guests at our recent party. Manager Anna was very helpful and accommodating.

30.description: I haven't been to Wally's in a while because its not so close to where I live, but when I get a chance I love to shop there.  I prefer this Wally's to the more convenient Milwaukee Ave. location because its bigger, because it has an extensive liquor section and its in a shopping center that has a jewelry store featuring necklaces with Pope John Paul II's picture on them.... Back to Wally's....
