I love the deli meats, can never turn down the cookies and various bakery items and honestly have the urge to dive right into the barrels of pickles.  I pretty much live for pickles.  You can also buy all sorts of international beer by the bottle in order to make your own global sampler.

3.description: If you aren't Polish you ain't welcome here. From my physical features, I am obviously not Polish.  I walked in here yesterday and I was stared down and given dirty looks by employees and customers. I had staring contests with a few people. I went to the deli and out of the 10 employees working the deli, only one spoke English. The others huffed and puffed when I spoke to them in English and cut me off mid sentence to tell the English speaking employee to speak to me instead.  The parking lot is a mad house and I was almost t-boned because apparently the customers don't believe in stop signs.  I will never go to this place again.

14.description: psss...hey you , come closer. Closer. Closer! Ok, back up.Now I have a secret but you can't tell anyone. Wally's is this great little Polish market with a fantastic deli. You know what that means? FRESH, CHEAP CHEESE and meat (if you like deli meat)! The bakery items and produce are great as well but everything else is overpriced and not unique enough to pay extra for.Wally's is located in this one stop shopping mall of sorts that i'm pretty sure the Polish peeps in the area are trying to keep all to themelves:) They have a lawyer, doctors, travel agent, etc located in this place.

12.description: I have to say, after reading all the reviews I was skeptical, but I actually got exactly what I wanted, for the price I wanted, without (much) hassle. You just have to be ready to be firm. Don't let them sell you something you don't want, don't pay for something you don't want. Remember, you have a right to say no.I wanted to 2 pair for $69.95 deal, and every step of the way I confirmed that with whomever was helping me or asking me questions. "Does it cost extra? Is that included in the 2 pair deal?" If not, then I don't want it!I was able to get 2 very stylish pairs of glasses, no bells or whistles, and a free eye exam for $69.95. The wait was a little unbearable, the doctor even confirmed my suspicions that it was just the front desk staff slacking off...the doctor wasn't even seeing anyone, yet I was waiting for almost an hour. Apparently for no reason. I also waited an unreasonable amount of time to pick up my glasses. It was the end of the business day, the front desk staff seemed more concerned with getting closing procedures done before helping customers. But all I had to do was approach one of the staff and ask for help a second time - and then I was on my way with my new glasses.Overall, not a horrible experience. Customer service definitely lacks here, but then again I wasn't expecting much. I was also able to get a copy of my prescription made to keep for my files.

7.description: i had a scratch inside my glasses lens staff was so friendly checked if i have insurance on it which i did they took it and replaced it . they changed both of the lenses even tho just one them was damaged i was really surprised how they handle it professionally so i give them 5 STARS KEEP IT UP GREAT JOB!

20.description: On my first trip there, my appointment was at 3pm. I arrived almost a half an hour early. I checked in and filled out the required paperwork. Then I waited. 3 o'clock rolled around, and a woman walked in with her kid. They were taken right into the exam room after she filled out their paperwork as I sat there. 3:15 came and I asked when I would be taken in. I was told by the woman at the counter that the lady and her child were ahead of me and that it might be a while. About 3:45 came and I was finally taken in. The doctor was rude from the start. She never gave me any instruction that I should be closing one eye, keeping both eyes open, or whatever, but then yelled at me when I was keeping both my eyes open during the eye test. "Well, that's because you're not closing one eye. Now do it right!" Personally, I'd rather have someone call me an idiot that just make me feel like one.The test was finally done, and I quickly picked the glasses I wanted. I turned around to see someone about getting them set up with lenses, and there was no one there. Once I got someone's attention, I was told that the lady and her son (who were still deciding on frames) were ahead of me and I would just have to sit down and wait. In the meantime, another lady came in with her two daughters to pick up glasses. She was taken care of right away. Nearly a half an hour later, I was finally taken care of myself by what turned out to be a very nice and pretty efficient lady. I was told it would be 7 - 10 working days till my glasses would be ready and that I would get a call when they were ready to be picked up.Flash forward 7 - 10 working days. I had not received a phone call so I called in to see if my glasses were in. They indeed were. So I took the trek to pick them up.I got there and was taken care of within about 10 minutes. I thought it should have happened a little faster considering that they weren't that busy and there were at least a couple of employees who seemed to be doing not much of anything, and by not much of anything I mean nothing at all.  When I was finally taken care of, one of the pairs of glasses I got was not what I ordered. The frames were right, but the lenses were supposed to be darkly tinted to be sunglasses. "Well, this is what you got," said the bored-looking woman who handed me my glasses, in a tone that suggested she didn't care and would rather be being slowly and painfully killed than tortured by having to be at work."But this is not what I asked for.""But it's what came and you should have said you wanted a tint if you wanted one.""I did. This pair is supposed to be sunglasses.""Oh really?""Yes.""What tint?" She asked this almost as a challenge. She wanted to know if I had really asked for them with a tint or had only just come up with the idea as I sat there. "I'm not sure. The lady didn't ask me what tint I wanted. She just confirmed that I wanted sunglasses, and I figured she had picked accordingly."This conversation went on for another few minutes. She walked away to confer with her manager twice. Then came over to tell me the manager would take care of me. Ten minutes later, with the manager still not making an appearance, I hailed the bored "Visual Acuity Expert" again. I told her the shade I wanted and asked that the glasses be shipped to me at home when they were ready. She said they would. We'll see what happens.The only reason this place gets a star at all is due to their lower than average prices. Unfortunately, with those low prices, you get a significantly lower than average quality of service.

19.description: Rude sales staff/uninstructed assistant manager.Wanted 2 pair for 69.  The DR and the techs were great but when I choose my frames I said just basic lenses.  The sales girl showed me a picture that said basic 2 pair 69 and I said ok and paid.  When I got to work I realized I was over charged so I went back the next day where I found out basic lenses and basic package are two different things.  I was telling the asst. manager that I was confused when the sales girl jumped up w/an attitude and said I explained this very clearly two days ago.  Then I got upset w/her no reason attitude and said if you remember so clearly then why dont you remember it was yesterday not 2 days ago.  Anyway price was adjusted in 3min.  I can over hear sales girl w/another customer confusing them with the "basic" term luckily they noticed right away.  I was told 7-10 days for glasses to be ready.  I called on the 10th day they said only 1pair arrived, they called on the 15th day for me  to come in and pick up glasses but when I got there only 1 pair was there.  The asst. manager blamed it on me because they must have gotten lost when I got the price adjustment.  Bull $&%*.  I f that was the case wouldnt they both be lost?  I finally got an apology from asst. manager and she said they are rush ordering my other pair.  (Sorry but that is the short version)

1.description: Just got off the phone with America's best and am nt happy!Bought 2 pair of glasses 6 months ago.  One pair is fine, but the other pair falls off my face.  They are not the same size, but when I questioned the woman on the phone, she said they didn't have to be the same.  In the past, all my glasses were the same size.  I checked a pair that are at least 5 years old, and they are the same size as the pair that does fit.  I took the misfit pair back shortly after getting them for an adjustment, but it didn't work.  She told me today that my only option is another adjustment.  Apparently if you do it within 30 days, you can get a refund or an exchange.  No one who rushed me through the initial appointment informed me of this, however.  I believe it was this original rush job that resulted in the wrong size or they just gave me the display frames.  I'm afraid it goes back to the old saying "you get what you pay for".MY recommendation would be to go elsewhere for glasses.  I'm not even sure I will go back for another "adjustment".

2.description: Picked up my new glasses!!  Was greeted (and not so nicely) by Marzena, who with her face snarled up like she had a load of poop in her mouth, told me to 'go sit over there' and to my delight the same girl who did my pretests the other day was the one who helped me. Sweet as pie that one is. Again, she is the only 'two star' reason.

9.description: The best service that I've ever had at and eyeglass store!!!A big Thank you Jazmine and Christine for going the extra mile to help my MOM.!!!Great price also!

6.description: I've had a good experience every time and I've been coming here for years. Good price and as long as you have an appointment on a non busy day and time then everything goes smoothly and you can avoid what others experience. I was in and out in 15 minutes. Had to order my contacts since they didn't have the 90 daily pack of contacts but I received a five day trial for free while I wait for my order. Everyone I've met has been very nice and helpful.

18.description: On my first trip there, my appointment was at 3pm. I arrived almost a half an hour early. I checked in and filled out the required paperwork. Then I waited. 3 o'clock rolled around, and a woman walked in with her kid. They were taken right into the exam room after she filled out their paperwork as I sat there. 3:15 came and I asked when I would be taken in. I was told by the woman at the counter that the lady and her child were ahead of me and that it might be a while. About 3:45 came and I was finally taken in. The doctor was rude from the start. She never gave me any instruction that I should be closing one eye, keeping both eyes open, or whatever, but then yelled at me when I was keeping both my eyes open during the eye test. I turned around to see someone about getting them set up with lenses, and there was no one there. She just confirmed that I wanted sunglasses, and I figured she had picked accordingly."This conversation went on for another few minutes. She walked away to confer with her manager twice. Then came over to tell me the manager would take care of me. Ten minutes later, with the manager still not making an appearance, I hailed the bored "Visual Acuity Expert" again. I told her the shade I wanted and asked that the glasses be shipped to me at home when they were ready. She said they would. We'll see what happens.The only reason this place gets a star at all is due to their lower than average prices. Unfortunately, with those low prices, you get a significantly lower than average quality of service.

10.description: Extremely poor customer service with rude disrespectful employees. Avoid this place at all costs.

13.description: I went in the other day for lenses only. America's Best is more affordable then the other place I went to. They beat the price by $100.00. I bought frames & lenses at a competitors. Plus had an exam. When I needed the lenses to be upgraded to transition & progressive, the other folks tried to over charge me. I checked around & America's Best had the lowest price to replace the lenses. Dr Sazelan is thorough, quick & precise. She took real good care of me.

16.description: This place is a joke. I don't know if other America's Bests are better, but this one is terrible. I made an appointment two weeks ago(still don't have my glasses, btw!) and was treated very rudely by the receptionist staff. I didn't wait very long, which was good, but the one thing this place is really focused on is the hard sell, pushing the extras. From the moment the assistant brought me in for the first tests(before you see the optometrist) she tried 3 times to sell me an extra test for brain cancer or something. I said no. She asked two more times, trying to make me feel guilty or stupid for not taking the extra test. But I was firm and she gave up. The I saw the optometrist. I wish I remembered her name, because she was the best part of the whole experience. She was in her early thirties and had blonde hair. She was great during my exam. Afterwards, one of the rude receptionists sat down with me and tried to sell me a package that was about double of what I expected to pay. I told her i wanted the absolute basic package (the 2 pairs for $70). She told me that that wasn't what the doctor recommended for my glasses. I jokingly told her i knew the risks and after a lot of prodding and trying to make me feel guilty, made me sign something that said i was going against the "doctors recommendations." Just for the record, the doctors aren't allowed to recommend the basic because it's not even an option on the sheet she handed me. She was so focused on the hard sell that she put in the wrong prescription on my glasses. I saw her type 2.0 but I just assumed that's what my eyes were. When they finally came in at the end of the week, i tried them on(with the help of another, different rude receptionist) and they were twice as strong as they should have been. i told her they were and she look and said that they were my prescription. i told her they weren't. she argued with me for about two minutes before i insisted i wasn't taking them since i would die if i had to drive with them. only then did she go test them on a machine. she came back and sheepishly told me that they had to be reordered since they were the wrong prescription. She didn't even apologize for arguing with me when i was telling her the truth. Still haven't received my glasses yet...two weeks later...

17.description: Don't go here unless you have a lot of patience. The wait time is ridiculous and the service is like icing on the cake. Been here twice and both time I had to wait over an hour for an eye examination. I will never step foot in there doors again.

15.description: They should rename this place America's Worst! After about 8 years of going there, I have finally given up on them. I have recently had the absolute worst experience of my life. The experience was so bad that it not only ruined my day, but inconvenienced my life the past 2 weeks! Trust me, if you're considering going there, you should really read this first.           Basically, I went for new glasses. The lady carelessly took my order. I reminded her of my phone number & told her not to call the old one. A week later I called, they weren't ready. 2 days later, called again, they were. I went there and told them nobody had called, they claimed they called. Sure enough, they called the number I told them NOT to call, AND they said they had been ready for days! The glasses wouldn't stay on my face. The lady told me that it's because of my prescription & that I had to pick out a new pair. Isn't it their job to tell me that ahead of time!?! So I pick out new ones, paid the difference, told them my phone number again, and waited a week. Called (assuming they wouldn't call me) and asked them what number they had on file, and they actually nonchalantly told me a 6 digit number! THEY ARE SO CARELESS!            So finally I go there and after a few days of wearing the new glasses, realized I just couldn't see right. Went back, and they basically told me it was my fault and they couldn't help me. I went to another location, and the doctor told me my lenses had a lab error! (The Brickyard location is a little bit better) So I went back, with my note from the doctor saying that they had to be sent back. Instead of being friendly, they all gang up on me and start giving me lots of attitude about it, as if i'm crazy. I mean if I can't see, I'm pretty sure I would know it. So they rudely said "fine, we'll get them remade, but when they come back the exact same there's nothing we can do." As I leave, I pick up MY glasses and she says "YOU NEED TO LEAVE THOSE HERE! HOW DO YOU EXPECT US TO SEND THEM BACK!?" I ask her how she expects me to see for the next week and she didn't seem to care that she was putting me in danger by making me drive home half blind. It wasn't my mistake, they should have sent in another pair!              All in all, I've gone back and forth a good 6 times in the past 2 weeks, and frankly I am completely out of time and patience with this place. Nobody should be treated that way, especially when you're dealing with somebody's health. This place either needs to be completely re-staffed or shut down!

0.description: Ileana helped my daughter and I select frames from their optic gallery. There were significantly more options compared to the private practice we received our prescription from for my 3 year old and Ileana made the experience incredibly simple and positive. She patiently assisted us in trying different styles and educated us on the benefits of each fit. She was absolutely wonderful- HIGHLY recommend seeing her if you have a little one in need of new frames! The pricing was an incredible value as the lenses were at no cost because of my daughters age. The frames we selected (one metal understated pair and one plastic hipster pair) are reasonably priced and cost only $30 to warranty both. We opted to include the enhanced lenses to eliminate a glare ($69 for both pairs). This was awesome compared to the private practice as for one pair the cost was more than double (before the warranty)!Exemplary customer service from Ileana and nice-sized optic gallery offering cute, adorable frames! Very happy!

5.description: The one star goes to the optometrist and technician who seemed to be professionals. The rest of the non-stars go to the sales staff who are in charge of "persuading" you to take advantage of the eye club. Coming out of the exam room, the doctor told me about the the eye club, to which I thanked her for letting me know about it. She wasn't pushy, just informative, which I can appreciate. Then she asked me to sit back down in the waiting area, so I waited, After looking around and seeing an empty room for a bit, I saw one of the sales lady talking to the front desk lady. It didn't seem like any one knew I was waiting. So I walked up to the two, and the sales lady was like "oh I was just coming to get you"... so she takes me to her desk and explains the eye club, to which I listened, and then I said I would like just to pay for the exam and also wanted to know the prices of the contacts. She continues to tell me the benefits of the stupendous eye club, to which I listened once more and respectfully told her "just the price of the exam and maybe some contacts."  She seems totally thrown off by this - almost offended. She snarks "So you are going to come back next year and pay ANOTHER 79?" In my head I thought - at this point I will not be coming back at all.  I asked her about the price of contacts, to which she brought up the eye club and how I would get this amazing 10% discount. Then the neighboring sales lady chimes in, "Really??? You aren't joining the eye club? If there was an Eye club mafia, this was it,. At this point, my friend who was only a few feet away in the waiting area who heard and saw everything, sent me the funniest text about the situation,  without looking at him, I smiled, and I saw the sales lady dart her eyes over at him. Yes, lady, this is getting hilarious. Stop pretending like you aren't the lens-nazi. Then I went back to the contact prices - she went over the discount once again, as though she did not hear me say I was not interested several times already. I told her to just ring me up for the exam and I would get the contacts elsewhere. The other sales lady, asked where am I going to get my contacts then - as if it is any of her business - I told her I didn't know the name of the place off the top of my head, and she goes on about other places and their prices also going up, letting me know that the prices are the same, I sighed and just waited to be rung up. Finally, I got my receipt and prescription and walked out of there for good. When I got home I bought my contacts online, no eye club needed and they were cheaper - and the best thing of all? No hassle.

11.description: This place is horrible!! Avoid this place at ALL COSTS!! Been going there for years now (since they opened) and they were good BUT lately they just can't get anything right.....got my exam and sat down to order my glasses forget the 2 pair for $69.99 not for me I left paying over $500 for one pair! With all the extras they said "I had to have" I waited the 7-10 days for my glasses and finally called after 2 weeks only to find out they had been thee for a week .......no phone call to let me know as promised. Then I tried my glasses on AND COULDN'T SEE A DARN THING. They said "let your eyes adjust" bulls**t eyes adjust ......they gave me the wrong Rx so when I finally insisted I could not see they looked it up and sure enough THE RX WAS BACKWARDS! So I had to wait another two weeks?? They said they said they would "put a rush on them this time" 2 weeks go by again no call, so I call still not there another week still not there.......THEY FORGOT TO SEND THEM BACK IN! ! Just whatever you do DO NOT GO THERE!!Every person that works there is RUDE, the manager has no idea as to what's going on and does not care.....the DR. Was ok but that's about it.

8.description: 2 Stars for the girl who took my appointment she gave me a lot of false information 2 stars for the girl that did my initial testing.....this isn't a HUGE LOCATION.....you should know what I'm paying for what's included and what's not. 3 Stars for the eye dr. I'm skeptical that my eyes have not changed prescription because I squint with my glasses but she seems to feel I'm the same. I guess we'll find out... 4 Stars for Maria she was you're saving grace, great personality and has all the answers. But if you're going in for 69.95 glasses. It's not happening. I walked out paying $550.

3.description: This location is most likely the worst customer service wise, and the worst with scheduling in all aspects. I come in on a day where my appointment is at 1:00pm. I come and wait, and continue to wait for over 30 mins before even going into the first room where the exam takes place. I had a day full of errands to run and this was just one of the many I had to do before a certain time. After waiting for over 30 mins, I went to the reception desk and tell the lady that I cannot wait any longer. I had things to get done and was on a schedule. Some other employee walked up, out of no where and said, "well I was just about to take you." Well, after 30 mins I grew extremely tired of waiting. I ended up making a. Appointment for the next morning, and as I am still currently sitting here waiting to be taken, it's been over an hour. They didn't even get my "file" out and give it to the other employees. 2 people walked in after I did and they were taken before me. Their appointments were also after mine. This location NEEDS desperately to revive their scheduling system. It DOES NOT work! Don't book appointments 20 mins apart, when you know that it surely takes a longer to get one person in and out in that time. It's really frustrating to be sitting here waiting and waiting when I have other things to do. Everyone has things to do and most don't have extra time to spare waiting for an unknown amount of time. This location should also hire new employees. Maybe that would help them with their scheduling issues.

14.description: If I could give this place a negative star, I would.  I went in for a contact lens exam and the Dr. was very pleasant.  The issue happened after the exam while I was waiting for my trial pair of lenses.  I was told that I needed to PURCHASE  the prescription the doctor had written for me BEFORE I would get a trial pair.  I said that doesn't make any sense since we aren't 100% sure that the prescription is correct and it may need to be tweaked a little bit.  I was told that they advise their patients NOT TO OPEN THE BOXES OF LENSES if they are not the correct prescription and return them if there is a problem.  I refused and said that is not a very smart way of doing business.  The Dr. came out and gave me a pair of lenses that did absolutely nothing for me and told me I would have to wait 7-10 days for my "trial pair".  I left and called the customer service number and explained to them that I was told I needed to purchase the boxes before  I received the trial pair.  He said that is absolutely not our procedure.  I would NEVER recommend this place to another person.  They are rude, condescending and liars.  I was able to get a refund for the exam and am glad that I did.  I went to Vision Works shortly there after and am now sitting in a great pair of contacts that seem to be working well for now.  STAY CLEAR OF THIS PLACE.  They do not believe in honesty.

4.description: Picked up my glasses and contacts. Again they were busy, but I didn't even have to wait in the waiting area...they got to me right away. Marzena brought me everything, she was so nice and even put in a screw in my old glasses so I can keep them as a backup. Told my boyfriend to come here too next time.

12.description: My review is based on 3 services: eyebrow waxing, up-do, makeup. Waxing: I've been going to Magda for years and she is now working here since Merle Norman closed. I would not trust anyone else to do my eyebrows - she is AMAZING!Up-do: I went for an up-do for a special occasion. I believe the owner did my hair. She did a decent job for the money she charged. The poof on top of my head was a little lopsided so I had to go home and fix it, but the rest of it was great. She took her time and paid attention to details.Makeup: This is the worst of it. When I made the appointment I was told they use MAC makeup. The day of my appointment I was taken into a bathroom in the back and was told the MAC was with another artist for a wedding. So for me she used Revlon, Cover Girl, and a bunch of other drugstore brands. I know a lot about makeup and I know a smokey eye is supposed to smoke out from the lash line. I basically got a ton of dark shadow up on my brow bone and a bare eyelid. To top it off, she used false lashes without asking and charged me $15 for them, on top of the $50 for the "makeup" job. For junk brand makeup and a shoddy job, $65 was a rip off.

7.description: Amazing salon. Had a keratin treatment with Jessica and she was so thorough and great at her job! Highly recommended!

3.description: I had my monthly pedicure yesterday with Gina at 5th Avenue Salon and Spa.  I enjoyed a wonderful and relaxing time while Gina did my pedicure!  She makes my feet look and feel marvelous!  I also had my eyebrows, mustache and beard (how sad but true) waxed by Magda.  She is a miracle worker and I leave looking wonderful!I would definitely recommend Gina and Magda to anyone who is looking for virtually any type of spa service!

1.description: I had no idea that this place existed until I saw it on Groupon. There aren't very many places in the area to get a facial, so I was excited to try it out. All the other reviews are raving about Magda, however, the Groupon was only for the other aesthetician at the salon. Too bad for me....Scheduling my appointment was pretty easy, hence the two stars. I was able to get a next day appointment. When I arrived, the salon was completely empty, except for the receptionist and the aesthetician, who were both playing on their phones. The receptionist was actually trying to greet me and give me the paperwork to fill out while carrying on a personal call. I was surprised by how the aesthetician was dressed. In my experience, they usually wear an all black outfit or something very plain and unassuming. The aesthetician at 5th Avenue was dressed in jeans, a holiday sweater and gym shoes. I thought that was a little bit unprofessional. When I arrived at the treatment room, I was told to change into a robe and put on a headband. Pretty standard, however the robe and the headband provided to me clearly have not been washed. There were foundation stains on both of them, neither was perfectly white, and I have to be honest, I was pretty grossed out. The bed only had a thin sheet to cover with. The facial itself was worse than the average. I used to get them regularly due to problematic skin in my teens and 20's, so I have lots to compare to.  Few extractions, maybe 2-3 minutes worth. Disappointing, since this is why most people spend money on them in the first place. No neck/shoulder/hand massage. Bottom line: will not return.

2.description: I usually only have facials here. So this review is mostly for Magda the aesthetician.  I followed her here from Merle Norman, as did most of her clients. Magda is professional and offers a calming experience. She is always on time. I have never had to wait unless I came early. Magda has helped me find products to use at home based on my skin type and her advise has really made a difference. All of the staff is friendly from the moment you walk in.  They offer refreshments and sometimes snacks, which is nice if your coming from work. I did have a massage here once. I woke up and could not move my neck.  The massage therapist did a great job in working it out without making me sore after. They offer great package deals that change through out the year as well. Overall a great place in the neighborhood!

9.description: They sat with me the whole time I was getting my gel nails off. And explained to me why the type of "gel" that I got from another nail salon wasn't so great. It took 3hrs to get them off finally but once they were off the no chip took a 30mintues. Definitely going back they offered my something to drink and when they ordered food they asked if I would like any. They are very nice and informative I recommend also not to costly. I was a first time customer and very satisfied at that, will make more business here.

10.description: First time getting a facial and massage.The facial was good and the massage was fantastic.  This is all pretty new to me so you're getting a guy's first time experience.  The facial is nice and all but i would go back for the massage.

13.description: I went here to get the no-chip mani and a reg pedi and overall the experience was good. The place was cute, super clean and organized. This lady (super nice and polite) did my mani and pedi and my nails came out fine but she was kind of clumsy and not as quick as I've had before. So the no chip mani actually didn't chip-  I've had it for a little less than a week and it still looks nice except for the fact that the lady didn't put the polish right up to my cuticle so they look more grown out than they should at this point... Kind of lame when you're spending 35$ on a no chip manicure that's supposed to last like 7 to 14 days or something. Also for my pedi, she really wasn't very thorough and didn't get the rough spots as smooth as I would have liked. On the positive side, she was extremely thorough about cleaning and spraying down the different tools and utensils she used, which was comforting. Oh and they only have one pedicure chair soo yeah, I probably won't go there regularly cuz there's more of a chance that there will be a wait. It seemed to me like the salon focused more on hair, but yeah overall it was a pleasant experience.Oh and one more thing, I dont know if theres parking somewhere else but there are spaces right in front which are like in a diagonal row right off the street, so when you're backing out to leave and someones parked next to you its kinda scary cuz you are backing up right into the middle of Irving Park rd which is pretty busy... kind of nerve racking.

16.description: Will never step foot in this place or recommend this place!!! I have really frizzy curly hair so I get Keratin Treatments and when Groupon had a deal with them for $125 I though that was awesome considering I pay about $300 for them! Well the only awesome part of all this was that Groupon gave me my money back with no problems or questions asked for this treatment after I complained that it did not work to the owner and she never compromised with me or did anything for me. I met with the owner to look at my hair and all she did was spray Keratin in my roots that would last 6 weeks and re-flat iron my hair; which did nothing!!! I then called her and really started to complain and all she did was come back to me after speaking w the company and tell me I'm either on medication or it's just been really humid out...Really lady?! I'm on no medication and isn't the humid weather part of why we do this treatment?! So our hair doesn't kink and curl?!?!  Unbelievably bad customer service with a complaint. Not even a month later I went for a hair cut and my stylist did not believe me that I had anything done to my hair!

17.description: Bought a deal find here and came across a little problem long story short the deal find was cut, blow dry, style, nails and a $20 gift card. When i bought it and made my appt. i asked if i could get a pedicure same day with the gift card and pay $5 dollars extra, i was told yes. When i got to the salon it was a whole different story. They ended up giving me a coupon $20 off your next visit of $40 or more. HM might just be my opinion but they should of written that in the FINE PRINT. But whatever, the girl that did my hair was great (Deanna) she was so sweet and just all around an awesome girl. The girl that did my nails (Dominica?) SHE WAS AMAZING.. ive never had fake nails that were done that nice. They lasted for almost 3 weeks and when it was time to take them off they didnt rip my real nails off along with it. i think im going to start going to her from now on.. So long story short the salon itself kinda rubbed me the wrong way but the girls were nothing but GREAT.

15.description: The staff was nice, place was clean, close to the neighborhood, I thought Id give a try. They  however overbooked, waaayyy overbooked. It started with someone calling & asking if I could come 1 hour later. I said Ok. When I got there, they started my"no-chip" mani & mid manicure they started someone else. They stated that he had a standing appt & they were extremly short staffed. Then why book all these customers?! Ended up taking 3 hours for them to do normally an hour (tops) manicure. So annoyed. Top it all off it didnt even last a week.. Will never go back.

0.description: When I first walked in to the salon, I was worried because it had an "old" vibe. Located next to the Rolling Stones, it was easy to find and easy to park (free). It had been such a stressful month that I needed something, ANYTHING that would help me relax. I woke up, looked through Groupon and called 5 different spas for full body massages but had no luck. Nothing for today.Then, I went on to local "beauty & spa" section and found this salon. Immediately I felt relief because  I was able to find a Groupon that offered a facial near our apartment, and when I called, the receptionist was able to set up an appointment with the only aesthetician that accepts Groupon; Gina. It wasn't until couple of hours later, but I could try to relax until then, so I did.Back to the beginning, when I walked it, it was a hair salon, spacious, full of older ladies pampering themselves (older as in, they could be my grandmother's age or older. Full gray hair grandmas dyeing their hairs to look 15 years younger?) In any case, I didn't mind since I don't know much about facials. It was my first facial and as long as I felt relaxed and moisturized by the end of the appointment, it would be good. I walked in 20 minutes earlier than our scheduled appointment. The moment I walked in, I was greeted right away by the receptionist, who was older. She asked me to fill out two different forms. The first, very basic contact information to keep me in their directory asking basic questions including birthday and anniversary date. The second form asked more than 20 questions related to my daily habits. Anywhere from supplements that I take to the question that they always ask: are you pregnant?That form took about 3 minutes to fill. It was easy since it only required yes/no answers that needed to be checked off.Now, Gina comes out to greet me right away and patiently waits while I finish the questionnaire. She wears a uniform (soft yellow scrubs?) and takes me to a small room. She makes sure that I am comfortable. Reads over the questionnaire and continues to ensure that I am feeling comfortable at all times. She introduces herself as a trained aesthetician by Dermalogica and asks more questions about my daily ritual from cleansing to exfoliating to moisturizing. All really good questions because I have very troubling dry skin. My mother always said I had a normal asian skin. No. I have extremely dry skin. I know better mother!I tell Gina that I have had troubles with all the brands that I have used so far. Korean and Japanese high end products, Aveda, Dermadoctor and now Bliss. I need LOTS of moisturizing. My skin eats everything! She was so good at listening and answering ALL the questions that I had. So many of them too! She was very knowledgeable with the brand that she represented and she understood my skin better than my own mother. She gave me the attention that my skin needed. Cleansing, exfoliating, hydrating, cleansing, massaging, moisturizing from almost my scalp to my chest. My shoulders and behind the neck and upper shoulders. The entire session lasted about 70 minutes. Each time she would leave the room (twice, for 5-7 min. each time), she made sure that all was well with me and that I wasn't feeling claustrophobic. The steam was amazing and the hot towels were even better. At the beginning I was jittery due to the 4 cups of coffee that I had during the morning at Delia's in Oak Park, but I was so calm and relaxed at the touch of her fingertips. She was gentle and great at informing me with every step that she took.She didn't talk much otherwise, which was a blessing. There was soft music in the background and since she asked me to keep my eyes closed at most of the times, I didn't have to count the ceiling panels as I would do at a doctor's office :pI definitely recommend Gina, especially if you are new with facials. Maybe I didn't know better since it was my first time, but I am super satisfied. I will definitely return, especially since she gave me a $20 off coupon for the next time I make an appointment with her. Although she made it clear multiple times that I didn't have to buy any products,  I did purchase some of the products, and I loved how patient she was with all my questions. I was planning on dropping by Ulta after the facial anyways since I am running low on daytime moisturizers. I am going to give Dermalogica a try and pray that I have found THE moisturizer for me. Oh, and by the way, I checked the prices that they charged me for the products after I left the salon and compared them to Ulta. They did save me a couple of bucks and Gina gave me 5 packets of samples too! (at Ulta, they aren't too generous with samples....)Btw, Gina also does full body waxing too! I am so going back :)

5.description: Nice salon - friendly staff, comfortable and clean.  I regularly do pedicures with Gina.   I am a diabetic and very cautious with who/where I have pedicures - Gina does such a great job that my doctors (podiatrist and endocrinologist have praised my foot care - say she does terrific work). Gina also offers lots of OPI and other polish choices - very fun picking them out.   I also have had facial services from Gina - a trained aesthetician.  She takes great care in treating my very sensitive skin - always using/recommending appropriate Dermatological products.  My skin looks good thanks to her help.  Another great salon/spa service offering here are massages with Jen.  Jen really helped my aching legs/back.  Finally, the salon always is very accommodating with scheduling/rescheduling and uses a email/text reminder system that is useful to me.

11.description: My best friend bought a Groupon for both of us so we could pamper ourselves while our hubbies were out of town.  Not only were we disappointed that we BOTH couldn't have facials done at the same time since only ONE aestheticiantook Groupon, we were even MORE turned off when we were given a hard time about booking.  Unsure if they have multiple aestheticians, we were told only one takes Groupon.  ????  We then received calls yesterday letting us know that our appointments scheduled for the week after next would have to be cancelled!  Fed up with the back & forth, my best friend finally cancelled both facials and pedicures.  We're going elsewhere.  Is 5th Avenue just that busy that they don't have time for new clients?  Or worse...too busy for silly Groupon vouchers??  Where only ONE aesthetician will take them??  Why even OFFER a Groupon if only some of your staff will accept them?  What a rollercoaster trying to make an appointment and then...having it KEPT!

8.description: Very friendly and informative staff!

4.description: This review is mainly for Magda the aesthetician... Magda is great!  I followed her here from Merle Norman.  She's done my waxing for years as well as some facials.  She always makes you feel comfortable and does a great job.Ella for nails... Ella used to do my mani/pedi's at Merle Norman and is now here.  I haven't had a chance to go to her at 5th Ave due to scheduling conflicts, but she always did a great job.

14.description: I wanted side swept bangs a little longer jessica simpson style and kim kardashian I returned looking like a pilgrim will not return hated this hair cut if you don't know what the customer wants and your confused then articulate it and let them explain it more instead of pulling out ur sissors and just brushing them off ok ok LISTEN!!!! I had long hair and now it looks ridiculus and when I was leaving the other stylist was like ur hair looks nice sarcasticly !!!!!!!! DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!! only for old grammies

6.description: Lisa is the best!  She really listens to what you have to say, explains what she plans to do, and executes perfectly!  I get many compliments about my hair cut and color after an appointment with Lisa.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

3.description: Ok first time in the store and presentation could be better but omg the deli area with the different selection of items an their prices it definitely a hidden gem an the fact that at 3 in the afternoon there still baking fresh bread and stocking their shelf with it is awesome the only thing their high on the little bit of produce they have that the reason for the lack of star an the cashiers a bit rude .

1.description: Ladies at deli meat department at Laramie Bakery on Harlem and Belmont are so unfriendly and so not helpful! Would not recommend going here.  They will ignore you and act like you are doing them a favor.At check out you will wait till they are done on their phone and no smile no nothing.  Better off going to Montrose Deli.  Always smiling always helpful.

2.description: Before buying your food here, make sure to check if it's still fresh. I stop by the bakery to get paczki (donuts). I went to my car and noticed they don't look like they usually do. I tried one and it was as hard as a rock. I took them back and asked the lady at the counter to exchange them, and she said they were all "the same". I could tell that the ones in front of the glass display were fresh however. She was simply trying to sell the older ones from back!!! VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

5.description: I am very impressed with this new adition to my neighborhood.  It is one of only a selevt few Euro grocery stores in the neighborhood.  Prices are a little high on some items, but .99 2 lb loves of homemade rye bread, and deli specials.  I love this store for it's convenience.  It opens at 5am on weekdays and is great for the local economy.

0.description: It's a bit disorganized and the signage isn't great, but make this your go-to stop on Paczki Day. The strawberry cheese is my favorite, but they are all good! The bakery has assorted cookies and pastries, all at reasonable prices. The store also has a selection of European candies. Parking is very easy--they have a small lot plus there's street parking nearby. Come for the paczki. Stay for more paczki.

4.description: What a great stop.  I decided on some Corned Beef, Ham, Swiss and of course RYE Bread encrusted with onions!  Throw on some Krakus mustard and blueberry muffins and you have a meal.  I was not all that impressed with the poppy seed coffee cake but I was probably spoiled rotten longing for the one I got from Kaufman's Deli in Skokie.

1.description: I went here to purchase my mattress which was way overdue. The owner was knowledgeable and the prices fair. My husband and I were in and out in 30min. I've had my bed for about a week now and have slept soundly the entire week. Nothing beats a good mattress or great customer service for that matter. When it comes time to purchase a bed for my kids, I know where I'm going.

2.description: I just heard about this place opening and decided to check it out. I am in desperate need of a new mattress. I drove up to the store and the sales person was outside on the phone smoking, everyone needs a break. I walked into the store and inquired about their mattress's they had on sale posted in the window. He gave me some small information and as I inquired more about the mattress's he had the phone rang. He said hold on, I thought he was talking to me then he says no the phone. Then 'Frank'  proceeds to cut me short and hand me his card if I had any other questions just call. I was standing right there ready to buy, but I was handed a card and he continued his phone conversation, something about home from work already. That's where he should of been he didn't care about his work. I drove a short distance down the street to another mattress store called mattress bargains and the sales lady was more than willing to help including ignoring the phone call from her husband. She sat and gave me tons more of information I didn't even think to ask and she made a sale. I love my new mattress. No thanks to Mattress and more. Save yourself the hassle don't even walk in the door.

0.description: My experience with Mattress and More was wonderful!!  Got a queen size bed and frame, which they delivered and set up the next day.  Found out when they were at the apartment, that the box spring wouldn't fit  through any of the doors. Within a couple of hours, they had returned the box spring and came back with the split box springs, and even brought some headboard clamps.  After getting all the pieces in to the apartment, they set up the whole bed including the headboard which was not purchased from them.  The whole experience was a '10' start to finish.

I stopped by Emily's about 2 years ago when I was in town with friends for a fun trip. We were shopping at Navy Pier and enjoying some black Friday shopping, and we decided we wanted to go out for a nice night on the town Saturday before flying home, and waiting to really paper ourselves! So, we called up Emily and the three of us were able to get in and get amazing high quality makeup done for the night. At first we were not sure if the cost was going to be worth it since we were just going on on the town to have fun, but I am so glad that we did! We got a tun of compliments on our look, and took a lot of photos that got even more comments on how great we looked when we posted them to social media. My friend even used one of the photos we took that night and posted it on her online dating account. She is now happily dating someone she met who saw the photo and was super interested in her based on the glamorous look! Anyways, we were so happy with the results, and will for sure be going back to Emily's when we are in town next for a girls weekend! It was the best experience ever, and worth the time and money spent for sure!!!!

3.description: I would love to just give them the middle finger all day!! I just went there, and the ONLY reason I ever go there is because I am to lazy (I admit it) to get out of my car (damn the convenient drive thru!) so anyways I'm there this morning I ordered a mocha toasted almond iced coffee (yummmmm) cream and 3 sweet and lows, sandwich/hash browns, and a donut (French twist) I pull up to the window and the lady bring my coffee to the window and I notice right away that there is NO mocha in it. So she tried to hand it to me and I say is there mocha in there? She replies oh you wanted mocha ......yes... That's why I told you mocha... Toasted....almond ....so whatever she puts mocha in it . Let's try this again Goes to hand it to me again I see a ring of sugar on the bottom (hate hate hate it!!) I say I wanted 3 sweet and lows (like hello you asked me I told you) She replies with the slightest hint of attitude fine I'll remake it... Good for you go get my coffee right jeeze!! In the mean time she hands me my food and after there track record for the day I decide it's best if I check the the bags. First bag I look into is the sandwich and hash browns fine! My orders correct!! Then the other bag with 1 donut ( such a waste of paper) and it looks nothing like a French twist so when she brought me my finally correct coffee I asked her is this a French twist? And her response was we don't have French twists....... Well thanks for letting me knowNow I'm pissed! So I say I asked for a French twist if you didn't have them why would you just think it was alright to give me another donut I don't want? Give me a Boston creamI pull away and the little Indian lady didn't even so much as say her sorry for royally messing my order up! The managers don't even care. They are rude to this wasn't my first horrible experience at this location, after today I am not going back convenient or not.

1.description: Just walked to this location to find out only the drive thru is open 24 hours!  Its not even midnight.  Doesn't seem right to me.

2.description: I would have made this one star, but I am giving it two because I want to give props to the nice indian man who took our order while the rude lady who was supposed to be working with him just stared blankly and yelled at him while he did all of the work. I stopped by tonight (9/12/15) at 11:30 pm. If you know the lady who was working with him, she is doing nothing good for this business.

5.description: Worst DD on the planet!!!  Don't EVER use your debit card in the drive thru or they will rip you off blind and/or charge you multiple times.  It happened to me several times!  The prices are higher and the portion sizes much smaller at this DD.  The employees in the early morning are the rudest, nastiest human beings I've ever dealt with.  Most of the time the order is wrong too.... how can you screw up coffee with cream and a plain bagel?   It sucks because it's the only DD near my house with a drive thru, but I won't go there any more.   I've been ripped off too many times!

6.description: This DD is just fine.  Nothing really spectacular about it but nothing bad either.  Wide variety of donuts that are fresh, good selection of ice cream, ice cream cakes, etc.  Just a basic good, DD.This review, however, is really for the soft serve ice cream.  LOVE IT!!!  Nice and creamy with a solid vanilla flavor.  Very nice.  Warning: the small is huge.  Not a super selection of toppings but that's fine, I got a sundae with fudge, whipped cream, nuts, and a cherry.  One star is removed because this DD location tends to be cheap with their heating and air conditioning.  Not always - but on occasion.

0.description: Great place to sit and have your coffee. The place is very clean and the staff is very friendly. The only problem I have is that they offer wifi, and most of the they don't show up on the list to log on. If it wasn't for the lack of wifi, I would go more often.

4.description: How do you screw up a one donut order?Besides that, this double d is fine, I agree. I appreciate that they're open 24 hours and am happy that they always have decent donut selections... but people that work here seem miserable.

3.description: First time coming here for lunch and I have to say, it was such a treat. The staff is so friendly and always try to make you smile. The food was good but i just adored the coffee. Such a veriaty and great flavors. For sure coming here again.

1.description: I was surprised to see Coffee Bean Cafe only 2 storefronts down from a Dunkin Donuts.  Only a Subway is nestled between the two.  I like trying new coffee places, so I chose Coffee Bean over DD.Coffee Bean also has a menu of sandwiches, salads, and even pierogi.  I ordered a praline latte, but was disappointed to learn they were out of praline.  I went with almond instead.  The coffee wasn't mind blowing, and I don't know what coffee they brew, but my latte was good.  If I lived in the area, I would be more likely to go to DD for my coffee fix, unless I found something I absolutely loved at CBC.A small latte was $3, which isn't terrible, but with DD next door I wonder what the fate of Coffee Bean will be in a year from now.  They also close much earlier, at 6:00 p.m.The interior is pretty boring.  There are a few tables, a bar with stools at the window, and some comfy chairs.  There's a TV, which was showing news when I visited, and it's pretty quiet in here.

2.description: I've been waiting for an opportunity to try coffee bean & today happen to be the day. They did a great job in the decor also the ambience is comfortable, free wifi, great drinks, pastries & food. It's a must try I will be back for more.

9.description: It was nice to see another indie coffee shop in the area. I decided to give them a try. Like other reviews I have read, the place is nice, but that is about it. Service was not too friendly to me. Plus they had to go to the back to make my latte? I found this odd, since the espresso machine is usually located where customers can see it. I just found the place to be okay, Probably will not go back again.

10.description: I randomly found this place while looking for a Dunkin Donuts. Unfortunately,  the only starbucks in this area is inside the target,  inside the mall and that place is HORRENDOUS. Anyway, Coffee Bean is in a strip mall next to a subway and DD. The space is very clean, neat and they have a pretty big menu. They also have sandwiches and pastries which I could not try. I came pretty late in the day and they were sold out. I had a regular iced coffee with an extra shot. It was strong and he let me pour my own half and half. They guys behind the counter are friendly and fast. And its way cheaper than starbucks or dunkin. I will definitely be returning before my evening classes for a pick-me-up.

4.description: A new spot in the neighborhood thought we would give it a try.  Cute little shop, clean and friendly staff.  Unfortunately that's the only nice things I can say about the place.  It's definitely not a sit down restaurant it only has three small tables with three chairs at each table.  $12.99 for a breakfast special that consists of cold greasy hash browns, eggs, toast and pancakes or French toast.  The food is brought out in stages, orders for everyone are  not brought out together and a good 10 minutes after your food is brought do they bring utensils and any condiments for your meal.  There is no wait staff to speak of the cook comes out to bring the food.  There's a big disconnect from the person taking your order and the cook.  The people running the shop are not professional restaurant servers or cooks.Don't waste your time or money.

6.description: The food is not worth the price. If i want to eat burnt hash browns and dry bacon i can do it at home for cheaper. Plus NO TABASCO SAUCE....what place doesnt have tabacso sauce or something close to it. NEVER COMING BACK!

12.description: Our new favorite place in the hood! The staff is very friendly, they can accommodate to your needs (I'm vegetarian). The food is good and has a very home made tasty flavor. The place is super clean and there is no problem with parking.We like to go and get brunch or the soup and panini por $5.50. They need more tables but overall is one of the best options for breakfast/brunch in the area.

5.description: I came in to check what this place was about. It's right next to a subway and a jewel. I paid $6.50 for a croissant ham and cheese sandwich. Not worth it. Go to jewel, buy a croissant and make yourself a sandwich and I guarantee you'll make it better and for less. It's basically a glorified Subway. Blegh the lady wasn't friendly at all, no smile, she seemed like a robot.

13.description: Food was hot, delicious and fast! The restaurant is very cute and the staff was super nice. I will definitely be coming back to try other items on the menu!

11.description: Just visiting a friend and decided to go local instead of the usually large chain here in Chicago. The guys here are super nice! Very cozy. The croissants are baked fresh everyday and they are aaaaamaaazing!!! If you in the neighborhood I would highly recommend it. And they've only been open for 3 weeks :)

8.description: 5/5 stars for sure!! The food is delicious, and served in great and fulfilling portions, for a very good price!! The interior is very unique and warm. Makes you want to stay for hours. The coffee is amazing, and doesn't taste like cheap, water downed, burnt coffee from d*k*n d*n*ts! And the price was extremely inexpensive, considering the quality of the coffee. They have many choices, and flavors you can choose from. I was pleasantly surprised to find out I can have a red velvet latte! Also, I'm not the biggest fan of d*nkin because the coffee never tastes well prepared. This isn't the case at the coffee bean. Overall the place is extremely good and satisfactory.

0.description: It's a pretty solid neighborhood coffee shop.  There's another excuse for not patronizing D*nk*n D*n*ts, which is a couple of stores down on the same strip mall.  There's parking available since it's located on the Narragansett side of Dunning Square.  They have light lunch menus, including panini, bagels, pastries, and soup.  However, hubby and I were in need of our coffee fix.  We had 16 oz. white mocha and latte.  They had those made-to-order.  If you want super express service like most Americans like to do, go to DD then.  I HATE being in a hurry for coffee or food in general.  As a foodie, taking time and slowing down for having a relaxing time is SO, SO important.  I felt that Coffee Bean Cafe provided me the relaxation I needed in the morning when I had a day off from work.  They don't have lots of seating, but setting up the high stools facing Narragansett is a nice touch.  I love people-watching and today was a perfect day for it!  The owner is a friendly Polish gentleman.  Thank you having a place to sit down, have a cup of coffee, and chill in the city when I see everyone else rush like a chicken with the head cut off.  I do that for five (5) days a week with my day job, and I don't see the point doing this if it isn't necessary.

7.description: Great coffee and soup.  Met a cute girl there!Love the fresh baked bread and pastries and Megan's pizza is yummy.

3.description: I met the owner before shifting to my house in the area. He gave me some insight about the neighborhood and voila we became friends and neighbors too. Sam is very enthusiastic  and dedicated to his craft. He has a do or die mentality. He makes sure that his creations are made with love and undivided attention. He likes pleasing his customers and giving them the best experience they could have in his shop and with his products. We are glad that he is doing well and coming up with new stuff that everyone will enjoy everyday.

1.description: So I have to say this no pretenses boutique with the purpose of well being,clean,fresh,and sensuous skin more than exceeds expectations.The soaps are hand crafted,of generous proportions and smell fantastic!Just purchased the Valentine soap which smells like a combo of berries and roses and after I showered with it no longer had scaly winter skin.The soap master is now producing an expanded line of bath bombs I purchased the cucumber melon and Asia pear.The bombs are terrific fragrant but not over powering.This store stocks men's grooming supplies by small makers, wonderful oils and even a shampoo bar which is great cause of the scent and no recycling.There are even candles with exotic scents.This is destination place in Portage Park and is great to buy thoughtful sexy soaps.Doesn't  soft supple skin say love more than boring roses and teddy bears?

0.description: I love this little shop! I got the majority of my purchased Christmas presents from here this season, and they're my general go to when I need to spoil someone. The quality of the soaps is really high, and you get interesting scents you don't find elsewhere. My father in law loved the Evergreen soap, for example. He has started mixing solid lotions and I picked up a Cinnamon/Eucalyptus tin. SO GOOD! I do end up smelling like a stick of Big Red, but my dry winter skin just loves it. I think it was also available in Lavender. It's a totally cute shop. The owner and his shop assistant that I've met have always been completely wonderful. And the product is really good. You won't regret checking them out.

2.description: Sam's soaps are the BOMB! This little shop in Portage Park has everything you need to satisfy yourself as well as your friends and family. Take advantage of Yelp check-in to get free bar of soap.

5.description: I visited this store for the first time today and loved it. There's a variety of specialty soaps, salt scrub, body butters, and other goodies. They sell a lotion bar that practically melts in your hand, but is so easy to carry in your purse or bag in a tin. I also received a free soap with a $10 purchase today, sweet! The owner is friendly and knowledgeable, and makes most of the products himself.  Everything in the store is all natural, its great! I will definitely be back for the shaving soap and brush for my hubby:) This is a great store to find something distinctly different for anyone on your Christmas list, or any other time of year.

6.description: Hands down, one of the best shops in Portage Park!  Sam, the owner makes all of the soaps and everything about the natural ingredients.  I've bought so many teacher, hostess, holidays gifts here, it' not even funny.  Love the soaps and the other products he has complement his soap selection quite well.

7.description: I really like this store! I only bought a few soaps, but I am ready to go back and try some of the body scrubs and lotions. They have lots of great smelling bath bombs too! The owner is very friendly. I would much rather support this local store than have my bath supplies sent from Lush in Canada. It is a great addition to the neighborhood!

8.description: Super cute inside! Feels like I'm in a shop in Lincoln Park - lots of charm and character. Love buying local - great artisan soaps, bath bombs, salts and tons of other stuff. It's like a hidden little gem in my neighborhood! I am soooooo glad that we are getting more and more businesses like this right where I live!

9.description: Great little store.  I got the yelp deal for my wife and she loves the salts, lotion and bath bombs.  Looks like we'll have to make a return trip soon to restock.

10.description: Great products. One bar of soap is making my whole bathroom smell lovely. Their seasalt works great as a scrub.

4.description: I met Sam at a holiday market last weekend.  He is very friendly and knowledgeable about the art of soap-making.  And I was happy to stand and chat with him because his soaps smell SO GOOD!  Cannot wait to stop in and see his shop.  Highly recommended!

1.description: Vince is a high quality barber and gentleman!  Takes care of business and is old world charm!!

0.description: I've been going to Vince since I moved out this way a little over a year ago. He does a great job. He's old school and laid back just like his shop. 60s, 70s decor with a little 20 in. TV most of the time playing metv with the old westerns. He's quick, he's affordable, he's worth every penny!!!

28.description: We stopped in because it was across the block from Eva's- which is I'm sure how they get much of their business.  We were curtly told that if we didn't have an appointment there was no way to try on gowns.  So, we started browsing."The nice gowns are in the back.  You need an appointment to see them.""Well, we don't have an appointment, and we drove 45 minutes to get here.  If you want any chance of getting our business, you'll let us see the gowns that aren't ugly like these to convince us it's worth coming back.""You need an appointment to see the nice gowns."What's with the attitude, and how can you run a business like this?  Screw it, I don't care if you do have "nice" gowns.  This kind of business model doesn't deserve to be in business.

1.description: Terribl customer service. Completely rude about my dress preferences and was negative about my wedding date and venue choice. She talked poorly to me about customers before me and also surrounding bridal shops- this does not make us bond, it makes me trust you even less. She also was rude when I told her what I was looking for and implied that I would never find it and needed to be less picky. Well guess what? I found it- and gave another shop my business.

9.description: I just recently purchased my Bridal dress from them and once I walked in, I was greeted by Jackie and her mother. I had been searching for a dress for 6 months and had been to about 12 stores across the Chicagoland and Indiana area. I hadn't made a decision yet because I felt that every other store had additional expenses that consisted of $500-$700 for alterations and $500-$1000 veils with Swarovski crystals. Also other stores charged additional for bustling of the dress, I feel the bustle should be included in the alteration price. So when I walked in to Jackie's Bridal I was greeted with a warm smile, and there was a difference in their stock of dresses. Jackie has Maggie Sottero and Midgley which is a brand I am in love with! The mother and daughter duo were so knowledgable and informative of wedding couture lines and brands , also they knew the industry like the back of their hands. Plus they have been in business for over 17 years, so I knew they are talented at what they do! Overall, I am in love with the store, their warm spirits, and their talented craftsmanship! Altogether my alterations are $350 which included taking in the free to up to 2 sizes and the bustling. Plus they are giving me 50% off any veil I like, and they have veils that are $200 and under, which is very reasonable! Jackie's mom is the seamstress and I found ease in trying on dresses and she was right there glancing over the areas of my body that she would probably take in. Overall I love this bridal store and I think people should def check them out!

29.description: I know Eva's Bridal was the next block over, but since the store was here we figured we'd go in and check it out.  They had a very small selection of bridesmaid dresses.  I think they had more Mother of the Bride dresses than bridesmaid dresses.  A lof of the dresses had so much sequins in them.  If simple is what you are looking for, then I don't think this is the place for that.  We didn't stay in so long to see the bridal dresses, but it just seemed like that was all we really needed to see to know.  The staff there was nice and friendly, but we just were not on the same page for style.

23.description: My past two (and only, thus far) bridal shop experiences have been NIGHTMARES!!  After my horrific experience at Eva's bridal, my sister and I walk next door to Jackie's Bridal, figuring it had to be better than crap-hole 10 steps away-WRONG!!  The place is about the size of a large closet (which would be fine with me if they had nice dresses), and I practically got a migraine from the thermostat being cranked up to 80+ degrees (or was it from the neon-colored prom dresses hanging by the door?)  Anywhoo, there were two sales ladies and two shoppers when we walked in.  One of the saleswomen was speaking with the customers, the other was behind the counter thumbing through a bridal catalog.  Apparently, whatever she was looking at was very important because she didn't even bother to look up from her magazine to greet us.  We looked at a few dresses and walked right past her to the back, and still, not so much as a side-glance!  Then we walked by the other sales lady, to whom we were invisible as well.  We looked through maybe three small racks of ugly dresses, which were packed in as tightly as could be, and left less than five minutes after walking in.  We even stood around for a second to see if anyone would offer to help us, be we walked out without so much us a "goodbye" from them.  I'm kind of traumatized...time to try River North bridal shops...

5.description: I think they are really good, I went to so many bridal dress places, at the end I find out the one I like from here, it's amazing.

25.description: This was by far the worst bridal experience I've had and could never imagine giving them any business!  When I called to request an appointment the first time, I was hung up on when I said my wedding date was a year away!  Since I was in the area and it was horrible weather, I decided to still head in.  Although the store was completely empty, I was told I needed an appointment.  Next, I asked if I could at least look at the dresses to see if I wanted to wanted to come back and was told no!  I am surprised such a small store stays in business with such poor customer service!

12.description: I visited Jackie's Bridal while shopping for my wedding dress, and from my very first appointment I had a great experience.  Jackie was very helpful as I tried on gowns, and she even provided tissues when I found the one!I was kept informed on the status of my dress, and I even ended up choosing bridesmaid dresses from Jackie's.The staff was always courteous to me and my maids, and I truly enjoyed working with Jackie.

21.description: I went to Jackie's Briadal after leaving Eva's bridal, which if I ever see those people again, I'll kill them!! Rude as hell!!!Anyway, Jackie and her mom were very sweet to me and even gave me half off on a veil and threw in my shoes for free!!! Whoever said that they were rude are stupid. They have no patience, as I know that new brides are nervous and very rude, but Jackie was very sweet and they don't rush you like the bitches, yeah I said it!! at Eva's Bridal.

16.description: Went there without an appointment, just to look at headpieces and veils. Had a wonderful experience. They had a much better selection than other bridal shops I've been to. I bought my headdpiece and veil that day.

17.description: I went to Jackie's Briadal after leaving Eva's bridal, which if I ever see those people again, I'll kill them!! Rude as hell!!!Anyway, Jackie and her mom were very sweet to me and even gave me half off on a veil and threw in my shoes for free!!! Whoever said that they were rude are stupid. They have no patience, as I know that new brides are nervous and very rude, but Jackie was very sweet and they don't rush you like the bitches, yeah I said it!! at Eva's Bridal.

10.description: I gave it an honest shot.  I was trying to be open to the horrible reviews on several bridal salons.  This one proved to be true.Walked in and basically, I am assuming it was Jackie, came to the front.  Handed me two books to look through and tell her which ones I liked.  Then another woman (maybe her daughter...??) came to the front.  No introduction, just asked if I had time to look through the book.  I showed her the one that I liked.  Oh forgot to mention that Jackie told me that the dress that I liked was the most popular and they had two dresses that were the same.  One was $800 and one $1200...so when the other woman came up, I told her that I wanted to try on the dress.  I asked about the two price differences.  She said they werent the same but similar but they didnt have the $800 in the store...?Anyway, went to the back with the most popular dress, I guess.  She literally hung the dress, undid the corset and told me to let her know when I had the dress on so she could tie me up.  Now, call me crazy, but isnt their job to help you get into the dress??  I mean this thing was much heavier than expected with layers, ruching, etc.  Help would have been nice.  I obviously had trouble doing the swoop and dive in alone....finally I got it on, but it was totally all over the place.  I almost laughed at myself.  She knocked on the door and asked if I was ready so she came in and tied me up.Honestly, I liked the dress, loved the dress.  It was heavier than the previous one, but felt like a little better quality for not much more BUT the customer service here was the reason I didnt buy from here.  I didnt really understand the cold nature of this store.  I had been to several bridal stores in the past two days...this was by far the most blah.  I guess if you have a dress in mind that they carry and dont care about a smile or help, this is the place for you.I also found it funny that they didnt have me look at any of the physical dresses or suggest any for me to try on.  I felt very unwelcomed.

11.description: Bad experience here, they promised me that the dress would be correctly fitted when they were done but at my appointment she showed "all they could do" and it didn't love up to the promise that she would fix it. I see that there are mixed reviews and when you're trying stuff on they are very nice, but after they are simply trying to get you out of the store

26.description: After calling 4 other different bridal shops which refused to help me track down a particular gown, Jackie's put in the extra effort to call the manufacturer in California and have a sample shipped to the store.  That resulted in Jackie's getting the sale and my getting the perfect dress.  On the down side, the ribbon-tying bustle system was ineffective and I dragged around a saggy bustle much of the night.  The halter top was too long and instead of actually altering the strap and adding new metal eyes for the hooks, the seamstress added nearly invisible white loops of thread which were neither secure nor easy to find; the halter came undone on the way to the venue.And, brides, check your egos at the door.  I'm a size 10 and on each of three fittings either mother or daughter/owner made a crack about my weight.  Not exactly what a bride wants to hear - ever!

27.description: This was by far the most pleasant bridal dress shopping place I went to. The women in the shop were phenomenal. I'm not sure what store these other yelpers walked in to, but I had the best experience.I walked in after hitting so many Bridal shops in the neighborhood. I didn't have an appointment, but the ladies helped me look over their selection and gave me some price points. I made an appointment to come in after work the following week. They had such a huge selection to look over, I was overwhelmed & they could tell. The older sales women gave me 5 suggestions & each looked better then the previous!When it came down to making a decision, they both gave me their honest & fair opinion & they were right. It was a dress that I would have not picked out for myself, but it fit me like a glove! All of their dresses were of far better quality the half the dresses I had seen at other nearby shops. They had beautiful veils, even mantilla style veil, that I ended up getting.The best part is she was super understanding that I could not pay for the whole thing at once. She let me pay half then a little by little of what I could.I just want to give every bride the chance to go in this special bridal store & have the experience I had. You won't be disappointed!

0.description: Jackie's Bridal is awesome, plain and simple. I visited a few bridal shops before coming to Jackie's and wasn't pleased with the selections available or the lack of interest in helping me find "the one." After describing what I was looking for, Jackie pulled out a dress that she said she knew I would love and she was spot on with her recommendation. Putting it on gave me chills and actually brought tears to my mom's eyes, which hadn't happened at the other shops. I even left Jackie's to try one more place and went back that same day to get the dress Jackie picked out for me. Unlike some of the reviews here, I think everyone was extremely helpful. Each time I came in, whether it was for a fitting or purchasing accessories, we smiled and laughed together as they helped me with a dress related task. But then again, I came in with a smile on my face to make sure they knew that I appreciated their help and dedication in making me feel like the most beautiful bride. I knew I needed to drop a few pounds and she didn't hesitate on reminding me lol. But I loved that about her because she wasn't going to lie and say I look great when she knew I could look even better in my dress. In the end, I lost the pounds, she altered my dress perfectly and I couldn't stop smiling as all of my guests complimented me. I highly recommend Jackie and her team.

20.description: UPDATE - The owner, Jackie, is pure trash.  After being treated like dirt, and owing me a HUGE apology, she sent me this in response to my review:"Thank you for ALL your great input. I was pleased to know you LOVED our gowns but would rather have purchased some where else because with an additude like yours it was a pleaseure to lose you."This low-class creature clearly has not been properly educated on how to treat customers, run a business, OR use deodorant.  Seems that many people shared a similar experience.  Sorry, but when someone writes about being treated the way that these people treated me, you APOLOGIZE, not slam them.  Jackie really needs to learn how to spell too.  Nothing funnier than insulting someone and making multiple spelling errors.  What a trashbag!

19.description: My experience with Jackie's Bridal was nice but not great. The staff was friendly & tried to be very helpful although I must say that I was disappointed in the size selections of their bridal gowns.
