I am somewhat of a plus size girl (size 14 but in couture gowns I have to wear 16 or 18) and the largest size they had was a 12 which was a gown that I wasn't so interested in trying on, but I did anyway just to give it a try. I was never able to try on any of the gowns I actually wanted seeing as they had most of them in a size 6. If I had been one of those insecure brides I seriously would've had a melt down. lol  So I give them an A-OK because they were very nice & we were all having a good time in the process of "trying" to find something for me.

2.description: I had an amazing time at Jackies Bridal. Jackie was able to help me find my perfect dress. She listened to what I wanted and found a dress that I feel in love it. As a customer, her service was great and she kept working with me on finding a dress. I recommend Jackie's Bridal to anyone who is looking for a wedding dress.

18.description: Self-Disclosure:  I am not a girly girl, gets excited to try on dresses, Kardashian type of gal (despite my unditional love for Khloe Kardashian), so I will admit I was less than thrilled to be going in to a notoriously terrible store to try on a bridesmaid dress.  With that being said, I am a pretty easy customer, if I do say so myself.  Friendly to a fault perhaps but straight forward, decisive, and informed.  The dress was already selected (while it wasn't my favorite dress ever, it was pretty nice, despite the larger than life flower attached that costs $40 to remove, for some reason..), so I figured the experience would be pretty easy.  Wrongers.  I was encouraged and near forced to purchase a dress that was 2-3 sizes bigger than my size.  This would be understood if I had a certain area a bit (or lot) larger than another area and in turn would require alterations.  I get how it works.  However, I do not, and to my defense (the only rational thing one of the workers had said), even the sales person said something similar re: similar proportions.  Now that that's out there, I had to purchase a dress that would inevitably need alterations in mild paranoia that I would not fit into the dress I would of course never wear again.  I picked up the dress after it had been in the store (I believe a week, I am unsure exactly how long, to be honest, as I was NEVER called by the store as I was promised I would be) and was lectured about how "I may have to pay extra for alterations now since I waited so long to pick up the dress."  The wedding was in 6 weeks!  Do they not realize that there are countless places in Chicagoland that do alterations within 24 hours (including where I had my wedding dress altered!) for a far less expensive rate?  I understand 'we're all trying to make it in this crazy world,' but please.  Like I was even remotely considering giving my business to them.  The tailor I ended up using laughed about this place (tailor not even closely located to Jackie's Bridal) saying he had had to do many alterations before due to dresses being 'way too big.'  I had to have  major alterations done on every area...waist, length, you name it.  The thing that really bothered me that I've been saving for last is that they commented on others in the wedding party's bodies to me, very inappropriately..Who does that?  While I was not directly insulted re: my body, I was frankly very insulted and shocked that someone would even comment on people that perhaps could have been my life-long best friends (while they are not, how the hell does she know that?), relatives, etc.  I responded by just saying positive things about these girls re: their beauty, etc. to show her how people are suppose to talk about others, at the very least their customers who will never return.  So sad to see that bullies exist in every facet of life, including wedding dress stores where I'd respect more the opposite BS: fake smiles and tireless encouragement.

13.description: I had a wonderful experience at Jackie's. The mother( owner) and her daughter were very friendly, understood my taste and helped me find my perfect dress. I walked into Jackie's simply due to location( I was checking out another bridal store nearby which I didn't like).  Both the mom and daughter were very helpful and eager to help without any appointments. I was quite surprised that the store I walked into by pure accident was where  I found my perfect dress.

4.description: The one regret I have about my wedding day is getting my dress from Jackie's Bridal. The in house alterations were terrible and my dress did not fit on my big day. Plus, the "seamstress" (also the owner) was completely rude. I should had known better when she didn't measure me for any of the fittings. Zero stars!

24.description: My experience with Jackie's Bridal was nice but not great. The staff was friendly & tried to be very helpful although I must say that I was disappointed in the size selections of their bridal gowns. I am somewhat of a plus size girl (size 14 but in couture gowns I have to wear 16 or 18) and the largest size they had was a 12 which was a gown that I wasn't so interested in trying on, but I did anyway just to give it a try. I was never able to try on any of the gowns I actually wanted seeing as they had most of them in a size 6. If I had been one of those insecure brides I seriously would've had a melt down. lol  So I give them an A-OK because they were very nice & we were all having a good time in the process of "trying" to find something for me.

6.description: SUMMARY: I think that Jackie and her mother have forgotten that they are not just selling wedding/prom/special event dresses. They are selling a dress that will serve as the focus for a significant moment in the owner's life. They are selling a memory that the owner will take with her for all of her life. They are forgetting that they can contribute to that memory by being a positive highlight or a stressful disappointment. When buying my dress, I envisioned having a wonderful experience where I would take pictures, have a heartfelt memory, and starting a relationship with a salon that would last generations. I did not expect to be crying, alone, in a car, on my birthday after being yelled at for my dress not being ready on time. If you are looking to have an experience where you build memories- do not shop here. If you are looking to be treated like you are at McDonald's and still spend thousands of dollars- then shop at your own risk. I plan on notifying the designer house Maggie Sottero about my experience and the type of salon they have identified as being an authorized retailer.DETAILS: After reviewing the online reviews I was hesitant, but I followed the recommendation of my MOH. In calling to schedule my 1st appointment to pick a dress, whomever answered the phone was very curt and brief: name, what do you want, date, ok, hangs up. I called back because I wanted to confirm if I could bring 5 guests w/ me, because other salons had stated they needed approval for parties more than 4. Again the response was short: bring whomever you want just not your whole family, hangs up. I was nervous but I moved forward. At the salon I met with Julia, who is a delight. She helped my try on a dress I never would have and I found an amazing Maggie Sottero gown. I did not have my mother with me and she understood how personal of an experience this was for me and why I wanted to share it with my mom. I came back with my mother and purchased the gown.After the dress arrived I was told to schedule an appointment one month prior to the date of the wedding. I did so and explained I was nervous due to having a destination wedding, and I explained how important it was to have the dress on time. The assured me that the dress would be ready one week after the first fitting. I came in for my first fitting, measurements were taken and I scheduled a time to pick up the dress in 2 weeks. They said I would come in, try on the dress and then if I approved I would leave. On that day, I took off of work, spent over 3 hours driving to pick up my mother and bring her to the salon for the final reveal. When I arrived, the dress still had pins in it and the stitching was still taken out. They made up a lie and said: this is only your 2nd fitting and the dress will be ready in 1 week. I did not allow this to upset me because I still had time before my plane would leave. They offered to have the dress done in a few hours and I told them I did not want my wedding dress to be rushed, I wanted them to take their time and to do it right. We scheduled a time for me to return in a week (which is 5 days before my flight). I rescheduled my b-day plans and instead drove to the salon to pick up my dress, this time I had to do so without my mother. I came to the salon on my b-day and they said: did you not get my message on Saturday (this was Monday) we said the dress would not be ready until after 5PM. I was so upset. I was told:* It was my fault for coming because they left a message.* They were busy on Sat. because they had a wedding to go to and if they would have stayed to finish the dress they would have been late to the wedding they planed to attend.* The reason you are so upset is because you can't handle the stress of being a bride and aren't ready.* I am not going to bother talking to you when I could be sewing your dress* You can choose to wait for your dress or you can leave.A plus, Jackie did offer to complete the alterations and drop the dress off at my house. This couldn't work because my fiancé would see the dress and if I needed more alterations or if it was not right I would have to go back to the salon again.  After having no choice but to wait my dress was ready about an hour and half later. I checked the sewing and it was half-hazard and not worth over $300. I was disappointed and when I pointed out that the dress was not falling well on my hips, the mother/seamstress told me that I needed to be better at watching what I eat. (I'm a 4)When I went to leave with my dress, Jackie pulled me aside to prove that she called. I tried to explain to her there still had not even been 1 business days' notice of a reschedule and she had already had an additional week to complete the alterations. Her mother/seamstress interrupted our conversation, and told me: why are you talking so much? You talk so much! In a couple years from now you will look back and wonder why you are talking. With that, I walked out.

22.description: So, I don't know if the people that own Eva's are giving Jackie's customer service tips- but these two (which are right across the street from one another) should just go into business together and crash and burn at the same time.  Now, if you feel like you're in hell when you're in here- don't be alarmed- for some reason they feel the need to crank the heat up to 110 degrees in this joint.  Not only were we not so much as greeted upon entering the store and literally walking 2 inches past TWO sales women, but the dresses were vacuum packed into a space that was not much bigger than a good size walk-in closet.  I know how Julia Roberts felt in Pretty Woman after this shopping experience- only sad to say I was NOT in Beverly Hills and the women working here were even more hideous.  Don't waste your time.  At least this bridal shop was less than 5 minutes of my life I'm never going to get back. Pa-the-tic! ZERO stars!

15.description: UPDATE - The owner, Jackie, is pure trash.  After being treated like dirt, and owing me a HUGE apology, she sent me this in response to my review:"Thank you for ALL your great input. I was pleased to know you LOVED our gowns but would rather have purchased some where else because with an additude like yours it was a pleaseure to lose you."This low-class creature clearly has not been properly educated on how to treat customers, run a business, OR use deodorant.  Seems that many people shared a similar experience.  Sorry, but when someone writes about being treated the way that these people treated me, you APOLOGIZE, not slam them.  Jackie really needs to learn how to spell too.  Nothing funnier than insulting someone and making multiple spelling errors.  What a trashbag!

7.description: ZERO STARS!!!! I purchased the first dress i tried on from here. When it finally arrived i went for my first fitting. The whole dress was dirty on the bottom and they said its because they just cleaned their carpets. Really? So your dragging my $3000 dress through your whole store?? Annoyed i went home. When i came back for my second fitting the dress was still dirty and they wanted $300 for alterations. I decided to go to my tailor who was sewing my bridesmaid dresses and she said she will charge me $100. When i got to her she zipped me up and noticed a big hole around the zipper!! The reason i didn't notice this hole the previous times is because they would also zip me up. I am so upset i paid $3000 for this dress and A. it was dirty and B. ripped!! I would not recommend this place for anyone!!!!! Also, the veils are expensive i paid $700 for two one short one and one long one. For veils i would go to davids bridal. Some dress advice- if your dress will have sequin/rhinestones on the top of your dress dont get a veil with rhinestones outlining your veil because for me my veil kept getting stuck on my dress.- GOOD LUCK!POINT OF MY STORY DO NOT COME HERE!

8.description: I would not recommend this bridal shop. Zero customer service, they don't care about their customers. Moreover, owner is extremely mean and rude. Make sure you read and double check you receipt before they cheat on you. Will not come back or refer my friends there

3.description: Beautiful sequence dresses and amazing service.  Jackie and her mom stayed past closing and were very patient and helpful.  My sister, the bride, is very particular and there were multiple dresses there that she loved.  She's going to say YES to the dress!

14.description: I had a wonderful experience at Jackie's, so I must admit I'm quite surprised to read the posted reviews. My future sister-in-law (the bride) were in the area looking at some of the other bridal shops, and we had some time to spare in between appointments, so we decided to give simply walking in a shot. Jackie greeted us as soon as we entered. We explained that we didn't have an appointment, but that didn't seem to bother her. To be honest, she didn't even give the slightest indication that it was any sort of problem at all. She pulled out two large books and allowed us to flip through them, marking the dresses we'd like to see. This was brilliant, as dresses look different on people as opposed to hanging on racks. The selection of dresses was beautiful. She had every style that a bride could want. My future sister-in-law was interested in the mermaid/trumpet styles, and there was a wide variety of them. All of them were gorgeous. Jackie pulled all of the dresses for us, and even went so far as to remove one from a mannequin. I know that's a hassle, but she did so gladly. Unlike our experience with other consultants, she was very patient, and HONEST. We appreciated it. She didn't put any pressure on us whatsoever. Not to buy, not to hurry with trying on the dresses. She would admit when something didn't look right, whereas other consultants would drop their jaws and say "oh, it's beautiful!" Her feedback was excellent, and something we defintely took into consideration while viewing the dresses--which, by the way, were lovely. She was constantly giving suggestions on how to accessorize the dresses, and took our reception of each dress openly. By the time we were halfway through the fitting, it seemed as though she knew exactly the kind of dress we were looking for. We ended up falling in love with the dress she'd pulled from the mannequin. And the price was amazing. We had been under the impression that the dress would sell for double of what the actual price was. A nice surprise.We didn't purchase the dress (yet), we're taking some time before making the decision. But we did make an appointment to revisit Jackie's to see the dress once more. It was our best experience out of six bridal boutiques. Jackie was kind, patient, and honest. She seemed more concerned with helping us find a dress, than making a sale. The selection of dresses was incredible and affordable at the same time. We have a feeling that we found the one! But even if for some reason we don't end up purchasing a dress here, we had a wonderful experience. Thank you, Jackie.

3.description: This place is A ok great beer specials. Flat screen tvs even thought one was a chain going through the middle of it.

1.description: I think I can accurately describe this place with three words. Just a Bar.  This place is definitely just a bar, as a matter of fact that's what it says on their awning in the front.   This place has a few tvs and pool table if you're into that kinda thing.  There's also a jukebox with a limited selection.  This is a neighborhood bar so there's mostly a bunch of regulars in here but the beers are usually on some kinda special so this is a decent place to meet up and get your pre-game on before going out.

2.description: Well, I've been in the area and for over 2 years and only recently came across this place. The brick exterior and smoke windows can be intimidating, but once you get past that it's not a bad little joint. Any place where you can get beers for $1.50-$2.00 and watch your fave Chicago sports team is a winner in my book. And on top of that, they also serve the infamous Malort....plus! Real Chicago bar here, posers need not apply.

0.description: The cast of characters at this place is what makes this place great! From the daily urchins to the weekly stopper byes! It's a fantastic shot and beer joint!

1.description: I feel so compelled to write this, that I am doing so waiting for our check. I was expecting it to be crowded, it is a Sunday afternoon after all. The bottom line is, it wasn't that busy and the service is beyond horrible. The waitress seemed like she had a chip on her shoulder. I would like to tell her, she should switch careers. We waited over 15 minutes just for our order to be taken, and another 40 for the food to come out. She gave me decaf coffee, when I asked for regular. I can keep going, but I will just stop here.I can promise you that I will never come back to this location, and that is saying a lot since my love for French silk pie is unconditional. Get better Bakers Square, start with managing your restaurant and employees better.

9.description: Went here with my sisters and have never experienced such bad service. We could not even get our waters refilled, however the Caucasians next to us had the waitress as their service. The food was fine, not bad but not very memorable. However  due to the lack of service, I would never return.

23.description: I used to come here all the time back in high school.  I stilll come here every once in a while with family and friends from the neighborhood.    It's a chain restaurant, duh.  But it's not half bad.  Burgers, foccacias, pitas, pastas, soups, salads, and the pies.  Greasy but not too greasy.  Nothing super healthy on the menu but tasty.  They always have monthly specials and what not.  The pies are sooooooo good.  Different cream pies and fruit pies.  Always fresh.  Always delicious.  Always calorific.  Nice quiet place in the neighborhood if you feel like relaxing a little and chatting over pie and coffee.One more thing, I bring my developmentally delayed uncle here sometimes and the staff is so sweet to him.  They always give him special attention.  A lot of the staff have worked at this location for many years so I think management treats the staff well.  A staff that likes where they work always makes me feel good!

25.description: Sooo many memories of coming here on those late nights after work... *happy sigh*Decently nice waitstaff at this location. There is also a parking lot (in case you care).Pretty good food. Sandwiches, soups, salads, oh my! Everything I've ever gotten from here has been good. I remember especially liking the slow-roasted turkey foccacia. Mmmmmm...The pies...yummmm (if you get the right one). My picks:Banana CreamCoconut CreamAny of the apple piesPecanCaramel Apple Pie a la Mode (OMG! Best ever!)So as I sit here and wipe up my drool, I wonder...I've Baker's Squared lately. Have you? :)

12.description: I ordered the strawberry crepes, which were delicious and done perfectly.. I love the service. We were seated very promptly and ask us if we will like something to drink. I wanted some coffee, the waitress brought me back a cup and a Carafe with more coffee and extra creams and sugar.. My son order the Mickey Mouse pancakes  with bacon. Pancakes were nice an fluffy.. Will definitely go back.

21.description: Sorry to be the "fly in the ointment", but my family and I just had the worst meal ever at this restaurant.  Granted, the staff was pleasant and the restaurant clean and quiet.  The disaster occurred when the food arrived.  Both the grilled cheese sandwich and the patty melt were burned black.  Although the cheese in the grilled cheese sandwich was not melted completely-go figure!  The child's order of turkey and gravy was so dried out and small that I would not serve it to my dog.  It looked like leftovers that had been reheated several times.  It seemed a little ridiculous to send EVERYTHING back to the kitchen, so we kept it.  We had decided to revisit this Baker's Square after receiving poor service at another Baker's Square, hoping this place would be better.  We were sorely disappointed and will probably not be venturing into a Baker's Square for a meal again.  It's a shame, because we've been regular Baker's Square customers over the years and we do enjoy their pie.  The pie must be the only reason they're still in business.

16.description: Pie is decent, slices are small (or my expectations are too high)I would go back if I got a coupon.Oh, and wednesday is free slice night (with  any purchase)

17.description: Perfect blueberry pies ala mode! This is the only place that comes to mind when i think of this recipe. Damn the ex that got me hooked on it. :)

10.description: I personally like Baker Square over IHOP so I got to this location for breakfast. They have good customer service. The manager on duty always acknowledges the customers. I love the strawberry crepes or the pick four special. Huge parking lot which is a plus you can always find parking and a table right away.

5.description: Until the age of ten, I associated Baker's Square with the smell of cigarette smoke because the smoking and nonsmoking sections were essentially one and the same. Since then, a lot has changed. Indoor smoking is banned. The table arrangements have led to a more spacious floor. The restaurant looks bright. Management has gone through many changes. Even the menu seems new to me now.I hadn't been to Baker's Square in years because I found it depressing and the food subpar. I came here with my mom recently for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress, Rebecca, was attentive and polite and the food was actually good. I got a great chicken avocado sandwich. The assistant manager also helped my mom decide on the best slice of pie since she's diabetic and needs to limit her carb intake. I used to come here just about every week as a child and now it seems like a very different restaurant. It's still a place for senior citizens to posse up, but it doesn't overwhelm me with a sense of dread the way it used to. Between the service, the new decor, and the menu, I won't object to going here anymore. I'm glad I gave it another chance.

11.description: "Baker's Square is so under appreciated", said my boyfriend as we pulled into the dreary parking lot. "It's actually pretty good", he added.And it was decent, compared to similar places in this category. Particularly the ones in the area. My food did not wow me, but was alright. The pecan pie, however, was pretty darn outstanding.Service wasn't great. Our waitress disappeared quite a few times.

22.description: I like Baker's Square. It's dependable.  You always know what you're going to get.  In spite of that, I don't get to BS very often anymore, and was perturbed to hear that the chain was in financial trouble.   I stopped there today with a friend for a quick lunch, and I did wonder what I'd find.  Often places try to cut corners when they're looking at bankruptcy, thereby making the situation even worse as they alienate loyal customers with sub-par food and increasingly nasty conditions.Fortunately Baker's Square -- this one at least -- has not succumbed to the cost-cutting trend, at least not in any obvious way.  The place was clean and attractive, the staff was friendly and attentive and the food was as good as ever.  My cobb salad was very, very fresh, and the portion was as generous as ever.  My friend had their fish special and said it was excellent.  I believe him since he cleaned his plate.  He also polished off a sizeable hunk of carrot cake while I indulged in my favorite: triple berry pie.  The iced tea refills were free, and the prices were reasonable.  I brought a whole cheesecake back for the workmen who are doing the reno at my place, and my bill for both lunches and a hefty cake was only $40.  Darn good for what we had and the service we were given.It's easy to forget the dependable chain restaurants when you're on the lookout for something new and interesting.  But there's a lot to be said for the familiar, the moderately priced , and the honest, simple style.

0.description: What is there not to like about Bakers Square? The food can best be summed up in one word and four letters: IHOP-Dennish. The food there is what you can call your typical American diner grub although, their variety is a lot more refreshing than that of an IHOP or Denny's and, just like its national franchise counterparts, Bakers Square offers breakfast anytime.The best thing about Bakers Square is the one thing that those other guys don't offer, namely, a slice of pie with any entree. What? That's right, you get a 3 course meal for the same comparably priced meal at IHOP or Denny's, and we ain't talking about just apple pie either, let's see, there's cherry pie, strawberry pie, pumpkin pie, peach cobbler, oreo pie, pecan praline pie...I'll stop right now because I'm starting to sound like Bubba Gump when he was describing shrimp to Forrest.If you're looking for a fairly quick bite to eat and don't mind pie (what are you, a Nazi? Who doesn't like pie?) Go check out Bakers Square.

20.description: Pie is decent, slices are small (or my expectations are too high)I would go back if I got a coupon.Oh, and wednesday is free slice night (with  any purchase)

19.description: love Baker's Square. It's a diner-like atmosphere with hospitable service. I've been to this location a couple times to have dinner with a friend. Last time I came here was back in Feb. I came with a friend in the evening and they had this awesome deal going on: 1/2 a sandwich with your choice of soup or salad and also a slice of pie all for 7.99 or 8.99. They had 2 menus to choose from different types of sandwiches and the grilled sandwiches were 8.99 and cold sandwiches were 7.99. Our server Amanda was nice and very helpful.

2.description: 3.5 Cozy interior. Came Labor Day Monday at 3pm. Floors pretty unswept/vacuumed. Server was friendly, but didn't come by too often. Food was pretty good, with some misses. I ordered a chicken avocado melt, which came with mushrooms and sour cream. It was tasty, but the mushrooms had a sauce that soaked through the bread and made it very soggy. The fries were completely forgettable. I didn't even plow through 25% of it. Tried with both ketchup and ranch. There was really no saving it. The cream of tomato basil soup was surprisingl every good. Good a mount of sodium. Complex base. Definitely did not get flavor boredom here. For dessert, I had the hazelnut silk pie. Uhm... it's NUTELLA!!!!! I usually always get the french silk, but had to try this out. It was a win. I love that it wasn't overpoweringly sweet... although I still had to share the piece, and even with help, couldn't conquer it. Definitely good for a splurge, but even then, it's a splurge I'm only willing to take rarely.

18.description: I used to come here all the time back in high school.  I stilll come here every once in a while with family and friends from the neighborhood.    It's a chain restaurant, duh.  But it's not half bad.  Burgers, foccacias, pitas, pastas, soups, salads, and the pies.  Greasy but not too greasy.  Nothing super healthy on the menu but tasty.  They always have monthly specials and what not.  The pies are sooooooo good.  Different cream pies and fruit pies.  Always fresh.  Always delicious.  Always calorific.  Nice quiet place in the neighborhood if you feel like relaxing a little and chatting over pie and coffee.One more thing, I bring my developmentally delayed uncle here sometimes and the staff is so sweet to him.  They always give him special attention.  A lot of the staff have worked at this location for many years so I think management treats the staff well.  A staff that likes where they work always makes me feel good!

13.description: Kevin SUCKS as a waiter!!! Ignored us for long periods of time, had to beg for refills on tea & water, food was warm but not hot when it came out.

4.description: Amazing that this place is open til midnight. The service is great usually but the last time I was there it was kind of slow. Food was tasty and the pie at the end was super delicious as always! They have so many different kinds of pies on display when you walk in, yum!

24.description: How bizarre that there's a tv commerical on for this place RIGHT as I am writing this.It is what it is -- an adequate chain place to grab a meal if you're way the hell west.The menu has plenty of high-fat selections, the food is served quickly, and at the right temperature. I'm not saying that it isn't tasty. Service is pleasant and responsive. I would like it to be a tad cleaner than it is but that isn't enough for me to completely rag on it.I don't need to tell you about dessert, right?

6.description: Service was below par...I felt like I was in the movie The Steppford Wives...From the hostess to the waitress is was all a fake..I will be back when pigs fly...

15.description: way over priced. i go there with 3 people and we spend 50$ for basic food and pie. i have been twice and the next time im just gonna go for their pie ** by the way my apple pie with ice cream basicly came flat. pies should be standing up. not falling off the plate. it tasted good but looked awful.

7.description: Pleasant experience. I had breakfast with my mom on Sunday (May 31st). The manager was very attentive. Our server, Stephanie, was very sweet and polite. The breakfast was delicious! The restaurant is also very clean and it's so cozy from the inside.

8.description: The service and food are both fabulous! I ordered the Ultimate mac and cheese. It was the best I've ever had at any restaurant! It arrived at my table warm and creamy and wasn't dry at all like at most places. I also ordered the lemon merengue pie to go and it was great! The waitress was very attentive. She also told me about free pie on Wednesday with any food purchase. Spectacular restaurant!

3.description: Terrible customer service.  Wasn't that busy and waited 10 min for a side of mustard and mayo.  Patty melt is the best around but only if you eat it warm. Chicken avocado melt came with chicken that didn't taste fully done and the size of the chicken was less then half a half piece of bread.

14.description: It's Baker's Square, all around alright food,  and pies! However, the service was horrible, didn't get refills, and got the wrong pie initially. The waitress seemed intent on avoiding us, which is a sucky feeling to get as a customer.

3.description: Pretty standard local bar. My boyfriend loves this place though. I do have to say the food is surprisingly yummy!

1.description: Oh how I love local establishments!  Friday night karaoke drew us in to meet up with friends.  We were hungry and told they had good food.So I got a burger... good, but the bun was a bit too greasy, it came with a very large side of yummy onion rings too.  Husband had garlic parmeasan wings which were very tasty, and very garlicy.  Then there was the chips... the french fries, really... very thick cut potatoe chips, deep fried to tasty perfection.  We had them smothered in cheese, bacon, tomatoes and green onion.Atomosphere was good.  Hawks game on in the main bar and karaoke goodness in the back.I can see popping in again.

2.description: Stopped in early in the year around January. It was playoff football season and I was in the area so gave it a shot. I had been wanting to stop in for a while during my daily drive home just never got around to it. This particular day I took the plunge and was neither wowed nor disappointed. Had the feel of a regulars bar with a slightly more modern feel. I sat at the bar and ordered a beer while I watched the games. The crowed was a bit older and a few regulars walked in during my time there. Seemed like everyone kept to themselves. Bartender was nice but she was not very warm to this newcomer. So basically I felt like I was just sitting on my couch alone drinking a beer. Didn't try the food so can't speak on that but it did seem everyone was trying something. Overall a nice cozy little spot if you go with a friend or a group. I probably wouldn't be back only because of so many other little gems to try and discover.

5.description: A nice neighborhood bar that gets four stars for layout and comfort in the bar. They also have attractive Russian bartenders so that is another reason for a good ranking.  A diverse crowd inside that will never be mistaken for a wrigleyville sports bar.

6.description: Close to my house, its never ever crowded and the beers are cheap.  It's a great place to watch a game or hang out whenever you don't feel like going to wrigley.  Plus there's a lotto scratch off machine that I've spent way too much money on.  So there's that too.  I don't think I've had a bad time here so if you're with friends around Harlem and Irving, check it out.

7.description: Had a blast here. Brought a few friends to this neighborhood bar and they finally have food. Guess what? It's good food. We had burgers that were thick and juicy. Very flavorful and cooked the way we asked. Loaded chips were good. They make homemade chip slices and load it up w cheese sauce, bacon and sour cream. Tomatoes topped it and they were delicious. Tried the wings... Good size and crispy w lots of sauce. Only it was spicy garlic when we ordered hot. None the less, tasted like Buffalo Wild Wings spicy garlic. So it was good anyway. Owner is a delight and very friendly. Bartender was spot on and the prices were fair in comparison to a neighborhood bar. We are all in the industry and liked our experience. There is a shortage of young people, and it's a little bright but were not complaining. Everyone was enjoying themselves. We will definitely be back, and can't wait to try more food.

8.description: I like this neighborhood bar! Nice cozy casual atmosphere. Lots of room to comfortably sit and watch a game. They have a really nice beer garden outdoors with lots of seating and even a TV outside. It gives you the feeling of being in someones backyard.  I've been here on a few occasions for parties where the back party room has been rented out and that's a really nice space to have a casual party. Some may disagree but I like that the party room is still open to the main bar area so it's still private without feeling too excluded from the main atmosphere. Decent prices, drink specials. no frills but a nice place to socialize!

9.description: Great Neighborhood sports bar. Big screen TV on the wall along with a couple hanging over the bar so you don't miss a minute of the game. They have a pool table, foosball, darts and pinball. Great beer garden!

0.description: Great neighborhood bar. Good prices and I can go with the wife or the dudes. Tons of parking too!

4.description: The place is great to catch a game - for the most part good people - always a couple of "gang bangers" pop in here and there. I'd go back to watch a game and enjoy the patio - but the FOOD was awful - could have been a bad night but - burgers were not cooked, grilled cheese had solid cheese in the middle we had to ask for it to be re cooked. Polish was under cooked also..SMH. Again could have been an off night

58.description: I have been to this place NUMEROUS times.  Two of my best friends got their wedding dresses here and got amazing deals.  I also got a bridesmaid dress here and my own wedding gown.  Here's the deal....they are great until you put down your money.  Then they are ok but not as helpful as they should be.  Their selection is really great! Including their sales rack where you can get an amazing dress for cheap and take it home with you on the same day.I didn't have the luck to find a dress off the racks but I did find an amazing gown and ordered it with a nice discount too!  But then I came to get the dress and there were not super helpful about helping me in and out of the dress.  And then they left me standing by the mirror by myself for a while and I had alteration questions.  When I told them I was going to need alterations based on how the dress fit, they did NOT tell me that I had to make an alterations appointment.  Yes, I did come in on a day that the seamstress wasn't there but they never told me that i needed an appt with her!!!Bottom line, they are OK but they could be a lot more helpful. Edyte ROCKS!!!! She gets FIVE STARS.  But c'on, help a girl in and out of her dress!  I shouldn't have to ASK for their help in and out of the dress, it should be part of the service.When I got my dress, at first look under fluorescent lights it looked REALLY white and I had ordered Ivory....So they quickly took the dress away and I could HEAR them talking about me and my dress in the rooms nearby talking about how it's definitely ivory and that I need to see a white dress next to it! Fine, no problem, but don't doubt a bride's words.  All I needed to hear was, "under these lights it may look white, but when you are out by the natural light you will see the ivory and we can compare it to a white dress!!!!"  Don't go talking about me specially when I can HEAR YOU!!!!  Yes, the dress in ivory but it wasn't my first impression of the color!In the end, I decided to find my own seamstress for alterations because I left with a poor taste in my mouth.  I would definitely go here again to shop for dresses but really only because you get GREAT value, not so much the service.I do have to admit they are VERY responsive if you call them.  When they say they will call you back, they do! So A-OK but they have some improving to do.OOOH, Also, it was NOT cool that they don't accept American Express!LASTLY:  My dress came in a garment bag into the dressing room.  I just went to take my dress out of it so that it doesn't wrinkle up and guess what??!?!?! THEY KEPT THE BAG and sent the dress home in a clear plastic bag.  Like the ones from the dry cleaners!  I failed to notice this because they put a white plastic bag over it so my fiancé can't see the dress.  Seriously? I want my garment bag!

56.description: I was mostly just concerned about getting an affordable gown and Eva's seemed to offer that. I dropped by just to see their selection before making an appointment and they were very inviting. The day I had my appointment went quickly! I'd already seen most of the dresses and it was pretty easy to collect the ones I wanted to try on - no hassle from the staff or otherwise. And the other reviewers are right in that their selection is pretty sizable! Their sale room has dresses to purchase right off the rack - most around $1,000, from what I saw. Kay was the woman who helped me and she was very sweet. She grabbed a few dresses for me from another room based on what I was looking for and did a decent job. The thing that was kind of crummy was the size of the dressing room and that I was left to try on the dresses myself - with only the help of the company I brought along. The fluorescent lighting wasn't so great either. But aside from the not-so-ideal environment, getting a dress for $700 was a major win. When I found my dress, Kay brought me to the main part of the store to stand in the broader mirrors, which was nice. We asked about the "no photos" policy but she encouraged us to do whatever we wanted and we had out about 3 cameras. She laughed about us getting her in trouble, but let us do our thing. When it came to the veil, there was no pressure to purchase. She heard my mom and grandmother sewed and suggested they might as well make it! Overall, not a bad day at all. Eva's does the job.

29.description: Horrible experience. First off, the owner parked in the handicap spot, and wouldnt move. This was  an issue because my mom needs the handicapped stop. The salespeople were terrified to ask him, so I did, and he refused. I looked at a few headpieces, but really, with that attitude of the owner, why should I spent my money there. I wish I could give this a ZERO  stars.

42.description: I bought my wedding dress at Eva's.  I was looking for a Morilee retailer, the reasonably-moderately-priced ($700-1200?) brand that my best friend bought and was gorgeous in a few years ago.  I looked at a TON of dresses, by Morilee and other similar designers in the same price range.  Ultimately I did get a Morilee dress, after visiting it about three times.  I'm rating four stars because I had a good experience, I found what I was looking for, and they delivered on time.I was also able to try on the deeply-marked-down samples, of which they have a TON.  If you're looking to find a nice gown at a steal of a price (and willing to buy day-of because it might not be there when you come back), check the sample sale.  They also have an everything-included alterations deal which you can get if you buy there and I think that's an awesome deal.  If it wasn't so far from my home I might have used them instead of my tailor, but I couldn't get out there three more times before the wedding!A few things to expect:  I felt a bit of pressure to buy on the first day, but I can't really blame them as it's totally possible you might go away and not come back.  If you make an appointment to come back, it gets you out of bargaining on day one.  Also, I thought the dressing rooms were modest (though well sized) and a bit run-down.  This isn't your marble-floor and gilded ceiling designer bridal shop.  If you want that, and also want to spend $3500 on your bridal gown, maybe you shouldn't try here.  But if you want a reasonably priced high quality gown from a reliable place, I would say, Eva's is your place.

23.description: Eva's was my third stop on wedding dress shopping and I was really excited.  After a wonderful day, it was disappointing to end at Eva's.   Cons- There were eaten lolly pop sticks over the couch in my fitting room.  Gross- Sad to watch them throw these beautiful gowns on the floor in between fittings- This lead to my favorite one (the dress I found online and brought me into the store) being dingy and didn't lay right. I couldn't tell if it was the dress, or lack of care. - Loved a look of a dress that didn't quite fit on my non size 6 body.   I didn't want to buy a dress that I couldn't try on, I was not upset by this.  It just leads to my next point...- After I got dressed to leave, I heard someone (manager?) yelling at my sales contact for not closing the deal with me.  I heard her point out I didn't want to buy a dress that I couldn't try on, and they weren't pleased with that answer*** Note: the offices are in between the dressing rooms and the showroom, so I was just walking out when I overheard this.   Pros- Multiple dresses in different prices ranges- ParkingI wouldn't recommend Eva's for wedding dress shopping.UPDATE MADE AFTER EVA's response...I stand by everything I said and experienced.  This would have been a chance for you to learn from poor customer service and again, you provided why you only deserve one star.   I doubt your response written two months after my visit allows you to accurately remember me.         Everything I listed above happened.   There is a difference of putting a dress on the ground while you step in and out.  That did not happen.  The dresses were piled on the floor, not hung back up.   That is not how I'd treat my gowns.   I tried to give you a completed that a like a look of the dress.  It was my favorite of the dresses I tried on there, but not one I considered buying. I didn't go into all the details in my first round but yes, I pointed out the directly lolly pop sticks to the sales associate.  She suggested I don't sit on the couch.  I found a tissue and cleaned them up myself. Re: the size of the dress, I just pointed out the dress didn't fit me to explain why a sales associate was yelled at.  I am a size 10/12 and am proud of that.   I tried on many gowns at your store that I couldn't get past my curvy hips.  Shame on your for trying to say anything differently.   I was never upset that the gown didn't fit, just that someone would push me to buy a gown that I didn't try on!! My guess is whoever respond to this review is the person I heard YELLING at the sales associate.  Perhaps if you're so concerned that this behavior could lead to someone being fired, you should have asked me for more information to handle the situation internally versus insinuated it never happened. Inappropriate on many levels.

47.description: ***Store will not take measurements unless you order from them***I came here to try on a bridesmaid dress. It was the only store in Chicago that had the style, so I didn't have much of a choice. I had been here once before with a friend trying on a bridesmaid dress, but it was a few years ago and I didn't remember specifics. I called to confirm the dress was there. The woman on the phone said I did not need an appt unless I was coming on the weekend. I told her I would be in later that night. When I arrived, I was greeted by at least 5 ppl standing at front desk. They pulled the dress right away and I headed back the fitting rooms. The stylist who worked with me was fine, but she smelled like she had just come from a cigarette break and that grossed me out. Once I had the dress on, I had to go out and find someone to pin the dress properly, I inquried about sizing and how that was determined. I was told that they would need to do measurements and then select the appropriate. She quickly mentioned that they will NOT measure you unless you order from them. Wish I would have been told that over the phone before I made the hour trek out there. I am ordering from an out of town store to receive the group discount the bride set up. Cons: store is old and dirty. not impressed with sales associates or the dressing room

8.description: So excited for my amazing friend found her gorgeous bridal dress here. Excellent customer service and a great variety of dresses. Great experience!!!

31.description: Judy was very nice and helpful ;however, she only showed me the veil without trying it and as a new bride, i didn't know the veil was only one layer after trying it on with my gown after 2 months on my last fitting from the taylor shop. That night i went to the Eva's and Judy wasn't there. I got my originial receipt and just want to do an exchange. It was 2 mos ago purchased and I know my fault too. I thought the final sale was the only gown I bought because it was discontinued but also the veil! The problem was the  supervisor there didn't want to do anything about the veil one layer I purchased for $119!!! That expensive!! I even told them that David's Bridal selling the same veil a lot cheaper for $70!!!  The other manager " old man" even commented that he can't teach common sense when I said I didn't realize that the veil was only one layer just after 2 mos. without checking it. Well, I'm sorry Mr.you're genius! I am a customer, I need to know what I need to know as a customer, I am not a Bridal consultant. My fault again, I got excited that day and so my mind was somewhere. In the end the problem was resolved but not customer friendly.Over all, customer service is horrible!

34.description: I was very satisfied with my experience there. I've been there a few times for myself and friend. I'm not sure what people expect in a bridal salon. It's not "Say Yes to the Dress." It's a place to get a wedding dress.

16.description: Just bought my dress! Couldn't have had a better experience! With my sister and bestie. Judy accommodated to all our needs and helped pick out styles I did and didn't like. Just to test out what looked good and did not. Couldn't be happier with my dress!

13.description: I had a wonderful experience finding a wedding dress at Eva's bridal!! I was so relieved and happy I didn't need to look any further than Eva's- they had a gorgeous selection, and I loved many of the dresses that my very helpful and sweet consultant, Gina, helped me find. And when we found the one that stood out above the rest, I was very excited to say yes to the dress! Gina was extremely helpful through the process/ she made me feel comfortable and really helped make a typically stressful experience not stressful at all!! Thank you to Eva's bridal and Gina for helping me find a dream wedding dress!

11.description: If you want a beautiful, positive event with a not damaged dress that is done ON TIME-don't go here. I went for a bridesmaid dress. Sample sizes are VERY limited (and small). the environment is dated and dirty. When I went to try on I was alone noone sought me out to help with the purchasing, zipping, seeing who might have already got this dress (the bride did same colors for all, different styles, no overlapping), or price. dress arrived 4 months later, I got a crumpled up dress in a plastic garbage bag (goes for brides and your $2000+ dress too, garment bag not free, extra $30). They did not and do not press dresses for you and instead hand it to you out of the box, letting you leave with a wrinkled dress-attendant even said it came in a box and they pulled it out and hung it (pressing is extra $25-$50 depending who you ask-shady) It was a disaster, bottom of this floor length $320 gown did not touch the floor. Not only did it not hit the floor (barefoot), it was on an angle upward where one part was lower than the other part by 2-3 inches.In comes manager Flo (blonde 80's style hair nasty woman). Flo's said this dress was uneven b/c my hips were uneven and one was higher than the other. Next she said "you are wearing the dress wrong" and came up and pulled it waay down. i said to her "the fabric literally ends right above my nipple-is this right?" she said "yep that's how the girls wear it" i was like "no you dont get it its literally a half inch above my nipple and way under my armpit" she said "no thats how you have to wear it"She then said the dresses are made for girls who are 5"6 with a 2.5 inch heel. I told her I am 5"6 with no heels and it isn't touching the floor. I asked if she stood behind her product/dresses, she said "no, i didn't make this dress so i can't and won't take ownership for how it turned out" then i asked her to at least acknowledge that it was uneven and way too short, she did. she had a bad attitude told me i can keep it as is or send it back and hope a new one comes in time but that it probably wont then shrugged her shoulders and left never to be seen againAfter 1 hour (2.5 hrs total), a seamstress gave me some options-she turned out to be incompetent too as the alterations she told me would take 2 weeks took 3.5 and when i was due back at 3pm on a monday she said she totally forgot and needed even more time.Gina came next who was also terrible. She is the woman who initially was there with my appt and who left me alone. she asked me why i didnt discuss adding length at the bottom during my consultation (my consultation with the MANAGER Flo). i told her because i am not a bridal consultant and am only 5"6 so why would i need it? She told me i should have mentioned to my consultant i was going to be wearing heels to the wedding and because i didnt mention that this mistake happened-wait dont most bridesmaids wear heels? also the consultant said these dresses are made for a 5"6 girl with a 2.5 inch heel soo here i am wondering why is it not hitting the floor if i am 5"6 and barefoot.she said i should just return my heels to get flats. after THAT she asked how tall the guy i was pairedwith was. i said we're similar...she then said "well you dont want to be taller than your date anyway! get rid of these heels, get some flats and then you wont look silly next to your date and your dress will hit the ground!"she then took me to the computer to look at a pic of a model in the dress. i told her it looked right on the model but didn't change how bad my dress looked, she said "well honey models posing for these kinds of things are made to look perfect and have perfect dresses" and i said well mine should be perfect too. i also reminded her this model was probably much taller than 5"6 and her dress draped beautifully onto the floor.they kept saying my short dress was an advantage because i won't trip or rip it etc. Noone could admit that it was wrong and looked terrible. noone offered me solace, a discount, or any kindness. my dress was over $300 and for that price i have a certain standard. I told something similar to Gina, I said "you know, if i was at davids bridal and i spent $100 our conversation would be different, but it's not davids and this dress was over $300"..her response: "yes i know i suggest davids bridal to a lot of clients who come in because it is more affordable". i asked for them to waive remaining balance and i could just leave, they refused.they also upsize you big time to make $$ in alterations (happened to our whole bridal party + bride)also: my aunt knows a seamstress and we asked if she could come in, Gina said she'd check, she came back and said "oh I'm sorry, she left for the day"...well ok no biggie except when we were exiting who do we see? the seamstress! We asked Gina "oh I thought you said she was gone for the day" but Gina had no answersave yourself the stress and do not go here. Dirty, shady, only accept cash for final installment

39.description: Date of Service: October 2012I went in for my appointment one morning and the ladies were very pleasant and helpful. My consultant was such a sweetheart and as soon as I told her I was looking for a long sleeved dress she went on a hunt to find the only long sleeved dresses they had. She told me that long sleeved dresses are really hard to find now since the wedding trend is sleeveless but that she will find all the ones she has. She pulled out 2 dresses and she was not liking them. But then she remembered about this dress and she right away brought it to me. That was the one! She immediately put me in the dressing room. Helped me put on the dress, she was as excited as my mom when she saw me with it on! The whole experience was amazing! She fixed my hair and put a veil on me. She told me the dress was for me. And I agreed!! The dress has lace sleeves with beading. The best thing was the price, $699 on sale! The dress was perfect. The consultant was a doll. I will never forget the experience I had there! :) The owner of the store saw me with the dress on; she was so sweet and told me that I looked gorgeous. Sweet ladies, quick service and one of the best experiences I've ever had in a retail shop. Thank you Eva's Bridal for making my wedding dream come true!

37.description: Very poor service overall.  My bridal consultation took about 10 minutes and I tried on 2 dresses. The bridal consultant rolled her eyes at me every time she pulled a dress I didn't like. The dressing rooms we're filthy, and when I walked out, no one said a word to me. I would never recommend this place to anyone and I will never be back!

0.description: This was my first experience wedding dress shopping, so I have nothing but Say Yes to the Dress to compare it to. I came to help my friend pick out a wedding dress and I have to say it was a very efficient process. We had a 11:30AM appointment time, but we got there around 11AM. They let us start early and she tried on five dresses and found the one in under 30 min. I think that's a world record if the tv shows are at all accurate. I thought they had a good selection available and while they were not a name brand boutique their prices more than made up for the lack of name brands. My friend was able to get her dress with all the adjustments for $2,000. So much more reasonable than what the TV shows would have you believe. At checkout they had her ring a crystal bell to signal that she had said yes to the dress, cute! They require at least 6 months to complete the dress not including Nov-Dec because of the Chinese NewYear? We ordered the dress in Sept and they said it would be ready in June of next year. The location is in a small shopping center in an obscure part of town. Although the shop might not look as fancy as you would like, the dresses are pretty and the price is right.

38.description: I am a DC bride, getting married in Mexico.  I have 3 BMs and 1 MOH, and of which only one lives in my timezone, so this makes dress shopping as a group impossible.  I chose the designer, the length and the color, and all of my girls get to choose the style that they like best on their bodies.  I sent one BM out look for dresses in her area (Chicago). She landed at Eva's, where she was told she not only could not try on dresses, but couldn't look around either, without either me (the bride) or 3 other BMs with her.  Since I'm not planning a trip to Chicago any time before the wedding, and 2 of the other girls are not within driving distance to go shopping with her (she needs all 3 anyway), I guess that means that Eva's lost business on potentially 4 dress orders, since we had not decided yet on where we were ordering from.  In the age of facebook, skype & long-distance friendships, this policy is absolutely ridiculous and stressful to brides who are trying to plan a wedding with wedding party members who live far away.  I do not recommend Eva's Bridals.  Ever.

51.description: Various appointments, various issues = do not recommend.The only reason I went to this store is because they carried the designer and style I was in search of. 1) Ambience - None; store needs serious updating. Floors/carpet dirty/stained, rooms small/dingy with weak, inefficient lighting.2) Bridesmaids dress selection = Unimpressive. There were a few nice and pricier selections, but my jr. bridesmaid niece (age 9) was not impressed at all. It was quite embarrassing but I overheard her likening the dresses available for her selection, to those in a second-hand store... 3) Staff - Rude, uninviting. The bridal consultant was fine throughout the process. However, the other staff was rude, abrupt and uninviting with each visit. I expect more from a long-standing bridal salon especially when one is making a significant purchase. 4) Dress order - I was told that it would take five to six months for my dress. Which was very close to my wedding date. I was told (to apparently allay my fears) when it arrived, the alterations wouldn't be more than two days to do. They also ordered a different size than the one that was indicated from my fitting. They notified me after the fact, that a different size would be be ordered unless I signed off. I signed off. Five to six months later, guess which size arrived... The one I did NOT sign off on.5) Alternations - as with number 3, no or little help offered or given through the fitting process. Non-attentive, constant in/out of the rooms and rushed feeling at all times. When we posed questions, abrupt and vague responses. I wanted to walk out to the main room to see the dress in actual light (see number 1 above- terrible lighting) and was scolded that it would get dirty (see number 1 again - dirty carpet) and they have no responsibility [due to the conditions of their own salon]. They notified me it would be over a week for the (minimal) alternations (see number 4 above- notice, not the two days). 6) Garment bag - when first saw the dress, it was in a clear plastic bag, which I found unusual given that it is a designer gown. I will be traveling with it and wanted an opaque bag and called exactly a week later to check if it was ready (if the buttons were sewed on yet) and was brusquely informed that it was not. When I asked about a bag, it seemed like I was speaking in circles when I was trying to ask questions and it seemed as though she did not want to speak to me and notified me that I can get it when picked it up, and there was a charge. She was utterly rude. There is no reason why my gown shouldn't have have its original, designer-provided garment bag. It was provided in the end...I would not recommend this bridal store.

27.description: I think they stink!   My daughter flew in from Florida and we didn't realize that you needed an appointment for wedding dresses (early morning - middle of the week - no one else in the store!).   They were rude, so we ended up going to Kasia's on Irving Park Road (Wonderful!!!!).   So, they lost a sale, but after reading these reviews, it probably was a good thing they didn't accommodate us!

32.description: I'm soooo happy with Eva's bridal shop! I literally called them in the morning, email them the style of gown I want. Dorothy immediately call me back and squeezed me in. I was actually late but Delia still took in and picked out the most amazing wedding gown. I loved it. Eva's bridal is the best place. Go and ask fir the double  d! Dorothy and Delia.

54.description: We had a great experience! I went with my friend today to shop for her wedding dress and she bought one there. Brianna and Gina helped us and were awesome! They made my friend feel so special. They worked with her on pricing too!We went to Eva's Bridal's International first and it sucked. It was super small, we couldn't be in the dressing room with my friend, only the lady could. She was WAY TO PUSHY and rude. It made us all feel very uncomfortable and we couldn't wait to leave. It just ruined the experience.But Brianna and Gina at Eva's Bridal of Chicago (Yes almost the same name and on the same street but different towns and not affiliated at all!) saved the day! They had us laughing and really enjoying the whole thing. My friend loved her dress and they made her feel great. We even had a mini photo shoot at their encouraging once she picked her dress. She got a great price and had a wonderful experience! Highly recommend!

48.description: I've noticed this place has a lot of low ratings, and maybe it's because the reviewers aren't working with Edyte. If you are visiting Eva's, then request Edyte!  I met with her twice this weekend, and she was great.  She was super nice, helpful, down to earth, AND she understands the concept of a tight budget.On Saturday, I tried on several beautiful dresses but one stood out the most.  It was $295 marked down from $900.  Even though it was inexpensive, it still looks luxe and expensive because of the quality of the fabric and tailoring.  Because it had been tried on before, there was a small make-up smudge on the side that I pointed out.  Edyte said they would clean it right away.  I put the dress on hold because I had more stores to visit.The next day (yesterday), I called and asked if I could come by and try on the dress again.  Edyte was so nice and accommodating and said I could come in any time.  When I arrived, the dress had already been cleaned; the spot was removed.  Edyte helped me put it on and then gave me all the time I wanted to stand in it, sit in it, and discuss it with my friends.  I ended up buying it!  It needs some minor alterations, but I understand that Eva's alterations are all a flat fee.  So I'm just going to take it to a tailor in order to find a deal.But bottom line: Eva's has gorgeous stuff that's very affordable. I ended up buying something that I wouldn't have picked out for myself. But Edyte has such great knowledge about what looks good on an actual body that she surprised me by finding something super flattering and beautiful that I wouldn't have thought of.  She never pressured me or made me feel uncomfortable (like they did at David's).  It was a great experience.

44.description: UPDATE - manager still has not grasped that the companys size chart is wrong. I will state again - the bridesmaid that ordered a size 12 WAS MEASURED by Eva's bridal, she WAS TOLD to order a size 12 as the "stylist" recomended... this bridesmaid is 5'9" 130lb... she is a size 4 because of her height... NO WHERE NEAR a size 12. I felt terrible for all of my bridesmaids, small alterations are easy, cutting a dress in half is scary and should never have to happen.Had Eva's bridal associates showed some understanding and ownership of mistakes this entire situation would have been avoided. HORRENDOUS CUSTOMER SERVICE is what this all comes down to. DO NOT GO HERE if you want to trust the "stylists" or company that are taking care of your dress.

24.description: On first impression, Eva's Bridals is an older, outdated store as I read in reviews before going there. It could definitely use some new carpet and paint. However, prices are still on the high end. I was pressured into buying a sample dress that was on sale for about 2/3 or 1/2 the original price that day because they will not hold anything. They tell you that if you don't buy it on the spot, it could be gone the next day. The sample dress was an older, discontinued style that was still modern and fresh looking. The sales associate I worked with, Kay, actually seemed nice (but the cashier/associate in the reception area was very rude). I also read other reviews that they are nice to you until you buy a dress, or until they know you are not going to buy anything, and I found this to be true. Kay did tell us the policy was not to allow any photos, but my mom snuck some when Kay wasn't in the dressing room. I have heard that some sales associates at Eva's Bridals don't help you get in the dresses to try them on, but Kay was very helpful with this and clamped the dresses. I bought my dress there and they held it for several months so I wouldn't have to store it, which was nice. I wasn't sure I wanted to get it altered there because I couldn't find many reviews on actual alterations at the store, except there were plenty of reviews on bad customer experiences with dress shopping at Eva's Bridals. The dress was huge because it was a sample size (12) and I am a 4-6, so alterations were very important in getting the dress to look right. Ultimately, I appreciated that they have a sales room where you can look through dresses on your own and you can buy off the rack right away. I did have buyer's remorse for a long time after being pressured to buy the dress immediately (also because I found it online in my size and closer to my size for cheaper or similar prices), but luckily I found a seamstress elsewhere recommended by a friend to make it look beautiful. :)

7.description: Maggie at Eva's bridal of Chicago picked the prefect dress for me.  I had tried on a dress at another shop that I was ready to buy and I explained to Maggie how the dress was and she was able to show me a similar dress but waaaay better!!  this bridal shop had a great selection of well made wedding dresses.  I am very happy with the dress I bought.  Thank you, Maggie for seeing my vision!

49.description: This afternoon I was pleasantly surprised to receive a phone call from Briannah.  They had been working on my dress and were ready (a week early!) to do a fitting.  I couldn't wait to see what it looked like with the changes.  So of course I hurried over!  Again, there was ample parking in the lot when I arrived.  I was greeted at the door by the lovely Briannah.  I was about 30 minutes early, but they welcomed me with open arms.  The receptionist was very kind as always, and I was greeted again by Gina and the owners.  Briannah led me back to try on the dress and I was introduced to Souad.  She was the seamstress who brought Briannah's vision and design to life.  This woman is amazing.  Actually they all are!  The dress looks completely different and it is gorgeous! I would never had been able to envision this design and it is all coming together perfectly.  Since the dress is so delicate, Souad spent not hours, but days, unstitching, re-stitching, cutting and pinning.   I love the way the dress looks on me and I was completely speechless when I looked in the mirror.  It truly is a one of a kind and I am so grateful to Briannah for her design, as well as the rest of the staff for helping and making me feel so comfortable.  What I liked best was that I never felt rushed or pressured throughout this process. They took their time with me and gave me many options.  I also valued their honest opinions which is huge, especially if you are shopping alone.  I go back again next week after the sewing is finished and then again for a final fitting.  I can't wait to see the whole look with shoes & veil!!!! When I read other reviews I must add that I think it is important to let them know what you want, don't want, like, or don't like when you are there. They are so eager to help you find the perfect dress and there are so many from which to choose.  The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  I have been a bridesmaid more times than I can count on two hands and I have been to numerous dress shops with my friends looking for their dresses or bridesmaid dresses.  My experience at Eva's trumps them all.8/8/12 I returned from my wedding, but would be remiss if I didn't follow up on the dress. It turned out beautifully for my wedding day and I wish I could figure out a way to post a picture, because they truly did an amazing job!  Thank you Eva's and Briannah!

40.description: I came here with my mother after a very dissatisfying experience at another bridal store. Wasn't expecting much and was a little put off by all the poof and glitter when I first walked in the door. Although I didn't have an appointment (it was a Monday evening), the receptionist told me to look around a little bit and they would get me a consultant, no problem. I ended up finding about 10 dresses (to my surprise) and started the trying on process with my consultant Edyta. I found a dress that I really LOVED. I tried it on 3 times, with Edyta clipping me in and giving her opinion (where needed). I was hesitant to pull the trigger but there was no absolutely no pressure from Edyta. She said, "It's your wedding day. I want you to be happy. Take the time you need to think about it". I came back a week later and tried this dress on again. I realized it wasn't it and told Edyta I had seen another dress that I was pretty sure was the one. She did her best bringing me what they had in stock that was similar to the other dress and was never rude or annoyed. I loved her for that. Ultimately I did not buy my dress at Eva's, but I HIGHLY recommend stopping in there if you're looking for a reasonable wedding gown, but MAKE your appointment with Edyta!!  She really is looking out for the best interest of the bride, not herself and she knows what she's doing. A total class act consultant.

53.description: I recently went in with two friends, on my second dress appointment (the first here). At Eva's of Chicago, they now have a new manager, Briannah, who is fabulous.  My consultant was Gina, who was quiet at first but quickly warmed up.   Both of them helped by bringing in dress after dress. I explained what I liked, and every dress fit exactly what I was looking for.  Gina stayed in the dressing room (which was huge) with my friends and I, and helped me in and out of every dress.  It was great to feel so pampered.  I did find the perfect dress here, and they helped me on price!  After I decided, they dressed me up in hair accessories and veils, and my friends and I had our own photo shoot.  They weren't pushy, and all gave me a hug and congratulated me on finding my dress.  I can't wait to go back for my fitting!!

30.description: I just got my wedding dress here. You get what you pay for. It's definitely not a fancy boutique. It's a big store with rows of gowns (bridal and bling-y prom dresses). The staff kind of briskly greeted me, had me fill out a form, and then set me loose to grab whatever I wanted. I had to ask if there was somewhere I could set my winter jacket and bag and then they opened a fitting room for me. From there my sister and I basically just did everything ourselves. We picked dresses, hauled them to the room, and them tried them all on with the clips they gave us to hold the backs shut.Given the look and vibe of the store, I was a but surprised to find that most of the dresses we were finding were in the $1500-2500 range. I had just been to a much fancier boutique with similar prices. But they did have dresses under $700, which the other did not. I slipped into one and things started improving from there. The world's cutest little old sales lady, Jeannine, had been checking on me and began raving about how fabulous I looked in it. She and my sister scurried off to peruse the discount veils and brought me one with two teeth bent in the comb. 60% off. Excellent.Jeannine pulled strings for me to buy the sample dress right off the rack (getting married in 3 months!). She was a spunky little thing. The other ladies behind the counter didn't seem to care too much to try to be friendly, but Jeannine was a doll and helped me still feel special even though the store's vibe wasn't overly different from any other store. Three stars for the store, five stars for Jeannine.

46.description: I had such a great experience at Eva's. My consultant was Judi and she was amazing!! This was the first bridal salon that I went to try on dresses at. I had 2 of my bridesmaids with me and when we arrived they let us have free reign of the shop and let us pick out any dresses we wanted to try on. Judi allowed my girls to help me put on the dresses and gave us time and space to decide if it was a "yes" or a "no" When I finally started to narrow down on the silhouette & fabric I liked Judi started pulling dresses that were similar to what I wanted. By the end of the appointment I had tried on probably 50 dresses and successfully narrowed it down to 2 dresses I loved. We left and went on to 3 more shops that day. I came back to Eva's a couple months later and of course asked for Judi. She brought out the dresses I had put on hold and I tried them on again. I ended up saying Yes to the dress!  In my experience shopping for a wedding dress has everything to do with your consultant. Judi was the main reason I came back to Eva's and I look forward to working with her to choose my bridesmaid dresses.

1.description: UPDATE:The owners of Eva's finally contacted me. She pleaded to take this review down, unfortunately my feelings are too strong and people should know the truth. She seemed like a sweet lady over the phone - and apologetic. I will keep my review up but I am adding this update to let others know that she she contacted me ... To take the review down.Horrible horrible HORRIBLE.I went to Eva's because all of my sisters have gotten their dresses there. I wanted to give them our business again. Everyone was decently nice when looking for a dress.When it came to alterations? NIGHTMARE.I had unexpected surgery that caused me to gain a few pounds and of course due to swelling I needed the dress to be a little looser. 1) I realized that this would take a lot of time in alterations 2) I realized there would be an extra cost. This is why as soon as my surgery happened ( July) I notified Eva's that I would need to do the above. Even after explaining the situation they told me I should wait until the beginning of September to come for a fitting for my dress ( wedding September 19th).I was confused but did they told me. When I went in for my fitting, still bandaged up from my abdominal surgery - no surprise to me the dress did not fit. It was too small in the waist ( expected) and too big in the arms ( a little unexpected).The seamstress didn't even walk into the room but laughed and said " well are you going to lose 30 lbs or buy a new dress". (She didn't come in to measure me  and said that 19 days before the wedding she can't get it done. She was SO rude.After the next few weeks of phone calls and multiple visits a week the dress did get done. When I called to complain about service... The manager didn't say anything.Me: "I felt disrespected"Her: mhmMe: so... Her: what do you want me to do about itMe: nothing I guess.I didn't want anything for free-I wanted an apology. Never EVER going back. Which is sad because the girls in my family were starting to make a tradition of "going to Eva's" for there prom/homecoming dresses, bridesmaid dresses and wedding dresses- this experience will never allow me to utter a positive word.

55.description: Eva's was the first shop we went to for wedding dresses and if you are looking for that dress experience...this is not the place to go.   I had an appointment and  thought everything was going well, until our consultant brought in 2 dresses, one of which was two times my budget.  I was really put off by the fact the consultant tried to up-sell me before I had even tried on one dress.  On top of that she would drop a dress off and leave, so my mom and friends were the ones who got me dressed in every gown (clips and all)!  The consultant would show back up after I was done changing, have 3 more dresses (many not even close to what I was looking for) and ask if I liked the one I was wearing, then she was gone.  Finally I had enough and told my mom to go break-up with our consultant, who then proceeded to give me some insight into competitors as a last ditch effort to get us to stay.   Needless to say, I would suggest many other places over this one.

9.description: I had the greatest experience at Eva's! The entire staff was very helpful and accommodated everything I asked for. The dress selection was huge with lots of different styles to choose from. I didn't feel pressured or overwhelmed even though it can be a stressful experience. I tried on so many different dresses and they didn't seem to mind one bit even when I couldn't make up my mind. I love the small business feel and even after checking out the chain stores I had the best experience and selection to choose from here.

26.description: I'll start by saying that this was the first boutique shop I went to in search of a wedding dress. (My previous appointments had been at two separate David's Bridals) My first appointment was bad. I have a 6 mo old son who my mom insisted we bring (she lives in Texas and waned to get in all carrying opportunities) him with us. That didn't go well. The consultant kept bringing me dresses to try on when I told her that I really wasn't in the to mood to try anymore on because my mom wasn't able to partake while tying to keep my baby calm. After the second dress she insisted it looked amazing and that if I bought that day I'd get a 1st visit discount price.
