I told her I liked it but didn't love it so she made it a point to tell me that my next appointment would be my second visit. At this point (dealing w a cranky baby and MIA mom and a huge headache) I replied with "I can count. And I don't want it." I caught her off guard. Regardless, I made an appointment to come back Monday while my son was in daycare. The consultant I had made the appointment for me. She have me a card and everything. I come in on Monday, an hour early and with family in tow (All in from Texas), to be told that I can look at dresses but I can't try any of them on. WTF?!Apparently it was a commission issue. I told the person who approached me thanks but that I would be leaving. What's the point of just looking? I can do that from the comfort of home online. I was never old this little golden gem of a rule. As as I was angrily telling my family to grab their bags and leave she came running out of the back to tell me I could try on anything I wanted. Apparently the manager okayed me doing this. (Good for you manager. I'm glad making the right choice for a customer was easy. That's a dumb rule. You should look into that, manager.)Everything went much better after this. Since we were an hour early for my appointment I dragged my Jr bridesmaids  to a room and they had a blast trying on dresses. We settled on both bridesmaids and Jr bridesmaid dresses. Their selection of wedding gowns is huge. I'm not sure what order they are in. My first consultant very quickly told me what I shouldn't even look at because certain dresses were out if my price range. My second consultant said that she would do her best to find comparable dresses. She was much more helpful. I give three stars because you can't take pictures. This is crazy. Brides need To be able to compare and visualize the dresses. I'm even sticking with two stars after a much nicer second visit because first impressions are everything, and they are awful upon meeting. They are very sales driven, this commission game makes for a bad experience as a customer. And they don't provide helpful criticism. I was much more comfortable at the Davids bridal where the consultant very nicely told me if something didn't flatter my figure. Eva's never said anything except, "that's the one!" To every other dress.

25.description: Got our bridesmaid dresses for my cousins wedding here. Amazing customer service. They have a huge bridesmaid section and bridal gowns. Also going back for my boyfriend sister's wedding gown and bridesmaid dresses.

12.description: I had a wonderful experience at Eva's. I had no problems making an appointment on a Saturday, they had a great selection, and were very nice. 75% of the dress is due when you purchase and the other 25% is due when it comes in and they take only cash for the balance. My dress came in the month they promised and I didn't need an appointment to go in when it arrived. It was so easy and stress free. Definitely recommend.

59.description: I had much higher hopes for Eva's when I came here on 9/25! I read the reviews, asked my friends who have went there, and made my apt with confidence that my fellow Yelpers would be wrong.But oh Yelp...you are always right.What amazes me is how Eva's hasn't changed...even with SO MANY other brides leaving similar comments. Doesn't the store even look at Yelp??Firstly, the consultant I had, Judi, didn't even ask me details of my wedding like formality, where it's at, wedding colors, nothing. Just my date and what I like. I told her my date and what I like (fit and flare but she whisked me away sooner than I could've told her I wanted to try on some a-lines too!) and my party and I were zipped off to the dressing room where it sounded like a high school party was going on in the rooms next to me (very distracting and took away from the experience). So I thought I'd give Judi a shot to redeem herself. But she didn't step foot ONCE fully into my fitting room. THANK GOD my mother and two friends were there to do her job of putting me into the dresses otherwise I'd be S.O.L. She would knock on the door throw more and more dresses at me and ask to take away the ones I didn't like. That's it. Just yeses and nos. Now let me tell you...I've worked as a bridal consultant before. To be successfull you cannot just ask for the yeses and nos, you have to ask what I do like about it and what I don't like about it. You actually have to TALK to your bride Judi!! There we were, 3 women trying to get dresses on me which took away from the experience greatly. This salon has such tremendous potential! They have amazing designers (I loved Enzoani and Jim Hjelm!) and I feel that for the money I would be spending on a dress I should get a fabulous experience to boot. But after the terrible service (or rather lack therof, Judi was very nice and listened to my suggestions), I don't want to give Eva's A PENNY of my money. I had a completely amazing experience at David's Bridal and I was MORE THAN HAPPY to give that consultant my money that day!All in all, if Judi would've paid me much more attention, I just might have bought my $3350 Enzoani dress from Eva's.

21.description: DO NOT GO HERE! They ordered me a dress that was supposed to be to big for me, then it can in and was way to small. My measurements were the exact same! Then they tried to charge me to alter it saying they would do nothing for me because I agreed to trust them with the size! They released the dress to me, only for me to open the bag ( which was a long garbage bag and not a garment bag) at home to find it filthy and ripped on the side! All within a month of my wedding! Terrible customer service!!! The worst bridal store in the world!

17.description: I'm not sure why Eva's doesn't have more stars!  I had a great experience when shopping for a bridal gown last year.  Maggie was my consultant, and she was absolutely wonderful!  I showed her one picture of a dress that I liked.  She found it, and one similar that she thought I might like too, and that was it.  I fell in love with the second one she found.  She was never pushy and seemed genuinely supportive of whatever decision I wanted to make on the dresses.  Maggie was really encouraging and made me feel great about my shape and body even though the sample dresses were not my size which can be discouraging.  My dress did take 6 months to come in, but based on discussions with other stores, that is just the norm for my designer.Also love that you can stop in any time you want to try the dress on with no appointment necessary!  The service I received at this visit was also stellar.  Forgive me for not knowing the name of the person who helped me, but she was also wonderful and made me feel beautiful in my dress.Fast forward a few months, I just had my first alterations appointment.  ANOTHER GREAT EXPERIENCE!  The women working at Eva's really know how to make a girl feel good about her not so perfect body!  There was an error when paying for my alterations (accidentally charged me for the wrong dress's alterations), and the woman at the front desk caught me before I even pulled out of the parking lot to fix it right away!Seriously, I was skeptical of this place when reading some of the negative reviews, but after my own experience thus far, I wish that my bridal gown shopping experience wasn't over so that I could shop here again.  I definitely recommend requesting Maggie if you are shopping for a bridal gown!

10.description: Had a wonderful experience at Eva's Bridal! Gina was FABULOUS. She took of our bride Maria and she said YES TO THE DRESS!

5.description: Judi was awesome! She really listened to what I wanted and went above and beyond to get me what I wanted in my price range. She was very knowledgeable and helpful during the entire appointment. The store has lots of choices at different price ranges for all types of brides! Can't wait to wear my dress!!

3.description: This was the most uninviting bridal boutique I have ever been to. I made an appointment, which seemed pointless and we were greeted by a women who had a frown on her face and who seemed completely disinterested. The bride gave a description as to what she wanted: chiffon, beach wedding, flowy dress, light. The women still suggested puffy dress after the clear descriptions and they were repeated again. The demonstration of the boutique and gowns were poor, and for a place that is very important for marital bliss, it was dim. During the fitting of the dresses, the boutiques personal stated that she must stay in the fitting room while the dresses were being tried on. No privacy at all. I understand that they are there to help in and out of the dress, and to prevent pictures to protect the styles, but it was as if they thought we were going to take off with the gown and run. After we gladly left, we went to Jackie's Bridal boutique, and were blown away by the awesome customer service. The bride fell in love and purchased the first dress she tried own. She got the best treatment she deserved. Including this boutique, there are three in close proximity. I advise anyone to go to Jackie's boutique and the other located across the street. If you enjoy wasting your time and feel like spending your money in a place that don't deserve it, this is the place for you.

35.description: We came here in a hurry after our horrible, horrible experience at LJM.  Preferring to buy bridesmaid dresses somewhere where our money would go to the *original* designer, we came to Eva's having heard good things.  True, the interior was Pepto pink, but that didn't bother me so much.  The sales associate was also very kind, accommodating us even though we came in about a half hour before closing.The thing I HATE is that they don't allow photos in their store!  I know this is somewhat common practice, but I think it's absolutely ridiculous. What if your mom, or another family member can't be there? How will you remember how you looked? How will you compare to other dresses at other stores?  I guess the reasoning is maybe that you will find the dress for cheaper somewhere else, but they DO write down the designer and style number, so you can price-shop anyway.Therefore, the no-photos rule is completely nonsensical and for us, was a bit of a deal-breaker in ordering from this shop (aside from the issue that the dress we liked here didn't come in the right color)

19.description: DO NOT GO HERE! They ordered me a dress that was supposed to be to big for me, then it can in and was way to small. My measurements were the exact same! Then they tried to charge me to alter it saying they would do nothing for me because I agreed to trust them with the size! They released the dress to me, only for me to open the bag ( which was a long garbage bag and not a garment bag) at home to find it filthy and ripped on the side! All within a month of my wedding! Terrible customer service!!! The worst bridal store in the world!

28.description: BAD experience. My consultant was not very pleasant. She asked me twice how I met my fiancé and was more interested in a sale than providing quality service. She rushed to put me in dresses and seemed very inexperienced. Additionally, I was not a fan of the no photo allowed sign on the door, as it made it very difficult to compare dresses after leaving the shop and visualizing how it would appear on camera. She also kept mentioning "We have the largest selection of wedding gowns!" That may be true but the dresses SUCKED. A complete waste of an hour.

45.description: This was my second time at this store, but the first for myself.I actually liked them here.  I thought they had a decent amount of dresses here.  Also, they supposedly have a great alteration lady that can customize the dress of your dreams.  One of my top dresses was here.  The only problem...it wasnt sweetheart and they actually couldnt make it sweetheart because of all of the beading on it.  Bummer.  If it would have been sweetheart, I probably would have said yes.I thought their price point was reasonable for what I saw similar in the area.Gina helped me and she was helpful, nice and not pushy but totally knew what I was looking for after talking with me.Not to mention, parking lot for all those terrible parallel parking people :)

33.description: Bottom line: overwhelming, used-car salesmen pitches and pushy sales tactics. Oh, and lies.I get it, if you are a larger size, chances are bridal stores are not going to have a lot (if any) samples to try on. I am well aware of this and didn't want to waste my time or any sales associates time in any store because of this.  So I don't go into stores in which I can't try on any dresses. My size is a standard size in any plus size store and not a crazy high number either. I chose to go to Eva's because their website touts that they have a LOT of plus sized wedding dresses to try on. I called ahead to find out if this was true. I told them my exact size and what sort of dress I would like to be able to try on. I asked if they had more than 1 sample I'd be able to try on (clips or no clips). Person on the phone assured me up and down they had quite a few wedding dresses in my style and size I would be able to actually try on. I made an appointment for the weekend.Bad traffic on the way to the morning appointment.  Again, I hate to waste people's time so we called ahead to let them know we were sorry, we'd be about 10-15 minutes late but would definitely be in.  Woman on the phone said no problem, they had our appointment and it wasn't a problem.So we are just getting out of the car, walking to the front door of the store 12 minutes late and my phone rings. Woman on the phone says it's Eva's Bridal, we are late for our appointment--are we still coming in? They have a busy day and we are late and they really need to know if we are coming in.I said yes, we called 20 minutes ago and spoke to (name)  to let them know they we were running a few minutes behind and (name) said that would be fine."Well, she never told us. Are you coming in?""Yes, I am literally walking into the store right now."Are you kidding me?So we were paired up with a fast-talking lady who would not let me get a word in edgewise. I told her I'd called ahead and was told there were a few gowns I could try on in my style and my size and wanted to start there. She said she'd pull a few dresses for us while we browsed some other bridesmaid dresses.Long story short--we were whisked away into a fitting room where sales lady pulled some dresses for me to try on. But, you see I could not try them on because NONE of them were in my size. Not a one. And I mean not even close where I could put it on and clip the back of them to get an idea. And again, I am a plus size but a very mid-range normal plus size.So, sales lady insisted I stand in front of the mirror and wanted me to just HOLD THE DRESS UP in front of me and "just imagine what you'd look like in this dress."I asked if there was anything I WOULD be able to try on. She kept talking about how I could get cheaper alterations and if I was worried about the price of alterations I could just go to a local tailor and not get it done at the store. I just needed to imagine what I would look like in the dress.I had to stop her several times just to remind her it's not the price of alterations, I just wasn't excited to spend $2000-$3000 on a dress I can't actually try on and have to "imagine" will work out well. That's when sales lady huffed and puffed and grabbed the remaining dresses and just left the room and never came back. Seriously. Before, we could not get her out of the room for a private 2 minute discussion, then, but poof. Gone. Never came back to check on us.So, we left. With barely "have a nice day" from the people at the front desk. They asked no questions and barely acknowledged we were leaving. Sales lady was nowhere to be found.Heads up to Eva's: It's not the pepto interior or dingy dressing rooms keeping people away. It'll take more than an interior makeover to make Eva's a place worth shopping.

43.description: I have nothing bad to say about Eva's. Edyte, my consultant, was patient, knowledgable, gave good feedback and was thoroughly enjoyable to work with. There was a very nice selection of dresses at a range of prices. I didn't buy my dress there but it was VERY close.

2.description: I'm confused about any good reviews posted. My girlfriend and I walked in for her to try on dresses and she immediately received the most unprofessional service! The woman was rude and not even up to date with information. I have never witnessed someone so unprofessional especially at a bridal shop. We went across the street to Jackie's afterward and the PROFESSIONAL and WELL INFORMED woman sold us a dress within the first 2 dresses! We even went over budget! And the woman here told us "well you have expensive taste hunny so it's more!". Shame on her! I'm making sure that nobody I know will waste their time or energy here!Suiz-4 (employee worth replacing)

18.description: Great experience !! The team gave us tons of attention. Buying my dress and bridesmaids dresses today!

41.description: I give this place 0 stars!! But it won't let me post unless I put at least 1 star!! Awful service and the dresses were filthy!!! I Will never go back to this place. The lady who helped us was rude and could care less what type of dresses I was interested in. She insisted on staying in the room while we changed and we had to ask her to leave while we changed.. I have no idea how this place is still in business!!

52.description: I made an appointment at Eva's in December 2011 to try on wedding gowns.  When I showed up, the consultant was still busy for another 30 minutes.  Finally she led me to a dressing room, asked the type of styles I am looking for, brought me one dress that I pointed out right away an then disappeared for 20 mintutes.  She came back with two dresses and then disappeared for another 25 minutes.  This pattern continued and most of the dresses she brought for me as options I didn't even try on because they were nothing that I liked (for example, I did not want pick ups and she kept bringing me dresses with pick ups).  I was there almost two hours, probably tried on about 5 or 6 dresses and mostly sat in the dressing room bored and cold.

50.description: When I called to make an appointment, the lady answering the phone was nice and asked all the right questions (date of the wedding, theme, etc.). Upon arrival, my girlfriend and I were promptly helped into the back changing room. I showed our consultant the dress I had in mind, and to my delight she said they had it! So why only three stars? Trying on dresses felt like a marathon. I literally started sweating at minute 8 as I was trying on dress no. 5. Seriously, slow the heck down! I have a year, not two hours to my wedding! Another turn off, I was offered a price and told that this is only good for right now, and if I come back, the price will be different. Why? I am a big girl and understand how purchasing works, and consumers do have all the power. If you can sell it to me for x today, I am getting the same price tomorrow. If not, I'll go elsewhere. And I did.

4.description: We did not feel welcome here. As soon as me (Maid of Honor) and some other bridesmaids walked in, the ladies looked at us like we didn't belong there. This was incredibly disappointing seeing that I was SO excited to come here. The woman who was supposed to help us barely did; the most she did was take our dresses to the fitting room and wrote down what dresses we liked. She didn't assist us with the dresses, she never even came in and checked up on us to see if we were okay in the dressing room! We were alone the ENTIRE TIME. I will NOT be returning here to purchase dresses.

6.description: Absolutely love Eva's Bridal!!! Amazing service and a huge selection of bridal dresses! I worked with Judy and she was very helpful and listened to everything I said! I ended up buying a dress that she recommended, with a veil and belt and I couldn't be happier!! Thank you Eva's for amazing service. I can't wait to wear my dress!

22.description: I've reluctantly given them 2 stars because the staff were fairly helpful and pleasant when we went to try on bridesmaids dresses. My family all live in the UK so, we took the opportunity two days before my own wedding at the beginning of the summer to go shopping for a bridesmaids dress while my sister - who is getting married in a couple of weeks - was in town. Time was tight so we needed to go somewhere with plenty of choice so, although the location is out of the way (I don't have a car), we headed to Eva's. There was plenty of choice and we found a great dress that my sister and I were both very happy with.We were told it would arrive early - mid October, which left me with plenty of time until my flight (the day after Thanksgiving). I had to chase them up and the dress didn't actually arrive until last Friday - just two weeks before the wedding. I'm absolutely swamped right now (for various reasons) so having to trek out there on my bike so late in the game to pick up my dress was not something I'd planned on.I've put on some weight since trying on the dress so I was worried it might be a bit of a squeeze around the chest - instead I discovered that it's WAY too big so now I'm scrambling to get significant alterations made before Thanksgiving. Either she measured incorrectly or they deliberately ordered a size that was much too large in order to gouge us on alterations.For a late, incorrect order that's left me in a major bind I'm wondering whether two stars is a little generous...

15.description: Been here before and they were rude me...fast forward 10 years and my soon to be mother in law bought her mother of the groom dress here, I had to drive over there to see the dress because they would not allow pictures unless you paid for it  (weird.) Also when I got there I told them if a flower that was on the dress was removable and the sales woman in a rude tone told me that's "what the mothers wear" um it's my wedding and if I don't like something I should bear to express my opinion...needless to say just buying a regular dress is an unpleasant experience I can't imagine buying a wedding dress there...

57.description: We didn't have an appointment, which I know is bad form. But still, we decided to stop in while we were in the neighborhood. We were rudely told that we couldn't look at wedding gowns, and basically, that we were not welcome. So we left; never looked at any of the dresses there, but we were so unhappy with the lack of even basic politeness that we just left.

20.description: Been here before and they were rude me...fast forward 10 years and my soon to be mother in law bought her mother of the groom dress here, I had to drive over there to see the dress because they would not allow pictures unless you paid for it  (weird.) Also when I got there I told them if a flower that was on the dress was removable and the sales woman in a rude tone told me that's "what the mothers wear" um it's my wedding and if I don't like something I should bear to express my opinion...needless to say just buying a regular dress is an unpleasant experience I can't imagine buying a wedding dress there...

36.description: I visited many bridal shops in hope to find the perfect wedding gown, but it wasn't until my third stop that I found Eva's Bridal of Oak Lawn!  During my appt (please note they are by appt only - no walk-ins) the consultant was very kind and considerate of my budget bringing me dresses based on photos and clip-outs I showed to her.  Eva's has one of the best selections of designers and gowns that any other shop so I tried on lots of dresses.  Once I found the one (Enzoani Dakota) I got a great deal because I purchased that day, but there was no pressure to buy.  I got my alterations at Eva's as well and everything turned out perfect.  They even tacked on a belt that I purchased off Etsy.com.  I even stopped by after my hair and makeup trial one night and they let me try on my dress to see a preview of what was to come!  I had a great experience with Eva's and would recommend them to my friends! Thanks Eva's!

14.description: Let's start with the positives: my dress was beautiful, perfectly tailored, and I had a lot of compliments. When I was dress shopping, the woman helping us was very friendly and listened to my feedback, so she picked me the perfect dress, which I bought. Also, the seamstress, Pat, was great. I wish I could have dealt with her exclusively.For these positives, I wish I could give at least 2.5 stars and not 2, but 3 is too high.I only ordered my dress 4 months out from the wedding, but they checked with the designer and said that was fine, it could be rushed and arrive mid-August. The dress didn't arrive until September, a week before my wedding. I would have been completely fine with that except Eva's did not do a good job of communicating the dress status at all. I called them in mid August and was told the dress would be there the next week...then the next day...then I was told that the tracking number said for sure by the next Monday....and so on. Total runaround. Three weeks later, Eva's emailed me to say there was a delay at the factory so the dress hadn't even shipped. So basically all the previous information about "it will be here in two days" was just fabricated to either appease me or get me off the phone. Either way, the communication was not transparent at all. Once my dress finally came (9 days out), I was told that there were no fitting appointments until 3-4 days later, even though I had literally begged them in advance to slot me some time, knowing that we were going to have a tight turnaround. I had to speak to two different people and really arm twist someone to be put on the fitting calendar the next day.I spoke with the manager or owner about this when I picked up my dress, and requested that my final balance (a nominal $34) be waived as a courtesy for all of this miscommunication and them not being forthcoming with information. They knocked off $10, which I found to be pretty insulting actually, and the woman insisted that no other discount could be given because the dress had arrived "on time." (It was ready for final pick-up two days before my wedding, when I did not really have the time to drive to Eva's in rush hour traffic).I really want to like this place better but had to give an honest review. I could have bumped to at least a 3 if the manager I spoke with at final pick-up had been apologetic and waived the $34 balance as a gesture of good will and customer service - it was not a lot to ask. But apparently $34 savings for them was worth a bad review.

58.description: I've been  coming here for over 15 yrs.  I've been exclusive with my current person (Aurelia) for nearly the entire time.   She's spoiled me and I wouldn't have my hair cut by anyone else here.  It's finally repainted a normal beige.  For a few years it was clownish bright green, purple and orange.  Not settling, restful or flattering and just plain silly.  It maybe plain, but it is so better that the crazy paint store remnant look.Prices aren't Fantastic Sam's or Nick and Betty's cheap, but they aren't Michigan avenue nuts either.  Tho, there are some of the Euro crowd stylists that are kind of crazy to watch.  Lots of young girls always looking at themselves for self perceived flaws in the mirror.  That drives me nuts.

56.description: The prices are fair, $30 for a woman's hair cut. But you ALWAYS have to wait. However, JUMANA is totally worth the wait! She rocks my hair out every time. I don't know about anyone else- as I've only ever gone to her. But I'll be devastated if she ever leaves! Jumana is truly a color expert if you need a color change, of any kind, I'd see her!

29.description: I have long, thin hair and I was charged $75 for an updo that looked nothing like what I wanted. She pulled my bangs and slicked my hair with hair stray ---  I had to have it fixed by someone else later in the night (this was for a wedding). I tried telling her that I don't like how slicked back my hair is and she wouldn't listen - I wish I remembered her name. I would never come back here again. I also got my makeup done. Ask for prices before you do anything. I ended up paying $100. My friend got mad about the price and they charged her $85 instead for the same thing I got. WTF.

42.description: I would only go to Jordan to do my hair because for the past 10 years I have gone to other stylists there and they all screw up my hair by burning it or making it brassy orange. I had hair to my butt and one girl there burned it so bad with bleach after I told her not to  Jordan is now gone and I need to find him!!!!!  My appointment in September was with Jordan and since he left they recommended  some chick who supposedly knew color and was so great . I had a beautiful sand blonde that Jordan always unkept for me. The girl messed it up and made it orange, brassy and tricolor of crap. I had to go elsewhere to fix it

23.description: Kate has been cutting and coloring my hair for 2 years love her.  Won't o anywhere else.

47.description: This place seems to be the hot place to go in my neighborhood and honestly, I don't know why. The salon is dirty and looks gaudy, the hairdressers are stuck up, and even unprofessional. I only came here twice: once because i had a coupon and another time because absolutely needed to. I first came here for a $60 cut and color, and while the girl was dyeing and brushing my hair, I was literally playing tug-of-war with her, she kept pulling my hair that hard. She also kept burning my scalp with the blow dryer. And my hair turned out nothing like i wanted. she barely clipped it and the dark burgundy i wanted appeared very pinkish. Also, people who were on break or something would sit down in the empty seats and eat. In a salon, really?! The next time I came here was because I had a botched dye job and needed it covered ASAP. Well, I came here since its right down the street. They were able to take me quickly (I came right when the first opened their doors at 9am) and the hairdresser I had was just absolutely chatty! I originally was going for a permanent dye job, but she talked me into a semi-permanent, or color deposit, since its much more gentle and will darken  my hair like I wanted. I'm glad that she was very knowledgable, but she really didn't need to repeat the same thing 20 times over and over again (I understood what a color deposit was the first time you explained it!!!) SOO this time I did leave with my hair the way I wanted it and I was happy for that, but the overall experience of this salon is a train-wreck. I would recommend going someplace else to get your hair done, don't come here.

8.description: Can I rate this place 10 stars??? Just got an updo for my baby shower with B.B. (Or it may be spelled BeeBee)...she was SO gentle and kept asking if she was being too rough. I was almost falling asleep! Lol. I posted pixs of my hair for you all to see the beauty

31.description: I love Gallery of Hair, I have had updos done here with Jennie N. and I recently had my hair colored and cut by Bebe. From the reception staff to the girl washing my hair, everyone is really friendly and knowledgeable. What I loved most is that Bebe took the time to really ask questions in my consultation and give me honest feedback and recommendations based off of the pictures I brought in and my face/hair type. I added bangs and colored my hair from brown to red and added blonde ombre. The results were amazing, I have gotten so many compliments and I really love my hair!To sum it up, the staff is amazing, I love the location in the shopping plaza with plenty of parking and I will definitely  go back!!

34.description: I went to a previous hair salon on Diversey and lawndale, and I thought I would get good results.  I have very thick and slightly wavy hair that has been previously dyed dark brown in the winter. I came in with a picture of a lighter hair color, and they said sure. The lady that spoke good English left, and to make a long story short, my roots were light and that's all. I came here and I met with Martha, who is a very pleasant woman to be around. She gave me a consultation, and we agreed on the project. They saw me the same day and she went right to work bleaching my hair and adding dozens and dozens of foils and she definatley took her time. She then added a belch type chemical and everything blended so beautifully.  I love it and I got the results I wanted with her. She had to stay about 2.5 hours later, so I defiantly made sure to Tip her well, which can only be done with cash.  My friend who sat with me during the time will also be going back for her hair as well.  Thank you Martha, I will be seeing you for my touch ups.

16.description: I've been coming here to get my hair done a few years now. I recently moved out of the neighborhood and tried a couple trendy, local, expensive spots which were all disappointing. Never again will I stray away from getting my hair done by Bobby. He is so on point with color and cut every time. My hair is black and I wanted a subtle ombré/bayalage and he did exactly what I asked for but better! By far the best stylist I've ever been to.

13.description: I love Alan! He puts up with my crazy and my indecisiveness. Recently I let a family member cut and color my hair and all I wanted to do was cry. I went to Alan and he knew exactly how to fix it.  I won't stray away from him again!

11.description: Just got another AMAZING haircut with Nery and she is AWESOME! I love what she did and I will def be a regular of hers! Thank you, thank you!

39.description: I haven't been here for a couple years but even back then the hair stylist were very rude and mean. There was this one time me and my mother went here and I have very thick curly and it gets knotted very easily type of hair. My hair stylist the women was suppose to do my hair sat me down in her chair and was basically insulting me about my hair how it was nappy and knotted and that she gonna have to cut it all off. So I told her if she washes it and put some conditioner in it it will take out the knots ( I feel a customer shouldn't tell you how to do your job) so she sent me to the shampoo girl and she washed my hair and start to brush it then the shampoo girl start being dramatic and calling over random hair stylist to help her. this never happened to me before or any other times in the past. So I go back to my hair stylist and again the complaining continues but this time in another language ( I think it was polish) so I nicely asked if she knew how to work with my type of hair ( I would have been fine if she said no) but she gave me a nasty look and left and another hair stylist came along and he did my hair no complaining no insults just did my hair and sent me on my way. After that when my mom went to pay the hair stylist that left me in her chair in a fussy mood almost bum rushed my mother to tell her how she supposedly washed my hair.  There was another time were someone cut my hair extremely short and and put a bunch of layers that with my type of hair if I wore it curly it would look like I had a mullet. But again I haven't been there in years so it may or may not have changed

37.description: I have been there  3 times. I love who does my hair she is very professional and serious about her art. She listens and gives good tips.The only thing I don't like is that the place uses Sally's shampoo and not the expensive products they sell. I just don't think that is right ....I'm paying $150 plus tip of 20%. That is a management issue not the stylist. I will go back because I like who does my hair. I have gone to many expensive places and they always use what they sell. I was shocked to hear Sally's beauty generic products are what they use on their clients to shampoo. I suggest they make this change. Only use what they sell on their clients, it's the right thing to do! The salon is always very busy so it's not a cost issue.

0.description: Carly is amazing! This is my second visit and since meeting her my hair is repaired and looking better then ever. Did root touch up with overall blended highlights to revamp the blonde and remove the buttery look.Looks and feels great.Thanks Carly! Took a better pic here it is:

38.description: Worst salon ever! I wanted my hair light after years of dark brown healthy thick hair. The woman bleached my hair to it's death. After I left the salon my hair was so dry and the color was horrible. Name of the person, I will not mention but she was in a rush. After a few weeks of I put a hot oil treatment to restore moisture which resulted in my hair break off and falling out. Hundreds of dollars later my hair still is dry and looks horrible. They were a really good, high end salon back in the day, not any more. #true story

51.description: Obviously great parking lot space,but that doesn't cover over rude stylists. The salon itself is very nice but some of  the girls are just outright rude and disrespectful..i honestly dont know how this place is sill in business. Being in the cosmetology industry myself,I personally know girls who have worked here and disclosed to me that a number of the stylists at this salon are unsanitary when it comes to cleaning their combs/brushes etc....now im not being a hater or jealous hairstylist here...just advising anyone in general...anywhere you ever go...make sure your stylist cleans his/her stuff!! (Beauty school 101)

27.description: Great salon--I've gotten my hair cut here for a year. Bobby and Neno have both cut my hair and it's immaculate every time!

32.description: I've been going to Gallery of Hair for 15 years!  It's always had a special place for me.  This is the only place I would let someone cut my hair, but certain stylists.  I gave it a 4 just because in the last few years its changed a lot.  It was a close 3 but because of my history I couldn't do it!  The new staff at the front is a little green and the thing I loved about this place the most is that when I walked in people knew it was me, it made me feel like I was spending my money at a place where people cared about the fact that you were putting money in their pocket.  That changed a little.  But overall all the people there are extremely awesome and talented.  Hopefully, I will be able to change it to 5 stars sometime soon!

54.description: I love George!A friend recommended I stop by George and I was not disappointed.  I had to wait a bit (which I expected since he squeezed me in), but the girls in the front was super nice and checked in with me several times.George handled my hair like he's done it a 1,000 times.  He asked me a bunch of questions about styling, texture, etc. and then made a product suggestion.For a girl with fine hair that never holds curl, I walked out of that salon feeling like a curly haired goddess!  My hair was curly even when I woke up in the morning and he didn't use any hair spray.I left my appointment feeling happy and with 2 new products in my bag.

48.description: This was the most reasonably priced hair cut I have gotten in a long time. My stylist, Jenny, spent so much time with me. She washed, cut, and styled my hair beautifully. If you complain about the price, this is not Supercuts. That being said, it was very affordable. I'm very happy and glad to find a place close to home. I will return for sure.

44.description: I always know when I go to Gallery of Hair I'm going to get a great hair cut. I've seen a variety of stylist there and been happy with most of them (one time I saw someone who was a bit preoccupied).Only tried a coloring once but the stylist I saw did take the time to show me colors I might like with my generic "blonde" request.

24.description: I stopped in on a whim. I haven't had my hair cut in months, after relocating from Philly and being nervous to try a new stylist, so it was high time for a trim. Not planning to try anything dramatic or adventurous, I gave Gallery of Hair a shot.The front desk staff were polite and helpful, but the ambience, pace, and tone of the place aren't very relaxing. I definitely prefer a sort of salon/spa feel and Gallery of Hair feels like a doctor's office mixed with a fast food restaurant. There are a lot of seats and a lot going on. It's not the most calming or welcoming place, despite friendly staff. Bear in mind, it's in a strip mall beside a TJ Maxx, so...adjust your expectations accordingly. It's pretty much what you're envisioning.I had my hair washed by Maria and cut by Violet. Both were very sweet. Violet did a great job adding long layers and trimming my hair, though she was a little rough with the brush and comb. She was itching to dye my hair and tried to persuade me to try it in the future. I'll think about it, Violet! The whole thing cost me $45 plus tip. Not too shabby.If you're looking for something quick, simple, and relatively affordable, this is a decent option. The staff was nice and I'll keep it in mind as a fallback option, but I think my search continues for a better fit.

7.description: They damaged my hair. This place charged me so much money for something I did not want and did not even care. Go somewhere else. The good reviews on here are all probably fake. They are horrible human beings. They say that they have been in business for years...yea scamming business. Trying to smooth talk you but I know a liar when I hear one and I know a bad person when I see one. Save your money and go somewhere else.

49.description: This place is huge and very busy. I have never seen a salon so busy and so packed with women waiting for their hair to be done on Saturday morning. They are very efficient checking you in by calling you on a microphone if you are sitting far away from the counter.  Also,  as I mentioned the salon is huge, but, they do not have that many hair washing stations so you might need to wait for one. My hair stylist was very nice and she did good job. But again this is not your usual spa salon.

40.description: I'm actually getting my hair re dyed as we speak, but I figured I'd talk about when I had my hair dyed 2 months ago. I come here often to dye my hair and get trims. I never have the same stylist because I usually walk in, it's hardly ever a problem. I'm not picky. Bobby dyed my hair, he was great. I told him I want red and he can do what he wants. I got an amazing color and nice conversation.  No complaints. I'll do another review when Violet is done with me. :) she's super cool so far.

53.description: GREAT CUTS/COLOR BUT $$$$ and UNORGANIZEDI've gotten cut/color/highlights from Jessica (now gone)  and Basia. Both gals gave me AWESOME services and were nice and accommodating. But the prices are STEEP. For cut/root touch up and highlight touch ups, I paid $150 w/o tips. And I have medium-length hair. I tried to stretch it out for 8-10 weeks before returning, but got charged more for using more product anyway. Also, my greys HAVE to be touched up no longer than six weeks here, whereas other places I could easily wait eight weeks.And this place doesn't grasp simple practices of business. So when I made a mistake on an appointment, they couldn't call me because they don't take client's phone numbers. When one stylist left and I was referred to another, she had to guess which mixture of toner was used because they don't keep a client history. They can't even tell you when your last visit was because they don't keep track of that either. You can't even get a price range on services over the phone. A RANGE, mind you. Apparently, stylists charge different amounts.I feel like whoever owns the salon is big on creativity but needs to up their game on organization and customer service for some staff. I really dislike when staffers talk in a language other than English out in the open. I did not appreciate when two stylists, a shampoo girl and the following client are all blabbing around me. Last time I was there, I needed to bring a Polish translator! It's just rude.With a little improvement,  this place could be worth the price.

30.description: I have been a loyal customer of this place for 6 years because of the fantastic stylist Bebe. She makes my hair look gorgeous!  I always see people happy with their hair when they are about to pay.Prices are great, there is parking lot and  a TJ Maxx next door!!!

46.description: Ok, so i was n critical need of hair repair, i have thick curly frizzy hair that was unmanageable. God sent me Ruben G, his hands are of a surgeon. Im amazed and extremely satisfied with how my hair looks now. I should keep him to myself, but that would b to selfish. Enjoy this gift that Gallery of hair has.

1.description: I love Gallery of Hair! Besides the fact that my mom once worked here and I see her very nice co-worker Mariana. I feel my mom's presence here. The staff is always super attentive. Today the color assistant, Mila whom I met, was super nice and very attentive, not just towards me but with other clients. It was so nice to have a conversation with her. I hope to see her go a long way here.Then there's my hair expert, Mariola Serwin! She is the absolute best hair professional. My hair salutes her. LOLBUT, seriously, she is always courteous and accommodating. She takes her job and clients very seriously. Keeps track of her clients' needs even when she's on vacation.  She follows up and keeps us all informed when she's away and returns. Now that's a hair stylist! And just take a look at her work on my hair. Love it!

55.description: I have been having my hair done here on and off since 2005.  The space is large and VERY busy, which makes for some fun people watching.  Some great stylists work here.  My poor review is in regards to management.  I called yesterday to make an appt with my favorite stylist and they told me that she had been "let go from the company".  I was incredulous and questioned it.  The receptionist acted like it was a surprising thing, but confirmed it.  So I tracked down said stylist, only to find out that she left and opened her own salon....good for her!  Isn't that a normal goal for most stylists?  I find it VERY unprofessional of Gallery of Hair to be telling people that she was fired...whether it were true or not.  The appropriate thing to say is simply that she no longer works here anymore and that you have no further information about where she went.  I know that in the H.R. world, even when someone IS fired from their job and a new employer calls for a reference you are only ALLOWED to state the dates that the fired employee was on staff.  Low class, Gallery of Hair, LOW CLASS!!!!

9.description: One star is too much for Pedro and the salon. I'd gone to him for many years, even though we moved 45 miles out of the city. I had an appointment for a cut and highlights. The receptionist called and asked if I could come early as Pedro has 2 cancellations due to rain and sleet. I was unable to make it any earlier. Due to the weather, I called when I realized I would be 20 minutes late. They checked with him and he said it was ok. I arrived and he came up to me and said, "I'm not doing your hair." SO unprofessional and classless. He had my phone number and never called to apologize or anything. Sorry, Pedro, you were pretty good, but you're not the god you think you are. And no one at the salon seemed to have the slightest clue about customer service.

26.description: Went in for a touch up and my hair faded completely after the first wash! I called Gallery and the manager said to go in and they would fix it. I go in and the girl at the front desk tells me it is not my stylists fault that she has over 15 years of experience..bla bla. She told me that because I have my natural hair color it would fade. Well I wish the stylist would've warned me that my hair would fade before I decided to spend over $130 for the crappy service I received. I asked to get it fixed because my hair looked horrible and after an hour of arguing I finally got them to fix it. Never again!

25.description: Im mainly giving this place a 3 out of five simply because I love how Lena did my hair. She definitely knows what she's doing... Id give this place more stars if it was cleaner. The general upkeep of the place isn't too great, and a few times over the phone they were rude... Other times, pretty nice. I have mixed feelings about the place but Lena definitely took care of me so I definitely hope they clean up better soon.

12.description: I have to say Violet is an extremely rude stylist. This review is just based on my experience with her and not the salon but because she works there it is a reflection on them. After waiting a half hour for my appointment she has me wait up front to not even tell me but the front desk girl that she cannot do my hair cut. She does not even apologize and says she's over booked. It was extremely unprofessional and I wouldn't have wanted my hair done by her anyway. The girl at the front desk was very nice and was able to have Katia do my hair cut that I am very happy with.

59.description: Ruined my hair... ruined my friend's hair... not professional... over priced for their service... very judgmental group!! Uncomfortable atmosphere... Never again!!

21.description: I've been coming here since 1990 and I keep coming back. I've tried other places but they they don't  compare.  I've never had a bad hair cut. Only once my color process didn't come out right but it got fixed for free and I'm talking one mistake in decades! They are fair priced and wash and blow dry is included. I tend to go with the hair dressers nearest to the windows my whole life. Mariola, Vida, Agnes are awesome.

17.description: Called first thing in the morning after my stylist cancelled on me and they made my appointment right away. RJ did a fabulous job with my hair and makeup. It turned out exactly as I described it to her. I definitely recommend this salon, they can do it all.

10.description: I went in for a haircut.  I called last minute and they got me in right away which was great ! I saw Adella, and she did such a nice job on my hair . I love it ! Thank you again ! It is such a cute style and exactly what I wanted .  I have very fine, thin hair and the way she cut it makes it look really full.  Thank you again ! :)

5.description: This place is so inconsistent. Sometimes it's wonderful, which is why I have returned in the past, but sometimes it's a hot mess. My stylist seems to triple book appointments. I get she needs the money but it's completely unprofessional.

3.description: I came here after a friend had referred me I needed a nice cut and wanted to try something new so I decided to go with a nice ombré. I forgot my stylist name but she was wonderful very nice easy to talk to and funny. When she finished my hair I loved it! I was very happy with the results. Except two days later I noticed my hair kept falling out. I wasn't going through stress, nothing new was happening in my life or my hair routine but after a week I had realized it was the dye she used in my hair. My hair was falling out for weeks it was so embarrassing there was hair everywhere all over me all the time. It was a horrific experience especially because my hair had always been healthy. I gave two stars because it was a great environment, they were lovely people, they offered a beverage, had very nice music, and the stylist who did my hair was very sweet. But the experience I had with my hair after was just horrible and it was pretty pricey for what I had done.

35.description: I used to come to this place long time ago but my guy left and I stopped . This Friday I came back and I was with Nery . Let me tell you this !!!!!! This girl did great job I absolutely love my new haircut ! She was an amazing ! Super friendly ! Made great suggestion ! Love it ! Love it ! I strongly recommended her !

19.description: Fellow yelpers I will try to keep this brief! I called GOH on Monday and spoke with Ella about what I wanted. I have never colored my hair so I was naturally nervous and on top of that I wanted my extensions colored too. Ella asked me so many questions about my extensions which I loved because she really wanted to make sure I gt the results I was looking for. She gave me the run down that some extensions may not take and to be prepared for that. So I scheduled my appointment with Nery on Thursday evening.When I arrived I was amazed at how big the space was, so many people for a Thursday evening! So I checked in had a seat and at 635 Nery came to get me. She looked at my extensions and I told her what I was looking for. I showed her pictures of the color and after that we decided a bayalage would be the best for me. Having ext I was nervous but after 15 mins my extensions had taken the color and were blonde!!!! Nery was genuinely excited too because she had never seen that happen. So that was a huge relief. After Nery was done the finished product was more then I could have asked for. For my first time color it was spot on and I love it. It's a light brown with a hint of red/blonde FABULOUS! Nery is professional,fun and I will definitely be coming back to her soon after my next install. I will post pictures soon!

28.description: I had the worst cut in this place yesterday, I don't even know how I'm gonna start my week looking like a sheep,it's so embracing to have a bad hair. I don't remember my stylist name maybe Maria but she was so rude, I told her what I want then she didn't even try to please me she just start cutting it then in the front she made it really really short so I really can't fix it in another place when I complained she told me that's what you want. I will never go there again they are not professional or organize or even clean enough. She ruined my mood, my day and my hair

45.description: If I could give it 0 stars, I would. I made an appointment for a simple blow-dry for 8 AM this past Saturday and the stylist, Sofia, didn't arrive until 8:10 and take me until 8:18. She began blow-drying at 8:22. When she saw me, she told me how disgusting my hair was. She insisted I needed a hair cut and told me on more than 10 occasions I needed one because my hair is so dry, long, damaged, and ugly. In my 27 years, I've only received compliments about my hair, never such remarks. My hair is actually very healthy! On top of all that, I left the salon with a soaked back. Literally, my bra and entire t-shirt were drenched. She didn't even put one of those hair capes on me! The style was horrible; I went home and curled my hair with my curling iron! Never going back!

33.description: Great place great service! Came here as a teenager for updos for homecoming, prom, weddings, etc. Am here right now with my friend's bridal party and everyone is extremely pleased with the service and results. This place is like a beehive of great stylists. Loving the service and my 'do.

43.description: Its definitely hit or miss with this place. I recommend Juanita for latin hair. The stylists will charge an arm and a leg. I suggest to talk to them about the price before they begin with your hair.

2.description: Disappointed how bad this place has become. I've been coming here for years and sadly that will probably stop. I've been trying to give them tries but it seems like each time I am wasting my time and money. The employees here seem always rushed and never finish what they promise.

18.description: Im mainly giving this place a 3 out of five simply because I love how Lena did my hair. She definitely knows what she's doing... Id give this place more stars if it was cleaner. The general upkeep of the place isn't too great, and a few times over the phone they were rude... Other times, pretty nice. I have mixed feelings about the place but Lena definitely took care of me so I definitely hope they clean up better soon.

41.description: This salon is always crazy busy and not exactly relaxing, think constant sound of blow dryers.  I come here and fight the crowds to get my eyebrows done by the one and only Agnes.  She is VERY good and knows what she is doing.  She can make anyone look good.  I drive 30 minutes to see her.  She gets 5 stars.  The salon gets 4.

52.description: Not bad but a little bit pricey.

50.description: I used to rave about this place because every time I would get my haircut I had a bad experience but not at this place....Now im finding that the prices arent worth that either now... I on a level understand the economy is hurting everyone but payin 45.00 for a trim... i cant do this ever again. Over the years the service has gone to shit and now i cant find a reason to return...

4.description: As always, I stand by my review.I am one of Nino's regulars & I will never go anywhere else. I went in today super sick with a terrible cold and not only did he make me feel better with his funny jokes but also by the way he did my hair. I didn't even tell him what to do besides "highlights and cut" he just did his own thing and my hair looks AMAZZZZZINGGGGGG! The highlights look better than any I've ever seen (gotta brag a bit ;)) and the cut is so nice. He cut my hair into layers and took off about 3-4 inches as a result of my "just cut off as much as you need to, I want it healthy". I love going to him so much, he truly is THE BEST.

6.description: Hmmm...my last review was TEN years ago, my last visit about FOUR years ago. I stopped going for a while because I was absolutely certain there had to be another salon in this big city that's closer to home, more competitive in price, and just as good in quality and service. After years of searching and a few questionable haircuts, I decided to "just go to gallery" to get my next haircut. So glad I did, so relieved, and so never going anywhere else again. I've never had a bad experience here and I stick to my word that these stylists know what they're doing. I was so glad that I was able to make an appointment yesterday afternoon (Friday) for this morning (Saturday). Maya cut my hair beautifully and styled it just how I wanted. She took the time to listen and worked fast, which I really appreciate. I'm looking forward to my next day of beauty!

22.description: I've been coming here to get my hair done a few years now. I recently moved out of the neighborhood and tried a couple trendy, local, expensive spots which were all disappointing. Never again will I stray away from getting my hair done by Bobby. He is so on point with color and cut every time. My hair is black and I wanted a subtle ombré/bayalage and he did exactly what I asked for but better! By far the best stylist I've ever been to.

15.description: If I could give half a star I would. My neck is still hurting from how much my hair was pulled, & dried. Never again.

57.description: I came here for the first time on Saturday and It's always been a struggle to find a good hair dresser who can cut and style curly hair. I came in a lil late I called ahead and said they would take me in anyway.  Once I've arrived the ladies at the front were friendly asked if I wanted anything which was a first for me at any salon.  I waited about 10 mins the most the girl that did my hair was nice she gave me her honest opinion about what type of hair cut would work for my hair since it's so curly and I appreciate that.   I also asked how much it would be to blow dry straight.  IT was rather pricey as I always feel I am discriminated or curly hair girls I should say to charge more to blow dry IT ( I get its more work but how do you know you cut somebody's hair properly) anyway the girl did blow dry it straight but it looked like something I can do myself with a flat iron, had not volume or flip to it and If I am paying that much I would like to walk out lookin like a movie star.  I explain that since it was about 90 degrees out I would need some more product in my hair and she insisted it wouldnt curl or frizz.. Well we all know how that ended lol... Other than that I was fairly pleased and I will be probably be going back and maybe demanding a better blow dry straight this time.

20.description: Fellow yelpers I will try to keep this brief! I called GOH on Monday and spoke with Ella about what I wanted. I have never colored my hair so I was naturally nervous and on top of that I wanted my extensions colored too. Ella asked me so many questions about my extensions which I loved because she really wanted to make sure I gt the results I was looking for. She gave me the run down that some extensions may not take and to be prepared for that. So I scheduled my appointment with Nery on Thursday evening.When I arrived I was amazed at how big the space was, so many people for a Thursday evening! So I checked in had a seat and at 635 Nery came to get me. She looked at my extensions and I told her what I was looking for. I showed her pictures of the color and after that we decided a bayalage would be the best for me. Having ext I was nervous but after 15 mins my extensions had taken the color and were blonde!!!! Nery was genuinely excited too because she had never seen that happen. So that was a huge relief. After Nery was done the finished product was more then I could have asked for. For my first time color it was spot on and I love it. It's a light brown with a hint of red/blonde FABULOUS! Nery is professional,fun and I will definitely be coming back to her soon after my next install. I will post pictures soon!

36.description: Horrid place.  I had my hair done by Angel  in February.  She ruined my hair with color and subsequently I had to have a chemical treatment to remove the color damage she created.  I had contact with the manager Michelle who told me that it was because of my age (I'm in my 40's) that my hair did "take".  Thanks for adding insult to injury.  She admittedly said she was a hair stylist, so clearly she had no clue.  Fast forward to my talking to Ela who apologized profusely and PROMISED to make it right.  Today I go in to get my hair colored and they told me that I had to pay to fix the damage their so called "talented" stylist creatd.  They made no effort whatsoever to fix their wrong.  I also spoke to Jackie who assired me they would take care of it.  Low and behld she wasn't truthful either.  I would give negative stars if I could,  very poor ownership and management skills.My name is Lee Sanders and I will never step foot in this place again.  EVER.

14.description: I stopped in on a whim. I haven't had my hair cut in months, after relocating from Philly and being nervous to try a new stylist, so it was high time for a trim. Not planning to try anything dramatic or adventurous, I gave Gallery of Hair a shot.The front desk staff were polite and helpful, but the ambience, pace, and tone of the place aren't very relaxing. I definitely prefer a sort of salon/spa feel and Gallery of Hair feels like a doctor's office mixed with a fast food restaurant. There are a lot of seats and a lot going on. It's not the most calming or welcoming place, despite friendly staff. Bear in mind, it's in a strip mall beside a TJ Maxx, so...adjust your expectations accordingly. It's pretty much what you're envisioning.I had my hair washed by Maria and cut by Violet. Both were very sweet. Violet did a great job adding long layers and trimming my hair, though she was a little rough with the brush and comb. She was itching to dye my hair and tried to persuade me to try it in the future. I'll think about it, Violet! The whole thing cost me $45 plus tip. Not too shabby.If you're looking for something quick, simple, and relatively affordable, this is a decent option. The staff was nice and I'll keep it in mind as a fallback option, but I think my search continues for a better fit.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Asian Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions, Straight Perms, Coloring, Kids' Hair

12.description: When we first moved to the city, my boyfriend and I got a craving for Chinese food and happened to find Kowloon 2 blocks from our condo. We decided to try it and are happy that we did.Low sodium, no MSG and pretty big portions. The Mongolian beef is really good, although ask for less onion because there is too much. My boyfriend likes the garlic chicken. We took our friends and family there and they all liked it as well, even my boyfriend's dad who sometimes gets really sick off of chinese food. When we moved to the suburbs, we would plan stopping in here to get lunch when we would go the area. Very good.

3.description: Used to be my go to Chinese food option.  Sadly over the last six months its really declined.  In December I ordered for delivery.  Said it would be 45 - 60 mins.  After an hour and a half the food hadn't arrived.  For 10 minutes I tried to call repeatedly to see how much longer.  Finally jumped into the car to pick it up. When I arrived I found no one at the counter and phone ringing off the hook.  It took almost 3 mins for someone to come from the back.  At this point it's been almost 2 hours since I placed the order.  They apologized, said my food was almost ready. 10 mins more it arrived.  They took 10% off.  Food wasn't its usual quality tasting. Hey things happen and I felt one bad incident didn't warrant putting the "on the do not go to list".  I ordered once in January.  Took 45 mins on a Friday.  Food was good. Then tonight I try to order.  Called for 15 mins on and off.  Finally on my last call someone answers waits a moment and then just hangs up.  What?  If they are that busy, hire someone else or tell us when ordering it will be 2+ hours because your swamped and give us the choice. Or get an answering machine that has a message we are extremely busy and what time you'll be taking the next order at.   Not answering the phone isn't the right option.  I called another local place Happy Garden.  Oh well.

1.description: I've never tasted food that was so bad I would just throw it away. Usually, I will look at food and either find something offensive or see an unappealing plate of things that would never touch my tongue. The orange chicken at Kowloon was tricky...it looked MOSTLY picture perfect. The glaze on the chicken was beautiful and glossy. Insert the trick...it was awful! The meat did not taste like chicken, rather something heavy and harshly flavored...it was truly disgusting. The sauce was sweet and bitter...like a sour orange. The rice was lifeless, dull colored and flavorless...except for the lingering taste of an over-used aluminum wok.The redemption was that the young man at the counter:  Albeit a bit clueless, he handed me the order in less than 5 minutes and was very nice. He politely tried to explain the differences between the sesame and orange chicken sauces...saying that one was hot. I ordered that one...and it was NOT at all hot. Granny could have eaten...well...spit it out like I did. Try something else on the menu...like a canned soda or a prepackaged fortune cookie, otherwise, go elsewhere.

2.description: very food and fast deliverymy whole family like the food

9.description: Best delivery Chinese in the Portage park area. I was very impressed. Chicken Lo Mein was some of the best I've had outside good sit-down Chinese restaurants. Mongolian Beef was very good, especially considering they offer the "gravy" option. Thanks for defining my problem with most Mongolian beef: I love the gravy that comes on some, but by no means all, Mongolian beef. A lot of my (least favorite) MB experiences have been with dry, overly marinated, over-salty beef with no sauce but the over-marinated, salty beef juice. I know it's probably less authentic or something, but I love the spicy, favorful gravy that Kowloon offers as an option. Pot stickers were awesome, even though they sent me friend dumplings, rather than the steamed that I had ordered. Egg roll was quite good, might be hand made, and free with my order, which makes it even better.

10.description: lunch time and empty,but gave it a try..egg drop soup good size bowl and needed a little salt(no big deal)so ok..ordered sweet sour chkn(lunch special L11)egg  roll was poor processed quality and no way fresh,sweet-sour chkn not that impressive AT ALL and fried rice had funky smell..keep drivin u'll  b glad u stopped somewhere else

13.description: The Egg Rolls and Crab rangoon are phenomenal, the fried rice and entrees not so much. Stick to the appetizers and pass on everything else.

16.description: I can't say I've ever been inclined to actually eat-in here.  However, I love getting take-out.  Sweet and sour chicken, pork fried rice, crab rangoon, and eggrolls are my standard order.  As far as I'm concerned, it's currently the best chinese food in this neighborhood.  Oh, and I believe the egg rolls are free if you have the coupon from the menu.

6.description: Food was not tasty at all. Very bland. The menu said I would get 15% off my order, but when I called they told me I could only get 10% off. Plus they forgot my fortune cookies. They would not redeliver and said that they could only give them to me on my next order. Well, doesn't really matter because I won't be ordering from there again. Very disappointed.

15.description: My favorite chinese restaurant in this particular neighborhood.  Quality food with friendly service.  Reasonable menu prices and their 3.95 lunch special (lunch ends at 3:30) is a gift from heaven.

0.description: Love this place! Shrimp and Beef Fried Rice, egg rolls, orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken, egg rolls, pot stickers, and crab ragoon are awesome!!!

5.description: Used to go here back in the day and it was really good. Decided to try it again since I saw the take out menu. I ordered the lunch special, and the quality was on cheap side. I suppose you get what you pay for. The food had a greasy taste, and the chicken was rubbery. I think I'll find some other place in the area with a more quality flavor and texture.

11.description: For me Kow Loon is definately one of the better Chinese restaurants in the area. I have yet to be disappointed with anything I've ordered. As far as basics go,  they have really good pork fried rice, crab rangoon , wonton soup and egg rolls. I like to try new things, but I've really enjoyed the Beef Chow Mein, Beef with pea pods, Szechuan Chicken and Chicken with garlic sauce. Service has always been very fast and efficient . But, I've only ordered for pick up and delivery. The inside isn't anything too special if you are looking for a nicer sit down place.

8.description: enjoyed the "bo bo platter" tasty beef, shrimp egg foo yong and a general tso chicken dinner special. the gen. tso's was a little hotter than i expected, next time i am going to try the chicken in garlic sauce. the food was fresh hot and tasty! will definitely order takeout again from here the next time i have a chinese craving as it is close to the house and was really good!

4.description: Consistent, way fast, and way friendly. I've been jamming here for five years and this family has been nothing short of solid.

14.description: sweet and sour chicken is good

7.description: Get the crab ragoons they are the best!   The hot and sour soup was delicious and came in a big bowl.   Mongolian Beef was ok but too many onions.  Plenty of street parking.

3.description: Ask for Nicki she is very pleasant and knowledgeable. Capable of sizing you by eye. 2 Thumbs for this location

1.description: Horrible experience. Me and my husband Went to pick out a tuxedo to rent for our grooms men. The lady that was helping us who name was angel claimed to be the manager. She wouldn't tell us anything about the tuxedos until we filled out the paper work for the group rentals then goes to tell us that the tuxedos have no price difference. So we walked out. Long story short we ended up booking across the street in the mall, received a group number for the grooms men was told they can go to any men's wear house to get measured for the tux, one of my grooms men got measured at this men's wear house (on forest preserve ) when the tux came in He went to try it on. when he told the lady he would be back to pick it up and pay it off she told him he couldn't do that. ( it's not like he already had half paid off and he clearly told her he was coming back with the money ) When my grooms men told me this I was very upset I asked him if he knew the name of the lady that helped him he told me her name was angel. I am very very dissatisfied if I can give them no stars I would. Bad horrible service please drive or walk across to the men's wear house inside the mall they will give u great service.

2.description: I went to men's warehouse this week to have my dad sized for my wedding. The girl working was extremely unprofessional, had an attitude, and rushed us out the door.  They did not even show my dad the tux I picked out for him. Extremely disappointed. I would not recommend this location to anyone. When you shop for a tux for a wedding it should be as great of an experience as buying a wedding gown.

9.description: By Bestman, his fiancee, and I went in to see about tux rentals for our upcoming nuptials. We were greeted by a very nice lady who showed us what they had available, and patiently walked us through the details of their current offers and the features of each tuxedo. They didn't have a very large selection within the store, but what they had worked out great for us. As someone who has never even owned a suit, much less rented a tux, she was full of knowledge and helpful suggestions. She even stayed an hour after they closed for the evening to hammer out all the details for the tuxedo rentals for each of our weddings.While she was helping my friend pick out tuxedos for his wedding party, the manager of the store was happy to talk to me about my interest in a future purchase of a suit. He was really helpful as well. When I am ready to make a purchase, I will surely be back to talk to hi.

10.description: Since my boyfriend is tall (6'6" so can't buy off the rack) and in law school, we decided that the store that would best fit his budget for suits would be the Men's Wearhouse. Our experience was less-than-ideal, though.First, we were greeted by ALL the salespeople ( who you can tell work on commission) who essentially fought over us for 5 minutes before one woman won out. Once she found out that we were on a budget, she decided she didn't want to help us anymore, and passed us on to this other guy. Neither one had any fashion sense (you can tell by how they were dressed), so thank goodness I came along to help. When he decided on 3 suits, he was then fitted for his suits (the tailoring of course is extra- ALOT extra, so be prepared) and then paid for the suits and we left. His suits were NOT ready when they told us they would be and I had to essentially call and heckle them to get them to speed up the process. Even after all that, the jacket had too much room in the body, and the pants were a wee bit too long. HOW HARD IT IS TO GET IT RIGHT??!?!?!?The quality of the suits also leaves something to be desired- you really do get what you pay for. They are already pilling and have loose buttons (one actually already fell off).If you don't have any money or any taste, then I highly recommend the Men's Wearhouse.

4.description: the worst customer service I have ever had to deal with! My wedding is this Saturday and the manager from mens warehouse called me to tell us we can not have the suits we chose bc they over booked them... which we had made deposits for and I thought that would guarantee the suit! After we chose different suits I called the manager the next day to double check that everyone will have the same suit and all the sizes are fine.. they assured me that everything is fine! We go to pick up the suits yesterday and everyones suit is 2 sizes too big!!! the manager did not even know that the different brand tuxedos run in different sizes. All she had to do was ask them all to come back for another fitting just in case. One of the groomsmen lives out of state and wont be able to come get his suit until Friday night! then my fiancé told them he doesn't think his pants are slim fit and they assured him that they are, but when one groomsman when to a different location they said you are right they are not slim fit. so not half of the guys have slim and half don't. When I called to let them know whats going on manager said that maybe the guys aren't slim... which I thought was a hilarious response bc they are slim and if that's what they wanted then that's what they should get, its their decision! Every employee made it seem like this isn't a big deal, and im sure to them this isn't but I don't think I need to be dealing with their carelessness 3 days before my wedding!

6.description: So I got a suit here a few years ago. It looked good and now that Im getting married, My fiancee and I went to Black tie first, they had great prices but she insited that we use Men's Wearhouse due to the quality being better (which is kinda true). We went and got measured, they let me know that if all my groomsmen got their tuxedos here mine would be free.  We went back a few days ago to also get that original suit taken in and to also clear up some color issues for the wedding. Up to this point everyone was super nice and very helpful.      Last night she made a call to just clarify when the tuxedo was going to be ready, then asked the person on the phone (who says hes the manager) if she could ask one more question. He dramaticly sighed loudly and said "Another question?? Listen ma'am,  I have alot of customers at the counter in front of me, ok? Whats the question then?"     WHAAAAAT???? ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? You give MY wife additude for simply asking a question after weve spent all this money with you?? She was very upset and called me to tell me what happened. Obviously, I had to call back for her and reprimand him for such unprofessional behavior. Of course he backed his way into an apology. Hopefully this isnt how he treats other women customers. If it is then Id like to give him another piece of my mind.     Its a real shame. Everyone is great, the product is great and its spoiled by one rude A-hole. If it werent that my wedding is next week I would have told him Im cancelling all the tuxedos, not paying a damn dime. Being in sales, customer relations are everything. I wish i could give them a 5 star but that rude "manager" has severely affected their rating. Ill have to think again if I want to use them in the future.

11.description: You're going to like the way you look is darn straight. This is usually my first stop when I need a new suit. First class service, with knowledgeable staff makes shopping for men's clothing a breeze. They have a considerable selection of men's clothing at very reasonable prices. This location is similar to other Men's Wearhouses I been too, just closer to where I'm at now. Another cool thing about Men's wearhouse is even if you are in another state and need tailoring, just go into what ever local store is near you and they'll have you in their data base and get you hooked up. As for me, I like wearing suits because, it makes me look good and shopping here keeps the money where it belongs, in my wallet. Pros: Selection, Prices Cons: Limited Parking, Cost: $$$ of 5Overall Rating: 4 of 5 Recommendation: Recommended
