5.description: Called Men's warehouse at 11:40 am to ask if it was possible to get there at noon, find a suit or two, get fitted and walk out wearing one of the suits purchased within 1 1/2; Tristan said, "we will do our best" and that they did.Tristan and his team worked together to help me find two suits, get fitted, put a shirt/tie combo together and got me out the door within 1hr and 10min wearing the suit I needed for a wedding today; OUTSTANDING.  And the price was great too; everything was buy one get one free and he found an old certificate I never used that was expired. He got it reinstated and saved me another $50.Without sounding like a commercial, great team, great demeanor and actually fun to shop with.No complaints here!!!

7.description: Just purchased 2 suits from Jeff and also got great help from Tristan...these guys rock.I got a reward in the mail for $100 and ended up getting 2 more shirts with it.Im a customer for life..thanks again guys!!

8.description: Helped out a United States Marine in a time of desperation (see below).  They have my everlasting thanks and they were extremely helpful and friendly.  I was able to get what I needed, including some minor alterations (such as hemming the pants) within about 15-20 minutes!  I drove up to Rosemont to attend the United States Marine Corps Birthday Ball.  The drive was about 250 miles and when I went to get ready I found that the pants for my dress blues were missing!  I believe that my coat was put in the closet sans pants and I usually keep them in the same bag so I guess I didn't check this time.  Anyhow, I was missing dress blues pants and it is a formal event, so I had to figure out something quick!  The ball was due to start in about 30 minutes (cocktail hour) and I needed to think fast.  I could possibly get away with a suit but a tuxedo was the appropriate attire and I was a guest this time (I got out in 2009 and it's 2012 at the time) so I didn't want to come in a suit, but I was willing to take what I could get.  The only spare clothes I brought was a pair of Jeans and a t-shirt!  There was Woodfield mall about 15 minutes away, but for some reason I decided to try for the Men's Warehouse, which was 10 minutes away, but in the opposite direction.  I'm sure glad that I did!I decided to head over to Men's Warehouse to see if I could rent a tux, but of course I'm a 52XL so it's really hard to get my size normally, let alone at the last minute.  I spoke with the manager on duty there and he was super helpful.  They didn't have anything that I could rent, but they helped me out finding a tuxedo on clearance that was just my size and a shirt, tie, etc.  All in all I got a pretty good price and was in and out of there within 20 minutes (I know because I left the hotel and was back within 45 minutes or less!).  I really appreciate how they helped me with my needs and were so quick and friendly.  I would highly recommend this store to anyone and if you have a bad experience I would definately report it to the management.  The Tux was very nice quality and I have already worn it twice!

0.description: Best retail experience I've had in a long time. In and out in less time than it would take to go to any upper end retail store and simply get someone's attention. I did not have to guess and try on 20 things to find something I thought would work. Told them what I wanted to accomplish and they put it all together for me. Things I would have never guessed to combine and that look great. Also took alterations so my apparel would look great on me. And the kicker is that I got a better deal than I would have anywhere else. So better service, better deal, better experience and great products. I never thought to try Men's Warehouse until now. And, I am glad I did. It is literally down the street from my house and it will now be my first stop.

28.description: Great neighborhood joint for reliably good pizza. Fair prices on drinks and wonderfully friendly staff. The food overall is unremarkable....simple bar fare. You go here to relax, catch the game or hang out in a friendly establishment.

1.description: A very comfortable neighborhood place. A good mix of people of all ages of couples, singles, families and Moose. Prices seem to be very reasonable for liquors and wines, although I didn't see the beer selection. It has a full bar and a nice selection of drinks which you will need to get through the Bears game on the many televisions throughout the bar.The Italian beef was very good and came on crusted Italian bread - a nice touch too often overlooked. The french fries were very good, not too thin or thick. My friend had a slice of pepperoni pizza, which was very good I am told. One doesn't always find pizza slices available at many Italian sit down restaurants. The waitresses/servers cannot have been nicer. One seemed to be under the weather, which is probably why our service was less than spectacular - no harm no foul.Anyway, come by and say hi to the lovable regular Marty. Marty is a moose. You'll find him in his regular spot, never one to miss the Hawks or Bears game.

39.description: Great Pizza .  The cheese / sauce / sausage , are quality and the crust is nice and paper thin. .

9.description: Buffalo chicken pizza is on point. Ask for suicide sauce if you can handle the heat. If you want a laid back sports bar head to Bijes. Good service. :) :) definitely a place to come back !

29.description: The pizza is excellent, I have been going here for years.  My niece and I went in here for a drink one night recently just to unwind and relax after the work week.  The music was so loud, we couldn't hear each other even though we were sitting next to each other.  Did we come on club night?  Seemed we were also being ignored, as it took over ten minutes to order a drink even though there was less than ten people in the whole place.  Staff was highly unfriendly too.  Bottom line for me...I will keep having my pizza delivered to me at home, and I can make my drinks faster even if I had to walk to the store to get the liquor myself.

23.description: Very affordable and delicious pizza.  Gotta try the buffalo chicken pizza... I couldn't stop eating it, it was so good!!

5.description: best thin crust delivery in the city!Get the roast beef and mushroom pizza... you won't be sorry.  We are so sad we moved out of the delivery range.. but make sure to come back at least once a month to pick up a pie.I'm drooling just thinking about it.

31.description: Another very good pizza, middle still a little soggy, but I am blaming my selection of carmelized onions again. I love the taste of them, but I think they just have a little too much moisture.FREE 2 liter with Large Pizza.5/$12 Domestic buckets Tuedays.While I always take it home, seems like a great local place to grab a pizza and a few beers. Always great staff there...

25.description: I absolutely love places like this, family owned good crowd a place you can bring your kids or go with friends and get a pizza and some beers. Last time I was There with my wife and some friends and we had blast. We got a table and ordered a pizza with sausage, tomato, garlic, and basil and cooked it wheel done and it was fabulous! We had some beers talked, took our time nobody bothered us its was very nice. A good place to go relax, eat and have some drinks.

12.description: Carl has the best pizza, great beefs, excellent meatballs & sausage...best in the city of Chicago. I can't believe this guy deejay w gave this place 1 star. Don't take this guys word for it...I'm from Brooklyn and this funook is from Orange County California!...that alone should be enough. So if u r in Chicago try this place out...

37.description: Was pestered by a few locals to get pizza there instead of the many other ones that were a lot closer.  So already I had a feeling that they made a good pizza.Its nice that they have their own parking lot, which can't be said for the majority of the businesses along Irving Park.  Got there right around 4 when they opened and there were already some patrons inside.  It seemed more like a family friendly joint with the coach, some little leaguers munching on pizza and pitchers of soda.  The place was also decorated with a lot of old and new Blackhawks memorabilia on the wall, which I liked, and I didn't seem like the people here were "bandwagon" type fans either.I got a small thin crust with bacon and indulged on a soda (too early for a beer) while waiting for it ($13 altogether).  Cindy, the barmaid, was pretty nice and seemed to know all the random customers that came in.  I also found out the name Bije's was allegedly the name of the owner's dad's dog.  The pizza looked basic, but had a good amount of flavor and was a great effort, coming from a bar and grill.  I only took a star off for their lackluster beer selection, with all macro brews and Sam Adams Boston Lager, which was the closest craft they had.  All in all, I would like to come back, especially during a Blackhawks game, and I did get a feeling that I would hear some great stories if I would of stayed longer.

21.description: My husband and I stopped in for a beer and tp check out the menu for a future night since we already had dinner plans for this evening... however we will not ever give this owner another dollar... there was the nicest girl behind the bar who was new and doing a good job but the owner kept yelling amd putting her down in front of us.... he then went on to cuss at her right in front of us... I work in a restaurant and know thaf this is never ok... I would of refused to pay my bill to him if i hadnt already payed at this point... no owner should ever treat an employee this way... u just lost a potential repeat customer

16.description: Good pizza two girls working there I think Cheyenne n Maggie super nice n on top of things but some grumpy old man was just lurking over there shoulder n staring them down from across the bar I kept expecting him to pull out a whip or something . It really seemed like the girls had everything under control even tho it was kinda busy but the rude old guy carol I think I heard them call him kept nagging them for nothing Made me so uncomfortable I almost said something to him but the girls just kept a good attitude ignored him n  handling the crowd , I really liked this place till I seen him then it sucked,

17.description: My husband and I stopped in for a beer and tp check out the menu for a future night since we already had dinner plans for this evening... however we will not ever give this owner another dollar... there was the nicest girl behind the bar who was new and doing a good job but the owner kept yelling amd putting her down in front of us.... he then went on to cuss at her right in front of us... I work in a restaurant and know thaf this is never ok... I would of refused to pay my bill to him if i hadnt already payed at this point... no owner should ever treat an employee this way... u just lost a potential repeat customer

10.description: Best fish sandwich with season fries was to die for.  My table ordered the thin crust pizza and chicken wings and they loved them.  Bonus, great place to watch a Blackhawk game.

11.description: Bije's is a great place for food and drinks. Reasonably priced ..... With the best pizza and pasta around! Full bar and menu....friendly sports bar! Love it here!

26.description: This local awesome pizza and drink place.people working there are super attentive and nice.private parties are fun there too!THE PIZZA IS SOOOOO GOOD! Calamari is excellent as well !thanks Bije's :)

27.description: I have to say that this being my first time time there it was wonderful the Italian beef was superb,the Pizza was awesome we had bacon ,spinach and mushroom divine fare.You really must  try this neighborhood eatery. Joyce Tracy

35.description: Great food for small bucks.  Pizza is awesome.  Be sure to say hi to the owner, Carl.

8.description: The buffalo chicken pizza is my death row last dinner. Best crust and pizza in Chicago, hands down. Blackhawks bar par excellence.

0.description: PHENOMENAL THIN CRUST PIZZA!!Have had delivered 3 times and decided to dine in today - also had the chicken wings to start -- YUM!!!!I was also very impressed with the service and staff - super nice and very attentive!!Really nice casual local joint - looking forward to going back!!

38.description: Oh Bije's, why can't you be closer to the city? If you would, you're prices wouldn't be as cheap, I guess. This super casual, sports bar allowed us to kick back, sing along to  jukebox tunes, and have a obnoxiously great time. Unfortunately, the blasted guy at the bar wanted to join in. However, once we requested to the owner to get the guy away from us, he was pleasantly escorted away. Ideal place for a large group, inexpensive drinks, and wonderful, bubbly staff. And I hear their pizza is amazingly yummy! Can't wait to go back.

20.description: This is our family go-to place for dinner. Their wings are the best and we've tried them all. BLT pizza...Hello!  Caesar salad with grilled chicken is awesome. The prices are reasonable. The service is great most of the time and when it's not, there's a good reason so stop whining. The owner, Carl, is just a fun-loving guy who enjoys being there. The kids play video games, we drink a few beers and everyone is happy. No dressing up, no yelling at the kids, no ridiculous bill. If you don't like the place, don't come. You're probably a boring person or a snob.

19.description: Another very good pizza, middle still a little soggy, but I am blaming my selection of carmelized onions again. I love the taste of them, but I think they just have a little too much moisture.FREE 2 liter with Large Pizza.5/$12 Domestic buckets Tuedays.While I always take it home, seems like a great local place to grab a pizza and a few beers. Always great staff there...

33.description: I want to write this review but I don't want to write this review. Let me explain myself.I came here with a Groupon. I got a large BBQ Bacon Pizza and a large Buffalo Chicken Pizza with medium sauce. I brought them over to my buddies house for the Bulls game. The pizza was how I expected it to be, delicious until my health conscious body realized what it was being stuff with. This occurred right about when I hit my third slice. These specialty kinds of pizzas just do not sit well with me. This applies to the ones I had at Bije's, as well as ones that I've had from California Pizza Kitchen and other similar places that make exotic pizzas.  I should have ordered a mushroom, sausage, and black olive pizza and am sure my taste buds would have been satisfied. However, i was hanging with a couple of friends and watching a Bulls game, so I figured these two pizzas would compliment the game and scene of things a little more than your typical pizza. Guys, Sports, Buffalo Wings....but pizza style :) As I have said, the first couple of slices were great. I actually liked the BBQ Bacon Pizza a lot more because the saltness of the bacon combined with the zest of the BBQ sauce really mixed well with the cheese. The Buffalo Chicken Pizza was a bit bland and probably would have tasted better with the suicide sauce rather than the medium sauce. Then again, I am not sure how hot the suicide sauce ranks in at, if it were too hot, it might not be enjoyable. Regardless, I do not think one can go wrong with the BBQ Bacon Pizza.The reason why I debated heavily on writing this review was because I knew I had a bias going into tasting these two pizzas. I knew that at some point my stomach would remind me of my Dad's favorite quote, "A man has got to know his limitations" (Dirty Harry aka Clint Eastwood). For me, my limitations are a typical old fashion simple topping type of pizza, nothing extravagant. I realized that I had tossed my limitations out the window as I saw the grease of the cheese glisten off of the top of the pizza  and felt the lard of the bacon clogging my arteries. I should have known better, but I wanted to get something that the guys would appreciate and am always up for trying new things. Therefore, is it really fair that I express my opinion on this pizza? I don't know. I guess you, the reader, get to be the judge. I can tell you one thing though. If I was tossing back beers (even though I don't drink anymore), getting my buzz on, and looking forward to a heavy night of partying...these pizzas would have fit the mood and situation perfectly. This is good "let's get completely wasted and chow down on some greasy food at the end of a long night" pizza. Ya feel me? I hope so :)Now I finally get to mention the thing that I've been most looking forward to write about in my review. Carl Quilici. He's the owner and he's a hell of a guy. I walked in the door to pick up my pizza and was greeted by his wonderful personality. We got to talking for a few seconds. I hear a little history on how long his restaurant has been around and can tell he is really sincere about making people feel welcomed when they come into his place. He is also a very humble person who realizes the economy is ruff, but rather than complaining about matters,  he gives praise to the Lord for blessing him with enough business to remain open. God Bless guys like him who do not take things for granted and whom always remain thankful. Carl, if you are reading my review, I am sorry that I only gave your place 3 stars. However, while I do not live in the immediate area of your bar, I will definitely make it a point to visit you again one day and to suggest your pizza to all of my friends who live in the surrounding area. I have some really diehard Karaoke buddies too and will definitely bring up the fact that your place is the place to be on Thursday nights. In the meantime, I wish you all the best brother and hope that anyone else reading this review has the pleasure of meeting you and tasting your delicious pizzas. Thanks for everything.

2.description: A local favorite and one of the best crusts in Chicagoland. Bijes is a great local place for pizza, wings, friend cauliflower and sports. The restaurant's menu is full of amazingly good food, decent pricing, a decent alcohol selection and is a great place to stop to watch a Blackhawks game. Bijes will always remain on the very top of my list for some of the best Chicago pizza and appetizers. Definitely worth stopping in and checking out.

34.description: My cousin has been telling me about the Buffalo wing pizza  with the suicide sauce from Bije's for awhile now, and I FINALLY got to try it.  Verdict: Woot! Awesomtastic!The place is definitely a place where locals congregate, but I was happy to intrude.  Perfectly cooked thin crust pizza that's not greasy and dripping with pure ecstasy.  Yumm!

32.description: This place is a staple in the neighborhood.  This pizza is REALLY good along with pretty much everything else I've had on the menu.  The place has a great atmosphere and it seems like no matter when you go in there, there is a good crowd.  Always great tunes on the jukebox too.  I'd say 90 percent of the time the owner is sitting on the very first seat at the bar when you walk in and he always greets everyone with a smile and some friendly banter.  If you are in the neighborhood, I highly recommend a drop in!

18.description: Pizza Pizza - This place does pizza right and its priced right... Much like most pizza in Chicago, someone will tell you it is the best ever and someone else will tell you they didn't care for it. I personally enjoy this pizza, it is not great but it is never bad! The Buffalo Wing Pizza is a nice departure from the norm... That is pretty much where the review ends for me, other than drinking at the bar I have not eaten anything else from Bije's.All in all, I will try to frequent this place more often as I have never been disappointed...

41.description: I SERIOUSLY know Chicago pizza. When you get to the end of this, you'll know why.Hidden away on a corner in a neighborhood dominated by condos and a pizza place very 60 yards is Bije's, a cozy sports bar with an amazing secret life as one of the best pizza joints in Chicago.The old moose head plays host to Carl and company's mecca for sports viewers. Bije's is a shrine to hockey. What most but a few insiders knew was that this family comes from Chicago pizza royalty, and they've blessed the neighborhood by keepin' it real... and here. Without the high-priced bullshit associated with Gold Coast sports joints, here's a REAL bar with real fans and a place that will host hordes of families and Cub scouts at any given time.  I will reveal that I brought one of the honchos from HBO Sports here one night while working on a Cubs documentary; we bellied up to the bar and he was, "Man, I LOVE this place!"  You can, indeed ,find magic times when the place is between crowds; if it were deeper in the trendier parts of Chicago, the lines would never stop.Yes, they do karaoke, but never have and never will, but the old TVs were replaced around 2010 to big, thin screens and a whopper of a full-walled projection system that, after years, still makes for a great night of watching and eating. The crew has enough ovens to keep it busy, and other items on the menu are just as good. Don't limit yourself to just the pizza, but for a first-time visitor, you HAVE to do Bije's 'zza. Outside of a local parish, you'd be hard-pressed to hear God's name invoked so often. The 'zza itself uses yellow corn meal for that extra crunch, and we just can't place what heroin is in that cheese and sauce, but trying to stop eating takes self-control. This and a pitcher of Miller Lite and we're totally happy. And pizza so good that it still has much of the mystique still there the next day, but really, hot from the oven is nearly religious experience. Crisp edges, and a center that weighs in under REAL cheese, so expect some softness there, but lined with crispy corn meal, it is like dining on a 2nd style pizza. nobody, ever, among our friends has said anything short of big love for Bije's. Friendly (unless, of course, you come in with attitude and/or block one of the limited parking spaces). If you must drive, park across the street at the bank. Tip generously; the girls here hustle with love and a smile. If you find yourself waiting, be cool. it's part of the deal: Demand can be insane some nights. No kidding; this is the best you could ever ask for in any city... and I have it walking distance from the house; Life is good. Above all, when WE walk in and you're in our booth, f***ing move. Mark B, Associate Publisher, Food Industry News

13.description: Great staff but the food could be better.  Not my favorite place for pizza in the area.

4.description: Been going to this place for years. This is real Chicago place. Best place to watch the hawks. Pizza is fantastic.

24.description: Pizza Pizza - This place does pizza right and its priced right... Much like most pizza in Chicago, someone will tell you it is the best ever and someone else will tell you they didn't care for it. I personally enjoy this pizza, it is not great but it is never bad! The Buffalo Wing Pizza is a nice departure from the norm... That is pretty much where the review ends for me, other than drinking at the bar I have not eaten anything else from Bije's.All in all, I will try to frequent this place more often as I have never been disappointed...

6.description: I went here just by walking around the area. There are other bar and grills around the area but I decided to check this one out. When I got my water there was something floating in it, it was a bug. I lost my appetite but I already placed my order. I got some nachos, which were just regular chips with cheese out the can and was sloppily put together. I also got the chicken wings, which were just some frozen chicken wings thrown in the fryer. I wanted to give this place another chance but I don't think it'll happen.. I hope you guys change your ways.

22.description: Seriously the best pizza anywhere in the Chicago area...hands down!

15.description: My boys and I Love this spot! We've been coming here for years the pizza is definitely on point and so are the drinks. The fried zucchini is super yummy. Carl is a really nice guy believe it or not he's a family man. Just a little rough around the edges (dont let him bother you) this is the spot for pizza and drinks when your in the area!! Yummy can never turn down Bijes :)

40.description: This is the best place for PIZZA in  my neighborhood..you would never think that seeing it's in a sports bar..but i tried just about every pizzajoint in the neighborhood and it's up there on the top of my list..the appetizers are pretty good also, their sandwiches leave a little to be desired though..even the delivery service is quick and you get free pop with your large pizza..can't beat that with a stick and not a 32 oz bottle but a 64oz bottle not to many places do that ..i've been going here for years and will keep on going in and having it delivered..they even give ya a free pie if you save 10 coupons from there pizzas such a deal..none of the other pizza joints got anything on this place i love it ..keepup the good work..

7.description: Excellent pizza. Friendly service. I like the fact that they have caramelized onions as a topping for the pizza. I enjoyed the atmosphere. The owner really lives the Black Hawks. Great place to watch the hawks game!!

36.description: The bar section was pretty cool, but the resteranut and tables and seating area for food was atrocious. I have never seen smaller and worse seating as it is right oot of the fifties. Do they realize how big people are today especially ones that like to devour into pizza. The staff was unfriendly. That can be ignored as the place is pretty cool and the location looking right onto Irving Park Road can be pretty cool

30.description: This has to be the best pizza i have ever eaten. The toppings are fresh and it's made to perfection. Treat yourself once and you'll be back. The staff is friendly and bend over backward to please you.

3.description: Great pizza!  Used to hang out here at the bar back in the day.  Always had a blast.  Food is awesome!

14.description: Came in today for dinner the food was great there was a bartender and waitress very attentive to us children are welcome to stop very comfortable here had a great time great meal definitely will be back

56.description: Another childhood haunt. I LOVE this place. Used to go here for my wife at 2AM when cravings for cheese fries and cheese dogs with onions when she was preggo with our first!!! Double cheeseburgers will stop your heart....

29.description: I have probably been eating at this establishment all my life. Even as a child I preferred franksville over the chain restaurants near it. the food is great, I used to get their chicken salads all the time but I feel they are starting to give less on it than they used to. My usual order is two super tacos and an order of cheese fries, extra cheese. You have to get the cheese on the fries, trust me it makes a huge difference.

42.description: This place is hands down in the top 3 places I could not live without. I was turned onto this place by my wife about 3 years ago, and no matter what, I must stop here at least 1/month. When I host executives from out of town, I take them here to get a feel for real Chicago food. The best item on their menu is the grilled chicken pita sandwich. I have had almost everything on their menu and this no doubt is the best. The kids meals are great too and no matter what you order, they shine. If you are a regular, the people who work their will recognize you and even get to know your name. I don't know what some other reviewers are talking about with their low ratings, but this place is in my top 3. I can't think of a better place to get great food, a cold brew, and a more of a Chicago feel than this great restaurant.

23.description: Franksville is usual neighborhood hot dog place.  Everything is good. Hands down place to order a Greek Salad.  Always fresh, never wilted with dressing on the side.  You would think it would be a given if you ordered a take out salad that the dressing would be on the side, but it really isn't.  I can't say I'd travel from the south side just for Franksville, but if you are in the neighborhood, stop by.

47.description: I have been honestly trying to eat healthier over the last few months. I have been limiting my greasy food intake to the weekends. I have been eating a few more salads and less Red meat. But after a hard day at work, I really needed some good Old fashioned, comfort food. I pass Franksville literally every day on the way home from work, so I stopped in for some Greasy Goodness. Franksville brings back a lot of memories. My father used to take me there after we would watch the Cubs lose, which was most of the time back in the 70's. The original location was located on Addison, just west of Clark. It's now part of the McDonald's parking lot. What amazes me most about Franksville is that the food tastes exactly the same as it did when I was a kid. It takes me back to the day's when my father and I would bring home a sack of Hot dogs for the family after another miserable Cubs loss. And if I was especially good and didn't yell any obscenities at Bobby Murcer after he struck out with the Bases loaded, he would let me splurge and get Cheese Fries. I know that I'm not a kid anymore, I'm just a middle aged, chubby man with a bad case of Acid Reflux, but it feels good to remember those care free days again. The day's where nothing else mattered except Bill Buckner's Batting Average. The Hot dog and Cheese fries took me back to those days, if only for a little while. The bottom line is this. If you have a hankering for some Greasetastic food, at a decent price, give Franksville a try. And if you grew up near Wrigley Field in the 70's, the Ass Bomb food might bring back a few memories for you as well.

8.description: Another place where the flashy appearance does not really meet expectations with the food. Nothing either special or missing from this place. The food is bland at best but not terrible. Pricing is reasonable. Its forgettable.

31.description: The food here is good, not amazing - but for a hot dog place I can't complain. You would think with the huge sign that's outside that the food would be delectable, but sadly it is easier described as average. I used to live a few blocks away from here, so the convenience factor was great. Nothing bad to say about the place, so A-OK is a pretty accurate description.

34.description: It is excellent for the type of place it is, a fast food place: those bad reviews must be from foodie snobs. That being said, the only two things that need improvement are the fries and burgers. It offers ribs, chicken pitas and gyros that are fantastic!

16.description: Must try the spinach pie the bomb thanks for being around ---way better than mcdonalds next door

13.description: This place never disappoints, I love their chicken sandwiches on French bread. And their onion rings are also nice and crispy. Their burgers are nice and juicy full of flavor and always nicely cooked. I believe pricing is a bit high on some items on the menu but other than that no complain on this joint!

11.description: This place was one of my dad's favorite spots.  Their cheeseburgers are delicious wih the grilled onions. Gyros are huge.   Workers are all friendly and although I like dining in, I love that they have a drive thru.  Try the greek salad with house dressing. I want one right now!

39.description: I'm a Gyros connoisseur and outside of greek town this place has the best around.  The burgers, cheese fries, tamales, and hot dogs are all fantastic.  The Tzatziki is the best I've had, and still homemade!

37.description: It's been a while since I've been to Franksville.  I went with the chili dog, taco, and fries. The chili dog was good. The chili had very good flavor. The hot dog was a Vienna Beef and was warmed up just right. The taco was your typical fast food taco. The fries seemed to have changed since I have been here.  They didn't have a lot of flavor. I think I would return again if I'm in the area.

0.description: Two words - SUPER TACO!  These guys make the best one around.Their cheese fries are also my favorite.I've been going here my whole life(35yrs) and have probably had about everything on the menu.  They are VERY consistent.  Other than the two items above, I'd recommend:-the gyro sandwich-taco salad-chciago hot dog-chili dogYou really cant go wrong with this place.  Check it out

38.description: I've been looking for a gyros place near work and I finally found one with Franksville. The meat is flavorful and I appreciate the good portion size. Yesterday was my first time here and I can't wait to come back for more.

51.description: Many friends of mine love their Grecian chicken special but to me, Franksville misses it big time.  Not that their chicken is bad, its just that everything else is so standard and boring.  Did I mention overpriced?  Where do these rinky dink hot dog joints come off thinking they can charge you top dollar for a less than perfect meal?  Hell, I didn't realize I needed to stop at the bank to roll out the wad to pay for lunch.  I paid for myself and 4 buddies.  After the total was figured, I almost fell on the floor.   I look at the guy and  said "Are you sure?  I didn't order the caviar.  I ordered two dogs, a burger, a combo and 4 Cokes.  Never again.  The dogs sucked, the Coke was the fake kind and the burger was way over cooked.  Sorry Franksville, looks like this train ain't coming your way again.

27.description: A Chicago NW side must, the dogs are great and the super tacos are superb.  I have been going here for 20 years and I take all of my out of town friends here when the come in to visit.Don't forget to grab an old style

32.description: Franksville is located on Harlem Avenue with an eye catchingly vintage sign of a hot dog train being driven by a Bing Crosby looking conductor. Walking in I noticed a Vienna Beef Hall of Fame plaque on the well and thought I'd be in for a quality hot dog. I waited patiently for my food to be ready and was served a hot dog with all of the appropriate ingredients on a plain non-poppy seed bun. For the price I was a little surprised by the plain bun, but not entirely discouraged. The slice of the pickle was definitely thicker than I would have liked, and as I bit into the hot dog the gargantuan pickle flavor overwhelmed the rest of the taste of the hot dog. The mustard and relish were only sparingly applied though the onions were chopped and properly complimented the hot dog. Overall I can't recommend Franksville, I was definitely disappointed with my hot dog experience here.

54.description: I have gone here so many times and I think they have good food for good prices.  Everything I have had here is good (most of the menu) but not the best I have ever had.  When I want some decent American food and I'm in the area I always go here.

48.description: I used to live up north and have since moved south and this might be the only place i miss dearly.  i really just miss the cheez fries and the burgers.  both are fab.  everything that I, or EVERYONE I know, has had here has been great!  a good ole greek owned fast food joint with a twist including items like greek salads and shish ka bob platters.  but the cheez fries..... omgosh.

44.description: I'm slightly surprised at the lukewarm reviews for Franksville. For me (a person who grew up in near-by Elmwood Park), it's always delivered as expected, and done so well!I have no issue with the gryos or the chicken pita for that matter -- to me, they are served up perfectly.The onion rings are great -- the onions actually stay in the battered coating when you eat them, instead of sliding out!But my favorite thing about Franksville are the shakes... and the MALTS. Hard to find a good, true malt nowadays. But they have 'em!OK, one more thing... I like that I don't have to get out of my car (drive-up window). Hmmmm... Does that make me a lazy ass? Probably, but that's how I roll!

24.description: Always drive past this place but finally decided to give it a try. The interior is not that much to look at, has been a round a while, one can see the history. Next the menu is alright, should you what they have, a little messy but the food looked good. The person taking the ordered struggled with her English a little as I asked a few questions. There seemed to be to many cooks in the kitchen just standing around watching people as the ordered, a little creepy but ok. I waited for the for the food for about 10 min. Everything looked good. The bun was a bit to soggy but the fries and chicken were delicious! I'll probably stop by again but take a to go. Would recommend for a quick bite.

7.description: Been here a few times fan of the burgers and gyros won't go anywhere else to eat that but here. Had chicken kabobs once and Grecian rice wasn't bad but definitely not for me chicken was too sweet.

49.description: Quite decent.  You can get a solid, satisfying meal, quickly and with smile, for a reasonable price and with lots of choices.

40.description: Franksville will always be one of my favorite places for fast food. The cheese fries, no matter how disgusting they look, for whatever reason, I LOVE 'EM! Order them every time. The chicken sandwich is really good as well as the gyros. The workers are nice and the food is just as good as it was when I was a kid. No complaints here!

53.description: It's cool. Not much to talk about really but it's a fast food place so I wasn't expecting a waiter in white gloves or anything like that. I ordered the chicken pita and it was great! Make sure to have plenty of mints on hand in case you decide to go with the onions on the pita. Pretty quick service, staff wasn't outstanding but they weren't rude and unbearable.  I say if you're in the area check it out.

30.description: If it weren't for my boyfriend's big appetite and my need to use a ladies' room, there's no telling how many more years would have gone by before I stopped driving passed this place without stopping. Although this isn't a franchise, it's been in business so long, it's become a landmark which serves Coke fountain drinks. Everything about this place is nostalgic.Honestly, I couldn't believe how cheap the menu was compared to other fast food restaurants in the area. I enjoyed their chicken gyro. I won't wait so long before coming back next time.

46.description: Granted, with a name like Franksville, I should only be eating hot dogs, but that must be the only good thing on the menu.  I decided to have a polish since I couldn't wait for a nice large roll and grilled sausage.  Nope.  Here, they put it on a plain hot dog bun.  The husband got a cheeseburger and I think you could read the paper through it - it was so thin.  And grey - and greasy.  Fries were half and half - the crisp ones were delicious, the soggy ones, not so much.  Plus for giving you your own ketchup and having salt and pepper on each table instead of pre-salting everything.  Minus for over-priced lackluster food.

1.description: Ordered the $9.00 chicken salad, gave me a head of lettuce and a few pieces of chicken.  Also ordered a side of Greek rice and it was mushy. What a let down, just moved nearby and really wanted to like this place. On to the next spot...

55.description: I've been going to Franksville for about five years.  In that time I've probably been there a hundred times.  With the possible exception of one or two times I order the sliced chicken on pita (plain) with cucumber sauce every time I'm there.  It's amazing!  I can't speak for the other items on the menu, but the chicken on pita is definitely worth a visit.

9.description: It's your regular corner hot dogs/burgers/gyros place. Food was good, fresh (fresh French fries), burger ok as well the steak sandwich my son ate.Nothing bad, but nothing really outstanding about the place. Will come back? Yes.

26.description: Great fast food!!!! Favorites are gyros (grilled onions, extra sauce), cheeseburger, and their shakes!!! Friendly staff and always a place to sit.

25.description: The gyros are just right, I love their French fries which are always nice an warm. I would Recommend the steak sandwich. It done just perfect. Their Greek rice is ok, nothing special there. The good thing is they serve beer!!! :)

12.description: Obviously my review won't be positive so I'll start out with saying that I live down the street and was hoping I had a gem in my neighborhood. I was very much wrong as a first timer. My order was a hot dog with everything on it and a side of cheese fries. It feels like they stinged out on the cheese and condiments. It was more like cheese glazed fries with a hot dog with a little of everything on it. I'd be more understanding if the place was busy, but from what I saw was an empty parking lot and two people in the drive through including me. The man that served me was rude, but who ever greeted me in the drive through was great- I wish he handed my food. He was the best part of the experience, really. I'm sure this place would be good, but it was my first time and I 'm not sure I will be returning. Maybe if there's nothing open and I don't want McDonald's.

21.description: Bad food and bad service never eat there!

17.description: If it weren't for my boyfriend's big appetite and my need to use a ladies' room, there's no telling how many more years would have gone by before I stopped driving passed this place without stopping. Although this isn't a franchise, it's been in business so long, it's become a landmark which serves Coke fountain drinks. Everything about this place is nostalgic.Honestly, I couldn't believe how cheap the menu was compared to other fast food restaurants in the area. I enjoyed their chicken gyro. I won't wait so long before coming back next time.

10.description: Love this place!!! I recommend the greek salad, the gyros, chicken on a pita sandwich, tuna sandwich on a croissant, and the cheese fries. I don't think I've ever been disappointed here. They keep their restaurant very clean and the staff is super friendly. Great place to sit down and eat with the family or to grab on the go!

5.description: The food at this place is pretty decent, better than most fast food hotdog/beef/chicken places in Chicago. The exception is they also have alcohol and frosty mugs, which is nice. A warm sandwich and a cold beer on a hot day. You got a problem with that?!

3.description: This place is so close to home and everyone here is always friendly especially the owner.  Makes me feel like family.Hands down they have some of the best chicken ever, if it's on a pita, or in a form of a kabob or gyro it's delicious.  And for all those beer drinkers they do have beer for sale which I think makes it stand out more. Price points are extremely reasonable for the quality of meat.Love this place

35.description: This is a cute spot I have passed by many many times over the years. Today we stopped in and both opted for the hot dog special (imagine that). They were good basic Chicago style dogs, though the standard seems to come with neither sport peppers or celery salt. I didn't ask about that however, so I don't know if they will add it upon request.The fries were nice and crispy, but I think best eaten on site, rather than as a carry out. The prices seemed reasonable and the place was clean.We will have to try some other items in the future, but for now, our experience was A-OK.

19.description: A Chicago NW side must, the dogs are great and the super tacos are superb.  I have been going here for 20 years and I take all of my out of town friends here when the come in to visit.Don't forget to grab an old style

28.description: Franksville is pretty good food for a decent price.  I would much rather give my money to a small business than the chain fast food joints around it.  Also they always get my order right!

45.description: I LOVE CHICKEN PITAS and I read a review somewhere where someone stated that Franksville sold the best chicken pita.  I was on the bandwagon for a while and then after a few more visits, it started tasting "funny" and I got off of the bandwagon.

33.description: Wow!! What in the seven hells has happened to this place? It's been a few years since I've been to this place and I happened to be driving by it early Saturday afternoon. I used to be a regular back in the day, just loved their gyro plate. I used to get 2 extra sauces which I considered the best sauce ever, eating it with fries as well. It hurts to say but I was really disappointed  this time around. The gyro meat was so dry and flavorless I didn't even finish it. And my favorite sauce tasted like a plain Greek yogurt.  Needless to say I won't be back here for another 5 years, we'll see if the food improves then. I'm giving them three stars for old time sake:(

43.description: The Guy with the dead arm is the dirtiest most disgusting person ive seen in my 42 years on this earth! I pulled to the drive thru window to get my order and this Guy almost half a finger dug in his nose, then proceded to take my cheese fries with that hand and stuff them into the package.  The funny thing is he comes to the window and gives me the hard time when I tell him I want my money back and why.

2.description: I've been looking for a new spot to grab a hotdog or grilled chicken sandwich so as I past this place daily, I got to recently stop by.  I had such high hopes and was sadly disappointed.  I ordered the grilled chicken breast on a pita and my son had a hot dog with fries. The fries were OK,  the chicken and hot dog weren't good.  The chicken had a reddish seasoning on it that I didn't like. My son complained that the hot dog he ordered wasn't good and he refused to finish eating it.  They get 2 stars for great customer service and an easy to read menu.

18.description: Decent average food. Not the best not the worst. Word of caution, the drive thru speaker is terrible. I couldnt understand anything the guy was saying so i just answered yes. Thankfully the order was right.

41.description: Been going to Franksville for years and for a neighborhood fast food joint it definately hits the spot! I generally get the grilled chicken salad with greek dressing for dinner on my workout days but other notably good items they have is the Chicken pita, Cheeseburgers and the cheese fries! The gyros dinner isnt too bad either. The food here just doesn't seem as greasy as most typical fast food places. I've also always received great friendly service too will definately continue to go here.

52.description: you cant go wrong with this place its all good shit here good chicago food with a drive threw window how can you go wrong tho i wouldent take a girl on are first date here but who cares

50.description: actually, you can go wrong here, and fairly easily. #1. the gyro is tiny. forget it. if you want a gyro, don't go here, unless you are a very little person or a girl. i'm not kidding. it is a very little gyro. #2. the house cheeseburger is horrible. grease, american fake cheese product, and i don't even remember what else. that said, my wife really likes the chicken gyro. and i have to say that it smells fabulous. cheers.

4.description: OK food. Expected  a Lil more  from this place actually . Food wasn't terrible. It was OK I'd eat here again. It was fast  Lil pricey I thought.

6.description: This is a very chilled place I recommend going inside to order as it seems to be quicker than going through the drive thru unless of course it is past 10 o'clock drive thru is open till 1 am which is a plus the hamburger with grilled onion is really good hot dogs are so so I would recommend this place if you're in the area.

22.description: Franksville is the bomb!   Old school food - consistent - just plain great!   Try their chicken pita, cheese fries, burger - omg!  Also, their service is quick and amicable.   Great place to nosh in the Harlem/Addison neighborhood.

15.description: Always drive past this place but finally decided to give it a try. The interior is not that much to look at, has been a round a while, one can see the history. Next the menu is alright, should you what they have, a little messy but the food looked good. The person taking the ordered struggled with her English a little as I asked a few questions. There seemed to be to many cooks in the kitchen just standing around watching people as the ordered, a little creepy but ok. I waited for the for the food for about 10 min. Everything looked good. The bun was a bit to soggy but the fries and chicken were delicious! I'll probably stop by again but take a to go. Would recommend for a quick bite.

57.description: You will be very very impressed with the footlong hotdogs here,  they are very good and filling with a side of fries your set.  For a drink I would get a chocolate shake, its really thick and chocolatey. Thumbs up for franksville

20.description: The food at this place is pretty decent, better than most fast food hotdog/beef/chicken places in Chicago. The exception is they also have alcohol and frosty mugs, which is nice. A warm sandwich and a cold beer on a hot day. You got a problem with that?!

36.description: Another 4 Star experience here! 3rd time in 3yrs, 2nd time in a week!Gyros-Great flavor, nice texture, but I am used to a little more meat & slightly more crispy. that being said, I'll take Quality over quantity any day, and rather not crispy than too crispy and dried out. Best Gyros experience I have had West of Pulaski!ILTACO brand Pizza Puff-Simple, yet fried perfectly which is easier said than done.Fries-While still not fresh cut, they are growing on me....As good as frozen fries get in my opinion. Not mushy, not salty.....Just right!Keep up the great work Franksville! A few more great experiences and I think I can over-look the fries! :-)

14.description: I live right down the street and I eat here way more than I should lol. The chicken shish kabob sandwich is a favorite as well as the fries. Yummy, just yummy

3.description: i played the flute for six years in elementary and junior high.  not to toot my own horn, (*groan*) but i was pretty damn good back in the day.  during my last move, i found my old flute at the back of my closet, and busted it out, curious to see if i could still play.  20 years had passed since i had picked up the thing, and of course, i could barely get a few notes out.  feeling slightly saddened, i called "we are music" and talked to the owner, doug, about taking lessons.  he recommended angela, the resident flutist.  at the very reasonable rate of $12 for a half-hour lesson, i figured it was worth a shot.its now been about three months, and i'm pleased to say that my lessons have been going very well.  angela is an awesome teacher...very patient and helpful.  she's got me playing honest to goodness music again!  yay!!!  (btw, angela also teaches sax, guitar, and piano).they offer all kinds of lessons for every instrument you can possibly imagine.  their teachers are energetic, friendly and talented.  it seems that most play more than one or two instruments themselves.  saturdays are pretty busy as far as lessons go, with a steady stream of students coming in and out.  i'm assuming that the weekday lesson schedule is less hectic.doug and his wife run the shop and are good people.  he's very encouraging and has referred to me as "our flute girl".  heh.that being said, don't be put off by the appearance of the store. its a little chaotic and disorganized, and crammed to the gills with merchandise, but dammit, this place has heart.  and that's what matters, right?

1.description: I'm giving We Are Music five stars because doing business with them does Chicago some good.As recently as five years ago, there were upwards of 100 music shops just like this in the city of Chicago:  neighborhood service, with good overall coverage on lessons, a decent selection of everyday-needs for most musicians and a collection of one or two specialty products.  The last time I was in We Are Music, I bought a heavy-duty music stand, a 25' 1/4" audio patch cable, and a rainbow saxophone strap; their specialty is guitars.  I hear their lessons (they teach EVERYTHING) aren't half-bad either, but can't personally vouch.Chicago is the city that was a melting pot of old-world music for much of the last 150 years and the town that became the adopted home of the Blues, doing just as much good for that quintessential American storytelling art form as the Blues did for Chicago.  This shop--We Are Music--and maybe a dozen more shops around the city are virtually all that's left of that storefront music culture aside from a few pawn shops that know the business.I won't say that it's bad that Guitar Center undercut the competition selling cheap stock and has overtaken the market in Chicago.  I do think it's a tragedy that they've managed to drive the mom-and-pop neighborhood music shops largely out of town, and absolutely have not managed to replace what used to exist in terms of culture and infrastructure.Do our city a favor:  the next time you're up on the north side shopping for a guitar, roll on up to We Are Music on Irving Park Rd.  Grit your teeth at the extra 10% over Guitar Center on the price tag and pay that tithe to help save Chicago's Soul.

2.description: Give me a break. I have a 5 year old who has been playing piano for a year. I started at 4 and took lessons for 18 years. I was in the market for a new instructor and was told that "none of the teachers want to take a 5 year old. They want a kid who knows what they are doing." Well, I want a teacher who knows what they are doing. Thanks but no thanks.

0.description: Since my initial review of this place, the only change to this store, is that Doug(the main person in the family that ran this place) passed away late last year. However, it's still as cool of a store, and though it was tough for me at first, I've gotten used to the other family members that've stepped up in running this place after Doug's death.No denying that it'll always be a little bit sad each time I stop, as I can't have my fun chats with Doug anymore.

3.description: Friendly place but terrible quality on food. I ordered a snack N go chicken wrap and it was the worst. They need to stock up on their items. They used grilled chicken instead of crispy and when I recieved it and bit into it it was stiff and disgusting. I didn't even eat half of it. Now I know to go elsewhere than at this location for a quick snack.

1.description: Once I get off the highway I pass two Dunkin' Donuts... Go past my school and then come to this location. Their coffee tastes so much better than the other locations, their employees are much more pleasant, and if you go to wright college you get discount :))

2.description: The worst experience ever. This place has the worst customer service I had ever had. They will not allow you to use washroom after spending $20 because "it is not for public?!" Even after telling them it is an urgency for a kid..Jelly munchkins has the worst taste... They should really go and try donuts in other places as quality here is BAD.

5.description: This is one of the worst experiences I had at a Dunkin' Donuts. Specifically ordered 2 wake-up wraps which one was made wrong when I told them they argued with me about what I ordered. Which to me was ridiculous because I know what I ordered and it was only .99 so just fix it and shut up.  Secondly, I ordered 2 orders of the hash brown bites and they put both orders into 1 bag so they had to fix that as well since they were for 2 separate people. Who does that? when you order 2 small fries at a burger joint do they put them all into one large container? Very poor service at this location.

6.description: Went for an iced coffee this morning and was very unsatisfied. To begin with my order was wrong. The second coffee I received tasted like water with milk. Some dunkin donuts have great quality coffee but unfortunately this location is out of the circle. I also ordered hot coffee for a friend and turned out to be very watered down. Please, if you don't want to be an unhappy customer help yourself and go elsewhere for some coffee.

7.description: Fast service but not enough donuts

0.description: This DD is my go to place when I go to my second j. The staff is quick, friendly and they are always in a good mood! Oh andddd, they ALWAYS have my Raspberry coffee freshly brewed and my blueberry bagels are always in stock!!!! ((Parking can be a pain sometimes depending how busy they are but, other than that, easy in a out of there always!))

4.description: Yo yo yo what-up my homies? This is yo girl Ellery kickin' it and I just wanna let ya'll know that the DD up in this dizzle is disgusting.  Seriously, it's gross.  I counted 3 employees standing around doing nothing.  Almost every table was grimy and smeary and dirty and nasty. What exactly was smeared on my table, I will never know. Garbage everywhere; in the window sills, on the floors etc.  The door seemed to have a miniature leaf pile in it by the way so if your feeling fall festive just open the store door and jump in.  One good thing, the service was quick (likely because all the standing around resulted in greater energy to serve me).  Maybe it's just me but I find it a little odd that I had to be buzzed into the bathroom.  Anyone with me on this one?  "Hello, I'd like a pumpkin coffee please and can you buzz me into your bathroom so I can do a line of coke?  Thanks." @@

58.description: This is by far my favorite music shop in Chicago. Truthfully it's the best one I've been able to find in the whole midwest. They have an unmatched selection of new as well as vintage gear. My last two large purchases (A Fender Hot Rod Deville and a Taylor 510 CE) were made here and both times the salesmen were incredibly helpful and knew exactly what they were talking about. They always let me try out whatever I want and they don't make you feel like you're smudging up all the gear.If you're a pedal junkie be sure to check this place out as they carry stuff by much smaller manufacturers as well as the usual, more common brands. Go to this place, you will not be disappointed.

56.description: Best store ever with amazing customer service! Nicest people work here... Thanks Alex for all of your help!

44.description: Lets start off with how rare it is to find a amazing musical instrument store where the staff is knowledgeable, friendly and the stock they have to be jaw dropping. This store has all of those things and more!This has become my number one favorite guitar store, they have such beautiful guitars on hand, effects pedals galore and their acoustic section is by far the best in the city! You know when you go here you are buying top quality gear and not duds like Guitar Center. (Which continues to disappoint me)You can find some great deals even though some guitars can be a little bit high in price BUT just so we are clear here these specific instruments are vintage and very hard to come by so the price is worth it for the top quality. I also love how the store is setup, its very chill and laid back but also comfortable like a well worn in strat.Don't get me started on the amps, the selection they have is amazing and if there is something you can't find the staff can do their best to find it for you!There is also a top notch repair shop downstairs which is a huge plus being that it can be very difficult to find a reliable one in the city.If you are looking for a top notch guitar store with all your dream guitars and amps look no further and stop on by the Chicago Music Exchange, you won't be disappointed .... and if you are then there is something seriously wrong with you...

29.description: This is the Mecca of guitar shops in Chicagoland area.I love this place.  I wish I could live within it's walls.  I would behave and they wouldn't even know I was there.  I promise.Seriously though, this place is amazing.  One thing I noticed is that every guitar I picked up (and I picked up tons) were in tune and very playable.They have a lot of vintage instruments here, but just as many brand new.You can really try out every guitar before you choose.Their Acoustic room is set up very customer friendly and I could hang out in there for a full day.I didn't check out the basement where I think they have the bass's and drums.  Because I spent like 4 hours in awe of every guitar and I was actually tired when I left here from the exhaustion of being a kid in a candy store.I will be back, and would love to buy my next guitar here.

42.description: people here are so nice. it looks like a shrine. it makes me want to be a rock star.

23.description: First off, umm wow?!So many great, fantabulous pieces in this fantastic place.We walked in on the side with the drums and cymbals. Pretty cool but my stomach dropped when we walked into the guitar showroom. Holy friggin' buckets. I have obscure taste in guitars (Harmony, Höfner,.. Ok that's really it) and there were a few Höfner guitars which was pretty amazing. Only one Rocket and they never have one like mine but it was still a pretty nice alternative. I also kind of fell in love with this lefty baritone Eastwood. Like I said, I like the weirdos in the guitar world and this is one of them. I'm wanting to be ambidextrous when it comes to guitar, I strive for the best.There are rooms set up with about 15 amps to play in (I saw 4 rooms) and you borrow a cord and can test out some sweet gear.The staff put up with my weird questions and entertained my talk about Harmony and wanting to be ambidextrous on guitar. It was great! I left wanting to go back and just browse for hours again. Someday, Chicago Music Exchange, I will return to your store. Prepare your drool rags for us now.

47.description: Everything about this shop is excellent. Amazing and unique guitars at a fair price. Recently purchased two guitars from here and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and easy to talk with about the guitars/drums. Also, it turns out if you spend $4k they give you some free goodies! Will definitely return when it's time to get some more gear.

31.description: I've been a customer for many years. Since Dave Kalt took over the store a few years ago, the quality of the service in store and on line has been fantastic. Staff are incredibly knowledgable, anxious to help, and encourage visitors to play the guitars.I am most impressed with the repair service. I've taken over a dozen guitars there for re-setting, re-stringing or re-habbing. A recent doubleneck purchase was given 4 new pickups at the recommendation of the staff, and they sound fantastic. A bass repair required an innovative fabrication that solved a serious problem without damaging the vintage quality of the instrument. When I was considering replacing pickups for a treasured old G&L, the staff actually recommended AGAINST it, noting that the pickups were hot, unique, and on the margin, new pickups wouldn't sound as good as the originals. That's professional service.I live over an hour away from CME in good traffic, but I won't take my instruments anywhere else for maintenance. I highly recommend their repair shop to anyone in need of professional, high quality and economical repair services for their guitars.

34.description: I only had enough time to check out the Bassment but I had a great experience down there. Mark was a very attentive, knowledgable guy who made me feel welcome in Chicago (I'm a traveling musician from LA.) He knows the inventory very well and worked with me to get the vintage bass that I wanted.

16.description: Absolute best customer service! I had a small issue with a snare drum (not their fault) I had purchased and they went well out of their way to make sure I was happy. This was an online purchase but I can't wait to get into the store the next time I am in town.

8.description: Mecca for Musicians.This place redefines a quality instrument shop.  Great selection of new and vintage amplifiers, guitars, basses and drums.  Lacks much more than that, but you won't even notice.The only real comparison to this place is gruhns guitars down in Nashville or Vintage Instruments in Philly, and falls short to their really high end stuff (like Fender strat serial number 1!), but you can find something between $100-$50,000 here.  If you want something specific, I'm sure they'll help you find it.I encourage you to visit, even just to look, who knows you may even run into a band that's playing Chi-town that evening, CME is a must-stop-in place for the serious musician.

11.description: There is no doubt that this is the most amazing guitar store out there!!  Their selection is incredible.  I found it to be a players store and even though it was busy, I was able to try out all the guitars I had my eye on while there.Walked out with a new Gretsch Silver Falcon  and Brian was a huge help with shipping it back home.

26.description: Great service, very knowledgable, and unpretentious. Give them your money!

39.description: I went here the other day for an item which was listed on the CME website, but which they didn't have on the sales floor. I asked about the item by name, and was told it was "downstairs". But I was offered a different item, which I was assured was "exactly the same" except for some minor aesthetic detail, and $5 cheaper than the item I wanted. I was suspicious, but in a hurry, so I agreed. When I got it home, and compared it against the online description of the item I had intended to purchase, it was clear it wasn't even close, and item I intended to purchase would suit my needs much better. I called and talked to another person who confirmed my suspicion, and I went back to the store to do the exchange. The person who helped me on the phone must have been a manager, because instead of charging me the extra $5 and tax for the exchange, he just did an even exchange for my trouble. Kudos to the second guy who helped me, he'll make sure I'll be back in the future (maybe for one of those $6,000 Les Pauls, even) but to the guy who sold me the first item, please listen to your customers, especially when they come in asking for a product by name. If it's downstairs, go get it, so the customer can determine whether or not it meets his or her needs. It will end up saving a lot of time and hassle.

37.description: I'm not a musician but CME still gets me all hot and bothered. All the beautiful guitars hanging from the walls, shiny and unique and amazing. They're just all so sexy! Mounted between the walls are photos of all the amazing artists who have visited their hallow halls, taken down the guitars, and jammed. I love wandering around looking at these photos as my fella takes down his dream guitars and strums a few chords. That's also really cool--they don't care if you take down the guitars and play. No matter how expensive you can play. They have small rooms with amps you can plug into as well, if you want to see how they really rock. Want something mellower? There's a huge acoustic room that also houses banjos, mandolins, and other unique items.Amps? They got 'em. Accessories like straps, strings, peddles, pics and more? They got those too. A truly impressive collection that makes my guitar collector fella salivate. Prices can be steep but I've been assured by aforementioned collector fella that they're not crazy considering the quality and condition of the instruments. Super super awesome place!

0.description: I have had 2 basses and 2 guitars worked on here. I love the work they do. It's an amazing repair shop. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I have also bought some accessories from them. Decent prices. They have tons of high-end stuff. This place is legit. This is a place you need to shop.

38.description: I was heading up to Chicago for various reasons, and I was looking to sell/trade a few guitars I had. I emailed them ahead of time and had it somewhat worked out. I probably could have made more money by selling them on Craigslist or ebay, but I honestly tried for a long time, and I had no buyers. So after some thought, these guys were willing to step up and make the trade for an item I wanted, so I went for it. So when I arrived they checked out the items I brought and all was well. It took awhile because it was on Saturday and they were busy. I got my paper work and they shipped me the item (It was out of stock everywhere). They also shipped me a gig bag for free. Zero money was exchanged. I was very happy with the deal, I initially felt like I could be getting ripped off, but no one was making me do the deal. I could have said no, and again I tried to sell the items but they were just not selling. So I felt I got a good deal, because I wanted the item, and they made it happen. The next time you want something there, try doing a trade? They maybe able to help you. Also, just a word on the store. WOW. I mean WOW. You do not see collections like this anywhere. It is really unbelievable and overwhelming. Everyone I dealt with or spoke to was nice and polite. I didn't like how you would have to go in a little room to plug in the electrics to play them, but I get it. If you are a fan of music and guitars, go to this place, it is like a dream come true!

51.description: IF YOU ARE GOING TO BUY ANY INSTRUMENT IN CHICAGO GO TO CME. I just bought an amp and guitar there. JOEL was amazingly kind and helpful. So much so that he held off on a lunch break to lug 6 different amps (heavy ones), 4 different guitars, and a myriad of pedals into my playing room. Even after I had given them the money for the amp and guitar, they were still cool with me just hanging around and playing tons of pedals through my new amp.When I was only spending a few bucks on a pedal a while ago (probably 1/20 of their monthly revenue) they were more than willing to help in whatever way I needed (they even let me play of vintage 57' Fender Stratocaster for shits and giggles). Most of the people complaining about "unprofessional" or "bad attitude" staff are probably people who just kind of go in, don't really make an effort to say anything to the staff and just plug in and play. CME is actually really cool about you just testing out a bunch of crazy gear you've probably never encountered (or will again). They're willing to answer any questions you might have, it doesn't matter if your pockets or overflowing or your just a person trying to play cool guitars. Only the highest of regards for this amazing store.

22.description: Drew was the best!! I felt right at home as he helped me choose my first guitar, a Taylor 114e, to use and reacquaint myself for my planned lessons at Chicago School of Music with Richard. By the way, it was my instructor Richard who recommended this place to me. So, a referral from a musician/music instructor carries lots of credibility in my book.Needless to say, I was not disappointed. Drew and the rest of the staff worked as a team made up of friends - the opposite of what you might expect at a big container store made up of text crazy strangers with very different lives. In contrast, this place was made up of a "critical mass" of musicians, where all of the computers were Mac's and most staff were dressed in tattoos and tripster jeans - which I thought was very individualistic and cool! I could feel the passion and harmony within this temple and, of course, couldn't help but admire all of their fine heirlooms. The guitar room was my focus which felt like a bank vault stocked with precious valuables with shiny lacquered bodies (guitars of course) and a place of worship simultaneously. Let me not forget a man, part of this congregation, I noticed sitting in the middle with his sunglasses on and playing Blues with his soul like a professional musician. Yes, this is a place where professional musicians spend their days off and music aficionados from abroad (i.e. Italy) show up out of the blue in awe. As a novice, my dad was a bass player in a band while I was growing up, and I remember all of the times he and his band members would gather around a fire and jam to Long Train Runnin' (Without Love) by the Doobie Brothers and songs by Santana along with a faint smell of oregano in the air lol.Be sure to ask for Drew!! I found a couple of guitars that he was kind enough to demonstrate the performance with one of his own songs. Wow! And, again, this was done because Drew has a passion for music and wanted to share that with my gf and I. Thanks Drew!! Oh, and Drew can play, play, play guitar well. His playing was inspirational as he passed me the model and I carefully placed my fingers to slowly strike a C chord lol. Well, gotta start somewhere so I might as well start at the beginning with a great sounding guitar with a great resource like CME to back me up in a time of need. Thanks Drew and CME!! Maybe someday soon I will be able to play Spanish guitar like Jesse Cook's Havana. Check it out!!

32.description: I want to stay here.  I want to live here.  I want to stay here forever.  If you are a musician and u walk in here, u will be short of breath.  O MY GOSH!  This is the coolest store I have ever been in!  Their selection of vintage guitars is unreal!  Everyone is so nice and knowledgeable.  The only problem is that if u play any style of extreme music, u won't be in love with their selection.  Their most metal amp is an orange rocker verb, and they don't have any metal guitars, like ESP, schecter, or Jackson.  4.5 STARS BECAUSE OF THAT ^^^

54.description: I recently made two rather large purchases at CME and I will definetly use them in the future for most of my guitar needs. This is easily one of the most iconic and best music stores in the country for guitar. The service I received from Alex was second to none as he was very insightful on all the products we looked at. There was no hurry ever, I played different guitars over much time and the practice rooms are great. They even send personal thank you and follow up emails, very nice.The place is top notch on everything, for design and layout of the store to the online outstanding videos they produce in house.It is like going to guitar heaven.

48.description: Ordered a Fender Stratocastsr American Standard Jade Pearl Guitar from Chicago Music Exchange. The guitar was listed on Reverb web sight selling for $899.00 along with the make an offer button.The next day same Guitar listed for $799. Only fault listed was a minor scratch other wise in excellent condition. With the same Guitar selling for $1199.00 up here in Canada I took the plunge, sight unseen except for some pics of the guitar I went ahead and made an offer of $725.00 for basically a new 2013 Fender American Standard Stratocaster.Less than 30 minutes later to my surprise the offer was accepted by Chicago Music Exchange. I placed the order right away. (even got a call for a $20.00 refund shipping cost was less than expected)Four days later the guitar arrived, packaged perfectly upon opening the case I was blown away. The guitar was absolutely perfect, even the so called scratch was a non factor, it was so small it took a 300 watt light bulb to find it. The guitar was set up perfectly and the most important part is it stays in tune. A great deal, on a very fine American made Fender guitar. When I decide to pick up another guitar Chicago Music Exchange is on the top of my list.                                                                                                                    Yours Truly Mark P.

13.description: Obviously this is THE mecca for guitarists, bassists and drummers. I have bought untold gear from them and they are always helpful and kind. This review is specific to the dudes in the repair shop. They've helped me mod my partscaster and turn it into the guitar i've been searching for for decades. They make the right parts recommendations and will make sure it's fixed right, even not charging if I bring it back with a small issue. Great customer service and skill. Six string ninjas!

24.description: Just go.Amazing gear, great service, cool vibe. Very expensive, but if you're like me and value excellent customer service this is the place to go.

7.description: I'm not a musician but CME still gets me all hot and bothered. All the beautiful guitars hanging from the walls, shiny and unique and amazing. They're just all so sexy! Mounted between the walls are photos of all the amazing artists who have visited their hallow halls, taken down the guitars, and jammed. I love wandering around looking at these photos as my fella takes down his dream guitars and strums a few chords. That's also really cool--they don't care if you take down the guitars and play. No matter how expensive you can play. They have small rooms with amps you can plug into as well, if you want to see how they really rock. Want something mellower? There's a huge acoustic room that also houses banjos, mandolins, and other unique items.Amps? They got 'em. Accessories like straps, strings, peddles, pics and more? They got those too. A truly impressive collection that makes my guitar collector fella salivate. Prices can be steep but I've been assured by aforementioned collector fella that they're not crazy considering the quality and condition of the instruments. Super super awesome place!

27.description: I'm jealous of you locals. I was on a work trip and decided to check out CME after hearing quite a bit about it. It was totally worth the trek there, and I was stunned - like a kid in a candy store. I hadn't been playing guitar for a while and instantly fell in love with a Jaguar there. I couldn't resist, and Brian Westfall (guitars manager) set me up to receive the guitar back in SF. The whole experience was really smooth, and the store could not be any better. They literally have everything! The "practice" rooms were loaded with really great amps and there's just about every variation of any guitar, from the quirky offsets I like to rare and vintage Les Pauls. Brian was really helpful and took the time to walk me through all the aspects of the Jaguar as I was comparing various versions. The knowledge all the staff has towards these products is very evident - and I wouldn't hesitate to buy everything from them (I am planning to!).To be clear: My Jaguar was packed super, super well - but UPS (knowing them) somehow managed to ship it in a manner that resulted in some paint flaking off... However, Brian has been super helpful from the start and he's working on helping me out - I'm not stressed at all, and neither should you. Definitely a fluke but figured I should compliment them on how they are handling the post-sale experience...

49.description: Very impressive.  Please remember that not everyone has a place like CME local.  The prices aren't as unreasonable as you might think and I did very much appreciate the staff.  The original Barney Kessel was really a hoot.  If I could get a guitar back on a plane without it getting destroyed, I probably would have bought one.Short review: helpful staff, amazing selection.  Reasonable prices for the quality.  Excellent testing and sound areas.

53.description: So, I've had two very different experiences with Chicago Music Exchange, though both with the same outcome. First, I want to point out that while having a large, expensive inventory is nice, it isn't something that warrants "5 stars".
