Too many falsely believe the meat and bones of a good music equipment store is defined through their selection. Rather, the breadth of repairs and modifications is what truly differentiates stores. I took my 1976 Fender Quad here when I first moved to Chicago. The turnover was about two weeks, nothing crazy, but when I got it back, the thing ROARED. I'm not one to write a yelp review when I'm high on my own satisfaction, so I wait until I can be more pragmatic about the place.September 6th, I dropped off a '72 Electro Harmonix Small Stone just to have it true-bypassed and eliminate the volume drop. It took 2 months and eleven days, when I received it back on November 20th. Ridiculous. I hardly had contact and was really frustrated. Every time I called, I heard they were working on it, but that the year of the pedal was hard to do the simple mods I wanted. I get the pedal back to being the most MIND BLOWING pedal I've ever heard. It really is so unique and beautiful sounding. The quality was so fantastic that it outweighed even the ridiculous wait I had. I later found out that the pedal was very hard to mod due to the age and once I plugged it in, all was forgiven. Awesome place.

30.description: Yelp can go f*** itself, but I feel compelled to tell you that CME is honestly one of my faves. They are pleasant professional and not a bunch of dbags. Whenever I've had an inquiry of any kind they are knowledgable and passionate about what they do. People always complain about prices. Typically cheap people. CME offers the same prices as anyone else and guarantee the quality. They also are quick to help in the event of a malfunction AND their repair shop has never let me down. Quick and quality repairs. I can definitely single out Marc, George, Dan and most recently Dan Albert. Never disappoint. Always awesome. Ignore all negative things on here. Chicago Music Exchange. Do it.

46.description: Good selection of amps. Amp prices are reasonable.    Staff is very helpful. Isolation rooms are fantastic! Selection of guitars- very limited! If you want a strat or LP, this is the place- provided you have a trust fund.   Guitars are mostly used (called vintage because it sounds more valuable lol), but no Jackson, ESP, Ibanez, etc.  What they do have is very nice but WAY OVERPRICED. Amps, staff, and iso booths are 5 stars.  Selection and value of guitars is zero.  If you are a working guitar player that realizes that price does NOT equal quality, that an expensive guitar does not equate into being a good guitar player, avoid this place unless you want an amp.  If you are the type that spends your time on blogs debating the difference between a 1955 or 1956 while your actual guitar gathers dust and your skills diminish, this is the place for you.  This place is the Starbucks of guitar shops. All dressed up, fancy names, but in the end, its just a cup of coffee.

1.description: Well there is no place in the world like this! If you play guitar, or bass and you want to look at a lot of dream machines that you will never be able to afford to drive this is your one stop shop! I love guitars, I love looking at them, I love playing them, hell I love playing air guitar! Air guitars are about the only thing you can't buy here! You can get Fenders, Ric's, Gibson's, Gretch's all of them! They are all in pristine condition and priced accordingly! They have a great fix it shop as well, so if you already have an axe you can bring it in to get worked on. I Love the vintage basses for sale, they have weird hollow bodies I have never seen anywhere! Great amp selection, cool drum shop.. it's all here! I was super stoked the first time I went here cause I knew some of the Wilco movie interviews with Jay Bennett were filmed here! In other words this place is historic, it's the place I first saw a Mutron Bi-phase guitar pedal. I love this place it blows my mind still!

9.description: CME has a large stock of very valuable and expensive gear, but oddly enough they let you handle most of it (and some of the rarer stuff with permission). This has always been my go-to place when trying out new gear, pedals, and the like. The staff are also respectful and friendly, and you can ask them questions without being harassed for a sale (unlike Guitar Center) and without them judging you. Good for beginners and experts alike.They have also expanded by adding a drum shop next door and moving basses downstairs to their own dedicated space.

40.description: Rob, Matt, and Ryan are excellent guys and very helpful with their advice. Also very friendly, approachable. If you're trying to achieve a specific sound, they'll find you a way to get it. My personal favorite drum shop. Period.

25.description: Just wanted to mention that I had a great experience working with Alex. I traded some old gear in for a new rig and found that he was very knowledgable and patient. I felt I got a very fair price for what I was trading in and in no time was walking out with new toys! Most of the staff appear easy to work with and know their stuff!

12.description: I came in to try out a pedal I had been thinking about and ended up walking out with a different one I had been looking for, and for much less than I was expected to spend.  I dealt with Brian, who provided nothing short of amazing customer service.  I finally got there an hour before closing and all the demo rooms were taken, so he grabbed an amp and set me up in the room where they film all of their demos - awesome!  He even grabbed another pedal he recommended so I could try that out.  I've bought here before and have had great experiences.  This is no exception.

59.description: If you like real vintage guitars, basses and drum kits-this is your place to go. If you like good service-this is your place to go. Guitar Center fails in comparison.

21.description: There is no doubt that this is the most amazing guitar store out there!!  Their selection is incredible.  I found it to be a players store and even though it was busy, I was able to try out all the guitars I had my eye on while there.Walked out with a new Gretsch Silver Falcon  and Brian was a huge help with shipping it back home.

17.description: My first time at CME for a guitar repair and they exceeded my expectations with friendly and fast service. Very welcoming atmosphere - I'll be back. Thanks!

10.description: Despite the great selection of guitars, it's hard for me to justify giving them a good review because of the staff. I brought in a guitar to sell to them, and they offered $1700. Instead of taking the offer, a guitar they already had caught my eye that was priced at $1500. I offered to trade for it plus $100 store credit (a $100 loss to me). The guy refused... Giving me a nonsense runaround explanation like he thought I had a single digit IQ, so I left and will not return. What a waste of time. There was no logical excuse for his behavior.

5.description: Amazing music store. The guitar selection is beautiful. Looking for a new instrument? You should stop here!

35.description: This is by far the best music store I've ever dealt with before. I've never actually been to the store but their online store is amazing and so is their customer service. I bought a pretty expensive Gretsch from them and it had a couple of small scratches on the headstock and they personally emailed me with pictures to see if I still wanted it and offered me a small discount. A small detail like that would be glanced right over at any other music store but not here. I still took it and the guitar is perfect.

19.description: Drew was the best!! I felt right at home as he helped me choose my first guitar, a Taylor 114e, to use and reacquaint myself for my planned lessons at Chicago School of Music with Richard. By the way, it was my instructor Richard who recommended this place to me. So, a referral from a musician/music instructor carries lots of credibility in my book.Needless to say, I was not disappointed. Drew and the rest of the staff worked as a team made up of friends - the opposite of what you might expect at a big container store made up of text crazy strangers with very different lives. In contrast, this place was made up of a "critical mass" of musicians, where all of the computers were Mac's and most staff were dressed in tattoos and tripster jeans - which I thought was very individualistic and cool! I could feel the passion and harmony within this temple and, of course, couldn't help but admire all of their fine heirlooms. The guitar room was my focus which felt like a bank vault stocked with precious valuables with shiny lacquered bodies (guitars of course) and a place of worship simultaneously. Let me not forget a man, part of this congregation, I noticed sitting in the middle with his sunglasses on and playing Blues with his soul like a professional musician. Yes, this is a place where professional musicians spend their days off and music aficionados from abroad (i.e. Italy) show up out of the blue in awe. As a novice, my dad was a bass player in a band while I was growing up, and I remember all of the times he and his band members would gather around a fire and jam to Long Train Runnin' (Without Love) by the Doobie Brothers and songs by Santana along with a faint smell of oregano in the air lol.Be sure to ask for Drew!! I found a couple of guitars that he was kind enough to demonstrate the performance with one of his own songs. Wow! And, again, this was done because Drew has a passion for music and wanted to share that with my gf and I. Thanks Drew!! Oh, and Drew can play, play, play guitar well. His playing was inspirational as he passed me the model and I carefully placed my fingers to slowly strike a C chord lol. Well, gotta start somewhere so I might as well start at the beginning with a great sounding guitar with a great resource like CME to back me up in a time of need. Thanks Drew and CME!! Maybe someday soon I will be able to play Spanish guitar like Jesse Cook's Havana. Check it out!!

28.description: So a lot of the reviews might be about buying experience at Chicago Music Exchange, so I will give you a small run down of what the experience is like when you sell your musical equipment to these guys.I had a 78 Les Paul Custom that I wanted to get rid of, so after posting it on Craigslist a few times and being unsuccessful, I tried a different online site called reverb.com.  About a day after I posted my guitar on reverb.com, I got an offer from Chicago Music Exchange.  Ironically, I bought this same exact guitar at Chicago Music Exchange about 12 years ago.  Fittingly, if I were to accept the offer, the guitar would be going "back home" so to speak.After going back and forth with a few reasonable counter offers, the deal was sealed and told them i was going to drop off my guitar at their shop and that I'd like to pickup a check instead of getting payment thru Paypal, to avoid their fees.  The minute I walked in, the check was ready.  They went thru my instrument very quickly and the transaction was done!

3.description: There's everything to love about this store. Aside from the fact that they always carry the specialty boutique guitar strings my hubby looks for when we come here, this place just keeps getting more and more amazing. Our Friday night excursion to the city (the one that included the Dave Grohl donut scenario from across the street at Dinkel's bakery*) was made extra special when we brought our kiddos in here and no one gave us a hard time about it. With the thousands of dollars worth of merchandise all over the floors and walls, we got lost in all things musical and amazing: Amps in all shapes and sizes, custom guitars, used and new guitar pedals, square guitars, pointy guitars, pink guitars, rehearsal rooms, and the new drum shop next store. Did I mention they carry the most exquisite collection of James Trussart guitars? What's not to love? If you ever want to get your kiddos excited about playing guitar or drums, this is the place to go. Run, don't walk!*yelp.com/biz/dinkels-bak…

33.description: I recently dealt with Chicago Music Exchange for the first time and had the best experience ever with a music store and specifically the salesperson, George C.  I live in Los Angeles and have been obsessively looking for a particular Gibson Acoustic.  I was uneasy buying something sight unseen.  George was very patient and accommodating and did everything he could to make sure I was confident and satisfied with my trade in and purchase. This is where I will shop from now on before going anywhere else.

43.description: Wow! This has to be the #1 vendor of guitar inventory! Mine was an internet transaction.  Very professional communication and transaction.  Excellent shipping and proper packing : I received my guitar in pristine mint condition as advertised. In addition, they did a setup on the guitar--100% perfect, AND they had a VERY EXTENSIVE checklist...which would rival that of a new car!!!!! Who does that? Kudos to Chicago Music Exchange!

2.description: CME was a very cool music store and I had to check it out on my trip to Chicago. They have a huge inventory that's probably in the multi-million dollar range. If you're more of a traditional jazz or blues guy, CME is the store for you. I'm into hard rock/ classic metal and I thought CME missed the mark for that style of music and gear. They had very few high gain amps and shred guitars. It was cool to look at all the vintage pieces though. While it wasn't the store for me to purchase gear, if you're more of a traditional player, it might be good for you. Cool store bro.

45.description: This place is amazing!I had a great sales experience with Matt K at the Chicago Music Exchange and will definitely be back.  Being a beginner I especially appreciate the 'no pressure sales' and extra time that was taken to explain some of the basics  and overall just to make me feel comfortable.  The individual practice rooms are just out of control, many amps to plug into in each room.  And most of all, just being patient (for 2 1/2 hours) while I figured out what it was that I wanted to take home to NY - thanks for this Matt.  Between this and all of the follow up attention that was put into ensuring I knew where my guitar was every step of the way until it reached my house was exemplary!  I actually use my customer service experience at CME with my team at work as an example of 'the right thing to do' if your goal is a happy customer and repeat business.  I will definitely visit again next time in Chicago.

18.description: My favorite Chicago guitar shop, you'll feel dirty walking into guitar center ever again.  Great selection and very good service.  I bought 2 guitars.

41.description: I am traveling the world for my job. CME is the best music instruments store I have ever visit. The selection of vintage guitars and the staff are amazing. Now you come to CME to buy the guitar of your dream (sure they have it) not for get cheap deal.

52.description: This place is really good for a certain segment/slice of the guitar player population.  D13, Two Rock, Orange are the tops on the amp front... not bad.  Guitars are standard Fender, Gibson, etc but a huge selection.Unfortunately, this isn't really my scene.  The high gain player just doesn't have much to choose from here.  Channel switchers are sparse, and sometimes that old Marshall just doesn't cut it.  My hope is that some of the high end boutique amps could get to Chicago some how.  I'm talking Fryette, Diezel, etc.  I know Komet may be hard to find also, but that would be an amazing addition. Couple that with exorbitant prices, even for Chicago, and you're sort of left wondering...This place just seems and feels too sterile to be a guitar shop.  I'll get strings, etc from here, but any real purchases would be done elsewhere.  This just ain't the place.

50.description: Located in a nice part of town, Chicago Music Exchange has a huge inventory of guitars.  I was impressed by their Fender, Rickenbacker and Gibson inventory, and they even had some lesser known stuff like Bill Nash's relics, Trussarts and Fanos.The store is laid out really well and it's relatively easy to pull a guitar down off the walls and sit on a couch and play em.  There are also amp rooms to demo guitars in.The staff is very nice and chill.  Big plus that the store is very close to the Brown Line.

4.description: First off, umm wow?!So many great, fantabulous pieces in this fantastic place.We walked in on the side with the drums and cymbals. Pretty cool but my stomach dropped when we walked into the guitar showroom. Holy friggin' buckets. I have obscure taste in guitars (Harmony, Höfner,.. Ok that's really it) and there were a few Höfner guitars which was pretty amazing. Only one Rocket and they never have one like mine but it was still a pretty nice alternative. I also kind of fell in love with this lefty baritone Eastwood. Like I said, I like the weirdos in the guitar world and this is one of them. I'm wanting to be ambidextrous when it comes to guitar, I strive for the best.There are rooms set up with about 15 amps to play in (I saw 4 rooms) and you borrow a cord and can test out some sweet gear.The staff put up with my weird questions and entertained my talk about Harmony and wanting to be ambidextrous on guitar. It was great! I left wanting to go back and just browse for hours again. Someday, Chicago Music Exchange, I will return to your store. Prepare your drool rags for us now.

6.description: Great choice of high end gear. Very nice store with isolated rooms for playing but overpriced from two to three times. Thou if just what to visit a nice exhibition of top guitars then it's the place but if you want to buy then look somewhere else.

55.description: Probably one of the coolest music shops I've stepped foot in...EVER...Awesome selection, cool atmosphere and the staff unbelievably professional and laid back. Went here to get my first guitar after shopping around at the obvious chain and a few smaller independents. This place truly blows the competition out of the water.  For a first timer, the trusting staff placed beautiful (and pricey) guitars in my hands without hesitation...even taught me a few chords.  Gotta hand it to Alex C. for hooking it up with a gorgeous Martin (at a price that even GC didn't offer) he was extremely friendly and knowledgeable and made what would seem a hard decision a piece of cake.  Gotta say this place is truly jaw dropping the first time you walk in.  Highly recommend...even if you aren't a musician go check it out! Can't wait to head back there.

15.description: I was heading up to Chicago for various reasons, and I was looking to sell/trade a few guitars I had. I emailed them ahead of time and had it somewhat worked out. I probably could have made more money by selling them on Craigslist or ebay, but I honestly tried for a long time, and I had no buyers. So after some thought, these guys were willing to step up and make the trade for an item I wanted, so I went for it. So when I arrived they checked out the items I brought and all was well. It took awhile because it was on Saturday and they were busy. I got my paper work and they shipped me the item (It was out of stock everywhere). They also shipped me a gig bag for free. Zero money was exchanged. I was very happy with the deal, I initially felt like I could be getting ripped off, but no one was making me do the deal. I could have said no, and again I tried to sell the items but they were just not selling. So I felt I got a good deal, because I wanted the item, and they made it happen. The next time you want something there, try doing a trade? They maybe able to help you. Also, just a word on the store. WOW. I mean WOW. You do not see collections like this anywhere. It is really unbelievable and overwhelming. Everyone I dealt with or spoke to was nice and polite. I didn't like how you would have to go in a little room to plug in the electrics to play them, but I get it. If you are a fan of music and guitars, go to this place, it is like a dream come true!

57.description: Chicago Music Exchange is without a doubt the most amazing music shop I've ever visited. As the wife of someone who has been playing guitar for well over a decade, I sometimes find myself tagging along at different shops to buy picks, cables, amps, and whatnot. Plus, music equipment is always a great gift idea for J. There are places I have liked (e.g. Sweetwater, but that is in Indiana), and places where I would rather sit in the car and wait. CME is like a dream. It is so spacious and well laid out. SO SPACIOUS. The repairs are downstairs, there is a separate place for drums, rooms for bass and acoustic guitars, and little tiny individuals rooms where you can plug in and do some wailing and not annoy everyone else. The staff don't check on you every single minute, but you know where to find them should you need assistance. Most importantly, there is comfortable seating scattered all over the place - we're talking cloth and leather seats and couches. This is fantastic. I am not a teen anymore, and would rather sit down and scan my Instagram feed, instead of fawning over anyone who can strum a few John Mayer or "Hey There Delilah" chords. The axes (throwing a little guitar lingo in here - who am I?!) are beautifully displayed. I actually walked around for quite some time to look at them - the vintage ones are my favorite. I also love the display of amps. Highly recommend for musicians and their significant others.

20.description: have lived in cleveland and miami.  nothing in either city comes close to the variety of instruments available at CME. and the service is outstanding too. i had the pleasure of being helped by Dan. he provided just the right balance of expertise while not making me feel uncomfortable.

36.description: I have been here 5-10 times (but probably closer to 5). Every time, I went to the Starbucks next door and two times I used that Starbucks bathroom without buying anything. Once I walked by at night (really deep in conversation about Neko Case for two people who never listened to Neko Case) and waved to the empty store. At this point I feel I transcended from "customer" to "maybe worst customer ever" and I'm here as a form of penance.May 2013, I turned into two windows before walking into the actual entrance. I'd sincerely like to know if anyone else has done this. It is a very big store. I was with a boy who let me join his band, which I found on craigslist, even though I had no experience playing bass or being in a band. I asked a guy where the basses were - at that point they were not in the "bassment," a concept I found clever - and he brought us to a back room where, he explained, he was filming a music video though he seemed very confused about it. He handed me a thing & I didn't know what to do so I said "maybe something much less expensive" and he took back the thing & said something about how "this one's made in Mexico" which seemed super seedy to me but my friend nodded & I took the bass and said "thanks" & plugged it in but still lost so I stalled until he'd run through 12 iterations of "can I help you with literally anything else" and left & I played a self conscious version of "Tiger Lamp," the only song I remembered for the band I was suddenly a part of. My friend played every Joy Division song he knew while the confused guy popped in habitually as if we were hospital patients, and I self-consciously felt like a hospital patient. He said I could have a black guitar or a sunburst guitar, and my friend said I wanted the sunburst, but I wanted the black one very badly and when they put it in a box, I carried it all the way home and this was a metaphor for our relationship. We walked for three hours trying to find the zoo and it started raining. We ended up kissing but that was the only time. I do not recommend kissing a bandmate, especially if it's just because you're confused about your feelings for your ex-boyfriend. That is not to say I don't condone following your heart, though. I condone following your heart.September 2013, I was dropping off my Orange Crush after it started making noises like it had a cold. The guy with the ponytail downstairs said he could not fix it because the individual parts were cheaply made in China. My mouth became dry until he continued, his back to me as he walked into the dark part of the repair room, "so I'll just grab you a new one." And he said I'd wait upstairs, where a guy was playing the same Joy Division songs from May & I took a picture, and they carried the new amp to my mom's car, and Chloe said "Caitlin did you know there is actual dirt on your back seat," and we listened to a mix CD from 2011 that had a Led Zeppelin song on it that Scott Cortez later made fun of in the dirty back seat.February 2014, the amp was having problems again. It is gray outside when the sun is even out and I'm sleeping only in three-hour intervals - I don't look forward to practice until I get there and I'm daunted by everything on the internet. I wanted to forget my Orange Crush, buying something else on craigslist, but I thought maybe I would just take the dead amp carcass back to the practice space to deteriorate. The ponytail guy was working and said, Caitlin, right? With the Orange Crush. This happened a lot. Caitlin, right? I talked to you on the phone. Caitlin, right? I'm the sales manager. I feel this was bad news and I was probably being talked about snidely. Ponytail guy said he'd get Alex, and a guy near the dark part of the repair room started playing a Mark Kozelek-ish song & making forceful eye contact with me while another guy off to the side shifted his glances between the two of us. I watched upstairs as Alex & other employees, including several managers, including a guy in a deep V who repeatedly asked me if I was okay, seemed to orbit in an augmented pace around the store looking for my amp. "I can just come back..." But the manager gave me this look like he was about to cry and said he would "hate for that to happen," in a way that seemed non-negotiable. Just wait 5 minutes, just give me 5 minutes, here's what we're gonna do, he told me. We're gonna give you the 50 watt, it's about the same speaker size... is that okay with you? And we're going to get you a nice t-shirt for your troubles. I plugged a Mustang into the (much larger and much nicer) Orange Crush in the bassment as my hands shook fiercely like the day after I bought my own Mustang when I learned all about following your heart and rounded out all nine of those months by playing "Tiger Lamp" as confidently as I had ever done a thing in my life. Later, with a CME t-shirt peaking out of my backpack slung over the new amp on the westbound 77, I told Chloe, "I guess I should have taken a cab."

14.description: This is the Mecca of guitar shops in Chicagoland area.I love this place.  I wish I could live within it's walls.  I would behave and they wouldn't even know I was there.  I promise.Seriously though, this place is amazing.  One thing I noticed is that every guitar I picked up (and I picked up tons) were in tune and very playable.They have a lot of vintage instruments here, but just as many brand new.You can really try out every guitar before you choose.Their Acoustic room is set up very customer friendly and I could hang out in there for a full day.I didn't check out the basement where I think they have the bass's and drums.  Because I spent like 4 hours in awe of every guitar and I was actually tired when I left here from the exhaustion of being a kid in a candy store.I will be back, and would love to buy my next guitar here.

1.description: This place is packed (literally) with great religious gifts in all price ranges.  I have found baptism gifts, first communion gifts for my nieces, and we were just there yesterday for my 9yo to find a first communion gift for a friend. Always many choices.  Very reasonably priced. Some beautiful prayer cards.

0.description: How has no one ever reviewed this store?!?!  I moved to Portage Park with my ma in 2003 and this store has been there since then at least. It is owned/run by the nicest man ever and this store has been around for the longest time. Great HUGE variety of rosaries, jewelry, prayer books, prayer cards, figurines, greeting cards, Holy Communion stuff, Confirmation stuff, candles, you name it, they have it. The ONLY store of its kind around that I can think of. Great prices too. I bought: a new scapula with prayer card, a new beautiful crystal and gold rosary for my ma, rosary pouch, prayer book for my ma, visor clip of St. Christopher for my step daughter, and a St. Anne sterling sliver pendant. All for $82 and some change. Not bad at all. Owner even offered and wrapped up my ma's rosary so beautifully. He was even chatting it up with the USPS mailman, what does THAT say about this great owner?!?! Stop in once, and you will be in love!

29.description: I love the chicken dinner and salads nicely priced, go there to eat as often as i could!!

42.description: I do love their Greek Salad with chicken breast and the house dressing.It's my "tried and true" item that I order almost every time I come here.It's very large, with a nice size chicken breast, two Dolmades (stuffed grape leaves) good feta cheese, and a yummy warm slice of pita.All for under $7.00!!Can't beat that!!Is it fancy? No.Is it a neighborhood burger/gyros joint? Yes.Never tried their burgers (but based other reviews, I probably won't)Good fries, good Greek Potatoes, decent Gyros.Plain and simple.

23.description: I've only ate Gyro's from here and there not dat bad but there not that good. There fries are plain with no taste or salt. Just in general its not the best Gyro point blank. I wish my Gyro sauce wasn't so watery and more creamy.

47.description: We usually stop in here after spending some time at Merrimac Park with the little one. I love the greek salad, it's not the best lettuce ever, but it is green and fresh. Plus they give you dolmades and lots of feta and kalamata olives. The salad is huge, and I love the dressing, its just the oil and vinegar greek style, but it's really tangy. They also give you a warm piece of pita w/your salad. My hubby got the chicken dinner, which he liked alot and he was stuffed because they gave him a side salad, rice and greek potatoes - oh ya and a piece of garlic bread.My daughter just eats a hot dog, but it's the first thing she's eaten in it's entirety in 2 days. Sans bun thank you.I've had the gyros and stuff here as well, and it's good I just don't like burping up gyro for the rest of the evening. Yuck!Good for the money, but not the best baklava I've ever had.

8.description: This is your typical gyro and dog stand. The food is about as good as one would expect, but it just takes so freakin' long to get. I don't understand why it takes 15min to get a gyro sandwich, italian beef or hot dog and fries. Maybe give them 5min to deep fry some potatoes, but the rest of it, you're just shaving beef or picking it up with tongs and throwing it on a bun.  I don't care about the demographic of the people working the counter, or the decor of the place, as others have stated. I just like to get my food within a reasonable time, and it just doesn't happen here. There's plenty of other places in the neighborhood turning out the same food and at a quicker pace.

31.description: Not the best food I've ever had, but decent.  Just mediocre. It's a typical greek/gyro place with the usual selections.  The place is old and a little run down and desperately needs a good cleaning and a makeover.  Also, expect to wait at least 10-15 minutes for a gyro to go even when there are no other customers in the place.  Typical teenagers working the counter. This is the kind of place you stop in when you are starving and can't wait any longer.  It's not the "OMG you HAVE to eat there" type of joint like Nick's at Harlem and Touhy! They do have really good fries though...

34.description: So I should have looked this up on Yelp before I strolled in.  I was hungry, in the car and thinking about taking care of the local guy and not Burger King.  So I ordered a chicken leg quarter dinner and grabbed a seat to wait.  I figured, since this is the "Famous Chicken" that it's gonna be good and fast.  Two strikes.  About 15 minutes later, my number is called.  Chicken was dry and seemed like it had been made about 2 days earlier and sat under the heat for a while.  Rice AND potatoes.... what is this, starch-fest.  I hate wasting money, so I soldiered through it wishing I'd saved my hunger for dinner tonight instead.

16.description: I've been eating there for over eight years and it's a winner every time. I used to live on Narragansett so this was always the place to go when no one felt like cooking; even after moving out to the burbs, my family and I would make a trip here because we love the food so much.My favorite dishes of theirs has to be the Gyros Plate and the Chicken Dinner and the portions are perfect. They have some of the best gyros I've ever tasted: good flavor and it comes with some really good gyros sauce. The chicken is on par as well: very good flavor and the box feeds two (or even three) easily. The sides are really tasty too--I highly recommend their oven roasted potatoes: they are extremely good!! They also offer cheeseburgers and hot dogs; they're not the main attraction, however they're good for those picky eaters (I recommend their cheese dog).The ambiance is nice: well for others it may seem outdated and boring, but I'm just being nostalgic.But overall their food is great and I fall in love every time!

13.description: I'm so tired of their nasty attitudes and forgetting food in my order. The only one who has been nice to me is the blonde greek lady at the counter. The rest of the employees are pathetic and pitiful. I stopped coming to this dump.

11.description: We've eaten here quite a bit and never had a problem.Clean, good size menu of American & Greek fast food. Lot's of room to sit. Tv's always have whatever games are on. Reasonable prices. Tastes the way it should. Great large portion sizes. Especially like the steak dinner plate and their Greek potatoes. Their Spinach pie is one of the better ones around as well.

39.description: I have been coming to Mr. Zee's for some 15 years, if not more.  The food is always good and I especially love their sirloin steak sandwich, fries and a side of BBQ sauce.The service is good and the place is comfortable to eat at.  I just wish they would sometimes tune the TV to something other than CNN.If you're in the area and are looking for what I call "home-made fast food" then this is your place.

37.description: I worked across the street at TCF Bank for 2 years and went to Mr.Zees at least twice a week for lunch. I love their chicken breast dinner plate with rice garlic bread and salad awesome. I live in miles now and still drive to this Mr. Zees at least once every other week for that chicken breast dinner, my best friend lives in oak forest and when comes up north always wants to eat here... He has the burger and grilled chicken breast sandwich on French bread... Their staff is really nice been there for years... A great family owned fast food restaurant... I recommend it to everyone...Only negatives is that it is bit pricey for a fast food joint, can't hear the TV in the sitting area, and not open late hours...

0.description: BEST GREEK SALAD EVER. All their food is really good but their dressing is delicious and the chicken (which I have added to my salad) is always cooked to order. Love this place

38.description: Moved to this area less than a year ago. We picked up from there & we really liked their food. I had the Chicken breast sandwich that came with a side salad, potatoes, & rice. It was great! My husband had the Greek style chicken with the same sides & I will have to get it next time...very good! Only downside is that they don't take any cards....but do have a ATM. Thumbs up!

27.description: I live in the neighborhood and have been going here since I was a kid with the family. The prices are good and the portions are huge! Any chicken dinner here is superb and they come with greek rice and potatoes (my faves!) The gyros here is also great and the fries are just the way I like em; thick cut and just the right mushyness!

32.description: Mr. Zee's has been a part of my life for almost as long as I can remember. It's about 5 minutes away from my Grandma's house, so whenever we go to visit her we always make it a point to stop in.I have tried a majority of the menu-Gyros, Chicken, Skirt Steak, Burgers, Italian Beef, Salad, Fries, Potatoes, and I can honestly say that I love everything! Their portions are also extremely generous for their prices, and they could easily be shared between two people, or you could take home some leftovers! I also love the fact that every time I go here, I always see a handful of CPD officers come in to have dinner. You know it has to be good if cops love it.The only downside of it was that it was cash only for the longest time, which was a little inconvenient for many new-comers. However, the last time I went, they started accepting credit cards, so definitely much better.I also have a theory that all great restaurants are somehow related to the Greeks, and Mr. Zee's is definitely no exception! Go here if you want some great food at great prices, because really, that's what Chicago is all about.

48.description: Huge,gigantic portions!The food itself is not spectacular, but if you need a lot of food,this place will fill your belly.Lots of families and cops,so you know the food is a good value!A little carb heavy for me. Do ya really need rice AND fries AND bread???Good chicken(my husband ate it,not me) and ribs(again,going by my husband's word). I had the fried fish,not worth it-it was overcooked!

44.description: I felt like a burger and opted not to go to the Burger King across the street. Sometimes, those little grease joints are the best spots to frequent. BUT... Mr. Zee's disappointed.I asked the girl if the burgers are decent and she said, "Sure" -- I shoulda taken the cue. I then asked what she liked, and she said the gyros. I got the burger combo, which was pretty inexpensive.When I got home, the patty was looked like a White Castle knockoff. The french fries tasted like microwaved potato sticks. Disappointing, I can't even go further.:(

24.description: Another place in the hood that has a lot on the menu. Food is good and there gyro is very good. Sometimes busy sometimes not the flow is pretty solid most of the time. There's always parking that makes it convenient. All in all good neighborhood place ill stop in when I get a gyro itch.

7.description: The last two times I was here the gyros was way over cooked and I had to return it. They cut the meat to order then destroy it on the grill    It is close to my house but I will not visit here again

49.description: They have a pretty large menu for what looks like a hot dog stand. Salads, gyros, chicken, beef sandwiches etc... It's very clean and their service and food is high quality. There is an outside patio for summertime use. You may want to stop here before shopping at Jewel across the street. You know what they say, don't shop hungry.

40.description: Phone ahead for faster carry out service is right. Greek chicken or similar entrees take time to prepare. Just because you call ahead doesn't mean you can't dine in.My frequent item of choice is the Grilled Chicken Breast Dinner. Served with rice pilaf, oven baked potatoes, garlic bread and your choice of salad or coleslaw ($7.55). Other favorites are the  Mr. Zee's Special Char-Broiled Chicken special ($6.75). Both entrees take about 10 minutes to prepare but if you are hungry it feels like 10 hours. As stated earlier...call ahead its so worth it.They do not take credit cards, cash only. Prices may seem to appear high once they total your food order bill but I think that's just the high chicago tax kicking in.

30.description: Best chicken dinner ever!! I always get the grilled chicken breast dinner which comes with rice, potatoes, pita bread and a salad. Their salads are so good too and it is just a regular side salad, nothing fancy. Everything always tastes so fresh. Mr. Zee's appears to be fast food but when you are dining in, everything is served on regular plates and you get actual silverware. The restaurant is also super clean. Parking can be a pain but that is expected in small strips in the city.

46.description: I really like their Gyro's, but can't stand the chicken. Their Greek Salad is pretty good and as mentioned before, the olives and feta are welcomed. The portions are quite large and I never feel sick after eating here. We come here before going to Jewel across the way.

1.description: The first time I came across the restaurant I wasn't sure what to think. So I decided to try them one time for lunch not knowing what to expect. I had the double cheese burger with small fries. What I didn't expect was a 12 monte wait time, but it was worth it. My burger was hot and fresh. My French Fries were the same. I devoured the burger in less than 10 minutes. I enjoyed every bite of it. The combo came at a price of $8.00. Now on lunch breaks when I do not want my homemade lunch or cannot microwave my food; or I am in the mood for a quick burger to eat, I always think of Mr. Zee's.  The other day I went in for lunch and thought is to something new instead of the double cheeseburger. I tried their Gyro Dinner. Big disappointment. My food was warm and my cheese on my gyro wasn't even melted. Never again.

9.description: Came here as a last resort to try one of their Italian beef sandwiches. The meat smelled spoiled and the taste of it was horrible. I couldn't take a second bite. The sandwich was dry and bread was stale. I ordered water and it took the cashier a 3rd reminder to only to be given a tiny cup. The chicken wasn't so bad but for the money I spent, I could have gone to a better place. Lesson learned, I will not be coming back

26.description: The gyro here is very good. I used to come here all the time when i was younger. My complaint would have to be that the fries were soggy. And also the staff didn't seem too thrilled about my business.

25.description: Cheeseburgers are pretty good, hot dogs are ok.. I think the best plate to try is the chicken dinner... Their Greek rice is pretty good...and so are their dinners!!! It's always pretty clean.. Which is a always a plus side.

12.description: Terrible customer service and forgetting items in my order.  Never again will I go there.

21.description: In all fairness I felt I had to post an update to my former scathing review. All of the rude employees I had bad experiences with no longer work there & I've had nothing but great service since then :)  I don't know the names of the young ladies who are always there now but they're awesome & I'm happy to be able to get a tasty burger and fries at a great price minus the attitude.

17.description: This place has some really good chicken when it's fresh!.. I come to eat here often and it's always good.  The wait can be a pain in the ass sometimes!! but It's always worth it. The staff is alright they are a bit young and not very personable from time to time but I guess what Teenager would be working at a fast food place?.I recommend if you are in the are to give them a try! They have a really good Chicken breast plate with greek potatoes that are too die for!!

10.description: This establishment has two locations: Montrose and Central, also at Narragansett and Irving. This is well made food, for the average person and family to eat and bring the kids. For about $7.00 per person, one can get enough food for two days. The portions are enormous. Many people with young children will order nothing for the kids and let them eat off their plates.Some highlights are Greek chicken, any of the kebabs, Italian Beef sandwiches, Chicago style hot dogs, salads with a whole chicken breast and a decent Italian dressing. The menu is huge and after ordering at the counter, all food is cooked to order.The store at Montrose and Central has better tasting food. I am guessing they have a better grill cook. The food at Narragansett and Irving tastes plainer and certainly less seasoned.This is good quality budget food and / or a place to grab a quick hot sandwich, when you are in a hurry. Tonight, the wife, grandson and myself ordered $25 worth of food and we ate well. We have enough left over for lunch tomorrow, bringing the cost per person per meal to $3.50. Not bad these days.

5.description: I phoned in an order and the lady could not understand what I wanted to order. Before I could finish my order , she hung up on me. This place has been decent in the past but not anymore. I ordered a steak sandwich which usually cost about 8 dollars. This time I was charged 17 dollars and I complained to the manager but that's the price he said. Bad attitude , bad customer service and the sandwich was burnt. I'll never come here again

3.description: Quick and easy American and Greek fast food. Usually stop by here when I'm craving a gyro and don't want to travel the distance. The meat is nicely seasoned and the fries are crispy. I have tried other stuff on the menu like their salads and sandwiches but to be honest all of their food is just decent. Nothing really stands out and makes it memorable and having to go back. Ambience is ok. Interior is dark and kind of dated. When I went there were a bunch of dirty dishes on the tables.

35.description: This is a great little neighborhood spot for gyros and chicken. The gyros are pretty perfect and the chicken is wonderfully seasoned, tender and juicy. Yes, you will have to wait for your order. They aren't really slow, they just make everything to order. I've always found the staff to be friendly. I prefer my fries to be a thicker cut as those thin cut fries get cold too quickly, but I know many folks like the thin cut fries.This is a solid neighborhood place where you can get a great gyros sandwich at a reasonable price.

19.description: Let's see.  Hot dog on a soggy bun.  Watered down cheese fries. Watered down soup of the day.  Nasty coffee with curdling creamer.  Tasteless tuna.  The 1 star goes to the young lady at the front desk she was nice.  But the owners apparently were crotchety only giving 2napkins.

28.description: This place has some really good chicken when it's fresh!.. I come to eat here often and it's always good.  The wait can be a pain in the ass sometimes!! but It's always worth it. The staff is alright they are a bit young and not very personable from time to time but I guess what Teenager would be working at a fast food place?.I recommend if you are in the are to give them a try! They have a really good Chicken breast plate with greek potatoes that are too die for!!

45.description: One word describes this place.  Nasty!I live a few blocks away from this place and I was never impressed but sometimes you say to hell with it and you go and grab something nearby.  I ordered a chicken dinner (their supposed famous chicken) and it was swimming in sauce.  As a person whose parents were in the restaurant business and grew up in that business, we had a motto "If it doesn't taste right, throw some more sauce on there to cover it up".  So from past experiences, I decided my garbage can will enjoy this meal more than I ever could.   Also, can anyone tell me why it takes 20 minutes for a polish sausage?  Every fast food joint I've been to has always prepared a polish in under 5 minutes.  Zee's can be empty with no line and it still takes 20 damn minutes for a Polish!  I mean come on!   Is it because of bad or absentee management?  Poor employees?  That's not my problem, I simply want good food served fast.  For Mr. Zee's to ever see repeat business from me, I need to see a different staff there because their current staff, management are not up to my standards.

33.description: Moist and flavorful Greek chicken. A fairly decent cheeseburger. Utterly indifferent service. I'd get the chicken to go if I am in the area, but I doubt I would eat there. Aside from the blah service, the interior is drab and kind of depressing. On the other hand, there is that chicken.....

43.description: I'm not sure why some people don't like this place, because my fiance and I love it. I mean it is what it is- a gyro/chicken joint that has food really cheap and pretty damn fast for the quality. I've been there several times and never have I been disappointed with what I got.Patty melt with fries- 3.45!!! 1/4lb cheeseburger - 2.45!!Then you have things like the Chicken Dinner which is enough food for today and tomorrow for just over 6 bucks.And of course the Gyro is soooo good... and obviously a complete heartattack :) Don't eat them too often. But seriously, if you like little places with some heart check out Mr. Zee's -- good food-- REALLY cheap.They are a CASH only place. Not sure why someone posted that they take credit cards.. however they do have an ATM machine inside.

2.description: Please get the half chicken plate.  Its a huge delicious meal for 8 bucks with great Greek flavors.The food feels like home-cooking; Its tasty but not fried or greasy.  The rice is a lemon orzo that is so moist and yummy.  The potatoes also have a slight lemon flavor and they are so tender. The shining star is all the chicken you will get that is NOT dry and seasoned so well.  Also a side of coleslaw or soup and garlic bread.  You can't beat that.

18.description: Food it aweful! My fiance ordered pork kebab and they're very small pork in 3 sticks!! And I ordered skir steak and they're like chewinh gum! I had my food exchange with my fiance. I will never come back here again. Anoter mexican restaurant disappointment again!!

41.description: So no matter what you get I guess you should be prepared to wait. I ordered a Greek salad and my boyfriend got a cheeseburger and fries....the wait for that was still kind of long.They also forgot to give us the pop that came with the cheeseburger meal. Although the staff is really nice,the operation is kind of scatterbrained and something that needs to be worked on.Now about this Greek salad. I'm not sure it was really a Greek salad. Does Greek salad always have hard chunks of iceberg lettuce? I didn't think so. Stuffed Grape leaf (on the side) Feta and olive oil dressing on the salad were good but as a whole, not so much.

4.description: I would seriously eat that grilled chicken Cesar salad from here everyday if I could. They give really large portions of food for a good price. They recently got new owners and they are 100x nicer and friendlier than the last one.

6.description: I can't say that the gyros are bad, but they don't taste the way I like them too. One thing that makes a good gyros is the sauce. If your sauce is whacko then the gyros is already heading towards a thumbs down.I'm pretty sure that they freeze their sauce because it is watery and runny, and sometimes icy. Tzatziki sauce should be thick, rich, and creamy. It should NOT look like white water with green bits floating around in it.The polish is good, but you have to tell them to deep fry it if you want it that way. I ordered one once and said I wanted it deep fried, the order taker looked miffed and said we ALWAYS deep fry them. Apparently not, since the last two times I'd had them, they were boiled because I forgot to ask.Other than that, they almost never get the orders right. I ordered a plain gyros for someone and it had raw onions and tomato on it. I asked for just grilled onions on mine, and got nothing but sauce. It's the same way with the polishes, they can't seem to get the toppings right if you order more than one of the same thing.

22.description: Food it aweful! My fiance ordered pork kebab and they're very small pork in 3 sticks!! And I ordered skir steak and they're like chewinh gum! I had my food exchange with my fiance. I will never come back here again. Anoter mexican restaurant disappointment again!!

15.description: Food and prices are good but the customer service is bad. The elderly man always seems to have a upset look on his face and when taking my order He made me feel like I was bothering him. I tried the place a few times and same thing. I tried their other location on Central and they must be related bcuz I received the same poor service. When I mentioned that they forgot to give me my soup that comes with the meal that I paid for the girls at the counter started complaining about it in Spanish not knowing I speak Spanish. Won't be giving either location my money anymore.

20.description: Finding a good Gyro joint is essential to happy living. There was a place where I grew up that made Gryo's with the fluffy pita bread and skewer lamb meat with cucumber sauce. I went to a place in Connecticut that looked like your standard Gyro joint but their lamb was chunky and dry. Glad this joint makes it like I like and by Chicago Gyro Standards.

36.description: Ahh, good ole' Mr. Zee's. I just about survived off of this place for almost ten years, when I worked in the mall across Irving Park. It's kind of hard to explain- I loved it, and sometimes, hated it. I'll try to explain. We would almost always order out for lunch back in the day, and there were a few choices: Burger King (eh), McDonald's (no one ever wanted to drive past Wright College to get it), China Chef (ugh), Mr. Ging (talk about sitting in your gut), Subway ($$), ...or, Mr. Zee's. We would more often than not have it delivered to us as it was just a short walk for the guy. The delivery guy used to be a young Mexican kid who would thank us for the payment and tip in such a timid way, that after he left, exaggerated impressions of him ensued every time. Good times. Very often the order would be taken wrong and they would send us the wrong food, but we never complained and ate it anyway. The prices are good, and I would order anything and everything off the menu. The food here has a most distinctive taste to it; Greek oil seems to be in everything. The salads were good, I liked the vinaigrette dressing. My favorites included the hamburgers, the shish kabob plate (beef and chicken), and the hot dogs. again, nothing extraordinary, but food good enough to leave us satisfied and ready to work another four or five (or more) hours. I recently discovered a Mr. Zee's Two in Morton Grove, but it appeared dilapidated, and according to reviews here on Yelp, it's riddled with major problems. So, this review is strictly for the location at Irving Park and Narragannsett.

14.description: Very tasty gyros and they give you plenty of meat, fries are good. Their grilled chicken dinner with the Greek potatoes are really good.

58.description: Great service, friendly folks, great meat. Every time I have been there they have been aces, and their product keeps me coming back. For instance, last time I was there they were out of briskets (the full brisket, not just the flat), so I ordered one for Saturday. It was butchered to my specs - picked it up first thing Saturday, they showed me the meat, and I walked out smiling from ear to ear. That's service, and you couple that with the quality of the meat and you have my fave butcher shop on the northwest side. It's not cheap, but you pay for quality. Love it.

56.description: Oh yeah, every reviewer is right on the money about this place. I personally want to thank Yelp for introducing me to this place.  Their mild sausage was a big hit at a family get together.  Their burgers, which are made of lean chuck, are in the freezer case at around $12 for 10 of them.  They also make their own gardinera (sp?) and barbeque sauce.   Ben, the owner, gives above average customer service that's rare these days.  I highly recommend getting their Barese-Style Sausage which is only made on request.

29.description: Yep. Best around. Great green pepper sausage. 1"+ porch chops were excellent. Thank you yelp!

42.description: I have Italian neighbors, and in the course of a barbecue at their place, I said "Wow, these are great Italian sausages!"  "They're from Joseph's," they told me, and I didn't waste any time finding this place on my next excursion.For those of you who have never experienced a real butcher shop, this place is a must-see.  It's small, but you'll find virtually everything you need there to put together a meal, and all at incredibly low prices.  I got Italian sausages, sopressata, cheese and a loaf of bread, for around twelve bucks and it was some of the best food I've had in a long time.  It's all very fresh, the sausages are made there, and there are no preservatives, so you need to use them within 48 hours of bringing them home, or freeze them.  Everything comes freezer-ready.The butcher who took care of me couldn't have been nicer.  He answered all my questions, explained stuff I didn't even think to ask, and when I was ready to go he actually brought my bag out from behind the counter to hand to me.  Where do you get service like that anymore?This is just another of those hidden gems that I'd love to keep to myself, but I also want them to continue to do well so that they'll be there for a long time.

23.description: Very good 1st experience.  White butcher paper wraps every deli item from cheese to brawts. Ben gave me instruction on perserving meats .. good tips.  Most juicy oven roasted turkey sliced medium.  amazing good sausage and brawts. 3.39 a pound = About 3 hearty links. Got the green pepper sausage and brawts. Ben threw in some spicy style sausage.  had the green pepper and they were perfect!! Seen some baby back ribs for a good price per lb.  and finally had to grab a USDA prime porterhouse. After some research I believe I never had a real USDA prime steak. The marbling on these steaks can't be found at target or jewels ..  Good spot ..friendly service.

47.description: The proprieter of Joseph's Finest Meats is named Ben Camarda.  Ben and his staff make you feel so comfortable that if you are in the area, you feel guilty if you don't stop in and buy some of their superior products.  I bought my Ho-Ka turkey there for Thanksgiving, as well as some rib-eye steaks, and I couldn't have been happier.  Whether you want steaks, pork chops, prime rib, or a stuffed chicken breast, you can't beat the quality.  If you're not sure of the proper way to cook an item, Ben will tell give you some professional advice.  Even their giardianiera is superior!  This place is highly recommended!  I drive all the way up there from Oak Park.

8.description: Ran in again over the weekend to get some beef for curry and some bologna for sandwiches.  It is always interesting to see what others are getting - this time one guy asked for neck bones to make sauce and another was getting 5 pounds of sliced roast beef, most likely for a party.  I also saw the owner of the neighboring Thai restaurant there getting his daily supply of meat - speaks well of his attention to quality and overall support of the neighborhood!

31.description: This place has wonderful customer service and thier home-made sausages are delicious. The prices are very reasonable, I purchased 6 sausages and a pound of sirlion steak for 15 bucks. I wanted the spicy italian sausage and they were out. The butcher offered to make it for me if I was willing to wait 30 minutes, that was really nice! However, I didn't wait because I figured I just try the mild sausage. Plus, he gave me free breakfast sausages. I will definitely return.

34.description: Without a doubt, the finest butcher shop in the area. Plus, they have PRIME BEEF!!!  JFM rocks

16.description: I've been here two times is the past two weeks and I think if I do it for two more weeks, it becomes habit.   Seriously though, I'm just impressed at the quality of meat/poultry that they have here.  The bacon is great and isn't greasy - which they explained is because they don't pump it with water.  Who knew?  And their pork belly was great for my lechon kawali fix.  I think every self-respecting cook should have a butcher and this place is going to be mine.

13.description: This place is truly a gem. I love that it's a family owned business. The quality, service and knowledge is all superb, I'll pay a little more for the best. All hand cut and trimmed to order. DO NOT HESITATE JUST GO!

11.description: So this review is long past due. My BF and I have been going to Joseph's for well over a year now, 2-3 times a month. We absolutely love this place. Everyone there is super helpful and the quality of the meats is second-to-none. Before I found this place on Yelp, I was growing increasingly annoyed with buying meat from the Jewels, Meijers and even Trader Joe's of the world. It was fairly expensive, and I was often disappointed. So when I found Joseph's I was excited to give an honest butcher shop a try. SO glad I did. Their ground chuck is amazing. No gristle ever, and so tasty. And we are in love with their bone-in pot roasts. They seriously are perfect every time. We tried their Amish chicken and I love that is has no extra fillers or anything in it. And the guys there will cut things up however you want, no problem. We recently had our parents' over for a nice dinner and we wanted to do something special. So we got a beef filet tenderloin to roast. It was a bit pricey, yes, but so, so worth it for a special occasion. Perfect. My mom said it was "the best meat she'd ever eaten." And their sirloin steaks are great for stir-fries. Bottom line: Joseph's is a must for us now. We won't buy any meat from anywhere else. Their prices are very reasonable and their meat will make a believer out of you. And the customer service can't be beat. Side note: We live in Oak Park and used to just take Harlem Ave. Do NOT do this. I hate driving on Harlem in Dunning. It's a huge mess and people drive like crazy. Do yourself a favor and take Oak Park Avenue to Addison, if coming from this direction. You will be glad you did!

39.description: Love love love the fresh housemade sausages.  Haven't tried anything else yet but I am working my way through the encased offerings.  The brats are superb, the veal brats are very good (salty for my taste but nice texture) and the green pepper sausage is - words cannot describe how insanely good it is.  Going to tackle the Italian varieties this weekend.  Although the meats seem pricey (taste tests to come when grilling season hits full swing!) the sausages aren't.  Best-ever fresh homemade brats for between $3-$4 a pound?  I'm a convert.  It's tiny, yes, but they fit a lot in to a small space.  Totally worth the "rush hour parking on Addison" roulette to swing by for brats and sausages.

37.description: Reminds me of Tony's in Edison park! Lots of fun, tasty stuff in their deli plus the grocery store has an amazing, authentic selection! Every time I go to Joseph's (or Tony's for that matter) I find things that remind me of my trips to Italy

0.description: I'm now know how to have a steak feast at home, without being interrupted by the waiter, dealing with noise from the adjacent table, and paying for a triple-digit price!  Joseph's will satisfy your addiction to meat.  Yes, I mean a wide variety of meat that one can imagine, such as steak, sausages, lunch meat, livers, salami, and much more.  I took Mama J. to Joseph's this morning, while the heavy rain was still in session.  Joseph's also has a small grocery section, just in case you need something else to go with your "Finest meats."  If you haven't had USDA Prime quality meat, I beg you to take a trip to Joseph's so that you can experience the "heaven on earth."  We paid $53 and some change for three (3), freakin'-thick strips of N.Y. steak.  I devoured one (1) of the three (3) on my own this evening.  Yes, it was amazing.  I will be returning for sausages that Daddy J. has requested for next time.  That will be the sole reason for taking the Addison, a.k.a. the mysterious #152, bus.  By the way, the stop to get off is Nordica.

38.description: Great place! Excellent quality, sausages made on premises, awesome dry aged prime meats and a friendly staff that knows what they are doing and has pride in their trade.  The price is right for the quality they carry. Not cheap, but then again, when was excellent dry aged prime cheap?I'm eating a spicy Italian Sausage right now and it's worht the trip for me!

51.description: One word wow.  Everything a bucher shop should be

27.description: There are two reasons that you must visit this place. One, the quality of the meat is unrivaled by anything that I've ever had. The ground beef tastes entirely different than anything you'll get at Jewel or Dominick's or even other local butchers. I've also had their skirt and strip steaks. All fantastic. The quality of the steaks is so good that they tend to be more forgiving when cooking. I have a bad habit of cooking steaks more medium-well than medium. No problem here as even when a bit overcooked they are juicy and tender. Oh, I can't forget their house made bacon. Get it cut thick and it's otherworldly. Secondly, they are really friendly. They answer questions and dole out advice without the least bit of irritability. Try and find that with some snot nosed, pimple faced teenager the Jewel counter. Also, they love to give away free sausages (there is a bad joke here somewhere). Seriously, drop fifty bucks and take home 3 or 4 freebies.

32.description: Been going to Joseph's since my mother would send me on my bike when a boy to pick up an order. Absolutely the best service and meats. My favorite is fillet mignon and I will ONLY buy them from Joseph.

54.description: This is my personal favorite real butcher shop, and part of a dying breed.  The staff is skilled, helpful and extremely friendly.  Their selection is great, quality has been outstanding, and their prices totally fair.  Overall this place just rules.  I LOVE the wild fresh butcher shop meat smell of this place- this place is the real deal.  Reserve your Thanksgiving Hoka turkey here and check the place out.  You'll be back.

48.description: We've since returned for ribeyes and more bratwurst, which I can not stop thinking about!  Seriously, I have never had a more delicious brat in my life!  And the personalized customer service is excellent!

44.description: Just grabbed a couple of steaks and sausage for a weekend grilling. And as usual the steaks were tender and delicious. Joseph's rocks!

24.description: old school family butcher. they know their cuts and they are very high quality.

7.description: Quality.  Service.Meat.

49.description: I drove an hour to get here.  Let me tell you something...I would have driven two hours to get there.  I got a nice big fat porterhouse that they cut right off of the huge slab of meat.  Absolutely FRESH and not pre-packaged and sitting around for who knows how many days like the other guys.  Took it home and cooked it up that same night and my taste buds haven't stopped dancing yet.  Great meats and great people, very helpful and friendly.  I may never go to a steak house again.

40.description: After reading the reviews, my fiance and I decided to go check out Joseph's Finest Meats. I am glad we did, the service couldnt be better, Ben was wonderful. We will definitely go back.EXCELLENT!

53.description: I drive to this place from Lincoln Park.  Its that good.  The quality of the meat and sausages rivals Schmeisser's in Niles.  For the price, I don't know where you can get better meat.As others have mentioned, the butchers here really know what they are doing and Ben? offered to help me walk my purchase to the car.  No need for that, but a nice gesture nonetheless.Try the Italian sausage with green peppers in it.  I brought it to a family party and even my parents who are nearly vegetarian devoured it.

30.description: My search for Dino ribs led me to Joseph's. Amazing customer service supporting a real prime meat butcher shop. Ben was great in explaining the type of cut, then proceeded to carve off the rib eye section from the back ribs. Everything was so fresh and reasonable prices, I left with an extra rib eye steak. But most importantly the ribs and steak were tender and delicious.

46.description: Well, it's no wonder restaurants use his sausage, and I don't even like sausage.  But, wow, Bennie is great and Angelo and the guys just have great meat and a great local market!  They make a party easy.

1.description: Bought 8 PRIME filets, 2" thick, that were awesome.Only place I know in (near) the city to get PRIME filet.

55.description: I have been a customer of Joseph's for a few years now.  I just adore them.  No where else will you find better cuts of meat with such quality service.  Everything they offer is top quality.  My husband loves their bacon which they slice extra thick for me.  Their homemade sausages are to die for.  Don't even get me started on their steaks. Every roast has been beautiful.   My life as a carnivore didn't truely begin until I found Joseph's.

9.description: Hands down the best butcher shop in chicago. All their meat is usda prime and the service is outstanding. They truly are nice people who really care about the quality of product they sell. I challenge you to find a better butcher shop. Simply the best!

26.description: Well everyone reviewing on Yelp is dead on here - excellent Prime meat. I had some New York strips and the Barese style Italian sausage. Ben, was great, actually taking the huge whole side of beef from the cooler and showing me how it is marked Prime. He also through in a sample of regular Italian sausage to go with my order. It was all outstanding and his sampling paid off as well. I came right back out from the burbs the next week and picked up more Italian sausage and their wonderful fresh baked rolls.It's a great neighborhood ma and pa shop and deserves to be supported by its patrons.

25.description: High quality, prime meat all the way! This place is a truly a gem. Price was very reasonable, specially with the quality of meat you are getting. The rib-eyes that we got were for my wife's birthday dinner celebration. It was the best rib-eye steaks we've had in a long, long while. Service was great. I took my 10 year old son with me and he said the people were very nice and friendly. JFM is definitely a keeper. We will surely go back. I highly recommend them!

12.description: Dry Age Bone-In Ribeyes...beats the pants off the big boy steak houses, at less than half the price. This is what I did .....trim off all side fat, trim bone down i.e. lollipop it. Sear over 1/2 bag over Kingsford charcoal.  One minute each side.  Close lid to reduce flare-ups.  Can  rest them for 5-10 minutes if need be. Oven to 400 degrees...put steaks on baking tray, run broiler...3 minutes each side....A perfect medium (warm pinkish center). Don't forget to salt n pepper the steaks before cooking and get them to room temp, 2 hours or so on the counter.

59.description: I use to be an introvert before I had kids.  Now I talk to just about anyone for an adult conversation, which is how I found my butcher.  I met the owner's son and loved the place from the first moment I walked in.  The owner (Joseph) is an old school butcher and has taught his son, Ben, the family business.  On my first visit, Joseph cut cut my meat to order, suggested some of his specialty items (like their homemade giardiniera), then walked me and the kids to the car.  From that moment on I began to rely on Joe for all of my butchery needs.But this place carries much more then meats.  They have a great array of dried pastas, frozen fish, fresh chicken, deli meats, fresh cheese like Parmigiano Reggiano, tortillas, apples, onions, and even bread crumbs.The best thing is, I call ahead of time, tell them what I need, what I'm cooking, get a little advice, and then pick it up.  And on those rare occasions when they don't have it, they order it for me and have it ready in a day or even in a couple of hours in some cases. I don't ever think you can ever get the personal service from any of the surrounding big chain grocery store, like you do here.

21.description: So this review is long past due. My BF and I have been going to Joseph's for well over a year now, 2-3 times a month. We absolutely love this place. Everyone there is super helpful and the quality of the meats is second-to-none. Before I found this place on Yelp, I was growing increasingly annoyed with buying meat from the Jewels, Meijers and even Trader Joe's of the world. It was fairly expensive, and I was often disappointed. So when I found Joseph's I was excited to give an honest butcher shop a try. SO glad I did. Their ground chuck is amazing. No gristle ever, and so tasty. And we are in love with their bone-in pot roasts. They seriously are perfect every time. We tried their Amish chicken and I love that is has no extra fillers or anything in it. And the guys there will cut things up however you want, no problem. We recently had our parents' over for a nice dinner and we wanted to do something special. So we got a beef filet tenderloin to roast. It was a bit pricey, yes, but so, so worth it for a special occasion. Perfect. My mom said it was "the best meat she'd ever eaten." And their sirloin steaks are great for stir-fries. Bottom line: Joseph's is a must for us now. We won't buy any meat from anywhere else. Their prices are very reasonable and their meat will make a believer out of you. And the customer service can't be beat. Side note: We live in Oak Park and used to just take Harlem Ave. Do NOT do this. I hate driving on Harlem in Dunning. It's a huge mess and people drive like crazy. Do yourself a favor and take Oak Park Avenue to Addison, if coming from this direction. You will be glad you did!

17.description: I recently stumbled across Joseph's and I will never again buy meat anywhere else. never. Their Amish chicken is fantastic, we've had the ground beef, kabobs, roast beef, all second to none. Oh, and if you are craving a corned beef sandwich - go buy their corned beef, which they make themselves - best corned beef I've ever had. Not only do they have a good product, they are extremely helpful and please to deal with. Going in there reminds me of going into the butcher and deli's with my nonna back in the 70's and 80's on Harlem Ave - definitely old school and love it!

10.description: Got a really great quality standing rib roast, and had a long enthusiastic talk about meat with the butcher. Excellent experience overall.

5.description: I bought a roast for Christmas Day for a recipe I have never attempted before, and it was truly the best roast I have ever made.Joseph's is truly a great butcher shop in what is a dying breed. You will not be disappointed one bit.Meats, seafood, cheeses & lunchmeats.....great staff and friendly customers. All round good experience that I didnt mind waiting the 35 minutes to pickup my order.Plus very reasonable.

3.description: I meant to write an update but didn't really get the chance to.For Christmas last year, I decided to host dinner for my family. I called ahead of time to reserve a prime rib. They told me that they only sell "aged" or "dry-aged" or something and that it only comes in 3, 5, 7 bones...etc. I think they said 1-bone feeds about 2 people.  Having about 10 adults and a child, I opted for having extra food than not enough so I got the 7-bone prime rib.Piece of advice during holidays, come in early to grab it. I had to grab it after work and had to grab a number. They're so busy during this time that it takes a while to get your stuff.The thing was MASSIVE. It was the size of a Michelin baby and barely fit into my oven (even with the oven rack on the very bottom). Without me asking, they had precut it off the bone for me and tied it back on (the way you should cook it). Great benefit! All I had to do was season it and throw it in the oven.My family raved about it all. My brother even told me that although they always have prime rib with my sister-in-law's family, this one was way better. I think we only got through half of it but that's because we also had sides. This year I will probably downgrade to the 5-bone but I will definitely be getting it from this place.

35.description: The leaves are changing, the days are getting longer and the weather is getting colder. Autumn is in full bloom. For those of us that like to watch the Bears embarrass our city, I can't recommend the fresh Brats enough.Its November too, which means Thanksgiving. Here are my tips1) BUY A QUALITY TURKEY. Joe's sells Ho-Ka, the best in the area. Sure its a little more expensive than the  Butterball rocks from the slaughterhouse sold at the local Jewel, but its worth it. Or you could spend twice as much at Whole Paycheck, but why? ORDER IT AHEAD OF TIME so you get what you need.Do's & Don'ts"DO brine or saltrub your turkey. They are not the most forgiving animals so buy some insurance by brining it. A good brine should have salt (a lot), sweet, seasonings, and oil.DON'T Over or undercook it - the pop-up timers are worthless. Use a real thermometer (preferably a probe one) and aim for breast meat at 158 or so. It'll keep rising after you pull itDO: REST YOUR FINSIHED BIRD. 20 minutes at least.DON'T fry your turkey unless you know what you are doing and are very careful about it.  Unless you have great insurance and don't care what happens to your house.

19.description: Well everyone reviewing on Yelp is dead on here - excellent Prime meat. I had some New York strips and the Barese style Italian sausage. Ben, was great, actually taking the huge whole side of beef from the cooler and showing me how it is marked Prime. He also through in a sample of regular Italian sausage to go with my order. It was all outstanding and his sampling paid off as well. I came right back out from the burbs the next week and picked up more Italian sausage and their wonderful fresh baked rolls.It's a great neighborhood ma and pa shop and deserves to be supported by its patrons.

28.description: Hands down the best butcher shop on the city. The service is amazing, everybody there takes pride in their work and it shows. The cuts and quality of their meat is ridiculous. I love to see them trim the meat because it's like watching a surgeon work with a blade. Whether its your weekly steaks, fresh turkey for thanksgiving, hams for Easter, or breakfast sausages, this is the best. A place where you're treated like family.

45.description: I visited Joseph's back in August of '09 to buy a special roast for my husband's birthday. I loved it. I walked into the small store with its big paper advertisements written up in marker and immediately felt transported to an Italian butcher's shop in Florence.  They have beautiful cuts of meat lying out on fresh garnish layered above the counter by a gorgeous stack of perfectly aged cheese wheels that towered above my 5'7" frame. And the service? These guys couldn't be nicer.I had to stand and wait a little while for my number to come up, but I was too distracted pouring over the selections of unique pastas, nuts, spices and various Italian imported goods to notice. The woman who had come in before me seemed to be stocking up for a gigantic family supper, experienced with her choices and gabbing with the meat men like old neighbors. I felt out of place but welcomed at the same time due to my previous lack of exposure to a *real* butcher shop.
