Even though I knew the cut of meat I wanted, I was so overwhelmed by the assorted comestibles (they had tomato paste in a TUBE!) that I needed guidance through every step of the purchase process. The gentleman who patiently yet efficiently waited on me did just that, aside from making a custom roast to my exact specifications.The price tag was hefty, no doubt, but I would gladly pay it again. Every slice of that tenderloin roast tasted as soft as filet mignon with as robust a flavor as a juicy prime rib.And I still have some tomato paste left.

33.description: I walked into this place for the first time this weekend when visiting some relatives in Chicago. We decided to stop there for a bite and MY GOD! That was the best bite I have ever had in my life! Definitely going back next time I'm around!

43.description: What can I say really? If you like excellent service, high quality meat, and need to stock up on some Italian dry goods this is definitely a place that should not be missed. The dry aged steaks are amazing, the home made Italian sausage is amazing, everything I've ever gotten here is pretty amazing.Short review, not much more needs to be said. You'd be a fool to pass this place up.

2.description: I can't tell you how many times we've gone to a local grocer and complained about the quality of meat going downhill. Then we find Joseph's and feel really dumb about hindsight being 20/20. What took us so long...?Joseph isn't kidding about having the finest meats on this side of O'Hare. My boyfriend brought home NY Strip and Sirloin equivalent to the best steakhouses for a fraction of the price. Jason came home raving about the Butcher. This place has been passed down to the next generation and he really knows his stuff. He liked this guy so much, I guarantee that after this experience, we will be coming here for meat from now on.

18.description: Joseph's is the best; I won't buy meat anywhere else. I've never been disappointed and shop there regularly.Most recently purchased a second-to-none filet roast for a special dinner with friends.  Also extra notable is their fresh Turkey's for Thanksgiving feasts....simply awesome. Its definitely worth the trip up from Oak Park (and agree with other reviewer - take Oak Park avenue and avoid Harlem)

41.description: Yummy yummy yummy!  I love the deli meats from here.  Their homemade summer sausage is to die for!  My boyfriend goes here a couple times a week to pick up fresh meat and bread for sandwiches.  Yesterday we went for some provolone Italian beef and gravy.  We made some amazing sandwiches.  They gave us a very generous amount of gravy and the seasoning was just right.  Joseph's is also my go to place for my lupini bean addiction!

52.description: What a fucking great Butcher shop!  If you're in the mood to buy quality meat, expect great value and to be treated like you matter, I encourage you to go to this place.The Owner Joe is a great guy. And Older gray-haired man with the body of a guy who knows good food, Joe will set you up. I enjoyed spending money here. So when you looking for great meat for your summer grilling in your yard, Park or at the beach, don't forget to stop this butcher shop to buy supplies!This Shop Is easily accessible by wheelchair and parking is not difficult to find. The employees are eager to please, open doors and will even take food to your car.

50.description: Just came back from this place - yes - it is awesome.  It is a lot smaller than I expected.  Prices are pretty low for high quality -- ribeyes go for $16/pound and they'll hand cut you different thicknesses.  Same for bacon which I got a "5" (thick) cut which was very good.The service is top notch, I think its a father-and-son business and both were maximum friendliness and helpfulness.  I asked lots of questions about cooking and prep and they were helpful in every way.  I am actually new to using a butcher rather than the supermarket so I really appreciated that.They also make other foods like bbq sauce and spaghetti sauce and they say to call them (773)- 736-3766 if you want anything special or if you just want them to prepare a couple of cuts for you.  They also have things like hamburgers premade which are probably not bad and they are definitely pretty cheap.

4.description: Came on Valentines day because of the rave reviews by yelps regarding the excellence of the meat and the exemplary staff.  Once again I was disappointed.   When I got home with my steaks I about cried for the steer from which they were cut due to the sloppy irreverence of the meat cutter.  If you can't cut a steak evenly you shouldn't be cutting meat at all.  The new York strip was both cut as a wedge and virtually re-butchered. The rib steak was a wedge.  The rib steak also lacked visible marbling and the outer layer of fat that add flavor and juiciest to the cut. I chide myself for trusting the excellent reviews and not babysitting the counter man. If you come here, fully examine the meat and the meat cutter as he performs his task.  Examine the meat again before it is bagged and refuse substandardly cut meat as well as substandard meat.Shame on you for having "finer meats" in your title while selling substandard stew meat as prime meat.I added a star because the floor manager was very helpful and sweet.  He actually gets five stars.

6.description: I was hosting a serious foodie friend of mine on a Saturday with his family accompanying. We're not Avant Garde but definitely strive for great food cooked in a home kitchen. We wanted to do a dry aged prime rib, believe it or not there are not that many options in the city to get dry aged prime beef from a proper butcher. I made the mistake of driving out here from the west loop on Friday Labor Day weekend, it ended up being nearly 2 hours there and back. Walking in it seemed pretty standard. The price was insane, like under $15/lb for dry aged prime beef. We got two ribs (for 4 people) with the bones butchered off and reattached with thread. Gorgeous piece of meat, they did not have veal or beef stock made that you could purchase for a sauce or stew but they did have bones for sale. I followed a reverse sear recipe and let me tell you it was SUBLIME, some of the best beef I've ever had. I will DEFINITELY be back!

22.description: I recently stumbled across Joseph's and I will never again buy meat anywhere else. never. Their Amish chicken is fantastic, we've had the ground beef, kabobs, roast beef, all second to none. Oh, and if you are craving a corned beef sandwich - go buy their corned beef, which they make themselves - best corned beef I've ever had. Not only do they have a good product, they are extremely helpful and please to deal with. Going in there reminds me of going into the butcher and deli's with my nonna back in the 70's and 80's on Harlem Ave - definitely old school and love it!

15.description: I was hosting Christmas eve and Beef Wellington was the entree. I went searching for a butcher to buy a whole tenderloin from. Getting it from Costco would have been the easy way to go, but I'm so glad I didn't. I called in my order for a tenderloin suitable for 7 people a couple days in advance and they had it ready to go for me and I was in and out in a jiffy. Did they sell me too much for 7 people? Yes, probably twice what I needed. Did I regret it? Amazing leftovers for days says No. Did it cost about as much as the GDP of a 3rd world country? Close. Was it worth it? Absolutely. Hands down some of the best meat I have ever had. Well, I went back this weekend to buy 4 fillet mignon steaks for a dinner I was hosting. The gent tells me it is $29.99/lb. I've gone pretty far out of my way and I've got my heart set on tasting that beautiful bovine backmeat again so I say 'no problem' and these guys came out of the woodwork and buzzed around like I was buying a Caddilac. One guy is cleaning and prepping the tenderloin and asking how thick. He makes the first cut. Guy #2 holds it up - Were these cut thick enough for me? Guy #3 - Was I using them today? Did I want them wrapped separately? Guy #4 - Had I been there before? Guy #1 -  Did I know to bring them to room temp before cooking? Guy #2, can they get anything else for me? The service is great and not surprisingly, my Steak Au Poivre was outstanding. I'll be back as often as I can, despite it being a decent trek from my house. Note that they do have affordable cuts that I'm sure are good as well. My point is that for a special occasion and/or expensive cuts, I wouldn't hesitate to shell out the premium price for the meat here. The quality is exceptional.

57.description: It's not in your neighborhood but it's worth the trip.  Zip in and out like Batman or linger over a piece of prosciutto and a butchery tutorial from Ben.Everything prime, everything good.The prices make you realize you have no business going anywhere else.Old men speaking Italian on both sides of the butcher's counter.Love it.This is the kind of place that flourished before the Walmarts ruled the Earth.

20.description: We have been big fans of Joseph's since buying the organic Turkey for our first Thanksgiving in Portage Park over six years ago.  Ben has been very generous with his time in explaining the different cuts and how to cook and his advice has been invaluable.  Across the board the gents behind the counter are great.  One time I saw the customer in front of me get an order of short ribs and I asked for the same.  Little did I know they called ahead.  Joseph asked me to call ahead next time and then spent 15 minutes cutting the ribs off the side of beef.  Top notch service every time.  My only gripe is they rarely ever have apple pies.  Blueberry is a fine substitute.

36.description: Great service, always friendly and helpful, the quality of the meat is excellent and the pricing is a value as well. This is my second favorite butcher in Chicago and I will always travel to get the best product for my meals. Two thumbs up to this place.

14.description: If you are looking for quality holiday meat, it is a given that you will be recommended to Joseph's by more than one person.  My husband called Ben for his recommendation and we went back and forth between lamb chops and legs. We ordered 2 legs of lamb with bones removed and butterflied for Easter dinner. These guys know what they are talking about and the service is old fashioned and personal.  The latter is what makes this place a gem!2 legs of boneless lamb weighed approximately 25lbs.  My husband was a bit surprised in how much lamb we were getting and they were even willing for us to only take 1 leg, but we decided the more food the better right?! We would hate to have a holiday that didnt include take home containers for our guests. Side Note - We had plenty of leftovers and froze a 1/2 leg for a later date.The prices are high compared to the shrink wrapped meat from the supermarket, but the quality cannot be beat.  The meat was as promised - bonless and butterflied.  The lamb was tender and everyone complimented us.Job well done Joseph's!

3.description: Fantastic European selections, particularly for sofas and living room chairs.  Many fabric or leather options.  While the staff are not warm and fuzzy, they are pleasant and extremely helpful, providing a great deal of information about the pieces.  They are also willing to work with you to help you select the best color and fabric options for your space as well as loan or give you fabric samples to try out at home.  In addition, they work with you on exchanges when your purchase does not work for your space.  I recommend this retailer if you like European (Polish) furniture.  I will also add that if you do not purchase an in-stock floor model, shipment takes about three months.

1.description: The worst furniture store. The service is really terrible that I have seen ever. One sales person (Polish blonde) is racist and very rude. The quality of furniture really not bad but a service made me really upset. Me and my family wanted buy set for living room but we couldn't do that 'cause we must know Polish or English languages that said the sales person. Be careful guys!

2.description: Customer service is really slow and not helping at all. Most furnitures are overprice. They sell some decor which is overprice as well. They even have one vase that looks very similar to the vase at HomeGoods store - but the one at HomeGoods costs around 60% less. I would never go there again.

0.description: Great Showroom! Lots of designs and unique styles. Beat sofabeds in Chicago! The wife found what she was looking for!

4.description: (I just want to update the situation itself versus giving another rating which Yelp requires me to. Since the previous star rating is discounted and only the newly updated one is counted, I still keep the same rating as I previously rated.) We've made a handful of trips to Idea in regards to the chairs we purchased as mentioned in the previous review, in attempts to get some comparable chairs with any new stock they might have received. Since there wasn't any new stock the last time we went, the manager tried to situate us with some new chairs of the same price they could order from the catalogs they had on hand. After us flipping through the catalogs for a while and finding nothing we were interested in, the manager decided to offer us a refund. I figure he saw the situation with us would only continue to perpetuate as it already has for several months. He didn't make us bring the chairs in to receive the refund either which was nice. After three weeks of that last visit, we received a refund in the form of a check via postal mail. It was a prolonged battle to find a fair result, but I'm happy the situation was finally ironed out.

1.description: This place is perfect!!! First off dollar hot dogs!!! That's right $1.00 for Chicago style hot dogs can't beat that!! Also there cheesy beef sandwiches for 2 dollars are so damn good yes their on hot dog buns and that makes em better in my opinion! Small local joint with awesome food and service ! Also on Black Friday everything in the place is $1.00!!!! EVERYTHING! Keep it up Mario's great food!

9.description: Read reviews. Lived down the street. Figured I would give it a shot. Two orders up including mine. They gave the other guy my order. Mistakes can happen.  So, let it slide. Then I get my food. The fries defy all logic. I do not know how this is possible, but they had no discernible taste what so ever. Try another fry. Nothing. Zero taste. How is this possible?  I don't know, but I decided to toss the rest of my food and head to another place. Live and learn.

23.description: I am right there with the 1st poster. Good place, very simple.....a little too simple though. I am a Fry Freak, their fries were just basic dog stand fries, but this IS a basic dog stand.Your typical awesome Vienna Beef dogs, great toppings. Also had a pizza puff, good stuff. Would love to see fresh cut fries there which are my usual preference. 4 Stars for sure with better Fries. I'd definitely go back, its 4 blocks from my house. 2 picnic tables in front on Harlem.If you go there, try to use side streets if you can. Harlem is terrible ANY time of the day. Usually back up solid from Irving to Addison.

12.description: Better than any fast food chain! Fresh food and good prices. Place isn't great looking but it's all about the food!! Give it a try you won't regret it. Don't let the look fool you, its a great neighborhood spot.

21.description: Great hot dogs and great service.  I came here with my sister and niece so they could try a Chicago style dog and we were not disappointed.  Poppy seed buns, good hot dogs and all the toppings were great.  The fries were huge too.  You will not leave here hungry.

16.description: Passed by this spot what feels like a million times and one day finally said just try it it's a buck...needless to say me and my roommate were back within the week!! 1$ hot dogs you can't beat! We ordered the 2 hot dogs each fries and pop meal each with 2 side cheese for the fries and it was under 11$ !! Generous amount of fries also! FYI if your a liquid cheese junkie like we are their cheese is to die for with a nice jalapeño kick!! This is a new favorite spot!!

17.description: A very small and generic hotdog stand. The food is nothing special and what can you expect when teenagers are cooking the food. I am sure the food is pre-packaged and nothing special you cannot find at your local supermarket.  A nice small neighborhood place.

10.description: If you are anywhere REMOTELY close to this place....say five miles....DO NOT GO TO ANY OF THE "BIG NAMED" PLACES....GO HERE.  you will not go wrong.  Its a hot dog...repeat...its a hot dog...and you shouldn't be paying more than a buck for it.  OK...I got a hot dog and ALL the works including sports peppers for a buck thirty and thats incl tax.  CAN  I GET ANY CLEARER ON THIS?  they use vienna franks too.  There should be lines at this place.

5.description: Mario's Red Hots is a fantastic neighborhood quick-service food joint. The employees are friendly and funny. They care about the awesome food they serve, and they really seem to like their customers. I have been here several times and have enjoyed the friendly conversations between customers and employees. It is a small place that can get warm on a hot day, but the food is so good and the people so friendly, that it is worth dropping in.The hot dogs are perfectly balanced - a meaty, spicy dog with a snap to it - dressed perfectly with mustard-relish-onions-pickle-tomatoes-sport peppers-celery salt, Mario's Red Hots are delicious and satisfying. I usually get 2 dogs with everything - for $2.20! I have seen and smelled other foods being made here (it all looks good), but I had 2 dogs my first time in, and  I just can't get myself to try their other offerings because the dogs are so very good.Parking is available on Harlem Avenue, but it may be easier to park on a side street a half a block away and walk over.

11.description: If you're craving food along the lines of hot dogs (or an Italian beef) you don't get any cheaper than this.Yes the hot dogs are a buck, BUT they don't taste any different than ones at other places where you'd pay like a 1/1.50 more.So why pay more, especially if you are buying a few! They don't have a big menu with a lot of variety, but what they do have is cheap with no downgrade in quality from any similar place. Best for carry out, not much room to sit (plus it can get rather hot in there) and the place is usually busy. I'll give a mention about their beefs. They work for me, not dry not too fatty. And, they've got the "mini beef"- with the same meat in a hot dog bun. It's cheap too. The only thing lacking (but that's just me) is that their fries are the thick type, not the thin cut ones. Another plus is that they are open fairly late, especially on Fri. & Sat..

22.description: Great friendly service and excellent food. Definitely would recommend.

0.description: Mario seems to be a popular name among geeks and gamers.  Yes, in this case I'm referring to the Italian boy in a video game.  However, for many Chicagoans, Mario's footprints have extended onto food, such as Mario's Italian Lemonade, and the topic of this Yelp review, "Mario's Red Hots."  Reasons why you should stop by Mario's Red Hots, on the southwest corner of Harlem and Grace: 1) you need your last Chicago-style dog fix before heading to O'Hare (CTA Harlem O'Hare Blue Line station is ten (10) to fifteen (15) minutes northbound).  2) you're on CTA #90 bus and starving.  3) you've finished shopping at the depressing HIP and don't want to dine at the nasty mall food court.  4) you don't feel like having to eat at Mr. Beef (near Harlem & Irving Park), even though their Italian Beef sandwich is fantastic.  5) you're attracted by the bright Red & Yellow dog house.  If you have some spare cash (a cash-only establishment), want an affordable lunch or dinner ($5.49 for two (2) dogs and two (2) servings of fries), and like your Chi-style dog with a large pickle on it, Mario's is here for you!  Their patio is quite large, so your consume your dog there and make the pedestrians jealous.

20.description: Cheap dogs at $1.00 each. Decent too! One of the best hot dog places I have been too! Great Hot dogs, TATER TOTS!!!! Limited menu but that keeps it simple!!

19.description: First I would like to say sorry to the owner as I told him that I would proptly put a positive review about my experiance here but I was having trouble with getting my yelp up and running mixed with me being a little lazy....With that being said I'll say this.So I'm leaving a funeral serive not many blocks away from Mario's... and I keep tellin my wife "I need something quick and cheap" and it wasn't more than a couple moments until I see this place shaped like a house with sign that said "$1 hot dogs". So I stop the car and go in and ask this gentleman "how much for a chicago style hot dog" and he tells me "uhhh, $1"... I was confused but hungry so I was prepared to have one of the worst dogs ever, considering the price. Well I got to see this guys son make my dog with fine ingredients (very cleanly I might add) and it was one of the best damn dogs I have ever placed my lips on. I don't know how this guy makes money but if you are around the area and you have $5.... you'll get like a king... Love these types of joints.... keep up the good work brother!!!

2.description: I don't know how you guys stay in business but please never leave.  Great comfort food for super cheap prices.  True chicago, blue collar food.  So don't expect A/C or a fancy seating area.  Good quality but at their prices, I go all out quantity.

18.description: Great place to stop for a quick lunch that serves great hot dogs with fresh ingredients at a really cheap price.  Not fancy, but I'd rather have a great hot dog at a cheap price than pay a high price to stop at a overly decorated, over done hot dog joint.  Highly recommended.  I'll be back.

13.description: Cheap dogs at $1.00 each. Decent too! One of the best hot dog places I have been too! Great Hot dogs, TATER TOTS!!!! Limited menu but that keeps it simple!!

4.description: I just want to say "WOW" !!  1.00 doesn't buy much these days but you definitely get your money's worth and beyond with Mario's Red Hots.  Yes they have $1 Hot dogs, that are the best, every ingredient is fresh and high quality, but they also have other items like mini beef, excellent beef in a hot dog bun w/nacho cheese..AWESOME and for $2, you gotta try it.  They keep their prices low and quality high.The service is excellent no matter what, any mistake on either party, no questions asked, they fix it to what you want.Being in Customer Relations for over 20 yrs it's really nice to finally see a business give back instead of take.  As long as they are there, my family and friends and I will continue to go there, CUSTOMER'S FOR LIFE!Keep up the GREAT SERVICE AND FOOD!!  IF YOU HAVEN'T TRIED THEM YET, GIVE 'EM A TRY, WHAT DO YOU HAVE TO LOSE $1.00? ..YOU WON'T BE SORRY :)

24.description: I was driving down Harlem Avenue during lunch time and the place caught my eye.It's your typical hot dog stand. Simple inside with a few tables.I went with the 2 Hot Dog Special.2 Hot Dogs, Fries, and a can of pop. At this time it was a little over $5.The hot dogs were the Vienna Beef regular dogs. They were good and the toppings were also fresh.The fries were OK. There was plenty of food. The fries were plentiful. They are wrapped with the dog, so it keeps everything nice and warm.It was simple but clean inside.  Maybe a little too simple for a hot dog stand in Chicago. They need to dress the walls up a little.  They have a good side front lawn area. I hoping they have some tables out there in the summer time, it would be nice.Overall I liked the place and will be returning.

6.description: This is the place to get cheap hotdogs.  I mean where else can you get a hotdog for only a buck and there's no limits on how many you can buy.  They aren't the best tasting by any means but they aren't the worst either.  I guess I'd compare them close to having an Oscar Meyer wiener and they come garnished Chicago style which I liked.  I also got an order of fries,  they were fresh cut and ok.  They also have other items in their small menu,  but come you know your here for the $1 hotdogs. So bring those singles because they don't take credit or debit cards.

15.description: I am right there with the 1st poster. Good place, very simple.....a little too simple though. I am a Fry Freak, their fries were just basic dog stand fries, but this IS a basic dog stand.Your typical awesome Vienna Beef dogs, great toppings. Also had a pizza puff, good stuff. Would love to see fresh cut fries there which are my usual preference. 4 Stars for sure with better Fries. I'd definitely go back, its 4 blocks from my house. 2 picnic tables in front on Harlem.If you go there, try to use side streets if you can. Harlem is terrible ANY time of the day. Usually back up solid from Irving to Addison.

7.description: Normally I would give this place 10 stars but lately I'm so disappointed in them.. Can't complain to much food is pretty cheap, but like the saying goes u get what u pay for I guess.. The hot dogs are amazing. But the fries are disgusting.. It's almost like the recook them they have never been fresh always a darker brown color I usually just toss em out! The last couple weeks we've been the FOUR times between 930 and 945, and twice the door was locked and the other two times (930) all they had were a certain amount of hot dogs left. We wanted burgers and fries but were told the fryer and grill had already been cleaned and shut down. Well if that's the case why would u advertise that ur open til 10? Makes no sense to me it's just a couple of young kids trying to get out of there. But than you should say 930 last order and doors close at 10. If it wasn't for the cheap hot dogs I would of stopped giving them my business...

8.description: Mario's Red Hots was a great place to eat at!  The prices were reasonable, the hot dogs were classic Chicago Dogs and the staff was super friendly!  We love supporting a family owned business and these are good people! Eat here and be satisfied

3.description: Hot dogs are either good or bad, no middle ground and no where is that more important than in Chicago. While Gene's and Jude's still rules the roost, Mario's is a great alternative! Vienna dogs, steamed buns and fries that were cooked to perfection. 2 dogs, fries and a drink was under $5.00, you can't touch that anywhere else. Indoor seating is ok, but bring someone to talk to, no TV in the building, a few outdoor seats are also available. Overall, quite good and I will be back to try their Italian Beef.

14.description: I'm a big fan of Gene and Jude's. Then I start thinking Franksville if it's too close to noon, for obvious reasons. Today however, I went to Mario's for a dollar hotdog. I was expecting edible but bad, I got a very good tasting hotdog and it was for a buck! My new place for a dog!

1.description: Local destination for flowers and Christmas trees for generations. Great selection and quality at a reasonable price. Vegetables and herbs, they have everything. It goes way back from Touhy, so keep going. Park next to the tracks off Touhy for firewood and Christmas tree pickup. Tip the guy who straps it on your car in the Chicago winter. Street parking available along Austin before the car dealership. A convenient side entrance is located half a block down with more cashiers. I think that's the main entrance although I never use it because I walk here!

9.description: Back in the day they used to have this old dog that strolled around while you were shopping outdoors during the spring and summer. With or without the dog there's a real sense of independent ownership. They're really helpful people who own Meinke's. Their flower selection in the summer is my favorite time to shop. They also have beautiful rosebushes. I wouldn't buy from anywhere but here...Some shops you visit and the plants aren't taken care of properly, the products are dry and dying...You can tell they take great care of their plants for their customers. When it gets colder out you can get firewood here. I'm not sure their prices on that though. I chop down err my own trees!!!::wishes I had a fireplace!!::How to pronounce Meinke's? Beats me.

12.description: Meinke's used to sell these crazy "flowers & stuff in a bag", which was this green plastic bag with holes punched in it.  It hung flat on the wall and you could get a variety of flowers or what-have-you growing out of it.  I came here almost exclusively for these.  You would be shocked at how hard it is to kill these things.  I am a terrible gardener and even I managed to make them work.  However, i havent seen them for a few years and this made me sad.  But they have redeemed themselves by amping up the herb selection.  Now they offer kooky stuff like pineapple-scented sage, chocolate-scented mint, and something like 10 kinds of basil.  Awesome.The one bad thing about this place is that if you have no yard, or limited space, you are going to be terribly jealous of the people buying carloads of stuff that are obviously from the suburbs.  Sometimes narrowing it down to one or two choices is no fun!

21.description: Meinke Garden Center has everyhitng you need to make or add to your garden. They have the latest things and the prices are amazing. Their flowers, especially, are very beautiful. Their employees also have a lot of knowledge about gardens and they have great tips as well. Whenever I need anything for my garden I come here.

16.description: I've been going there for years. Everything will come back. Nothing will die in 3 days, like it does from Home Depot and Costco. The workers are SO helpful and will even load your car! Once they sell out of bulbs or basil or strawberries, that's it. They won't be getting any more. But WOW! What a selection! I always go in the fall when they are getting rid of their perrenials at really low prices. THeir Chirstmas trees last longer than trees from any other place.

17.description: Meinke's is a family-owned gardening business which has been in business, on that land, since the land was first "distributed" to European settlers, and the family still takes deep pride in that long reputation.  They raise many of their own plants from seed in their greenhouses in the "off" months, and they carry gardening products hard to find elsewhere.  (For instance, they regularly stock "Father Dom's Duck-Doo," a compost manufactured small-scale in WI which benefits low-income employees, reprocesses organic waste materials, and provides a top-notch mulch of special value for rose bushes.)  Their selection of plants, while cognizant of the "fashionable" varieties which change from year to year, includes varieties I haven't seen elsewhere and have loved.  Their plants are healthy and their prices are decent; unlike Gethsemane, they haven't gone exclusively high-end.

10.description: We were turned on to this place a few years ago and have been huge fans ever since.  Amazing selection of anything and everything you could possibly want in a garden-it's almost overwhelming.  They are not cheap and their plants are not guaranteed so if I am taking a risk on a perennial I will pick those up from Home Depot because of the one year guarantee-but most of my fun, specialty annuals and hanging baskets come from here.  The place is huge so plan to spend some time exploring.  It's also crowded so I suggest avoiding weekends if possible.

5.description: Love it.. I love their variety and regret not getting my Halloween pumpkins from there last year now that I think about it.  Oh well, just starting a garden, and now I know the best place in town for anything yard related!

11.description: Oh, after years and years and years of passing by here I finally went for the first time last night. Fair prices and an amazing selection. I had no idea it was such a big place!I hear it gets uncomfortably crowded on the weekends, which I am not a fan of, so I'll stick to the weekdays.

3.description: Family place with good people who know their stuff and seem to like each other. What a relief! So my guy is obsessed, obsessed with his new Fire pit. I admit, when marshmallows are present, I share in his primitive glee. Thing is, to be blunt, the wood sold at out local Jewel and Home Depot sucks. It is frequently damp or recovering from the damp, smoky and doesn't smell very good when burning, which it does fast, also prohibitively expensive at $5 (maybe 4 or 5 sad little logs...) that don't last very long at all. Turns out what we needed is clean, dry hardwood. The kind they have here at a quarter of the price! Boyfriend and I bought a massive load by referral of my friend to bravely test and compare! Yes, Meinke accepts credit cards- rack up those points! Turns out, 4 or 5 hefty logs from here can make it thru: S'mores, Amaretto Cocktails, Neighborly Guests, My Goofy Buzzed dancing, Romantic Cuddling, Cute puppy-dog playtime, singing, a little nap... and gee, that is still burning and I'm not cold yet. Time to go inside? Why? We have the entire trunk of the car packed with sweet-smelling logs! Fun, Value, Bonding and Manly Fire await! I'm a big fan. I say, if you are out here and happen to have a Firepit, Fireplace, Smoker or wood-burning stove Check these guys out. Go to marvel at the options and enjoy the result! (P.S. Want something pretty? Go to the Dollar Store and buy a bunch of the Christmas lights. Yes. Now throw out or recycle the box responsibly. Good. Now throw those suckers on the fire and enjoy the pretty colors! Ahhhh... so romantic!)

0.description: After being out of town last weekend, we weren't quite sure if we'd even be able to find a suitable tree. Lowes and Menards were so depressing we almost gave up. We passed by on our way home and we are so grateful we did! We got here around 9 this evening and they were still open! Jose helped us out and he was wonderful! The tree is so fresh and looks amazing! He also discounted it given how close it is to Christmas! We spent the same amount last year and the tree was crap. This is our new go to place for beautiful, fresh trees!! Thank you!!!

20.description: This is a good garden center with a particularly great selection of rosebushes in spring, plus nice selection of perennials.  Also a good place to buy pre-started vegetables and herbs.

19.description: I've been buying from Meinke for years now. Never had any problems with their garden section, in fact they have a great garden selection. So why the 3 stars? I went there for firewood after reading the review here. I've gotta say I got some real crappy wood. It looks nice and all but I think they just cut the tree down. Not seasoned at all. Thank god I have a log lighter in my fireplace cause this stuff does not burn. Maybe by next winter it'll be ok. Next year, I'll drive right by them to get my wood somewhere else.

2.description: I'm an avid vegetable gardener, and this is the best source for vegetable and herb seedlings in town. Great prices, great selection of both heirloom and hybrid varietals. They have a larger variety of tomato seedlings than any other nursery in town. Same can be said of the herb seedlings.

18.description: I try to shop local, independant businesses whenever possible and so I headed over to Meinke today. The place is beautiful and had an incredible selection...if you have a clue what you're doing. I know very little about gardening but am eager to get started. I have some plants a neighbor gave me and I asked a cashier if there was someone who could help me figure out what pot and soil I need. She responded "we really don't have the staff for that kind of help." I was very disappointed. I walked through, grabbed a few herbs that I knew what to do with, paid $16 and headed on over to Lowes where an incredibly helpful woman walked me through everything I would need, why I needed it, care for my plants and a boatload of hints and tips. $140 later I was ready to go. I will probably go back to Meinke in a few years when I know what I'm doing, but was really dissapointed they didn't have anyone to offer some help.

13.description: This place is plant heaven!  I simply could not believe the selection and sheer volume of growing stuff they have packed into that little parcel of land.  Don't bother with the others--go directly to Meinke for your garden needs.

4.description: I have personally shopped at Meinke for years and have always been more than satisfied with their selection, quality and price.  As the owner and gardening planner/designer for my business, The Garden Gal, I purchase many plants for my clients because I know they are getting superior product and value for their investment.

6.description: I was at the Depot American Diner the other day and in walks a man with organic heirloom tomato plants for sale.  It's that kind of a place.  In any case, I temporarily forgot that the Slanty Shanty's yard is full of creosote and therefore, unfit for planting, and bought a number of these beauties. I got them home and remembered - this is the Slanty Shanty, NOTHING is easy here. I cannot plant these lovely tomatoes in my poison tainted yard.What to do? Pay outrageous sales tax at Home Depot for planters? Buy substandard potting soil as it cheap, or go to a high end garden center and get screwed buying something good?  Meinke to the rescue!Amazing place, just amazing. If you have any impulse purchase problems and like gardening, stay away from this place!  You'll wake up in your condo with 30 flats of annuals that you can't plant. Seriously, their selection is vast and beautiful and the plants all look so freaking healthy, it's hard to buy just one thing.  Needless to say, I strayed from my short shopping list and came home with a car full of goodies that I hadn't planned on purchasing. As I've never done a container garden before, I consulted several staff members for guidance. Fantastic service. They steered me to the right sized pots for my various purchases, helped me pick out the right soil (they even steered me away from the pricier product saying the less expensive one was their preference) and gave me solid advice on growing in pots vs. the ground.  I left with planters galore, a variety of peppers and a selection of greens and herbs to complement my on the fly tomato purchase. They did everything in their power to help me, now I just have to make this stuff grow.Prices? Very reasonable. I've paid a great deal more for far less in the city. It can be kind of thunderdomey on the weekends and their organization is a bit on the haphazard side, but helpful staff is never far away if you are trying to find something.  Family owned, good prices, helpful staff, amazing selection all make this place drive to the burbs worthy.

15.description: Went here for firewood...they had better prices than most places in the city and they talked up their wood to be good... It turns out it is indeed great wood.  We paid about $80 for a mix of oak and birch.  Their garden center has just about anything you probably need, from plants to soil and fertilizer.  We bought a few other plants and what nots.... everything was pretty well priced.  The guys working were helpful.Yes it is in Niles but only a 15 minute drive or so from 94/Fullerton (and there's lot of other good shopping right in the area while you're at it--Costco, Wal-mart, everything else).

7.description: We came here for the first time last fall, looking for flowering kale, and because we found so many beautiful autumn plants and decorations, we decided to come back today to add a few items to our growing family of plants.  I was mightily impressed by the size of the place which I hadn't even guessed at last October, by the variety, the excellent quality of the plants and the reasonable prices.  I did a lot better here than I'd done anywhere else including those big hardware stores (You know who I'm talking about.)The people are lovely, too, and the place is populated with kitties who occasionally become visible if you're alert.  Seriously, you can't ask for a nicer experience.

8.description: I am writing a review specific to the firewood they are selling. Nothing else. Their staff is friendly and helpful. From what I could see this place has things for gardening that the big home centers don't. But this review isn't about that. We just bought a house with a fireplace in it and put some money into making sure we could use our fireplace this fall and winter. A friend recommended Meinke's so we went there. I'm not an expert on firewood, but having grown up in logging country of the Northeast, I took one look at the firewood and could tell it was not seasoned (enough). But, since we needed some firewood, I decided to buy it and took the word of the guy working there that it was seasoned. We got it home and the wood just wouldn't burn. We gave it another try with a couple of pieces of birch and a stick of hardwood. Still the same thing. The wood smokes more than it is consumed by fire. I called Meinke and spoke to someone who said that I was the first complaint they had about it, but offered to take it back, which I appreciated. They said they seasoned the wood outside for about 2 months (which really is not long enough, even with the dry hot summer we had). There should be a fire in the fireplace, not smoldering logs. I then saw the difference when at my brother-in-law's house where he had purchased twice as much of the same mix of wood for half as much as I paid for a 1/4 face cord and the firewood he received was kiln dried! This stuff went up in flames, not up in smoke. I would spend less money driving about 40 minutes away to get more firewood that has been dried out in a kiln. Well, I've chosen to keep the firewood from Meinke and will try and season it myself for use next year.

14.description: I love this place!  I had to stop myself from doing pirouettes the huge greenhouse aisles.  I've purchased tomato and flower plants and they were very strong and healthy.  The selection of plants is phenomenal and I have not found a garden center that matches its size and quality in the area.  .  .

12.description: Worth the drive.  Huge selection of beautiful glass pieces.Nice bands tee-shirts as well Cic-ca-check it out.

7.description: best head shop in chicago.  period.  great selection of locally made hand-blown glass and everything else you need.

19.description: Adams Apple hands down is the best glass shop I have ever been to.  You are wasting your money elsewhere.

1.description: Honest, friendly and very helpful. I loved this place.

2.description: I have been coming here since the early 70's and have found this to be the most inviting smoke shop there is. Everyone is knowledgeable and offer great tips. No matter where in the city I'm living I always make it here to stock up.Stop in, you won't regret it!

9.description: stopped in mostly on impulse. the guy I talked with was really friendly and very helpful. I ended up leaving with a piece I love.

6.description: It's nice to enter a store where the employees don't run up to you and ask you if you need help before you have even surveyed the place.  This was my first visit, but it definitely stirred up the old senses from tours of old.  I haven't been to a headshop in years, but this place evoked that smile from my past.  The shop owner has my sense of humor who also noticed a small SYF logo on my clothing which started us talking.  The selection of items were up to date and appropriately priced for the changing economy.  It's nice to have a store from my past pop up again in a totally new city. They take credit cards... and return them too.  Expect this customer to visit again.

18.description: Great selection, service, advice and ambiance. Worth the trip from Northbrook!!

10.description: Best headshop in the city. If they don't have what you're looking for they've offered to order it for me :)

13.description: I was walking in my neighborhood, getting in some exercise, when it started raining a bit.  I walked into Adams apple to get a respite from the wetness.  I forgot I had been here some 15 years ago when it was not so easy to find water pipes and similar products.  I bought a nice piece and went home to "display" it.  I had buyers remorse and went back to upgrade to a bigger and better piece.  What a nice gift to myself.  The staff is genuine and courteous.  This place is cool.

16.description: I can't think of a good reason to come back here. The woman who runs the place was really rude to me--I was on the phone with a friend trying to choose a gift for someone's birthday, and she turned the volume of the music in the place way up and stuck her tongue out at me. I could kind of see doing that if I was just being a loud douche on a cell phone, but I was clearly talking to someone helping me to decide which of her pieces to buy. Besides, the selection's not that great, and the pipes are more expensive than average. Ash's Smoke Shop on Clark is way better and the guy inside is awesome.

17.description: very cool stuff, very amiable service

15.description: This place is fantastic. I've been going here for a month or so now and right off the bat I was blown away at how great the owner and his staff are. He's got a great story to tell about almost everything and he is a like an encyclopedia when it comes to smoking accessories. They have great selection and reasonable prices. Most notably, they feature a whole case of pipes blown my noted midwest blower Bear Claw as well as every other concievable smoking aparatus ever invented (seriously). Prices are very reasonable (pipes from 20, hitters from 5-10, water pipes from 40 and way to many more to list) but you should know that if you are getting a one of a kind piece of art like a Bear Claw pipe, you should expect to pay for it. These pipes are amazing and they look fantastic, but they will cost you around $400 anywhere you go. Adam's Apple has the best prices I've ever seen on Bear Claws though. You've been warned, so start saving up. They also have lots of shirts, incense and lots of other great 'hippie stuff'.I will never go to Secrets again. That is how great this place is. Check it out

0.description: Best Smoke Shop in Chicago. They have an awesome and wide variety of glass pieces. They also sell hookahs, incense, t-shirts, cleaners, and lots of other useful products. The guys who work here are old hippes and are really nice and will help you out with any questions you may have. A Chicago staple.

5.description: Decent shop. Very friendly staff. Don't come in here if you're in a hurry because they will talk to you forever. Good prices on pipes though.

11.description: Adams Apple is probably my favorite head shop in the city because it looks exactly as it should- like walking into a hippy's basement. The place is pretty simple, a couipla racks of tie-dye shirts, some kitschy Chicago PD shirts, a few cases of glassware and a bunch of stuff behind the counter.I took my brother in here for his birthday this last year and let him pick out his present. When we left, he goes "That place was fucking weird.""Why do you say that?" I asked."Well, did you see them selling Country Time Lemonade behind the counter? No frig. Weird."They sell some creative safes and hiding places. Always a plus in a head shop.

8.description: Fantastic little shop up on the north side. Best glassware selection I've ever seen. Large range of prices. Cool and knowledgeable dudes running the place. Seriously worth the trek. If you're looking for a unique piece, Adams Apple will NOT disappoint.

3.description: chill, little tobacco/head shop in the far north. the owners are super helpful and accommodating. decent glass and little smoke odd bits and memorabilia. i'd gladly come back!

14.description: Not only do they have cool glass, cool ambiance, and treat you right; they also have badass Bears t-shirts.

4.description: Simply the best tobacco and head shop in which I have been.  I have been to ones near a college where indifferent students or conceited hippies work, or ones in another state where if you mention anything other than tobacco use, they kick you out.  This is the other side of that universe here.  No questions go unanswered and the staff is always helpful and patient.  Prices are very competitive as well.  Do yourself a favor, get the Yelp deal and buy a new pipe or something!

1.description: This location is really a necessary respite from your iTunes shop. Other Songs has a multitude of records and CDs that seem to be way better personally compared to what they do in pixelated structure on personal computer displays. If you need any help, there's a really laid-back vibe to the store and, while the employees are all really nice and clearly know their stuff, they don't awkwardly follow you asking. Must be back in here.

9.description: The Music Store is still open for business. There are great deals on all store owned items. Repairs, free estimates, the place is great and the owner is a very nice guy.

23.description: Went in here with my boyfriend to trade some cymbals & pedals for an amp. It didn't end up being what he wanted, and the owner was very willing to work it out with him. It all ended up working out in the end, even though we didn't end up buying anything from there. They don't have a huge selection but they're very friendly and what they do have does seem quality. A great alternative to monsters like Guitar Center.

25.description: Allow me to be the first to review my favorite music store in all of Chicago. As a keyboard player who favors the quality craftsmanship of the eighties, it has been a trial to find a reliable repair person in the city...Everybody sends you to Deltronics, but their turnaround time can go into months. Bring your pro gear to the swell folks at The Music Store for a quick, honest and reasonable fix -- without the pro attitude. They've patched up my keyboards, amp, speaker cabinet and husband's bass, over the past coupla years.

12.description: Absolutely love this place. The staff is always very helpful and knowledgeable and the prices are always good. I normally get a good deal on used stuff and discounts when buying multiple items.The location itself is very small and everything is all over the place which makes it hard to tell some of the stuff they carry. However, the staff knows the place like the back of their hand and can tell you if they have what you are looking for and will normally offer to order it for you if its not in stock.I have purchased several things on separate occasions and have always had a good experience.

21.description: I'm a gigging drummer and public school music educator.  If you're looking for a music store to check out the lastest gizmos and gadgets, this probably isn't it.  However, if you're a musician (or newbie) that appreciates the kind of service that the mom and pop stores of yesterday prided themselves on, I suggest that you check this place out.  Small store with an experienced and knowledgeable owner and staff, nice selection of new and used gear (guitars, drums, PA), authorized Peavey dealer (among other brands), in house repairs, and reasonable hours of operation.  I originally stopped in to pick up parts to repair some PA speakers, but this has become my go-to music store whenever I can use them.  There just aren't enough places like this left.

16.description: One of the last family owned and operated music stores in Chicago. New and used guitars, amps, drums, brass, accordians and PA gear. They also offer expert guitar and amp repair as well as consignments and they pay more than most other stores. It's hit or miss as far as selection goes. Trade-ins come in every day so you have to check in often for the latest deals. Repairs are resonably priced and usually done in a couple days. I've bought, sold and traded several guitars and amps there. There are no better deals in the city.  I always check there first and you gotta love the Sanford and Son decor.

17.description: Best store ever :D I got my violin fixed there due to old broken bridge ; the bridge is the nicest I have ever seen and he made it more sturdy, and the post flying out  because I must have really made the violin mad some how by trying to restring it oops. Also my husband has bought recording gear there which he loves! They are great and super friendly :)I recommend going there for the fixings :)

10.description: Came in here expecting it to be a decent guitar store based on the reviews. What I saw was a dingy place with no room which made it very uninviting. Half of the stuff looked broken and prices were put on things sparingly. There's not even room to try stuff out. The place needs a overhall on product placement.

5.description: I love this guy. I love this store. He has repaired a number of guitars and amps for me--always done right, fast, at a very reasonable price, and ready when promised. I'm lucky it's here in the neighborhood!

11.description: This place is a bit on the pricey side. I stopped her after a pawn shop trip to pick up a fix-er-upper guitar to get some supplies to fix it up and the prices were pretty steep compared to most competitors. The store is also appears crammed and unorganized and gives you the sense of being trapped in a small area facing only the staff - pretty weird. All that aside, the staff is knowledgable and friendly so the service is excellent.

22.description: I love this store.  If you are looking for mid-to-low priced new guitars (Ibanez, Samick etc) this is the place.  Also has occasional steals on consignment.  No bull, no hassles, very laid-back.  I've bought several guitars there in the 300-1000 dollar range and they are great.  It's a small store, and can't do everything, but they do what they do very well.

0.description: Highly recommend. John is a fair and great guy to do business with.  Check in often as they have a nice rotating inventory of guitars amps and keyboards of all makes and price ranges. I have purchased cables, amps and accessories there and the owner will do things like trim cables etc as needed. This place has a personal touch seldom seen in this day and age.  Check it out. A Chicago Classic in my opinion

20.description: One of the last family owned and operated music stores in Chicago. New and used guitars, amps, drums, brass, accordians and PA gear. They also offer expert guitar and amp repair as well as consignments and they pay more than most other stores. It's hit or miss as far as selection goes. Trade-ins come in every day so you have to check in often for the latest deals. Repairs are resonably priced and usually done in a couple days. I've bought, sold and traded several guitars and amps there. There are no better deals in the city.  I always check there first and you gotta love the Sanford and Son decor.

19.description: "The Music Store" 's always  the first place I go. They're small, & might not have what I want, but when they do, it's a good price & the best service. It's more like taking a guitar or amp off your friend's hands than a typical retailer: They'll tell you the good & the bad about an instrument.  If you don't see what you want, ask anyway, & check again later: These guys  have their eyes open for deals, & have  lots of  friends in the business: With a small store, they sometimes have to"pass" on a piece if they think it's just gonna take up valuable space, even if it's a great bargain. Tell'm what you want , & don't be surprised if they find it for you.

2.description: Went in to get a new tuner for my jangly old acoustic guitar.  The owner is really friendly and sold me on a new tuner as well, which has worked out great.  Will definitely be coming back here, solid neighborhood music shop.

18.description: I referred a friend to The Music Store for rental of sound equipment for an outdoor show last year. They were able to get exactly what they needed and the staff was very helpful. My friend could not say enough good things about them. I know this place because my daughters took lessons there years ago. The staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. I know they are great at finding solutions for their customers. They sell instruments, books, sheet music, have an instrument repair shop and I'm sure they still offer lessons at good rates. Also, the street parking is good around this area.

13.description: The guys in here are very friendly with NO ATTITUDE!!! They are cool about returns and usually recognize you if you come back. Brian the luthier is very thorough and careful with your guitars. I have had my bass and classical guitar worked on and was very happy. The electronics repair guy was very fair and honest.  I love supporting small businesses like this.

4.description: I have no idea why this place has decent ratings, the selection of instruments, and accessories is on par with pawn shop quality and selection.

24.description: John and Brien are awesome.  I've been buying guitars from John since 1984 at Chicago Music (the real one at Lincoln and Addison not the new one at School) and have never been disappointed.   Great rentals, repairs and lessons.  Great for beginner guitars and sometimes you can find some great deals on vintage gear as well (bought a BF Princeton from them a few years ago for $400 and its probably worth twice that now).  If you're looking for all the latest from Fender, Gibson, PRS, etc--- Its not your joint, but for the vintage enthusiast, novice, hero-for-hire and the weekend warrior its a must.

6.description: I've been coming to The Music Store for about 4 years now. A friend introduced me to the place and I've been coming back ever since. This is a no-frills establishment for musicians who want honest recommendations and prices. I've gotten multiple guitars repaired here (setups, rewiring, etc.) for a fraction of the price that other places charge. The owner, John, will always give you solid advice since he's been in business for decades. He could easily be like other places and overcharge you for a repair or an old set of speakers, but instead he provides honesty to keep his customers coming back. I've never bought any gear from this place but most of it seems like good values for the condition it's are in. If you want a sexy show room full of over priced vintage gear, this place is not for you. For anyone else, do business at The Music Store. You won't regret it!

15.description: There are many other places where the stores resemble the "Land of Oz" and where you will be given an equal amount of dignity and respect according to how much you convince the help you have to spend.  The Music Store is not hangout for den mothers or for parents whose children have outgrown them.  If you are there to assess the scenery, ask yourself this one question, "Whats it supposed to look like?"  I trust any shop that looks as if there is an abundance of business, the lack of a maid, and all sorts of various projects scattered everywhere you look.  This tells me that there are repeat customers, that these guys will not any item go out unless it is fully operable and safe, and that a word of mouth about the quality of service is responsible for the looks of any professional shop.  I do not trust any business where the same merchandise is still on display, where all you see is the help cleaning the windows, and when the manager appears to be in a hurry to get you in and out in the same manner of a fast food restaurant.  Next case; you don't wait to jump on stage for the first time to begin rehearsing your lines.  The music store knows what to do, if its worth it, and they will even explain how a less expensive musical instrument will suit your needs better than a more expensive musical instrument.  I would suspect that the staff at The Music Store wants to make sure you continue to get the most joy instead of becoming bored and in the end your musical instrument will be put away and gather dust.  The Music Store is a rare find in Chicago, and not only that but the staff are all native Chicagoan s, something which is hard to find these days.  Finally, I consider the owner to be one of the best teachers I have ever been privileged enough to learn from.  I have yet to walk out of this store, without leaving with some new knowledge.  I would tell anybody who needs music,musical instruments, repairs, or some real advice about musical matters to call The Music Store, or to stop in for a visit.  Joe Stray Wolf Peppy ZamoraChicago, Illinois

7.description: Bad quality guitars everywhere in this store. You will regret buying one! They are the worst guitar I have ever seen. Go to other stores and compare them definitely

8.description: This place is a cool little hidden gem where you can get a guitar or amp fixed for a very fair price.  The owner, John, is one of the nicest and most down to earth people out there.  The store has a variety of instruments and P.A. systems that range from beginner to pro level models. Another good thing is that you can buy/sell/trade/consign and John is willing to work with you on any of it to make sure you're happy.  He really bends over backwards for his customers.  I'll be coming back for any future repair needs, and probably also just to hang out and talk shop since it's right around the corner from my place.

3.description: I love this place. The guy is genuine and does a good job.The work is done fast and I don't considered it expensive.

14.description: I love this place.  A guitar shop without attitude!  That in itself would score 5 stars.  But the loving, knowledgeable, repair service would get it another 5 if that were possible.  Just picked up my 33 year old acoustic guitar that was badly in need of an overhaul.   (Action adjusted, nut  replaced, bridge and loose bracing re-glued.)    The guitar is a joy to play.  Sounds and feels brand new.   Great prices on strings as well.  Great place!

58.description: I was with my kids on the far-NW side and decided to try this place. In the 6 years we lived nearby, my wife and I ate here only once. I thought it was worth a revisit.This is your Italian-run fast food place. The smell of Italian beef aroma hits you just as you walk in as classic rock radio is playing "Mrs. Robinson." Despite the temptation of the beef, I opted for a Maxwell Polish instead. My kids each had a hot dog. I deduct a star since grilled cheese was not on the menu, which surprised me.Looking around, the place is very clean, with black and white tiles on the walls. Seems that for every 2 Vienna Beef signs, there's a "No Public Restrooms" sign adorning the walls and counter. They also have a big Grand Ave. & May St. sign behing the counter, perhaps as a reminder of their origin. The seating consists of a counter all around the restaurant and diner-style stools that my Stunt Baby had difficulty scaling since they spun around. There were also plenty of picnic benches with umbrellas set up for eating outside. Since it was almost 90 out there, I think everyone chose to stay in the cool interior.Every order came with fries, not any old fries, but the fresh-cut potato fries. It amazed me to see both my kids clear them out completely. Very fresh and tasty. And yes, they have the forbidden k-word in a Chicago hot dog place - ketchup. They keep it behind the counter in a big quart-sized squeeze bottle. Use it discreetly for the kids and give it right back so you don't get caught displaying contraband.I deduct another star since my Polish was not flame-grilled, but had the rubbery quality of a hot dog. I need some charred edges to call it a true Maxwell Polish.Finally, after dinner, my five year old wanted an ice cream cone. Seeing that the cones are all huge, I asked for a kids size but they had none. The woman at the counter came up with a creative solution. Instead of a single big cone, she filled 2 cones with a sensible amount of ice cream in each, all for the same price of a single big one. This way, both my kids got ice cream and I paid for only 1 cone.In all, not bad. I saw a number of locals walk down the block to pick up orders for carry-out, some of whom were greeted as old customers by the crew. Of course, my older son liked his hot dog, fries and cone so much he told me to give it 5 stars, but then I reminded him of our favorite place and he changed his mind. I have no regrets for trying this place and I would even recommend it as a good place for Italian beef next time, maybe not for Polish sausage though.

56.description: I'm from California, went to Michigan for school which is how I discovered what Che-cawgo food is all about. Based on Yelper's checked this place out.  The IB was good, very good, but not something special in my opinion. What I was really surprised with was the fries, they were awesome! Shame I couldn't give this place more than one shot, but I gotta star how I gotta star. Hits the IB marks, which is a special sandwich, but it wasn't anything better than it already is...most Vienna places hit this sandwich out of the park, they do too, its good, but not better than what I've had.  If you're from California though and know about In N' Out Burgers fries, this place beats them, so its worth checking out.  I hope to go back someday.Recommended.

29.description: First time here, working in area.  Have driven by numerous times.  From pictures on wall history dating back to 1950's.  Anyhow, food.  Had a combo (beef/sausage) and a mountain of fries, with vanilla shake.  Sandwich a good size, taste ok.  Nothing great that would set it apart from others.  Price $11.00, inflation.  Hard to find lunch for under $10 now a days.  May return in a pinch.  Don't mind paying a little more, but has to be worth it.

42.description: The burgers were and chicken sandwiches are great. The only thing I would have changed was that they tell you that "Everything" on the burger includes relish. I'm not a big fan of relish so I would've opted out on that. The majority of things seem to be al a carte which is ok in case your trying to be good and not get fries. But if you do....it is a very large bag and can be shared easily between two people or even three. All in all great experience.

23.description: The best Hot Dog Stand in this area hands down. This place beats out jays and gene & judes. Their food is fresh delicious. Their customer service is what you should expect friendly & quick. The place is very clean and their prices are very reasonable. The music plays softly where you can enjoy it with any conversation.Thank You Bob O........

47.description: Fantastic beef's and hot dog's and the fresh cut fried to order frys ain't bad either..youwon't be wasting your time or money here like at gene n judes..in the summer they havepicnic benches to eat outside so kool..the beef is homemade and the dogs pure viennano skimping here..prices are a little high but i say you get what you pay for and thisjoint delivers..if you want some great chicago food then stop on in you won't be sorry..

8.description: We've been Bob-O's customers for years, but ordered 4 beefs tonight at 6:30 pm. Warmed over fies, dried out, poured into a bowl when we got home, not hot, certainly all not fresh. WHAT HAPPENED TO BOB-O'S?!Beef was still very good, but holy smoke, BAD fries.

31.description: Really good burger and dog joint. Tiny, only takes cash, and really good. Try the burger with grilled onions or the grilled chicken done just right. Shout out to the fries too since they are big and tasty. They also have ice cream and malts that you can eat outside on one of their many outdoor benches.

34.description: You always know what your going to get. From the hotdog and and fresh cut fries, to the beefs and burgers everything at Bob-O's is quality fast food. If your looking for that classic Chicago style dog, this place has got it.

16.description: This is among my favorites in the area for hot dogs, beef, tamales, & fries... if  you're not looking for the popular places like Gene & Judes or Superdawg...this place is a great find!  I no longer live in the area but this is a place I'll go to when I'm around.First off...their fries are AWESOME!!! Secondly...hot dogs are great, and the beef sandwich is of great proportion!  The quality is right up there and the price is just right!!!

13.description: This place is way over rated for what it is. High prices. No bathrooms. Cash only. & worst of all, the food is below average.

11.description: This place has not changed in 35 years...and that is a great thing. The fries are awesome and if you want a change with the fries, just add cheese. The cheezy beefs are full of flavor and the giardinara is the perfect touch. Even though they only take cash, they have an ATM in the store. Even though I moved to Jeff Park, I still make sure I get to Bob-os every two weeks.

39.description: This is the first time I've ever been disappointed at Bob-os.  I took a bite of my fresh-cut fry and it was lukewarm. They replaced the fries and then I bit into my hot dog which was bordering on cold.   I felt the need to console myself with an Oreo shake which I was told really was not a shake but that was ok because it was delicious.   When I told the lady at the register about my cold fries and hot dog she just shrugged her shoulders. Not even  an apology. Nothing, nada zip. I hope this was a just a fluke because it is hard to find good fresh cut fries.

37.description: When looking for the perfect Chicago hot dog you can be pulled in many directions. Some say less is more when it comes to toppings but i happen to like mine with everything. Bob-o's consistently delivers a fresh hot generous meal. Everything i have had there is very good, especially the fresh cut fries.  This restaurant is not small like another reviewer wrote and has seating inside and out. A couple other nice things about this neighborhood family owned business is that the staff is friendly and always keeps the place clean. I recently stopped in for a quick dog and ended up staying a little longer to read the paper and thats when my nose went crazy...... Crazy happy that is because they were cooking up something fresh in the back that was loaded with garlic, yum, probably starting another batch of Italian Beef which is also great here. Another nice twist they offer here is that you can get your dog or polish steamed or char grilled. If you want a good fresh reasonably priced fast food meal Bob-O's is tough to beat.

0.description: Solid classic hot dog stand with a lengthy history. Stopped here after hearing good things about the beef, and wasn't disappointed. It's a small cash-only joint with picnic tables outside, which were in use on a December afternoon in the mid-50's. Also 50's-style was the interior of the place, with antique enamel signs hung on the walls with checkered tiles and stools around the counter seating area inside. There was a smoky haze inside and we left smelling like burgers, but it wasn't really an issue. The sandwich is definitely a classic Italian beef, with very good house-made giardiniera. The beef itself wasn't too salty or overseasoned, plenty juicy. So much so that the juice mostly runs out of the sandwich and pools in the basket. Giardiniera was the best part, and I should've bought extra to go. Long crunchy carrots, celery, and cauliflower mixed in with the peppers, not too oily, just right.This may be Dolinsky's #1 beef in town, but Johnnie's and Jay's are still mine. Bob-O's is great for that 1950's atmosphere though, and i'd return again for sure.

38.description: This place is just fantastic, and my go to place hot dogs. It's nice and clean, and they make everything to order. The staff are attentive and efficient, I've never had to wait longer than 8 minutes even with a line of people ahead of me. They make all the fries from fresh potatoes, and you can see where they prepare and cook everything. who have to love a place that's confident and clean enough to do that, especially a little hog dog joint. They have great soft serve too.

51.description: Great hot dog !!! OK tamale....Cash only....

27.description: I have been hearing about this place for a long time and they DEFINITELY lived up to it.  I had a Cheezy Beef with Cheddar and it was AMAZINGGGGGG!I recommend this place! I will be back SOON!

32.description: This is my favorite place to eat at in the area. Hands down the BEST grilled chicken sandwich that I have had in a long time. My family has tried the beefs and pizza burgers and they also said that they were great . The fries are homemade are some of the best fries I have had.

54.description: I visited Bob-Os last week. I was starving since I did not eat anything all day so I ended up getting a cheeseburger and a pizza puff. The pizza puff was really sub-par even the Aldi brandered pizza flavors hot pockets taste better and those are downright nasty. The cheeseburger was also nothing special and left me somewhat disappointed but on the bright side it was not as bad as the pizza puff. The next day I woke up with salmonella poising and spend the whole day in horrible pain. The days that followed were slightly better.I LOVE fast food but I will avoid Bob-Os like the plague.

48.description: This is a Chicago dog! Awesome, fries from fresh potatoes, cut right there! My faves are the cheesy beef, the pepper and egg w/ cheese during Lent, and of course the meatball sub! They have a lot more other delicious things; just go hungry and you will love it!!! Great, now I'm hungry just talking about it! LOL

44.description: Bob-o's makes cheeseburgers like Mom makes cheeseburgers.  Good-sized hand-formed patty, slice of cheese, hand-sliced thick pieces of tomato and pickle, almost a wedge of iceberg lettuce, plus grilled onions and MMK.  It's not at all fancy but very satisfying and good value.  Fries are GREAT and if you order cheez fries they ladle the cheez into the fries boat - not a little cup.   Hot dogs are just as good as Gene&Judes.  The beef is sliced paper thin (it's almost odd in its consistency) but seasoned well and juicy enough without falling apart.  I am going to try the polish next.

24.description: Didnt think it was anything special. Had a char dog and cheeseburger. Both things had a good amount of veggies. So many that it was hard to find the hamburger pattie or the hot dog. Had a better char dog before, honestly didnt even taste like one. The burger pattie was real thin and didnt have much taste to it. The fries where pretty good. The hot dog came with fries but not the burger. Paid about $7.60 for everything.  Would not recommend sitting inside didnt seem like they had AC. It was about 83 outside today and while waiting for my food I got really hot in there. If you want to eat there maybe at their tables outside. Since it was cooler outside than inside. No cc, just cash.

7.description: Bob-O No! This place is a disaster. It is definitely not a typical Chicago joint. I didn't try the Italian beef, but I'm very skeptical that it is even remotely good. Their hot dogs were sad and flavorless, no where near representative of a Chicago dog. Their hamburger meat is a perfectly shaped thin patty as if it was sliced from a cylindrical log of frozen mystery meat. Also, they're cash only. How is this place still in business? And how is it possibly getting such a high rating?

49.description: I like it.  Its my last stop out of the city now when I'm headed back to cheese-head country.  Good dogs and fries.  I think what I really like about the dogs is that they are putting in a nice slice of kosher dill pickle on top of all the other trimmings, and that really makes the meal for me.  Stop in and get a dog and fries.  Or, even better, a beef.  Buy a t-shirt and you'll just impress the hell out of everyone in the place.

40.description: I love Bob-O's Beef sandwiches, especially the cheezy beef. I used to live across the street from this place. I love the small-business (non-chain restaurant) feel of the place with their 60's decor & history of how they started as a trailer serving dogs in Norwood Park or Park Ridge. Dare I say, their Italian beef rivals Portillos...

53.description: Bob-o's is right down the street from my house....and boy am I glad for that! The beefs are great and the fries are fresh cut and superb.The burgers are good as well. On the down side the price's are a little high for me to frequent this Establishment on a frequent basis.

30.description: Holy cats!  I almost gave the place five stars, but I want to go there again to make sure. The fries were freaking awesome.  Don't know what magic they do with them, but yum.  The double dog was a bit weird, two hot dogs crammed in a bun. But, they were delicious, so I'll let it slide.  I can't wait to go there again and try more stuff!

46.description: By far a really really good fast food retaurant. Gene and judes usually will have a line and is further away add in they don't have a menu like this. I LOVE LUV really LOVE the Italien beef here. Their cheese fries is awesom and the dogs are too. I keep going back

1.description: This place is exactly what I needed. A cash-only hole-in-the-wall kinda place with a few locals scarfing down dogs and shakes. Beyond casual, eat at a counter, smell the grill from your stool--that's what I was looking for. I had a chili cheese dog, fries, and a drink for about 6 bucks. It was pretty legit. Probably not the best in town, but way better than a fast food option. If you're ever driving around hungry in yoga pants with a messy bun in your hair, pray to the hot dog gods that you have six bucks in your purse and you too could be as happy as I am.

55.description: Had this on my list of places to try for quite some time. I decided to go with the old standby test, a hot dog and fries.The hot dog was your typical good Vienna Beef hot dog. It was the natural casing type(SNAP). It wasn't quite as snappy as Gene and Jude's. The advantage is the choice of toppings over Gene and Jude's. You can get tomatoes, pickles, relish, onion, etc.The fries were very good for the fresh cut style.The interior was very clean. The people were nice and friendly.I will be returning to try the beef based on other reviews.

9.description: Great Beef Sammich!!  Great fries.

26.description: This place has it all. Great hot dogs and beefs. There are portions are reasonable. The size of the beef is just right. My family and I love coming to this place. My daughter loves the seating area. When its nice out, there's nothing better then sitting outside and enjoying the beautiful Chicago weather.

25.description: This is among my favorites in the area for hot dogs, beef, tamales, & fries... if  you're not looking for the popular places like Gene & Judes or Superdawg...this place is a great find!  I no longer live in the area but this is a place I'll go to when I'm around.First off...their fries are AWESOME!!! Secondly...hot dogs are great, and the beef sandwich is of great proportion!  The quality is right up there and the price is just right!!!

12.description: Awesome.  Trio...simple but delish.   Sausage meatball and beef.   Old school joint on Irving Park

59.description: Great Hot Dogssss

21.description: Great little hot dog stand. Cash only. Easy parking. Ive been here a few times. Prices are reasonable. Not a bad place especially if your in the area. Fries are fresh cut but can be soggy at times.
