17.description: I live close by to this place, its great to walk over there in the summer. Hotdogs are yummy and the fries and onion rings are perfect! Discovered that their beef sandwiches are also better than Al's Beef by far! Never too long of a wait, and friendly service, but careful, cash only!

10.description: The hungry hound says it has the best beef sandwich the hungry hound must have been very hungry because a beef sandwich was not that good it was actually kind of crappy salty kinda nasty it was fresh if that ain't saying much would not get it again tomorrow I might try a hot dog maybe I'll just go somewhere else onion rings were fake the only thing that was halfway decent was the Mr Pibb giving it two stars just because I haven't puked yet

5.description: I've seen the episode of the Chicago'Best featuring Bob-O's.  While many hotdog joints are claiming they are the best in Chicago, please let Rosa J. be the judge because she eats, and eats a lot.  She will travel miles with her own skinny legs and brutally yelp about each of the places that she has visited.  Please understand that Bob-O's only takes cash, but they do have an ATM onside for your convenience.  It was rare to see Rosa J. had a few bucks, in cash.  Of course she would be spending on food.  The menu is all priced very reasonably.  In average, an entree is between $4 to $5.  Plus a drink, you won't be paying more than $6.  I ordered the chili cheese dog and a 12 oz. lemonade, for under $6.  The hotdog wasn't humongous, but it was filling.  It also came with fries, which were crunchy and salty.  I wasn't "wowed" by the hotdog, yet it was some good-quality food for the Dunning neighborhood standard.  I still prefer the "Hot Dog Station" in my hood, Albany Park (see my review on HDS).  Nevertheless, if I happen to be in the neighborhood again, I will be thinking about Bob-O's.

3.description: I like and respect this place. It's clean, safe, and the food is good. They care about what they do, but they're not giving their food away. Solid joint for a decent hot dog and fries.

35.description: It's a skinless wiener which was overcooked and mushy.  The non-poppyseed bun was fresh but soft.  On the plus side, the condiments were applied in the correct proportions and the pickles, onions and tomatoes were fresh and crisp.The biggest highlight for me were the fresh-cut fries.  They were perfectly cooked.All in all a serviceable hot dog but, as previously mentioned, not one I would go out of my way for.

19.description: Was there to try the beef sandwiches. I ordered mine dry because I don't like drinking my bread through a straw, and a side of hot peppers. Overall the beef was okay, I came early as the place opened and felt like the beef lacked flavor. The peppers we average and didn't have any outstanding flavors to make them stand out from the rest. The French fries were fresh cut which I prefer over the frozen variety. FYI, one order of fries is big enough for 2 people. I wouldn't make a special trip, but may go back if I'm in the area with enough cash. CASH ONLY!

28.description: We've been coming here for over 15 years. Back then it was a tiny hole in the wall. However even with new decode one thing hasn't changed- fantastic beef sandwiches, hot dogs, home cut fries and quick service.The prices are a touch higher for the area but I don't even hesitate going there--- especially after a night out with the girls :)

45.description: A funny thing about Bob-O's Hot Dogs is how the place sort of hides in plain sight. If you've been passing by without stopping, do yourself a great favor and go in sometime.The Italian Beef is very moist with a nicely seasoned, sharp meaty flavor.The Hot Dogs are Vienna, and served with Mustard, Relish, Onion, Tomato, & Pickle(Ketchup, Hot Peppers, & Celery Salt upon request). I prefer the Char Dog. It's got the incredible Vienna flavor plus the terrific char. Awesome!The Polish is delicious too; one of the best in the area.Some of the sandwiches come with a side order of Fries, but you'll want an extra order, because they are great French Fries. They are unpeeled, crispy on the outside and buttery-fluffy on the inside; certainly among the best French Fries in the area.They have parking around the building, and you can park in the neighborhood if necessary.

33.description: I live right across the street from Bob O's. I have trie their hot dogs, cheeseburger, and the grilled chicken sandwich. I have not been disappointed once!! Very good quality of food. Everything tastes like it was taken off your own grill. The fries are super good as well! I have nothing bad to say and I have had this place too many times! Bob O's almost beats gene and judes..

43.description: Bob-O's is a very small restaurant off of Irving Park Road. It's immediately recognizable from the street with a large picture of a Chicago style hot dog adorning a sign in front of the building. As I walked in I saw a very clean place, while there are only a few stool seats inside the building there are a few picnic tables outside if you want to dine on the premises. I ordered a hot dog which included fries. The hot dog came on a regular non-poppy seed bun, the bun itself was soft. The hot dog was well cooked to perfection, it appeared to be a skinless dog by Vienna Beef, no complaints with the hot dog itself. There was not a lot of relish on my hot dog, but there was plenty (excessive) of mustard, the tomato slice and pickle slices were far larger than I would have preferred. The onions were diced nicely and were applied consistently over the hot dog so that there were onions in every bite. My hot dog didn't appear to be include celery salt, and I had to specifically ask for sport peppers. The sport peppers included were nice, not too hot and complimented the dog very nicely. The fresh cut fries were pretty decent, they weren't too salty or too greasy, they weren't particularly flavorful either. Overall this is an average place to find a Chicago style hot dog. Outside of the non-poppy seed bun all of the ingredients are fine, though the balance of condiments is a bit off. Simply put the mustard and pickle flavor overpowered a lot of the other components of the hot dog. The place itself is clean, service was fairly quick, prices were reasonable at 3.20 for a Hot dog and fries. So, I'd visit again, but I wouldn't go out of my way or recommend going out of your way to stop here either.

2.description: Went in here a number of years ago with my sister, both of us severely hungover and-yeah, this is weird-on her recommendation I ordered two tacos and an order of french fries. THEY WERE FABULOUS! Now I still drive from the NW suburbs to get their tacos....! They just clicked with me.And as far as Gene and Judes: ICK, ICK and triple YUCK. Hot dogs that taste like rubber; facilities flood every time it rains heavily....no thank you! Bob-o's all the way.

18.description: Didnt think it was anything special. Had a char dog and cheeseburger. Both things had a good amount of veggies. So many that it was hard to find the hamburger pattie or the hot dog. Had a better char dog before, honestly didnt even taste like one. The burger pattie was real thin and didnt have much taste to it. The fries where pretty good. The hot dog came with fries but not the burger. Paid about $7.60 for everything.  Would not recommend sitting inside didnt seem like they had AC. It was about 83 outside today and while waiting for my food I got really hot in there. If you want to eat there maybe at their tables outside. Since it was cooler outside than inside. No cc, just cash.

41.description: As far as fast food places go this place hits the spot!!! I had a serious craving for hot dogs and beer this particular day.Im picky about where I eat.I do my homework on Yelp and word of mouth.They did the job!!!!!! Im even afraid to order hot dogs at places I know absolutely nothing about.I was referred here by a customer and an hour later I was fully satisfied.GREAT JOB!!!

52.description: I went here today to try a hot dog, fries and tamales. Inspiration to check out this place came from a conversation with the fam over Gene & Jude's. An aunt who probably doesn't know of Yelp told me to check out Bob-O's for better tamales. She was right. I'm here to share the word of mouth recommendation here.The tamales are of the Americanized fast food variety, but these are superior - 4 mini tamales with a tomato type sauce. I really enjoyed it. Also, fries with skins maintained good flavor - and you get no hassling when you ask for ketchup! My friend and I agreed that hot dogs were good - we both got with everything - which doesn't come with hot peppers but includes other typical toppings (tomato, pickle, relish etc.) My friend tried the soggy just because we didn't know what it was. Learned it was italian bread dipped in au jus, so basically italian beef sans the beef. It was fine in flavor, but I personally like Portillo's for beef.The place itself was very clean and cashier/cooks very nice. Solid choice for a hot dog and fries.

50.description: I won't update every time I eat there......Another awesome meal!If you like great food, like great Chicago food.....GO HERE!!I will miss places like this when I relocate in the future, and this will be a must go to for my visits home!!!

4.description: So I noticed this place had a sign outside its restaurant saying it was voted best beef in the Chicago area. Although it was good, I don't think it was the best.First - I spent 11 dollars for a cheesy beef, fries, and a small drink. That's a little bit expensive.Second - The food was good though. The fries looked to be homemade. But Inhad better beef.I didn't ask for extra peppers though and that was my fault. It turns out that you had to pay extra for that. It's not bad. No public restroom though. And only cash. It is Vienna Beef so you can't go wrong.I will return sometime very soon as there are many menu options. However, expect to pay over 10.00 for fries, Beef sandwich, and a small drink. Otherwise I would of given it 5 stars.

6.description: Typical Chicago fast food joint. Burgers, beefs, sausage, fries etc. Very old school joint with old school characters, this is a good thing. Getting the beef. Can Bob O's unseat Mr. Beef as the best beef around? NO! Nope not on this day. Solid beef, better than a number of other places. Not nearly that of Mr. Beef. But that nasty garbage they call a Banana Shake. Haha here is an Alexander Graham Bell moment, how about putting actual bananas in your banana shake. Yeah your right I'm probably on crack rock, but just try it. We might get lucky and it will taste better.(Ask Jess Cafe how to do it right) This crap tasted like a liquified version of  those circus peanut candies. Let the regurgitation commence! Oh now it tastes better the second time. .(SMH)Respectable beef, horrible banana shake. Not planning on coming here again especially since Mr. Beef is between here and my home. Work on that shake people. That ish is aweful!  2.5 stars for a decent beef and old school vibe.

22.description: Decent enough I suppose.  Hot dogs not as good as at Plush Pup though.  Cash only is a negative.  Not a place you go out of your way to visit.

15.description: I had a hotdog and fries... both were good and if I'm in the area I'll stop by again. One annoying thing, cash only.

57.description: Best Chicago dogs anywhere in the world.  I grew up around the block from this place and as a kid I used to search for money in the couches to be able to get a dog and those delicious skin-on fries. Every time I come back to IL, I go here for my Chicago dog fix.  The place has been remodeled extensively since I moved, but the food it still fabulous.  Being that I live in CA, you cant find dogs like this and i crave them all the time!  Cant wait for my next visit!  Mmmmmmmm!!!

20.description: I've seen the episode of the Chicago'Best featuring Bob-O's.  While many hotdog joints are claiming they are the best in Chicago, please let Rosa J. be the judge because she eats, and eats a lot.  She will travel miles with her own skinny legs and brutally yelp about each of the places that she has visited.  Please understand that Bob-O's only takes cash, but they do have an ATM onside for your convenience.  It was rare to see Rosa J. had a few bucks, in cash.  Of course she would be spending on food.  The menu is all priced very reasonably.  In average, an entree is between $4 to $5.  Plus a drink, you won't be paying more than $6.  I ordered the chili cheese dog and a 12 oz. lemonade, for under $6.  The hotdog wasn't humongous, but it was filling.  It also came with fries, which were crunchy and salty.  I wasn't "wowed" by the hotdog, yet it was some good-quality food for the Dunning neighborhood standard.  I still prefer the "Hot Dog Station" in my hood, Albany Park (see my review on HDS).  Nevertheless, if I happen to be in the neighborhood again, I will be thinking about Bob-O's.

36.description: I wanted to see what all the hype was about so I ventured over to Bob-O's for a bite. After ordering I quickly lost my appetite while seeing the cashier handle money as well as the food. Just isn't good sanitation skills to me. Other than that mishap, they are expensive!! Now if the food was worth it, there would be no complaints. Best bang for your buck in this area is clearly Gene & Judes.Happy eating people!Pros:Good friesNice selectionCons:ExpensiveNot too clean

14.description: The best Hot Dog Stand in this area hands down. This place beats out jays and gene & judes. Their food is fresh delicious. Their customer service is what you should expect friendly & quick. The place is very clean and their prices are very reasonable. The music plays softly where you can enjoy it with any conversation.Thank You Bob O........

28.description: Unbelievable food that is wonderfully tasteful and unique instead of most places same old. The unique seafood flavored are mouth bursting. Definitely coming back soon!

1.description: Fire! Got me burnin', burnin', burnin'Walked right into El Ancla... after 30 sec pulled out my stopwatch on my phone.... 5 minutes later I was finally greeted at the door....yep this is about to be a 1 star review. (AT&T guy walked out around the 3 minute mark which is the only reason why I didn't walk out at that point myself.)Was given the menu with a magnifying glass which I thought was hilarious. $10 burger from kids menu? Yep 1 star is in your faith.  Julio I believe brought out Tostada De Ceviche (Tilapia) so my final negative thought was boy the sauce/salsa is small. I had trouble deciding between the Camarones Momias & Pina Rellena. Julio mention to order the Pina Rellena and that he would make one of the Camarones momias for me to try and to order next time I come in. Tostada De Ceviche - After trying the Ceviche I enjoyed the flavor very fresh and then I added a nice dollop of red sauce/salsa to one of the tostada and then my mouth turned to fire. Oh! That's why you get a small portion. Think of using it like wasabi as it's even stronger then that. There should have been a warning about that but the heat was good. Received about 8 Tostada so was able to use with the rest of meal.Pina Rellena - Shrimp , octopus , crab , corn , chili peppers, in champinoes cream and melted cheese. Served with rice, salad , and garlic bread . 5 stars  for everything that was on the plate. Used the Tostada's and really enjoyed my meal. It wasn't to sweet as I was a little worried about. It was mostly when you got down to the bottom with the cream but that's when I added the red sauce/salsa to balance it out. Camarones Momias - Seasoned shrimp , fried , stuffed with mozzarella cheese and wrapped in bacon . Served with rice, salad , seasoned potatoes and garlic bread . I will be getting this next time. I only had a small sample and it didn't have mozzarella in it but even without it I thought this was very good. (the only drawback I would slight have with this is wishing I could order it as an appetizer vs a meal.From reading from the other reviews it seems like they are addressing the problems which is great when the owner listen to the customers (even when they are wrong and just complaining lol)  minus my 5 minute wait at the door I really didn't have a problem. I did notice Rafael at the bar after my food came out and not sure if you/he cooked my food at the time but it was excellent. Keep up the good work.Will be back and recommending this place.

9.description: Someone on a facebook group mentioned this place. So I thought I would check it out.  I went in the evening. Our waitress was young and nice but really couldn't answer our questions about some of the dishes. The menu was in Spanish and I was not familiar with the words.  The ambience was ok but the lighting was dim so it made it difficult to read the menu. The menu had very tiny print so it made it even more challenging.  I suspect I could have ordered something I would have really liked more than what I did order but I just was not able to read or see it.  Nonetheless I ordered a shrimp cocktail.  And ordered the ceviche. Both were excellent.. however the ceviche was a bit on the spicy side.  Wish I had known that. It was ok.  The shrimp in the cocktail was excellent.  All in all it was a good experience except for the lack of understanding the items on the menu and the dark lighting.   I would come back during the day where the place would be brighter. I will bring a magnifiying glass and a Spanish dictionary to get thru the menu.

29.description: Love this place! The food is great! The micheladas they prepare are the best!!!!

23.description: We tried El Ancla on a Friday afternoon and we were the only people in the joint. We were seated and were given a complimentary bowl of fish ceviche, which was quite good--although we could have purchased shrimp ceviche which I prefer. We then tried two different styles of oysters as appetizers, which also were tasty and quite filling by themselves. But the star of the show was the stuffed pineapple: crab meat, scallops, shrimp, and more in a piña colada-esque sauce, serves inside a hollowed out pineapple. The service was certainly acceptable and the waitress was polite, but considering that we were the only two in the place, I expected the waitress to be a bit more attentive. She tended to dawdle when she did serve us and seemed bothered when pulled away from her conversation with the other staff. Nevertheless, I was happy with every aspect of our visit and will certainly return to try more.

5.description: I'm writing this review on my way out of the restaurant. I'm giving it three stars for a few reasons. Music situation there is there is no music if the box is not playing you you're just sitting there in silence which is pretty uncomfortable. Also I noticed that we were told a price for the crab leg platter and it ended up being $8 more than what she quoted us. I usually get WAY MORE Chapuzon. At another nayarit style restaurant, for the price,  I also pay about 10-15$ less for the crab legs. The service was basic. We waited about 8 minutes to place our food order. But we did get a michelada mix pretty fast. The food was good. I wish there was more nayarit sauce. It might be worth the trip to make it back to the city. 2 things.  BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE,  and play some music! Jeez I know you have a jukebox but sitting in silence is the WORST. especially for a $100 meal for 2 people.

31.description: Great little neighborhood gem.   Everything we ordered was amazing and seasoned to perfection.  Our server Carlos was great.  Service was fast.  Food was fresh.  Awesome seafood and it's BYOB! Definitely a place to try and frequent.

25.description: We were here on Father's Day with about 15 people and we got a table right away. That was very nice! The starter fish with tostadas was very good and flavorful. And it was Byob so we were able to bring our modelos which was perfect! They also have a great michelada mix for your beers. I ordered the red snapper fish and shared with the table. My fish was perfectly soft and delicious. We also got the shrimps in all the different styles and I loved them all. The octopus chapuzon was so yummy. And my daughter loves their rice!

12.description: We ended up at Ancla by accident.  We had dropped off friends at O'Hare and our GPS warned us of "severe traffic" and routed us down River Road to Irving Park.  It was dinner time and we started looking for somewhere to eat. When I saw the Mariscos sign, we pulled over and decided to give this unknown a chance.   How lucky for us!  Service was friendly with just the right amount of attentiveness by Josslyn (sp). Instead of the tired chips and salsa served as an appetizer at most Mexican restaurants, we had a delicious little bowl of ceviche served with tortilla chips and saltines. It was best with the saltines. We both got the fried red snapper, I with garlic sauce and my husband with Ancla sauce. We were served the whole fish (I asked them to cut off the head on mine) and it was SO good!  It came with salad and rice. It was very reasonable too, at $18. Downtown where we live it would be double the price or more. Note:  as of now, anyway, it's BYOB.

21.description: Really great addition to the neighborhood. A top-notch Mariscos place that rivals some of the best/longest in the business. If you can see past the fact that this place is devoid of any design style or character, rest assured the effort went into the food. Think Chinese restaurant on this one. It's usually the most unassuming places that are the most epic. Free homemade michelada mix for my 40's of corona that I bought at the 7-11 next door? Don't mind if I do. I love BYOB places...and I especially have a spot in my heart for places that take it to the next level. I think they were just being nice offering the mix for free as I saw it listed on the menu for a couple of bucks. However, next time, if need be, I will gladly pay for it. Food was fresh, inventive, and definitely something that you would be hard pressed to find at any other restaurant on the NW side. Other reviewers have said it, but I will second: Get the Mocajete and the Pina Rellena and say goodnight. For 2 people, that is more than enough food. With drinks and an app, it could easily feed three! I hope this place continues to deliver on quality of food and service. If so, they've got a winner.

16.description: A welcome entry in a neighborhood lacking many options. Shrimp empanadas are excellent. Ceviche table starter has a very good and spicy salsa with it. BYOB, but the 7-11 is right next door.Have been twice since opening, and will return often.

17.description: We recently visited this place, very nice nice establishment- service was fine, as our main plate we ordered the "Charola Levanta Muertos." We asked the waiter on the portion of the plate since there was two options, the small and the big, he stated the the large portion was between 4-5lbs, since we were splitting this dish we thought it would be more than enough for two people, well to our dissatisfaction and mostly disappointment the portion wasn't near 4-5lbs as the waiter has told us.

10.description: Really great addition to the neighborhood. A top-notch Mariscos place that rivals some of the best/longest in the business. If you can see past the fact that this place is devoid of any design style or character, rest assured the effort went into the food. Think Chinese restaurant on this one. It's usually the most unassuming places that are the most epic. Free homemade michelada mix for my 40's of corona that I bought at the 7-11 next door? Don't mind if I do. I love BYOB places...and I especially have a spot in my heart for places that take it to the next level. I think they were just being nice offering the mix for free as I saw it listed on the menu for a couple of bucks. However, next time, if need be, I will gladly pay for it. Food was fresh, inventive, and definitely something that you would be hard pressed to find at any other restaurant on the NW side. Other reviewers have said it, but I will second: Get the Mocajete and the Pina Rellena and say goodnight. For 2 people, that is more than enough food. With drinks and an app, it could easily feed three! I hope this place continues to deliver on quality of food and service. If so, they've got a winner.

11.description: Stopped in for a lunch special.  Service was great. Ordered stuffed crab based on server recommendation.  Received complementary shrimp soup as well. Food was very flavorful, a surprise at every turn.  Great place I'd you're in the mood for seafood with  a Latin flair!

26.description: Was disappointed in service and the food as well. Although service was very kind, Every time we asked the waitress a question, she had to retreat into the kitchen to ask someone else. The raw oysters were served with ice and lime, no house sauces, place has no cocktail at all as well. Portions were good, but taste was so so. We will not return.

27.description: We ended up at Ancla by accident.  We had dropped off friends at O'Hare and our GPS warned us of "severe traffic" and routed us down River Road to Irving Park.  It was dinner time and we started looking for somewhere to eat. When I saw the Mariscos sign, we pulled over and decided to give this unknown a chance.   How lucky for us!  Service was friendly with just the right amount of attentiveness by Josslyn (sp). Instead of the tired chips and salsa served as an appetizer at most Mexican restaurants, we had a delicious little bowl of ceviche served with tortilla chips and saltines. It was best with the saltines. We both got the fried red snapper, I with garlic sauce and my husband with Ancla sauce. We were served the whole fish (I asked them to cut off the head on mine) and it was SO good!  It came with salad and rice. It was very reasonable too, at $18. Downtown where we live it would be double the price or more. Note:  as of now, anyway, it's BYOB.

35.description: It's about time a Mariscos place opens in the area.  We had the ceviche, empanadas, and shrimp and fish tacos as appetizers and they were all great.  Had the stuffed fish as an entree and it was delicious. Washed everything down with their house sangria. The service was excellent.

0.description: My family and I stopped to dine at this restaurant when we were craving Mexican-style seafood last night. We had no expectations, and I am pleased to report that we were pleasantly surprised by how delicious everything turned out. The green and red table sauces were tasty and spicy; the red one was VERY spicy. Be careful when trying it! It might not seem spicy at first, but give it 30 seconds for the heat to build. You'll see what I mean :-)We were a group of 20 diners and entrees ordered varied widely. Stuffed pineapple, red snapper, shrimp cocktails, ceviche...they were all delicious! The octopus was tender, the scallops and shrimp seemed fresh. No unsatisfied diners at our table. Try it for authentic Mexican-style seafood dishes. You won't be disappointed!By the way, the place is BYOB. Take as much beer in as you want; no hard liquor allowed.

20.description: A welcome entry in a neighborhood lacking many options. Shrimp empanadas are excellent. Ceviche table starter has a very good and spicy salsa with it. BYOB, but the 7-11 is right next door.Have been twice since opening, and will return often.

19.description: Our waitress Carla was awesome, she recommended a large family style plate which included rice, garlic bread, shrimp wrapped in bacon, shrimp empanadas, a whole fried Red Snapper, camarones a la diabla, house camarones/octopus in a spicy red sauce big enough to share amongst the four of us. We also had a large shrimp ceviche plate. Carla fue un placer cenar en tu restaurant mil gracias y nos vemos en California.

33.description: Incredible! Our server, Carlos was amazing! His service was fantastic! The food was delicious! We felt adventurous and tried several items and were completely blown away. Best restaurant in the area by far! I would 6+ stars if I could! Will definitely recommend to all friends and family! We will undoubtably be regulars!

2.description: Had a great time here last night ! The food was amazing and our waitress was so attentive. So happy to gave found my new favorite mariscos place ! I no longer have to take trips to the south side for decent mariscos : )

34.description: This an amazing restaurant. Food is delicious and an excellent service. This is a place you must try.

32.description: Food excelent, the service with our server Carlos was great, definitely I'm going back and invite my friends

18.description: I heard from an acquaintance about this place and that it had a lot of seafood. I live in the area and unfortunately I can not read Spanish so that put me at a disadvantage. I went during the evening. I was handed the menu. I had a lot of obstacles to figure out the menu.  First I could not read Spanish, secondly the light was very dark and I could not see, and the the print was very small.  The waitress, a young girl, who was polite but not very engaging was not helpful and seemed very awkward.  I ordered what I could see or understand. I ordered the ceviche and the shrimp cocktail which were both good but they basically were very similar. I should have ordered something else but I was frustrated because I felt at a loss at this place.  I understand that your customer base is mostly Spanish but there are some people in the neighborhood who would like to visit your establishment who can not read Spanish. Sorry.  I would try this place again and bring a Spanish friend, a flashlight and a magnifying glass..

13.description: I recently moved and have been looking for a Mexican Seafood restaurant near me. Well this is it! Great food and great service! My kids don't like Seafood and there were plenty of other options for them to choose from. I had the langosta rellena (stuffed lobster) it was so delicious and plenty for two. I took half of it for leftovers the next day, and it was just as good.

4.description: This place is newly opened so we wanted to come check it out . It's BYOB and there's a 7-11 next door. The vibe is mellow and dimmed lights. The service was super friendly , all the waitstaff will come to you if u need something. Ceviche de camaron appetizer was fresh. I had the coctel de camaron large, it was huge with a bunch of shrimp and avocado and not to tomatoey which I really like. My friend ordered mojarra al mojo and loved it. Definitely coming back !!!

24.description: I can't even begin to describe how delicious the piña rellena is. So flavorful, so cheesy.. I swear I didn't even know exactly what types of seafood was in it (I know it had shrimp and octopus) but I kept wanting more. My friend ordered the molcajete and it was amazing. It was spicy, and juicy. We also had a couple micheladas (it's BYOB!!) They provide you with the mix which is pretty damn good as well. I'd love to know what their recipe is!! Service was great, atmosphere was nice, bathrooms were clean. Overall, we enjoyed our experience and highly recommend this place. :)

6.description: Holy fucking shit. The fact that this place is BYOB did not faze me for a sec. There is a 3 dollar charge for an ice bucket but bring how much ever booze you like. Let's get down to the food. When they serve you the salsa with the chips, its verrry spicy!! And I like my spice and my girlfriend is from Pakistan and even she thought it was spicy as hell. You've been warned. For our app, we ordered the oysters in the shell "especiales" which has everything on them. Very delicious and fresh. They came with shrimp, octopus and  avocado on them, so good!!For our platillos my gf ordered the langostinos which is basically a species between crawfish and lobster? (Not sure, so sorry if this is a lie). But whatever it was, oh my god. Perfectly spiced and flavorful, we could eat it all day. Next, I recommend the pina rellena. Its essentially a stuffed pineapple. I love food stuffed with other food, It is one of my favorite things about food in this world. But this is a pineapple stuffed with shrimp, octopus crab, scallop, bell peppers and fundido cheese. This pineapple is what Latin island dreams are made of. Perfectly sweet with a seafood tang. Add some hot sauce and you will know what it is to love again. The service here is spectacular. Consistent, friendly and helpful. Our waitress was very sweet. The menu is all in Spanish but the staff speaks fluent English and will assist you in the choices you make. Our bill was very cheap for the quality of food and service and quantity we received!! I'm blown away!! Everyone should try this place at least once!

22.description: I'm writing this review on my way out of the restaurant. I'm giving it three stars for a few reasons. Music situation there is there is no music if the box is not playing you you're just sitting there in silence which is pretty uncomfortable. Also I noticed that we were told a price for the crab leg platter and it ended up being $8 more than what she quoted us. I usually get WAY MORE Chapuzon. At another nayarit style restaurant, for the price,  I also pay about 10-15$ less for the crab legs. The service was basic. We waited about 8 minutes to place our food order. But we did get a michelada mix pretty fast. The food was good. I wish there was more nayarit sauce. It might be worth the trip to make it back to the city. 2 things.  BETTER CUSTOMER SERVICE,  and play some music! Jeez I know you have a jukebox but sitting in silence is the WORST. especially for a $100 meal for 2 people.

15.description: Fantastic. We had the Shrimp Empanadas and I had the Pina Relleno. Top 10 one of the best meals we have ever had! Service was excellent, and the atmosphere was great. I will be spreading the word!

7.description: I can't even begin to describe how delicious the piña rellena is. So flavorful, so cheesy.. I swear I didn't even know exactly what types of seafood was in it (I know it had shrimp and octopus) but I kept wanting more. My friend ordered the molcajete and it was amazing. It was spicy, and juicy. We also had a couple micheladas (it's BYOB!!) They provide you with the mix which is pretty damn good as well. I'd love to know what their recipe is!! Service was great, atmosphere was nice, bathrooms were clean. Overall, we enjoyed our experience and highly recommend this place. :)

8.description: The 3 stars are for the ceviche, that ws really good. The atmosphere is meh, no music, one server who did not seem to know anything (even when something said Market Price, whats the price? I don't know let me check, 3 minutes later..., and then what do you put in this? Eh I don't know let me ask, uuuuummmm ok? ordering took forever, and the food took a little while to come out, it was just the 2 of us in the whole place) We both got the stuffed pineapple (the stuffed lobster was ~$50, I wasn't really sure if was worth it considering I have gotten for the same prices at much fancier restaurants) so I didn't get it. The stuffed pineapple was meh, the mixture was too cheesy and sweet for me to taste anything else.

30.description: I ate here a few weeks ago with some friends. Right away I was greeted by their staff. They are so sweet and friendly! We were given our waters, ceviche, salsa, lime, and tostadas before we ordered. Our waitress was polite and our food came fast. I ordered the langostinos. Perfectly fresh and spicy! One of my friends had the caldo 7 mares, it was so delicious. This is a great place. I love how clean the restaurant is and how fresh the food is. We all know how important cleanliness is, especially when eating seafood. I can't wait to go back!

3.description: The red salsa really is on the hot side. I eat fire, and I had to take it easy. Okay, here goes. The House special oysters were some of the cleanest and most fresh I had had in Chicago. The grilled mussels were good overall, a bit on the salty side due to the sauce, but seemed to balance when eaten with the fresh cucumber and tomato that was with them. Friendly service, clean place. I will be going back to try the caldos, and the larger platters. Very nice change of pace for the area.

14.description: Had the shrimp ceviche.  Delicious.  Had the shrimp "your way" with the house specIal sauce.  Just the right amount of flavor and spiciness.  My friend had shrimp "your way" with garlic sauce and she loved it.  Snacks on the table are a super nice compliment.  Our server was friendly, helpful, and just the right amount of attentiveness.  Don't forget BYOB!

1.description: Ordered from here with my coworker today because it was a very busy day and neither one of us had time to leave the store. Delivery was about 35mins which was ok but when the food arrived I was just upset! I ordered the lunch special which was the number 17 Bourbon chicken and when you I tell you that was the driest chicken in my life omg!!! I called to speak with them and they flat out told me that's the way they prepare the dish and when I said I wasn't happy he said well that's our style and I don't care if you don't like it!!! Needless to say I'm still hungry but one things for sure I'll never in life order from here again!!!!

9.description: This place is close to my house and it's a pretty decent Chinese restaurant. I recommend their Mongolian beef. Prices are pretty good and the owner is very friendly.

12.description: The best Chinese food in the city! Very nice people, they always recognize me and know what I want. The lunch special is excellent. Their beef is very rich, as is their orange chicken. The food isn't as greasy as other restaurants either. The best part? They don't give you regular fried rice, they give you chicken fried rice with your order. And it's fresh with white meat! There isn't an excess of sauce either, your food doesn't swim in Sauce. I doubt you will finish it, it's just like buying two meals! Everyone who came here loves it.

21.description: I came here last Friday night really hoping to be satisfied because it'a right by my house. Sadly, I was disappointed. The egg rolls to me were not even edible. I took one bite, hated it, then discarded it. I thought the BBQ pork was just okay. I ate it all, but I've had much better. The only thing good about the Kung pao chicken was the white rice. I do not recommend this place at all to anyone.

16.description: Some of the best Chinese food. The family that owns this is really cool, they're very close with my family as well. The food is good as hell, but again, its Chinese food. It's pretty solid, it's good all around. Quick delivery, and definitely cheap and delicious.

17.description: If you stick to the simple stuff like fried rice, they make it alright.

10.description: Excellent food!  Fresh, light, not greasy at all... and possibly the best fried rice I've ever had.  Big chunks of white meat chicken with no gristle.  Crispy veggies, delicious sauces, and large amounts of food for the price.  They will happily make your food without MSG, and it still tastes great.  This is my new spot.  (Sorry Jess Cafe, you have been replaced!)

5.description: Worst food EVER! Ordered lunch special Mongolian Beef. Only thing special about it was that it was served last week.  Beef was terrible, tough, and served in salisbury steak gravy. The chicken fried rice was so dried out and tasteless that this ended up in the garbage after a few bites. Won't ever eat here again. Disgusting!

11.description: Good Chinese food and there quick if you call ahead. My wife and I usually get Mongolian beef, fried rice and egg rolls and try a new item we never tried. A good place for carry out in the hood

22.description: They have thier regular lunch specials like every chinese restaurant in the chicagoland area but thier fried rice is what keeps me coming back!

0.description: For some quick Chinese delivery, it was actually pretty good!  I'm picky about my Chinese take out and in general don't love places like this and prefer authenticity.  But you know, when the craving for some fried rice hits, beggars can't be choosers.  My dude and I each got a dinner to share.  The dinners are about $8 and come with tons of chicken fried rice, an egg roll, two crab rangoons and a pop.  Our entrees were egg foo young and pork chop suey.  All surprisingly good and for a really reasonable price.

20.description: Solid take out Chinese food.  Good egg rolls, pot stickers, mongolian beef, beef with broccoli, and shrimp in lobster sauce.  Quick Delivery times, usually under 30 minutes and good prices.

19.description: Solid take out Chinese food.  Good egg rolls, pot stickers, mongolian beef, beef with broccoli, and shrimp in lobster sauce.  Quick Delivery times, usually under 30 minutes and good prices.

2.description: We were coming back from Menards after revising our kitchen layout when we passed China Chef.  This is a small storefront Chinese restaurant @ Dunning Square, 4042 N Narragansett.  The restaurant is nothing fancy.  The food is ok, but nothing to rave about.I got the combination plate with shrimp egg foo young (pretty good), chicken fried rice (ehh average), egg roll (probably the best item) & crab Rangoon (more like cheese Rangoon).  My wife got the beef noodle soup which had beef (gristley), noodles, & Bol choy.  Her brother ordered the chicken & pea pods which was pretty good (the pea pods were perfectly cooked (still green & nice & crispy)

18.description: Since I moved up here I had trouble finding a good Chinese restaurant that was as good as the one back home. This has very good food and large portions. The price is very reasonable for the sizes the give.

13.description: China Chef is your average, neighborhood Chinese food joint. I see a couple of bad reviews, but really, I'm not sure what they were expecting. They're not trying to be Chinatown/Downtown fancy or anything. Sometimes, you just need a decent neighborhood staple. I head to "the Chef" here when I want some Chinese food because it's close to home and always consistent. They have vegetarian options that aren't greasy and heavy (although they have fried stuff, if that's what you're looking for!). The smoothies with tapioca are pretty good. The owner is super nice and recognizes me every time I come in. They've never gotten my order wrong and are always very nice. They deliver and it's usually fast (under 30 minutes, even if they quote longer).

4.description: I enjoy this restaurant because the food is GREAT and the prices are super low. I think they are SUPER friendly!

6.description: This place is a dump! The Owner or who ever he is , is a complete a-hole!! He is always rushing you to make your order and is giving attitude when you ask about certain items on the menu. There food is garbage.. The only thing good about this place is the  smoothies! Best smoothies! That is the only thing I would recommend on their menu!!

15.description: What a let down!!!! Reviews lead me to believe this is top notch Chinese cuisine, but not for my palate. Bland, dry, undercooked food. True, There's lots of food, but who cares when it's not worth eating

7.description: We ordered takeout from there again.  This time they seemed to have a different chef.. everything we had was really really bland.  The chicken, the soup etc.. not sure what happened.

8.description: Ordered here for the first time for pick up.  When I called to place my order, the guy on the phone sounded ride and in a hurry to hang up.  My food was ready when I gotthere which was the best part.When I got home, my husbands orange chicken was burnt to a crisp.  My general tso's chicken was burnt as well but not as bad as his.  I called and told then it was burnt and they offered for us to come back and get another orange chicken for no charge.  That was was also burnt!

3.description: Pretty good quick Chinese food fix.

14.description: We had great take out from here. Loved the hot wings, mongolian beef was perfectly spicy, combo lo mein was delishous.  Veggies were crisp and fresh - its a great local spot with friendly owners and good prices.

28.description: Super Fresh, Super Fast And GOOD PRICES!I don't write alot of reviews but I had to write one for this place. I couldn't believe all these neg reviews!  Honestly, I'm in love with this place.  I've eaten here well over 10 times, I usually get the sushi, appetizers or special rolls. Their stuff is always fresh. I've never waited longer than 10 mins for even large take out orders, they deliver relatively fast, their estimations are accurate at least. Presentations are professional.  One of the best things about Yummy is that I can eat here no matter how far I am from pay day, If I've got some extra cash I can splurge some higher end special rolls,  if not I can get a couple great rolls for $10. The Chinese options are really affordable, I've had the chicken and pork fried rice and crab rangoon, both really decent.  I recommend their 'yummy salad'  the original dressing compliments the roe and the fish is really fresh, but its not very big. Its great to share it as an appetizer with a few rolls. I recommend the Beauty and the B, Alaskan, and spider roll. I really like their bbq eel, which is included in a lot of different rolls too. Im not much of a fan of their tuna or smoked fish however. But if you can find a better sushi joint in the area I'd be surprised, don't miss out!!

1.description: We arrived for dinner around 6:30 and when we walked in it was not a friendly welcome. Dismissing that we order sea weed salad and a cold spinach salad with peanut sauce . The spinach sauce was very sweet and it was a lot of dressing which makes it hard to eat and enjoy.Then we order two dragon roll sushi for both and again the eel sauce tested like a burnt one and the fish inside tasted old and not fresh. I always enjoy sushi with eel and ate in numerous places so it absolute didn't taste quite right. The price absolutely doesn't match the quality of their food nor the service .

9.description: I can't believe that anyone posted badly about Yummy. This is one of my favorite places in the area. Everything is delicious. Their sushi is great. My boyfriend didn't like sushi before he had sushi at this place. Now he's addicted. I've never had one bad thing from this place. I like how they offer a variety of smoothie additives aside from the basic tapioca balls. Can you say mango pearls? Delicious! They have great prices for sushi as well. Their basic sushi rolls range from $4-$6. You can't get much better than that. I would highly recommend this place.

29.description: Really good sushi. Their Singapore noodles are really good too. The service isn't great or I would give it a 5 star rating but I can't complain about the food at all and I've been here 4 times now.

23.description: The food is delicious and they are always fast! They have some really great lunch specials too!! Not busy during lunch so the service is good too, great time to go in and sit down!!

5.description: The best Chinese and Japanese food in the area !!! Inexpensive, great tasting sushi rolls, and good selection of steamed foods.

31.description: I ate there a few days ago, I finally feel well enough to write a review.  I got really sick eating there.  I do not recommend this restaurant.

25.description: Food was okay, Not bad. Not much flavor and didn't enjoy it while I was eating. Probably wouldn't go there again despite living so close.

12.description: Today was the first time I ever ordered food from this restaurant, the sushi never again. My husband and I got incredibly sick after eating the sushi from here and it wasn't even that good. The other food was good though. .

37.description: Pretty good for delivery sushi in the neighborhood, if delivery sushi is what you're in a pinch for...took 60 minutes exactly from order to door. Portions seemed small for what we paid, but the quality and flavor were there.I was not overly impressed with the special roll we had (dragon)...again, quality of fish was good, presentation was decent, but the size of the roll was not what you would expect from a "specialty roll" at a $12 price point--was pretty much a standard size roll topped with very thin layers of fish. Seaweed salad was a seaweed salad, but again, 50% of the size of a standard seaweed salad from any other place. 3 out of 5 because they're just getting started and probably ironing out a few kinks. I'll give it another couple of months before I try again, but would not discourage anyone from patronizing them in the meantime. Perhaps the dine-in or the Chinese menu is the better way to go...I'll find out sooner or later, I'm sure.

21.description: My husband and I like this place.  He likes the miso soup and the chicken on a stick. I get the Mongolian beef.  I like having a Chinese food option in the neighborhood.  I have never had their sushi. I think I'll stick with hands on sushi for that.

16.description: I really tried to like this place but I just can't seem to find anything I really enjoyed eating. I ordered my safe dishes when trying new Chinese restaurants which consist of Chicken Fried Rice and Sweet and sour chicken.   and my my my was I disappointed, First off let's get it out the way we are all used to traditional brown color fried rice and well this one was YELLOW!! and easily very under cooked!! Peas and other veggies were still really hard!! NOT IMPRESSED!!Sweet and sour chicken was EH! the Skin was not fried enough and it still very doughy and the chicken was slimy and not very tasty at ALL!! Ordered some Frieds Wontons with beef and that was the one thing I was MOST looking forward to to only be disappointed.  Wontons were extremely stale tasting and seemed to have been fried in old oil!! just not good! Def prolly will pass this place up and not order from it anymore.

17.description: Since there's no good sushi places around here and I'm not fond of the Chinese places I've tried, I kept my eye on this place as soon as I noticed they were moving in. Checked their site once more before lunchtime today to see they had online ordering (10% off to boot)--sign me up! So what did I get: crab rangoon, shrimp tempura and mixed veggie rolls, and a coconut smoothie with mango pearls (random, I know). Both rolls were 5 pieces, but they were the larger sized pieces, tightly rolled and easy on the rice. The shrimp in particular seemed freshly cooked and still tender--not tough and rubbery like it sometimes gets. Since I ordered the 2-roll lunch special ($9), it also came with a fresh, good-sized side salad. The crab rangoon was pretty average with a nice savory, creamy center. Came with that standard blindingly red sweet and sour sauce; would love it if they could make their own sauce because it'd be more interesting and unique. Coconut smoothie also average (not that that's a bad thing), but the mango pearls are what really make this--I've never seen mango or lychee pearls on any bubble tea menu. The pearls have these delicate skins, so when you put a bit of pressure on them, they pop open with this gooey tart fruit flavor. Fruit caviar. Weird, delicious fruit caviar~The restaurant itself looked very clean, minimal, and contemporary with a decent amount of seating. There's a large open area in front of the counter that could fit a few more tables so I guess they're expecting a lot of take-out? Staff was prompt and friendly. As far as what I ordered, prices seemed pretty much on par with other places I've been to.Will definitely be back, especially to see how their Chinese offerings stack up against the stuff I've had from other local places.

10.description: I like the food, but the driver always complains about the tip I give...he literally yells at me

11.description: The first and last time I came here was maybe a month after opening, I ordered an avocado smoothie w tapioca. I literally waited half an hour. People came In after me and got their food before I got my smoothie! I kept asking about it n all I kept getting was oh yeah five minutes. Horrible. If I hadn't already paid I would've left

26.description: Ordering online was easy and the food came in half an hour. It was yummy!

27.description: I was driving by and saw this restaurant, since I did not have lunch yet, I decided to try it.Ordered Tuna Roll and Beef with garlic sauce.Based on the Tuna roll I had, I would stay away from their Sushi bar.The Beef with garlic sauce was decent.Would I stop by again? I do not think so.The staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean.

35.description: not good. i had a cold, so i ordered chicken rice soup. it arrived in a nice container, but it was BROWN! BROWN chicken rice soup??? with weird looking chicken pieces. looked like chopped up chicken feet................crab rangoon was nothing special. neon red sauce was too sweet.mongolian beef was just ok, but probably the best thing we ordered.shrimp egg foo young had that "cornstarch gravy" that turns in to a "gel" when it cools off...ick!delivery was quick but i will never order from here again!

8.description: The food is ok. I've had them once before and I had no issues. They even showed up earlier than my estimated delivery time. (I order off Grubhub.) This time, though, it's a different story. I placed my order around 8:30pm and got an estimated delivery time of 9:20pm. Now I know sometimes they're going to run a little late and there's traffic or a lot of orders that need to be delivered, I get that. But at 9:40pm I called and asked how much longer it would be. The lady said soon that there was traffic. Ok. You're not that far from me so there can't be that much traffic. THIRTY MINUTES LATER it's still not here, I call back and she answers again saying another fifteen minutes. So I have to wait 2 hours for chicken and broccoli and crab rangoon. This is getting ridiculous. 10:30pm and still nothing.UPDATE: it got here as soon as i posted this. the guy was nice enough about it and said they were understaffed so I guess I'll let it slide this time. But I will be more cautious about ordering with them next time. the food is good though.

0.description: Steam dumplings and orange chicken lunch were very tasty and delivered much more quickly than projected. I ordered through the Yelp eat24 app. The delivery driver was very nice and didn't mind the dog. Overall, I am happy with Yummy. This is not the first time I've ordered from them and will likely not be the last.

38.description: Since there's no good sushi places around here and I'm not fond of the Chinese places I've tried, I kept my eye on this place as soon as I noticed they were moving in. Checked their site once more before lunchtime today to see they had online ordering (10% off to boot)--sign me up! So what did I get: crab rangoon, shrimp tempura and mixed veggie rolls, and a coconut smoothie with mango pearls (random, I know). Both rolls were 5 pieces, but they were the larger sized pieces, tightly rolled and easy on the rice. The shrimp in particular seemed freshly cooked and still tender--not tough and rubbery like it sometimes gets. Since I ordered the 2-roll lunch special ($9), it also came with a fresh, good-sized side salad. The crab rangoon was pretty average with a nice savory, creamy center. Came with that standard blindingly red sweet and sour sauce; would love it if they could make their own sauce because it'd be more interesting and unique. Coconut smoothie also average (not that that's a bad thing), but the mango pearls are what really make this--I've never seen mango or lychee pearls on any bubble tea menu. The pearls have these delicate skins, so when you put a bit of pressure on them, they pop open with this gooey tart fruit flavor. Fruit caviar. Weird, delicious fruit caviar~The restaurant itself looked very clean, minimal, and contemporary with a decent amount of seating. There's a large open area in front of the counter that could fit a few more tables so I guess they're expecting a lot of take-out? Staff was prompt and friendly. As far as what I ordered, prices seemed pretty much on par with other places I've been to.Will definitely be back, especially to see how their Chinese offerings stack up against the stuff I've had from other local places.

20.description: An update... I used to love this place-- really, REALLY love... Until my last visit. I personally don't eat fish so I always order vegetarian sushi. On the other hand my husband loves sushi and sashimi. We ordered our usual orders on our last dinner visit in early July and I was completely fine but my husband started having stomach pain the morning after eating the sushi. (We know that eating raw and undercooked fish can make you sick however when it's prepared FRESH and professionally it should be completely safe to consume or otherwise they wouldn't allow it to be served) He suffered with diarrhea (sorry-tmi) and stomach spasms for over a week before we got him in to see a doctor and turns out he had a stomach infection (he's stubborn and thought he could suffer through it and it would get better on its own- wrong). The doctor put him on a slew of medications for infection, stomach discomfort and stomach spasms. He would have intense stomach pain an hour after he would eat anything and it would last anywhere from half an hour to a few hours every time. We changed his diet- nothing helped with the pain. The real lifesaver for him was the bentyl the doctor prescribed for the stomach spasms that reduced the pain. It took him about 6 weeks to completely recover and he can now finally eat without pain again. So in a nutshell- never again. Never, ever, EVER will i ever order anything from there again, regardless of how incredibly amazing the sweet potato sushi tastes. My previous review:They have theeee best sweet potato sushi. I'm not a fish person so my choices are usually limited to cucumber or avocado at most places but the sweet potato is a nice alternative. It's deep fried sweet potato and it comes with a brown sauce drizzled- absolutely delicious! You must try it!They also have bubble teas- lychee is my fav :)

19.description: An update... I used to love this place-- really, REALLY love... Until my last visit. I personally don't eat fish so I always order vegetarian sushi. On the other hand my husband loves sushi and sashimi. We ordered our usual orders on our last dinner visit in early July and I was completely fine but my husband started having stomach pain the morning after eating the sushi. (We know that eating raw and undercooked fish can make you sick however when it's prepared FRESH and professionally it should be completely safe to consume or otherwise they wouldn't allow it to be served) He suffered with diarrhea (sorry-tmi) and stomach spasms for over a week before we got him in to see a doctor and turns out he had a stomach infection (he's stubborn and thought he could suffer through it and it would get better on its own- wrong). The doctor put him on a slew of medications for infection, stomach discomfort and stomach spasms. He would have intense stomach pain an hour after he would eat anything and it would last anywhere from half an hour to a few hours every time. We changed his diet- nothing helped with the pain. The real lifesaver for him was the bentyl the doctor prescribed for the stomach spasms that reduced the pain. It took him about 6 weeks to completely recover and he can now finally eat without pain again. So in a nutshell- never again. Never, ever, EVER will i ever order anything from there again, regardless of how incredibly amazing the sweet potato sushi tastes. My previous review:They have theeee best sweet potato sushi. I'm not a fish person so my choices are usually limited to cucumber or avocado at most places but the sweet potato is a nice alternative. It's deep fried sweet potato and it comes with a brown sauce drizzled- absolutely delicious! You must try it!They also have bubble teas- lychee is my fav :)

33.description: Tired the food the first time and didn't really like it. The rice was a weird yellow color and flavorless. My boyfriend recommended we try something else from the resturant and give it another shot. I ordered the "brown rice ", it was brown but it was not rice, flavorless also. The sushi was very messy looking like it was rushed. Very disappointed.. Will not be going back.

2.description: This place is awesome. Happened to drive by and stopped in with the family. The food was light and fresh. Even the fried food was light. We didn't feel all greasy afterwards.  I highly recommend this place!

34.description: I really tried to like this place but I just can't seem to find anything I really enjoyed eating. I ordered my safe dishes when trying new Chinese restaurants which consist of Chicken Fried Rice and Sweet and sour chicken.   and my my my was I disappointed, First off let's get it out the way we are all used to traditional brown color fried rice and well this one was YELLOW!! and easily very under cooked!! Peas and other veggies were still really hard!! NOT IMPRESSED!!Sweet and sour chicken was EH! the Skin was not fried enough and it still very doughy and the chicken was slimy and not very tasty at ALL!! Ordered some Frieds Wontons with beef and that was the one thing I was MOST looking forward to to only be disappointed.  Wontons were extremely stale tasting and seemed to have been fried in old oil!! just not good! Def prolly will pass this place up and not order from it anymore.

32.description: This is our second time to Yummy and we love it.  This is not your hole-in-the wall Chinese place.  The decor is modern and classy.  The food is plentiful and has a light taste (not greasy and heavy like other Chinese restaurants.)  I love that I can enjoy sushi and Chinese food at the same meal. I also love that they offer brown rice.

18.description: Not good. Had spicy crunch tuna roll and white tuna sushi. The roll was spicy, but also flavorless. Spicyness drowned out any taste. It was like they just mixed tuna with sriracha and called it a day. White tuna didn't taste fresh and was chewy. The service was polite and quick but for the food quality, it wasn't a good experience. Also very over priced for the quality. $5 for two pieces of chewy white tuna? I'll pass.

13.description: One of the best Chinese foods ever! the place is small but is great. The food is so good and fresh. Did I mention how cheap it was, the lunch special was under $6 and included a soda, talk about a deal!

4.description: Prices for the lunch special is great, but the food isn't! Staff wasn't very friendly when I asked questions about popular dishes after mentioning it was my first time there. I wanted to know about the sushi/Japanese food (popular sushi rolls) in addition to the Chinese. The lady just shrugged her shoulders and said she didn't know it's whatever I like. Won't be returning.

24.description: Not good. Had spicy crunch tuna roll and white tuna sushi. The roll was spicy, but also flavorless. Spicyness drowned out any taste. It was like they just mixed tuna with sriracha and called it a day. White tuna didn't taste fresh and was chewy. The service was polite and quick but for the food quality, it wasn't a good experience. Also very over priced for the quality. $5 for two pieces of chewy white tuna? I'll pass.

6.description: I used grub hub for delivery this evening to order from Yummy for the first time.  I've driven past the restaurant a few times and wondered if the food was any good so I thought I would give it a try.  I ordered the side salad with ginger dressing on the side, crab Rangoon, and a Philadelphia roll.  The ginger dressing tastes home made and is delicious!  The salad was fresh and not overly garnished.  The crab Rangoon could have been fuller as far as how much filling was actually in the crispy shell, though they were good.  I have not tried the roll yet as I ordered that to have for lunch tomorrow but by the looks of it I should enjoy it quite well!

22.description: Chicken and string beans was very chewy. No texture of chicken at all. Very disappointed.

15.description: This is my "go to spot" for Chinese food.  The crab ragoon and any of the entrees are delicious.  I usually pick up my order but it's a great place to go if you want to eat at a restaurant.  It's not your typical stuffy Chinese restaurant dining room.  It's very laid back and clean with a flat screen tv on the wall.  Check out this spot if you're in the mood for Chinese food.

7.description: Just ordered the soft shell crab tempura and it was very good... Prepared perfectly, all the way down to the cute, perfect sized container it came in. The spicy, crunchy salmon rolls were even better. I think, instead of ordering next time, I'll go eat there. It was a little cold (the crab) but I attribute that to the delivery. I would eat here again, and I would recommend it to friends!

36.description: Nasty terrible. Just ordered from them and immediately has to write my Yelp review.  So mad that I gave this place a shot after I called to place my order, and when asking them if their bubble teas were fresh or powder, she hesitated  to answer. Should've listened to my gut. Service was terrible. I arrived and the girl at the register was more interested in her iPhone game than saying hello. She kept going to the back to check on my order and everytime would resume her game, yet my chalk tasting bubble teas weren't even blended yet. Pretty annoying that i still waited for my order and not a soul on the restaurant. Went straight home to try our grub. My shrimp walnut was barely warm. You could tell that they were reheated. The middle of the dish was on the tad cold side soI lost my appetite, wouldn't even finish my food with the thought of how long the shrimp was sitting out, waiting to be reheated. The fried rice was bland and flavorless. JC said soy sauce would help. Not a chance. You can tell they used a frozen veggie bag to make their fried rice. GrossHe was less than pleased with his shrimp and broccoli, his go to choice dish at every Chinese restaurant. Brown sauce, no flavor. At least his dish was hot. And yes, the bubble teas were nasty.  You can taste the chalk from the powder they used from it. Gross gross gross! Never again would I go back. Stay away from here. I was so excited to maybe have found a Chinese restaurant in our neighborhood but the quest still continues.

30.description: The food wasn't bad.  I had 2 different rolls and the both seemed fresh.  Smoothies were good.

3.description: I'm not sure why the reviews are so bi-polar. People either love or hate this place. I ordered through Grubhub, because the reviews were good there. Plus, I liked their menu and the fact that they had a 'healthy section'. Delivery was very prompt on a Saturday night- within 30 minutes. And I liked their food.

14.description: I've never been to this place till a co worker told me about it. I decided to get an order of sweet and sour chicken and a bubble tea with tapioca. The bubble tea was amazing! The chicken was a little over done but other than that, not bad. I'll try something different next time.

58.description: The subs scream out value for moneyTrumps the sub chains anyday..  They are heavy on spice seasonings .. Might ask them to go easy next time.. Most of their Grocery are on the expensive side.. They will survive just as a sandwich shop though

56.description: Deli place that sells good sandwiches, but where you can also get anchovies, Italian sausage, etc.

29.description: The Italian sub from Bari may be the best I've ever had! Bari is definitely my preferred sandwich joint in the area! The prosciutto and mozzarella sub was also very tasty! Will definitely be offering from Bari again!!

42.description: A true jewel in the city. Those three types of Italian sausage they gave us were the best sausages we have ever had. Also I have a list of the top three brands of anchovies in my wallet and have been looking for one of them here in Chicago for over a year. Finally found one at Bari's. Also the veal baloney just melts in your mouth. This is going to be a regular stop for us from now on!

23.description: For a neighborhood grocer/deli, they sure do a brisk business around the lunch hour! Although it was a great spot to pick up some grub after a morning at the Shedd, parking was pretty non-existent and we had to park 3 blocks away!  Oh well, we had meatballs on the brain so we had to commit. When facing the deli counter, you order at the L side--the line kind of queues that way, there is no number system so just ask the person in front of you if they are in 'the line'. I've had the regular Italian sub here and was less than impressed.  There was just something about the bread that seemed "off".  Please don't tell me that you served me day old bread, it didn't seem as fresh as I thought Italian bread should be.  The meat?  excellent.  We went back to try the hot subs and shared the sausage sub and a meatball sub. Now I felt those were much better than the cold sub. The bread on both sandwiches was so much better. Fresh and chewy soft.  Both the meatball and sausage were flavorful, but I really liked the sausage more--the flavor was bolder and heartier. There are tons of different chips to round out your meal, a cooler of their house made sauces (yum!), cheeses, staples like pasta and olive oils, small selection of fresh veggies..lots of items packed in the small store.  Deli guys are abrupt, but the cashier ladies are always kind and chatty.  I love how they dote on my son.

47.description: We come back to Chicago every year. Whenever we are in town we visit Ralph and Frankie and get our spicy italian w/ imported provalone. No where else have we found a better sandwich. Who needs mayo when the flavors of the meats and cheese and crusty breadWe also grab a couple of jars of their homemade giardinera. We have given some to friends all over the western United States to try and have received many compliments and testimonies of goodness. From mild to Extra Hot the labels speaks the truth.  The mild can be fed to your children and the Extra hot has habanero in it, need i say more?

8.description: A few of my friends kept mentioning this place and their sandwiches, so I stopped in for a bite. Bari did not disappoint. The sandwich I had was amazing! Fresh ingredients that were nicely composed into a beautiful and tasty sandwich. And all of the staff at this little Italian style grocery store were very friendly and helpful. I am by no means a sandwich expert. So being as it was my first time here, I asked a lot of questions about the deli and the grocery store in general. And the person at the counter was polite and patient with my "light" interrogation. All of the food items looked really good. And when I come back here for a second time, I already know what I want to try.

31.description: They jacked up their prices last week when they got a new sign. They incorrectly charged me for a sub. It says on the menu- roast beef and cheese-$6.75. They proceeded to charge me an extra $.75 for cheese even though it's supposed to be included. I've been going here for 7 years, and I always thought it was good for the price. Now it's not worth the price at all! Try a much better sub place on Taylor St.- Conte di Savoia. Better quality meat, much better bread, and an overall better experience in regards to interacting with the workers. Bari has rude workers with a bad attitude. Also, there's now real order to the place, lunchtime is chaos, and frustratingly stupid. Avoid this place at all costs.

34.description: Bari is a neighborhood grocery that has managed to charm a large number or Chicago citizens over time. Everybody was talking about this place and especially about its sandwiches, so I decided it was time to find out whether Bari was worth all the positive comments. Once I entered this Italian style grocery store I noticed that customers were treated very nicely and more than 10 people were standing in line to buy sandwiches. I was pleased to see that this place sells a wide range of meat, hard bread and many other ingredients. The homemade giardiniera looked amazing so I couldn't help buying a jar, decision I totally praise now.  I also bought a prosciutto and mozzarella sandwich that made me fall in love with this place. I ate half of it and although I was already full I couldn't stop eating: that has seldom happened to me, as I am not very easy to please when it comes to food. I've been to Bari many times and I've had the chance to try all the products in this grocery. My favorite type of meat is the Barese sausage, which I buy whenever I happen to be in that area. Now I know why everybody was so pleased about this little Italian grocery called Bari, and I have even become one of its fans. No other place in Chicago has better sandwiches and sausages!

16.description: Had an italian beef, it was pretty good.  Not cheap, $8.33 after everything was said and done.  Bread is solid.  Problem is that the people are not friendly, thus I can only give 3 stars.  I stood in front of the deli counter for about 10 minutes.  I made eye contact with two employees.  The place was empty and no one was willing to help me until I spoke up.  Very strange.  I refuse to give business to those that don't have any business sense.  Try Vinnie's Subs instead, very friendly and great italian subs.  Just next door!

13.description: One of the all-time great sandwich spots in the city.  The meatball sub with atomic giardiniera alone secures Bari's permanent perch in the top five best sandwiches of Chicago. This place gets wicked busy for lunch, with a line from the deli counter to the door. Or so I've heard: my experiences are always at off hours when I can peruse the fancy imported groceries and spend my well earned money.In particular, I like their selection of soda and sparkling water, their many kinds of angel wings and ornate Italian cookies, and the homemade pasta and olive salads. Delivery to my apartment in the neighborhood is always hot and fresh!

11.description: A native Chicagoan told me this place had the best Italian sub sandwich in town. She wasn't kidding. This quaint, authentic Italian grocer and sandwich shop resides in the heart of Chicago's Italian neighborhood. Here you can find every type of pasta, sauce, and deli item you could possibly crave. From fresh mozzarella and Sicilian olives to veal chops, this place has it all. They pack a lot of items into a space that's not much bigger than your kitchen and dining room so I could see it getting a bit snug in there during peak hours. However, it's worth it. When you step up to the counter, treat yourself to an order of the Italian sub. The 9-inch is priced to sell. You'll be hard-pressed to find a better sub for about $5. For a $1.50 more you can get the 12-inch and have an extra meal. It comes in mild, medium, and hot. Get the mild if you're not keen on spicy sandwiches. This place is a must try for anyone wanting a quality sandwich that will leave you full without breaking the bank.

39.description: This place has always had the best sub's in Chicago. My only fear is that the Major gentrification of this neighborhood will jack up the prices, or worse yet sell out to  developers. Yuppies ruin everything.

37.description: Best Italian sandwich in Chicago. And extremely reasonable price

0.description: Love, love, love Bari's sandwiches!! It's in a small market where you can pick up the sandwiches at the deli. What's even better is the price! The sandwiches are such great quality and fresh ingredients with a low price. We got the Italian sub and prosciutto with mozzarella. I couldn't decide which sandwich I liked more and kept taking bites of both. The Italian had a good amount of meat and I loved the spicy peppers. The prosciutto with mozzarella was also delicious, although I wished it had as much filling as the Italian. Either way, yum.... Verdict: I want to go back and try all the sandwiches that are available. Grab a bag of chips and a drink in the market on your way out! You can also get one of their great sides.

38.description: I was taken here by my sous chef last Friday.  I have never had a sandwich as delicious as the footlong I had.  Ridiculously delicious, perfect bread, perfect ratio of oil and vinegar, mayo and dijon, absolutely delicious housemade giardinara, and the feel of the place was very old school Chicago so I felt very at ease.  My sous was telling me they do a very good business and I was not surprised at all - they also have a nice butcher shop but I was really there for that sub.  I will go back again and again.  Magnificent!

51.description: For someone who doesn't care for for giardinara, I loved Bari's, and am now converted.  I tried both the hot and mild versions on their signature Italian sub, and it brought out tremendous flavor in the meat and spices.  The reason that I'm not giving a higher rating is because I ordered 3 subs, and the bread was crusty and didn't seem fresh.  I ordered Friday night before they closed and wonder if they were using up old bread.  Perhaps this wouldn't matter as much in the Italian beef sandwich, and I do plan on returning to try it at some point.

27.description: I'll keep this nice and simple... Bari subs are a gem in Chicago and despite some recent price increases still an absolute bargain.You can get a delicious and authentic sub made from truly quality ingredients on freshly baked bread for the same general price as a junky chain like Jimmy John's... why would you even debate this choice?Walk to the back of the store to the butcher counter. There you will be greeted by a platoon of guys working diligently to make subs for what is often a sizeable line at lunchtime. Go for the traditional Italian first but also try to mix it up with a custom order using the Italian meats they have or try a house made sausage. Don't bother with generic stuff like turkey; Bari shines with the authentic Italian meats.When you are done stop by D'Amato's next door and grab some cookies... this is among the best lunches you can have in the city and it will cost you well under 10 bucks all in. you really can't beat it.

32.description: I'm an Italian beef fanatic.   And a combo enthusiast to say the least.   So obviously I google the best Italian beef sandwiches in town and Bari pops up #1.  I had tried Mr.  Beef,  Boston,  Al's, and some damn place on south Pulaski that I don't remember the name.   So I says,  ok,  this is gonna be the love of my life, right?  As you can tell by my rating...WRONG.   the meat doesn't even look or taste like Italian beef.   Plus it's dry and has no bite, just pulls apart but not in a good way.   They put a crap load so that's good.   I say to myself, I must be wrong,  maybe it was a bad day or something so I go again.   Same thing,   at least they have consistency.   To be honest,  it's the second to last on my list.  The last is that south Pulaski place that tastes like plastic,  (rated #1 on WTTW Tony's Italian beef it's called)  I actually threw that one in the garbage after one bite.   And these placed come up highly rated,  I don't get it.   Want a damn good italian beef sandwich or combo.   Go to Portillo's. Your taste buds will literally explode.   It's a chain, I know,  but it is what it is,  the best Italian I've tasted till now.   Oh yeah,  Gene & Judes are not the best hot dogs around,  not by any means.   Don't trust the ratings!
