18.description: Not what they used to be.  In the beginning I went there a lot and it was great.  The coffee was great.  I went there about a month ago and my mocha was just gross.  It used to be crowded all the time which shows it was good.  But today it's always empty in there and for a good reason.  If you're just looking for a coffee to go, bite the bullet and go to Starbucks in the hip or Dunkin Donuts on Irving...and yes they are both better than this dive is now... So sad.

41.description: I like this place a lot! The employees are nice, the coffee is good, they serve food(which I have yet to try) the hours are good. There are plenty of places to sit and a nice place to just enjoy a cup and surf the web. I stopped by at about 8am on a weekday and after about an hour it started getting pretty crowded. I was here one other time with a friend, we played checkers over lattes. This place is such a nice change from starbucks, I only wish it wasn't right across the street from the mall as I am going nowhere near that place over the holiday season. Did I mention they serve gelato?

52.description: Cute, clean, tasty coffee and good food.We met Ms Kate M here for a light lunch on a breezy, sunny Saturday afternoon. I have never been to Norridge and did not realize there was an enormous Target across the street! Word to the wise, turning left out of the shopping center lot is a pain in the butt.But J. Bean itself? Not overly cozy but certainly a nice little cafe with plenty of tables. I had a veggie wrap which came with chips (bagged, and no pickle which mildly disappointed me); the wrap was full of deliciousness and fresh vegetables, and was a good sized portion without being ridiculous. They also have panini and salads, plus pastry and gelato. I also had an iced Americano with a little toffee syrup, very good depth of flavor without being bitter. Kudos on the coffee.I noticed a little outdoor seating area in the back but didn't investigate; I can also report that the ladies' room is clean and well stocked. The lone young woman working was friendly and did not bug us (she also didn't clear our baskets or anything, but that's OK). Prices were about on par with similar places, $6something for the wrap or sandwich, I believe? less than $3 for a not-so-small iced Americano w/syrup.I don't know if or when I might return to Norridge, but if I have reason to be in the area again, I will know J Bean is there to provide a light bite and a tasty cup of coffee or tea!

50.description: Love this place! I practically live on their turkey wraps and my hubby loves their Italian paninis. Very friendly staff! And, the owners seem quite engaged in making this place the best it can be. I found this place through Groupon and have been going back ever since! Everything we've tried has been great here!

4.description: I discovered this coffee shop in search of a median place to work from the burbs go downtown.  It's such a cute coffee shop on the inside and the small business cafe owners/managers are adorable.  She has this big welcoming smile.  I told her I was vegetarian/vegan. As I ordered my almond milk chai latte, She told me she makes the best falafels.  I'd have to agree-- it ties with my moms.  I also liked the chai-- as it seemed of good quality and it was compatible with my body-- with not being overtly adrenalized.  The tables are small, but I love it because it reminds me of Paris.  Paris keeps the tables smaller to bring people closer together.

6.description: Coffee was plain and they were very unprofessional.  Worker had trouble swiping my credit card and acted so confused and asked for cash.  Seemed a little shady for me.  Then when I said that I have a gift card, she said they don't honor their own gift cards anymore!  WHAT?!  They said they changed owners too many times and will not honor them.  Again - so shady.  Won't be back.

22.description: This place is great. I always come here with a friend and get a shake made with their ever-changing selection of ice creams. The man there is super friendly and not too bad looking. :-P They have a cozy electric fireplace and tv area and plenty of electrical outlets for laptop use. There is also an outdoor seating area that is great for a larger gathering or a loud group. I would feel bad being too loud inside since the vibe is very calm. I will continue to return and will try more of their food items. I've only had the pesto panini, so good!

15.description: Good coffee and amazing tea selection!! Ever since my first visit iv been going there on a weekly basis.

57.description: There are NO cafes near my house that are in walkable distance. But J.Bean is not too far west of me if I want to get out of the house for a couple hours and don't mind a 5 min max bus ride. The staff is nice and my brother used to play guitar here once a week. They have OK coffee but no refill option which sucks because I love to get coffee "for here" in an actual mug and not waste the cup but then it gets cold quick and I usually just get it topped off..  Its definitely a neighborhood type crowd and not too packed that you can't find a seat. But I was here on a Sunday night and it was a little loud for studying. Convenient if you have something to do at FedEx/Kinkos (next door) or if you're waiting for somebody to be done at the mall or Just Tires on the corner.

20.description: Cozy little spot with a fireplace. I'm not a coffee drinker but their hot chocolate is great. The sandwiches have gone down but the noise level is okay for a person that needs to get work down. Great go to spot for studying.

36.description: The service is awsome. Love the breafest sandwiches. The girls in the morning are alway friendly and the coffee is fresh.

14.description: I find Brian's review kind of funny. Because I know who he is and when we worked there, and I find it ironic that he left when Amir was there, didn't post a review because he was his friend, and now that Amir sold it, he put a bad review up. Ultimately, he's right, in that the place isn't too great, the items I get are pretty decent still; although sometimes now they don't come out the same with the new staff, but they might learn overtime. They are in fact, remodeling some stuff on the inside, and I'm curious to see what they'll do.

3.description: This is a fabulous nursery!  There are always plenty of employees around to help you with anything.  They aren't just friendly,  but they're all knowledgeable and more than willing to give suggestions or point you in the right direction if you have no clue what you're doing.  They offer a vast variety of products. They also hold frequent workshops on lots of different topics.   Compared with the other nurseries in the area I've been to, I feel they're prices are right on the mark.  Sure, you can always find something cheaper somewhere else,  but you also get what you pay for.

1.description: I have to give two reviews.5 stars - Their staff. Very knowledgeable and helpful when it comes to landscaping newbies like my husband and I.3 stars- Their prices and their products. We received a gift card to here for some bushes for our backyard. We picked out 3 Weigela bushes that died within a month. (Not to mention the dent I have on my car from their carts not being corralled outside) Thankfully we bought the warranty. So we made the trek back up to Palatine (from Bartlett) and bought 4 rose bushes and 2 hydrangeas. We get home and plant them in our beds and it looks like they're doing fine and then the rose bushes start to turn yellow. We had a plant expert come by (aka my mother-in-law) and it seems the roses we bought have a fungus. So we had to run to HD and buy some fungicide and prune back most of the rose bush. Ugh.Hopefully these plants survive or there goes $200+

2.description: 3 stars due to the EXTREMELY HIGH PRICES5 stars to the extremely knowledgable and helpful  staff.....

9.description: Very nice nursery - we have purchased flowers as well as shrubs here.  Last summer we showed up looking for 9 (yes 9!) new shrubs for our backyard.  One of the associates took the time to consult with us while walking us around and showing us various options for what our needs/likes were and kept in mind our budget.  They are a little pricey (that's why they get 4 stars instead of 5).We have also purchased our fresh Christmas tree here for the past three years - they are VERY reasonable with prices and the trees were of very high quality.

10.description: Very nice selection but it's hard to justify their prices when down the road is another, cheaper alternative. They also weren't running any sort of sale considering the time of year. Every nursery further west is running at least 50% off on in stock items right now.

4.description: Everyone who works here is very friendly and helpful.  Not many people are experts at gardening and really appreciate when workers assist them or give recommendations.  The selection is great and everything is labeled so you know what you are buying and how to take care of your plants/flowers.  I was very impressed with the service I received and will continue to shop here.

6.description: i love this place cause they have a big variety of plants, i also love that they offer some free seminars for all the green thumbs out there.The employees are all so friendly and helpful.I went here last weekend for Hydragena Hoopla! i learned A LOT about hydragenas and how to care for them properly.Definitely come here for your plant needs!

12.description: I called and inquired about the purchase of 20 Arborvitae trees and asked if they give a discount for a large purchse like this and they said " NO, why would we do that. " I just laughed and said have a nice day. Move on to someone else

5.description: If you want a great selection of wonderful plants and gifts this is the place. With an ever helpful staff it's my go to place for my garden plants.

11.description: Wow, we had 2 experiences with Knupper and both were underwhelming...with the latest experience downright horrible.First let's start by saying that the prices are borderline astronomical!  We knew what we were getting into and wanted quality, so we overlooked that point believing you get what you pay for.  In this case...WRONG!We started with the design service for our lawn.  Since we were starting with a new lawn, we needed a lot of help.  The design they came up with was very nice and they were very helpful, accommodating and knowledgeable.  I asked them to keep the project under $7,000 and they said "no problem".  A few weeks later after calling and calling...I get a nice drawing and a project price of $15,000.  What?  I asked for $7k and get $15k?  Am I missing something?  Anyway, we found the exact same plants at Home Depot for less than half the price, so I helped myself out.The BIG problem with these arrogant jerks came when I bought a few of the specialty plants there.  I bought the plants and brought them home.  A few days later I noticed that a couple of the bushes didn't look very good.  I kept an eye on them and exactly 2 weeks after I bought them, I brought the nearly dead plants back.  I tried to be nice, but when they told me that they only had a 2 day warranty on their plants and they would not exchange the plants I went ballistic!  A 2 DAY WARRANTY??  WTF?  EVERY PLACE WITHIN 100 MILES HAS A 1 YEAR WARRANTY!  I PAID TRIPLE FOR THESE PLANTS AND GOT A 2 DAY WARRANTY???Needless to say, I steer my frenemies to Knupper to get corn-holed, but I would never send real friends or family to these jerks.

8.description: In my quest for my arch and some other things for the garden, I stopped at this shop along "nursery row" on Rand Road. Knupper, pronounced Kn-oo-per (no silent k), is a gigantic establishment that runs about a full block. It probably rivals Atrium in its size, but didn't seem to have as much ornamental stuff for the garden, or outdoor furniture.It's impossible to miss from the road, with its walls adorned with large murals of birds and animals. Even an electrical box outside has a chipmunk painted on it!While I did not find an arch like I wanted, I did get a sturdy wood trellis for a clematis that has been spreading all the way up to the rooftop. It was not something I had not been planning to buy, but I didn't see one as solid and tall as the one at Knupper.I also got some petunias to put in baskets and planters. The mini petunias in orange, yellow and shades of pink and purple simply can't be found at the big box stores. Not only that, but the plants were in really good shape, rather than being merely "survivors" as it seems to happen at Home Depot stores.And I have to commend Knupper's for having a huge number of wagons and carts available to transport stuff. At too many garden centers I've visited, seems the carts and wagons are hidden away somewhere at the other end of the store, requiring a long walk. Here, they seem to be at every entrance, and even between sections of the store.Knupper is a bit pricier than Atrium, so I'd recommend checking one of the other stores along Rand before committing to something big like an arch, trellis or giant planter from here, but I can't say anything bad about them.While I liked Atrium the best, Knupper holds its own and I still would go back there for certain garden items in the future.

0.description: Diverse selection of plants that are well maintained. In addition to herbs, flowers, and some shrubs, they also have more exotic plants such as pitcher plants. They also have decorative items, soil, and various sprays for any plant ailments.

7.description: This nursery has it all, and friendly service on top of it. They have the widest variety of plants in the area hands down. I do agree with other posts that they are a bit pricey, however when I compared the plants and flowers to other "nurseries" Knupper's were bigger and healthier. The staff is also very knowledgeable in the area, and that helps. That's something I will pay a little extra for.

1.description: I'm a woman but I really HATE shopping... especially for clothes.  I would much rather order stuff online.  Well this past Saturday they had a 40% off sale so my friend and I went there.  Holy shit. First off that Dunning Square parking lot is a freaking nightmare at any given time, but on a Saturday afternoon forget it.  After 10 minutes of driving around we finally found a parking spot.  But that's not Fashion Bug's fault. So we get in the store and it's pretty crowded but no big deal.  We find a ton of stuff we liked which is surprising because most of their clothing is cheap gaudy shit.  Now we get in line... which is about 25 people long and almost out the door.   It's also about 85 degrees in there because they had the heat cranked on a 70 degree day.  They also only have TWO registers open with two of the slowest, dingiest broads checking out customers.   We stood there for almost 20 minutes and the line did not move at all.  I'm getting more and more aggravated.  Now I got these fat smelly bitches behind me in line, pushing and shoving and practically laying on top of me.  Really?  You can't back up a few inches?  She was about to get an elbow to the gunt if she didn't back off...  After over a half hour of waiting and not moving one inch, I threw my clothes on the floor and walked out.  I went home, got on my computer, and ordered everything online and saved even more money with promotional codes.  Oh how I love the internet.  And oh how I hate people. Sorry Fashion Bug but when you have a massive sale like that you need to have more registers open and get things moving!!!

0.description: Even though the style here can be super cheesy at times (i'm talking tapered jeans and leopard pring shirts) its a great place to find something cheap and quick for a night out!  I have a ton of shoes from here because, as Patricia mentioned, their sales are unbelievable!

3.description: I used to enjoy going to this bar to drink and play darts, but when they have some kind of party going on, the people that are in that party are usually rude to the darters. I have had a few bad experiences, not with the bar its self but with some of the party people...needless to say I stopped going to this bar.

1.description: Good dart bar with a built in dart store, what more can you ask for.The prices are amazing and the owners (Dave and Deb) are great people and always make sure you have a great time. The atmosphere in the bar is blue collar, which means its perfect. David Jr the Bartender always takes care of ya tooIf you are ever in the Northwest looking for a dart bar with good people and cheap prices, stop by the family bar!

2.description: This is one of the legendary West side dart bars which run serious leagues. The walls are lined with boards and the score keeping system consists of the pencils that can be erased on plastic boards. There is a spray bottle of water and a towel to make sure you can clean up the scoreboard quickly and not get your hands all chalked up. The bar sells darts and dart replacement parts which is key when your darts inevitably take a beating (especially if you lend them to someone else). When I went the bar's patrons looked incredibly roughneck (i.e. class Northwest side), but no one bothered me and I was left to play darts in peace with a friend.I'd go here again, but the neighborhood is very far on the Northwest side, which makes it a bit out of the way. I recommend this bar for throwing darts, but TVs are outdated and the floor is linoleum.  Beer is super cheap, so if you live nearby this would be one of my favorite places to throw some steel tipped darts.

5.description: A bar that focuses heavily on steel tipped darts, with many boards along the left side, and the bar itself comprises the right side.  Teams play darts and pool there on Mondays, Tuesdays, and Thursdays, but the people are boisterous but congenial.  The prices are low, and there's a huge selection of dart supplies available as well.  Can get noisy in there at times, but the owners are wonderful, and the commitment to darts is very genuine.  Pool costs a dollar and there are several Millenium machines and Golden Tee as well.

0.description: Great place for the serious drinker with a dart problem. Friendly place with a freekin dart store built in so stock up on flights!

4.description: Your typical beer n a shot bar with a bunch of dart boards. Drinks r very reasonable n crowd is always well behaved. They finally updates the tv's woohoo .Id give them 5 stars if they had some bar food outside slim jims n chips. staff is fantastic as r the owners dave n deb.They usually have a dart blind draw on saturday around 9 for u darters

3.description: I don't even want to give it one star!!! Since it has reopened I've been there twice and both times I was the only customer. And both times my food was cold  I took a fry out of the bag immediately and it was cold. I was very disappointed poor service.

1.description: I hate to leave bad reviews and I will only do this if there's constantly issues. The food is wrong 8out of 10 times No lie.. Or the food has been sitting there This time I ordered a whopper ob And chicken nuggets I refused to feed to my kid. The whopper was stale and sloppy sauce every where. My first job was at bkThere's no way we can serve that food so why here???  I will Never coming back here

2.description: Orders are wrong 80% of the time. If you say no lettuce, you will probably see plenty. Order the 20 piece nuggets, you will likely get 16. The chicken fries tend to be overcooked.Recently I ordered the spicy big fish sandwich, got it home and had a $1 menu spicy chicken sandwich! There wasn't even extra sauce like I had said, there was next to nothing. I had to call and they offered me a free spicy fish sandwich meal to pickup the next day. The sandwich was greasier than a jar of grease!

5.description: ZERO STARS!! First and last time I'll go to this location. I normally don't eat fast food but was in a rush after a long day at work. Ordered a simple meal - Single burger and fries. The worker who claims she was management was very rude when I paid with cash she basically threw it at me and my money will hopefully find someone who needs it as it blew away... When I told her she rolled her eyes and walked away.. Really!! Good thing it was only $1. Your job isn't that hard. Common sense and kind customer service is all you need. She couldn't even handle that and just because she claims she's management I WILL be calling corporate!

6.description: TERRIBLE SERVICE! You don't expect much going to a fast food place but the employees here have the worst attitudes. Pulled into the drive-thru tonight to grab something quick to eat and instead I got an attitude from some shit-head employee. Drove off before even finishing my order to take my money elsewhere. Poor customer service.

7.description: Yet again...another dissapointment! There are nothing but a bunch of idiots working at this location! How hard is it to read the order off of a screen and put the shit in a bag?! You fuckin dumbasses! People go to a fast food place for a reason..do you honestly think that I have the time to go home and reheat my food because you gave it to me cold??! Lazy ass bitches! find a new job if you can't do this one right!

8.description: Haven't been here in years especially for a burger but today was exceptionally terrible. Simple careless mistakes and no care given poor attitude and long wait time for partially complete order. During this time I only one other car in drive threw and five people inside so not too busy just lazy! Yuck

9.description: The service is horrible. I'm not expecting top notch service but dang at least a pinch of customer service. Nope. Not here. It's so bad I sent a complaint to corporate. Don't waste your time coming to this one. They can keep their attitudes!

0.description: What can I say, it Burger King. Cheap and easy, better than McD's.Pros: it cheapCons: it cheapOverall Rating: 2.5 of 5Recommendation: Recommended if you're broke

4.description: Food poisoning at its finest!  I ate here 2 days ago and I have never been this sick in my life.  I have spent a whole day vomiting and the other on the porcelain throne.  I now believe the hype about the issues with this BK being disgusting and having violations.

12.description: standard head shop, but light on the hippie crap and a GREAT selection of obscure tee shirts. ARMY OF DARKNESS? IRON MAIDEN? WHERE IS MY VISA.

7.description: All the stars are for their INCREDIBLE, eclectic selection of CDs. Everything from 80's goth and deathrock to several genres of punk (including quite a few rarities) to tons of black metal. I don't actually *buy* CDs too often (heh) but if I did, this is where I'd always go.Don't let this information mislead you, however, seeing as beyond their CD display the place looks like a Spencer's circa 1999... Think Limp Bizkit dogtags, glow-in-the-dark posters of pot leaves and ICP-everything. I quite like this juxtaposition, though, seeing as I find their tacky wares hilarious. Good place to go kill some time when it gets too boring up in Dunning (which is um, always...)Cheapest Special Effects hairdye I've found anywhere, too, but call in first to see if they have the color you want in stock.NEVER GET PIERCED HERE, THOUGH. JUST SUCK IT UP, PAY A COUPLE EXTRA BUCKS AND GO SOMEWHERE LEGIT. THAT DOESN'T MEAN JADE DRAGON, EITHER.*ahem* That is all.

3.description: I wish I read previous reviews about this place. It would have saved me a lot of pain and $50. This lady is pretty delusional. She is so confident that everything she does is perfect. My piercing was so crooked. And both my friend's belly button piercing and my own got infected...worst pain of my life. I let it heal but it healed so crooked and scarred that I had to take it out. Wish I went to an actual professional.

1.description: I was once young and silly enough to shop at this place. The last time I did was in 2009 and was treated by Ann (the proprietor) like shit and the shop manager bearing a "skullet" (that is bald on top and long in the back. Think Ronnie James Dio but more extreme) was just as sarcastic and ill mannered towards me as she was. Back in the late 80s and early 90s, this place was hoppin' with business. That's because it was the only shop like it for miles and miles. We had no choice. The prices are outrageous. The staff are disrespectful. The selection is way worse than the Alley on Clark and Belmont. I've moved away from Chi-town and thank GOD I don't have to deal with this lousy shop anymore. For the life of me,I don't know how it stays in business.

2.description: Ever since I discovered this place, it's one of the few go to places for my rock and roll/hard rock/metal shopping. I've been coming to this place for many years now, I would say at least a good 8 years (boy am I old). If you're wondering what they carry here, they have your standard music t-shirts not just from rock artists but reggae and a few rap artists as well, metal artists and more. They also have pop culture shirts and random funny shirts too. They carrie hoodies, baby clothing for your mini rocker, wallets, jewelry, piercings, zippos, posters, magazines, hair dyes, music flags and even hookahs. Some of the other things I come here for are their great incense selection, candles, fragrance oils and warmers, magick candles, votives and tealight candles, and pretty badass incense burners too. Don't forget about the music and pop culture merch they have here like mugs, action figures, cool gismos and toys and more. They also pierce you here if you decide to get pierced in a private room, I've had a friend get an industrial piercing here a few years ago. Though this place carries extremely underground music, this place is more known now for their merch and accessories. I listen to a lot of music and when I came here and checked out their music selection, I still have a lot more bands to discover. I wanna say they buy CD's here too? Not sure, I'd call. I was just here last week, and the store always has a nice atmosphere, definitely in a different league than crappy hot topic and even better than overpriced Rolling Stones next door.

9.description: I got my cartilage pierced here. They take you into a little room in the back and have you sit in a dentist type chair, it's kind of creepy at first haha. It's really not cheaper than getting your cartilage pierced at Jade, I spent about $60 with a gold hoop earring starter. Great experience though, minus the fact she had a baby problem while trying to get the earring on and I was nice and bleeding for a while but haven't had a problem with it since. They've got jewelry, cloves, Salvia (at least they used to sell it), pipes, t-shirts and hair dye. I'd honestly recommend Sally's though if you want to find some extreme hair dye that's of better quality or more permanent...but they do have some neat colors. They never seem to have the same people working there and when you come in they're always screwing around online etc. so go figure. Even if you're not looking for anything in particular it's a fun store to window shop in.

18.description: Not a bad place, has a lot of fun stuff.   The only complaint I have is when my friend got her tongue pierced there about 5 years ago.. the guy ( who i think is the owner) was kind of pervy and creepy... Plus that room was tiny.

10.description: Yeah yeah yeah, they sell bongs and pipes. Now that that's out of the way, there really is more to this place than it being Ye Olde Neighborhood Head Shoppe. The minimal, but excellent, collection of Cds they carry is worth the trip to the Limit on it's own. Occasionally they've got some interesting vinyl or live show bootlegs too. If you're not into music or weed (who the fuck are you then?) check out their stock of punk, rock and comic t-shirts, body jewelery and incense. At the counter in the back they sell a range of tabacco products, including strange and quirky cigarette brands, hookahs, pipes, tobacco and rolling papers.  Whenever Christmas rolls around I almost always end up knocking a couple people off my life at Beyond the Limit.

13.description: The lady 2nd owner she's great had a laugh while she was repiercing my monroe and talking about guys and her exhusband who is the 1st owner. I love this place sells everything for anybody incense,cds,tshirts,pipes,cigarettes, get piercied,even hair dye.

16.description: Very cool place.  They have many different types of earrings.  They also have alot of posters of muscial artists and famous people.  The piercing are cheap there and come out great.

17.description: This place is like an unheard of Spencers-type gift, gag, and record shop. You'll find unusual jewelry, many varieties of incense, tons of radical gear, and much more. It's a very unusual but much welcomed shopping experience. This is also a great place to check out if you're the type that likes punk hair dye.

15.description: I give this a store an A for effort, even though I haven't bought anything from here in 2 years. If you are looking to pick up a Metal ,punk, comic , or novelty shirt , give this place a shot. This is like the Northwest side's answer to the Alley , way smaller though , but not too bad. You can pick up some 420 supplies here , though thats not my thing. They also have some punk and hippy jewelry , spiked wristbands and the like. You can find a smaller selection of punk, metal and alt cds here too. There is a good supply of some novelty stuff , like a kiss diorama or a James Brown bobble head. I stop by at least once a month , to find something goofy , like I said  , I haven't bought anything in years.

0.description: I'm a sucker for cool t-shirts and rock paraphernalia.  Throw in a body piercer and mini head shop and I regress into adolescent heaven.  Nothing like a little incense and manic panic to bring back the good ole days!The help is surprisingly helpful for a store of this sort and there's a good selection of music, hoodies, onesies, magnets and lunchboxes as well.  Need any Betty Boop or Elvis crap?  They got that too.They tend to stay open late, but the hours are irregular so you might want to call first.

5.description: I will say that this place actually got one star.  I'm not saying that it should have been zero stars and the one star is a default, so I'm conceding in saying that that single star is legitimate.  With that said, I hate this place. I really really really hate this place.  I think the last time I went there and didn't want to throw a cheap piece of shitty  rock "memorabilia" at the cashier on my way out was when the first  two numbers of the year started with a 19**.   I think it was for when my sister used my ID when I turned 18 (she was like 15) so she could get her nips pierced (which had to be re-done by a  REAL professional, btw). Secondly, get a website.  I can't believe that a speciatility shop in this day in age, still does their online promotion of their company through that archaic social networking site Myspace.Now days the only reason I venture into this hellhole neighborhood to visit this hellhole store is for their music selection.  I gave them that lonely yellow star because it's the only place in the area that I could have counted on for having a large selection of Psychobilly.   I'm sure they know this because everything is horribly overpriced.  I'm not ok with spending $15+ for a used cd that I could buy  new online with shipping included for 1/3 less (which is what I will be doing from here on out).  Lastly, don't count on them having a specific album, the selection is erratic and in this case they didn't have the album I was looking for (and was unable to find online). A side note, they don't have a public washroom so make sure you keep that in mind when you go there to spend your money on their overpriced wares... yup, they're really appreciative of your business...

11.description: The only record store with a Psychobilly section in the Chicago area. Metal, Punk and Ska are also available. Band t-shirts, head-shop fair etc... Anyone looking for Psychobilly CDs this is the place for you.

8.description: I've been a customer of Beyond the Limit for years. I've gotten many piercings by the woman who owns the shop, I think her name was Annie? Not sure. Anyways, they've got new people at the counter all the time lol they must change workers as often as the toilet paper runs out. ... That's a stupid correlation but it's all I could think of. Doesn't even matter.Anyways, yeah, good place to go. Unless you want to get a piercing and you're claustrophobic.

4.description: I'll admit, I was young and stupid once upon a time and chose to get my 2nd set of lobe piercings done here.  Bad idea.  Other than the fact that they used a gun to do so, the lady really had no business doing piercings.  I remember while looking at jewelry (for my industrial) one of the workers described it as "male" and "female" instead of internally threaded and externally threaded, so "did you want the bar to be male or the ball to be male?" was what I was asked.  Again, I was young and stupid and knew nothing about piercings.  I would never get pierced here.  I would never go to Jade Dragon.  In fact, there's 2 places in the city I'd go to, and that's it.Shirts can be over-priced, but I remember they always had a nice selection of magazines.  When I wanted a drum magazine (such as Drum) and didn't feel like going to Guitar Center, if I was in the area I'd go here and pick up some.  I think everything is over-priced here (kind of like The Alley), but considering a majority of the clientel are high schoolers going through some phase (yeah, I said it, a PHASE) they'll pay it.  It is fun to look at some of the ridiculous things they have though.

14.description: A cool place for collectibles and gifts.  They also carry local band CDs.  They got some funny and radical t shirts.  I recommend browsing through this store.  Take a break from shopping down the street and support these little guys!

6.description: I was in high school, young & dumb. Got a cartilage piercing, which was done with a gun. Now of course I am older and wiser but at the time I had no idea what was what so it seemed okay. Eh, no. Not to mention they trained people to do piercings who could barely tie their shoes. I dont trust people with sharp objects around me, especially if they look clueless.The magazine section went down hill completely and if I wanted to ONLY find magazines where my exes band from Europe is in, I'd stay here all day. No thank you.The music selection stinks, the shirts are meh. And not to mention the jewelery section used to be much bigger. Now its just crap. I'm honestly surprised that Hot Topic in the mall hasn't put this place out of business. Maybe the people who shop here also avoid Hot Topic thinking if they shop at H.T. they will be posers....but...well...yeah. No comment.

28.description: Bare bones store, and a great place to go if you are looking for used musical equipment:  electric bass, electric guitar, acoustic guitar, stand up base, banjos, mandolins, violins etc.  Also amps/heads.  Place lets you browse and touch, and won't drive you crazy asking if they can help you.  If you want help, ask and they help.  Staff are friendly, and are willing to chat and share what they know, and don't know.   They took the time to look thru books and ID the bass my son was hot on.  Don't expect details on obscure items - they get in what they get in, and won't know the history, or even much about the item in general if  it's something a bit off the beaten track.Another reviewer noted you need to go in armed with some knowledge - I do agree with that.  Does sound like they are willing to hold instruments for a short period of time - so you could go home or to the library and search for reviews online before purchasing (or bring internet browsing phone, and look up what you need at the store).We found what we needed - because it was refinished (but very playable) it was a great price (1/3 of an original finish for same) - we walked out happy.Note:  Make sure you are happy before you buy - no return policy, unless something is actually wrong with the item.  You buy it, you keep it.  (I suspect there may be some flexibility on it.)Also - had more used pedals than I've seen elsewhere, at better prices than I've seen elsewhere.  Some new stuff - clips, slides, cables - all priced right.    Worth the 45 minute drive for us to go there a couple of times a year.Marking this review as "inexpensive" - but it's all relative - saw a bass in there priced at $2000 and the one beside it for $200... both were potentially good deals for the right buyer.  :-)Would I recommend:  yes.Would I return:  yes

1.description: We live in the area, I had no idea what this store was about until driving down Irving.  I saw the lights on and a ton of guitars in the window.  Knowing my husband has been wanting a guitar for awhile I told him to check this place out. Glad I did, he left with a guitar and said the guy gave him great feedback on his existing guitar. In fact he's heading back right now to buy more stuff.  The prices are better than guitar center, and everyone should support a small shop over a large chain like guitar center. I also texted my brother about this place who also lives in the area and plays.  Our only regret about Midwest buy and sell is that we didn't know about these guys sooner.

39.description: Best used instrument shop in Chicago. They have hundreds of guitars, amps and lots of other equipment. Try anything out before you take it home. If you're looking to buy, sell or trade up, check this place out

9.description: Helpful, friendly people at Midwest Buy & Sell and just like the name says, they buy and sell guitars, amps, and all kinds of musical stuff. If you can't find what you are looking for, they will try & help you find it. Fun place to see what they've got, merchandise comes in often. Definitely worth checking out!

29.description: With all the ridiculous boutique-ish top shelf places in Chicago and the outlying suburbs, this place is a welcome sight. This isn't for Aerosmith or Slash to spend their riches on overpriced crap with flames on it... it's for regular players looking for fun and interesting used gear.... lots of Fender and Gibson and Marshall along with older off-brands like Danelectro and Hagstrum and Supro and the like... always a wide range of amps from older tube amps to newer hand wired ones all the way to grey fuzzy solid state door stops. Usually a large amount of used stomp boxes prices fairly... and then there is always the unknown... a cardboard box full of cords and odds and ends... a pile of used vintage cymbal stands.... a weird rare rackmount effect unit.... an old ribbon mic.... a Hammond organ with Leslie....a crazy reverb unit. There's always something of interest at Wayne's. I like to stop in at least twice a month. Things really do move in and out of this place quickly. The prices are most often very fair and if they are not, there always seems to be room to work out a deal.

23.description: For used gear, this is the best place. Decent prices that they are willing to negotiate on. Just got a GK 700 RB head here. Originaly they were looking for $350. Its a lil rough around the edges, but not beat to hell  Plugged it and started playing, to find some popping coming from the pots. An easy fix, but they knocked it down to $300 out the door.  The owner, Wayne, even knew an amp repair guy, but that's a review for another day.

5.description: Great guys- I got a better deal on a trade in than I would have at GC or CME. Knowledgeable and good service. Will definitely be back.

31.description: Love this place! I am a new wannabe guitar player, and went in there based on the comments from yelpers. They were very helpful and acknowledged me right away,  let me browse (although I must have had my deer-in-headlights look) and talked to me about acoustic vs electric and what to invest in as am absolute beginner. Hooked me up with the whole package for a damn reasonable price, told me to come back with any problems or questions, just good people all around. Dave you rock! ... and now I am at home going G chord, D chord, C chord. Great experience for noob like me!

25.description: So these guys don't have a gorgeous shop like CME, but Wayne the owner is a nice guy to talk to unlike the former owner at CME.  They are straight up and honest.  Prices are ok, but they are reasonable and I have gotten some gear at reasonable prices there.   They have mainly player guitars, but generally a nice selection of Strats, LP, Marshalls etc., with several "one of" different models.  Not as overpriced as CME.   I would buy there again.

12.description: I bought a Les Paul Studio here about 6 years ago. I couldn't afford the Standard. At the time, I was so sick of my crappy Squier Strat (1st guitar) & I wanted to rock out like Jimmy Page and I was not into getting an Epi.I paid cash and the owner was flexible with the price and threw in a cheap case, too. I couldn't be happier with the service or my guitar. I've only avoided the place because I know when I go back, I won't be able to walk out empty-handed. This place is awesome!

37.description: probably the best used music gear shop in chicago.  very fair if you are selling or trading in old stuff, prices seem reasonable if you're buying.  they have tons of guitars, amps, pedals.... you name it.  sold them a Marshall 4x12 cabinet today, got a good price for it. sure, i probably could have gotten a little more out of a private buyer, but continually posting ads on Craigslist and checking email etc for people who never show up to look at it isn't worth my time.  Midwest Buy & Sell is no bullshit.

21.description: Concerning their price on used pedals.  They were higher priced than a new one from guitar center!  GC $109, Midwest $120. They would not budge from their price.  I was a potential future customer for them but they declined any kind of counter offer.  In a few hours I bought one in new condition from a private seller for $60.  I think this place has got off track and their workers arrogant.  Not going back, ever.

16.description: Had my first experience at Midwest Buy & Sell yesterday, and I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.    Came in with my Tiny Terror looking for a cab to match, a 1x12 or 2x12 maybe.  I was shown a few options and encouraged to plug my head into each to see how they would sound.   I ended up picking out a small tweed 1x12  reasonably priced at $179.  On checkout, they knocked it down to an even $150 just because I asked. The guy at the counter even tested the ohmage of the speaker for me so I wouldn't have to take the cab apart to find out  (the Tiny Terror has multiple output options,  so definitely vital information to have).      I spent some time perusing their stock a little before leaving and was impressed to find some higher end guitars on par with what you might see at CME or Make 'n Music.   As used music stores in Chicago go, MW B&S occupies a unique and happy medium between the higher end vintage guitar places and the junk shops that only carry beat up epi's and squires.  Be warned though, if you're looking for anything apart from guitar and bass, not the really worth it. I only wish they were a little more centrally located so I could check in on their inventory without having journey all the way to Irving Park and Austin.

17.description: I bought a few guitars and some pedals here as well as some trades. The guys at the counter are cool and very personable. Never had any problems thus far. You can find some one of kind stuff here. Best purchase here was my Gretsch 3161 that I purchased for $300 after selling another guitar. It came with a hard shell case and is one of my favorite guitars.

10.description: Not much to look at from the outside but once you get inside you'll be amazed at all the equipment they have in stock. I found a used Epiphone 57 Reissue Les Paul Jr. (TV Yellow) hanging above me (they're really hard to find) and came back the next day and bought it. They reduced the price and re-strung & threw in a gig bag for free. You may mistake the guys there as disinterested in their customers but they're just really laid back and they all seem to love music and musicians. I would recommend this place to anyone who loves equipment and likes to be treated fairly.

11.description: Bare bones store, and a great place to go if you are looking for used musical equipment:  electric bass, electric guitar, acoustic guitar, stand up base, banjos, mandolins, violins etc.  Also amps/heads.  Place lets you browse and touch, and won't drive you crazy asking if they can help you.  If you want help, ask and they help.  Staff are friendly, and are willing to chat and share what they know, and don't know.   They took the time to look thru books and ID the bass my son was hot on.  Don't expect details on obscure items - they get in what they get in, and won't know the history, or even much about the item in general if  it's something a bit off the beaten track.Another reviewer noted you need to go in armed with some knowledge - I do agree with that.  Does sound like they are willing to hold instruments for a short period of time - so you could go home or to the library and search for reviews online before purchasing (or bring internet browsing phone, and look up what you need at the store).We found what we needed - because it was refinished (but very playable) it was a great price (1/3 of an original finish for same) - we walked out happy.Note:  Make sure you are happy before you buy - no return policy, unless something is actually wrong with the item.  You buy it, you keep it.  (I suspect there may be some flexibility on it.)Also - had more used pedals than I've seen elsewhere, at better prices than I've seen elsewhere.  Some new stuff - clips, slides, cables - all priced right.    Worth the 45 minute drive for us to go there a couple of times a year.Marking this review as "inexpensive" - but it's all relative - saw a bass in there priced at $2000 and the one beside it for $200... both were potentially good deals for the right buyer.  :-)Would I recommend:  yes.Would I return:  yes

26.description: As I am from the East Coast, and have been to many a music store around there, two things come to mind with most of these guitar stores: expensive, and/or poor selection.So I hear about this guitar store something like 1.5 hours from where I was.  I figure it's worth checking out.  When I finally arrive, I unfortunately find that the model I was currently interested in, an MIJ stratocaster, was not in stock.  I was fairly disappointed when I spotted a vintage, unusual Fender, one that I particularly sought but usually saw for between 1200-1400.  I asked for the price, expecting it to be around there.  I was flabbergasted when I was told they could do $650 for it.  They even found a case that could fit it, which considering how rare the guitar was is impressive, and threw it in for a mere $30.  The only part I wasn't thrilled with was the tax, but even with the tax it was still an absolute great deal.  Throughout the entire experience they were very cooperative, and even fixed up a minor bridge issue on the spot.  So now I don't need to spend hours hunting for a good deal on this guitar.  Next time I scrape enough money to relapse my GAS again, I'll definitely be heading to this place.If you're from the coast, and happen to be at O'Hare, and have a layover around three hours or so, be sure to take a look, they're a short train/bus ride away.  Just try not to upset the TSA with luggage.

27.description: These guys have a very unique place in the Chicago used/vintage gear market.  They know the fair market value of the things they have, and they sell them slightly above that price.  It is a business after all.  All prices are negotiable - in my experience about 10-15%.  They give a fair price if you're selling too, typically about half of what they'll put on the tag when they hang it on the wall.  If you think that doesn't sound good, try some of the other shops in town and see how they value your used "player quality" gear .  If you're looking to upgrade, a decent price on items for sale plus decent trade in value on your used stuff equals a good deal.  Furthermore, they won't screw around with your trade in like a used car salesmen.  The value of what you're selling doesn't fluctuate based on if/what you're buying, and the price of what you're buying doesn't fluctuate based on how much you're getting for your trade in.  I agree with the advice of other reviewers in that 1) it's best to know your stuff.  this way, the incredible deals will jump off the wall at you, and you'll be able to avoid the lemons and 2) if you buy an amp from them, especially of the vintage tube variety, head straight to your tech to have it checked out and don't be disappointed if it needs work.  The staff is knowledgeable and friendly enough, although they will stay behind the counter and let you engage them if you want to.  Their inventory tends to rotate fairly quickly, so I would recommend being ready to buy if you're after something specific.  This is the place where  "I saw a ______ for $___ and should have bought it" stories are born.

35.description: I read other Yelp reviews of this place and knew I needed to go here for my first guitar buy (I've never actually bought a guitar before, just somehow found myself in possession of them).  I've been "on a mission" to a lot of guitar stores in the past, and I knew generally what I wanted, but have never felt good enough about what I was looking at to buy.  After an hour and a half in and around Midwest Buy and Sell, I walked out the door ecstatic with the deal I got on my gorgeous "new-to-me" Epiphone Sheraton II.  For me guitar shops have always been intimidating due to the ubiquitous 10-year-old fingerstyle genius who hangs around and makes me shy about pulling an instrument off the wall and plugging it in to plunk around.  Part of this is confidence: I am totally comfortable in piano stores playing $100,000 instruments -- I absentmindedly rested a cup of coffee on a $70,000 concert grand in a piano shop once (once!).So I was shy going in here, looked at a couple guitars and nearly left, but pulled down a guitar I liked, plugged in (turned the amp way down low) and played a little chord progression.  To my surprise, the 10-year-old virtuoso in the corner and another guy who was appraising an accordion both jumped in on my progression and started riffing out.  The stars aligned: that little 30-second experience got me over my nerves and led me to pull out my wallet.I wish there was a clear sign at the front that said something to the effect of "This is a used guitar store. Feel free to pull an instrument down and plug it in; we will not judge you if you don't know what you're doing.  However if you break something, you will buy it."People who love making music will find something to buy at this place.  Whether they're looking to drop $10 or $10,000.  It can be rough around the edges, but is a great shop.

8.description: Here's that I like - This range and gun / sporting goods store is not the cheapest, nor are they the most expensive. They sit quietly in the happy medium zone and because of this they are able to staff plenty of good ladies and gentlemen who are kind, extremely knowledgeable, and patient! I've been to several different shops around Chicago and by far Midwest has  THE  BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE. This alone is worth the medium range price tag! Not only that, they do have a lot of sales, but it just so happens the things I am after are harder to catch on sale (I expect this anywhere because I go for top end). So, after buying your new best friend you can take him or her to the range in the same building. Excellent, will be here many more times in the days to come.

0.description: Don't let the front of MBS mislead you - it's not a pawn shop - it's an amazing store full of used/vintage/new equipment.  There's a huge selection of amps, guitars, basses in that small space, along with things that you can't find at the big box music stores - old lap steels, dobros, etc.  Great prices on used equipment.Best of all is the staff - great guys, very helpful and friendly. I went in looking for a bass cabinet to hook up to my guitar amplifier, and they were willing to move, rearrange, and connect anything that I wanted to test out.  Other places that I'd gone into flatly told me, "that won't work".  At MBS, I told them what I was trying to do, they said, "yeah, that should work - let's give it a try".  Made me a great deal on the used cabinet - sounds fantastic!

38.description: Their  focus is on used electric guitars and amps. They buy and sell to the public. They have some acoustics and of course accessories. Worth checking out.

20.description: I don't know what happened, but the last time I was here, the dudes who were working were down right personable and awesome.I own a late 70's Marshall and my band is starting to tour a little bit more, so I wanted to get an amp that would be less likely to "grow legs" at a show in the middle of nowhere.  I found a used Marshall JCM 2000, an amp that sounds great but has little worth on the resale market.  The guy who helped me gave me the ins and outs of the amp, pointed out all the work done on it and even told me to "make an offer" since their prices allow for wiggle room.  I went in with a price in my head, offered it and got it.  Haven't been disappointed in the amp or my most recent MBS experience.  I'll definitely be back again when I'm ready to buy another guitar.

19.description: Wayne looks out for his customers and knows guitars.  Pricing is always fair, and almost always negotiable (the limited new selection isn't always negotiable, and I assume this is due to manufacturer related pricing issues).  Selection is always good, but always call ahead if you're looking for something specific.  I've bought 7 guitars from MBS in the last 9 years.  Cost has always been below market value.The best guitar shop in Chicago for a vintage Marshall or Gibson.

33.description: Midwest Buy & Sell is located in a west side nondescript storefront. Once a pawn shop, MB&S now carries an excellent selection of working class guitars and amplifiers. The staff are really great guys and have a good knowledge of the equipment that they carry. They are easy to work with and always give a good deal with trade-ins.  One of my favorite music shops by far.

2.description: Buy far a must first stop for anyone buying it selling gear.  Wayne is super honest and knows the latest trends in market prices to help you with a purchase or sale.   Business the old fashion way.  Honest.

34.description: I've bought almost every amp and speaker I own here. And that's a lot. This is one of the few music stores in the city a girl can visit without feeling like, well, a girl. This weekend, my husband and I were in and I eavesdropped on a dad getting his daughter her first electric bass. The staff could have been complete douches and girlfriend could've walked out with some sort of Japanese-make five string. But they did her right -- she was choosing between a Fender P-bass and Jazz Bass. Thank you, Midwest Buy & Sell. We love you.

32.description: I went to Midwest on recommendation of a friend of mine who had bought a second hand amp head and a couple cabinets there for a great price.  At the time I had been toying with the idea of getting a nice Fender tube combo amp (just a nice all-around amplifier) but I had some other priorities that I had to take care of.  About a year later, I started looking again on a Saturday afternoon with nothing else to do.  I found the exact amp that I was looking for at Midwest with a price tag that was a little bit steep.I asked for some help from the salesman about what was possible to do about the price.  I told him that I knew about what these things got new and on used markets.  He nearly immediately knocked 25% off the price and calculated tax for me.  I went home, made sure it was a good deal and then returned two days later to buy the amp.That's about the one bit of advice I would have about shopping here or at any other used music store for that matter.  Go and look at what they have, then look around and tell the guys there what kind of prices you found.  They are honest enough to help work on a deal with you.I have a hard time imagining going anywhere else for a guitar or an amp now.

18.description: Worst hours

13.description: I don't know what happened, but the last time I was here, the dudes who were working were down right personable and awesome.I own a late 70's Marshall and my band is starting to tour a little bit more, so I wanted to get an amp that would be less likely to "grow legs" at a show in the middle of nowhere.  I found a used Marshall JCM 2000, an amp that sounds great but has little worth on the resale market.  The guy who helped me gave me the ins and outs of the amp, pointed out all the work done on it and even told me to "make an offer" since their prices allow for wiggle room.  I went in with a price in my head, offered it and got it.  Haven't been disappointed in the amp or my most recent MBS experience.  I'll definitely be back again when I'm ready to buy another guitar.

4.description: A friend brought me to Midwest Buy and Sell in search of a cheap used bass since I'm just starting to learn to play. We were warmly greeted when we walked in and when I articulated my VERY low budget for a decent bass, the owner didn't blink an eye. Instead, he found me four great options in my price range. Then, we were given plenty of space and time to play around with them and settle on one. When I did make a selection, the owner have it a quick tune-up and threw in a bag for free!! In addition to the fantastic service, they had a wide range of rock and roll instruments and amps...and the owner is willing to make you a deal. Great place...I will definitely be back and recommend it to musical friends.

24.description: As a female musician I really appreciate that these guys don't give me a second glance when I walk in.  They assume correctly that I'm a musician there to buy instruments (and not to follow my boyfriend around), which is drastically different from the way I'm treated at CME and more so at Guitar Center.  That aside, the shop and it's owner are really and truly great.  My first big purchase there was a Fender Deville which they gave me for a ridiculously good price (I love that beast of an amp!!!).  I've since gone back for an Fender Esquire with an added Glendale pick-up (crunches like a Tele), some pedals, and a bare-bones drum set.  Every time I go in that place I find a sweet gem!!!In addition, their customer service is beyond compare!  I'm trying to find a specific used guitar and they've offered to keep an eye out for it at trade shows to snag it for me.  Plainly: These guys are down-to-earth, honest, and genuine guys who love music and instruments, support musicians and really want to give you a good deal.  The store offers unique finds and if they don't have what you're looking for they will offer to hunt it down for you.  What more could you ask for in a music shop???Just a note: They are not open on Sundays and have slightly odd operating hours during the rest of the week--make sure you check before you head that far out west!

6.description: This place is amazing.  There's a huge selection of instruments at every price point.  I've bought (or brought a friend to buy) a great acoustic, a solid electric, a cheap yet very workable bass, an amazing 70s bass amp, a few mics, guitar pedals, little tube guitar amps...The staff is friendly and knowledgeable without trying to upsell you.  They are my first stop for any guitar/bass purchase!

22.description: I echo they are very respectful of female musicians. They also bargain and negotiate with you, which is great. The one annoying thing is that they sometimes pressure you to buying things you are on the fence about- I regret the guitar I bought- but business owners gotta hustle.

15.description: I don't know how many times I've been here in the past but I have not bought a thing yet and it has nothing to do with the store.  It's all me and my indecisive nature when it comes to buying equipment.  It doesn't help that every time I go there, I'll find multiple pieces of equipment that I want that I'm sitting there contemplating..guitar...or amp...which do I get??  Out of frustration I walk away with nothing.  I found a nice Fender Stratosonic there that I passed up and regret...I found a nice Gibson 6LS there that I passed up and regret....I found a couple nice amps I walked away from as well...Probably not a great drum store, but if you're looking for amps or guitars, basses, this is the place.  Very friendly people.

7.description: 0% pretentious.  This store always has an amazing selection of vintage gear at honest prices.  There's always a few interesting/rare items in the shop to check out.  Not a huge selection of pedals - but they always have have a stellar collection of electric guitars, amps, and basses.

36.description: Three words: Great used guitars.

30.description: Awesome selection of vintage guitars and amps at very reasonable prices. I got a great out-of-production amp here and was even able to haggle them down a little.A word of advice: only shop here if you know your stuff. You can get a great deal if you know what you're doing, but you can also get burned if you don't have a clue. My friend bought an amp here, and was upset when he later found out it had been heavily modified by the previous owner. This information was not volunteered to him by the staff. Maybe they deliberately didn't tell them, or maybe they didn't even know.The staff is pretty hands-off, but have been friendly when I approached them.

3.description: I've been shopping here for decades. A wonderful store, with a trade based selection - always exciting to see what pops up. You could not ask for a more fair, honest and helpful staff.

14.description: As a female musician I really appreciate that these guys don't give me a second glance when I walk in.  They assume correctly that I'm a musician there to buy instruments (and not to follow my boyfriend around), which is drastically different from the way I'm treated at CME and more so at Guitar Center.  That aside, the shop and it's owner are really and truly great.  My first big purchase there was a Fender Deville which they gave me for a ridiculously good price (I love that beast of an amp!!!).  I've since gone back for an Fender Esquire with an added Glendale pick-up (crunches like a Tele), some pedals, and a bare-bones drum set.  Every time I go in that place I find a sweet gem!!!In addition, their customer service is beyond compare!  I'm trying to find a specific used guitar and they've offered to keep an eye out for it at trade shows to snag it for me.  Plainly: These guys are down-to-earth, honest, and genuine guys who love music and instruments, support musicians and really want to give you a good deal.  The store offers unique finds and if they don't have what you're looking for they will offer to hunt it down for you.  What more could you ask for in a music shop???Just a note: They are not open on Sundays and have slightly odd operating hours during the rest of the week--make sure you check before you head that far out west!

12.description: I know its KFC so they deserve a one star review just for that.  Not so!  First off I went through the drive thru at this location.  First I try and order mashed potatoes as a side they tell me they are out.  Then they offer me cole slaw I say ok.  They then inform me they are out of coleslaw.  I then say ok give me the corn ok they have that good I figure.  I then try to order 2 extra biscuits opps they are out of biscuits they inform me.  What isn't the biscuit the KFC staple?  So they we out of everything essentially and it was not even close to closing time.  Horrid employees at this location.  They were not even sorry about it nor did they offer me a discount on my order of what I really didn't want.

3.description: Place is dirty and service is slow.  Order a chicken bucket and all the chicken wax fried to the bone.  I used to go all the time now will never step foot in there.  Definitely not recommend.

1.description: Just glazing over some of the other reviews, I see that I am not alone in my complaints of this particular KFC location.  I have tried to give this place a chance, but like the Cubs...they have repeatedly let me down.  One time I had to wait over 5 minutes for a boneless piece for my KFC Go Cup. This was at 6 pm, in the middle of dinner rush.  I would think that you would anticipate a high order volume order at around this time and adjust.  This has happened to me 3 times at around the same time.  One time, they ran out of honey mustard dipping sauce...seriously???  This has to be bad management...and that is just unfortunate. I love KFC, but I seriously avoid this location.

2.description: This location is super, super slow inside and drive thru. There's always long lines. The last time I was there, the customer in front of me had been waiting almost an hour for her food and I waited almost that also.  Alot of the times my order was wrong and I had to return back several times. NEVER AGAIN!

9.description: Takes forever here! They also neglected to give us sauce for tenders. They also screwed up my order I ordered mashed potatoes and that it was on the receipt but when I got home they gave me potato tenders. Not sure why they kept this one open when they closed the Park Ridge one where they were nicer and more efficient

10.description: It takes half an hour to get a pot pie. Pathetic. it is also hazardous just to get back on Harlem Avenue from this tight fitting KFC.

4.description: If I could give this shit hole zero stars I would. First, the cashiers had to go back and forth to get me my change because the computers weren't working..uhm..what? Then my boyfriend was ordering and the guy was like "we don't have any original" and thats what my boyfriend really wanted so he asked if they were going to make any more any time soon, and the guy behind the counter was like "NO" very curtly and RUDE AS HELL. This guy had a stick up his ass the whole time he was there. Don't ever EVER go here, if you're hungry go right next door to Mr. Beefs or even Wendys! Much more courteous staff and they actually HAVE the food they advertise on their menu. I hate this KFC.

6.description: I don't like that when I order the boneless white meat chicken, I get thighs. I do not eat thighs, and never have in my life. When I order white meat, and pay, that is what I want to find when I get home to eat it.Twice I had to give the food away, and spend more money online ordering. The third time I went back, I said make sure you give me white meat chicken, and not thighs. I said it twice.The girl at the counter spoke to the people in the kitchen about it. Finally one of the cooks came out and said he would try to give me boneless white meat and not thighs.Try?He admitted that when the chicken is floured, because it is boneless, they can't tell which pieces are which, so they guess at which is white meat. How about after you flour the thighs, you throw them in a bin labeled thighs, and do the same for a bin labeled white meat? Simple, no?

0.description: I like this place they have never messed up my order the store clerk is allways cheerful when you order their foodOnce i was double charged on my credit card  i came in the next day and they took care of it without problemBTW Yelp users should also join FourSquare website :)foursquare.com/venue/956…

5.description: Went here right after work, pulled up to drive through and the guy was like " we only have chicken tonight" ........ I'm sorry isn't this KFC? Kentucky ...Fried ...Chicken?? Lmao..he was rude and rushed to take my order. It took him 20 minutes then I had to go back because he got it wrong! Every time I go here, I end up angry over something dumb they did! Don't waste your time! Worst KFC possible!

13.description: The worst KFC I have every every been to! I happen to love KFC thats why I gave this one another chance a year after the first time I went there, and guess what no change. This place is just o bad they are terribly slow, I mean KFC is fast food 40 min wait for a bucket of chicken that is just crazy and they have been very rude to me each time I have been there, please fire everyone at this location and hire a staff and manager that know what there doing, I WONT BE BACK

11.description: Wth? Was this stuff chicken or pigeon? Smallest & driest KFC I've ever had, and I luv me some KFC!  And its so expensive these days, this was a complete rip off.

8.description: Its a KFC. You'll be happy if you dont get food poisoning. I have be coerced by drunk people to bring them here. Then I have to wait while they make the food thats not under their warmers rotting away. Hooray!

14.description: This place is insane! Me and my friends went in there one day and the people behind the counter were very odd. I swear if I didnt know any better i would say it was a hidden camera show. The lady taking the orders was yelling at everyone in the back making the food and the guy handing out the food was a flamer. He offered me more then what i had ordered. if you get what im saying

7.description: They always seem to be out of chicken with a 20+ minute wait whenever the kids are asking for KFC.  720pm on a Friday I was told it would be 23 minutes to get chicken.  Really? On a Friday evening?  It has been 23 minutes and it seems the kitchen is imploding and a lobby full of customers is fuming.

28.description: I have ordered delivery from here a few times now and the food was great every time.  Burrito was better then most around here and I tried their tortilla soup my wife loved it I thought it was ok but I am not a fan of tortilla soup.

1.description: Been here a couple of times already  It's a new restaurant in the neighborhood and I'm liking this place.. I Love the fresh salsa and the pulled  chicken enchiladas  a lot of Mexican places don't really make them that way..  The mola sauce is yummy!! I have no complaints I hope their here to stay!!!

9.description: The food was great, but our waitress was just awful. .I don't know if it was her first day or what her deal was but she couldn't have been worse! At Least The Food Was Good though.

29.description: They don't let you in at night if you are wearing gym shoes.  Really?! This is not a fancy place or downtown swanky club. However there is a guy here in flip flops with ugly toes hanging out but yet my husband cant wear his gym shoes. Oh and because we are not hispanic. A girl right after us who was hispanic got in with tennis shoes.

23.description: I came here with my family and we all really enjoyed our food. The inside is very clean, welcoming and spacious. We got caldo de res and a few different burritos. The flan was also very tasty and homemade. We will be returning!

5.description: I will start with DO NOT COME HERE!  we called ahead to inform the staff that we had a party of 11 headed their way. Once we got there it took the waitress 20 minutes to bring one of the women in our party the Margarita she ordered. We asked the waitress several times to take our order and were told that she would be right with us.  Meanwhile, a separate party walked in and immediately had their order taken, when we pointed out to the waitress that they received their food before us she stated that they ordered ahead when we WATCHED her take their order ahead of ours.  There were a total of three tables occupied and the wait staff could not handle it.  Disappointing to say the least. I will never come here again, I suggest you don't either.

31.description: The food is excellent.  The second time coming here and rhe service has improved. The first visit service was slow, but this time it has improved.  Guacamole is home and excellent.  Their tortilla soup realy good. The steak fajitas, steak tacos from the first visit were excellent tonight I ordered the tampaniqua and my husband ordered the steak burrito.

25.description: The soup is beyond amazing!!!!!! The food is so good. Everything is fresh, with so much flavor. The girls that work there are so sweet.

12.description: Very clean and very fresh!!!We got The steak burrito dinner. No chewy fatty pieces of steak like other places. Charbroiled to perfection. Best place that delivers in the Neighborhood.

37.description: Recently opened at the end of my block. My wife and I love Mexican Food so we decided to give it a try. Went there around 8pm on a Saturday night, and the place was almost empty. Its a great layout in there with plenty of space. First thing we noticed was the VERY LOUD Bulls Game on. Of course Chi-Town Pride there, but I guess we expected some traditional music. It seemed like more of a Sports Bar that happens to serve Mexican Food. Great waiter that was very attentive. Rushed out with decent chips and an OK salsa, and refilled it once. I ordered their Namesake; Tortilla Soup as well as 2 steak and 2 fish tacos. My wife went for a Grilled Shrimp dinner.The Tortilla Soup was great, as it should be. Tasted like it was made with care......but, a $6 1/2 Bowl of Soup isn't going to keep people coming back......My tacos came out and looked great, but that's where it stopped. The tortilla tasted like it had been sitting out for 10min and the steak was like a bad grilling experience. Fish Taco, I will guess that it was Snapper, but not sure since it was crumbled and over salted. Not sure if they were trying to cover a fishy taste or if that was their "Special Seasoning"  I wasn't happy with either taco.My wife enjoyed her Shrimp dish, after she spent about 5min peeling little pieces of the shell off the actual meat, but at $16 for 5 medium shrimp, the value wasn't there......Really a shame because we were very excited to see a very local Mexican spot at a great location. There are so many other options in the area. $50 with 2 beers, tax/tip left me feeling unhappy when we left. A $20 Taqueria meal at one of the other local spots would have made me happier...You can see my previous reviews on a few Mexican Spots......

21.description: My boyfriend and I went last night using a groupon & we we both really enjoyed our food & the experience ! They were not packed no wait to sit food came pretty quick as well as out margaritas ! Yum!  Our server was cute & very attentive ! We both left happy enjoyed the shrimp cocktail the most! We also had the mix fajitas and steak burrito also very good ! Will be back !

16.description: Ordered takeout and it was yummy. Rice is good and authentic and usually i am not a beans fan from some places because they're too salty but these were not and i even found an actual bean in them! My food was great and they give you your moneys worth. Would order again..

17.description: I live in Jefferson Park and there are plenty of Mexican restaurants to choose from. I tried this place based on the Grub Hub stars and was very disappointed. The delivery took two hours from the time the call was placed. The driver blamed it on the Cubs game, and then having to reheat the food in our microwave to then find a couple of thin hairs in the re fried beans. Yuck. Save yourself from ordering here.

10.description: OMG!!! I was at tortilla soup yesterday, with family 6 of us!!!!! The food had great  the strawberry Margarita was very tasty. We order a variety of food and I'm happy to say that everything was authenti!!!! The restaurant is  great for family event, for party group, or just for 2.  LOOKING 4 GOOD MEXICAN FOOD, WELL TORTILLA SOUP IS THE PLACE!!!!!

11.description: I had a margarita! I had a nice time! The salsa is flavorful and refreshing! Nice people, too!

26.description: Pretty much nothing was good. No one in my party of 5 liked their meal. We had burritos suizos, enchiladas and fajitas. All of it tasted off. It was 6 pm on a Friday and we were the only guests until 7 pm. I think the neighborhood agrees.

27.description: This place gets increasingly worse. First time I ate here the food was great! I went around raving to everyone about how I finally found a Mexican delivery place that was good. Next time I ate in the restaurant. Food was, well ordinary.  I shrugged it off, everyone has off days. I ate in a second time. Food was again ordinary. At this point there were a lot of much better Mexican restaurants I'd rather eat at. But, because my first experience was so awesome I gave it one last chance this time for delivery again. Awful. Just plain awful. The burrito suzio, tasted funky. I had it before, with my first order (the good one) and it was amazing. Best I'd ever had. Second time it was un edible after a quarter of the way through.The guacamole tastes like avocado with lime. There is no onion or cilantro in it, and very vary minimal tomato. I mean like 4 pieces in the whole container minimal. There serving of guacamole also keeps getting smaller. I ordered it three times, only because I will eat any guac regardless if it is just a plain pile of mashed avocado or not. The last time I received it, it was less than half the size of my first order. They also gave me 13 chips. Yes a large paper bag, with thirteen chips in it. This is supposed to be a large order of guacamole...so I take it a small order is one tablespoon with 5 chips right? It's not on the cheap side either. To top of the bad, my rice was extremely dry today. Possibly a one time thing since I have actually really enjoyed their rice in the past.What ever, it's not un-edible for the most part. There's just a lot of better choices out there for the same price or less. Aside from the guac... Even TBK has better than them.

35.description: The food is really good, very nice portions and it comes out hot. We had the guacamole, the large portion and it was really good and they put it in a large taco shell so that made it even better; it's a lot so make sure you have the large portion with a group which we had. We also had the flautas and tacos those were delicious; and we tried their tortilla soup and it was delicious; I had a full bowl so it was just right. Like I said before the food was really good, and the pricing was good.  The only thing the we had to ask the waitress for the tableware and napkins, other than that it was ok. We had the manager come to the table and ask how everything was, they were very attentive. There was a party in the bar area and it was not bad they had the music playing and it was nice. Over all we had a nice experience and we can't wait to go again.

8.description: I really love this place.  We've been here 4 times in the last 6 months,  and I haven't had anything less than excellent yet.

0.description: I come here often, always have the tortilla soup either in a cup or bowl with chicken. Also order the shrimp cocktail every time, both are the best I've ever had. Anything with steak is awesome. And you must finish with fried ice cream or the flan. Drinks are good too. Everything has always been delicious here.Give this place a shot.
