20.description: This place has amazing chicken and mole, and enchiladas. I'm sure it would be better eating in, than ordering. That is my reason for 4 stars instead of 5. Delivery takes forever, but it's worth the wait.Fried ice cream completes my order! Yum!

19.description: My boyfriend and I went last night using a groupon & we we both really enjoyed our food & the experience ! They were not packed no wait to sit food came pretty quick as well as out margaritas ! Yum!  Our server was cute & very attentive ! We both left happy enjoyed the shrimp cocktail the most! We also had the mix fajitas and steak burrito also very good ! Will be back !

33.description: Great tortilla soup & chile rellenos! We enjoyed our dinner here quite a bit. Staff are super friendly too!

2.description: very mediocre, food wasn't bad. they just charge you for everything extra. example i got fajitas, if you wanted cheese, tomatoes sour cream etc, thats extra!!! not a big fan of paying for something that is given to you at any other mexican restaurant.

34.description: We saw this place open up at the end of our block and had it on our "to-do list" to try it out.  We did so on New Years eve and were not disappointed.  Although from the outside, it may not look like much, but looks are deceptive.  There is a very nice dining area, a dance floor, a bar, etc.  It's very nice inside.I ordered the vegetarian taco dinner.  Their rice is easily in the top 5 Mexican rice I've ever had.My wife had the chicken flautas.  She said the chicken was well-marinated and delicious.We also had an order of small guacamole, which was rather large.  I can't imagine what the large size looked like.  But it was delicious and came in a nice tortilla bowl.We also split an order of the nachos, which were also delicious.  At many restaurants, this is not that much food, but we barely touched half it and had to bring it home.  Nice size portions.The waitress was also a very nice bright spot.  She was extremely pleasant and accommodating.  She took great pride in the restaurant and did her best to make sure we had a great experience.All in all, it was a fabulous experience and we even went back today.With the abundance of greasy spoon places around, it's really nice to see some great new restaurants open up in our neighborhood (reviews coming about them).  I promise you won't be disappointed if you check this place out.

32.description: I was excited to see a new place pop up in the neighborhood but so far we are underwhelmed.  The atmosphere is confusing.  It is REALLY big and open and bright.  It was uncomfortable to sit on the dining side that has a huge dance floor and huge wall size chalk board....so we sat over at the bar that had sports on TV loud (?) and some random bar games - also very bright.  Just didn't understand what they are going for - mexican restaurant, sports bar, banquet hall - could be either of the three but all together - is not a good mix.  The food was very good but if I'm not comfortable, we aren't going to go eat there.  We will try it again - the servers were so nice but the place was pretty empty.  I hope they can make it but I think they need to concentrate more on the feeling of the place - you have to be able to draw people in before they get hooked on the food.

18.description: Used to be great, but has dramatically dropped.We've been here a number of times, either just my wife and I, or with our friends.  The food usually is great.  Prior to this last visit, service seemed to slow down.  But on this last one, it went from bad to worse.First, we wanted to order the guacamole.  And, for some unknown reason, they were out.  This wasn't a late night dinner either.  Next, we ordered some margaritas, even specifying frozen or on the rocks, sugar or salt.  Not quite sure how you mess that up, but it was wrong.  Completely.  They tried again, and again it was messed up.  We finally "settled" for the final one, even though they couldn't get the salt/sugar part right.The rest of the service was painfully, and I do mean painfully, slow.  We originally had one waitress, but she opted for a larger party table, and seemed quite attentive there.  Ours, on the other, disappeared at times, not coming out to check on us for 15 minutes straight.  Was the kitchen short staffed?  Not really sure.  What used to be about an hour dinner turned into nearly 2.5 hours.  The food, great as always.  But the service, poor.And here's a side note.  On our dinner plates were slices of avocado.  So, they can put slices on our plates, but can't make fresh guacamole.  No, there's isn't fresh as we had previously thought.The final nail here was a Groupon.  We had dinner for four, $99.00.  Our bill at the end, before this, was roughly $125.00.  After the Groupon, and we did take drinks, tax, and tip into consideration, we owed around $45.00.  How exactly could that be?  We even discussed this with the waitress after pulling out our phones and calculating things.  At that point it was as if we were speaking a foreign language.What started out as a great place has turned into a nightmare.  And I'm honestly sorry to have seen that happen.  I really enjoyed their food.  This last visit has changed everything.Our final note?  We won't be returning.  Ever.

13.description: Waitress was very nice, tacos very good no noticeable fat in steak which is very hard to come by in most mexican restaurants now a days. Mother in law and wife enjoyed the margaritas will be back soon!

4.description: Just ordered two tacos, burrito dinner and two fried ice creams. Delivery came to the exact time estimated (I love that!) tacos were good & hubby's burrito was good. The fried ice creams came picture perfect (p.s. It is 91 degrees today!) they wrap the styrofoam your food comes in in plastic wrap so it stays intact (yay!) and they included yummy chips! Good salsas (we asked for green and red-those were in plastic wrap too!) This place delivers class AND good food. Definitely have to make this a date night restaurant in the future, I want to try the flautas next!

24.description: I really like this place !  I'mGlad it's in the neighborhood. They are really nice here and can't beat 1.00 tacos on Tuesdays !

6.description: Awesome tacos and food. By far the best in the neighborhood. Friendly and quick service.

22.description: Delicious food & Margaritas! Cute decor. We purchased a groupon and will definitely be back.

15.description: This place has amazing chicken and mole, and enchiladas. I'm sure it would be better eating in, than ordering. That is my reason for 4 stars instead of 5. Delivery takes forever, but it's worth the wait.Fried ice cream completes my order! Yum!

7.description: Salsa was AMAZING. Chorizo Sope and Tostada and Assda Tostada were good. Fried Ice Cream was also good. We came for lunch but want to return for dinner. Prices were very affordable.

36.description: There is not many Mexicans restaurants around this area and I got to say that this is my new favorite Mexican place aound here. Food was delicious.. large portions for a great price.

30.description: I went to this restaurant to dine with my wife and daughter. The food was excellent and the service was great. I would definitely go again to dine soon. I got the steak taco dinner and it was flavored well and hot when I received it.

3.description: So I've never written a review before. I always just used yelp as a recommendation tool, but today I was in the mood for some Mexican food and yelp suggested this place. I read a lot of the reviews and figured that this was a safe bet. Man, was I wrong. I'm assuming that the people that have reviewed this place before have never been to a real Mexican restaurant.  If they had, they would know that this food is terrible. Everything was bland. The molě was so bad that it stained the Styrofoam that it came in. I am Mexican. I was born and raised here in Chicago, but my grandparents were all from Mexico. I know what Mexican food should taste like. This is not Mexican food. Trust me, do NOT eat at Tortilla Soup. It is a waste of money. Go to the Mexican place on Diversey and Harlem for authentic Mexican food.

14.description: I really like this place !  I'mGlad it's in the neighborhood. They are really nice here and can't beat 1.00 tacos on Tuesdays !

3.description: Cheap ass bastards!! They never wanna turn on their heater, i just asked the bitch to turn it up and she told me flat out they don't wanna waste the heat, because of people comin in and out the door. If I could I would give them a minus star.

1.description: I would have not given any ,stars to this place  we went there for lunch and order a lunch special and let just say I won't ever go back and it very unsanitary  with there food  I brought something to the manager attention and he just laugh it off like it was a lie I told him to keep the food and I was not asking for a refund this is unsanitary and nasty we found hair in our rice I will never go there again .

2.description: Found this place while traveling through Chicago. Must say their food is excellent. The price is reasonable. The owner there is really friendly.

5.description: NASTY GREASY AND MADE MY WIFE SICK, SORRY BUT wont ever go back

0.description: I've been going there for years and just love their food... my favorite is the garlic chicken, um um!!! Their food is good, tasty, prices are reasonable and the people working there are very polite & courteous. When you walk in, it is very clean as well. That's why I always come back to Chop Stick Express!!! :))

4.description: This is a local Chinese spot in my hood. The food isn't bad, fresh and tasty. The Sesame chicken is a safe bet. The fare is pretty standard and the lunch specials are a good value. Lots of food and reasonable prices. Nothing off the charts but for a chinese fix this place is a serviceable option.

1.description: Tunes & Taps is one of the best music schools to take lessons from... if not THE best! It has been a staple of the community for more than 30 years, attributed to a successful business model that focuses on creating personal relationships with families and students in a shared love for music. All thanks to its genuine and down-to-earth owner, Lil Coco, who embodies the passionate spirit that makes Tunes & Taps so welcoming and so great. You/your children don't just come here for a music lesson, but for an AMAZING experience. As a current teacher and student of Coco's (10+ years strong!), I can definitely say that she and this school have had a lasting impact on me that I will carry for the rest of my life!

0.description: This is not just a school... It's a family. Period. If you are serious about learning music, this school offers a wide range of  instruments all taught by serious and dedicated teachers who love sharing their passion.      I have been involved with Tunes and Taps for over 25 years. Ms. Coco is by far the most genuine, loving, and supportive teacher there can be. And it seems to filter down to all that she employs.     The neighborhood is very lucky to have Tunes and Taps Music School. And for the price of lessons, you will know that it is all done out of love. Not a business just for making a buck.

1.description: Royal Flowers was our florist for my daughter's wedding on July 25, 2015.  I met them back in January when I just randomly went into the store while waiting for my daughter.  I met with Alice who is the owner's daughter who told me her mother is an artist and loved flowers so combined her two passions.  I knew right away that I liked them and they did an absolutely phenomenal job!  They were nice to work with and will put together anything you ask for.  Everything from the bride's bouquet to the church flowers were gorgeous!  Theresa clearly has an artistic gift!  And their prices couldn't be beat.  I would highly recommend them.

0.description: Unbelievable service! Theresa helped us tremendously! Phenomenal work! Beautiful and fresh flowers! Very artistic. She put together 5 large Sprays for a funeral within a day, just as we asked. She had such compassion, patience and understanding for our situation. Her daughter was a great help with extra translations. Very reasonable prices for the work and amount of flowers! I prefer to use family owned businesses, and this business was worth it. You won't go wrong here.

1.description: This place is really a hidden jewel! Check it out yourself and there'll be no question. Anything and everything can be found here. They don't have it? They'll get it. Collectible figures at an awesome price. Will definitely stop by again!

0.description: This store has everything! I went here to buy some rare figurines and they were really cheap! The man who owns the store is very helpful and nice and helped me get what I wanted. This store has literally everything for all ages. I would definitely recommend for anyone to come here, especially kids and even adults.

1.description: This place is great.  They grow everything on site and the key to it is that they won't sell you stuff out of season.  The owner explained to me that many of the mass nurseries will sell you items when they are not yet viable for the conditions.  Here they sell only when each item is in season, therefore your garden will properly grow.  I did read a review that was 1 star and said they aren't open in the winter.  The reason they aren't open is that that is their growing season and they don't carry plants or flowers that would survive in the winter.  I walked away spending $30 and learning a ton about the industry!  I will be a regular here over any mass produced nursery.

9.description: Rude staff that were very unhelpful and curt. I came in during the fall/winter months to find plants for educational purposes and the staff brushed me off and offered no solutions or personalized support. I will definitely not be returning there for any horticulture needs.

12.description: I'm very impressed with this place.  The quality of the plants is spectacular the prices are very reasonable and the variety is good.  Their strong suit is flowering plants so if you want to prettify your garden, this is a terrific place to come.I will say that while the people there are very pleasant, it's hard to find anyone actually on the floor of the greenhouse to answer questions. And the aisles?  Eensy.  But it's a lovely site and fairly addictive.  I've been there two weeks in a row, and oddly enough, ran into the same people both times.  What are the odds?  Yeah, it's that kind of place.

21.description: This family-owned greenhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in LIncolnwood and is truly a hidden gem. I just love strolling their vast greenhouses filled with geraniums, begonias, coleus, vegetables and hundreds of other varieties of exotic outdoor plants. They also have perennials and roses out in the yard. Bring cash or a check, as they do not accept credit cards. If you want pedestrian greenery, go to Home Depot or Lowe's, but if you want something unique for your garden, go to Urhausen's!

16.description: Unbelievable greenhouse!  I was told there are 2 acres "under glass" and it looks bigger.  First visit but I was very impressed.  I needed strawberry plants in December and they had them.  I will be back in the spring for sure!

17.description: Urhausen is simply amazing. They have an abundance of gorgeous plants on what looks like a midcentury Lincolnwood farmstead. A great find, and much more fun than other greenhouses. Simply excellent plants.

10.description: I'm not much of a gardener but I know a beautiful greenhouse when I see one! I did not know a place like this even existed in my "neck of the woods" until this past summer. Checked it out on a Sunday morning and couldn't help but buy a pot of fresh basil and curly parsley. This place is also home of some of the most beautiful flowers I have ever seen. A great place to check out if you want to spice up your home decor or even just your work desk. Note that this place is CASH ONLY. The staff was very friendly and the place overall was very well organized and clean.

5.description: This place is absolutely fantastic. Extremely high-quality plants at the most reasonable prices around (example, I decided to price out some of the big box stores in the area before going to Urhausen and found hydrangea pots priced $20 more at Lowes and Home Depot for lower quality blooms). The employees were very knowledgable and eager to help, as well. I had quite a few questions and the woman I spoke to was able to answer them all with ease and gave me some great advice on ground cover choices. I'm so excited about this find, I will be returning this weekend to pick up some perennials!

11.description: Found this place by accident about ten years ago and this is now our place to go ! Great selection of annuals with a lot of colors to choose from. The people who work there are always very helpful and can give good advice. Last year when the "downy mildew" virus effected the impatiens they had great suggestions for alternatives.  I admire them that even though impatiens were one of their biggest sellers they stopped selling them,unlike many other places.

22.description: Not the cheapest and bring cash as they do not accept credit cards.  But if you are looking for annuals, especially flats, and want the maximum in variety this is the place to go.  They have lots of colors and types of plants for both containers and bedding that one cannot find elsewere.  Small but decent perennial section.

0.description: I LOVE this place!  The smell in there is awesome!  Every spring I buy my flowers there. I also like the fact I am helping to support a small, local family business and not a big box store.There is some parking in their lot but there is also street parking.They are also very good at helping you put your purchases in your vehicle.

20.description: Urhausen Is one of the best finds for Chicagoland gardeners. I had looked everywhere trying to find geraniums with the really large-headed flowers. I found them at Urhausen as well as the wonderful Pillar Geraniums that I couldn't find last year except at a very high price. They even had the Peek a boo plants that I had ordered on the internet, thinking I'd never find them locally. The ones I had ordered had suffered during the cold weather and I ripped them out and replaced them with the much larger and healthier peek a boos I found at Urhausen. There are aisle after aisle of beautiful healthy plants. The people who work there who I think are either Urhausen family members or temporary (and perhaps migrant) workers. The previous reviewer said they were unfriendly. I'm not sure that's quite accurate. Well, OK, maybe it is. They don't seem to have much of a sense of humor either. The first time I went there I had bought about $500 worth of plants and when I pulled out my debit card I was amazed that they said they didn't take credit (or debit) cards. They did direct me to a nearby Walgreen's with an ATM. When I go there now, I take as much money as I plan to spend as well as an extra several hundred dollars which I always end up spending!  This year I ended up ripping out the many geraniums I already had planted and replacing them with the wonderful ones from Urhausen. (The ones I pulled out ended up in the neighborhood's corner gardens and peace parks which are maintained by volunteers.) Next year, I swear I'm just going to Urhausen in the first place.

19.description: Urhausen Greenhouse has the most awesome selection of unique plants in the Chicago land area.  If they are low on something, just ask and they will find it in their vast greenhouse.  They constantly replenish their plants, so you will not be disappointed.  Urhausen takes good care of their greenery and you will not see half-dead, dehydrated flora like at some other nurseries.  I have been everywhere twice, and this is the place I  go to just once!  No credit or debit cards.

2.description: My husband and I and our two (well-behaved) children just spent $200 at this greenhouse. I wish we had taken our business to Gethsemane, where you find good quality and variety and extremely pleasant and knowledgeable staff. The plants at Urhausen looked good and there is indeed variety, but we received no help, even after I stood and waited for staff to acknowledge me. I explained the location and desired plant (perennial). To say the woman was unenthusiastic is to put it mildly. She didn't even walk us over to the plants she listed. I would not go back.

18.description: This family-owned greenhouse is tucked away on a quiet street in LIncolnwood and is truly a hidden gem. I just love strolling their vast greenhouses filled with geraniums, begonias, coleus, vegetables and hundreds of other varieties of exotic outdoor plants. They also have perennials and roses out in the yard. Bring cash or a check, as they do not accept credit cards. If you want pedestrian greenery, go to Home Depot or Lowe's, but if you want something unique for your garden, go to Urhausen's!

13.description: This is a true greenhouse.   They grow their own plants, (as opposed to places that get them shipped in from ba-fu) and they take CARE of everything growing here.   All the plants are just gorgeous, always.    The prices are amazing for the quality and the staff is super friendly and helpful.   They can answer any questions you have about gardening.  Family owned business since 1922!   Even though it's a bit of a drive for me, I love going here - well worth it.  They don't sell any fancy pants garden "accessories", just PLANTS.   Flowers, herbs, vegetable plants...the place is just blooming.    Cash only, so come prepared.

4.description: I have purchased most of my garden plants here for many years!  They have quality plants, and I love walking into the greenhouse and seeing the beautiful colors that hit you.  It's the best laid-out and cleanest greenhouse I've been to, and it's a local family business.  A friend recommended this greenhouse, and I've also recommended it to my family and friends.

6.description: All the plants are grown right there. Many unusual plants and varieties, along with the standards stuff. The guys that work there know so much about their plants and it's a joy talking to them. Very clean, beautiful nursery with gorgeous bug-free and disease-free plants.

15.description: Lovely place to acquire fine flowers and plants. Know what you want not a lot of help. But quality is there. Prices are modestly high.

7.description: Good selection of proven hardy perennials, nothing too fancy but lots and lots of good options.Their selection of annuals is extensive and reasonably priced. Their herbs and vegetables are a good option too.Cash only, so plan ahead

8.description: I just went here for the first time, and I was extremely impressed.  It has greenhouses full of interesting and well priced annuals, and some perennials as well.  Mostly home raised, as opposed to being trucked in from Monrovia, etc.  WOW.   Why did I not know about this place??A much better choice than the big box stores, and closer to the city and better priced than Lurvey's and Pesche's.  Extremely nice and helpful staff.  Cash or check only.

3.description: They took the time to talk to me and help me look for appropriate plants.   I was impressed and surprised by the space and variety of options.  This just felt like a place where I felt good about spending my money.  Please note that they are cash only.

14.description: I have shopped at family owned and operated Urhausen for years.  It's always a surprise to come here and feel like you in the country yet so close to the city. I have always been more than satisfied with their quality and selection.  As the owner and gardening planner/designer for my business, The Garden Gal, I purchase many plants for my clients there because I know they are getting superior product and value for their investment.

3.description: I walked in with a laziness-induced afro and walked out looking good and clean; mission accomplished. Yonin cut my hair and he was very proficient.

1.description: really bad experience, too distracted when assist, cut my hair really bad, talk too much and fail to give good service.

2.description: I wanted to like this place really badly... Normally I write really long extended reviews on here but quite frankly, I'm pretty upset.I received a wash, trim, and blow dry and eyebrow threading. The job on my hair  was alright. I didn't catch her name, but a woman stylist worked with me. She would occasionally stop to talk on her phone and spent a while on her phone while flat ironing my hair. That made me pretty nervous, but the job looked alright. It began to frizz up almost immediately after I left the place, but that could just be the humidity.It's my eyebrows I'm upset with. The woman cut me off when I was trying to explain to her what I wanted done. I want my eyebrows threading a specific way so that they're arched but still thick. She took too much off my right brow. I noticed it immediately but didn't know what to say because at that point she can't put the hair back on my face...After filling them in with makeup and going about my day I just came home and got a good look at them. I'm really REALLY upset. I don't think I'll be going back. I would like it if my stylist paid more attention to what I wanted... In general I enjoyed the atmosphere and the work that I got was about what I'd expect for the price but I am SO upset about my eyebrow.

9.description: I was dropping off something at the cleaners next door when I noticed Mario's. I needed a trim and after hearing it was only $12 I came in. To be honest, I didn't have super high expectations - but Mario blew my mind. He explained all the details of the cut and got approval before making a decisions about my hair. I have a great cut that won't grow out insane because he cut it well. I am very proud to have Mario's in the neighborhood. I will be back for sure.

10.description: I actually wanted to try Mario's based on yelp reviews, but to be honest I did not have super high expectations.  He had one customer when I walked in and was very friendly and professional.  Not before long, his shop began filling up.  As soon as I got in his chair, I told him what I wanted and he really knew his stuff.  I have long hair and when he was done, I felt like I should have been in a herbal essence ad.  I have paid almost 50 bucks for a haircut that was not even half this good.  There was an added bonus since the cut was an awesome price!  I paid 15 cause I have long hair, but the price is 12 for shorter hair.  I also got my eyebrows threaded and he did a great job and even offered some shaping advice.  I will definitely be going back to Mario's.  It was a five star job for a two star price!

4.description: I went there to have my eyebrows threaded for the first time.  Usally I stick with waxing, but heard a lot of great things about this technique.  Mario's came highly recommended and it was just down the street from me.  Well worth it!  Mario was kind, talented and knew how to make this threading technique not very painful at all.  It did not hurt any more than waxing, possibly even less.  And the best part, it is a fraction of the cost of waxing!  $10 for brows and upper lip ladies, a steal! I will be returing on a regular basis, so long hot wax and expensive salon prices for this beauty service!

6.description: My husband and I have been getting our hair cut and eyebrows threaded at Mario's for the past six months, and we've been very happy each time. Some of you may remember Mario from his previous salon on Pulaski and Montrose (Hair By Mario). Well, he's back and has opened up a new barbershop/hair salon near Irving Park Road and Elston. It seems like most of Mario's clients are men, but I get my hair cut and eyebrows threaded there, and I think he does a great job. He's really fast, though you can tell he's a perfectionist and always gets it right. And he cuts your hair the way you ask him to; he'll make suggestions, but he's not one of those barbers who will say, "OK, I got it," then just do whatever the hell he wants. He's very precise and talented and listens to the customer.According to his business card, his shop offers haircuts, coloring, highlights, fades, threading and waxing, though I've only had haircuts and threading done. Mario's is really affordable. Men's haircuts cost $10 and women's cost $12. Eyebrow threading costs $7. As with any successful salon or barbershop, Mario's can get pretty busy. There were times we had to wait 30 minutes to get a haircut because of the line of customers before us, but since he does such a good job, I think it's well worth the wait. I would suggest going during off hours -- like in the daytime during the week -- if you can. He's closed on Sundays.  Overall, I would definitely recommend Mario's. He's really good at what he does, and I always leave looking great!

11.description: Fantastic !!! A Master !!! I went in not knowing what the outcome would be and was pleasantly surprised ten fold. A real hands on operation. I could not have got a better haircut no matter what the cost. I will be going back and recommending it to all my friends.

5.description: I went to Marios because it was across the street from where I work and I am cheep. I am not to picky when it comes to my hair so I thought I would give it a shot. They did a great job on my hair and even threaded my eyebrows and the total was only $18! My eyebrows were more red than normal but she did a great job on the shape. My hair was done very nice as well although I didn't like way she styled it, once I styled it on my own it was fine.My only problem with the place is that they were not professional at all and the place was a mess. If they cleaned it up and acted more professional they could really do good. Needless to say because I am cheep and they did a good job I will probably go back.

7.description: Well to start things off, I previously had a great barber who suddenly went crazy... then I asked around where can I get a good haircut and razor? Consensus says, "go to Mario's".Hair By Mario was his previous location and he is now back with his own shop at this location. It's on Elston just north of Irving Park, you can't miss it.Thank god I found this place. Parking is easy, it's always available. Mario does a great job all the time, he is a perfectionist. Everybody should follow his professionalism when it comes to customer service.I highly recommend this place, I get a fade, lined up, shaved and threaded for cheap.FYI: from what I've heard, he's good at cutting women's hair too =)

8.description: I've been going to Mario's for a few years now!  He is great and very professional and a kind man! Love him! Makes me look sooo good!

0.description: Thanks to this salon, my eyebrows are on fleek.You know, I truly hate that term and should have left it back in 2015, but when I consistently get comments on my "eyebrow fleek-ness" from friends and strangers alike, it starts to kinda rub off.Alas, here is my secret. The wonderful woman by the name (or nickname?) of Mimi who threads my eyebrows. She's a master when it comes to the eyebrow game. I can come in with wildly bushy eyebrows like I just came out of the Amazon and she can transform that to beautifully arched brows that can make any girl feel like a fierce supermodel. Always had a great experience here and the whole staff is very welcoming and fun to talk to.So get yo' brows done giiiiiirllll/boyyyyy.

3.description: Street parking on Harlem can be a little inconsistent but they have a small parking lot in back.  Hours are limited but it is a small, local grocery store so I try to make it on the weekend.  If you're there for a sandwich, you choose your bread from the bin and then let them know which sandwich you want.  I've been there a couple of times and the bread is sort of stale because it is quite crusty.  It's beyond chewy; more like tearing apart with your incisors.  The quality of the meat and cheese is quite good and you should let them know what you want (or don't want) on it.  Prices are fair.  The arancini at the register (if they aren't already gone) are definitely good.  Because it's a smaller, local grocery store, the turnover in their frozen and dried goods isn't always there so you need to check expiration dates.  I had decent expectations considering other Italian delis and grocery stores and reviews on other sites, but I was still disappointed.

1.description: I had seen this little Italian store driving down Harlem Ave. while I drove home every night. Finally decided to stop in. It's a quaint little family owned store with pastas and a deli. My first stop in I had the Italian Sub and it was stacked with meat. All freshly sliced salamis, meats, and cheese on fresh Italian bread. Today I went with the beef. You can tell the beef was fresh and topped with cheese and giardinera all for $5.50. I definitely recommend stopping in for a sandwich if you're in the area.

2.description: Classic Italian corner shop that makes great sandwiches. This place looks and feels like the real deal.

9.description: all i want to know is, whats up with the little italian social club that is next door to the place? can anyone go in there? do they have exspresso in there?

10.description: I really really wanted to like this place, but I just can't.  I ordered the diavola, really excited for the fresh mozzarella.  The bread was stale, the prosciutto was old, and there were no toppings on it ie lettuce tomato oil and vinegar.  I wasn't asked if I wanted any of these, so assumed they came on the sandwich.  Nope.  If it weren't for the hot peppers on it, this sandwich would've been dry as a bone.  I also bought a frozen pasta e fagioli, a delicious soup, especially when homemade.  After getting home, I realized the date that it had been made was more than two months prior.  Still wanting to give this place an honest shot, I heated it up only to find that it had definitely reached its expiration date.  So so disappointed.  I should just try to give up on finding an authentic AND good Italian deli besides Bari Foods in Chicago.

4.description: Great sandwiches, made fresh from meats sliced to order, great bread, quick service. Bring your own napkins!  This place beats Bari any day!

6.description: I'm really, really glad to have found this place on Yelp. My parents and I used to go here many a moon ago for our pre-Christmas (or year round) authentic Italian pantry raid.They have homemade sausages, pasta, and other Italian deil goodies, as well as a fresh and varied selection of imported items such as cookies, beverage syrups, soft drinks, and other goodies.Very nice, very friendly, and oftentimes, very busy! I haven't been for ages and I'm due a visit!

11.description: this place has the best sankwiches on harlem, hands down! whatever you get add alittle bocconcinni and some of those beautiful red peppers drenched in alittle oil and i'm telling its heaven.  just make sure the old man don't make it cuz he's alittle shy wit da good stuff, man i'm starving talking about dis.

5.description: GREAT sausage here.  we get the mild no fennel and always fresh.  owners are super friendly and humble.  fresh cold cuts, olives, some salads.  frozen sauces, and raviolis. all your standard pasta and canned selections.

7.description: After hearing through the grapevine that they make a good Barese style sausage so I decided to try it for myself.  The lady tells me that its made first thing Monday morning.  Even on a Tuesday they run out.  Finally, not wanting to take anymore chances, I show up there Monday morning where they actually had a good amount.  There it was, presented on a kitchen plate in a coil.  I decided to get 1 pound @ $3.49 & got the mild with fennel @ $3.69.  Both weren't bad at all but, I didn't see the hype with the Barese.  I was also expecting a lot more from this place but, in the end, felt underwhelmed.  I also couldn't find any San Marzano canned tomatoes, which disappointed me very dearly.  Pretty much, their canned tomatoes/olive oil section was slightly better than Jewel & at par with Caputo's.  With that said, most of their stuff was priced well.  During the 5-6 visits I made here, I never encountered 1 customer, which amazed me, especially when you consider the area that its in.

8.description: It isn't Bari, but you don't have to be Bari to be really really effing good.I love the sandwiches, the Diavola in particular. This is a spicy sandwich and enough of a bargain where the drive to Harlem isn't a silly proposition.While you are there pick up some pasta, some pomodori, and an extra sandwich for later.

0.description: Great Italian grocery store.  We were in the neighborhood buying fresh pasta so stopped here to see what else we could buy.  We ended up getting a great lunch spread (prosciutto, mozzarella, fresh bread, olives, peppers) - everything you would need.  The guy behind the counter wasn't very friendly, but the lady at the cash register was sooo nice and made a bunch of recommendations.  Everything tasted great!293/365

3.description: They would get Zero stars if that were an option! Worst food/Customer service in this area!I ordered a steak dinner cooked medium. They killed it. It was completely well done (No pink meat at all) and super dry. The garlic bread was wet and there was so much salt that it was not edible. My daughter ordered a cheeseburger with a fried egg that they forgot to fry? It was raw on top and dripping slime. Her fries were burnt and steamed so they were floppy and wet with way too much salt on them so they could not be consumed. Her bun was soaking wet and the tomatoes on the burger were cooked (From the steam?) and were droopy and falling apart when she attempted to remove them...eww.  So, we called GrubHub to complain since we ordered through them and they got us $20 of our money back as a credit at the restaurant. We were hesitant but hungry so we called to order more food (dumb idea) and the guy taking our order was arrogant and condescending from the start. So we honestly thought they might do bad things to our food and cancelled our order. Disgusting food prep and packaging was the worst. Beware people! $30 bucks in the garbage! Jerks.

1.description: Best damn food in the neighborhood. Stopped in this place after I found it on Yelp. I live a couple blocks away, but there's no sign so I missed it. Ordered the steak and salmon dinner. It was absolutely perfect. The steak was tender and juicy. The salmon was fresh and delicious. The fries and bread were good too. All for $10.95. Had a great experience. We'll definitely go back and try other menu items.

2.description: So I came to Whiteys to eat w my boyfriend, his sister and her boyfriend. The Food was delicious but while I was eating my boyfriend noticed a black and white hair on my fries, it was not human hair..looked like either cat or dog hair. But I continued eating my burger that I also ordered w my fries. Then my boyfriend noticed a long black and white hair on his sandwich. He picked it up an threw it on the floor and noticed a ton more of the same kind of hair! After that I was disgusted! We wanted to tell the owner and when we turned our head, we seen 2 Health inspectors walking into Whiteys. The health inspector told the owner to close the doors to not have anymore customers come in. I'm disgusted that there was so much animal hair in there! I hope there doors are closed FOR GOOD! so no one else has to go thru that!!!

5.description: I used to enjoy this place based just on the corn beef sandwiches.  The past two times I've called for delivery, I heard sob stories about either the driver or cook.  How can a place that's supposed to be open until 10:00 P.M. close at 8:30 on a Saturday night?  Obviously, they want to put themselves out of business.  This app needs a zero star rating.  It sucks to have to give them one star.  Actually it's ZERO stars.  Avoid them like the plague!!!

6.description: By far the worst food I have ever ordered for delivery or ever and completely inedible. I ordered a steak meal medium, a burger with a fried egg and fries; which sounds simple for a with such a limited menu. The steak was a very dry well done instead of medium, my mixed vegetables were overcooked & disgusting, the garlic bread was soggy & pure salt. The fried egg for my burger was not cooked all the way; the top of the burger was slimy clear with some white. Needless to say but I did not eat it. The fries were burnt yet completely mush and pure salt tasting. Ordered through Grub Hub and they were wonderful in trying to help resolve the issues, but because we paid cash for the food the restaurant would only give a $20 credit. Since we were still hungry and didn't want to waste more money, we called the restaurant to order again. The guy working was arrogant, condescending and all around rude. I ended up cancelling the order. I don't want food poisoning, nor do I trust them to handle food. Never eat at this establishment.

7.description: I ordered a steak sandwich on french bread with fries. Good food. Friendly staff.The steak came out as ordered - medium well - brown on the outside, a tad pinkish on the inside, no blood.I had a choice between a bun or french bread. French bread here actually meant garlic bread. So I got a sirloin steak on two pieces of garlic bread! The fries were a surprise. I expected regular fried potato slices, the usual fry. What I ended up with were flavorful herbed fries. Needed a dash of salt, but otherwise a pleasant and tasty surprise.I saw a sign saying $1 for a scoop of ice cream. I didn't ask or get to try any though because it was way too cold for ice cream.The food was good. The man who took my order, Tony, was friendly and very helpful to a first-time visitor (me).They have 1/2 price burgers on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and 1/2 price steak sandwiches on Thursdays. So, I'll probably visit again on one of those days to try other items.

8.description: Best burgers! Work right around the corner and decided on a fluke to try them and we were pleasantly surprised by the hand packed, juicy, and huge burgers we got! The price for a burger and fries is with tax like 6.50 so its affordable and for the price its alot of food! Also tuesday and wednesday they run a special for 5 bucks for a burger and fries! My boss tried the chicken blt sandwich and it was wonderful and huge! TRY THEM!!!

0.description: There is an Ancient Chinese maxim, which translated into English says, "the further one strays from the Hipster Belt, the more one must suffer at the dinner table." Whitey's answer to the age-old "what's for dinner?" question is a bold refutation of this maxim.On my first trip to this ramshackle dive of a restaurant manned only by a soft-spoken man with a rugged Marine-like appearance, I ordered the salmon dinner. This is how one eats like a King on peasant's wages. The slightly charred salmon was so perfect, I swear it practically swam off the plate directly into my mouth. The only thing that kept me from wolfing it down like a wolf in bearskin clothing in Gap attire was the distraction of the deliciously salty garlic bread, and, most surprisingly, the fresh green beans (and I used to think green beans grew only in cans on the west side). Second visit, steak dinner with baked potato. Perfectly seasoned, that cow was not bad. Not bad at all.I may have to permanently change my definition of "walking distance" to accommodate more visits to this place.

4.description: So i ordered a burger with fries today everything seemed to be over seasoned overall not bad for 6.50 gonna give them another chance hopefully next one will be better

12.description: This is a wonderful little Italian bakery! I LOVE the sicilian pizza bread (great to order for parties) and so reasonably priced. They also have a decent selection of cookies! (the butter cookies are my favorite) My dad is currently addicted to ther cannolies, and they have small little bite size ones too which IMO are taste better than the regular sized ones. If your looking for a sweet treat give this bakery a try.

7.description: Like some of the other reviewers, I probably wouldn't have set foot in here if I'd read the owner's response to a bad review.  (One of the things I've learned as a writer is never to argue with bad reviews -- you'll always come across looking like a real jerk.)  However I'm glad I went in there on a whim a couple of weeks ago because I think the baked goods are very good.We bought a pound of cookies, a loaf of bread, a chocolate ring cake, a sfogliatelli (something like a crispy cloud) and two genovese (cannoli cream in a short crust) and found them all delicious.  Also?  Cheap.  I ended up spending well under $20 for all that.If I have a quibble it's that there's no numbering system so that you really have to rely on the honesty of the other customers and your own memory to figure out who's next to be taken care of.  It's a busy place and the line can move fairly slowly so it's a short step from waiting impatiently to elbowing someone else out of the way to get your cookie fix.But once you're being waited on, you'll find the counter gals really pleasant.  Though I have to say that one of them failed to describe the sfogliatelli properly (It was even better than her description.) If I remember correctly, there are a couple of little tables outside where you can eat what you've purchased there.  Unfortunately the day we went, Harlem Ave. had turned into the sun's anvil, and sitting out there, even without a cup of coffee, would be inviting the kind of heat stroke where your brain boils right out of your ears.  And then, the street is usually pretty busy, so the fumes are a little off-putting.  But it's still a nice grace note.This is yet another of the small, local, ethnic places that really ought to be cherished, not only for the quality and the great prices, but because we need more businesses like this.  Stop buying your baked goods at super markets!  Patronize local bakeries if you can find them.

19.description: So overall with my experience I would not return unless it was for the cookies everyone raves about, but I will narrate my experience so you can judge for yourself.It was great to realize that this place made tiramisu as I was looking forward to this for Thanksgiving Day so I price checked the cakes the week before and was told that I could order them on Monday, but it turned out that on Monday they were closed. So after deciding to order the cake from this place I was happy to hear on Tuesday that my order could be ready the next day because I wasn't told that they would be open on Thanksgiving and I assumed they would be closed. It was great that they made the order in 24 hrs, but then lets get to the day we got the order.I got there about an hour after they opened and I thought the place was nice. Small and cramped but in a nice way just like Weber's Bakery. I saw the cake and the cake looked beautiful it was absolutely precious. They put pilgrims on the cake from the same whipped cream. That is where I had a problem. When it came time to pay I thought it was a lower price and I never got the person's name on the phone when they gave me the prices, so no big deal because if the cake is great who cares.  Then I was a bit annoyed that they were going to be open Thursday, but I thought it was for the better because I would be running around doing other things anyway and how bad could the cake get in one day. They told me that it would be fine. For a small place I thought it was great that they had plenty of staff on hand when the store was empty.So Thursday comes around and to much anticipation I get a huge slice for me. The taste was absolutely bad.  I was so looking forward to eating this tiramisu from this great bakery and I was so shocked. I still can't get over how bad it was because there was actual whipped cream on the cake. To this day I had yet to try a tiramisu with whipped cream. Now I don't know if that is how they make their special order tiramisu's or not, but I really wish I had just overlooked this place and went with a place I had already known for good tiramisu. So if you are looking for tiramisu be cautious and if you love whipped cream this is great for you. I don't like whipped cream, but the whipped cream was good, but it just doesn't belong on this type of cake. I could hardly taste anything else.So while the cake looked beautiful the opposite was true of its taste. I was so embarrassed at dinner too, everyone had a funny look on their face when they took a bite.  Needless to say half of the cake was left over and went in the trash.The place gets two stars because the service was great and the cannolis are a 5 star item.

1.description: Saw that the Irving location was open.  I was hoping for a little more.  I am sure it will improve over time!

2.description: If you're looking for great Italian pastry look no farther displace supplies Marianas food chain as well. I ordered a cakes from them and I was never disappointed

9.description: The is the best bakery in this neighborhood. There isn't much selection around here, so I frequent this place often. I recently got my husband his birthday cake here. I didn't have a chance to pre-order and the only ones they had available were cannoli and tiramisu. I went with the tiramisu. My husband loved it. I agree with the other reviews that the best part of the bakery is their cookies. I usually get them as gifts. They box them for you if you let them know your purpose, they will put pretty paper inside. It's a nice touch. Parking is a problem, and so it the traffic, but I think that's the problem everywhere you go in the city.

6.description: First and most importantly: I LOVE PALERMO BAKERY WITH ALL MY HEART AND MY STOMACH!!Yes, I looked at Yelp before I headed into Palermo and yes, I still went to this bakery without ANY hesitation. Yes, yes, yes. Some yelpers can be quite cruel online because it is so easy to type things. But will those yelpers ever actually take action by trying something different at the bakery or discussing why something tasting odd with the owner? No, they will not because moaning and groaning online is always easier. Paula, the owner who I met and is truly a considerate and wonderful person, is simply a baker at her finest who knows how to appreciate delicious food. She is willing to take action, online or not, to get everything done right. Now onto the food. First my friend and I started out with the Tres Leches cake. YUM is all I could mutter as I took the first bite. The amount of cream, cake, and milk was perfect harmony. We also had cappuccinos, which were right on spot. They aren't sugared up Starbucks drinks--this is real Italian coffee. They even sell the espresso at the bakery. I got a Sicilian focaccia because sweets always make me want something savory. It was a perfect combo of sauce, onions, and soft bread. My friend had eaten lunch beforehand, but I still convinced her to try the focaccia. She ended up eating half of it. That's how good it was. The prices were all a good deal. You can get a pound of unique cookies for less than $10 or a big, delicious coffee cake for $4. There are tons of pastries even some as low as $.89! I mean come on where can you get a good brownie for less than a buck? You just can't go wrong here. I ended up buying a box of cookies and three pastries. My mom loves tirami su' , so I bought her some from Palermo. Now she only wants tirami su' from there!This place sounded so tasty that I was willing to ride on the CTA for 50 minutes. So yes, I recommend this bakery.  Ask for Paula the owner, say that her customer Tasha convinced you to stop by. That day forward, you will always be treated like family :)P.S It is NOT dark in here. How can a normally lit bakery be dark? I just don't understand..

18.description: love, love, love this bakery! the pastries are amazing! palermo's catered  my pastries for my wedding, and they were a huge hit. you can not get anymore authentic then this place! it is just like being in italy, if not better. i am surprised there are any bad comments on here.  some people absolutely have horrible taste in food.

10.description: This little Italian bakery is wonderful. They have amazing canolli chips with filling dip (an interesting dessert that you wouldn't think to try but it's delicious), good Italian cookies and wonderful arancini and pizza bread. The perfect mix of sweet and savories. Going into this bakery is a treat every time. Friendly staff with good recommendations and they get you in and out quickly.

13.description: I used to buy their focaccia bread at produce world by Cumberland & Lawrence but it's often moldy there so I figured I might as well go to the actual bakery since it's so close. And for the records, the mold is produce world's fault for not switching out their products.I stopped in over a year ago and bought some products but didn't make it back there until about a month ago because I can only make it over there on the weekends. I bought a certificate off of a deal site and was really excited that I was able to purchase multiples (I bought 2). When I arrived the bakery wasn't too busy considering it was Valentine's Day weekend and there were a few young kids working behind the counter. A gal and guy assisted me (I think he was in training but he had a lot more personality than the gal) and I noticed there was a different kind of focaccia bread out. I asked what it was and she told me "artichoke". I said "ok, I'll take one of those and two of the regular" and then I ordered some cannolis, a cute valentine cake for $3.50, and some tiramisu. I was giving some of the treats as gifts so they boxed stuff up separately but I don't think they were very happy to do so. When it was time to pay I pulled out my deal and handed it to the gal. She didn't know how to ring it in so stepped to the back and returned to ask me if I had ever been there before. Her tone was a bit rude so I was confused as to why they asked. I know most places would prefer new customers to be using online deals but since you could buy multiples and there weren't any provisions stating "new customers only" (which is impossible to enforce), I didn't really get why she asked it in such a tone.My total was a little over $30 (my deal was for $24) so I handed over the cash and left. When I got home, I was really disappointed to find that I was only given one of the regular focaccias and 2 of the artichoke ones, which turned out to be anchovy. I was bummed out but didn't have time to go back and fix my order. Luckily, the cannolis and tiramisu were great! The cannolis were chocolate and I thought it just meant they were made with a chocolate dough but these were regular shells dipped in chocolate. So delicious! I don't know if I'll be able to eat non-chocolate dipped cannolis again.Overall, I'm going to keep returning to Palermo and I highly recommend others to check it out!

16.description: Went there around Saturday afternoon.  For the amount of stuff they have, the bakery felt rather cramped.  Here's what I got:Cheese & Sausage Panzerotti ($3.50 Pasta Fresh nearby are better)Slice of Pizza Bread ($2.25 pretty good)Coffee Bar Brioscie ($1.65 pastry bars filled with custard & chocolate chips, delicious)2 semolina half-loaves ($2.78)Pistachio Amaro cookies ( $8.29 @ lb. but my favorite)Foccacia ($2.89 for 8-inch)$18.93 grand totalNot too many pastries but, the bakery is more known for their cookies instead.  Their pistachio amaro apparently take 3 days to make.  Service was kinda in the middle.  I kinda got the feeling that the lady seemed impatient because I was shopping with an empty stomach & pretty much had a hard time deciding what to get when I really wanted a little of everything there.  Would go back to get more of those Pistachio Amaro & the other cookies I never had a chance of trying.

17.description: Wow! So glad I finally stopped at this place in my neighborhood. Great pastries and ridiculously cheap. I ordered a couple pastries, a couple cannoli and several little cookies. I whipped out the credit card thinking I'd be around $15-20, only to found out the lot came to $6.95. I look forward to getting back here to try their bread, focaccia and pizza.

15.description: I found this place by purchasing a Group on and was really excited to see that they have LOBSTER TAILS!  Anyone who watches Cake Boss will know that these cream filled pastries are really hard to make and look amazing to sink your teeth into!  I bought a whole bunch of different pastries....including the Lobster Tails (YUM) and some things I loved and some weren't for my taste but it didn't matter, they were all high quality and well worth the trip and the price.  By the end of the weekend my family members helped me polish up all that I bought!

0.description: Are you a sweet tooth fanatic?  I am!  I unabashedly LOVE the sweet stuff!  At times, it is all  I want to eat.  Palermo Bakery helps me hit the spot!Palermo is a featured partner of Peapod. Each grocery order, I happily decide which 3 donuts or cookies I am going for and my sweet tooth has never been disappointed! Talk about a deal- great bakery goods, delivered in your home with the rest of your food?  Heaven!Chocolate topped custard filled Bismark - I am enamored with these babies!  The gooey chocolate on the top shines and begs you to bite.  The custard inside is more like frosting to me, and makes my mouth water!!Sugar topped Jelly Donut- These cry for a bite.  They are enormous when compared to your normal Jelly donut.  They jelly is sweet and tastes of raspberries.  You cannot go wrong. Sugar topped Cronut- The croissant donut mix topped with a bit of custard and a ton of sugar.  Delicious and worth every bite.Happiness is a well done sweet!

5.description: To be honest, if we had read the owner's responses to the low-star ratings before we went there, we would have gone elsewhere. That said, we ended up with gorgeous cakes that were exactly what we wanted. We had a very particular look in mind, so we half-expected a CakeWreck because our geeky idea idea of the Portal Weighted Companion Cube cake was really esoteric, but they did an amazing job. The almond paste was so delicious, and much better than fondant would have been. We got a tiramisu cake, though I don't recall ordering a tiramisu, but it was a huge hit at the party. Our second cake (The Cake Is a Lie...) was beautiful and unbelievably gorgeous. They followed our reference photos to a T, were affordable and very friendly. I'm also a huge fan on whipped cream icing/filling over heavy buttercream. If you're looking for buttercream and fondant, this might not be the place for you. But if you like a lighter cake with a nice fluffy icing, I highly recommend it. That said, I'm still very turned off by the rude response by the owner to those who didn't enjoy the bakery and feel very fortunate we didn't have any issues. That alone gives me reservations about returning.

11.description: I'm sorry if I offended you. this was just my opinion and maybe your right my taste isn't everyone elses. but also recently tasted a birthday cake from your establishment and the cake drenched in modeling chocolate almost wasn't ready on time,  although the banana cream was tasty inside the outside modeling chocolate also wasn't appealing to me or most at the party. im sure you have people who enjoy your kind of things or you wouldnt be in business, johnny t has your whole menu posted on his review keep up the

8.description: Decent little Italian bakery at Harlem & School.  A good selection of fresh bread, hot items (like arancini, pizza, etc) and small pastries.  But the highlight of this place is the vast selection of Italian cookies available.  An entire case devoted to them, and there's a lot of flavours not often seen.  Things like Pignoli Amaretti (pine nut cookies), Anginetti (iced lemon cookies),  macaroons and of course biscotti are some of the ones I remember.  Cakes are also available but I did not see any examples the day I went.  Sadly, the cannoli did not live up to expectations.  The chocolate coating was incredibly waxy, the filling way too smooth and super-sweet.  But that's OK, as I am glad I found this place for its cooky selection as well as the lovely breads & foccacia.  The prices are excellent too!  Parking can be bad - no lot and lots of traffic on this section of Harlem.

3.description: Had 2 hours to spare so I took a quick cab from O'hare to Palermo Bakery and got their famous pistachio cookies, some citron and some amaretti.   The citron marzipan cookies are definitely an addiction as they go extremely well with pretty much with any drink or wine-- just the right amount of citrus without being lemon-y.   Their pistachio is loaded with roasted pistachios & marzipan.  WOW,  I easily ate 5 on my way back, haven't had them in a while.  I cant decide which one I like better, Bulgarini's Sicilian pistachio gelato or this.    Palermo Bakery sells the largest variety of marzipan based Sicilian cookies I've seen here, easily addicting, oft craved.Tip:  Palermo is a few miles from ORD,  is in the middle of Schiller Park on Harlem,  my favorite Sicilian bakery outside of Sicily.   Ask for Mary the owner and she'll give you a tour of the Sicilian cookies over 30 varieties.  Visits: 10+

14.description: I really like the tiramisu and cookies, i think horseshoes, with mocha filling! I like the Franklin Park location, closer to me, and actual parking

4.description: I've been meaning to check out this bakery and then a Groupon for it popped up. I saw that as a sign and immediately snatched it.Walking into the bakery I was amazed by its small size and a large quantity of people inside. I wonder if it was the Groupon that brought in all these people or if this is their usual Sunday clientele. All I really wanted were cannolis, but did not see any, so I looked around for some other stuff. They did not have a lot to choose from- maybe they were just out by the time I got there. Additionally, the pastries were not displayed in an appetizing manner - I mean, there was nothing wrong with the set-up, but they certainly did not scream "eat me". Service was good. I did not have to wait long, because they were very well staffed. Fortunately, they had cannolis ready to be filled in the back. I got some other stuff to go with them, paid and left after a total of about 10 minutes in the store.The cannolis were good. Definitely better than the ones you get at Il Giardino. The custard is smoother and the shell is crispier. As for the other pastries I got, they were just average. I definitely want to check out their Franklin Park location. It seems much larger and hopefully the selection won't be so picked clean.

3.description: I like this jewels..I've been coming here for years. I stay down the street from this location so this is my go to spot. Whether it's for food, toiletries,baby items or my cosmetics. There prices are reasonable..they regularly have good sales. Staff here however , always have a mug look on their face. Never pay attention when your checking out and need help. There is never anybody at the customer service desk. I regularly buy my bus passes from here and every time, I wait ATLEAST 10 minutes with every other employee avoiding me when I ask if somebody can help me . They always give me the " somebody will be right with you" .. This is very annoying! Also, their bathrooms are disgusting! All these people on staff..and nobody can clean the washroom???!

1.description: If you could avoid this location and jewel as a whole, do so. I am so dissatisfied with their produce and customer service. The only good thing about the place is their self checkouts but those are mostly out of order anyways.

0.description: I love this jewel, been going there for  a long time and I had a very nice employee help me to my car, I think her name was Maeve

2.description: I use this store as a pit stop on my way home from work.  I'll stop by here every other week or so and pick up my groceries during rush hour.  This Jewel Osco is pretty standard with no complaints here.  The staff at the deli and the fish butcher lady are very nice.  Don't be shy to ask for a sample of deli meat and pick out a fresh cut of salmon.  *if you are ever looking for gyoza(potstickers) they won't have them here

5.description: This store made me feel like the life was being sucked out of me. The prices were high and it felt gloomy. The workers were nice, its a shame jewel makes them join the union though.

6.description: I've been shopping that this Jewel for years. It used to be open 24 hours, but a few years ago they stopped. The produce is just ok. I recommend going to a local grocery store instead.You can find almost anything you need here though and the prices are not that bad.Lines get long on the weekend so watch out.

7.description: We don't have this chain back home so I didn't know what to expect. Overall a clean store that is organized. Had a decent produce section as well.  Also like being able to get liquor without making a second stop....wish Texas TABC would change some of their rules.

8.description: I live with in a block and go here for almost everything, the prices are not that bad, and they have so many options...

9.description: Love this store!!! This Jewel has consistently fresh salmon. The fruits and veggies are always fresh.  The store is clean and staff is friendly. My favorite of all Jewel stores.

10.description: One of the two Jewel's I frequent. I find this store to be well organized with a good selection of produce at prices comparable to the other big chains.  This store is a lot busier then the one on Irving Park Rd.

4.description: This is my neighborhood Jewel and Im always going in there for last minute items. Deli is just ok.  Produce has not been the best every time. Their bakery is just ok.  I have to say, Id rather go to the Jewel by Old Irving in Portage Park.  They have a better bakery, deli, and they are very well stocked with everything!

3.description: Great food and service! We had the sampler. Ribs and pulled pork is delicious. The biscuits and fries too!  Happy it opened in our neighborhood. Cathy our server was very attentive and friendly. Highly recommend it!

1.description: The atmosphere was really friendly. The owner and manger walk the floor to make sure everyone is enjoying their food and if they could do anything to improve our visit. The food was delicious and tasted better than expected. The only down side is that the food is a little pricey but the quality is worth the cost and it is definitely better than any other restaurant in the area. Would definitely eat there again!

2.description: Food was absolutely amazing!!! Probably the best pulled pork I've ever tasted. All of their food is made fresh and you can sure tell. The Service was just as great! Our server was so friendly and helpful and the GM came by and had a conversation with us to see how we were doing. Overall I am super impressed and can't wait to go back! I hope this place does very well.

0.description: I've lived in the south, love BBQ, and consider myself a bit of a "smokehouse snob." That said, this place blew us away.  The atmosphere is relaxed, cozy and friendly. The service is friendly and fast. But the food is what really makes this place.  I had some of the best smoked brisket I've ever tasted -- smokey and tangy, without overbearing the taste of the beef, and so, so tender and juicy; the stuff just melts in your mouth.  My wife tried the Carolina pulled pork, and it was just about as amazing -- tender, and with a bit of really nice attitude.  The sides are pretty darn good, too; just about everything is made on premises, from scratch, and with fresh ingredients.  IF you have room (and that's a big IF, since the portions aren't small), I highly recommend their desserts, too.  Also home made, and very, very tasty.  We were stuffed, so came back to try another day -- so glad we did.  The bread pudding is exceptional, the Tres Leches is very good, and they have a strawberry/pretzel thingy that looks downright dangerous. The place is a little pricey for this stretch of Harlem, but worth every cent.  Great meal, and a great time.  We are SO gonna be regulars.

4.description: Came in this evening on the recommendation of my local Alderman, for he carried on and on about the sampler. So seeing as how it piqued my curiosity I came in with the intention of ordering the sampler but reluctantly chose the skirt steak dinner, and to be honest the food did not disappoint either way. The hospitality at this location was very well...hospitable. Shannon my server was very spunky as she was energetic in assuring that I received top notch service. Alex the restaurant manager took the time to show me the redesigned smoker which was converted from the old brick house oven which was previously in the aforementioned Crazy Calabrese restaurant. The floor plan is much nicer with the new design as it opened up the scenery to allow full view of the two TV's housed on the back and side walls. It has a very family friendly atmosphere and the owner Lou was very gracious enough in introducing himself almost assuredly making it a point to meet and greet every customer that comes in ( Kudos to you Lou, Alex and the staff in taking the time to do that). I'm not giving this place a 5th star until I try the sampler which by my account will be very soon. I am pleasantly surprised by the level of service accompanying great food, it was quite a wonder that Lou the owner told me that they just recently opened quite quietly. This is a much needed repast from the doldrums of Big name BBQ joints, overall I personally think people will enjoy family friendly quaint BBQ restaurant located on the corner of Roscoe and Harlem. I think this will be my new go to spot.

29.description: The food was a little pricey for the venue it was in but it was good food and they give good service. Some advice: It's BYOB!!!!

42.description: I went here with my wife for her birthday.  Tyler served us and was very attentive.  He was very knowledgable and did a great job.  We had the "eggplant ball" appetizer.  It was delicious. For dinner, we had the linguini fruiti di mare and and a rolled up steak dish on a doughy pasta.  We loved our food. The service was great.  A couple of things that could make the experience improved.  1) get that liquor license.  Eight dollars per person is a very steep corking fee.  2) use less salt in the food.  The food was flavorful, and if there was less salt, it would taste way better and I'd give this place five stars.

23.description: This is my new favorite restaurant. BYOB and amazing food - if it weren't for the fear of outgrowing my clothes I'd be here weekly.  They are wonderful about putting together whatever pasta my kids are currently requesting, the chicken ravioli (I forget the exact name ) and the meat and cheese plate appetizer are delicious.

47.description: Spectacular service. Phenomenal food. Decor is cozy and old yet modern.The atmosphere is adorable. Be sure to try the Beet pasta dish, it's heavenly I just have too many words to describe this experience. Can't wait to come again! We had: Polpettine di Melanzane - Delicious flavors &  the gravy is sweet but just right!Casarecce alla Barbabietola - Again, whoever thought of beets with goat cheese and pasta... Brilliantly delicious.Brasciole alla Barese - All these homemade pastas just make everything on point, the gravy is sweet, full of your gardens tomatoes, and your grandmas love. The Pancetta & Angus beef steak are in just portions for this dish making it perfect to the tongue.

8.description: This is a tough one because the food and service were great, but it took a really long time for our food to come out. My wife and I were there with our 1 and 3 years olds (who were thankfully in patient moods that day) and arrived at 5:20. We were the only people there and were waited on right away. After having the octopus to start, we waited an hour for three pasta dishes to arrive at the table. This would have seemed like a really long time even if it were just my wife and I at dinner! Hopefully they were having a slow day in the kitchen because all three pasta dishes were excellent as was our server. And based on the other reviews this must not be a common occurrence so I'd give it another try. Plus it was nicely decorated and would be nice for a date or a group outing with friends.

31.description: We were rushing by to grab some fresh pasta next door, and I recognized the logo and looked in the window. It was 4:15, earlier than opening, when an elderly Italain man waved us over; yes, they'll make something! We still got food to go and oh boy, excellent fare! THIS is real Italian food in a great little hideaway. Yes, you can really fall for BarTucci!

34.description: What a fantastic addition to the neighborhood!  The ambiance is on the level you'd find find dining in River North. Really great job.  Candlelight and creative artwork. From the moment we walked in we felt the warm welcome. The staff is very professional yet personal. With that, along with the ambiance they've created, we knew we made the right choice for our valentines dinner.  Very attentive without being intrusive. Now, the best part - the food. The menu is not very extensive, but it's solid and creative.  The eggplant appetizer is a must. If we had only had that dish, I would've been happy. (They are that good). The roasted beet salad was just perfect. They had a couple of vegetarian entree choices (kudos!). Everyone raved about their meals (mushroom farfalle, pork chop & Gorgonzola chicken). Excellent presentation and excellent execution. Seasoning was spot on. Not the overly salty dishes like you'd get at a lesser restaurant.  The pasta - SO FRESH!!!!Our group was so very pleased!Dessert - tiramisu. So yummy. We shared, it was a large serving. You have to get it!They've only been open a couple of months, but you wouldn't know it as they are rock solid in every aspect. Can't wait to visit in the summer when they will have quaint patio seating. So happy to have this gem in the neighborhood. Ok, one last note - this is a byob. byob's!!! Other reviewers have misstated the corkage fees. It's $5 per bottle (NOT per person). Very reasonable. (You do need to consider the glassware they are cleaning for you after all)We really love this place, if you can't tell. Give it a try, you'll thank me!(Side note - visit Pasta Fresh next door for some amazing Italian meals to take home and bake in your own home)

16.description: Authentic, excellent food & service! The interior is cozy and inviting. I loved everything I ate - the roasted squash antipasto, the pappardelle ai funghi misti, and the tiramisu. I look forward to returning soon!

13.description: The squid ink pasta is probably one of the best pasta dishes you can have anywhere. They keep the dishes here simple but full of flavor. The service is excellent, servers are very attentive. Prices are reasonable. A true gem

11.description: This place is great! The food is magnificent!! The wait staff is sweet and helpful. The ambience Romantic.  My husband and I shared 2 bottles of wine over a lengthy 3 course meal (and I mean that in the best way); it felt like we were on vacation. While we were hear we heard several people speaking Italian- a sure sign of a good authentic Resturant. Beautiful!! We will definitely be back!

39.description: It is treat to have such a fabulous Italian restaurant so close to home! No need to drive all the way into the city for delicious Italian food. We will definitely return, and highly recommend it to all!!

37.description: I have dined in literally Hundreds Of Italian restaurants in Chicago and the suburbs, as well as in Italy.BarTucci is one of the finest Italian restaurants I have ever Dined inHomemade pasta, fresh gravy and ingredients.Cooked in the old world Italian tradition.And the service, and attention to detail, exceptional!if you love traditional authentic Italian, then go to Bartucci today!You will love it!!!Gino, Tyler and Neal are great hosts. You will feel welcomed and leave "fat and happy." :)

0.description: Very cozy and fresh made pasta. BYOB is very key. Love the ambiance and feel of the place. I went with the Rigatoni Amatriciana with a side of Brasciole. I love they have a side of Brasciole as it is a dish I like in moderation. Both were excellently prepared and the fresh pasta was immaculate. Very simple preparation but done flawlessly. My wife went with the Linguine Nere all'Aragosta. What value at $21 with a full lobster tail that was perfectly cooked. If you like squid ink pasta this is as authentic as it comes. For starters we tried the Bresaola which I can only describe as prosciutto on steroids. We were very pleased that a complimentary Polpettine di Melanzane was brought out. Even though there is no meat in this dish, it was rich enough to suggest you weren't eating eggplant but in fact very good Italian Sausage.All in all this is a great cozy spot that is extremely affordable and shows great attention to detail. Fresh food, great service and a slightly different take on Italian Cuisine (you will notice no old staples like Veal/Chicken Parm which is refreshing).

38.description: A hidden gem! My meal was phenomenal. Where do I start? The Affettati Misti is incredible, and the pasta is made fresh daily. My husband and I throughly enjoyed our dinner. We will be regulars.

51.description: As soon as I walked into this restaurant I had a great vibe. It felt cozy and quaint but yet elegant. I was greeted by Tyler and later by Gino who were both very pleasant. Tyler went out of his way to provide excellent recommendations for us two very hungry girls! We started with the grilled octopus. It was made with red wine, carrots, and red onion. If you are an octopus lover you will not be disappointed. It was cooked to perfection, not chewy at all. The portion was a large size for an appetizer. We also had the Minestrone soup which was delicious and definitely tasted homemade. For the entre I had the most amazing Linguine Frutti di Mare. If you like seafood, this is the dish for you -calamari, prince edward island mussels, shrimp, manila clams, and tomato sauce. TO DIE FOR. For dessert we shared tiramisu that was made with Captain Morgan rum. Again, to die for. Seriously, I asked to hug the Chef and we did! I always go to downtown Chicago for dining. How wonderful to know that I can drive 10 minutes and enjoy the same quality food and atmosphere. Easy parking and when I got the bill, I was pleasantly surprised at how incredibly priced everything was taking into consideration the exceptional quality of the food. If you are a foodie...you must come here!

27.description: It's a rare occurence to find a restaurant that can truly replicate not only dishes that have been a staple throughout your heritage, but also the level of comfort & intimacy that you would feel at home amongst your closet family & friends. I can honestly say, Bartucci's has accomplished this feat, and much more. From the authentic homemade Italian dishes that will knock you off your seat, to the friendly waitstaff & cozy atmosphere, you will feel right at home in this family owned neighborhood restaurant.
