It was the perfect ending to our wonderful dinner! Personable , caring, amazing customer service and even more amazing food! We will continue to come here! Thank you for being great!

1.description: NOW, THAT'S ITALIAN! Heard about "Check, Please" review and it's in the hood, so why not. Make sure you have your server tell you about their certification as a Neopolitan pizza maker (it's all about the ovens)and how they use local farmers and butchers to craft their delicious dining options. I've had their salads which are beautifully presented and the dressings are flavorful, yet light and definitely home made. Their homemade caponata (a marinated eggplant spread) is literally made by owner's mother and grandmother. It's soooooooo delicious and authentic. A must- try. The desserts are exquisite. The nutella crepe is a family crowd- pleaser. But the pizzas: Out of this world. The sauce is busting with freshness and compliments the crust which starts out chewy and crispy....and gets thinner and thinner til it's paper thin at the smallest point. The meats and veggies contain perfect amount of spices and taste sooooo fresh. You'll find some interesting pizza combos too in the menu like white pizza and arugala and prosciutto pizza. But even the less exotic margarita pizza will rock your world. The reason it has 4 out of 5 stars is because i think they could improve on the ambience a bit. Better chairs and tables, better lighting. Also, parking could be a bit hectic depending on day/time you go.

55.description: Excellent Neopolitan style pizza. Had the Locale and, even though we were just here for a quick late lunch, seriously considered spoiling our dinner appetite and ordering 2-3 others just a to see if they all are this good. Guess we'll just have to come back. No problem. We'll definitely be back and, after they open their downtown location, there, too.Manager, Giorgio, came by and chatted with us. Very nice and enthusiastic about the product.

9.description: Easily one of the best pizzas in the Chicagoland area, especially for those who love the Neapolitan style.

26.description: High quality food, with many products imported from Italy. They offer a diverse selection of white and red pizzas, catering many different combinations.

25.description: Napoli pizza at its best! The four of us just came back from Italy and did a 3 hour walking tour of Napoli and its pizza history and culture. So of course we wanted to compare Forno's pizza to our experience in Napoli. Absolutely Perfect! Wonderful crust, very light, as they use 100% - 00 flour. The center was moist and delisioso just like Pizza Michele, the first pizzeria in the world. We had a Margherita and a Locale pizza and a very fair priced wine. Had a wonderful conversation with the manager, Giorgio about his pizza and fantastic wood burning oven. BTW - takes about 90 seconds to bake. Highly recommended - Buon Apertito !

12.description: I was really looking forward to the new one in my neighborhood but it's been "coming soon" forever, so I decided to check out the original on the way out to O'Hare. We started with a nice pear salad and then ordered two pizzas - a red and a white. While both were delicious, there was still something missing though I couldn't put my finger on it. Maybe a little more herbs/basil would help brighten things up. I'll have to check back to be sure. Other than the food, service was good & efficient.

59.description: I should've left my expectations at home for this one.  This place was rated 4.5 out of 5, I beg to differ because the 2 dishes I had were totally underwhelming.Locale pizza:  kinda like a margherita pizza with sausage and mushrooms.  The server suggested that this is their most popular pizza... Why??? Although the server claimed use of local ingredients, this pizza was more on the bland side for me.  Perhaps more seasoning in their sauce and meat may be the answer but then I wasn't happy with the crust either.  It was soft and soggy in the middle making it impossible to pick up a piece... Ay Caramba!My perpetual search for Italian pizza ends right here.  I realized it's mission impossible.  It's kinda like me going to Italy looking for the best Chicago style pizza.  I give up!Caponata (appetizer):  it's like an eggplant and olive salad with sweet vinegar dressing.... the bread was so hard and literally hurt the top of my palate.  The eggplant mix is ok, nothing spectacular.  I wonder if it's better served warm.I had 1 slice of pizza and 1 bread slice with the eggplant.  Needless to say, my appetite died along with my high expectations.The service was great, the server was very knowledgeable and friendly, the price was way high, ambiance good, and variety of apps and pizzas were satisfactory.  I saw the beer and mixed drinks were priced at $12.  This place is way overpriced and way under-tasty.  Thank you for putting my search to rest Forno Rosso!Prego!

21.description: Went here for the first time and boy was I in for a surprise. The pizza is absolutely delicious, it is a must try. Calamari was outstanding. The service was on point. The ambience is a little loud so not good for elderly folks (our fault we went there at 9 PM) ... looking forward to returning!

17.description: Pizza is a little pricey but absolute worth it. Amazing!!! I can't recommend taking them home due to the style of pizza they are but they are worth the title of sit down restaurant food.

10.description: Went here for the first time and boy was I in for a surprise. The pizza is absolutely delicious, it is a must try. Calamari was outstanding. The service was on point. The ambience is a little loud so not good for elderly folks (our fault we went there at 9 PM) ... looking forward to returning!

5.description: Fantastic  salad, instant pizza and great wine at a good price.  What more can you want?

3.description: Rosa J. and hubby have been missing the wood-fired, Neapolitan-style pizza.  Our neighborhood pizzeria, unfortunately, failed to make it through the crucial first six (6)-month trial period for a newly-established local restaurant.  However, some time ago Rosa J. noticed "Forno Rosso" while riding the CTA #90 bus.  Of course she did her Yelp "thang" and had this place bookmarked.  After work this evening, feeling "famished" accurately described Rosa J.'s state of being.  Driving to Forno Rosso shouldn't be too much of a struggle because free parking is available at the strip-mall lot.Here are some useful measurements you may want to know: 1) each wood-fires pizza is a 12-inch size 2) a 12-inch size will be divided into six (6) slices3) as a result, 12x12= 144 (square inches); 144/6= 24 (square inches for a slice).  4) we need a dietician to calculate the calories for each slice. Oh wait, before figuring out the calories for each slice so that you know how many hours you will be spending at the gym, I have to disclose the information on what kinds hubby and I had tonight.  - prosciutto e arugula: the utilization of arugula should be a mandatory ingredient for any pizza.  The saltiness of prosciutto complements well with the naturally bitter taste from arugula.  - capricciosa: artichoke+olives+mozzarella= absolute satisfactions.  Ok, I will stop with my nerdy equations from now on.  To be honest, I will definitely order the prosciutto e arugula again.  Capricciosa was tasty, but I will opt for something else.  Two (2) pizza cost us $33 after tax.  We attempted to get a discount through the 5% off Yelp check-in offer, but George, the manager, respectfully explained to us that this was no longer valid.  Manager George D'Anna did his rounds and stopped at our table briefly.  He chatted with hubby, gave his business card, and invited us to come back. Other than the pizza menu, they have a wide selection of alcoholic beverages, wine, and after-dinner drinks.  Service was attentive and informative if you ever have any question on the menu.

35.description: I went out of my way to check this place out. Overall, the pizza was very average. I expected more. I did enjoy watching them make pizzas and stuff them in the brick oven, which is visible from your seat.

19.description: Good pizza. Just a little over rated. The appetizers suck. But THE PIZZA MAKES UP FOR IT

28.description: Great food and service!  We were seated immediately, and our meal came out quickly.  The staff was very attentive, And the food was very good.  We all had pizza, as well as some calamari.  I'm excited to go back and try some other things, there desserts look incredible.

45.description: Outstanding pizza and generous and attentive staff. Forno Rosso does lose a star for the inclusion of two very large TVs in the dining room. I am sure there is pressure to have TVs for when "the big game" is happening, but I think these giant glowing screens otherwise distract from the delicious food AND from the good company at one's table. Forno Rosso would only be enhanced by the removal of the TVs, or the very sparing use thereof.

33.description: There is something delicious about simplicity.  This place knows it.  Excellent quality food, dying to go back.

43.description: After reading such great reviews of this little restaurant, my friend and I decided to try it out for her birthday dinner. It took a good 10 minutes to even meet our waitress on a slower Wednesday evening. I had the prosciutto/arugula pizza and my friend got the margarita pizza... To our dismay, the pizza came out lukewarm. My pizza was sloppy and wet; I couldn't use just my hands as it fell apart with barely a touch. The environment was loud and other waitresses presented themselves in an unprofessional manner.  My questions about the menu weren't answered with confidence, and it seemed like a very ingenuine experience. It's safe to say we won't be coming back for this overpriced mediocre pizza; I've had better from Mariano's for $6.99.

2.description: Well where should I start?The food , was good for the neighborhood I live 10 min away from there !  But the management / partners are more worried about taking care of theirs friends insteadOf regular customers .Rule # 1 in this industry always take of every one the same .Pizza;  goodSalad ;  really good Octopus ;  may be they need to stick to pizza Tagliere  ;  ok meats are cut ahead of time not freshBurrata ;  definitely not fresh Dolce ; anything with Nutella its good ( not creative) but goodEspresso. Ok I really wanted to love this place , I think the food will be better but they need to treat people the same not because we look NONE Italian it doesn't mean we dont know good food !! 150.00 is later for two of us not worth it !Server needs to be more attentive !!

18.description: Awesome pizza choices that are really delicious, unique Italian beer selection but the beers were $10-14 a bottle (not even 12 ounces) The pizza is out of this world!

41.description: We've returned to Forno Rosso several times; in fact, you can just say were regulars now.. I can't say enough good stuff about this place. Everyone I've sent there loves it, & they have all gone back for more.The pizza, the appetizers, the salads- it' all great. My favorite appetizers are the rice balls (arrancini), but the caponata is my second best. The panzenella salad- mixed greens, Gorgonzola, & walnuts-is a must try; they do some lemon thing with it that puts it over the top. My favorite white pizza is the barese, but you have to try their specials, too. They're on the blackboard, and they've always a hit. The manager, George, never forgets a face, and usually makes it over to the table to say hello. The waitstaff is well trained & warm- not overboard. A welcoming and comfortable ambience. I live downtown, and I hope the new place is as sweet as this place is. Downtown could stand some restaurants with a neighborhood vibe like this one.

52.description: Had a previous bad experience here last week ordering take out, and the owner Nick reached out to me on the phone and invited me and my wife to come in for dinner we meet with the other owner George who treated us like royalty he was very nice and a stand up guy the food was Delicious we had the Margarita pizza as well as Arancini as well as desert every thing was great this pizza is defiantly meant to eat there  i would definitely recommend visiting this place thanks again Nick and George.

50.description: BEST PIZZA IN THE CHICAGOLAND AREA. Have been here with my family multiple times and it's always a great meal. So many pizza options that are big enough to split. (They also make a great nutella pizza)******** Their Caponata Della Nonna is the greatest thing I have ever tasted in my entire life. Still waiting to get the recipe (I believe it's the owner's grandmother's recipe)

4.description: I should've left my expectations at home for this one.  This place was rated 4.5 out of 5, I beg to differ because the 2 dishes I had were totally underwhelming.Locale pizza:  kinda like a margherita pizza with sausage and mushrooms.  The server suggested that this is their most popular pizza... Why??? Although the server claimed use of local ingredients, this pizza was more on the bland side for me.  Perhaps more seasoning in their sauce and meat may be the answer but then I wasn't happy with the crust either.  It was soft and soggy in the middle making it impossible to pick up a piece... Ay Caramba!My perpetual search for Italian pizza ends right here.  I realized it's mission impossible.  It's kinda like me going to Italy looking for the best Chicago style pizza.  I give up!Caponata (appetizer):  it's like an eggplant and olive salad with sweet vinegar dressing.... the bread was so hard and literally hurt the top of my palate.  The eggplant mix is ok, nothing spectacular.  I wonder if it's better served warm.I had 1 slice of pizza and 1 bread slice with the eggplant.  Needless to say, my appetite died along with my high expectations.The service was great, the server was very knowledgeable and friendly, the price was way high, ambiance good, and variety of apps and pizzas were satisfactory.  I saw the beer and mixed drinks were priced at $12.  This place is way overpriced and way under-tasty.  Thank you for putting my search to rest Forno Rosso!Prego!

6.description: I liked my pizza here, but my boyfriend's pizza not so much. We expected quite a wait on a Saturday night but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at 6:30 and there were a few tables and all of the bar seats open. WARNING: the crowds will show up and they only take reservations for tables of 4 or more.We ordered the grilled octopus appetizer and it was really good. Just the right amount of dressing. I ordered the diavolo and he ordered the locale sausage. My pizza was great, it didn't have much kick to it but we had plenty of chili oil or red pepper flakes at our disposal to add. The crust was soft, the cheese was plentiful, it would have been nice to have more pepperoni but that's ok. The sausage pizza looked a little sad, almost as if it wasn't fresh.Our service was great. Our pizzas were ready in a matter of minutes after our appetizer plate was taken away. Our waitress was very sweet too. They take their orders on a cell phone which I'm sure helps speed things up.It's in a small shopping center on N Harlem, so you may need to park on the streets. Not much else out this way.

22.description: Cute cozy space! Great service. Fried calamari perfect. Pizza..... good not great and only not great because I expected something a little different. What they do they do very well, however my one and only previous experience with wood fire pizza which was close to 18 years ago was quite different and that is what I looked forward to. Having said that, I will probably return because the food really was quite good.

15.description: After seeing this place on Check, Please!, I realized that the location was about 5 minutes away from our jeweler in Harwood Heights. Since we had to head over there this weekend, it was a perfect time to try out this restaurant! It was pretty easy to get to, however the parking was MUCH smaller than what I had seen in pictures. It may be because I'm a suburban girl, use to giant parking lots :P When we entered, we were greeted at the door and promptly seated. Inside it was nice and cozy, and you could see all the pizzas coming out of the oven from our table! I knew I wanted a white pizza even before we started, so rather than just looking at the menu, I just asked the server what white pizza she would recommend :) Husband, kiddo and I started with the arancini , which had a great balance of the risotto, ground meat, peas, and a large chunk of cheese! They were delicious, served with a side of marinara sauce.Husband had the panzarotti, which starts with red sauce and cheese, and he added sausage. I didn't taste it (not a huge fan of red sauce....and frankly, my pizza kept me more than occupied!) but he couldn't stop raving about it. He even commented (and I would agree!) that this was pretty close, if not just as good as the pizza we had at Eataly!I did appreciate the kiddo menu, which was a basic pizza, but they shaped them into either Micky Mouse or Nimo. Kiddo had a Mickey Mouse cheese pizza, which came with sauce filled ears, and eyes made out of olives. Beware to those that are use to Americanized olives, these black olives are true from Italy, so they definitely don't taste like the out-of-the-can black olives (which was a disappointment to me, but that's ok!) The size of the pizza was great! Kiddo was definitely full, and we even had a few bites of her crust ;)I asked our awesome server for her recommendation of a white pizza. She said the most popular was the prosiutto and arugola pizza, but since I've had quite a few prosiutto and arugola pizzas, I opted for her second favorite which was the barese. This one had rampini (which was like a very flavorful broccili crossed with spinach), crumbly sausage, and burrata. I noticed that the burrata (imported from Italy) had a much saltier, and less cream flavor than burrata I've gotten from the grocery store. It definitely paired well with the rampini and sausage.It was such great food, and awesome service! The waitress we had was great, super nice and knowledgeable. Than the manager, George came up to our table to thank us for coming. He wondered what brought us in, and really took an interest in us as guests. I heard about this type of service from all the reviews, and they didn't disappoint. I saw George, as well as another manager, hit every single table while we were there, and were really having conversations with all the tables, even for just a few minutes. When we come back to Harwood Heights, we will definitely be back to Forno Rosso!

57.description: In a nutshell, great pizza done they way they do it in Naples. If you don't know what that is, you might want to look it up before you go so your expectations are set appropriately. Some of the reviewers here seem to be disappointed by the crust that's a bit soggy in the middle but that's how it's supposed to be done. This isn't your father's (unless your father is from Naples) thin crust pizza. The owner once showed me how they eat it in Naples: you don't cut it but rather fold it up and eat it like a sandwich. I've never tried it this way, but he showed me it works.I've had about half of the savory pizzas from the menu as well as several of the daily specials. I have yet to be disappointed. Everything is very fresh and tastes that way since it's only in the very hot oven for about 90 seconds. Since my first visit I wind up getting cravings for this pizza every few weeks.I don't know how folks think the sauce and crust are flavorless because that's never been my experience. I think both the red and white pizzas are very well balanced in terms of seasoning and the crust I could eat all by itself.They have two beers on tap, both Italian (Peroni and Moretti) but have a small but decent selection of bottled and canned beers. The Italian beers are a bit pricey, but the local craft cans and bottles are better at ~$6.

20.description: Very good pizza. The crust is thin and soft, and the ingredients are of high quality. The limoncello Martini is yummy, and so are all the desserts. Prices are appropriate for the quality of the food.

36.description: Didn't realize it when we showed up but this restaurant is part of the Associazione Verace Pizza Napoletana - which specifies the type of oven to be used, ingredients, etc.  The pizza was really good - very different from the typical Chicago deep dish. They had a good selection of wine and craft beers and the staff/owner were awesome.

14.description: Thank you "Check, Please!" for making me aware of this gem. The location is a little tough to deal with as there is limited parking and it's on a busy section of Harlem Ave. Then again, what section of Harlem isn't busy?We were greeted promptly and seated near the window. I like that they have bottles of water at the table. We started with the calamari. The pieces were good-sized and fried very lightly, they came out more yellow than golden-brown. Also, they were well seasoned, you could taste the salt and pepper in the batter. The calamari still had a nice crispness and the marinara sauce they came with was perfect. Bits of fresh basil and garlic with the fresh tomatoes. I wish I had some crusty bread to finish that sauce off!We had two pizzas: the bufalina and the local. Both pizzas are about 12 inches are so. The bufalina was basically a margherita pizza with buffalo mozzarella cheese. And the crust was done properly, not too thin, not too thick. While it still had a great flavor, it wasn't salty or oily, which a lot of crusts can be. The buffalo mozz had that sharp tang that gave that pizza a little extra punch. The tomato sauce was light and fresh, but still held its own. The only thing is I would have asked for some extra fresh basil, since I'm such a basil fan. But the ingredients were incredibly well proportioned, it was cooked well, and the taste was wonderful. The locale added a locally made crumbled sausage and organic mushrooms. The sausage was seasoned really well and the mushrooms were great quality too. It was awesome, esp with some grated cheese and black pepper.I had an Italian craft beer as well. They have about five or six to choose from. They're certainly not cheap, but it's nice to be able to purchase a beer that you're not likely to find anywhere else in Chicago. If you want to splurge, they even have a $16 IPA. The service was very nice, as our appetizer plates got taken away when we were done and the server helped us with pizza and drink recommendations. Also, George, one of the owners, came by and chatted with us for at least five minutes, if not longer.The prices aren't cheap, but the quality is on another level. It's unfortunate this place is an hour away from where I live. I certainly plan to return when I'm in the area.

12.description: How to shop very small place prices are higher comparing to other stores

3.description: Great local store with a lot of excellent food. Double smocked sausage $4.99/lb or smoked Salomon for $6.99/lb - can't beat it.  Pastry straight from their little bakery on the back, just great.  One negative about this store - not enough room to even have full size shopping cart.

1.description: Gregs deli they have everything from A to Z I wouldn't order for dinner but everything else tastes great also huge choice of liquor and the prices are pretty good

2.description: A Polish friend took me there. He speaks Polish, thankfully. The smell of smoked sausage knocked my socks off as we stepped inside. They have everything Polish- kabanos, ham, fish, spirtus (Polish Vodka). I will be back when I can. Going there for me was an adventure. I can't believe I used to live a few blocks away and never knew it was there. Well it pays to know people ;)

9.description: I've been meaning to join Yelp for years, and my recent experience at Szymanski's finally drove me to it. Having been born in Poznan and growing up here, I take huge pride in everything to do with the language, culture, and customs. Food is obviously an integral part of that. One of the things I enjoy most about my weekends is when my dad comes to visit from Wisconsin, we have brunch at the Red Apple, then go grocery shopping.Typically we go to Wally's (now Cermak Produce) for the majority of what we need, but for the few items we can't find we've gone to Szymanski's. Usually, we've never had a problem.  I've enjoyed their fresh baked goods, smoked fish and paszteciki time and time again. We stopped by there first for some fresh veal, smoked chicken, and other meats. While waiting in line, I took out my phone to take a photo of the sausages to post to Instagram and while I was doing so one of the cashiers pushed past me and yelled loudly that taking photos was not allowed in the store. I joined my dad and he read off his order from my mom's list. He asked if they had baked ham. The incredibly rude woman behind the deli said "yeah." My dad asked for 1/2 a lb, to which she replied "what kind?" "The baked kind," my dad responded. She walked away from him. Finally she came back and my dad (5'8, Pat Sajak look-alike with a mean streak) said "you know what, no thank you." We put our baskets down in the middle of the aisle and walked out. If they thought I was competition and taking photos for that reason, they were wrong. However with that kind of customer service, not only did we go to the competition, we'll be going there from now on and not stepping foot in an establishment like this again. Let me also say that Polish groceries are notorious for this type of treatment in Poland, and apparently it didn't change with stores here in America. The difference between Szymanski's and Cermak Produce is overwhelming; the girls at Cermak are smiling, joking, offering samples (of vodka even), being helpful and actually providing a service. Not only that, we found fresh veal and smoked chicken there this time around, so they offer even more now. Even if it is busier, the more positive experience is much more worth it.

10.description: I'm not sure whether I'm charmed by the authenticity of this Polish deli or offended that they don't speak to me in English. I dip into Szymanski (no idea how it's pronounced) for lunch meat every now and again. The patrons and employees all speak Polish first. You'd think you were in Warsaw, but I suppose Portage Park is close enough.When it's my turn at the deli counter, they always ask me something in Polish. Huh? So I start ordering, and they immediately get the point, responding in broken English.  I stick to the basics when it comes to the lunch meat, which is something labeled simply as "salami," Muenster cheese, and whatever sort of ham tickles my fancy that day. Sure, I'd like to be more adventurous, but everything else is written in Polish.  The bread rolls are good here too. And any place that has caramel Kit Kat bars (albeit at a steeper price than, say, Fresh Farms in Niles), is OK by me.

4.description: we buy here a lot. our 711 kinda shop. every wednesday they give discount to seniors, 15%, so bring your grandma or pa to get the discount ;)

6.description: If you don't speak polish don't even bother to go there. My husband and I were looking for Paczkis last Saturday. The woman in the Bakery was very rude, not even tried a little to understand what we wanted. Finally we got the pastries to find that were very dry and tasteless. Maybe she was trying to tell us that? Who knows. Too bad, we like to support local business around the neighborhood.

0.description: A pretty good Polish deli, though it's fairly cramped. There was a language barrier even with my very limited knowledge of Polish, but they were friendly enough though. Good selection of cured meats, there was a tray of very dark sausages which were "double smoked" according to the label. The wedzona was very good, and the kabanosy is pretty good here, though they all were a bit dry for my taste. Next time I'll try the smoked fish everyone seems to be raving about. Beer selection is pretty limited, liquor/wine is ok, I was able to find some Polish mead at least. Worth a try.

5.description: Great selection of polish food.  Always been treated well.  Very competetive prices and the most important - freshly smoked trout.  Heaven.  Sandwich made to order wit plenty of meat,  cheese and veggies for $3 it's much better option than subway

13.description: Szymanski's one of the best Polish Delis in Chicago.Good bakery, sweet things and a great selection of bread. Good selection of imported and locally produced Polish food.  It appears they have a large smoke house built on to the rear of the store.  I went in for a smoked fish one morning, you know the kind you can buy in the vacuum sealed bag in most other Polish Delis?  Well no smoked fish in the morning because they smoke them in the morning and sell them in the afternoon.  The freshly smoked fish ROCKS.  Lots of other smoked meat too.  Don't miss the bacon.Most of the employees are more comfortable with their native Polish than English.  If you are polite and smile a little they are happy to help you.  I assume from the other reviews here that if you go in with a scowl on your face and treat people poorly you will not get the best service.

11.description: Truly authentic Polish deli.   They had one kind of smoked fish the day I stopped in - trout - that they make on the premises.  Super reasonable price-wise and oh so delicious.  I'm definitely a SUPAH-FREAK when it comes to smoked fish and theirs is wonderful!!!  they also make their own polska sausage (displayed on a huge platter right next to the smoked trout) and THIS is what sausage SHOULD be like everywhere.  crisp thin casing.  just the right amount of 'smoke' and tender perfectly spiced meat inside - none of those chunks of grizzle or when you bite down think "what the HECK is that?!?!?!?"  Every kind of imported polish vodka, including a variety of flavored ones... check out their authentic homemade pierogies in the freezer - bought a little bag of my favorite potato ones (about 9 or 10 pierogies) for about $3....I'll definitely not be a stranger to this little gem...

8.description: I've been looking for light rye in Chicago for a while now. Harvesttime has the light rye from Bob's Red Mill but that is too easy! I did find what I thought was light rye except the packaging was all in Polish. A woman who worked here saw me with a potato vodka under one arm, some bread from Chris's Bakery, a bag of pickles from a barrel, and some light rye. She kindly bought me a shopping basket. I asked her if this was indeed the light rye I was looking for. She didn't quite understand me and asked someone behind the meat counter. After a few failed articulations of what I was asking, he confirmed that it was light rye.

14.description: I have a love/hate relationship with this deli. Avoid the dairy (milk/kefir). On more than one occasion I have purchased milk/kefir that was curdled.  Trying to return it was a headache. The owner claimed that the price I paid (on the receipt) was not the price on the shelf, which turned out to be lower, and would not give me a refund. It took some arguing but he finally relented. The customer service skills must have been honed in communist Poland. Most, if not all, of the workers appear to be in some state of disgust or contempt. Stick to your basics at Szymanski's and you'll be fine. The red cabbage salad is the best I've had and the croquettes are to die for. Also, plenty of cold beer available. Overall, you'd be better with Montrose Deli or J&J.

7.description: They have the most amazing smoked fish!! so worth the drive and wait. We get it once or twice a month and we drive from Lemont just for this fish. Amazing!!

0.description: I stopped here for a quick mani-pedi because it was a convenient location.  I can't say anything else nice about it.It was the worst manicure of my life.  They left nail polish on my skin and cuticles.  I had an exhausting day and didn't even have the energy to say anything.  I especially didn't want to piss off one of the women there who, while watching "Cheaters" on the television spoke to me only to tell me with great disgust how "nasty that girl is" on the reality TV show.  Unprofessional, disorganized, messy, poorly skilled and to top it off trash-talked the previous manicure they were removing!  Talk about the pot calling the kettle black!

12.description: We ordered for delivery and the food arrived in 8 minutes, the time it took to change the baby's diaper! Friendly employee on the phone and at delivery. Will order from them again the next time I'm babysitting.

7.description: These guys are as fast as any delivery . The food is always fresh and the staff is always friendly when the take your order. I highly recommend this location to anyone working in the area and needs to order a quick bite to eat.

3.description: The best sub in town ! I love tuna sub , service is fast and quick . I recomed this place for everyone ;)

1.description: I go to a Jimmy Johns once or twice a week for lunch.  You walk in and you're greeted by the team with a welcome hello. I like the sandwiches because they are consistent, fresh, & just the right amount of the right ingredients.  I like to eat healthy and just have tap water with the sandwich. The soda, cookies, and chips take away from that plus just add calories.  The interior is clean and the music playing helps enjoy my time while I eat my lunch.  Also, the service is always freaky fast!

2.description: I ordered from Jimmy johns tonight for my kids because I have the flu and am unable to get out of bed. I have 3 kids and my husband is working. I thought this would be fast and easy, but no. The delivery driver left her keys in the car. I placed my order at 526. They called me at 552 to let me know she had lovked herself out and they sent someone with keys and she would be her within 5 to 10 minutes.  OK great,  i Understand! Then i called back at 620 to find where the driver was and they said she is still locked out. I told them my situation and they said they could give me some chips and cookies for free. I didnt think that was enough because the story seemed to be that she was never going to find her keys and who would have thought to send another driver with my food instead!?! It has been an hour know and i could have ordered a pizza! I used to like them but after their lack of care and concern for a valued customer  (i go here all the time!) I told them to forget the order, the woman on the phone asked me if i was sure, of course im sure. You lost my business and i will make sure the rest of my friends and family know not to go there any more!

9.description: I want to thank the awesome crew working on Tuesday, June 4th, 2013 at 5 pm. You saved me from a disaster! I had planned to pick up Potbelly's for my entire  family, but when I got there, a sign posted on their door said they were closed until further notice. Instead of panicking, I drove right over to Jimmy John's, where they took my order and it was ready to go before I put my wallet away. The gourmet sandwiches were fantastic, and the customer service can't be beat!!! Jimmy John's you've earned a place in my heart!!!

10.description: delivery usually fast, 20mins from time i place order and i live about 10  min from location. today I waited 35 minutes, but the sandwich makes up for the extra wait.

13.description: I live right around the corner, but still end up ordering delivery for me and my beau whenever we are getting ready for work or sucked into beating the next game on my PS3.Always extremely fast, especially for a delivery. My boyfriend has called and said he ordered and never got his sandwich, but I have never had a problem. I have even called and picked up or just stopped in and the service has always been speedy and satisfactory.The price works too. No extra delivery costs, just the sandwich with a smile. Even if I get the "Gargantuan", I'm not breaking the bank and have a little snack for later.(Tip: If you aren't a mayo fan like me but like a little on your sandwich, make sure you say "easy mayo", otherwise they slop it on. I like some of my sandwiches this way, but I know everyone may not. Happy eating!)

16.description: Ok, I will mention that I visited this location the first and only time on 4-20-08 which my friends blame for my problems with the service.It was lunch time, and we were craving JJ so we found the one closest and headed out. It was agonizingly slow service. They got the order right....it was tasty, but holy moly it was S-L-O-W.Since I *love* Jimmy John's subs and this one is convenient to the HIP and not too far from my house, I will likely be back, I just hope they get a little more pep in their step by then.

17.description: I am sure you have had a good sandwich or two in your time, but I am also sure that at one point when you are craving a good hearty sandwich, you end up with a disappointing and unappealing abomination to the food we call sandwiches. It may appear to some sandwich fanatics that it is getting harder and harder to find a real genuine sandwich in these tough times. Places will cut corners in the sacred process of sandwich making. At Jimmy John's though, I can assure that will never be an issue.  Jimmy John's is a Subway like restaurant where you order and customize to your liking while moving down the line of foods and choices they offer. This place is always packed and appears to have only happy satisfied customers. There is usually plenty of seating even with the crowds rushing in to get their fix of fantastic sandwiches to sustain their sandwich meters. The service is fast also! It almost seems that before you are finished ordering they have completed your order and it is ready for pick up.  Out of all the choices there at Jimmy John's, it is quite the challenge attempting to pick my favorite. I think I am going to have to go with their turkey sub though. One of the key points that drives the whole experience to be so good is the oh-so-tasty bread on which sandwiches are made. I mean sandwiches are made on bread, aren't they? The bread is so divine I could almost eat it for a meal alone. Freshness is key in a situation such as this and it is definitely present in the bread used at Jimmy John's. The other sandwiches offered here at Jimmy John's are equally as good and fulfilling. Every last thing that covers the extensive menus of this restaurant are just . I cannot think of one thing done poorly in this establishment even if I felt compelled to. The whole restaurant just seems to give off a good vibe.  This is a place anyone should go if they are hungry and within 100 miles of one Jimmy John's. If you make the quest to reach your destination of Jimmy John's, you will be happily satisfied with anything on their menu and wonder why you ever ate grandma's meals in the first place.

15.description: food: i tried their tuna sandwich and the italian sandwich with spicy peppers.  basic sandwiches and pretty tasty!service: they were very quick and delivered to the convention centerfinal thoughts: i would order from there all the time if i lived in chicago!

0.description: Jimmy John's is a fine establishment for a quick bite. Jimmy John's is better than its peers (Subway, Etc.) and, true to their advertising, is incredibly fast when delivering. Their driver even delivered in a snow storm and were friendly about it, which of course, earned an extra tip. I've tried many different Jimmy John's sandwiches, and I must say that I'm quite pleased with all of them. Well done!

5.description: My favorite sandwich place ever.  I've been craving their Italian night club ever since I moved to the west coast where this place is very hard to find.  There's nothing better when it comes to a crisp, well seasoned and flavored cold sub.

11.description: As far as the food goes, this Jimmy Johns is consistent with the rest and that is a good thing. What sets this Jimmy Johns apart is the customer service. The staff was extraordinary and engaged everyone in the restaurant. Super clean and my sub was being handed to me even before my credit card receipt printed (and this was during the height of their lunch rush at 1230pm)

8.description: Always super fast... I usually order the Italian nightclub with the works..bread is always nice and fresh. The whole pickle for on my .99cents is great. As always the day old bread is only 25 cents.. Not bad at all.

4.description: Very friendly and kind staff. I wish customer service was like this at every business. I went in right before closing last night and the girls were very sweet and happy to serve me. I saw the ingredients and they were so damn fresh even at 10pm!!! Huge parking lot so that's a bonus.

14.description: I usually love their sandwiches but in my last experience it was awful...very disappointed!

6.description: Friendly and freaky fast!  I have ordered from them several times and each time I have been happy with how fresh the subs are.  Best sub place as far as I am concerned!

3.description: The best caramel apples ever!  Loved them when they were still in Logan Square (up until the 1980s sometime, I believe), then to Belmont (despite the neighborhood) and I hope they have many more successful years with their delicious treats!  Fall is not complete without Andrew's!

1.description: Lovely new Location... "Shhh" They gave me a tour. They now take credit cards.I always buy by the case and they are fresh, crunchy, and the caramel is amazing.They have been our go to place since they were in Logan Square in the 90's.It is fall for sure when I get my Andrews Caramel Apples!!

2.description: Andrew's is around the corner from my office, so we decided to pop in and try it out. The caramel apples are probably the best I've had. The caramel had a great flavor, and was not too sticky. The apples tasted really fresh. The larger apples with the nuts and chocolate were terrific as well, with high quality chocolate and almonds. My wife's co-worker is a self-proclaimed caramel apple aficionado, and she told me that they were up there with the best she'd ever had. We also got the opportunity to try a new turtle they are about to debut, which they are calling the Tortuga. This was probably the highlight for me, as the mixture of caramel, chocolate, and pecans was perfect. The pecans are chopped, instead of whole, which I like, and the caramel was melt-in-your-mouth delicious and smooth. I highly recommend getting these when they become available. The caramel for the apples and candies is made on-site from a secret recipe. Going to factory store is worth  it, even just for the smells wafting from the kitchen. The apples are also incredibly reasonably priced, at only $1 each for the regular-sized apples. If you are a fan of caramel, or even if you aren't sure you like caramel apples, I'd highly recommend trying these out.

0.description: I went to Andrew's last location on the corner of Lavergne and Belmont, across from Forman High School.  However, I didn't know Andrew's has been relocated.  Their Dakin location, in between Neenah and Normandy, is freakin' close to my house!  It's in route of #80 (Irving Park) bus.  I haven't validated if a major credit card or debit card would be accepted, but it's more useful to bring cash since a classic or peanut-covered caramel apple is only one (1) buck, as of 11/10/15. Their apples are definitely worth $1 each.  Caramel is thickly-coated on the entire apple.  If you order the peanut-covered option, Andrew's doesn't skimp on peanuts.  I told Mama J. not to purchase the "A*fy T*ple" brand anymore.  I will start collecting pennies and dimes around the house so that I can get myself some treats from Andrew's.

4.description: This afternoon we dropped by jewel on the way home and I stumbled on a package of Andrews caramel apples.  I haven't had these in, oh forever.  I grabbed the 3 pack package and headed to check out while my husband asked "how much are those? ". I answered "I don't care i want them".  I have not had them since I was a kid. They were exactly what I remembered. So excited that they have a factory store! Best caramel ever!

3.description: Love Scott & his team of teachers! My kids showed no interest in music or piano, but one trial class at UpBeat and they loved it. The teachers are so hands on. It's a very relaxed and inviting environment for kids to learn music. We've been attending for 4 months now and I'm amazed at how much they've learned and that they still love going each week.

1.description: I'm so excited to have this amazing place in the neighborhood!  My two children (ages 7 and 9) did a week of music camp at Upbeat this past summer. After the first day of camp, my 7 year old came home and asked us to buy her a piano!  She was hooked!  After the week of camp was over (amazing week of camp!), we immediately signed the kids up for weekly classes.  They both love the classes and have already learned so much in such a short time.  The instructors are amazing!

2.description: I'm so happy to have a great music education program in the neighborhood! My son has been taking piano lessons from Scott and his team for over a month now, and his enthusiasm can only be explained by the energy and quality of teaching that UpBeat provides. Scott is easy to work with in scheduling lessons, and his staff is wonderful. They are motivating and professional, and I am so glad we found UpBeat and Scott to work with.

9.description: My daughter loved this camp. She enjoyed learning guitar and piano, as well as music theory. Every afternoon, she came home from camp and sat down at the piano to play the music she had learned that day. I highly recommend lessons or camp with UpBeat.

10.description: It's been a long time since I've brushed up on my piano skills. UpBeat Music and arts are there to help. Their hands-on approach to adult classes have me excited about playing an instrument again. The teachers are helpful and attentive and are willing to work with whatever skill level you are at to help you achieve your goals. I am glad I took the leap with UpBeat. You will be, too.

4.description: Upbeat is an amazing music and art program. It has inspired my daughter and son to try harder in there music. Their teachers have motivated them to get more involved.  Upbeat also has great summer camps that give them both education and having a fun time. Upbeat is truly amazing!

6.description: Our second grader began piano lessons at UpBeat only six months ago. Already she had learned a number of songs, excellent hand position, has played at a recital, and absolutely adores going to class! Scott has a way of commanding the children's respect and admiration because he respects and adores each one of them. Lessons are FUN! One on one time is plenty, and the last five minutes of each lesson, parents are welcome to come inside to hear their child's "progress performance," a wrap up of what they've worked on that day. Scott very clearly loves what he does and that feeling inspires the entire school! We are new fans of UpBeat, but I'm quite sure my daughter will be a lifelong student here!

12.description: My oldest daughter took lessons from Scott for over ten years, and my youngest participated in camp last summer. Scott has a great enthusiasm for working with kids and innately knows how to challenge without frustrating them. Highly recommend any programming offered. Look forward to camp 2014!

5.description: BIG BIG fans of Upbeat Music! Our 6 yr old daughter has learned so much from the kind & generous staff there & seriously looks forward to each & every lesson. They convey technique & theory in a way that is super fun for the kids - HIGHEST POSSIBLE recommendation!

13.description: My son attended camp at UpBeat and loved it!  He is begging me to go back to camp and continue with their after school program in the fall.  It was such a positive experience all around...he is 7, so on the youngest end but it was so great to have kids of all ages - they were so encouraging to each other and it worked really well.  Scott, Marty and Justin were amazing with him and taught him so much in just the week.  They had a performance and I couldn't believe what he learned how to play in that short time.  They also got outside to play soccer, capture the flag, etc as well as played board games inside...a great mix of fun and learning.

11.description: My son has never played an instrument and in two days was playing two songs on the piano!  Scott and the guys at UpBeat made him feel very welcome, he was the youngest in the summer camp, but that did not matter, he thoroughly enjoyed it.  He loved the high fives he got and the general encouragement he received every day from the small group.  He can not wait to do another session!

8.description: My 13 year old son has been taking lessons at UpBeat for almost a year.  He advanced more in two weeks in small group instruction at summer camp than in a year of private lessons.  His summer camp experience was so rewarding he has continued weekly lessons.  The education is excellent, and our experience has been super positive.  There is so much encouragement and support from the instructors as well as the students.  My son is in such a happy place and feels so inspired after every lesson.  Scott, Justin and all of the instructors are amazing.

0.description: UpBeat Music and Arts is a must try if you have a youngster interested in trying out an instrument AND it's right in our hood.  The teachers are kind and very flexible, which is key in motivating parents and students in today's hectic, over-scheduled world.  They bring enthusiasm and joy to lessons vs guilt and stress, which keeps kids coming back.  They also offer summer camp that kids actually LIKE and want to attend. If there is any drawback, it is only I wish it were larger / had more space as I anticipate it doing quite well.

7.description: My 7 year old daughter LOVES taking piano lessons here!  We used to take lessons at Old Town Music, which was also great, but she's improved so much here.  They're on the keyboard the whole time (a full hour) and the instruction is strong but done in a fun and gentle way.  On top of that, they're super encouraging to the kids.  We feel so lucky to have found this gem in the neighborhood!

3.description: Hmmph!After going to a local really cheap hair place that totally butchered my hair.  Left me crying, on my birthday no less.  I thought I would check out this gem.They managed to fix, (ie. even out the back of my hair that was totally chopped up)They managed to get my color right also.

1.description: If you want a fabulous local place to get beautified Angie's is the place!! Stella has been doing my hair for better part of 5 years!! I am impressed every time I go in the salon. Everyone that walks out the there looks like a movie star. They are a full service salon and anything that you can think of getting done they can defiantly accommodate you!! Love this place.

2.description: I've been coming to this salon for a long time, but I think I've had enough of it and the delays and gossip that goes on in there.Yes, I'm well aware that all salons are gossip central, but all they ever do is rip on people, make fun of them if they are not "loaded" or greek.  What can you expect here? Gorgeous color and nice haircut.  What else? Spending 4-6hrs here!  Yes, between 4 and 6 hours, that is insane!  I had an 9am appt, they told me I'd be the first one, and low and behold I arrive to having some lady sitting with color, a dude with highlights, and  another lady mid way through a haircut.  I was taken AFTER all these folks were totally complete, at 11:30am.  My highlights were interrupted to do someone's roots.  When my highlights were done, the girl in the back washed my hair, and told me to sit across from the stylist to wait for her, another 1hr of waiting with wet hair, cold air blowing from the door opening and closing, and a wet towel dripping.  My haircut was YET AGAIN interrupted to go wash out and keep checking on other people's colors.  By 2pm I was finally out!  From 9am to 2pm for haircut & highlights?  Unacceptable.The pricing is tricky here, as they go by "ranges" the ranges are somewhat determined by how much they like you.  If you are talkative and agree with them, you get service a little cheaper.  If you are quiet and dont  giggle at the gossip, you pay a slight surcharge.  Maybe this was fine for 1990 on Harlem, not in 2010 on Irving.Stacy does nice up do's, she's quick and tries out unique styles, the only issue is that her stories are focused on how "rich" she is or wants to be.  She always has a smerk on her face like she is better than you, and you should be thankful she is even touching your hair.  Schedule with her once, and that means you better come in there every time to have her do your hair, otherwise she'll be mean.Angie is the owner, a bubbly nice lady.  She does a great job, but is slowww.  She did an up do for my cousin's wedding party, it took her 2.5hrs to do the brides hair, the bride was late to EVERY other appointment after hers due to this.  Who needs that stress on their wedding day.  Angie talked and talked instead of doing the hair.  If you want nice hair, these ladies will definitely do the job.  However, they are not courteous of your time, or that you had an appt for a particular time, or if you are late to your own wedding.  Once you enter here, you are on THEIR time.The reason I gave 3 stars is they do very nice work, you will be happy with your color, your haircut will be perfect; however you will spend double the time of anywhere else, not know what to expect in terms of pricing (last visit compared to current visit), starving after sitting there for 4-6hrs, and a headache from all the gossip.

0.description: Always awesome haircuts. I got my girlfriend going here now & she loves it.It's a nice family owned business too, NOT some fly by night chain, where you get your hair cut by a different person every time.All the employees here are friendly & have great suggestions.

28.description: I've gone here 3x now to get no-chip manicures. I work in a professional kitchen so NO-CHIP is very important for me. For me they last exactly 2 weeks without any chips. Then, like cinderella at midnight, they start chipping like crazy after 2 weeks and 1 day. I'm trying a rounded shape this time instead of square to see if that helps keep my manicure longer. The salon is very clean and has no overpowering chemical fumes like some other salons that I've been to. Everyone that has worked on me has been very nice. They have a large selection of no-chip colors to choose from including moodchanging colors. I have been posting pictures of my manicures. My nails are short and stubby, and each one has a different shape so they're not always easy for people to work with.

1.description: Everyone is very friendly here. For a Chicago location it's a rare occasion. :)Chris removed my old full set and did a great no chip manicure for me. She ended it with a massage which was a cherry in top of the great job she did. Recommend this location no doubt!

9.description: Amazing! Finally I found a great nail salon. I've had such bad experiences at nail shops lately. So I yelped a nail salon and found this place. First off the place is clean and updated. The staff is wonderful. A huge selection of no chip colors. I got a no chip manicure done and the lady offered me a bottle of water. They take their time when doing nails. She did plenty of coats. It came out great! They also didn't charge me extra to remove my acrylic nails I wanted off.  They also serve you wine with certain pedicure service along with hot stone massage for your feet. I can't wait to come back for a pedicure.

29.description: I like this place alot. Me and my friend got a pedicures and waxes here, and My friend's pedi looked amazing. And I'm very particular. My pedi was good too, but she cut me once. But, hey, people makes mistake. Our wax person was Joyce, and my friend had her for pedicure. She did a really good job. We will come back, definitely, to see Joyce and her team. Great service.

23.description: I've been coming here now for awhile. The salon is beautiful and I love the remodel. The nail techs are all warm and inviting.  As soon as you walk through the door you are greeted and helped. They have awesome color choices for both no chip and regular polish.  I love trying new designs on my nails and the techs especially Hanh are always willing to try them. The no chip colors definitely last without chipping.  I work a lot with my hands and my nails always last til I go to my next appointment.  Their pedicure service is amazing and so relaxing.  I received a pedicure from Kelly and she did a great job. They definitely know how to make you feel pampered at Nail Tech 8. Prices are reasonable and they also offer a discount card.

5.description: If you're looking for a clean and reasonably placed mani-pedi place near Portage Park, this is a great place to stop in. They have a wide variety of colors and provide the standard set of services -- but they are busy, and so, you should definitely make an appointment if you don't want to be waiting for a while. (They have a good number of people working there but it's not an army and so, make your life easier and make an appointment). In some cases, I think it's a case of what you're paying for -- so, you're not going to get the "free wine/water/tea and massage" service you might get at a Wicker Park or Lincoln Park type establishment but for the price -- that's ok. :)  They also have a loyalty program and so, if you come back a certain amount of times, you unlock discounts, which I always think is nice. If you're looking to spend/share an afternoon with your girlfriends and it's an "event" then maybe check out mani-pedi places in Wicker or Lincoln Park -- if you're looking for good value for money in this area, Nail Tech 8 = great option.

31.description: This place is fantastic!  Great family business, very friendly and accomodating. They stay on top of the trends and though they've become busier in the laswt couple of years, they do a great job of ensuring that their regular customers can always get in for an appointment.  Robin

25.description: New to the area and popped in last week after looking around on yelp.  Very good service, attentive and professional.  There was a little issue because the person who did my pedicure didn't let me know that she wasn't the one that was going to do my no-chip manicure and I felt like I was waiting for quite some time but then realized it was a misunderstanding.  The person who did do my nails did a great job and I will definitely be back!  Very clean and nice friendly staff.  You can also make an appointment ahead of time  which is a good idea as they can get busy.  Easy parking since they have a lot!

12.description: My first visit to Nail Tech 8 was enjoyable, the staff are welcoming and all acknowledged me kindly. The wait was kind of long but reasonable considering I went on a Saturday afternoon. My treatment consisted of a mani-pedi combo, 35$ is a good deal to me. The pedi was wonderful and not rushed, the mani was nice too but less pleasant. They topped off their kindness with  free water bottle. Overall the experience was enjoyable and I'd go there again

21.description: One of the better places in the neighborhood for nails. The guy that did my nails was very professional, courteous, and detail oriented.  The salon in  it of the self is very clean, and all of the tools that they use are sterilized and package; the technician wears gloves also.  The prices are reasonable compared other salons in the area; and the services is better; you don't feel like they are rushing just to get to the next customer.  There is ample parking available.

16.description: I went with a friend to have a manicure and pedicure and we were greeted nicely with one of the employees and didn't have to wait at all to get started. My review is based on the quality of the service provided by the two people who did our nails. The service wasn't detail oriented quality work and one of the tools she was using on my nails which she opened from the sterilized package was rusted and when I asked her to change it , she took another unsterile tool from the drawer to use. I asked her politely if she could get another one  in a package but she was not cooperative as wells as happy to change it and went to the back to get another one which didn't look clean as well as not in a sterilized package.  Her service was very unfriendly. My friend as well didn't receive a quality detailed work.

17.description: Never going anywhere else. This is seriously where it's at. Kenny took his time doing my nails. He made sure everything looked perfect. The place is very clean and sanitary. Very nice people. Finally found my nail place!

10.description: This place is very nice, clean, and friendly. Came for a no chip mani and pedi - they had a variety of colors to choose, couldn't . They had a real good scrub smelled real nice, like tropical scent. We didn't have to wait and they gave us water too! Prices were the norm.

11.description: This place is great. They do an excellent job, great nails, great eyebrows and everyone is super nice. It takes FOREVER though.

26.description: This place was AMAZING!!!! Totally the best nail salon I've been to! All the people were wonderful and free champagne with our pedi!

27.description: I used to come here more than 5 years ago. My neighbor had recommended my mom and I to come back here because they have new owners, and had a full remodel. So me and my mom decided to give it a try. And we are SO HAPPY that we did. This is the absolute cleanest nail salon I've ever been to. The pedicure bowls are beautiful. The floors are amazing. The whole nail salon is just luxurious. All of the their tools are STERILIZED!! All tools used are taken out of serialized packages so each individual person has fresh, clean tools. I've never had anything like that in my life. My mom had sensitive feet and we asked the nail tech to just be a little careful and she was more than accommodating. The best pedicure I've ever had. I will always pay a tad extra for quality work. And this is the place I will pay extra! The nail techs are so nice and make you feel so comfortable. The massage chairs are also a big plus!  My mom and I will definitely be returning for all of our nail needs !

0.description: Right away, the shop was clean, beautiful, organized, and staff was more than courteous. I was helped right away and, although it was busy, I could see that the shop was running like clockwork. No one was shy in aiding to direct me to the polishes, pedi chair, mani table, etc., and all done very accommodatingly. I loved the organization of the polish samples and the multiples of them (so multiple incoming customers could browse simultaneously at their leisure) - Ha! Funny how such simple consideration for customer care can be so overlooked in other places that it becomes glaringly noticeable;  nonetheless very refreshing and appreciated. All the work (pedi, acrylic fill-in and gel polish) was done exceptionally well and with much consideration to the customer.  I asked for a very difficult "fade" which I could not seem to describe accurately upon arrival, which turned out to be a very specific and technically difficult ombré which my technician had absolutely no hesitation in creating for me. Turns out the tech who did my no-chip, who had also greeted me at the door, aided other staff, and catered to a bridal party while answering calls and handling the front desk, was none-other than the owner, Hanna, who did it all with ease and not even one drop of sweat or hint of frustration. She completely my very technically difficult mani and made it look so effortless that I could almost find it unbelievable that most shops will refuse to do this mani for the simple inability of their techs- but I do believe it, because I've been turned down before for similar requests.Hanna is very talented and a gracious host to all her customers. All the staff were very capable and welcoming. Service was very exceptional. The shop was clean, organized, and modern stylized, plus prices were very averaged priced. This must be why the shop was busy, and I'd imagine the shop stays busy because the staff accommodated the traffic with ease.  Most of all I appreciate the amount of work, skill, and patience provided to me on my visit. The lady waiting after me said she drives 40 mins just to come to this nail salon. I can agree with that decision. Definitely found my new regular nail spot.

20.description: Never going anywhere else. This is seriously where it's at. Kenny took his time doing my nails. He made sure everything looked perfect. The place is very clean and sanitary. Very nice people. Finally found my nail place!

19.description: One of the better places in the neighborhood for nails. The guy that did my nails was very professional, courteous, and detail oriented.  The salon in  it of the self is very clean, and all of the tools that they use are sterilized and package; the technician wears gloves also.  The prices are reasonable compared other salons in the area; and the services is better; you don't feel like they are rushing just to get to the next customer.  There is ample parking available.

2.description: By far the best nail salon yet. Great customer service, very clean and professional. Only place I allow to touch my nails.

18.description: We really enjoyed our experience here. The techs are knowledgable and do a great job. The atmosphere is pleasant and relaxing. My dad even got a pedicure and loved it!

13.description: I've gone here 3x now to get no-chip manicures. I work in a professional kitchen so NO-CHIP is very important for me. For me they last exactly 2 weeks without any chips. Then, like cinderella at midnight, they start chipping like crazy after 2 weeks and 1 day. I'm trying a rounded shape this time instead of square to see if that helps keep my manicure longer. The salon is very clean and has no overpowering chemical fumes like some other salons that I've been to. Everyone that has worked on me has been very nice. They have a large selection of no-chip colors to choose from including moodchanging colors. I have been posting pictures of my manicures. My nails are short and stubby, and each one has a different shape so they're not always easy for people to work with.

4.description: If you have more than 2 hours to spare for a fill in and pedi then try this spot out BUT if you don't have about 4 hours then keep looking for another spot. I waited an hour to get in a pedi chair then they left me there after the pedi was done for half hour! At the very least they could have left my feet soak.the lady who did my fill in took 18 seconds to apply a CLEAR COAT!!!! I counted that's how frustrated I was ! I won't go there again. Three star because the polish has lasted for 3 weeks.

24.description: I recently moved to this area and was in search of a nearby salon. I trusted the reviews given by others on Yelp and went in for a pedi. I have to say that as soon as I walked in they were so welcoming. The salon is so clean, the chairs are comfortable and the massage is so relaxing.  The lady that did my pedi was gentle, meticulous to detail and was so very nice. I have made this my nail salon; I just had a pedi/mani and am very satisfied with their service. Prices are reasonable and most importantly they are very clean. I highly recommend it.

6.description: OMG!!! I can go on forever....This place is just Awesome!!! As soon as you walk in you are greeted and asked to pick a color. Pick a color? Be prepared, because they have a vast selection of colors. Very friendly staff and most of all very clean. Everything they use is Sterilized. They make you feel right at home.I found this place by accident one day and haven't gone to another salon since. Mind you that I live in Oakbrook Il. and there are many salons in that area but none that can compare. I'd rather take the 30 min. plus drive to them and feel completely satisfied and pampered with their service.I go every 2 weeks for No Chip/Pedi.  Hannah always has new colors and different design ideas. I get tons of compliments on my nails. This place is Highly recommended. I promise you will not go wrong with them.Ohhhh I almost forgot.....Who can go wrong with a complimentary glass of wine or champagne. Like I said... great place great people...

22.description: OMG!!! I can go on forever....This place is just Awesome!!! As soon as you walk in you are greeted and asked to pick a color. Pick a color? Be prepared, because they have a vast selection of colors. Very friendly staff and most of all very clean. Everything they use is Sterilized. They make you feel right at home.I found this place by accident one day and haven't gone to another salon since. Mind you that I live in Oakbrook Il. and there are many salons in that area but none that can compare. I'd rather take the 30 min. plus drive to them and feel completely satisfied and pampered with their service.I go every 2 weeks for No Chip/Pedi.  Hannah always has new colors and different design ideas. I get tons of compliments on my nails. This place is Highly recommended. I promise you will not go wrong with them.Ohhhh I almost forgot.....Who can go wrong with a complimentary glass of wine or champagne. Like I said... great place great people...

15.description: I went in for the first time on a Thursday morning... I was seen immediately. I got a no chip mani and pedi. Lots of colors to choose from... Everyone is extremely friendly. I really like when they take their time doing my nails and I don't feel like they are rushing, so that was really nice. I was offered a bottle of water. The place appears clean. Definitely a plus!

7.description: They are very friendly and have lots of colors to choose from and polite because if the hurt they would say sorry. They keep very clean and nice environment other than the smell. Really like my acrylic nails

8.description: I recommend this place to everyone!Great service, great selection of colors, very clean. Pedicures are amazing. Nail chip lasts you weeks unlike many other places. People may think pricing is expensive but what you pay for is what you get. It is worth every penny you spend here!

30.description: I absolutely reccomend this place! I got a no chip manicure with Joyce and it lasted three weeks even though I was gardening and going to the beach! I was extremely impressed (especially since my first experience with the no chip at a different place was terrible).  Everyone there is really friendly and when I brought my three year old, one of the ladies was nice enough to put on a movie for her! Love it!

3.description: First time there and i'm very satisfied with their service! The place was clean and very friendly! I had a pedicure with Christy and she did an awesome job! Definitely i will go back to try the manicure service too!

14.description: This salon is very clean BUT super slow!If u make an appointment it means nothing!! U still wait - that's not a very good policy!Waiting for 15 minutes is not an issue but NOT for an hour!One woman works super slow - make sure to block at least 3 hours for her.I'm also not pleased with all the Vietnamese chatter - not cool when u have customers and they have no clue if the talk is about them or not -  very uncomfortable!In business in the USA u should speak English in mixed company - if u don't I consider it rude and unprofessional They do nice work but seriously need to realize that you need to be a bit more professional and considerate of your customers -

3.description: I've given this store a few tries and there is nothing to really report about this store. Very boring, doesn't offer much. The staff all seem like they are half awake.... I don't care much for TJ Maxx in general since they all are very hit or miss. This one is a little better than the one one state street downtown, but is much smaller. The store set up is better than other TJ maxx's I have been to though. I will give them that.

1.description: Good variety of merchandise. The store can get a bit messy and things get damaged. Pay attention to the item before purchase. The staf is friendly.

2.description: This location isn't the best, but It for surely isn't the worst, either.  Occasionally you can find some high-end fashion jewelry, such as Swarovski and some luxury designer items, like Tory Burch and DVF.  Otherwise, it's the same old things that you would expect from other TJ maxx stores.  The reason why I keep coming back is that this store has a better organization and isn't trashy.  The clientele consists neighborhood moms and kids, so you will hear moms discipline kids in whatever language.  You will encounter this at any retail store so it's not unusual.  I still like shopping at TJ maxx if I'm in the mood for some treasure hunts.

9.description: Used to like this particular TJ Maxx a lot, but last time I was there, it changed my mind. I was returning an item that was purchased a week prior at another TJ Maxx, I had a receipt and the tag was attached to an item. The manager (Jaimie Drozier) told me that he will not take this item back because he doesn't believe it was purchased at TJ Maxx and suggested that I donate the item to a Salvation Army store, since he will not be taking it back, he placed it in the bag and basically shoved it in my face.....Later that evening I went to another TJ Maxx and they had no issues taking it back and they even apologized for the other manager. I wanted to make sure that others will not be treated this way and called the district manager, Barb Menke, spoke to her assistant who insured that Barbara will call me back, but that never happened. As much as I love TJ Maxx, Marshalls and Home Goods, I think I will have to look elsewhere for my Christmas shopping this year...and avoid this TJ Maxx all together. Rude customer service that I received from a manager is not worth a few dollars that I can save on my purchases, plus there are other discount stores out there.

10.description: I found a 200 dollar akademiks coat for 40 bucks. That is a savings right there. A great selection but whats up with all the Indiana Pacers and Colts items? We are in Chicago not Indiana. It's just weird to see that. Otherwise a great store with all the designer names like G Unit, Phat Farm and so many more.

4.description: Love the clothes ,jewelry,shoes,purses and household items.

6.description: Sure to find gems if you're willing to look.

11.description: This place is great for buying clothes. They have quite a collection of clothes to choose from. The only thing that bothers me is the people that they hire to work there. I believe that they should have hired more professional people to work there. My experience there would have been a 4-5 or at least very close to 5 stars if it was not for the rude customer service there. It seems as though the people that they hire to work there believes as though the world revolves around them. They treat their customer with little and very close to no respect at all. I would have gone to the manager and have them fired. But I did not want to go through all the trouble of doing so. Perhaps maybe next time someone would take my place and go to the manager to have the rude workers there fired.

5.description: Loved this place! Quite good deals.

7.description: I like to drop in to TJ Maxx a few times a year. I love purses and love "the hunt" even more. Today I scored a sweet little bag and a really cool scarf. If I went here too often the thrill would be gone. Purse hunting is my own little personal pleasure and TJ Maxx is fertile hunting grounds.

8.description: Today I came to this TJ Maxx just to look for a cute shirt or something. I ended up walking away with a 50 dollar croptop/poncho shirt for $12.99 $106 adorable bathing suit for $24.99, and a $130 velour zip up hoodie for $15. I saved about $230! How amazing is that?! I love TJ Maxx. This particular one is unorganized but the deals are so worth it(:

0.description: I bought two Jones New York blouses for less than $30 each, a great deal.  I also found a cute toddler outfit for $13, to give as a gift.My shopping habits at TJ Maxx are hit or miss.  It's a good place to shop for women's clothing, and especially at this location, the handbags.  All of the racks and displays were packed tight with designer handbags like Kate Spade, Michael Kors, and Betsey Johnson.The customer service could use some improvement.  The cashier, a bit starchy, looked startled when I said "hello," and another cashier was dismissive when a customer was seeking someone to translate to Spanish.  Surprisingly, a customer overheard this, approached the cashier and offered to translate.  TJ Maxx employees aren't working on commission or making big bucks, so I understand to a point that there is no sense of urgency to assist.  But customer service is still the core of the job.Overall, I was happy with my shopping experience.  I did not spend a lot of time in here, but I found some quality blouses and a gift for a great price.

28.description: Not a bad little neighborhood pizza joint basically a delivery or carryout type of deal. Usually I do the tuesday night special 14" 1-topping pizza for $8.00. The delivery is fast and gets to me pretty quick. A very young staff but they are always quite pleasant to deal with and very nice and respectful. The pizza isn't great but all ingredients are solid and fresh and the sauce is good. The real surprise here is the Stuffed Pizza as when I ordered it the pizza arrived hot, there wasn't a soggy crust, the toppings and cheese were cooked perfectly and the sauce was good not sweet but more tangy that's actually the way I prefer it. Not like that particular "Most famous Stuffed Pizza" chain restaurant that shall remain nameless. where their sauce must contain about a bag of sugar. The fries are fresh cut as you can see them peeling a potato and running it through the metal hand cutter, a lot like Gene and Jude's hot dogs out in the burbs. The thin gets three stars, but the service, stuffed pizza, and my favoritism towards well operated local family businesses bumps it up overall to four stars.

1.description: THIS IS HOW PIZZA IS SUPPOSED TO BE!!Last time we ordered and did a pick-up, while the pizza was very good, it wasn't hot by the time we got home, this time we had it delivered and it was PERFECT! Crust is thin and crunchy, sauce is flavorful, the sausage to cheese ratio once again was spot on. I think we have found our newest and favorite pizza place....if you haven't tried this place yet, do it, you'll be glad you did.

9.description: My family and I have ordered from here many, many times since we live in the area. We love the pizza here! The staff there is very nice too.

23.description: Place looks like a dump, but the pizza is terrific. Good prices.

5.description: Stuffed sausage pizza was excellent... delivery was fast and pizza was hot!

25.description: I promised my nephews a Pizza party and wanted to try something new closer to them so I ordered from Lonnie's based on a friend's recommendation and  the reviews here and I was very pleased! I simply ordered a large extra thin crust cheese and sausage and it very good!
