The quality of ingredients was good, the cheese was a little bit greasy but not too bad nice thin crust with good crispy edges, great sausage and the price with delivery was very reasonable. Also nice to know they offer an 18" pizza which many do not. There is a lot of great pizza in Chicago and I'm always looking for a good extra thin crust. I will be ordering from them again.

12.description: Great pizza!! I tried the sausage and pepperoni pizza and it was great.  I have been there 3 times and it's the real deal.

21.description: Ordered five pizzas two were stuffed they were absolutely out of this world all my family loved them even the out of townees said "this is the best pizza in Chicago"great delivery service too!  We did specify brown cheese on top but not burnt.  I am ssssssssssssooooooooooooooo glad we found Lonnie's!!!!!!!!

16.description: I live near the neighborhood, always see this place crowded. Never understood why people wanted to go to such a small place and it looks dirty (from the outside). But the food is great and CHEAP. And the place is pretty well maintained inside even if it is small. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. Totally try it out.

17.description: I've lived in Chicago all of my life and this is still my favorite pizza. Better than Lou's, better than Pequod's. The double dough is phenomenal. This is true Chicago pizza at its best.

10.description: This place is surely becoming one of my favorite pizza places. I just barely moved over here n had their pizza once n was hooked. Highly recommended.

11.description: Their Margherita pizza is excellent. We tried the spinach bread as well, but didn't care as much for that. I love that we have this as a go to pizza spot close by. Beats the normal delivery chains by far

26.description: Just moved 2 blocks from this little gem ! Nice that they have slice's Great thin crustton's of cheese!great price!2 blocks from the housepricless!

27.description: Kinda hard to spot this little place at first but, I'm glad I did.  Going in, the place felt like a family ran business & where everyone knew each other.  Taking a previous reviewer's advice, I tried the stuffed pizza (30 min wait) & was pretty impressed, considering I don't think most pizzeria joints can make a good stuffed pizza.  For me, its the dough that makes it great.  It had a great balance, not too much cheese, sauce or dough, just right.  Probably the best stuffed pizza I've ever had and that's saying a lot.

0.description: Been a long time since I had a pie from here! I had 20 Coupons so I decided to grab my FREE X-Large Sausage last night! Just delicious! Same as always!So yes, last night was my 21st Pizza from there :) By comparison, my other local place is at 8! :) REAL Chicago Pizza! Never tried their thick crust as I prefer the Thin and Extra Thin. Im sure its just as amazing! Celebrating 15yrs I see! Congrats on serving great pizza for a decade and a half. There WERE 5 Pizza Joints on Irving between Harlem and Cumberland last year, now there are 3.

20.description: Pizza is very good. Had the thin crust. The sauce is good. Doesn't taste canned. Good quality cheese too. What more can you ask for.

19.description: Just ordered some food from lonnies, we have been ordering here for years, the pizza was just ok compared to pizza we have had before. The fries where terrible ,as where the chicken tenders,I don't think it was chicken,for that money we will try some where else.

2.description: My favorite place for pizza by the slice. Their ingredients are so fresh and their bread is so crisp and soft. I love coming here when I'm out northwest or want pizza by the slice. They deliver too which was a plus. Cool staff and friendly!!

18.description: Their pizza was SUPER GOOD!!!! First time having it, and I was very impressed. I live right next to the place, so it was very fresh because we got it right when the place opened. I had cheese, mushrooms, onion, and green pepper. The other half was cheese and sausage which my boyfriend loved! I have nothing bad to say about their regular pizza, the reason I am rating it 4/5 is because their MIGHT be better !

13.description: Ordered five pizzas two were stuffed they were absolutely out of this world all my family loved them even the out of townees said "this is the best pizza in Chicago"great delivery service too!  We did specify brown cheese on top but not burnt.  I am ssssssssssssooooooooooooooo glad we found Lonnie's!!!!!!!!

4.description: Lonnies is our go to pizza joint in the area. Quick, Consistent & delicious as far as pizza. We've never ordered anything else from them.

24.description: Best pizza in the area hands down. I've been going to Lonnies for a couple years now and their pizza is consistently one of the best. Its mostly a to-go place as there is a small seating area but you wont be disappointed.

6.description: Customer service is horrendous, which is unfortunate bc the pizza is pretty good, but will never go back!!!!

22.description: Their pizza was SUPER GOOD!!!! First time having it, and I was very impressed. I live right next to the place, so it was very fresh because we got it right when the place opened. I had cheese, mushrooms, onion, and green pepper. The other half was cheese and sausage which my boyfriend loved! I have nothing bad to say about their regular pizza, the reason I am rating it 4/5 is because their MIGHT be better !

15.description: Tried this place one night at a friends house and after that i was hooked. It was a thin crust pepperoni and sausage. Good overall pizza sauce, cheese, everything. Tried stuffed pizza and it was just as good. Delivery is pretty fast and pizza is always hot when it gets to my house. Officially my go to spot for pizza delivery.

7.description: Lonnies is the best  Always good. I like there crust and sauce. This place is run by a nice local family. These little pizza places are what really makes Chicago pizza great. I am so glad to have Lonnies close to me.

8.description: Love this place. Been there 3x now and its always great. I love the thin crust pizza, and the beef sandwiches. I would love to try a stuffed pizza next time.

3.description: This review is not about the product but about the employees. THE DELIVERY DRIVER ALMOST RAN OVER MY 7 YEAR OLD NEPHEW. Driving 35mph at least down a street that is 5mph and through the ally!! The driver yelled out sorry and did not bother to stop and make sure he was ok! After my sister contacted the store and got no where, I am writing this review. NO pizza is worth a life so SLOW DOWN Lonnie or you might be out of business buddy.

14.description: Great neighborhood joint. Thin crust is superb. Toppings are of good quality. I ordered the spicy Italian, this pizza is king of badassery. The delivery guy was nice and friendly

1.description: This place is good for teens and men. The mens wear is all about "NOW" styles! Prices are great,  customer service is good, and the place was definitely clean. Casual, dressy or club gear, snapback hats, outer wear. I heard the spring and summer shipment is already on the way. My husband will be suited this summer ;)

0.description: Great Customer Service!!!!  Not to mention the quality of the clothing is awesome, the fact that the price is very affordable is an added plus!!!!  I'll be back to shop for my hubby soon!!! Also for my brother and little cousin!!!

3.description: Love this bar! I lived in this neighborhood for the past 15 years and have never gone there until I knew the bartender, Natalie. This place may be a dive bar, but it's an awesome one. Love the people that come here. Always a good time! :)

1.description: thought  it was a good place But. we- drank over 3 cases of beer- tipped heavily & the bartendrer- on her last day - didnt even buy us a round.    not a good move..come on  ..But..... It Still is  a Good barThat's why I only gave it 3 stars

2.description: Good old drinking place for a beer after work they also have a variety of shots and other alcahols

0.description: For an update- I've still been coming to this bar and they still have the best prices. The bar is well kept, neat, clean and the staff is friendly and quick- even on those crazy busy nights! Glad to still be here and still be paying less out of my pocket compared to those other places. Great job Mugshots!

4.description: I've been here twice and I live down the alley from it.  The only reason I didn't go sooner was because I'm in my 20's and I thought I wouldn't fit in at an "old-man" bar. However, now those are the places I frequent the most.  Prices are cheap here, 2.50 a bottle for domestics, and the beer is always ice cold. In addition, the bartender while sometimes a bit preoccupied with conversation is friendly and affable. Lastly, there are 4 flat screens so you won't miss any of whatever game you want to watch.  If you're in the neighborhood and your throat is scratchy and dry I'd say stop in and slake your thirst.

1.description: I tried to make an appointment for a manicure, pedicure and a leg wax for Wednesday October 29 but they had no availabilitySo I opted for Thursday October 30.I got all the way there in the middle of rush hour and they had their doors locked and were closed!!!Apparently they had no water and closed for the day, however they didn't bother to call me to tell me they were closing for the day.I called and left them a message asking why they could not call but it's been days and never heard back.Clearly they don't value customer's time or their needs.They have very poor customer service for not even calling me back to apologize either.

9.description: I bought a Groupon for a Keratin Treatment. It was the worst treatment I have ever had. Ive gotten this done 3 times prior to here so I something to compare it to. My hair is frizzy when I air dry or blow dry. The only way to make it frizz free is to flat iron. If I wanted to flat iron my hair why get the treatment. Dont waste your money. The salon itself is cute and the girl was very sweet but dont get the Keratin.

23.description: I bought a Groupon for a Keratin Treatment. It was the worst treatment I have ever had. Ive gotten this done 3 times prior to here so I something to compare it to. My hair is frizzy when I air dry or blow dry. The only way to make it frizz free is to flat iron. If I wanted to flat iron my hair why get the treatment. Dont waste your money. The salon itself is cute and the girl was very sweet but dont get the Keratin.

5.description: I went in to the salon to get my eye brows done I loved the music and feel of the salon as soon as I walked in I felt relaxed and I was approached right away by Georgina she was super friendly I enjoyed the experience with her. She threaded my eye brows perfectly it didn't hurt it was fast and it was a perfect shape. This is definitely where I will be having my eye brows done in the future and also look forward to trying other treatments !

25.description: Lisa did highlight, cut and style LOVE IT!!! also next time I went back lisa tryed this NEW flat iron infusion can not say enough about it LOVE IT!!!!

12.description: I bought a groupon which led me to this place.  I had Georgina and she was awesome.  She did a great job on my no chip.  I also tried out the eyebrow threading which I was VERY impressed with.  She did a nice job shaping them.  Needless to say I really liked her and recommend her.  The salon is a really cute place as well and the people there are nice.  I would definitely go again!

21.description: I bought a groupon which led me to this place.  I had Georgina and she was awesome.  She did a great job on my no chip.  I also tried out the eyebrow threading which I was VERY impressed with.  She did a nice job shaping them.  Needless to say I really liked her and recommend her.  The salon is a really cute place as well and the people there are nice.  I would definitely go again!

16.description: These girls have no clue what they are doing.  Not sure if the owner is aware of the stupidity that goes on at this salon but someone should let her know.  No type of professionalism what so ever! No clue how their system works. Get a clue!

17.description: I've been here 4 times now to get my Keratin treatment done. Each and everytime I've had a great experience. It lasts as ling as I follow the stylists recommendations. Never had a scheduling conflict and they've wlways been courteous. Had a trim and eyebrow threading service done and happy with those results too :)

10.description: Very unprofessional. I have bought Groupons in the past for mani-pedis. They have done a comparable job to the local Asian shops, but without a Groupon they are a lot more money for the same services.   I recently went in for extensions, I told my story of how I lost my hair through chemo, and was looking to get a few extensions to give myself some needed length in the front of my hair. They were helpful with the information, I decided to order the extensions and Vanessa suggested I do a Kerratin treatment to relax some of the curl in my hair. They gave me the Groupon price of $99 and I put down a deposit on the extensions of $75 and another $15 fro a brush they suggested. They said they were out of the 16 inch extensions that were on backorder, so she would order the 18 inch extensions since we'd be cutting them anyway. She said it would take about two weeks and she would call me when they were in. I got the Kerratin treatment, didn't wash for 48 hours, continuously flat ironed if it got out of place and when I washed my hair that Monday, 48 hours later, it was the same result that I had before the Kerratin treatment. I called the salon on Tuesday and left a message because I wasn't sure if this was the result I should have, I knew it wouldn't straighten completely, but I didn't expect any frizz which I had. No one returned my call. I called later in the week and again, no one returned my call. Two weeks had passed and I never got a call about the extensions, so I called on a Monday and left a message. Again, no one returned my call. I called the following Wednesday, and Vanessa answered and she said she didn't know what happened, that she would  talk to the owner and get back to me. (The owner is her mother, Lisa) She never returned my call. I then wanted a refund, I was over it and now didn't trust her to put then extensions in my hair and didn't want to give her the $225 she quoted me to do my hair, especially since the Kerratin didn't take well. I called again and I left a message with the receptionist to have the owner Lisa call me. I never received a call. This was so frustrating that I was starting to think that they took my money and didn't order any extensions. I felt like they were avoiding me. Finally after a month after my original visit, I went into the salon. I asked the receptionist if I could speak to the owner. I explained that I was in for a refund on extensions and suddenly Vanessa popped out of the  esthetician's room as if she just woke up. She told me she spoke with the owner and that she would give me a refund because the extensions were on backorder. I found this very strange because the day she ordered them, she said the 16inch were backordered so she would order the 18 inch and they would be there in two weeks.  She didn't even put the refund back on my credit card, she gave me cash back from the register and then offered to re-do my Kerratin that I declined. I started to wonder if there was a Lisa and if she was the owner. I really hate writing bad reviews, but this was such a weird experience. I will never go back again.

11.description: I came here on Christmas eve to get my hair blow dried for my birthday. I never been here but grew up in the area. My hairstylist is Georgina for 4 yrs now & I follow her where ever she goes. The place is friendly & the young stylists are sweet. I recommend going to Gerogina if your a curly girl but besides blowdry's she does no chips, updo's & professional makeup.

26.description: Went for a men's haircut and love it!!! Vanessa was my stylist and really sweet and nice!! Place is super clean!! Definitely go back and very affordable!!

22.description: So, I decided to get a blow out for my birthday because I just didn't feel like doing my hair that day. I bought a Groupon and thought it'd be a good idea. NOT! I was appalled when the hairdresser named Nina washed my hair and didn't even comb it out before started to blow dry it. I felt my hair getting ripped out of my scalp! I thought this was some type of new technique and I trusted this girl which was a big mistake! After I left the salon I started to get a headache! I've never had such a bad experience at a hair salon before and wouldn't recommend anyone going to this place at all!! Stay far away! DO your own hair; it'll look way better!

0.description: I bought a groupon for a Keratin Treatment, called the salon and was able to get an appointment that evening! I had my treatment done by Daniela, who was absolutely meticulous.  The treatment took about an hour and a half, yet she worked hard the entire time to make sure each section of hair was properly treated. I was amazing by her attention to detail and patience. In addition, her fun personality made the time fly by! I am beyond happy with my treatment, I noticed a huge difference in my hair right after my first wash. It's healthier and shinier than ever, and even on the most humid days I don't have to worry about frizz! I really didn't think that would be possible for me.The owner, Lisa, is so very sweet and accommodating. She even called me to follow up and ask how the treatment went. There aren't many business owners that care about their clients quite like she does. I'm glad to say I found my new go-to salon. Cannot wait to return!

20.description: Found this place with a Groupon, but am back because of the service.  Left with AWESOME looking hair after my Global Keratin treatment (THE best product line available) and plan on returning again and again!  Definitely worth the little bit of a drive for me. Free parking too!!!!   Friendly staff that is interested in YOUR styling routine and desires, not what they think you should be doing, although constructive suggestions should always be welcomed.  They share info about how best to care for your hair with your treatment and you can tell they want you to look your best - you are a walking advertisement for them after all (: .    So extremely pleased I have brought my daughter for her own keratin treatment as a Christmas treat.  She has more hair than Sasquatch and I have no doubt she will leave looking absolutely fabulous!!!!  I can't highly recommend this place enough - check it out - YOU WON'T BE SORRYAnd I plan on fully taking advantage of their specials too...would be insane NOT to!

19.description: I have been to Montebello Salon 3 times for the global keratin treatment and have been more than satisfied with each visit.  Vanessa also colored my hair and then put in the keratin and my hair looked so healthy and shiny.  They have been nice enough to honor the $99 for the keratin each time and I plan to continue to come here for the same services.

2.description: Usually go to another place to get my eyebrows done. That place was busy. Went for a tan and saw this place right next door. I walked in to get my brows done and boy was that a big mistake. I walked out with one brow way thinner than the other. Lady told me it would grow back. 'Nuff said.

18.description: Mongibello Salon and Spa girls are super-talented and friendly! The moment my best friend and I walked in we felt welcomed (the stylist we shared for over 20 yrs recently married and moved out of state). I came in for high/lowlights and Lisa took a solid 15 minutes going over new trends and techniques...I ended up with a fantastic cut and bright perfectly placed highlights. My cut is heavily layered and the length flirts with my shoulders perfect for my long, oval face and naturally wavy hair!! My best friend is just as happy with her new stylist Vennessa, her new asymmetrical bob, and all of her many new compliments she gets daily!! Thank you Mongibello!!!

13.description: I had a keratin treatment done by Daniella and must say she did a great job. I had a similar treatment at another salon and am much more pleased with the results this time. I also had Daniella cut my hair and am very please with the results. Will definitely go back!!!

4.description: Found this location due to a Groupon for a keratin treatment.  Danielle ,was wonderful made my second appointment for my hair color with highlights soon..can't wait for her to fix my hair color oops from another salon!

24.description: Mongibello Salon and Spa girls are super-talented and friendly! The moment my best friend and I walked in we felt welcomed (the stylist we shared for over 20 yrs recently married and moved out of state). I came in for high/lowlights and Lisa took a solid 15 minutes going over new trends and techniques...I ended up with a fantastic cut and bright perfectly placed highlights. My cut is heavily layered and the length flirts with my shoulders perfect for my long, oval face and naturally wavy hair!! My best friend is just as happy with her new stylist Vennessa, her new asymmetrical bob, and all of her many new compliments she gets daily!! Thank you Mongibello!!!

6.description: Vanessa did a wonderful job on my manicure and pedicure.  I walked out of there very relaxed and with beautiful nails.  I also made an appointment for a facial while there. Would definitely recommend Mongolia Salon & Spa.

15.description: The only reason I gave it a one star was because the girls were friendly .  However extremely inexperienced , well the one that did my hair at least . I especially told her I do not want thin streaky blonde highlights , I gave her the exact colors that I wanted ,showed her pics ,and asked for bayalage . But guess what I ended up with ? Thin streaky blonde uneven highlights ! I also went in there to get the keratin treatment which made my hair look worse ! It looks so unhealthy , dry, and damaged. The girl that did my hair was extremely inexperienced , she kept asking her co worker what she needs to do, and when I asked how long do we have to keep the foils on, her response was till they get light?! I've been to a lot of salons but this was the worst. She did not even offer to cut my hair that looked dried fried and unhealthy after the treatment .  Extremely Over priced for the type of service and experience . I never write reviews but I had too since I'm beyond disappointment and unsatisfied with my hair .

7.description: Is the salon still open? I had my hair and makeup done there for my wedding in Oct. I went back to the area, and it looked like the Italian restaurant took over the spot. However, their website is still up and running wtih this same address and phone number.

8.description: This place is amazing!! I got me hair colored highlighted and trimmed by Georgina,  and I will never go to anyone else to touch my hair. She does an amazing job, I suggest you go see her, she knows what she is doing and she is a true artist when it comes to hair. The owner is amazing and friendly, love this whole environment.  Go make your appointment now!!!

3.description: I've come here twice! The original visit was thanks to a $99 Groupon for keratin treatment. I ended up getting a cut color and eyebrows as well since I was well overdue. My stylist was Georgina and she was so helpful and knowledgeable about a good style for my hair type and the best methods to preserving color and keratin in my hair.    I came back a few weeks later and I made my second appointment with Georgina again for eyebrows and color toner for my hair, the color came out gorgeous! And I have not been this satisfied with my eyebrows in YEARS! She really took the time to shape and thread my eyebrows. I will definitely be going back to see her, and had concerns that I would not make my appointment before she takes her leave of absence. She assured me that I would be due before she goes. The staff is funny and friendly and down to earth. Worth the time and money.

14.description: So, I decided to get a blow out for my birthday because I just didn't feel like doing my hair that day. I bought a Groupon and thought it'd be a good idea. NOT! I was appalled when the hairdresser named Nina washed my hair and didn't even comb it out before started to blow dry it. I felt my hair getting ripped out of my scalp! I thought this was some type of new technique and I trusted this girl which was a big mistake! After I left the salon I started to get a headache! I've never had such a bad experience at a hair salon before and wouldn't recommend anyone going to this place at all!! Stay far away! DO your own hair; it'll look way better!

1.description: The stylist that I was most happy with left. I went back and had a couple more haircuts that were inconsistent. I wish the business success, but have found a local barber shop that is much more personable and reliable.

0.description: I go to a certain school to get my haircut by students and it's closer to downtown but they often take a while since you have to wait for a teacher to approve each step of the process. I liked going there since I felt comfortable knowing a teacher could cut it if it was messed up, especially because my hair is pretty thick and I get nervous if someone is not familiar cutting thick hair or a bob. My husband and father in law have been coming here, so I went here based on their past experiences. I was a walk in on a Saturday around 10am when they had opened. I was in the chair within 10 minutes since there was no line. A gentleman named Jose cut my hair and he did wonders! I told him exactly what I wanted with photos and it was perfect. He made sure the water temperature was ok for the shampoo, what length was ok, if I wanted more volume, and If I wanted a blowout. It was all perfect, and I was surprised since it's been a while since I've gone to a chain place, but this is in my neighborhood and now I don't have to drive 35 minutes and park for a few in a garage! It's in the Dunning Square parking lot so there's plenty of parking for free. It was reasonably priced - altogether for the cut, shampoo and blowout, it was $26 (not including tip). Thank you to Jose! I definitely recommend this place for a reasonably priced cut.

3.description: This place is not what you'd think when you hear the name "New England Inn." It's not a restaurant that revolves around seafood, sailors and bluestockings, rather it's a Polish bar with a restaurant in back where they will hand you platters of good food for very little money.We got there about eight on Saturday and apart from what I think must've been the owner, and some of his cronies sitting at the bar (They greeted us warmly, too) the place was empty, which honestly didn't bode well in my book.  It's an unpretentious place, and I kept thinking it should have been packed (Yeah it was a little late, but still.)  The waitress who seems to double as a bartender, checked to see if we wanted the English menu, and suggested Okocim, which I'd never tried before.  While we waited for the beer, we ran through the menu which consisted pretty much of pork, pork, pork, chicken, pork, pork and pork, with a bit of beef and veal.   I ordered the pork loin, Glinda tried the pork side (probably pork belly) and Jim had the country plate which was All Meat, All the Time.The country plate was two thick slices of pork loin, two or three of smoked butt, two large pieces of smoked sausage and two large pieces of schnitzel.  The pork side was a pile of meat in gravy, and my pork loin was -- I kid you not here -- SIX half inch thick slices of gorgeous pork loin. Each dish came with a soup bowl of really delicious sauerkraut and the waitress plunked a platter of sliced bread dumplings in the middle of the table. I counted them; there were thirteen thick-slices of dumpling, looking like the equivalent of a loaf of bread. The only thing that I thought there could have been more of is gravy.As usual, we passed food around the table. Glinda's pork was really kind of fatty, but the flavor was fantastic.  My pork loin was kind of dry, but again the flavor was good, and I think it might have been less dry earlier in the day. The sausage and smoked butt were excellent, too. And I brought home one of those large styro leftover boxes filled almost to overflowing with my leftovers.The prices? $5 each for a large stein of Okocim, $11 each for the pork dishes and $12 for the country platter. Service was fast, friendly and attentive, and as we left, the owner asked how everything was an the rest of the guys said good-night to us.Why this place wasn't jammed is beyond me.  I grew up going to places like this; it reminds me of a restaurant called "Pavelka's" of which I have many fond memories. Just because the place isn't all prettied up, doesn't mean it's not a terrific place for a good, inexpensive meal.  And any place that has SyFy on the TV is okay in my book. Go.  Eat your weight in Polish food. Take the rest home. Especially now, in the winter, the warmth of this place is really welcome.

1.description: Went on Saturday afternoon on Halloween at 1:00 pm and at the time, we were the only people in the dining room. They said they are usually more busy but the rain and the holiday kept people home that day.Cons: outdated, run-down decor // a little hard to findPros: great food (we had the pork butt (ham) and the breaded ham and cheese as well as mushroom and kraut pierogis), extremely friendly and attentive (helped us with our order when we weren't sure of something), great value for the size of portion (we had leftovers for later)We will DEFINITELY be back.

2.description: They have amazing food and it is good for groups try the sampler platter if you have never been there but the place is amazing

5.description: The ambiance is not all that great, but the food is excellent. Big portion sizes and quick service make this local joint a good value for the money.

6.description: This is the place to go if your husband can eat his weight in meat and potatoes, and still have leftovers to take home , all for a measly 10bucks.  This place has pretty good food, and you get your money's worth and then some. Like others have said you don't come here for ambiance but the service is not bad at all. And the beer is delicious too.

7.description: This is one of my favorite places to get a nice meal of Eastern European/Polish/Czech food.  The front looks like your basic bar- lots of worker guys having beers.  They have some good beers on tap, even German brands.  But the back room is a legitimate restaurant, with dedicated waitresses serving the food and seeing that you're served properly.  Too many other NWside Bohemian cafe/bar type places like this have the bartender girls serving the food and you pretty much have to eat in the smoky bar with some creepy characters or risk being forgotten while they do shots.  Not here- you dine in a normal restaurant setting, the service is good and the food's really good too.  Their potato pancakes drowned in Goulash is my favorite, but all their hearty dishes are prepared well.  Bring an appetite or expect left-overs- competing in a culinary world where large portions are the norm, this place BLOWS the competition away!  Order the "country platter" and you'll be brought an enormous pile of various meats and dumplings and sauerkraut- so much they bring it on two plates!

0.description: I came here after a ridiculously awful ophthalmic procedure because I needed some comfort food after not eating for 24 hours.  I know it's mostly a Polish place, despite the incongruous name, but it also has some Czech food.  I got the Czech version of the chicken with dumplings, and Hungarian Goulash- type dish, which both came with really wonderful salads of cabbage and carrots topped with a light vinegar dressing.  The owner was very helpful with my selections.  Czech dumplings are not what you would think -- they almost look like slices of white, crustless bread.  Then you stick your fork in them and realize that they have this lovely dumpling consistency.I don't mean to be pedantic, but both Poland and the Czech Republic are in Central Europe, not Eastern Europe.

4.description: What a hidden gem, amazing hearty food and huge portions at great prices. The roast pork was incredible. We've been searching for big bready czech-style dumplings ever since "The Dumpling Haus" in Stickney closed, and we finally found 'em.This place is as good or better than any other polish/czech place, and even offers some schnitzel. If you're looking for a cheap eastern european meat/potatoes fix, this place is second only to The Grand Duke down in Summit. (and cheaper!). We're voracious eaters and we  had enough food left over for lunch the next day.You'd never notice the sign, the name sounds like a seafood place, and the address is misleading (the entrance is actually around the corner on New England Ave., which explains the name...) Then when you walk in, it just looks like a bar full of Polish dudes. But just keep walking, there's a banquet room in the back where they serve the food. It looks like a great place for a anniversary or birthday party too, with a small stage/DJ setup and a private bar.Our only complaint was the blaring liteFM radio and TV was showing some gory action movie that sorta crippled the atmosphere, ha.

0.description: This is where a Polish man that looks like a Santa has a watch and jewelry repair workshop and can fix almost anything. I come here when I need a new battery in my watch or like recently when I needed to resize a watch that I just bought. Quick on the spot repair and fair prices. I would not go anywhere else. Highly recommended for all your jewelry repair needs. By the way, the location is actually 6006 W. Irving Park Road, Chicago IL 60634

3.description: Alex is the BEST!  I am in the process of my second tatt with her.  The first one was an exact copy I wanted.  This one I gave her a general idea and she designed it.  It's so AWESOME!  I can't wait till it's finished. :-)  Like Brigitte said, she does her research, and is SO thorough!!!  I can't say enough good things about her.  AND she puts up with my non-stop rambling during each 3 hour session.  That alone should get her an award! :-)  But seriously, she is very creative and I am VERY happy with her work.  DEFINITELY go to Alex if you are looking for a real artist!  Very happy for she and Steve that they opened up their own studio!Lisa S.

1.description: Alex is the best! She's extremely thorough and detail oriented. She gave me exactly what I wanted. I would trust her with any style of tattoo, you can tell she does her research before sitting down with you. She's doing an amazing job of a forest scene on my upper arm. I recommend her to all my friends, and will continue to see her for any future tattoos!

2.description: Just got my second tattoo from Stephen, needless to say he is AMAZING! Not only is he an incredible artist he has a great personality. He really made me feel comfortable and relaxed. His studio is super comfy I felt right at home. I have a rather large tattoo and it is absolutely gorgeous better then what I ever imagined. It's like he took the image from my brain and made it 10x better. I would recommend him to any of my tatted friends and everyone else. My boyfriend joined me (he has zero tattoos) as we were leaving he said "if I ever get one Stephens doing it." He also thinks it's beautiful. I'm beyond happy with this work and my experience at knight studios!! 5 out of 5 stars without hesitation.

5.description: Steve did my first tattoo and he's been my go to tattoo artist ever since. He'll take your concept for a tattoo idea and make it look exactly how you want it to. Give him artistic freedom with it, and it will look even better. His artwork is amazing in general and his tattoos are incredible. He'll work with you in the consultations and give you his honest opinions, which ultimately just leads to a better finished tattoo. I get compliments on my tattoos from Steve all of the time and am always proud to share where I go to get the work done. Not to sound cliche, but he really does view your skin as his canvas, and the end result of that outlook combined with his incredible tattoo skills is a perfect tattoo. I highly recommend Knight Studios to anyone interested in getting any ink.

6.description: Stephen is one of the best artists in Chicagoland. I have been going to him for many years now, and I have many tattoos from him. I was excited to here that he has his own shop now. I have already started my next tattoo with him. He really takes his time and creates amazing work. I generally come in with a basic idea, which he transforms into a masterpiece. I highly recommend him as an artist. He knows his stuff, so check out his portfolio.

7.description: I've been getting work done by Stephen Knight for 2 years. Happy that Stephen finally opened his own shop. He now has been able to bring his personality into the entire studio atmosphere. Stephen is laid back and open for any ideas. I have been throwing my thoughts at him for my sleeve and he's been able to draw up exactly what I had imagined. Knights Studio is like being at home, chill and super laid back. Seeing Stephen in his own environment has allowed him to take the time he needs with his clients. Stephen is very thorough with his tattooing, takes time allowing for the best healing process. All my tattoos look like they did the day I got them done. New shop is super clean and Stephen is very big on avoiding any type of infection at home. I will always go to Stephen for my work. He is super trust worthy and has always worked with my schedule. I highly recommend him for anyone that is looking for quality work.

0.description: Do you prefer impatient artists?  Do you like having the knowledge that the person who began your tattoo may not finish the piece?  Are you looking to have the artist provide no professional insight whatsoever?  If so, many tattoo locations in the Chicago area that will provide you with that experience.  I encourage you to seek one of them out immediately.  Are they gone?  Good.  Now that the D-Bags have left, I can tell you about Stephen Knight, and Knight Studios looks to serve people who are serious about body art.  I do not mean snobs or elitists.  I do mean people who fully understand the life-long commitment they make when one decides to get a tattoo.As a result, Stephen and Alex take the proper time, professional approach, and trained input to ensure their clients have the best experience possible.  Earlier this year I moved to Washington State.  As a result, I waited months until I was in Chicago again to have Stephen tattoo me.  To me, it was more important to receive a tattoo by someone whom I trust me than receive the immediate gratification of having the piece completed.  I do have a quick example of my experience at Knight Studios.  I brought Stephen several ideas I had for tattoos and where I wanted them placed.  Stephen took the time to create stencils, discuss the realities of each suggestion, and work with me to find the best possible design, size, and location of each piece.  If you want someone a "Yes-Man" who will give you a tattoo you will regret within seconds of completion, go elsewhere.  If you are looking for tasteful, skilled, and creative artists, visit Knight Studios.

4.description: Knights studio is one of the best tattoo establishments I've ever been in and had work done by. Steve and Alex are top notch in everything from consultation to art checks. Their work is excellent and they are as knowledgeable as they are flexible with their clients. Highly recommend them. Alex has done 5 for me so far and I get compliments everywhere I go. Stop in, call, or email them, you won't be sorry.

1.description: Celebrated my fiancé and my birthday here last week. What a great time! Teresa made it possible for us to have a reserved space for the friends to hang out. The drinks are great and very reasonable! They don't serve food but they were totally fine with our ordering a few pizzas which is awesome! Friends were complimenting our choice of bar as the dj played a good variety of music and everyone felt comfortable. We had an amazing time at Draft! Thanks for helping us have an amazing birthday!

9.description: It seemed like a really cool spot when we were driving down Irving so we decided to stop in and watch the Hawks game.  The place is really nicely done, with brick walls, and lots of TVs.  They even played the sound during the game.  My bf and I got to sit on their comfy couches by the windows.  We got a domestic bucket for $10 which I think is a good deal.  Although they don't serve food, they had a food truck come out front.  The only downside was that the bartender lost my bf's credit card, but they were really nice about handling the situation.  I will definitely come back for a drink if I am in the neighborhood again.

12.description: Love having draft in the neighborhood! Nice week night specials. Teresa and Mike are awesome and I look forward to lots of many more great drinks!

21.description: I want to hang out here every night. Great beer selection. Sit at the bar or sit at the tables. Great hang out on the NW Side. I'm coming back.

16.description: Wow I could not be more bummed out after leaving this bar. Heeneys was a total dad bar but at least they never tried to rip off their customers. I ordered a absolute and cranberry and was served a straight cranberry juice in a Tom Collins glass. I will start by saying I have bartended in this area for the better part of a decade. I can tell if there was even a drop of vodka in a drink and I had a couple friends try my drink as well. I left a nearly full drink on the bar and walked out. The female bartender was friendly but the male ones acted like I was an inconvenience to order a friend a beer! See ya heeneys, I will always have fond memories of the bar you used to be.

17.description: Finally a really great bar in the area, and the guiness is definitely good.  Really nice atmosphere.  You can tell the  owners put a lot of time and effort into making this a great neighborhood spot.

10.description: Great, city-bar feel nestled in the norridge/northwest Chicago vicinity. Attentive bartenders with fabulous suggestions and notable music/entertainment. Great pricing, fun atmosphere, and extraordinary service! We return again & again!

5.description: Stopped in for some drinks and watched the games on Sunday. They don't have a food menu, but the bartender brought in chicken tacos - yum!

11.description: Was in Chicago for my first time on business.  I ended up here after reading all of the positive reviews.   The environment was great and the owners came over and introduced themselves.   $10 domestic buckets and chili during halftime.   It was a nice local place and I would definitely return here.

22.description: Draft rocks. Welcoming, spacious, with a great selection of craft brews on tap. Eight flat screens to watch sports. Couches and plush chairs make for a living room feel.

0.description: Great hangout spot!!!!!!I've been going to draft since it opened and it has become my "go to" bar.. Everyone is so friendly and its a great environment!I recently attended a birthday party and the bartenders always made sure we had drinks.The music is great. There's always a Dj or a live band. Theres always a food truck on the weekends.. AMAZING FOOD!!!!!!! If you're looking for a local bar to watch the hawks  game, Draft is def the spot to go to! :)

20.description: Finally a really great bar in the area, and the guiness is definitely good.  Really nice atmosphere.  You can tell the  owners put a lot of time and effort into making this a great neighborhood spot.

19.description: I celebrated my big 4 0 here. Had a blast!! Dj is there on Saturdays from 9 pm -1 am.  I reserved ahead of time for my date. The owner Teresa had the Dj call me to ask what kind of music I wanted for my event. I did a 1920's theme and had about 70 people.  It was tight but we had it booming!! Bar needs to stay open to the public no private parties. I was able to cater food in and my cake. We did the consumption package where my guest had a $1 off drinks. They also have wrist bands $30 for 3 hours. We would definitely have another event here.  See you soon Draft!

2.description: Friendly bartender. It was a slow and quiet Sunday night. Love the decor and lounge area. I wouldn't have noticed the place if they didn't have a large bright sign outside haha. Drink specials are great too.

18.description: I want to hang out here every night. Great beer selection. Sit at the bar or sit at the tables. Great hang out on the NW Side. I'm coming back.

13.description: Great addition to the neighborhood.  been in here a few times with friends,neighbor and alone and every time felt at home.   please add another craft beer to the selection...lots of local breweries to choose from!

4.description: What I enjoyed most about this place was the decor. It was also very clean. One of the bartenders was a total sweetie (another lectured me on what a drink was supposed to be called). The clientele was very mixed. There were both older people in their early fifties and people in their early twenties. I felt their drink prices were pretty high considering how far from downtown it is. This place should not be charging Wrigleyville prices for cocktails. The DJ also told my friend, who requested a popular song, that he couldn't play it because the owners told him he is only allowed to play a couple of "urban songs" a night, which kind of bothered us. My biggest complaint? The bathrooms! There was only one woman's bathroom. After 30 seconds of being in the restroom, an older regular was banging on the door. Not wonderful!

6.description: Nice neighborhood bar. Went for a party and they had a live band, I think they were all lawyers, that was pretty good. No food available but the drinks are affordable and the decor is a step above some of the other area bars

15.description: Threw a surprise party this past weekend for my husbands 30th.  We had about 40 people and everyone had a great time!  The bar is clean and serves drinks quickly!  Teresa offered us a great package for drinks as well :) The dj was good too, he played a mix of diff music.  Well definitely be back for another party :)

7.description: This is a great neighborhood bar. Its very clean and very down to earth. The wait staff and bartenders are attractive and attentive...and the prices are reasonable. Of course I'm used to downtown prices so any prices under that seem reasonable to me.The only thing I would want them to do is to serve food. They have a food truck outside many nights and they have no problem having you order food in so its not that big of a deal.

8.description: Just moved into Dunning and I could not ask for a better neighborhood bar. The staff is super nice and the place is very clean and comfortable. Beers range from $2+ all the way up to craft $5+ and all shots are $5 including my favorite bourbon Buffalo Trace.Plenty of TVs and seating for the big game, could not ask for a better place... seriously.Oh yeah, it's BYOF and you got Bob-O's across the street serving one of the best dogs in town.

3.description: Awesome place to hang out with some friends.  The bartender Jamie is awesome!   Great bartender and good to look at to if you know what I'm saying! ;)  Great drink specials too!

14.description: Had birthday party there and the staff and owners couldn't have been any nicer. Everyone was so helpful with the planning and the decorating. I would recommend this for your next event. The food truck that came later in the evening was also a big hit

3.description: I was told about this store by a family friend.  I went to their website and they had such incredible dresses by European designers.  My mom and I were really counting on this store to have the dress I was looking for.When we got to the store, the owner wasn't there.  Instead, her son arrived a few minutes later and told us that she had an emergency and had to visit a friend in the hospital and will be back in an hour and a half.  Well, certainly someone else was going to help me find a dress instead of this kid, right? Wrong.  So, how do we shop for a dress?  He points us to catalogs and mannequins and says that we can customize almost any dress, so if I like a top, but not a skirt, they can do that.  Can I try the dresses on?  Yea, he'll pull them off the mannequins for me.  While my mom and I carry dresses to the messy fitting room, he helps several guys renting suits and a girl picking up a bridesmaids dress.  We wait for him to pull dresses off mannequins.  Nothing works out and we look at catalogs, but can't make any decisions without someone who's knowledgeable about the designers helping us. This is when I have my break-down and we leave.Now, I know that emergencies do come up, but the owner could've been a little more professional at called me and rescheduled my appointment! Or, maybe sent someone less clueless than her son?  1 star review + 1/2 a star for her son who tried very hard to be helpful and 1/2 star for the beautiful dresses in the catalog that I probably would've purchased had I not been devastated instead.

1.description: I flew to Chicago to go go dress shopping with my bridesmaids and one of my best friends that is also getting married. We booked an appointment here because the reviews led me to believe there would be some great discount dresses here. There was a sale section, but the majority of the dresses were around $1800, which is more than I was looking to spend. I was also not aware that European style gowns were so extravagant. I was looking for something much simpler than this store had to offer. All of the dresses had a lot of poof, or a lot of beading, or a lot of both. Some of them were fun to try on, but if you are looking for something understated and on a budget of $1000 or less, this may not be the store for you.

2.description: After a disappointing visit to Eva's Bridal, D and I stopped in to look around at Laurel's dresses. Entering the shop, there were unbelievably gorgeous dresses EVERYWHERE! There was such a variety of colors and styles, D and I looked at each other in astonishment. We were greeted warmly and cheerfully by the owner who looked genuinely pleased to have us come in. She introduced herself to both us and asked what we were looking for. After we described D's dream dress, we were escorted to dresses that were exactly what we had described. She listened well and gave opinions as to what styles and colors would complement D. Leading us into the fitting room, she explained to D and I that she would be showing us three different styles of dresses that she felt would portray the dress D was dreaming of. [She without a doubt kept D's budget and desires in a dress at mind.] She helped and showed D how to put her wedding dress on and gave her honest opinion how the dresses looked on D. Having the opportunity to select a top and a bottom from two different dresses to make them into ONE dream dress is the most AMAZING thing D and I have ever heard. The graciousness of the owner and the intimate and genuine desire to help us look through dresses is an absolute great quality this shop has. The owner is so knowledgeable and kind hearted, she made our horrid experience at Eva's a mere memory =]

0.description: I recently got screwed over by another bridal store out of 5 bridesmaids dresses 2 months away from my wedding (read my other review for that lovely story!) And reached out to Betty here at Laurel Bridal.  She was kind, understanding, and also appalled at my story. :(   She went right to work in letting me know what my options were, her opinions, and what to do to make sure I get my dresses on time.  Couple hours later- my dresses are rush ordered and set to be here at the end of June.   What really struck me, is even though I showed obvious anxiety and desperation, she did not take advantage of me, and I can't express how honest and kind that is.  Will be sure to refer all my girlfriends to this shop!

4.description: When i first walked into the store i was greeted by the owner who was very friendly. The dresses they carry are quite different than what you normally would find at other Chicago bridal salons. By different i don't mean great, but they are not bad also! Laurel bridal is by no means a cheap place. Dresses that caught my eye were all priced over $2000. I was ready to pay that much or even more money in order to have a unique and stylish European wedding gown. First, I looked at the catalogs and i was very surprised that the front page of the some catalogs was either missing or designers' information was carefully covered with Laurel's Bridal flayers and business cards. When i asked the owner who makes the dress i liked, she just said it's European. Well, i went to try on some dresses and boy was i shocked! Those dresses just didn't feel like a designer European dresses. Trust me that I know what a well made designer gown should feel like. Needless to say that all tags and labels were removed from the dresses.The dresses i picked looked pretty, but they felt VERY VERY CHEAP! It was like something you get from the Chinatown; it looks pretty on a picture, but it's not the best quality item. I liked the style of some dresses, and i was hoping that Laurel bridal sells replicas of some well known brand. I went home dedicated to find out what was the name of that brand and where can i buy an authentic dress. After 2 days of searching the web i found out that the dresses that are sold at Laurel Bridal are NOT replicas and they in fact really come from Europe, but it's a little more complicated... Those dresses are not made in Italy, France or Spain like the owner claims (maybe some of them are, i can only speak for the styles i was interested in). The dresses they sell are made in Poland and Ukraine. I contacted Ukrshic which is a factory based in a small town in Ukraine and they told me that all their dresses cost under $500 (shipping to the US included). They were extremely nice, spoke fluent English and were even willing to make some changes to the dress i liked on their website (which can be viewed in English as well). They said that the dress would be ready in 4 weeks and i should allow another 2-4 weeks for delivery. I didn't end up ordering the dress from them because i wasn't impressed by the fabric quality. I ended up buying an incredible Enzoani gown from the suburban bridal shop for $2500. That gown makes me feel like a princess, you can't even compare it to the dresses sold at Laurel bridal. Personally, i have nothing against Russian, Polish, Ukrainian brands and I'm sure that there are many brides who like me would like their modern styles and affordable prices. I just feel it's very wrong to provide customers with inaccurate information and to build business on lies. It makes me very angry when businesses like Laurel Bridal treat their clients like they are fools. They greet you nicely when you come in and they even make you feel that you are best friends, but in reality all what they care about is a huge profit they make of you. In my opinion, every bride has a right to know how and where her wedding gown was made, especially if it costs more than 2 thousand dollars.

28.description: Stopped in after going to the other location on Irving and Cicero. Since I had done my pedi at the other place, I went ahead and did the no-chip French mani here.  I sat with Helen who did a great job, and she's hilarious!  Only thing is, I do have a tiny chip on one of my nails and it also has little ridges on it.  It could've happened when I put my hand into the UV machine, who knows?  I'll have to see how the rest of the mani holds up before I decide to go back or not.EDIT 7/7/2010- A lot of my nails chipped, not just the first one and it was only day 2!  I'm still giving them the 4 stars because they fixed (made them better) free of charge!  I think I'll see another tech next time, though.

1.description: Love, love, love Kelly and Patty. They always do a great job. Everyone there is nice and helpful. I have been going for over a year and will continue to go there.

9.description: I'm not sure about all the negative reviews, but they always do a good job on my nails when I come here. Even though I don't go too often, they still seem to remember me. It's sometimes annoying that they're so busy (and calling ahead doesn't guarantee anything). I've never had no chip, but my manicures seem to last 3 weeks and my pedicures over a month (longer if not for my nails growing!). Will keep coming here even though I have moved farther away.

23.description: When I came on yelp I read the reviews and I figured this would be a typical good salon.First of all, I read in a review that they speak perfect English. I didn't understand a thing they were saying.Second of all, my nails.. This is a joke. I overpaid. They didn't do my cuticles. I've been to many salons before and am completely unsatisfied. As soon as she was done I kept looking at her and wondering if I was good to go. My nails looked horrible. I thought she'd keep working on it. Also, she didn't even tell me we were done. She was more focused on her laptop... Probably looking up tutorials on how to do nails.I don't understand how people keep coming here. I've gotten better service from an amateur friend doing my nails. I do not recommend this place to anyone. Although this place could be near by, if you're going to overpay, at least go somewhere where your nails will look great.

5.description: I do an awful job at painting them myself.  I started going to Lee nails my Freshman year of h.s. '05/'06 and stopped going this last summer. I would go back in forth with Gel nails or simple manicures which meant I had a specific person for either one.  Diana(owner) would do my "gel" nails and her partner would do my manicures.  One day I was in a rush (one day meaning always) and Diana was booked so she sent me to this gal that I've seen before but being a nail tech surely was not her calling.  I was there for a fill in and i told her to go just a bit shorter...she filed them all the way to the point of no return. One of my nails bubbled up, another one was patchy, and two other one's were crooked.  I complained to Diana and requested for either her or someone else to fix them from scratch.  Knowing that I have been a long time customer (8 years to be exact)she completely denied me. I was furious and vowed to never go back again.Side note, I had witnessed bad customer service there to innocent clients and didn't say a word because I was being treated in an ok manner. I suppose you can say my time came around as well.Bad customer service is not okay, Diana. You are losing customers because of this and your poorly trained nail technicians.

25.description: There are plenty of nail places by my house, but I find myself going to this one the most. When I think about the reason(s) why, the first thing that comes to mind is that I never have to wait. They have usually have 7-10 nail techs working at a time and another plus - they all speak English relatively well! I don't request a particular nail tech so have experienced work done by many of the techs here.  I don't have anything bad to say, but I also don't have anything glowing to say. Thus, 3 stars - this place consistently meets my expectations. $35 for a mani/pedi. CASH ONLY tips. They have a cash machine inside if you forget to bring cash. Parking lot is another benefit.

12.description: I've been coming here for years , about 6 yrs I would say. Diana, Nancy and Julie are the only ones I would make an appointment with at this point. Overall a good place.

21.description: How do I start .... I have been going here for quite some time now never was super wowed by their work however it is right next to my house so I go for basic manicures and pedicures for the most part all their employees are pretty nice and professional how ever JULIE is terrible her attitude is just horrible not to mention her work....Went in with a HUGE group of girls (Bridal party) We had a 10am appointment. Got in everything was going ok.... The bride wanted us to do the color scheme of the wedding and asked JULIE who was doing my nails if she could show her how the french manicure with a yellow tip would look on ONE finger (just to see if she liked it) Julie rolled her eyes and said im sure you know how it will look and totally disrgarded her question..... #2 Before Julie got started on my nails I advised her on how I liked the shape of my nails (as I often do when I am paying for them) and she very rudely stated "I am Not Finsihed" I looked at her and said I know I am just letting you know how I wanted them done before you started. She continued to do my nails she completely disregarded what I asked of her and the nails came out HORRIBLE.  The bride then talked to the manager about her rudeness and asked if one of the other ladies could fix my nails (I had already paid the $50)The manager then proceeded to say that if I wanted my nails FIXED they would have to charge me extra AFTER she agreed that the polish job was "not good".Needless to say I will NEVER go back again and NEVER reccomend Anyone there I would rather travel to ASIA Nails (logan Square) than to go here again. I wish I could give it  -0  stars

16.description: Went in with my daughter as a little treat and hated it. I asked for them to do our colors at the same time and they split us up even when I kept on saying I wanted them to wait. Their attitude is disgusting. How can you work with people and just not care how you treat them? So pushy and rude!!! I'd rather go to the busy lee nails 15min away! DO NOT GO HERE!!! I hated that I tipped them..rude, pushy people!!! I wouldn't give them 1 star.

17.description: I've been here a few times because it's close by,  but I will not be coming back. The service is mediocre and I've had some of the nail technicians be downright rude and not accommodating whatsoever. I expect to feel comfortable and relaxed when I get my nails done,  and I never feel this here. I'd rather drive out of my way for FAR better service!!

10.description: I had went there last week. I would say that they were bad at attending a customerBut all I got was a fill in with color change. I arrived around 7:30. There was about 5 or 6 people working. One of the nail technician kept saying 5 minutes! 5 minutes! And by the time they got to me it was 8 pm and close to closing. I had picked a color and the nail technician said how about no chip color. And I kept insisting on no chip but he wanted to go home and not wait for the nail polish of my choice to dry. I finally then caved in. Getting a fill in with color changed costed me around 40$. Thats a lot for just a fill in and color change. This place is to expensive for me. Sorry

11.description: Was here for the first time over the weekend, I'll preface everything by saying, 1) it's as cheap as it gets and 2) I really enjoy what my nails look like today (I've done additional work on them AFTER the mani was done)Everything else is not good. Attitude when you refuse a no-chip, I change my color every week (or go bare) & my nails are ruined when I've done it in the past. And who the F thought it was a sexy idea to have a bunch of outgrown nail along with polish and dead skin that you cant remove unless you have tools anyways? Insisting THEN tisking when I refuse an eyebrow wax as I'm allergic to the wax, she rolled her eyes when I said I breakout. Like Bitch, you dont know my life!And I know that 5 o'clock unibrow ole girl was sporting was not judging my beautiful ass eyebrows. PU-LEASE. Its like do you own a mirror? Please check your own self  b4 acting like someone else has an issue. And the main issue I will never recommend this cheapo place is.....UNSANITARY MARY!  They tried to use an unwashed tool from the pedicure area, that was on the floor- on my hands. THEN they placed it back by the pedicure area and used it on the next person, it was not sanitized whats so ever, not even washed or anything.... Oh Hell No...

26.description: I get my hair done right by this nail shop so have been in there 3 times out of convenience, I get regular manicures somewhere else and usually do one polish change in between Mani's. Each time I've been there It has been only for a polish change. The first time I got a lady that I was not really happy with but it was late so I chalked it up to her just being tired. It seemed as if she was mad that I wasn't doing a mani and was just getting a polish change. The second time, same thing. Third time (I'm clearly a glutton for punishment) I get the same lady and again she is treating me as if I was getting my nails done for free. I asked for a polish change and as soon as they set me up with her she was super crabby. She started painting my nails by slapping a thick glob of polish on my nails. I asked her to please not put such thick amounts on my nails. She kept on and my nails were a sloppy mess. I quietly asked her to please redo a nail and she just put another glob over the nail. I finally said, remove all the polish and do it over. She kept saying i needed a manicure and that she couldn't "do it" with nails like mine. Mind you, I had a manicure like the week before and my nails and cuticles were just fine. I ask her to remove all the polish and start over considering I was paying for a polish change meaning if I wanted them to look sloppy and like crap I would've done them myself. She got really mad by now and started to yell and called the owner. The owner came over and I politely said, listen, I was asking her to fix my nails, she clearly wants me to make a scene since she is sitting here making a scene and being loud. It was beyond embarrassing. The owner then looked at my nails and acted as if they were fine. They looked as if I had painted them with my toes! Look, if you don't want to take a customer for a polish change, don't offer the service. I probably would have tipped her more that a person getting a mani and pedi. ($2 is not enough ladies!) I've been getting my nails done for over ten years and I think this is by far the worse place I've ever been to. Never again.

27.description: I have been going here for years. I am happy every time I walk out the door. The ladies are always friendly and the foot massages alomost put me to sleep.

0.description: I've been going here for a little over 3 years now and I'm very pleased with my nails. I ONLY go to see Patty here. She's the best, literally! She does my pedicures and no chip manicures. She's the only one that knows how to shape my nails perfectly. When she is not in, I see the lady who sits directly next to her, Julie. She does great work too, but not as great as Patty. I had one incident where I tried a mood nail polish color. Bad, bad, idea. Patty fixed it for me at no cost. I get so many compliments on my nails. If you go here, ask for Patty! :)

20.description: Okay gave them a second chance,they did an awesome job, very very happy customer she took her time she was patient she didn't awesome awesome awesome job I am so impressed with her after going to nail shops for over 25 years this is the only spot that I have been to that they did not put a nail crooked 25 years and this girl was able to put all my nails on straight I gave her a 10 never forget tiffany.

19.description: OK, so I really wanted to love this place because contrary to other reviews I think that staff is very friendly and it's so close to my new home.  Problem is I went in two times for a no-chip manicure and they chipped both times.  I don't mean a little chip, I mean, lots of chips on different nails.  I ended up having to go in two days later to have one fixed (I paid for it, no biggie) and assuming it was one bad experience I went back 2 weeks later for a full no -chip and yes, it chipped again.  I honestly would rather have ketchup on my blouse than a chipped nail.  Anyway, decided to go back downtown at the JRTC where I work to get my no-chips done even though it's easier to go somewhere closer to home on my days off but haven't had a problem since.  Maybe it's the supplies they use??  Not sure...

2.description: The only reason I came to this salon was to accompany a friend thats a regular at this establishment. They had the doors open during my manicure and all the acrylic shaving was flying everywhere. It was that bad to point that while I was drying my manicure I noticed all 10 nails had little spots from the acrylic shavings. I notified my nail tech and she asked her boss what should we do? All I wanted was for her to repaint my nails and i didn't see what the problem was because of how slow it was at the time but instead she insisted on putting another topcoat on. I refused and she had a nasty attitude about the fact that she had to repaint my nails. While she was taking off the polish she did such a poor job, i asked her for a cotton ball with acetone and took it off myself. If I was to come back, I wouldn't want the same nail tech.

18.description: Best place to get your brows waxed, even if you feel half of your face has been ripped off after they are done. I imagine this is what it's supposed to feel like but I'm still not used to it. Regardless, they are fast, and the results are amazeballs! Call me masochist, but I will be back!

13.description: I had been going there for 5 years. Today was the last time!  Nu was late 15 mins I had am app. and had a horrible attitude, and told me she hadn't taken her lunch. By this time it was 5pm. This is all very unprofessional.  Then the actual work was crappy.  When I tipped Nu she started talking shit because it was a small tip. I understood her comments the entire time I was getting my nails done.  I called Diana the owner and although she apologized, I didn't feel like it was very sincere. I wanted my nails shapped right, and my no chip feels sticky. Diana did not offer to repair the work. That tells you what you need to know about this establishment.

4.description: If I could I would give this place a zero. Went there Saturday for a no chip manicure. If of the lady was talking to the other employee the whole time. Only time she said anything to me was you pay now??? OkThen manicure was so rushed that I never knew a cleaning and shaping can be done in 10 min. (I work as a nail tech, but did t have time to do my own) then when she starred painting my nails God the base coat was all over the place. And once you cure it it's a done deal. Then the polish was so massy. I ask her to clean it up she say later. Whatever. So she done i ask to clean it up now. She looks as me like she doesn't speak English. Pretends to clean it up, I was so pissed at that point I just payed and left. Not even 24 hours go by on Sunday 2 of the nails just pop off literally as I'm washing dishes. The rest start lifting from the top. On Monday I call to complain she say come later to fix it. Ok fine thank you. When I get there. They have the nerve to tell me it will be $15 to take them off and paint new polish or free just to fix it up. Will fine just fix it up because the polish is light anyways. Which this girl did such a horrible job to its disgusting. I left without saying anything. Now it's only 1230 just 12 hours since I left after getting them "fixed" 7/10 nails are all peeled off. The worse salon ever. They need to go to actual school to leave what they are doing and actually speak with your clients and not between each other.

24.description: Aplace to recommend! They are quick, good, friendly!

6.description: I went to this place once and it was a bad experience. I went in for a manicure and the lady left my nails slanted from the top. I let her know (in a nice way) that if she could fix them. She gave me the nastiest attitude. Worst costumer service I've experienced. I'm usually not one to complain, and all my reviews are good, but definitely not this one.

22.description: Why do people go to this place?  My pedicure was done in record time and she hardly touched the bottom of my feet.  There was an employee sleeping (yes, sleeping!) behind the pedicure chairs!  Unacceptable.  I won't be back.

15.description: I came here with my mom to get a pedicure and manicure. The manicurist my mom had did an ok job but my pedicure was not the best experience I have had. Everything seemed average until I realized the "hot towel" they were wrapping my legs with was the towel I had my feet on and the pedicures used the water, at this point she was draining the water out, I had my feet in! I was grossed out and decided to leave without the manicure.

7.description: If I could give more stars I totally would. Been here many times but this by far is the best. I was in for a mani-pedi with a picture that I loved. Rosa hand painted little flowers and I could not be happier. Will continue to be my #1 choice for nails!!!

8.description: Service was great. They entertained us right after we stepped inside the salon but the lady who did my nails didn't do such a great job. Went to get my nail color changed. There are bubbles and it doesn't look as flawless as I used to get them from a different nail salon.

3.description: Have been a client for 13 yrs even though I moved to downtown, still coming back over and over every 3 weeks and never ever had a bad experience. The best place, highly recommended to all of my friends..all of them are great... Diana and Sandra are the best:)

14.description: How do I start .... I have been going here for quite some time now never was super wowed by their work however it is right next to my house so I go for basic manicures and pedicures for the most part all their employees are pretty nice and professional how ever JULIE is terrible her attitude is just horrible not to mention her work....Went in with a HUGE group of girls (Bridal party) We had a 10am appointment. Got in everything was going ok.... The bride wanted us to do the color scheme of the wedding and asked JULIE who was doing my nails if she could show her how the french manicure with a yellow tip would look on ONE finger (just to see if she liked it) Julie rolled her eyes and said im sure you know how it will look and totally disrgarded her question..... #2 Before Julie got started on my nails I advised her on how I liked the shape of my nails (as I often do when I am paying for them) and she very rudely stated "I am Not Finsihed" I looked at her and said I know I am just letting you know how I wanted them done before you started. She continued to do my nails she completely disregarded what I asked of her and the nails came out HORRIBLE.  The bride then talked to the manager about her rudeness and asked if one of the other ladies could fix my nails (I had already paid the $50)The manager then proceeded to say that if I wanted my nails FIXED they would have to charge me extra AFTER she agreed that the polish job was "not good".Needless to say I will NEVER go back again and NEVER reccomend Anyone there I would rather travel to ASIA Nails (logan Square) than to go here again. I wish I could give it  -0  stars

1.description: This location does not honor coupons or promotions. They also claim to be 24 hrs but the owner will lock up at 10pm if they feel like it. They are rude and have bad service. I highly suggest you go elsewhere.

2.description: I asked for an everything bagel with plain cream cheese and two medium dark roast coffees with cream and mocha. I got two dark roast coffees without mocha, extremely bitter without it, and he just FORGOT to tell me they don't have any more everything bagels and fails to ask if I want any other, charges me for the coffees. What, was he hoping I'd FORGET I ordered food with my coffee? Bad morning at dunkin.

0.description: GOOD DONUT OR BAD DONUTYou never know when you walk into a DD if you are going to get a nice employee or a mean employee behind the counter. It really feels like a game of Good Cop vs Bad Cop.We were very lucky to get a very nice worker. I will assume he was the owner cause he was wearing the special DD shirt. There is always one special shirt lingering behind the counter. This review is based on the nice customer service and is the main reason for the 4 stars. We were picking up some donut holes to give to some friends who were in need of some TLC. We were also a little hungry and decided to try the egg white flatbread sandwich with turkey sausage and cheese for ourselves. I must say that I am so sorry we wasted money on this sandwich. This might be the worse tasting sandwich I have ever had in my life. "Do not!" and I repeat "DO NOT!" ever try this sandwich because it is not worth it! The sandwich tasted like it was 100% microwaved. In fact, the flat bread was hard in some parts and almost inedible. The cheese was melted beyond recognition and I could not even taste it. The turkey sausage is mixed into the egg white and you can not even tell its there. Its very flavorless. This sandwich is so wrong. I would give it 0 Stars and it should be removed from the menu and not considered food. I can not rate the donut holes because they were in a box and we did not get to sample them because we gave them away. But they looked good. This place has a big bonus because its drive thru is open 24 hours a day. That is a score. This is my old neighborhood and when I was a kid, I would have loved a donut at 1am. We had nothing open at that hour, so I'm a little jealous. So I would come back her for the friendly customer service but not for that terrible egg white flatbread. It was one of the worse things I have ever eaten. Does DD even test these products out on humans? Cause it should have never made it past the test kitchen.

1.description: Polish bakery with so many things to choose from.  I hadn't been to one before but my beau had so he was able to pick up various things.  Everything was really great.  His sister is a big fan of the rum balls.

0.description: This bakery is the best in the area! Everything is fresh and home made. The women working at the bakery are very kind and are willing to let you try samples. Keep up the good work!

1.description: Came here in hopes of a better selection of cards than my local Walgreen's. There's a huge selection but honestly I was disappointed that the higher end brands like Papyrus weren't offered. After years of cheap cards I've switched to paying a little more for nicer ones and I wasn't able to find them here. Otherwise, the store is nicely laid out and clean. Fair prices. If you like a good deal on cards there's a lot to choose from
