0.description: What a great store I have found!Lovely Cards starting at 29 cents each!So Bright and Visually AppealingLove It!Last week as I was out exploring I came across a great find by thename of Card Frenzy.And, I will admit that the sign stating that they had Greeting Cardsstarting at the low price of 29 cents definitely piqued my interest.So, after admiring the great window displays/visuals I decided to takemyself inside to check this place out, and what I found were greeting cardsand so much more!Now, I will admit that I don't send many greeting cards out anymore becauseI don't have that lovey dovey type feeling for many these days, however,I would send out cards to a few designated people like.. You Suck orYou're a Backstabber, yadda, yadda, you get the drift.Unfortunately I was not able to find any of those at Card Frenzy!Anyway, this place has not only a great selection of greeting cards butso much more, Halloween themed items. Birthday Items, Jewelry,Handbags, Clothing and some really cute stuffed animals.Okay, I'm 53 and still like stuffed animals! Nuff Said!The Store Interior is Beautiful, there is so much to see here!And, I met the store manager Carlos who was/is very cool, he takespride in his store, with good reason.Oh, and can't forget, Yankee Candles are here as well as Fannie MayChocolates, truly such a great assortment of so many items.So, if you find yourself in the Dunning Square Area located at Irving Parkand Narragansett treat yourself to a visit to Card Frenzy.Chances are you'll find something great here!So, indulge, it's definitely worth it...

28.description: GORGEOUS,UNIQUE & AFFORDABLEI am very particular (others might say difficult!) about certain things. Flowers are one of those things. Before becoming an Athena lifelong flower-power groupie, my previous florist and I celebrated 10 dewy years together. I informed my closest that if they were going to buy me flowers....it HAD to come from my florist and no other. No one could sway me. But one very courageous friend arrived one day with this big, bold array of the most gorgeous and fragrant flowers I'd ever received. Well done my florist,  I said aloud. To which it was revealed that these beauties came from Athena's!!!!!Owner Gabrielle won me over with the quality and selection and has kept me estatic with her knowledge, expertise and commitment to excellence.I sent my mother Gardenias (not the hardiest of flowers) and was amazed by the creamy color and sweet bouquet AND how long they lasted. I ALWAYS send those important to me some of her roses. From blushing apricot to dreamy lavendar to rich crimson.......her roses are exquisite AND LAST FOREVER. Her mixed arrangements brighten any situation with their saturated color. When a relative died, Athena's handled the flowers. Not only were the mourners commenting on their beauty, I knew things would work out smoothly. I knew the owner was keen to my needs during this sensitive time and would make things seamless so as not to cause me worry.I really wish I knew about Athena's back when I got married. Both Gabrielle and Evelina are always so patient and helpful....I always end up with the perfect arrangement.Yup. I'm a goner.

1.description: Really poor experience with this florist. If I could give negative stars I would. She cancelled my order twice. A friend was going through a really bad time, she had just suffered a really bad loss. I call and ask if I can get same day delivery and was told yes, I provide my CC details while on the phone with the owner only to receive a call 10 minutes later saying that my card didn't work and that they can no longer deliver the flowers that day (it wasn't after a cutoff time or anything). I said OK and apologized and said I can provide a different card and the owner just flat out refused and hung up. I promise I'm not making this up, she just hung up with no explanation, didn't offer me the option to have them delivered a different day just nothing. I decided instead to just place the order online for next day delivery instead since it seemed to much of a hassle for them to deliver that same day. On the day the flowers were to be delivered I receive an email that says this: "Hi,This is Athena Flowers. We are sorry, but we will not be able to deliver your order today."That's it. No phone call, no explanation of why or suggestions for a different day. No explanation of if they refunded me or not. I explained my friend's situation and just nothing, no sympathy or anything. They are extremely unprofessional and I would not recommend this place to anyone. If an order is cancelled you need to pick up the phone and let the buyer know, not send a one sentence email that doesn't explain anything. I'll be sure to call my bank and verify that I've been refunded since that wasn't told to me. Again, if it weren't for having to put at least 1 star to write a review they wouldn't even get that.

9.description: Love Love Love the flower shop! Wish I knew about this place when I was getting married as I would totally have used them.  Customer service is outstanding.  Flower are always beautiful and fresh.  They do amazing job with working with your budget and making the arrangement beautiful! This is the place to go to for flowers on every occasion.

29.description: My wedding was just this past week, so I wanted to get this in while my mind was still as fresh as a flower. omg lol. I had a GREAT experience with Athena. I met with Evelyn, who worked with us from beginning to end and about a million emails in between.We wanted to add succulents into our bouquets and boutineers, which I wanted to order on my own. Athena was more than happy to let me bring in my own succulent plants (at no charge) to incorporate with their own flowers.Their prices were reasonable and they accommodated some of my odd requests, no problem!Everything was delivered on time and was totally GORGE(ous)It's worth the drive out west for these guys.

23.description: Gaby went above and beyond on our wedding flower arrangements and table decor as well ceremony decor. Hands down I will go to Athena Flowers for all my florists needs. She even came back that same night to pick up here vases. If you liked to see some of the work they did for our wedding hash tag #LosReillos on Instagram and see our pics from our wedding and Athena Flowers great work.

5.description: I found Athena Flowers on Yelp, and was so glad I did! My wedding was very small yet Gabriella never made me feel as if my business wasn't valued. She was comfortable texting which was so helpful with my busy schedule. But the best part was of course my bouquet! I wanted a cascading bouquet and showed Gabriella a picture that she almost exactly replicated while staying within my budget. I can't say enough about her creativity and professionalism. Thanks so much!

31.description: Needed some flowers last minute. They did a great job and had exactly what I needed. They also have balloons, little stuffed animals and some cards too if you need that sort of thing. Also Spanish speaking if needed.

25.description: Gabby was our wedding florist this June, and she did an amazing job! We desperately wanted to have tall and short centerpieces at our wedding, but many places were charging so much for the tall centerpieces that we almost gave up on that idea... until we met with Gabby at Athena Flowers. She was so sweet and understanding and willing to work with our budget when other places were not. Gabby worked with our work schedules as well and met with us many times to discuss flower arrangement ideas, even when she was busy, tired, had out of town guests, or it was her birthday! On the day of the wedding, we were awed by the beauty of the bouquets and centerpieces. All of our friends and family members LOVED them... even the hard to please people! She really listened to what we wanted and executed our ideas brilliantly! Her romantic and delicate bouquets added so much romance to our banquet hall. We couldn't have been happier with Gabby and Athena Flowers and highly recommend her!

12.description: This is an amazing florist.  Every bouquet from here has been beautiful and lasted for weeks!  The prices are reasonable and the staff very friendly and accommodating for last minute requests.  Highly recommend!!

21.description: My cousin's wedding was in a little over a month ago, and I was the maid of honor. I went with her to pick out all the arrangements, and was blown away by the work they do. We just got in the wedding photos, so this goes out to all future brides...if you're going to splurge on something for your wedding, please have it be the flowers. My cousin's wedding flowers were beautiful all the way from the cake, to the center pieces, to her bouquet and ours(bridesmaids.)I don't recall the name of the girl we had the consultation with, but she was incredible! She was so patient with us, and I loved that they had actual examples in the store, as well as piles and piles of albums PACKED with their work.  She was so good at showing us what she thought would look good, and gave us amazing options to choose from. The bouquets were all delivered to us that morning, and by the time we arrived at the venue, everything was set up, and as we were getting ready to go at the end of the night they arrived to pick up the vases. I know this may not sounds like a lot, but trust me, when you're running around from the moment you get up, it's INCREDIBLE to know that you don't have to worry about picking up the flowers or making sure they set up right, or collecting all the vases to make sure to return them the next day. I felt as though she not only offers an amazing, beautiful service, but also a piece of mind. I couldn't be happier with her work!

16.description: Gaby went above and beyond on our wedding flower arrangements and table decor as well ceremony decor. Hands down I will go to Athena Flowers for all my florists needs. She even came back that same night to pick up here vases. If you liked to see some of the work they did for our wedding hash tag #LosReillos on Instagram and see our pics from our wedding and Athena Flowers great work.

17.description: We ordered our wedding flowers (orchids) from here back in 2010 and have been customers ever since. Everything the owner (Gabriela) has put together for us - from corsages to birthday bouquets to a firefighter memorial bouquet - has been breathtaking. Her husband and employees are courteous and hardworking. She has accommodated us last-minute on multiple occasions. Her beautiful storefront keeps the community positive during the unstable economy. We only hope her business grows more during the years ahead. There are florists all over the city, but you won't go anywhere else after your experience with Athena's.

10.description: Gabriella was a dream come true to people like me who are clueless about flowers! She made bridal party arrangements and a couple arrangements for church for my wedding and did a beautiful job. She had suggestions based on a couple pictures I sent her and was easily able to work within my budget. I honestly know little to nothing about flowers so just trusted her opinion and I'm so happy I did. She even hand delivered the flowers to my parents house the morning of the wedding to make sure I was happy which was a very nice touch!

11.description: My cousin's wedding was in a little over a month ago, and I was the maid of honor. I went with her to pick out all the arrangements, and was blown away by the work they do. We just got in the wedding photos, so this goes out to all future brides...if you're going to splurge on something for your wedding, please have it be the flowers. My cousin's wedding flowers were beautiful all the way from the cake, to the center pieces, to her bouquet and ours(bridesmaids.)I don't recall the name of the girl we had the consultation with, but she was incredible! She was so patient with us, and I loved that they had actual examples in the store, as well as piles and piles of albums PACKED with their work.  She was so good at showing us what she thought would look good, and gave us amazing options to choose from. The bouquets were all delivered to us that morning, and by the time we arrived at the venue, everything was set up, and as we were getting ready to go at the end of the night they arrived to pick up the vases. I know this may not sounds like a lot, but trust me, when you're running around from the moment you get up, it's INCREDIBLE to know that you don't have to worry about picking up the flowers or making sure they set up right, or collecting all the vases to make sure to return them the next day. I felt as though she not only offers an amazing, beautiful service, but also a piece of mind. I couldn't be happier with her work!

26.description: Came here ON MOTHER'S DAY and was still able to get a beautiful bouquet. You have plenty to choose from and they were very quick! Looks like they do many arrangements. Would definitely come back.

27.description: Beautiful arrangements. Purchased bouquet for my sisters graduation, I showed them a picture of what I liked... My sister loved them! Also stopped by to get Mother's Day arrangement... Flowers were not your typical red...chose an orange color (not sure color name) - nevertheless...beautiful, fragrant and perfect bloom! Great price too :)

0.description: We chose Athena flowers for my father's funeral and were very pleased that we did. The service we received went above and beyond our expectations. The arrangement  was delivered on time and more beautiful than we could have imagined. Thank you again!

20.description: Amazing work!  I hate to say that when planning our wedding on October 12th, flowers were not my main priority.  I wanted something nice, but didn't want to splurge on flowers (we already did that on everything else!).  Gabby understood exactly what I was looking for and make some excellent recommendations for the bouquets and some floral arrangements.  I didn't expect what I saw when they arrived on the wedding day - just beautiful!!  I got so many compliments on the flowers and colors.  Prices are very reasonable and the service has been outstanding!!  Will recommend this shop to whoever is looking.  Thanks!!

19.description: GORGEOUS,UNIQUE & AFFORDABLEI am very particular (others might say difficult!) about certain things. Flowers are one of those things. Before becoming an Athena lifelong flower-power groupie, my previous florist and I celebrated 10 dewy years together. I informed my closest that if they were going to buy me flowers....it HAD to come from my florist and no other. No one could sway me. But one very courageous friend arrived one day with this big, bold array of the most gorgeous and fragrant flowers I'd ever received. Well done my florist,  I said aloud. To which it was revealed that these beauties came from Athena's!!!!!Owner Gabrielle won me over with the quality and selection and has kept me estatic with her knowledge, expertise and commitment to excellence.I sent my mother Gardenias (not the hardiest of flowers) and was amazed by the creamy color and sweet bouquet AND how long they lasted. I ALWAYS send those important to me some of her roses. From blushing apricot to dreamy lavendar to rich crimson.......her roses are exquisite AND LAST FOREVER. Her mixed arrangements brighten any situation with their saturated color. When a relative died, Athena's handled the flowers. Not only were the mourners commenting on their beauty, I knew things would work out smoothly. I knew the owner was keen to my needs during this sensitive time and would make things seamless so as not to cause me worry.I really wish I knew about Athena's back when I got married. Both Gabrielle and Evelina are always so patient and helpful....I always end up with the perfect arrangement.Yup. I'm a goner.

33.description: I purchased my daughter's wedding flowers here.  They were beautiful beyond my expectations!  They were absolutely perfect.  The bouquets, boutinners and corsages were very nicely done and fresh, not too big or too fussy, just right.  When it came to table arrangements and venue decorations I was very unsure what to order.  The owner worked with me and my daughter to help us figure out what we really wanted.  She even did some samples for us to be sure.  I was very concerned that the arch not be overdone.  She did it just right.  Just some simple orchids and greens tied with ribbon to the arch dressed it up just enough.  For the main entrance arrangement she recommended large cylinders filled with water and orchids, with lights on the bottom and floating candles on top.  They were very beautiful, dramatic, and perfect for the site.  Finally the table arrangements were made to the bride's specifications perfectly.  I even brought one home with me and I just can't stop admiring it!  They made sure we were aware of the pricing, and recommended alternatives to the highest priced flowers. I would recommend Athena to anyone.  They were wonderful to work with, and right on time as promised.

2.description: I can't say enough good things about Athena flowers! I found this gem on Yelp and I'm so happy I did. Gabriella was awesome to work with from bridal bouquets to centerpieces, she absolutely exceeded our expectations! She worked with us to stay within our budget and listened to our every need. I was looking for a specific coral colored rose for my bridesmaid bouquets and she shopped around until she found the perfect one! Our arrangements were gorgeous and we received so many compliments from our guests. Thank you Gabby for your beautiful and professional work!

34.description: I love this shop! They make beautiful arrangements that always impress whoever you are giving them to. So much better than going to Jewel!!!! Their prices are very good and they will help you design something special if you don't know much about flowers. The last arrangement I got came in a reusable vase that you can fill with all sorts of things like candy, ribbons, money, whatever. My aunt was really happy with it! Sometimes I go in for a few flowers just for myself and it really brightens my home and my day. If you want to make yourself or someone else happy, go buy some flowers from here!

32.description: We ended up choosing Athena Flowers to do all the flowers for our dream downtown wedding last September.  I can't stress enough on how happy I am to work with Ewelina!!I am one of those really picky brides in that I do a TON of research before finalizing my selection and signing the contract. Prior to going here, I went to a number of top Chicago event designers (e.g. Kehoe, Yanni's) and floral shops (e.g. Fleur).  I had specific visions of how I wanted the arrangements to be and originally felt all these places would be able to provide the level of quality and design I expected.  I was astounded by the quotes I got, main difference was the labor cost but there were differences in the flower markups as well.After fretting about who to go with, I remembered how some of my girlfriends had Ewelina at Athena Flowers do their weddings.  I made a last ditch call to her and came in to see if she could carry out my vision.  Not only did she do it, but she exceeded my expectations with the quality and design of the actual arrangements, bouquets, boutonnieres and most importantly the final quote.  To keep labor costs down you just need to return the vases to the shop within the week (this was not a problem).  It was a no-brainer to go with Athena Flowers.Ewelina is wonderful to work with and the shop owner is so sweet.  I felt really comfortable at the shop.  I came in twice, once for the initial consultation and the second to see table arrangement samples of what I wanted and to make modifications.  In between the visits to the big day, we also communicated through email and phone to finalize the exact colors (I had 2 primary and 1 secondary colors), flowers, and all those little design details.  Ewelina provided great design and cost savings ideas.  She was very responsive and professional.On the day of my wedding, I was at ease and did not have to even think about the flowers.  The owner delivered all bouquets and boutonnieres to my house in the burbs early that morning where we had a traditional home ceremony.  When we got to the church near downtown, everything was already arranged beautifully.  At the hotel reception, again everything was arranged beautifully and finished before we got there.  The only thing I regret is not putting more thought into how I wanted my card & gift table arrangements to be (my fault totally) only because the other arrangements turned out so elegantly beautiful and elaborate.I highly recommend Athena Flowers.  Ewelina is an asset to the shop and is fantastic to work with.  I will use them again for other major events.

18.description: I went in to Athena's on the Friday before mothers day to place an order for pickup. I ordered them for my brother who wanted to spend $100 on a bouquet. When I saw the bouquet on Sunday, I was extremely disappointed. It looked like a $60 dollar bouquet. Of course, they added a vase, which I could have mentioned not to. They probably charged $15 for that. For $100, I received only 8 roses, like really, you couldn't just do 6 or 12? I feel like they really cheaped out on it. Plus, the placements were off, like most roses on one side with a single one stuck side by side with a lily. The lilies were closed, when I requested them to be open. I gave them lots of request and told them that I trust them to make something awesome. Lesson learned, be specific, even if you think you already are. I could have added "one sided bouquet, no vase, 12 roses".

13.description: Athena Flowers totally exceeded my expectations. I needed a corsage for my daughter for a daddy/daughter dance. Of course, I waited until the last minute to order it. I first called another florist who said it was not going to be possible to find anyone who could do it on such short notice because nobody would be able to get the flowers needed for it. Well, the girl at Athena said it was no problem at all. She made a beautiful corsage in the perfect size for a little girl. I was so grateful because it was my daughter's very first corsage and she loved it! Thank you for making a lovely event that much more special!

4.description: Thank you so much for our beautiful wedding flowers! They lasted all day, it's 6 days later and they're still beautiful!

24.description: We ordered our wedding flowers (orchids) from here back in 2010 and have been customers ever since. Everything the owner (Gabriela) has put together for us - from corsages to birthday bouquets to a firefighter memorial bouquet - has been breathtaking. Her husband and employees are courteous and hardworking. She has accommodated us last-minute on multiple occasions. Her beautiful storefront keeps the community positive during the unstable economy. We only hope her business grows more during the years ahead. There are florists all over the city, but you won't go anywhere else after your experience with Athena's.

6.description: Gabriella does magic with flowers. They are 5stars for a reason. And now i know why.She has word of honor. Patient. Understanding. Punctual.Whatever you are paying, surely its not for the flowers. Coz flowers can be bought everywhere.My money went to her passion.It seems like its all she does.Try and see for yourselves!

22.description: For our wedding on September 1, 2013, we worked with Evelyn on our bridal party flowers (bouquets, bouts, corsages, etc.). We came in to discuss and show her what we wanted, and she worked hard to come up with pretty and elegant flowers that fit into our budget and our vision. She didn't try change what I wanted, and had very good suggestions for how to keep our costs down.  In the end, I got beautiful flowers that everyone complimented on, stayed in budget, and looked like I spent a lot more.  I would not hesitate to use Athena Flowers for all our floral needs.  My bridal bouquet still looks almost as fresh as the day of the wedding and it's now 3 days later!!!

15.description: For our wedding on September 1, 2013, we worked with Evelyn on our bridal party flowers (bouquets, bouts, corsages, etc.). We came in to discuss and show her what we wanted, and she worked hard to come up with pretty and elegant flowers that fit into our budget and our vision. She didn't try change what I wanted, and had very good suggestions for how to keep our costs down.  In the end, I got beautiful flowers that everyone complimented on, stayed in budget, and looked like I spent a lot more.  I would not hesitate to use Athena Flowers for all our floral needs.  My bridal bouquet still looks almost as fresh as the day of the wedding and it's now 3 days later!!!

7.description: Just had my wedding this weekend and I gave Gabriella no direction really I just said I want this flower...and fall colors. My bouquet was amazing everyone kept commenting on my flowers and my bridesmaids  flowers.. She was very helpful and def reasonable prices! I highly recommend

8.description: I moved to the neighborhood not long ago and I always drive by. Wanted to get flowers deliver on a Sunday Morning and I stopped by Athena just to check, but expecting a no as an answer since it was a Sunday. Not only she said yes, but she delivered a gorgeous bucket of red roses for a very VERY reasonable price. Amazing service, great customer service. Extremely happy, I will definitely use them again! Thank you!

30.description: I am so absolutely thrilled that I chose Athena Flowers as my wedding florist. From the initial contact until the big day, Gabby was so sweet and helpful.  At the initial meeting, I told her what I had envisioned for the bouquets, receptions, ceremony mass, etc., and Gabby gave me a ton of options and ideas that I would have never came up with on my own. Her prices were also unbeatable.  I went to a few flower shops before visiting Athena Flowers, and Athena Flowers' prices were by far the most reasonable for the quality. On the day before the wedding, I had completely forgotten to order a unity candle and almost completely panicked.  I called up Gabby and she came to the rescue. She assured me that I didn't have to worry. On the day of the wedding, I had a beautiful unity candle waiting for me at the altar (along with my sweet groom :-) She also arranged to have the Unity candle in a beautiful holder surrounded by gorgeous flowers. She told me later she purposely put together the flowers around a holder she made so that I wouldn't be charged an outrageous amount for a standard unity candle holder. Also, on the morning of the wedding, she called my maid of honor and said she had extra hydrangeas she thought would look great in my centerpieces  and asked if I wanted them.  I love hydrangeas and said "absolutely," and am so very glad I did. The hydrangeas made the centerpiece really pop.  My wedding party's flowers also looked amazing and better than I had imagined.  All of their flowers were fresh and stunning. Athena Flowers was definitely one of the easiest and the best vendors I had for my wedding day. Gabby definitely knows her flowers and is very passionate about making her clients' special day look stunning. Thank you Gabby and Athena Flowers for making my special day so beautiful!

3.description: I'm so happy I stepped foot into this place. It's a family ran business and the employees are super sweet. You tell them a price range, what you're looking for, and the color scheme and they will build you the most beautiful bouquets ever!  The worker was so passionate and knowledgeable about her flowers! She even let me keep an old hydrangea that they were going to toss. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to spoil themselves or loved ones with some quality, hand crafted bouquets.

14.description: Love this place! They are accommodating, understanding, kind, polite, punctual...I cant say enough about this place. The flowers came on the 9th of October and today are as fresh as the day they came. Thanks Athena's Flowers for all you did and how special your arrangement made my Mom and Dads 60th wedding anniversary!!

3.description: My husband and I have purchased three bikes and a bike trailer from 21st Century and that's where we go for every tune up, new tire, you name it. Joe is a Chicago fire fighter, so we felt very comfortable with his advice to go for a trailer for our two-year-old as opposed to a bike seat. It's a great family-run shop with lots of biking and skateboard supplies- tell Joe the Slaters say hello!

1.description: Store closed. :-(

2.description: Seems like a decent bike shop. I myself though skateboard and have been for 10 years now. Went to this place to check out some things for a new board set up and they were way to pricey!         I know that there is a lot of little kids in that area that most likely get their parents to buy them skateboards n other things. So being overpriced doesn't stop them from buying it for their kids. Especially if the parents don't have a clue that it's overpriced.   If anyone in that area needs skateboard parts or anything skateboard related, go to Uprise. That is by far the best skateboard shop in Chicago.

0.description: I've been going here for a little while now.  Cheapest place I know for inner tubes and small parts and the like.  I repair my own bike, so I'm not really sure how their prices compare to other places on that kind of stuff, but otherwise, they're very kind, knowledgeable and for the right price too.

4.5 starsI wasn't expecting much.  Can't really describe the inside other than it was in need of updating and could use a little dusting.  Other than that, I was surprised how much I liked this place.  The patrons (which seemed like they were there quite often) and the cute Polish barmaid Monica were really nice and asked if I worked/lived in the area, which was a good icebreaker.  They had the same stuff you'd find in any cafe plus sandwiches, pizza, and some homemade ice cream.  The dessert sounded too good to pass up so I got 2 scoops of hazelnut along with my cappuccino.  I absolutely loved the ice cream and it definitely didn't taste like it came out of an Eddy's container.  Both came to $6.  I'd love to come back if ever in the area.  Cash only

3.description: Came in and they fixed my no chip!

1.description: *HAPPY NAILS ON AUSTIN/ADDISON in the DUNKIN DONUTS plaza*I first came here to get acrylic overlay with no chip on top.  My first impression was awesome, so much so that I referred tons of my other friends...BUT - (and anyone who knows me knows that rarely do I give bad reviews on places, but this has to be told.)It was the day before Thanksgiving and sure it was busy at 10am.  I ended up coming in to get my no chip removed and a manicure and brought both of my daughters in.  We waited over 30 minutes, which I was totally fine with considering it was the day before Thanksgiving.  The manager (the one with the earpiece in his ear) had one of the guys put the aluminum on my nails to soak off my acrylic.  Then all of us were ready to get our nails done.  My younger daughter was getting a fill in and my other a fullset.  The owner was about to start on my nails but then started filing them with the machine and assumed I was getting a no chip, when I told him I was not, he seemed agitated because he doesnt do manicures and had some girl do my nails, mind you he didnt even know her name and called her honey, whats your name? do her nails, they were absolutely MEAN to this new girl and gave her no direction whatever so much that she was shaking doing my nails because of how poorly he mistreated her.Fast forward....The fullset one was done by one of the other guys which came out great.It wasnt even 10 minutes and my other daughter was at the drying table already which I found odd.My manicure was average, nothing to rave about.When I got to the drying table to see my daughter's nails she was upset because she felt that she was being rushed and when I saw her nails, you can see the evidence that it was rushed.  Now the fact that her nails looked like crap wasnt the issue, it was the "manager's" response that totally was unprofessional and was surely far from client-centric.  I asked him to please come look at my daughter's nails when he finished with his current client.  He came to look at her nails and his remedy was to put a 2nd coat of nailpolish.  Unfortunately, that is not the solution considering you can see all the deep ridges from over filing, etc.  When he tried to suggest that, my daughter (being a teenager) said no its not a nail polish issue you just didnt do it correctly.  His response (with raised voice) " I fix, you stop talking to much!"He was upset because we asked to have it corrected in front of lots of people and when my other daughter suggested that we dont pay for that $12 service since it looked terrible, he then yelled and said to her that she can never come back in his store.  There were lots of people and it was defintely a poor PR move.  If you look at the work that was done horribly, accept it humbly and fix it and we would have never been in this position.  But no instead he chose to barade us in front of people.  It was by the grace of God that I didnt respond, because I chose to not stoop to his level.  His behavior was juvenile and to refuse to go somewhere where you feel bullied to not want to speak up if you were unhappy with a service.The pictures will speak for itself... see below.  I would hate for anyone to encounter this type of service.  Whatever happened to the customer is always right?

2.description: So far I love this nail shop. It's so close to my house. I actual ran into the shop by accident because my sisters wanted their nails done so we happened to stop in. LOVE'd it and LOVE'd how many colors they have ! They have no chip color match in a original nail color. The colors are endless! I went in for a pedi (the sugar scrub is amazing) & full set when they first opened at 11. & they knocked out my full set and pedi in one and than moved over to the chair for my color! I was out in less an 1 hour there job on nails has not disappointed me thus far. I recommend this shop to anyone around the area (:

5.description: This is my new place for no chip and pedi's. I extremely happy with the service I receive here. The pedi is amazing, they take their time and the massage is the best I ever had. They apply a sugar scrub on your legs and feet also! Thank you Happy Nails. I'm HAPPY!

6.description: Overall a very odd first experience- definitely more cons than pros and almost all concern cleanliness and health safety. I walked into happy nails on a whim for a pedicure. The place itself is fairly small and parking is tight in the lot out front. My nail technician seemed to do a mediocre job- he was focused and concerned with my comfort. Everything up to the painting went well, however the painting was pretty terrible and the whole thing only cost $18.... Which is not nearly enough. I saw that all pedicure bowls were quickly sprayed with scrubbing bubbles, rinsed down, and walked away from post pedicure. I can guarantee that is not proper procedure. I encountered several fruit flies throughout my visit, and I imagine that also indicates lack of cleanliness somewhere. I don't know the rules of baking tools to kills germs, but the manicure and pedicure tools seemed to very rapidly go in and out of the autoclaves between uses. My nail tech also used a grating tool to remove skin from my feet and then brought the skin ridden tool off to the back somewhere. I genuinely hope and pray that is sterilized between uses. I was rooting for my immune system throughout the visit and will not return.

7.description: Went here yesterday in a whim. I love my reg. Nail salon in Jeff park, however they do not offer a no chip manicure option. We all use our hands a lot and I am no exception.So I was having to  get my nails done almost once a,week.Good for them,but ouch to my wallet.I was at tge Dunkin Donuts drive through and saw this lil shop :walk ins welcome/special 25$ for no chip. Guaranteed for 12 days.I had the time and mustered up the cash for tip.They do take cards for payment and you can also put the tip on there.It is a very small place,however they have 5 or six massage chairs for pedicures and 8 nail stations. They were friendly and professional. I was assigned Andy..he is a true artist! My nails look amazing and he did not rush.He gave me a wonderful hand massage after my nails were done. And before I left his station my nails were dry! I do not know if this is common ground with a no chip, this is my 1st experience having one done.I did scope out the pedicure Although I would not leave my reg. Technician, it was tempting. They really go at it at Happy Nails. Man the one woman giving her client a ped. Was amazing! She was not only cleaning up her feet, but she was massaging the heck out of them! I wanted to shout,Me next, me next!My experience there was a good one and the other clients seemed satisfied as well.

0.description: Came here on a whim with my sister and future SIL - two of us got no chips ($25) and one got a full gel set ($28)Even though they were fairly busy when we came in, we all got seen in a reasonable amount of time, and so did everyone else who came in after us. The nail technicians were all very nice. I do not know how/if they sterilize the equipment but everything looked clean. We are all very happy with how our nails turned out! I would recommend going here for the good service and great deal. I'll definitely be back!

4.description: Love getting my nails done at Happy Nails.  Staff is great, shop is clean and they have great prices!!!

29.description: In response to owner comment: I do not grasp how you can say that K&K "didn't do my alterations." I am certainly not making this up! True, ultimately I went elsewhere to achieve my end result; however, that was only following 3 failed appointments at K&K.Perhaps K&K and Kasia's bridal are technically "separate stores;" however, during my experience, they seemed awfully united; in fact,  If you look the two places up online, they are even listed under the same address and phone number! ....I apologize for assuming the two places were connected but certainly you can understand my confusion.

42.description: HORRIBLE! Do not waste your time at Kasia's. Incredibly disorganized and rude service. I am posting my email to Kathy aka "Kasia," the owner and pushy saleswoman at Kasia's, since it best describes our waste-of-time experience at Kasia's. As a side note, I still have NOT received any reply from Kasia's in regards to my message:"I am writing to let you know of my extreme disappointment and dismay at the experience that my friend and I had at Kasia's. We had our first appointment at Kasia's with you in August and my friend (the bride) did not find the dress she was looking for. She asked whether it would be possible to have a dress custom-made by Kasia's and you told us that it was possible and that we would simply need to bring in the design and a sample of the lace and satin we wanted to use. You suggested that we go to Vogue Fabrics or Fishman's Fabrics to look for the lace and satin and then to come back with the design and the fabric. We did just that and made an appointment for yesterday at 6 PM. We were runningearly, so we called and asked if it was okay if we came in about a  1/2 hour early- we were told that it was fine if we did so. We drove an hour to get to Kasia's and once we did, we found that you were still busy with another client. We felt as if you pawned us off on your mother while you took care of the other client. Your mother was obviously not very happy to be helping us and treated us in an incredibly condescending and rude manner. When we first arrived, you told us that the fabric was just not long enough, but you gave us no suggestions or other options; you just called over your mother and went over to the other client. Both of you made us feel as if we were at fault for not finding appropriate fabric and you gave us no suggestions in order to be able to have this dress made by you. Being that my friend and I have never had a custom dress made before, we were relying on your knowledge and experience to assist us in having it made. For example, I asked your mother approximately how much fabric we would need, as you had told us that once you had the fabric sample and design, you would be able to give us approximations on the price and fabric amounts. Unfortunately, your mother kept responding with a simple "I don't know." She said that the amount of fabric needed is different for everyone depending on the measurements, even though the bride was standing right in front of her!!! We finally just left with not even an "I'm sorry" from you oryour mother.The whole experience took no longer than 15 minutes, but was a colossal waste of time and left a bad taste in our mouths. We did not come to Kasia's to be belittled or treated in the degrading manner in which both you and your mother treated us. On your webpage, you state that your boutique is "dedicated to providing each and every one of its clients what every full service bridal salon should always offer...Excellent Customer Service, Timeliness, Superb Quality, and Value..." none of which, we received. It was obvious that you were too busy to deal with us, but in that case, you should not have booked us for an appointment, getting my friend's hopes up that she would be able to have the dress of her dreams made by you. Not only was the customer service poor, but the whole appointment-making process was incredibly difficult and disorganized. To say the least, we will not be recommending Kasia's Bridal to anyone and we plan on sharing our experience with our friend and others on Yelp."

23.description: I would not recommend this place to anyone. First let me say my wedding day was dramatically push forward by my husbands deployment. I was frantically looking for a dress I had about 4 months. I went here because I wanted to see about having a smile dress made. The women explained that this was there busiest season, and they weren't sure if  they could help me.  I found a dress that was not exactly what I wanted, but it was 200. I asked how much it would be to have the dress shortened, the lady told me 250 on top of the cost of the dress. Then I asked how much it would be to have the dress I wanted mad she said 300 plus the cost of fabric. I said the I would rather have the dress I want made then she said she didn't know and would have to call me. I knew then this women was full of CRAP! She never called me. Thats okay because I went to Victoria's Bridal 3738 West Fullerton Avenue, Chicago, IL 60647-2331 (773) 772-0972 She took excellent care of me. I would recommend if you have a spanish speaking friend to come with you, just to make sure everything is clear. She made my dress for $120 plus the cost of fabric, it came out to 160 flat! the dress looked exactly like the dress in the pic and she had the dress done 3 weeks before my wedding! she does AMAZING WORK WORTH THE PRICE!!!!!!!!!!!!forget this place it's a Joke!

47.description: I'm sad to see that Kasia's doesn't have an overall better rating. I agree with some that say it isn't fancy smancy and it is bare bones. But don't judge a book by its cover! She has a lot of dresses and they are WAY cheaper than you will find anywhere else. So use those arm muscles and starting lifting those heavy ass dresses around to find your perfect dress!I had been searching for my dress for a long time, I found it on a designers website and then in one bridal store that was outrageously priced. A lot of the stores didn't have it or if they did, it was pretty pricey.I called Kasia's and they didn't have it but could order it and gave me a super low price compared to everywhere else. Sold!I went in and the experience was great. Kasia and her mother were very nice and helpful. The dress came (and was perfect I might add! :0)) and they did the alterations for me at a discounted price because I bought the dress from them. I also got my bridesmaid's dresses and they all got a discount for ordering together. The ladies are fun and entertaining to be around, I don't understand others complaints. All in all, a wonderful experience! I think someone else said it best in their review, don't go bridezilla on people and you will always have a happier, nicer experience. No matter where you go. People don't like mean people and can only put up with so much. Surprise! :0) Another piece of wedding advice, RELAX. It's not the end of the world if a tiny detail goes haywire. Breath. Enjoy it, instead of stressing over it. That's what I did and I loved every minute of the planning and the day itself. Oh and don't let others freak you out! Remember that your awareness of everything is heightened and you could be extra sensitive to things. So don't let that little comment here or there get you down! So check out Kasia's with an open mind, a calm attitude, and a person who's opinion you trust, and I know you will find that "perfect dress" you've been waiting for.And you will live happily ever after.The end.:0)

8.description: --I'm going to make this a long review cause soon-to-be brides need to know what's up! Feel free to message me with any questions about this experience or others I had around Chicago.I had a great experience at Kasia's and finally pulled the trigger on a wedding gown. I can compare Kasia's to the following places where I had try-on appointments:1. David's Bridal2. Weddings 8263. Nordstrom4. Macy's5. Glamour Closet (walk-in)6. BhldnAs you can see, I got around town in a short amount of time, June-August 2014. By the time I made it to Kasia's I was exhausted, but had an idea of what would look good on me and what was attainable for my $1,000 budget. I'd called ahead looking for a certain Mori Lee dress which they had in stock. Making an appointment was easy, I called about 3 days ahead-almost all of the stores mentioned above required at least a 10-14 day wait. Advice: If you are a first-time bride and you want to bring your parents or friends and have "the experience" Kasia's should not be your first shop. For that, Weddings 826 and Bhldn had wonderful dressing rooms, champagne etc. I really enjoyed both. Macy's also provided a nice experience and a surprisingly good selection for my budget (but no pics allowed) and I highly recommend Elyssa as a consultant there.I feel like Kasia's should be around your 3rd stop, once you have an idea of what you want, at least as far as silhouette and you're ready to get down to the business of buying.I worked with Kasia's mom for the first 1/2 hour and she was really helpful. Even if she doesn't share your aesthetic, she is still a seamstress with decades of experience who can tell you what is fitting you well and what isn't. I didn't go to hear I looked pretty in everything (go to David's Bridal for that, totally meh) I went for an honest opinion. What I appreciated most was that once Kasia arrived and took over the appointment, I got basically the same opinion on the fit of my final two dresses as her mother had and some tips from Kasia that helped me make a decision. They were totally unbiased because both dresses were the same price. Even if the Mori Lee had been higher priced, I don't think they would have tried to talk me into it. They wanted me to pick the dress that flattered me most.After no pressure to buy, even though it was the end of the day for them, I felt like I was able to truly pick my dress on my own. I wound up in something totally different than what I'd gone in for! And my $1,000 budget? I came in $250 under thanks to fitting into the sample size, which was new and in pristine condition. And the best part is, you are dealing with the owner. She has the power to wheel and deal. Don't be afraid to ask her about discounts etc. Once I go back for my alternations in a few months, I'll probably update this rating to a 5.

31.description: In response to Kathy L:I'm not sure what your trying to imply by saying you don't have me in your book for an appointment - my appointment was in September so perhaps you need to go a little further back. I don't appreciate the insinuation though - I left a review to be helpful to other brides. I am certainly not making anything up and I am not confused about what store I was at. Since we are now clear on that, let me address the other points.The dresses in back may be kept in bags - none the less - they were dirty compared to the dresses I tried on in other salons. The dresses on the sale rack in the bridal area were in horrible condition and NONE were in bags. Many were expensive gowns at one point, but the fact that they were crammed into the racks and left there meant they had torn lace, dirt, and in some cases holes. I'm sorry but that is the absolute truth. Blue by Enzoani - Well yes, one of the reasons I decided to make an appointment at your shop was because I was specifically looking for dresses by this designer. However, since you take the designer labels off of the dresses and will not tell client the designer of the dresses they are trying on, and ALSO are not able to pull requests based on the designers style number because they are renumbered when entering the store - all that makes it very difficult to know what is being tried and what isn't. You may have had the dress I ended up purchasing at another boutique (an Enzoani dress in fact) but it never made it into my dressing room - and the 900$ dress that was my runner up never made it in for me to try on at your shop either.  So I can only conclude that either you did not have the dresses there, or the consultant helping me was not very good at pulling dresses.So - based on all the factors above I will again recommend that "brides to be" go elsewhere.

34.description: I've been really lucky in the process of wedding planning so far - I've gotten to work with some fantastic vendors!  Kathy of Kasia's Bridal is a delight, and I had a great time trying on dresses at her store.We called about 2.5 weeks beforehand to get an appointment.  It's waaaaaaaaay out west on Irving Park, so we hopped in the car and headed out.  (Irving bus goes out there too.)  Once we arrived, we were given a book of dresses and instructed to flag the ones I wanted to try on.  We were also given mimosas, which was a nice touch!The staff here was a well-oiled machine - one gal helped me into and out of the dresses, and another was on standby to wrap up or unwrap the next dress.  And everybody was friendly and helpful - no high pressure sales tactics here.  When they saw I didn't like something, they moved onto the next one, no questions asked.  The best part?  I'm a plus-sized gal, and they had samples in lots of different sizes I could try on.  I've heard so many horror stories about gals going to bridal shops and being told to "imagine how the dress looks on you" or, even worse, having it pinned to your underwear to "give you an idea of how it will look on you".  YUCK.  You'll find none of that at Kasia's.  I tried on lots of dresses, and found the dress I'll be wearing in my wedding!It's not super-fancy, so if you're looking for the whole "I'm a princess" experience, this probably isn't your store.  But if you want great dresses, great prices, and great service, check out Kasia's.

16.description: Absolutely LOVE this place!! Kathy was amazing and made me and my sister feel comfortable buying my bridesmaid dress. We even talked about our love for food!!! Amazing place, extremely beautiful dresses and great customer service. Highly recommended!!!!

13.description: During the process of buying/ordering my wedding gown I visited the shop three times. Every time I came to the shop I made an appointment in advance and every time we had to wait at least 15 minutes, which is not terrible, but a little frustrating. At our first visit, when I picked "the one," my mom started to take a picture of me in it and we were yelled at. From reading reviews before coming to the shop, I knew this might be a problem, but we explained that we were about to go pay for the dress and just wanted a picture in it and were still told that we couldn't, which seemed a bit silly since we were about to drop a lot of money on something we weren't going to see for months. At my first appointment, the owner had a personal emergency and couldn't be there so I was told I needed to come back to get measurements taken, etc. So I returned a few days later with the shoes I was going to wear for my wedding day. The owner took the appropriate measurements, and convinced me to get a custom length (at not additional charge) even though I told her I felt the length was perfect. She also told me I was in between sizes and I said that I planned to lose weight for the wedding, so I felt going with the smaller size would make sense and she cautioned me against it, but ultimately agreed.When my dress finally came in nearly 7 months after ordering and about a month before the wedding (and the only reason I got it then was because I called the shop to check in... no one had called me yet) it was a disaster. I had already decided to get alterations elsewhere because of my frustration with the disorganization of the shop, and I'm glad that I did. My dress came in about 3 inches too long (despite wearing the exact shoes I wore when she took my measurements) and about two sizes too big... I did lose weight, but only about 5 pounds which certainly does not justify a two (and a half) size discrepancy. Before leaving, I was talked into purchasing a bustier and slip for about $200 that my seamstress later told me I didn't need... but of course, no return on undergarments...I am very thankful to have bought such a lovely dress from Kasia's and was very happy to support a local business instead of buying a generic dress from a big corporation. The main reason I went there was because after calling around about a particular dress, they seemed to have the most fair prices in the area. But it seems that they are currently too overwhelmed to provide good customer service.

11.description: I did not have some of the experiences that others had when I visited the shop. I did not buy my wedding dress here, but I they did carry the bridesmaids dress that I really liked. The store itself is really low key and may seem a little cluttered, but they carried a lot of the styles I was looking at. Kasia was pretty helpful throughout the order process and for alterations on gowns not even ordered through their store.My mother even found a fantastic gown that she wore to my brother's wedding and she looked fabulous after the alterations were done.Kasia was actually helpful with alterations to my brother's wedding that was in the same year. Not to mention that they helped out my sister in a pinch with regards to the alterations that she needed for my wedding.

39.description: I had a really great experience at Kasia's.  The service and dress selection were both really great in my opinion.  I didn't end up buying a dress from here, but I had two really strong contenders.I arrived a full half hour early for my appointment, and, despite being busy, I was quickly taken into the bridal salon area and given their book of dreses to choose from.  You get to flip through a book that has pictures of each dress and price.  You flag all the dresses you like and then the staff brings them into the showroom for you to try on.  Additionally, they have an extensive selection of sample dresses you can buy off the rack.I am surprised to hear people say they were rushed.  I spent 2.5 hours here and tried on easily 3 dozen dresses.  The staff was attentive and helpful without being overly involved.  They asked good questions so I could understand what I liked and didn't.  At no point did I feel like they were rushing me or wanted me to leave.I would definitely put this on your list if you are looking for a bridal gown.

37.description: I came here during the sample sale and it was pure chaos!  I was worried about coming there by myself because both my mom and my friend who I was wedding dress shopping with were busy.  However, I had both a consultant and Kathy to help me try on dresses, and Kathy's mom walking around answering alterations questions.  They had a great selection of samples, so I can't imagine what their whole selection is like.  I also tried on a sample of Kathy's work and it was incredible.  I came in looking for specific styles of Demetrios dresses, which they don't carry, so I was a bit disappointed.  However, the prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly, so thumbs up from me.

0.description: I went into Kasia's Bridal after a very disappointing trip to David's Bridal. I was sad and defeated when I walked in, but Kathy turned that all around. She immediately reassured me that I would find a dress that was right for me and she was going to do everything she could to help me. She gave me some privacy as I looked through the books. After I flagged multiple dresses, she looked through them and asked if she could also give me some suggestions based on what I picked. She let me try on every single dress I liked and gave me her honest feedback when I asked for it. Her suggestions were spot on and beautiful. She was very willing to work within my budget, as well. I didn't feel pressured to try on items outside of my budget and, when I did try something outside my budget, she made me aware of it before I even put on the dress. Kathy was so understanding when I told her I needed some time to think about the dresses I tried on before I could make a final decision. The whole experience was stress-free and fun. The selection in the store was great, as well! I highly recommend you stopping by to try on some dresses-- It was a fantastic experience!

38.description: Kasia's is definitely a no-frills type of bridal boutique, but they do have a wide range of dresses at various price points.  I went in for a one-hour appointment and tried on maybe 15 dresses.  Unfortunately, none of them were "the one," but the sales associate was very sweet and all in all the experience was pleasant.  My biggest issue with Kasia's is that they take off the designer's labels from the inside of the dresses and replace them with their own product numbers (which is perfectly legal), but it just makes it difficult to really remember what you thought of a particular dress once you're back home when you aren't permitted to take pictures in the store, and you can't even look for pictures of the dress online because you don't know who the designer is.ETA:  Kathy's comment below is correct in that many of their dresses are originals, and they would therefore not have a designer label or be viewable online.  However, they do still carry a number of designer dresses, which is what brought me into the store in the first place, and it was disappointing to leave without knowing the designer or style number of the dresses I liked best.

27.description: ok! so my third and last review! Flash forward to NOW and I have JUST taken home my wedding dress! But not only did I do all my wedding dress buying and fittings here, Kasia also took care of my bridesmaids' dresses, flower girl dresses, AND Mother of the Bride dress. If i had had any qualms with the service or products in this shop, believe me, I would have never kept coming back.The one thing I wish I was able to get through kasia's but I didn't, was jewelry. Unfortunately I have gotten wedding jewelry as a gift, so I could not take full advantage of all the beautiful jewelry that Kasia has made herself. if YOU have the opportunity to do-so, do it!p.s. - Agatha of course still remembers me, and has been so accommodating to me for the past year, from beginning to end! What a great experience to go through with all the wedding planning! I am truly going to miss doing business with them!

32.description: I made an appointment to come in just after Christmas while my folks were in town. They said they were booked solid but we had the bridal half all to ourselves so they might only see 1 bride at a time.They had a big selection of the dresses I was interested in and after trying on at least a dozen I found one for me. The price was right and of the ones i saw in their books the median price is 1200.Agatha was a huge help though very quiet. She had a good eye for making more suggestions on other dresses to try. I'd recommend it as a low key place for a bride who is a little nervous about the pressure of dress shopping. if you watch a lot of "say yes to the dress" you might end up disappointed.

48.description: For anyone shopping for a wedding dress, this is not the movie-like experience in which you're standing in a beautiful bridal boutique on a lovely pedestal with a slick sales attendant in a designer suit oooh-ing and aaah-ing over your beauty in the dress of your dreams.  This is a bare bones, no-frills bridal shop.  I was glad that I got to have the princess experience elsewhere but happier than punch that I purchased my dress here.  For anyone looking for a very high-end designer dress, this is not the place for you either.  That being said, I highly highly recommend checking this place out.  Kathy (Kasia in Polish) has an excellent selection of bridal dresses, bridesmaid dresses, and other special occasion dresses at awesome prices.  I got my wedding dress for about $600 less than what I almost paid for it elsewhere.  My wonderful parents who so sweetly bough my dress were happy for the savings!  And my bridesmaids each saved close to $100 on their dresses.  They also sold me the perfect foundation undergarment at a great price... I couldn't find something that worked as well anywhere else (although it was admittedly not super pretty/sexy).  My dress came in right on time, and so did my bridesmaids'.  Kathy is very sweet and down-to-earth.  If you are kind and respectful and don't go Bridezilla on her, she'll treat you like the princess bride that you are and make you feel like an old friend.  I really enjoyed working with her and patronizing her small, family-run business.  Her mom Grace did my alterations and did a fine job at a great price, although I like my usual tailor better (see my other reviews).  It can be slightly hard to communicate w/ Grace because her accent is so strong, but Kathy will help you out if needed. Kasia's carries many major lines including Watters, La Sposa, Jasmine, Casablanca, etc.  You will not find your very high-end dresses here but for an excellent selection of dresses at unbeatable prices, you should absolutely go here!

44.description: I saw an AD in the Red Eye advertising a sale at Kasia's. I figured what the heck, I'll check it out and get an idea what I might like before going with my mom and friends. When you walk in it's not a glam place but the sales girls are so friendly and helpful and seem very genuine - not pushy at all. I saw two that I liked (my size 2-4 was pretty picked over) and tried them on. Second dress on and I was sold! It was elegant and perfect and a BARGAIN. I tried talking myself out of it since this was not the way I wanted to do it, but I could not pass up the dress. If you are a bride on a budget go here. I have since tried on dresses at other stores and have not found one that I liked and not to mention they were all hundreds of dollars more. I am very happy with my purchase. Kasia's is diamond in the ruff.

24.description: The only thing I would really say about this place is: reasonable yet awkward. I think that would pretty much sum up my experience here. I think this is a great place to go if you really know exactly what kind of dress you want or the style you look good in. I would say that the suggestions they gave me (as I had requested) were somewhat unfitting of my taste. I had tagged a whole bunch that I didn't even get to try on and received no explanation as to why not. The customer service is just plain awkward. I received no robe, no slip nothing. I was practically standing there in my underwear facing this women I did not know while she was so obviously looking away making me feel like very insecure about my body.I will say, however, that Agatha is very patient and tried very hard to be helpful but I think at the end I wasn't feel like the Salon had a whole lot to offer that wasn't available somewhere else for a better atmosphere and perhaps more comfortable situations.

7.description: Meh, I guess its ok but not my type of experience.I came her a bridesmaid dress. My cousin picked this place and we were to order dresses from here. For me this place is extremely expensive. $200 for a small short bridal dress and that DOES NOT INCLUDE alternations.Kasia's  bridal has two store fronts that are not next to each other and has only one fitting room. One of the store fronts is the dress showroom and the other is a small measuring/inventory/sale space.I was just confused by the whole experience. After I tried the dress on and we decided that it was the bridesmaid dress, there was very little help and after a while of standing there I found out that I am to get dressed in regular clothes and go two store fronts down and I will be measured there. But I get measured in my regular clothes and not in the dress. I really hope that I will not have any major issues with this store but I am a little worried.  I really want my cousin's wedding to go as smoothly as possible and I hope that everything will go well in my future dealings with this boutique in few months when the dress is to arrive.

49.description: Ordered my dress and will end up saving between $500-600 from what it would have cost me elsewhere.  You're bridesmaids will get a discount if you order yours and their dresses here.  Kathy is super nice and even though she has tons of brides & probably doesn't remember me right away talks to me like she we're old friends every time.  So far no problems.  Can't wait to get the dress in a few months!  Will update once I get the dress.Dress is in & on time, just need to get the shoes to get it altered.  I also ordered my flower girl dress there. Once all is done I'll do one last udpate.Update-the wedding is done and everything went off without a hitch.  No problems with my dress or the flower girl dress they both looked amazing and we received so many compliments.  I would highly suggest going to Kaisha for your wedding dress, it was so affordable and I was so happy with how it turned out!

40.description: I will have to say I disagree with negative reviews. I went there the day after Christmas. I brought my entourage with me and we went through dresses. Now I am a plus size bride so I dreaded the experience. I had been to Macy's Salon and got horrible service just browsing. This store prides it self on one on one service and it is smaller than a big chain but not cramped. There was plenty of place to sit even for myself with 4 people and another bride and her entourage. Kathy was super helpful as well as her mother. Oh did I mention not only am I a plus bride I am only 5 feet tall. So they gave me their honest opinions on the dress and advice on the alterations. I narrowed my search to 2 dresses came back the next day with my mom. Never once feeling pressured to buy that minute. Then came back again a week later with my dad and step mom I purchased the dress in full. I was not charged for a gown back it was complimentary. We were so happy with the service we are looking at dresses for the entire wedding party as well as the mothers. I look forward to getting my dress and until then I hope you think about Kasia's Bridal and consider then greatly when looking for that perfect dress.

30.description: I was a bridesmaid for my friends wedding, and she bought and had the dresses altered here.  They had a nice selection of plus sized inventory.  The prices of the dresses were reasonable, and everything seemed like it would go according to plan....That is, until it was alterations time!  The date of the wedding was getting dangerously close, and I had already come in twice to no avail.  Kasia's mother, the person who does the alterations, was not making the dress fit like a glove, like it's supposed to :(  I tried to be nice, but with the wedding date so close, I had to put on some pressure.  Kasia and her mother do NOT respond well to pressure.  They started bickering/arguing with me, and then had the gall to worry the bride by telling her about my fitting problem when she called to check in.  My friend the bride also told me Kasia's mom made some nasty remakars about me as well :(  So much for professionalism and customer service.  Bottom line is, the dresses are ok for a reasonable price and it is a no frills shop, so don't expect anything fancy or special.  However, if you MUST, please just buy the dress and take it to a good place to have your alterations.  Personally, I would never come back or recommend this place based on how rudely they treated me, the other bridesmaids, and how they worried the bride on what was supposed to be a special/fun time in her life.  Kasia will be sweet until you contradict her, or something goes wrong, then she turns petty and starts to attack you (See Kasia's comments to a Yelper's review below).  As a business owner myself, I know this is NOT the way to keep customers returning.

46.description: I did not get my dress from Kasia's.  To be fair, I didn't get it from any store, I had it custom made.  I made an appointment to Kasia's about 8 months prior to my wedding, which was in December.  The selection of dresses was huge and the prices were much more reasonable than House of Brides.  However, I found their sales tactics to be really pushy.  I sort of liked one dress, (sort of), and they tried to push me into buying it that day by threatening me with the omnious deadline of the wedding.  All  All in all, I found the entire wedding dress shopping really ridiculous....so I found an amazing dress maker who made the dress if my dreams for slightly less (labor, fabric, and imported european lace) than what I would have paid retail.

1.description: So disappointed. My cousin had her wedding dress and all 6 bridesmaids dresses made here and the mother of the brides dress as well. She is a very small girl, who did not need a dress 3 sizes too big, was directed to order it that way and paid for the extra material she told them she would not need! The owner is not very involved and not very friendly.. She seems interested and involved before payments and signatures are taken and after, she has little to no involvement..  My cousins dress did not come in when we were told it would arrive, more like a month later! Which left her scrambling and not able to add the pink frill she wanted at the bottom of her dress before her big day!  I was the maid of honor, and our dresses were chosen to be worn again. I did NOT have that option!!! My dress size was ordered in another bridesmaids size and with the wedding being so close I could not have my proper size reordered. I had to take it to another seamstress for her to do what she could, and even then, the center buttons down the back to my one shouldered black lace dress was 2 inches to the right, there was nothing she could do.. Very uncomfortable.My aunts dress was specifically chosen from swatches Grace gave her to choose from in a deep purple, and her dress came in a cranberry. She ended up being forced to buy the incorrect dress, wore that for the rehearsal dinner, and went to Carson's and found a dress for the actual wedding.... IN PURPLE!!! The other bridesmaids dresses were a disaster as well. One being ordered in the completely wrong style and the other ladies were charged over $200 for their alterations. Just ridiculous!  Oh, and not to mention the brides dress came with a $200 accessory- when my cousin chose a birdcage veil, that ended up being $210 with taxes, kasia so nicely let her know she would take care of the difference.. Like all the damage already done to the dresses and mother of the brides dress wasn't enough, she had to act like she did them a favor?  UNPROFESSIONAL!  I'd rather pay out the extra money then have a headache like that ever again... And I was just the Maid Of Honor!!!  Please ladies be aware before doing any business with this small failing company. I hated seeing my cousin cry over what should have been her biggest day of her life, over the mistakes professionals shouldn't have made to begin with.

9.description: I was very excited to go to Kasia's for my bridal appointment because it seemed like a wonderful independent boutique and when I called to schedule an appointment they were so warm and friendly over the phone.Unfortunately, I was very disappointed in my overall experience. Mainly because of 3 of their store policies:1) No designers - I understand that it must be very competitive in the bridal gown industry. The reason I went to Kasia's is because they came up in an online search for where to buy a certain designer that I really liked from pictures online. I was completely confused when the consultant refused to tell me what designers made the dresses that I was trying on. At first I thought she didn't know, then at the end of the appointment when I asked the final time she said that she wasn't allowed to tell me the designer. 2) No clamps - sample dresses will almost never fit a person just right as is and need to be altered. Every single other salon that I went to provided industrial clamps to give me the idea of how the dress would look when it was fitted to my shape. Kasia's however refuses to clamp the dresses because it "damages the samples". This was very irritating during my appointment because the consultant had to keep running around behind me pulling at the dress to show me how it would fit. This prevented me from being able to move freely in the dress and get comfortable in it. I could not envision walking down the aisle in any dress with the consultant trailing awkwardly behind me.3) No pictures - I know this is done at a few other salons as well, but it still a big complaint for me. I remember really liking a couple dresses I tried on at Kasia's, but since I tried on more dresses at another salon after my appointment here, now I can't even recall what the dresses at Kasia's looked like. Due to reason #1 above, I also could not look up the dresses online to see if I should go back and give them another try. In the wise words of one of my bridesmaids, "buying a wedding dress should be like buying a car". There are many dealerships that a person could go to, and it is the sales persons job to sell you the car, not make it feel like the car is a secret make and model and prevent the buyer from shopping around at other places. I prefer to make my large purchasing decisions based on the quality of service and care I receive throughout my decision making process, not the pressure the business puts on me in the moment.Kasia's is really a nice boutique with kind people. In my humble opinion, a small adjustment in policies to lay-off the pressure and add more of the personal touch to the dress shopping experience would take this salon a long way.

26.description: I would never go here again or recommend this place to anyone.I was a bridesmaid in my friend's wedding and we decided to get our dresses here.  We tried on the one that we liked, they wrote the number or whatever code they have down and we left.  My friend, the bride, requested they send her this style number so we could look it up, but they refused-they sent her a picture of the dress and it was not the same thing!  We told them that and I even went back to the shop and tried on the dress we had picked out and they assured me it was the same.  The dress we tried on and liked was straight and very fitting.  The dress we ended up getting was a full on A-line and made us all look like mammoth blimps.  Strike one.The shop itself is pretty unprofessional.  The dressing rooms are just little sectioned off areas with a sheet blocking it and the women that work there are like dress nazi's on patrol-they had a fit when we tried to take pictures of ourselves in the dress to send to the bridesmaids that couldn't come and try them on themselves.  They were so rude and crazy, they could have just politely told us there was no picture taking but they just lost their shit.  Strike two.Now onto the awful, awful alterations.  The woman that did my fitting was older and doesn't speak much english.  I am 6'1" and obviously most dresses are not made for a body as long as mine.  I was trying to tell her how I wanted the dress to fall so that I was comfortable but she said "no, no" and just starting pinning away.  I figured, ok, they're professionals and do this all the time-they know what's best.  Well, I figured wrong-way wrong.  I came back to try my dress on after the fitting and it was a complete disaster.  Basically, this woman was all worried where the dress was "supposed" to fall.  Well guess what-the seams aren't going to fall the same place on me as most women because my torso is about twice as long!  My boobs were falling out of the sides because she had pulled it down so low.  The front was so baggy and looked awful.  Finally the owner came out and tried to translate to this woman what I wanted but they said they just could not fit it how I wanted it...what??  I want it FITTED isn't that what you do?  The reason you do alterations is so it fits the individual person, not the norm.  Their solution was to give me padding to put in my bra to fill it out-ummm I already have size E boobs, I really should not require padding nor do I want it!  They also gave me double sided tape to stick the protruding top of the dress to my chest so it wouldn't stick out.  Strike three.  This place was awful-there are so many dress shops in this city and surrounding suburbs-take your business elsewhere.

25.description: I visited a lot of bridal salons in the process of picking out my wedding dress, and Kasia's seemed to me like the most organized and professionally run. I loved the idea of picking the dresses to try out of a book of pictures, since it is so hard to tell what a dress looks like on the hanger. Kasia's had my dream dress, but there was some drama when it arrived and didn't fit properly. In the process of resolving the problem, I ceased to be treated like a respected guest and began to be regarded as a problem child or even a hostile customer. I was upset but civil - and I would've been completely bulldozed by the pushy staff if I hadn't stood my ground. (They argued that I should've known certain things about the way wedding dresses are made - as if I am a veteran purchaser of wedding gowns. Hello?! Isn't this a once-in-a-lifetime purchase for most women??)Eventually it was all worked out - at an additional cost to me - but the staff made me feel like I was the worst Bridezilla ever. And it really made me resent my dress for a while.I didn't use the salon for alterations. I took my dress and ran! Bottom line, if everything had gone smoothly, I would've been relatively pleased with the experience. But I never left the salon with the warm and fuzzy feeling that you kind of hope to have when buying your wedding dress. I think that's what other reviewers mean when they refer to it as "no frills."
