I still think Kasia's is a better option than many other similarly priced salons in the area - but if you place an order, make sure you bring witnesses!

12.description: There are positively some pros and cons to this shop, which I will attempt to lay out both to be fair... This was my first attempt and bridal gown shopping and man was I disappointed. If you're looking for a "Say yes to the dress" experience, this it not the type of shop. I made an appointment, and felt Kathy was professional--- no complaint there. And FYI, when you arrive, you will have to feed the meters (which sucked).When I got in for my appointment, I picked out some styles from a binder of dresses and was also told that I can look on the over-packed racks. Agnies pulled the dresses and I was let into a fitting room. The temperature in the room was freezing-- they must have had they're heat at 65 and changing in that room made it no better! Even my mom was cold too and she kept her jacket on the entire time! Agnies, the girl that helped me with dresses, was fantastic. I can see that shes probably the gem of their store based on reviews...  She helped me move through dresses and made a few suggestions along the way. Through the dresses though, I remained stuck on the first one I tried on. At the end of my experience, standing on the pedestal thingy-- I wanted to sleep on it and make my decision the next day. Partiality because i was just too scared that THIS would be my only experience shopping. Partly because I didn't know if the dress I loved at this shop was IT. So-- in my mind what the shop could have done was let me take a picture and sleep on it. But NO-- THEY DO NOT. They also take the labels off dresses so that you don't really know who the designer is.. funny thing, they say this is because some of the dresses are made JUST for them. Here's the hysterical part-- a week later (after I left Kasia's with a bad taste in my mouth) I ironically saw the dress in a suburban dress shop window... low and behold it was 30% cheaper! And I bought it---The other thing that I thought was odd and noticed with the other girl I saw trying on dresses, is the only bustle option they recommend is the french bustle. I have a feeling that might be the style the seamstress prefers. So-- in short-I walk away saying there are far better shops out there, mostly in suburbs, where you can find better customer service and the same dresses cheaper! Most shops will give you the opportunity to take a photo (so that you are happy with your choice) and also give you so many bustle options, accessory options--- you name it.

21.description: There are positively some pros and cons to this shop, which I will attempt to lay out both to be fair... This was my first attempt and bridal gown shopping and man was I disappointed. If you're looking for a "Say yes to the dress" experience, this it not the type of shop. I made an appointment, and felt Kathy was professional--- no complaint there. And FYI, when you arrive, you will have to feed the meters (which sucked).When I got in for my appointment, I picked out some styles from a binder of dresses and was also told that I can look on the over-packed racks. Agnies pulled the dresses and I was let into a fitting room. The temperature in the room was freezing-- they must have had they're heat at 65 and changing in that room made it no better! Even my mom was cold too and she kept her jacket on the entire time! Agnies, the girl that helped me with dresses, was fantastic. I can see that shes probably the gem of their store based on reviews...  She helped me move through dresses and made a few suggestions along the way. Through the dresses though, I remained stuck on the first one I tried on. At the end of my experience, standing on the pedestal thingy-- I wanted to sleep on it and make my decision the next day. Partiality because i was just too scared that THIS would be my only experience shopping. Partly because I didn't know if the dress I loved at this shop was IT. So-- in my mind what the shop could have done was let me take a picture and sleep on it. But NO-- THEY DO NOT. They also take the labels off dresses so that you don't really know who the designer is.. funny thing, they say this is because some of the dresses are made JUST for them. Here's the hysterical part-- a week later (after I left Kasia's with a bad taste in my mouth) I ironically saw the dress in a suburban dress shop window... low and behold it was 30% cheaper! And I bought it---The other thing that I thought was odd and noticed with the other girl I saw trying on dresses, is the only bustle option they recommend is the french bustle. I have a feeling that might be the style the seamstress prefers. So-- in short-I walk away saying there are far better shops out there, mostly in suburbs, where you can find better customer service and the same dresses cheaper! Most shops will give you the opportunity to take a photo (so that you are happy with your choice) and also give you so many bustle options, accessory options--- you name it.

17.description: I had a fantastic experience at Kasia's Bridal when looking for my wedding gown - however I did not buy my gown here (it was simply a matter of not having that "ah ha" moment). Kasia's carries many different styles of gowns in all difference price ranges. The owner, Kathy, is great. She took her time and spent over 2 hours with me and my mom when we were shopping for a dress. I came back several months later to look for bridesmaid's dresses and worked with Kathy again. She let us pretty much tear the shop apart, pulling samples off the rack to try on. This was the first store I looked at for 'maids dresses and I found the perfect dress. My bridesmaids, span 20 year age range and range from size 4 to size 24 - so my challenge was finding a dress that they would be comfortable in, no matter their age or size. Kasia's had the perfect dress that all my 'maids really like and feel comfortable in and look fabulous in. Each time I visited the shop with my 'maids, I worked with Kathy. She made us feel really comfortable and right at home.  My mom bought her Mother of the Bride dress here too.  Kasia's had a large selection (however many of the dresses for MOB and special occassion are sold as-is and cannot be ordered in different sizes or colors) and my mom found a great dress that was sold as-is for nearly 50% off MSRP price. With a few small alterations, it will still be a fraction of the cost of ordering a dress in the perfect size and color. K & K Dressmaking, right in Kasia's does alterations and Grace is the seamstress. Both Kathy and Grace exhibit a ton of knowledge about the construction of dresses and when shopping for dresses Kathy is able to tell you the types of alterations or modifications that can be made to a dress. Kathy also has a great knowledge of the Designers that she carries and her imparting that knowledge while we were dress shopping was helpful and made me feel comfortable that I was selecting bridesmaids dresses from a professional who knows the business (not just a consultant who knows gowns and grabs some off a rack and tells you that you look great in it). Several things to note - it is a family run business, and I am OK with that. I proudly support small business in my community. While we were there, various family members, children and even pets wandered into the shop. I, personally am OK with that. Each time, Kathy was apologetic - but I don't mind. I'd prefer to shop here and support a small business, rather than large retailers where your money is going to splashy ads and to pay tons of sales associates waiting for a client to walk through the door so they can jump on you like a vulture. Kasia's is also on Irving Park Rd and parking is street parking and requires you to pay at a pay box. Just be prepared that parking rates are $3-4 an hour. Lastly, Kasia's is no-frills - exterior and interior. If you want champagne and heavy curtained fitting rooms and walls of mirrors and lights, go someplace else. If you want great dresses, a large selection, a range of price-points and to do business with a honest businesswoman and a small, local business, then Kasia's is definitely the place to go.

10.description: There is a misunderstanding concerning my mother's dress that I asked Kasia's to send for cleaning and preserving. As you can see from previous ratings this company does very well. My memory is that I was told this would take 2 weeks. They were to send my dress out July 1st. The Wedding Gown Preservation Company didn't receive it until 8/13. I don't know who's fault that is at all. It is September 7th now and I am very worried. Thankfully, Kasia's provided me with a link to track what I pray is my dress. I will call the Wedding Gown Preservation Company on Monday and request they please send me a picture of my dress to put my mind at ease. -My dress came back 9/12

5.description: I love this place! This where my cousin got her wedding dress and it's where I got mine. Kathy and her mom are wonderful! Getting them to do the alterations I wanted them to do was a little tough but eventually they did what I wanted and it turned out great! Their wedding dresses are beautiful and employees are so sweet! I felt so comfortable. Kathy is a sweetheart and really fun to talk to =) I live in Los Angeles and I traveled all the way to Chicago (where I'm originally from) just to get a dress from Kasia's. I'm obsessed with my dress! Kathy and her mom turned into family. I absolutely recommend Kasias Bridal!

3.description: I just walked out of this boutique and had the worst experience of my life. My mom and I walked in to try on Mother of the bride dresses for her and were willing to make an appointment if it was necessary. They promptly directed someone to help us and took us next door to their other boutique. Before walking in to the other boutique the lady said to us in a very mean way "are you going to buy something from us or just waste my time" I laughed it off and told her that we would if we found something we liked. She continued mumbling about how her time is valuable. I shook it off and looked at the dresses. We picked a few that my mom wanted to try on and then I calmly told her. That her remark earlier was very unprofessional and it's bad customers service. She went ballistic and started screaming about how we are wasting her time and screaming in her language. At that point I was very mad and told my mom to get her stuff and to leave. She was an older lady and I did not want to disrespect her by giving her a piece of my mind so I wanted to leave before I did just that. She continued screaming at us and telling us "you people waste my time, I have other clients with an appointment and you waste my time" I have a lot respect for older people and this lady almost made me break that. This was the worst service I have ever received. I tried to keep calm and walked to the main store where the owner was and explained to her the issue. She was very apologetic and wanted to make it up to us but my mom refused to come back and give them business. That woman made such a nice experience into a nightmare. I understand that the lady didn't speak good English but that's no excuse for literally screaming at customers and for being ignorant and unprofessional. I don't think this lady will be fired because she might be the owners mom or family. So be careful if you go in there and catch them in a bad day you might just walk out of there with the worst service.

35.description: I'm not sure why my experience differs so greatly from other reviewers. I actually had a positive view of Kasia's up until my actual appointment.When we got there, the whole storefront was being re-finished, so there were tarps, sawdust, and nails everywhere. The workers were still working when we got there for our appointment. I didn't mind the noise or dust, but what bothered me was when our consultant lied to us. She claimed she tried to call us to let us know there would be construction happening during out appointment. In fact, she never called my or my maid of honor, we had tried to call the shop to confirm the appointment and there was no answer.Once we got inside and started trying on dresses, I felt the customer service was lacking. In the course of the hour or so we spent there, we had 3 different consultants with us. For the first switch, we were introduced to the new consultant, but when the second switch occured, the consultant just left and a new one popped in. It felt like we weren't a priority, so whoeevr was free at the time just came over to relieve another consultant.As for the dresses, there was not a large selection. There were a few dresses I found online that I liked beforehand, and when we called Kasia's to see if they could pull those styles ahead of time for us, the woman on the phone responded they had many dresses, she was pretty sure they would have them, and they could be pulled when we arrived. They had none of the dresses.They also seem very afraid you will find a dress there and take your business elsewhere. All style numbers of the dresses were blacked out with a marker and when we inquired as to a specific dress to send a photo of it to a bridesmaid who could not join us that day, the consultant became very mean and told us she would not tell us the style and no pictures were allowed.We won't be back .

19.description: I would never go here again or recommend this place to anyone.I was a bridesmaid in my friend's wedding and we decided to get our dresses here.  We tried on the one that we liked, they wrote the number or whatever code they have down and we left.  My friend, the bride, requested they send her this style number so we could look it up, but they refused-they sent her a picture of the dress and it was not the same thing!  We told them that and I even went back to the shop and tried on the dress we had picked out and they assured me it was the same.  The dress we tried on and liked was straight and very fitting.  The dress we ended up getting was a full on A-line and made us all look like mammoth blimps.  Strike one.The shop itself is pretty unprofessional.  The dressing rooms are just little sectioned off areas with a sheet blocking it and the women that work there are like dress nazi's on patrol-they had a fit when we tried to take pictures of ourselves in the dress to send to the bridesmaids that couldn't come and try them on themselves.  They were so rude and crazy, they could have just politely told us there was no picture taking but they just lost their shit.  Strike two.Now onto the awful, awful alterations.  The woman that did my fitting was older and doesn't speak much english.  I am 6'1" and obviously most dresses are not made for a body as long as mine.  I was trying to tell her how I wanted the dress to fall so that I was comfortable but she said "no, no" and just starting pinning away.  I figured, ok, they're professionals and do this all the time-they know what's best.  Well, I figured wrong-way wrong.  I came back to try my dress on after the fitting and it was a complete disaster.  Basically, this woman was all worried where the dress was "supposed" to fall.  Well guess what-the seams aren't going to fall the same place on me as most women because my torso is about twice as long!  My boobs were falling out of the sides because she had pulled it down so low.  The front was so baggy and looked awful.  Finally the owner came out and tried to translate to this woman what I wanted but they said they just could not fit it how I wanted it...what??  I want it FITTED isn't that what you do?  The reason you do alterations is so it fits the individual person, not the norm.  Their solution was to give me padding to put in my bra to fill it out-ummm I already have size E boobs, I really should not require padding nor do I want it!  They also gave me double sided tape to stick the protruding top of the dress to my chest so it wouldn't stick out.  Strike three.  This place was awful-there are so many dress shops in this city and surrounding suburbs-take your business elsewhere.

28.description: The biggest complaint I had about the dress trying experience was that it was cold in the room and I had a big headache when I left (which could have negatively impacted my overall impression). They did have a thin bathrobe in the dressing area, but with constantly taking off and putting on dresses, it was a hassle to put it on in between.I have no complaints about the customer service - Kathy was very helpful in getting me situated and explaining how things worked, and Agatha helped with trying on the actual dresses.They do have some great deals off the rack and ready to take home, though I didn't find anything I wanted in particular. For the dresses that can be ordered, they have a giant binder of pictures of dresses to look through, and you can bookmark the ones you want to try on. Some of the pictures were a little blurry and it was hard to tell the exact material or details of the dresses.

45.description: I wasn't wowed.Our bridesmaids live all over the midwest, and I went with the last, who lives here in Chicago, to get her dress.  Everywhere else I've gone with all my girls have been great about coming in without an appointment, which is great because we knew what we wanted.Didn't have that experience here.It seems like the dresses aren't really organized in any way that makes sense.  This was part of the problem with our unsuccessful visit.  My bridesmaid knew 4 styles of Alfred Angelo dresses she wanted to look at, but we never would have found them.We were the first customers of the day, and the only person there was the seamstress, who seemed panicky about helping us look for dresses.  She actually called the owner, who was out for the morning and who wouldn't see is or let us poke around without an appointment.  They weren't particularly helpful or interesting in finding some way for us to make our visit work.  So, we went elsewhere.In a nutshell, MAKE AN APPOINTMENT.  They won't see you otherwise.  I wish that was clearer on their website.

33.description: Yearly Sample Sale November 09. I attended the annual sale at Kasia and there were only two fitting rooms. All the women trying on dresses had to share the two rooms which was very awkward and uncomfortable. You had to grab all your dresses yourself and the sales women seemed like they had never helped women try on dresses before. My mom and best friend were helping me with everything. There wasn't a large selection of dresses in size 6 but there were overwhelming amounts in 10-14. The prices were great for the limited amount of sizes they carried in the sizes 10-14. I left very disappointed and would not recommend this Bridal Salon to anyone.

43.description: I visited Kasia's to look for a wedding gown and was underwhelmed by the whole experience.  My mom & I arrived on time for my appointment but had to wait about 10-15 minutes (not a big deal) but the store is uncomfortably cramped - there's nowhere to sit and it's too crowded to even browse.  Once we were helped, I found the sales staff was incredibly pushy...I made it clear we were browsing and in no hurry to buy (it was 13 months before my wedding!) but the saleswoman was relentless.  Needless to say, we didn't purchase my gown there.  Also - and this is my pet peeve with any bridal salon - they cut the tags off the dresses so you have no idea who the designer is.  What's the point?  What are they trying to hide?  Sketchy.

2.description: I do not know what I would have done without Agatha and her numerous fittings... she gave me 6 different fittings and if I wanted more, she would have given them to me.  My mom wasn't able to come to any of them because she was out of town for the winter and Agatha helped me like a mother would!  She was wonderful! The price was reasonable compared to anywhere else we went!

18.description: I really don't know why all these women who have written negative reviews are complaining. I think some of these brides are bridezillas thinking they should be waited on hand and foot.Kasia's is not the fanciest of salons and you wont get champagne while you wait. What you will get is competitive prices, friendly customer service and quality alterations. It's a no frills family owned salon.I did not get my dress at Kasia's but I did have my alterations done there.  I should have bought my dress from them and saved myself a world of trouble that I had from the place I did get it from. Kathy, the owner, is very attentive and pleasant to deal with. Agatha, one of the sales staff is wonderful and attends to the brides and makes them feel like they are at a bridal salon in Beverly Hills.The mom who does the alterations was easy to work with and totally got my vision for how I wanted my dress to fit. I needed it taken in at the bust and the hips and bustled and since I have a fit and flare dress it was imperative that it fit as close to my body as possible to compliment my curves.There was a bit of a language barrier with the mom but it was easily overcome and clearly not an issue as she did the alterations perfectly!I would not hesitate to recommend Kasia's to another bride. I came here myself on the recommendation of a friend and was worried about all the negative reviews. Ignore them! Come and see for yourself what great staff everyone is and the excellent and  extremely competitive work  they do.

41.description: The ladies of this shop are wonderful. Years ago Grace made a bridesmaid dress for me that was absolutely lovely and fit to perfection. When the alterations department at the house of brides screwed me over with little time to remedy the situation, i remembered this shop and called them. My experience was even better than the previous. They offered a bustle style that HOB said was impossible and at a much lower price. Kathy was plain and honest about time frames, realistic expectations, and great suggestions regarding dresses and tailoring in general. I felt so at home with them. Yes the shop is small, but I'd rather a small shop with top-notch service and honest feedback than a big spacious house of brides with obsequious women who turn and ignore you once the money has been collected.

50.description: WORST service ever.  i don't recommend anyone buying a dress here.  My friend bought her wedding dress here and they made her PAY for the bag the dress went home in.  The owner made it very uncomfortable for the wedding party to call in and give their measurements and pay for the dresses.  There are many more, stress free places to buy a wedding dress in the city.

4.description: Initially, Kasia puts on a nice show being very friendly and involved. As soon as you put money down, everything changes. When you walk into the shop, she barely looks up off of her computer (every time I saw her screen - she was on Facebook). I ordered my bridesmaids dresses after having a pleasant experience with her having TRIED ON (no experience with actually receiving/altering the dresses) a bridesmaids dress for my friend's wedding. Both my friend and I ended up having "unforeseen circumstances" that resulted in both sets of bridesmaids dresses coming in over a month later than Kasia initially told us. Upon calling to check in on the dresses, she gets VERY defensive and is quite rude. I am generally a very passive person, but this woman was one of a kind. When the dresses did finally come in, she claimed to have called me - definitely not the case. I end up having to call her and she says "Oh - I called and said they were in 2 days ago " - I know for a fact I did not miss any calls from her, as I was waiting very patiently FOR that call, but she insisted that it was my fault and I must have missed that call. She straight up lied AND was rude about it. No apologies whatsoever, when I was nothing but polite on the phone. Upon getting my friend's bridesmaids dresses altered (now I know the price is much higher than other places for alterations), 2 bridesmaids dresses were much too big, and one was too tight - but there was no time (or $) for 2nd fittings since the dresses had come in so late. We made do with tape and safety pins for the large dresses and not breathing/eating too much in the dress that was too tight. Having thankfully learned from the experience with my friend's bridesmaid dresses, I told my bridesmaids to take their dresses elsewhere for alterations - one getting alterations as cheap as $20 whereas I had paid $90 for the same amount of alterations!

6.description: Great place to buy any type of dress for a wedding whether you're the bride bridesmaid or mother of the bride. Kathy is wonderful to work with and knows what she is talking about. I definitely recommend Kasias!

22.description: I worked with Kasia's to order a bridesmaid gown for my friends wedding.  Firstly, Kathy, the women we worked with, came across friendly and helpful and accommodated us twice when we were running late for a fitting.  However, that is the best of the customer service I was provided.  It started during the fitting when I was measured as a size 20 for my dress...when I wear a size 8 in woman's jeans! I argued a bit about the size as I realized this would be wayyyy too big, and she agreed to order a size 16 in the dress...still too big but more reasonable than a 20!  When the dress came in, it was of course huge.  Seeing that I had quite the alteration bill on my hands, I called Kasia's to complain in hopes of getting a discount on the alterations as it was their measurements which gave me this huge dress.  Upon returning to the store, I was told the dress was "fine" and that all dresses are that big on people. Then I was quoted at almost $100 for the alterations!  So, not only did I not get a discount, they were going to charge me more than any other tailor with no flexibility at all! Needless to say, I took my dress elsewhere for the alterations, and would not recommend this place to others.

15.description: I'm not sure why my experience differs so greatly from other reviewers. I actually had a positive view of Kasia's up until my actual appointment.When we got there, the whole storefront was being re-finished, so there were tarps, sawdust, and nails everywhere. The workers were still working when we got there for our appointment. I didn't mind the noise or dust, but what bothered me was when our consultant lied to us. She claimed she tried to call us to let us know there would be construction happening during out appointment. In fact, she never called my or my maid of honor, we had tried to call the shop to confirm the appointment and there was no answer.Once we got inside and started trying on dresses, I felt the customer service was lacking. In the course of the hour or so we spent there, we had 3 different consultants with us. For the first switch, we were introduced to the new consultant, but when the second switch occured, the consultant just left and a new one popped in. It felt like we weren't a priority, so whoeevr was free at the time just came over to relieve another consultant.As for the dresses, there was not a large selection. There were a few dresses I found online that I liked beforehand, and when we called Kasia's to see if they could pull those styles ahead of time for us, the woman on the phone responded they had many dresses, she was pretty sure they would have them, and they could be pulled when we arrived. They had none of the dresses.They also seem very afraid you will find a dress there and take your business elsewhere. All style numbers of the dresses were blacked out with a marker and when we inquired as to a specific dress to send a photo of it to a bridesmaid who could not join us that day, the consultant became very mean and told us she would not tell us the style and no pictures were allowed.We won't be back .

20.description: I went to Kasia's Bridal in the fall of 2008. It's taken me a long time to write this review because I wasn't sure if I wanted to post it but in the end I decided that it's important for other people to know. My sister and I visited Kasia's to search for a bridesmaid dress. Kathy was very helpful and friendly. We didn't find exactly what we had been looking for but we really wanted to get our dresses from Kasia's (my sister had gotten her bridal gown from here) so we settled on a dress that we felt just okay about. I put down my deposit and then all we had to do was wait for the other bridesmaids to send in their deposits and measurements. A month or so later, my sister realized that she really didn't like the dress we had picked out so we decided to go back into Kasia's to see if we could find something we liked better. Since the dress hadn't been ordered yet, I figured the deposit could be used to order a different dress if we did find one we liked better than the original. If not, we would stick with the first we had found. When we get into the shop, Kathy tells us that the dress I had put a deposit on for had been discontinued. She never called or emailed to tell us. Had we not gone in that day, when would she have told us? She insisted that she had no way of knowing when dresses would be discontinued (Which I'm not sure is true. I've visited several bridal shops since and all have told me that they are alerted well in advance if a dress is to be discontinued). We looked around and couldn't find what we were looking for so I figured I could get my deposit back since she had never placed the order and the dress was discontinued. Kathy told me that there was no way for me to get my deposit back because her computer "didn't have a refund button".  I understand that a deposit is like a promise to purchase an item but if the retailer can't deliver on the item, shouldn't the deposit be refunded? She told us it was our fault because the other bridesmaids hadn't sent in their measurements in yet. But wouldn't she just have been taking more deposits for a discontinued dress? She accepted money and never delivered a product. After some discussion, she told us that though she couldn't give us a refund, she would hold on to the deposit as credit that we could use in the future. I figured it was better than nothing. Fast forward to summer 2010. I got engaged and though I didn't want to get my dress from Kasia's, I figured it just made sense since I had credit there and she never mentioned anything about an expiration date. I called Kasia's and received the strangest response. I spoke with Kathy and she told me that the store's policy never included store credit. Also, there's no way of knowing how much my deposit had been because they do not store records past 6 months/1 year. She kept saying management had changed so she can't be held accountable for whatever the management had told me back then. According to their website, Kathy has always been the owner of Kasia's and the only person I had ever worked with throughout this whole ordeal so I'm not sure what she meant by "management has changed". She was very defensive and so I changed my approach and told her that it was my fault for not getting the store credit agreement in writing on paper and for periodically checking in. When I told her that I had just gotten engaged and wanted to get my dress from Kasia's, she told me that if I could find my original deposit slip, we could maybe work out some kind of discount. I found my original deposit slip and emailed Kathy to confirm everything we had discussed. I never heard back from her. I could have continued to fight this but I've run out of energy and it's simply not worth it. Since this whole ordeal, I've visited several bridal shops and I always ask what would happen if the dress were discontinued after giving them my deposit (this experience has left me paranoid). All have said that my deposit would be returned and that this wouldn't happen anyways since they know well in advance when dresses are to be discontinued and are pulled from the floor. I know that Kathy will respond to this review with a comment denying this and placing the blame on me (as she has done for almost every negative review on yelp) but after speaking with several other bridal retailers, I am confident that what happened was unfair. I've done my best to keep my personal opinions out of this review and to make it objective. But I just have to say, on her website, she states that "I went to a bridal house and ordered my dress almost 2 years in advance. Do you know that I never received my dress, nor did I ever get my money back for it!.. I decided to open up a bridal shop of my own, and VOWED that I would never treat a client the way that I was treated, and more so, not cause brides and grooms the same nightmare-ish agony I experienced, during their happy time." Sounds awfully familiar.

36.description: I called for an appointment after hearing a positive opinion from a friend who recently bought her wedding dress (off the rack, no alterations!!) at Kasia's. It turned out that I called for a day they were going to be having their July sample sale (all weekend), so I decided to take my mother and sister and go right when they would open that Friday, thinking it would be busy and chaotic.I was amazed to find myself the only bride for about 90% of my time there, meaning I received amazing individualized service. (Three other brides came in while I was there, two of whom seemed to have an attitude--one wanted them to let her try on dresses not part of the sale, etc.). I believe I tried on about 20 dresses in record time. While one lady took a gown out of the dressing room, another came in the other side. The employees were all attentive, but not hovering or pressuring in any way. I eventually found my dress at an incredible price. I also purchased a lovely veil that matches quite well. The veil was half off since I bought a gown and I got a 5% discount on the gown for paying cash. I was able to take my dress home that day!I am very happy with the service and selection at Kasia's and highly recommend the shop to all brides-to-be!

14.description: I ordered my wedding dress back in 2004. After the wedding, I moved to the St. Louis area and a friend had a random question about my dress. I looked at my certificate, but couldn't figure out the name of the dress that I had ordered. I sent an e-mail to the store, was very impressed that they still had my order on file, and they responded very promptly.If you are looking for a place where you will get excellent service 7+ years after your wedding day, this is the place.If you are looking for a Maggie Sottero wedding dress, then I highly reccomend Kasia's. I'm not sure of their other brands that they carry because I had made up my mind on the type of dress that I wanted before I started shopping.I got the dress (Maggie Sotero, Moulin Rouge) at an excellent price point (it was somewhat lower than other salons I called on for pricing), and the level of service that I received was great. The alteration process went smoothly. The staff there is friendly, knowledgeable, and they were one of the best vendors that I chose for my wedding.

12.description: . Some of the oriental places in the area have bland tasting food. Not here. The amount of food you get is also good. When I get delivery the lids on the containers are bulging. Prices are reasonable and the smoothies are great.

3.description: After my favorite Chinese restaurant closed,  I was I  the hunt for a new one. Asian Noodle Town has been doing a good job filling that void. I started visiting this restaurant about a year ago,  it was a total hole in the wall but with an extensive menu.  A few months ago it switched management and was remodeled.  The menu was also changed and had way less than the original menus,  which is ashame because I really liked the lemongrass chicken entree,  which is no longer offered. Now I get the spicy shrimp fried rice (tip: you have to request it spicy) and it was pretty good.  I've also tried the spicy tofu rice,  great for a vegetarian option.  The Vietnamese eggrolls, come in a batch of 4, were ok.  They are a wonton wrap filled with ground meat.  They include a homemade sweet and sour type sauce.  The restaurant is really nice and great for bringing family and frIends,  if your looking to eat out.  The customer service has also been good. I guess this is my new Chinese spot.

1.description: I came in solo to grab dinner on a Wednesday, 7pm. There are no other customers, I had my order to stay in. Ordered the pad Thai with beef, not bad. I am by no means a food critic, but I would have it again....in fact, the serving size is so large, that I will be having it again...for lunch tomorrow.I'm just rating my experience. Ymmv

2.description: Delicious and local Chinese food. Always prepped on time and hot. The interior is clean and welcoming. The staff can be a little friendlier but they still do their job great.

9.description: I would definitely say that this place is the best Chinese in our area. The first time around, we ordered beef with veggies and beef lo mein. We loved the sauce that came with the beef with veggies, the beef lo mein was great as well. Since our order was over $15, they honored the coupon they have listed on their website and gave us 2 crab rangoons for free. We enjoyed the food so much that I decided to try their lunch specials a few days later and I ordered the Mongolian beef. Personally, I am not crazy about sweet sauces and found the the Mongolian beef a bit on the sweet side. However, the food still had a lot of flavor. Also, I wanted white rice instead of the chicken fried rice but ended up with regular fried rice ( I think it was just a miscommunication due to the language). However, the service and food was great!

10.description: Food here is surprisingly good. Might be labeled as a hole in the wall joint. Did not expect to find good Chinese food out here. Recommended if you are looking to order to go! I hear they are opening up the dining room area and making it nice!  Can't wait!

13.description: I don't know how this place is doing business. what's the point of putting their business hour on the menu and when I called nobody picked up.

16.description: They just opened (as of January 2013).  It is replacing a Chinese restaurant that occupied the same location.  So if you hated the old place, this is MUCH better.  Give it a try.  I am by no means a Chinese cuisine expert but the Mongolian Beef I ordered was great and the orange chicken my son had was good too.  Not much to look at as far as dining in (that is why there are only four stars in my review), but great for carry out.  And they do deliver.

6.description: Great lunch special deals and the main woman and the counter is soooo friendly and nice!i ordered for pick up 2 lunch specials..shrimp egg foo young and shrimp with lobster sauce..which wasn't even on the lunch special menu but the woman was more than gracious to tell me when I picked up my food that if its not on the lunch menu let her know and she will make it special.such great customer service I received from this place and they truly deserve more regulars!the only thing is I did ask for chili oil and it wasn't in my take out bag :(but other than that their food is good and their veggie egg rolls are deeeelliish!!go their for lunch!!

15.description: We moved to the neighborhood 5 years ago and the place that was there before was horrible!  So glad this place has opened up.  Super fresh and tasty food.  Lunch special for 5.75 comes with mass amounts of food at such a great price.  I consider myself to be a chinese and thai food snob, so I highly recommend this place.  They haven't taken the old restaurant's sign down yet, but it's definitely new management and a brand new menu.

0.description: Pleased that there's a decent Chinese restaurant near my boyfriend's house. Came in and the restaurant was empty and the worker was happy to serve us! Really nice tables and chairs, but the walls are bare...so the restaurant is lacking some decor. The walls are a nice purple so it kind of lifts up the mood! Our waitress offered us tea, which was so nice and also free! We ordered crab rangoon, curry chicken and beef chow fun. The crab rangoon and were ENORMOUS! Yummy (: 6 large pieces for $5. The curry chicken we asked to be a bit more spicy. And when it came out, we were confused cos it wasn't like any sort of curry we were used to. Which was fine, since it was delicious anyway! Beef chow fun was yummy and crispy (like I asked). Our waitress was very attentive and always asked if we needed anything. She also provided us with coupons for next time and gave us 10% off our bill too (the special at the time). I highly recommend this place! Yummy food with huge portions for decent prices. Excellent service!!!

5.description: I've been going here for a few years but this is my 1st review. Once in a Blue Moon I crave some Asian Food. They have an awesome menu with something for everyone. A mix of Chinese and Thai dishes. Solid Mongolian Beef, not your typical brown slop like other places. The Orange Chicken was good, but not at the same level at the Beef. Egg Rolls are real good, crispy crunchy with fresh ingredients. Always a smiling face taking my order. Very Good Asian spot in the middle of Pizza and Beef Land

11.description: Great food!  I was looking for a chinese restaurant close to work, the ones near me are bleh... I found this one on yelp and decided to give it a try.  The amount of food in the lunch specials can EASILY feed 2 people.  Enormous portions!  Food is seasoned well and you dont need to douce your fried rice in soy sauce.  Even better that the staff is friendly.  Do yourself a favor though, pick up a menu, as I ordered online and their menu has changed significantly.

8.description: Love the noodles, more than enough food is given so this place is a must on the must try list. Different variations of foods are a plus almost has a Korean vibe going

4.description: This place is one of the best on the NW side of Chicago. Their eggrolls are so close to New Star's. I have ordered several times from here and am always surprised with the quality and taste of the food. I order something different every time. The Mongolian chicken has a bit of sweetness to it which I thought was a bit strange but everything else has been excellent. The dining room is great if you don't mind sparse decoration and lack of ambiance, but who cares, you're there for the food and not the decor. This place is awesome!!

14.description: We just moved into the neighborhood about 5 months and found this hidden gem. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the Beef Lo Mein. Also the prices are cheap for the amount they give you. Stop by if you happen to be in the area for good food and very affordable.

7.description: Their Kung Pao Tofu had me at first bite!!! Lots of fresh vegetables, the sauce is spicy, without having to ask that it be spicy. If you love Kung Pao, you know how frustrating it can be to find excellent Kung Pao, especially in this area. It's a small place, run by a husband and wife, who are so kind, you want to eat order from them at least twice a week! It is not fancy, they have a great lunch special that I recommend you eat at the restaurant, and they also sell fresh fruit smoothies. So glad my Mom found one of their menus in the mailbox. Please give them an opportunity to wow you with their delicious food!

58.description: Good food, not going to lie I'm a little skeptical about thai/sushi spots but I guess its a growing trend. Had the lunch special with drunken noodles(spicy). They were very very spicy just how I prefer. Only issue I had is they could've put a little more meat in the dish but for 8 bucks you get a side, entree and choice of drink so I'm still giving them four stars. Check this spot out you will not regret it. I'll be going back for the sushi.

56.description: I ordered delivery through Grub Hub from Hands on for the first time today and it got here much faster than I thought which was awesome. I ordered the Pyramid of Giza Maki, the Shrimp Temp Maki and the Crab Rangoon. For dessert I ordered the Double Chocolate Cheesecake. I decided to treat myself, yes I ate it all, Don't judge me. Everything was really really good!! I normally order from a different place but they no longer deliver to my address and since Im trying my best to be lazy I decided to try Hands On seeing as they do deliver to my location. I will definitely order from here again. One thing I will say is the Crab Rangoon is not like the usual flavor or recipe you would normally get at other restaurants but since there were so many other good reviews I decided to try it and I really like the flavors and the curry just gives it that little kick that makes it perfect. Definitely on my favorites list.

29.description: The sushi is amazing! The rolls are very filling, to the point that two rolls and an appetizer is enough for me and my fiancé. Quiet and pressure free.

42.description: My friend brought us take out from here and we ate it at my place. She had gotten about 5 different rolls. I have to say they were some fantastic, tasty rolls, wow! Wouldn't expect a great sushi place like this to be located where it is. The crab Rangoon had a unique curry (I think) flavor to it and it was tasty as well but different then normal crab Rangoon.

23.description: I'm assuming that the high reviews for this place are from people that either just stuck with the Thai side of the menu, or have not had decent sushi in their life.   The sushi rolls were the size of my fist.  Every roll had about a half cup of rice on it and a hard chunk of cucumber.   The positive was they played great music.   The miso soup and Asian house salad was good.

47.description: I live this place. Me and my husband's favorite restaurant.  We use to live in the area but moved but go here every opportunity we get. Because there are so many restaurants in Chicago /Chicago area we rarely go to the same place twice but this place we visit over and over. Get the calamari or Bangkok wings and any of their specialty rolls. We live the Stonehenge and pyramid of giza.

8.description: Ordered delivery for a party. Bad move!! The sushi rice is very mushy. Nothing special. Nothing impressed me. Will definitely skip sushi here from now on.

31.description: We went on july 4th and they were open. Food was fresh! Service was good. We ordered a godzilla, spider, California and spicy tuna. I will definitely go back.

34.description: I have generally liked this restaurant quite a lot. But I will say, you would be well served to stick with the standards. swapped black and brown rice on two different dishes and both were disappointing. I have had excellent examples at other establishments, but here it was just not very good. Subtracting a star and will stick with the dishes they do best.

16.description: An amazing experience! Probably the best sushi I have had. We got the gangster platter that consisted of 5 rolls which were chef's choice rolls. They had a variety of flavors added to them.we also had the crab Rangoon, poppers and edamame, all were delicious. We tried their dessert of key lime pie- which I was skeptical about at first but was very tasty, light and not overly done.   The service was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant and we will definitely be back.

13.description: Food is excellent, the seaweed salad is to die for.If you enjoy seafood and unique foods, this will be the place, it is kid friendly as Ive taken my 2 daughters, very nice staff and of course great food. My family and ai enjoy this friendly family restaurant.

11.description: One of our favorite places to go.  The place looks like a date spot but you can go there for lunch or dinner on your own.  Which I have seen ppl do many times.  The food is that good.  I get the dragon role.  I think it's their best but I am sure every one has their favorite.  The lunch specials are really good price and it is plenty to fill you up. If you live in the area I would be really surprised this is not one of your favorite regular spots.  Fyi the ice coffee is a good one too.

39.description: Amazing...cute little setup, but it feels cozy and nice to hangout in. My gf and I had been here several times...perfect place for pur casual dates and their chef's special rolls are out of this world

37.description: We went for dinner on a Friday. We started with a California roll. But it wasn't great. The mayo was too sweet. For our mains we had the curry. Red & massaman. They were both very tasty. However, it was a bit lite in veggies. Compared to the amount of rice & curry. Really cute place. And 10% off with 1st checkin

0.description: I seriously love this place.  I haven't reviewed it in a long time, but we have been here probably ten times since our twins were born and have had them in tow without any issues.  One is usually fast asleep in her carrier and the other sits in a high chair and eats pieces of whatever we have.  The sushi is huge portions and the husband usually gets the meaty egg rolls and either teriyaki beef or a filet entrée.  I wish we weren't in a hurry every time we are there (operating on borrowed time with the kids) and could have dessert.  I would like to find out what shaolin fist is!Oh, and the lunch specials are great.  My mom and sister and I came here in December for my birthday and had lunch - you get a mini app, a choice of entrée and a drink all under $10.  Delicious!

38.description: This place is exceptional. It is hidden from civilization but the food is one of ur best. I wasn't all into this good until I have had food from here. My favorite drink became Thai ice tea after I had it here, shushi is just too good.. It's hygienic, friendly and welcoming.. It's a wonderful place for a date or to just eat.

51.description: I just moved into the neighborhood and have to find a new sushi place. I turned to Yelp to help me out and I was very mislead! One other table was there when we showed up (early Thursday evening), but you would have thought it was packed with the lack of greeting and blah service my friend and I received. We were taken to a table and before taking my jacket off, the server was already asking if we were ready to order. "Umm, not yet, but can we  please have some water and can you please open our wine?" (Both Yelp and the restaurant's door says it's a BYOB) The server just nodded and walked away. She comes back to take our order, still no waters and our wine is sitting on the table unopened, we order crab Rangoon and ask (again) for waters. The Rangoon comes out, we still have no waters or plates. Crab Rangoon not what I was expecting (curry as a filling??) We finally get our waters and the server brings over some wine glasses (the wine will make this night better) and we order 3 rolls to start off with. The server never opened our wine bottle and had to be flagged down for more water. Rolls come out pretty fast, but that was the highlight. They were not rolled tight enough, there was too much gunk (sauce) on top and the fish didn't taste good. Oh, and our bottle of wine sat unopened the entire meal. We didn't finish, paid and took the bottle back home.....maybe this place gets good reviews for the Thai food?? Either way, I'm not coming back to find out.....

27.description: pad thai combo was well worth it

32.description: Got delivery to my hotel after a long day. The Pad Thai and Gyoza were fine, nothing amazing and I probably won't eat them again. The spicy beef salad tasted really off like the meat had gone bad so I didn't eat it. The chicken in the Pad Thai was really over cooked and dried out and my Thai ice tea was forgotten with my order delivery.

54.description: They had some modern twists on sushi, as well as classics.The hot food selections were very tasty too, plus their soups are a larger quantity than I am used to getting at.I give it 4 stars, because I didn't think the atmosphere was worth 5. The decor could use an upgrade to match their trendy dishes.

48.description: I have nothing but good things to say about this place! Everything was very flavorful and the prices were good! The service was also excellent! Definitely give this place a shot, you will not be disappointed! Happy, happy, happy!

44.description: First time here and first time ever using a YELP Deal and will first off say pretty AWESOME. The area of the city where this restaurant is located is what I what like to call "LOW KEY", not a busy area but more residential traffic which is GREAT. I love Thai food so coming to a Thai restaurant I have high expectations and same with sushi because there are not many GOOD sushi spots that I really know of. I ate the Pad See Ew w/beef and can say was not much different from other places so I was NOT taken away by any originality of flavor. As far as the sushi though I will say different, I had a VOLCANO roll which was really GOOD. And from what my friend had to eat that roll he ordered was AWESOME. I liked that there was a YELP Deal so when I mentioned it to the very KIND server about it they quickly explained how it worked and was ultimately as EASY as said. Because of the GOOD food, service, and location I will definitely be back to try more of the menu and will also be using YELP Deals in the future.

24.description: Food is undoubtedly amazing quality. I got house Asian salad and ginger dressing was great with avacado pairing. Avacado roll was great and big.Chicken teriyaki one of the best white meats I have ever had with a killer sausce.Green tea tiratsmsu is a must. Fresh and great work put into taste.

7.description: Found this place on yelp and I gotta say it was amazing! We came on a Tuesday the place was empty so it was very quick and great service. We both had gone with the pad thai and it was very tasty. We got a roll of sushi as well and that was spectacular too! The place is BYOB which was very convenient and I would recommend this for anyone looking for good sushi or Thai food!

49.description: Ok so I was here for a birthday dinner of about 25 people . The thing I had a issue with was the service. The servers were nice but they were all over the place. Our food came out at different times. When 3 people got done eating then another  dish came for another person. I hate that we didn't all eat at the same time. The food was meh. Also I felt like I was paying for downtown prices.

40.description: Hands on is a simple Asian restaurant located in Dunning. We made reservations on Open Table. They were not necessary for a Saturday night which was surprising, we were the only people there. It is not only a takeout place. There is plenty of seating but it was kind of nice being the only people there that night. They have a good menu and be sure to use the Yelp check in discount. We had the edamame, tofu frito, gyoza, and some sort of seafood dish. They were all good and will fill you up for sure.

53.description: The tom Ka soup was good and the crab Rangoon was delicious that is a must ! but the reason why they only got a 3 star is the sushi was a huge let down,  we decided to order the trio chef special thinking it would amazing but we ended up getting mediocre sushi that belonged in the 7 $ a roll category, the fish wasn't fresh, We will go back but we will stay away from the sushi and maybe try the Thai dishes

30.description: Finally tried this place after passing by so many times. There's no other thai places by my house so we were glad to finally try it. The place was cozy, nice and clean. We were the only ones there and came about 20 minutes before the lunch hour ended. I ordered spicy basil chicken, crab Rangoon and 2 types of sushi. I was disappointed that the waitress never offered us the lunch special menu and I noticed it too late that I could have still ordered that. Also, our waitress lacked on checking up on us, but she was nice. She took long getting our order, and lacked refilling our waters as well. The crab Rangoon was different, as it had curry flavors in it. It was pretty good. Basil was good as well. Sushi was eh. It wasn't rice sushi so it was all soggy and falling apart. I would recommend only getting their thai dishes.

46.description: Love this place! I had always ordered from them on GrubHub until my husband and I went here for an actual date. I always order either the drunk noodles, pad Thai, crab Rangoon, or pad see ew, all of which are so yummy. They always deliver ahead of time too. I was always adamant to order sushi though, so when we went in to the actual restaurant, we tried the sushi and we were happy we did! It's still not on par with the sushi I've had in California BUT it's still pretty good and it's close to us. We ordered the Angry Dragon roll and Golden Gate Bridge maki. The angry dragon was our favorite; probably because of the sauce and the tempura flakes, plus I love eel in rolls. The Golden Gate was ok, but didn't seem extraordinary. It wasn't busy when we had visited, but it was during a weekday in the early evening, plus I think they get most of their sales through grubhub. Either way, it's a great go to place, nice spot for a date, and AWESOME customer service; quick, efficient, good food. Easy to find parking too!

1.description: I didn't really enjoy the food here very much.  The décor and service was good.Ducky Becky $16 - This duck dish made me want to never order duck outside of Chinatown ever again.  I just didn't taste right.Massamun Curry with chicken $9 - This was ok, good amount of vegetables in here.Golden Gate Maki $16 - (10pcs) Tuna, hamachi, cilantro, jalapeno, scallion, cucumber, avocado, tobiko, crumbs, wasabi mayo, sweet soy sauce, chili sauce - It looked pretty, but for that price, I expected more flavors.Thai Ice Tea  $2.50 - My favorite item of the night.

55.description: When I need my pad thai fix, I order from Hands On. I've never had a bad meal from here. They are extremely accommodating and have an extensive menu. It's making me hungry now!

9.description: Take this from someone whos family used to own a sushi bar, and who eats sushi minimum of once weekly. Skip this place!!!Ordered delivery from this place. Bad move. Ordered four things. The Thai iced tea was very good. No complaints there.Left in cup: not a dropThe Pan Fried Gyoza was pretty flavorless. Also not pan fried very well, more like steamed. Nothing special. Left on plate 3/6The Shrimp Tempura Maki wasn't very good at all. I mean, it was just BAD! There is a crumb like coating around the rice that made the whole thing very mushy. The sauce on it way too sweet, they need to use less of it or put it on the side. The Tempura coating on the shrimp was very hard in some parts. Just no.Left on plate 4.5/6The Boston Roll, a tuna avocado roll, my favorite maki roll usually. It's hard to screw it up unless you have bad fish. Well, you couldn't even taste the tuna, so it's like I had an avocado roll. It is cut so large (6 pieces, could easily be 8-10 pieces) that I ended up taking the avocado and tuna out and eating them like that--- which is how I know the tuna was absolutly flavorless. Left on plate: the rice & seaweed of 4/6Other complaints.... sushi rice is right down mushy, soy sauce container is to tiny to dip sushi into, way way way OVER PRICED!!! The food wasn't outright bad, it just wasn't good.... at all. It was edible, I mean if you haven't eaten for a few days you'd probably enjoy it. Maybe this review is a bit harsh, I just don't enjoy over paying for food and then end up eating Special K cereal for dinner.Two stars: 1 for the great thia iced tea, 1 for the freaky fast delivery

26.description: Enjoyed dinner at Hands On several times and have never been disappointed. The basil fried rice is so flavor filled...yum. Food presentations are attractive and appetizing. Give them a try. You won't be disappointed.

25.description: Came to this place after I saw it on Yelp. It was a really lovely place to chill and dine. The food here was great. We ordered green curry chicken, beef pad Thai, Tom Yum soup and Volcano sushi rolls. Everything tastes delicious. I will definitely come again:)

12.description: We tried this place for the first time. We didn't wait long to receive our order. However, I'm sorry to say but our order of pad see iew beef and pad thai chicken was just too salty. My husband ordered pad see iew and he said there's some burned areas in his food. I thought it was only his food that was burned. Unfortunately I even tasted some burned chicken on my pad thai chicken. Sad part is they didn't even seem busy. How disappointing! I think I'm just generous I gave them 2 stars.

59.description: First time in this restaurant and I'm impressed,  soooo good, excelent service and delicious food, we really love this place and of course we are going back.

21.description: My friend introduced me to this place and I have been back two more times since.  I've gotten the Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles and both were very tasty although I will say I liked the Pad Thai the best.  We had the Vertical Shrimp for an appetizer and the Volcano Maki, both of which were very tasty.  I thought the prices were very reasonable and I also like that it is BYOB.  I will definitely be back.

17.description: Food is undoubtedly amazing quality. I got house Asian salad and ginger dressing was great with avacado pairing. Avacado roll was great and big.Chicken teriyaki one of the best white meats I have ever had with a killer sausce.Green tea tiratsmsu is a must. Fresh and great work put into taste.

10.description: Not many Thai/sushi options in the area therefore, hands on has been our to go spot for the last few years. Pad Thai, pad see ew and panang are a few of my favs. Great service every time we go to dine there...BYOB is a plus too

5.description: We went for dinner on a Friday. We started with a California roll. But it wasn't great. The mayo was too sweet. For our mains we had the curry. Red & massaman. They were both very tasty. However, it was a bit lite in veggies. Compared to the amount of rice & curry. Really cute place. And 10% off with 1st checkin

3.description: DONT EAT HERE. Don't expect to get a refund here!! After returning a takeout order that was completely incorrect, I was told I would have to wait 2 weeks for my refund. I gave it 2 stars cause the food is ok...not great. I have lived in the area 4 months & have ordered from them about 3 times a month. Let me tell you, they have NEVER gotten an order correct . On top of that I always have a problem with getting any kind of sauce from them. Teriyaki, hot mustard etc. A sales check of $60 or more & they want to charge me 80 cents for sauce . Have you ever heard of "Give them the pickle"? Google it. When I told them that they lost my business their response was.....OK. Be prepared if you ever have a complaint cause they don't care about your business. OR JUST DONT DINE HERE & avoid the problems.

35.description: This is my new go to place for Thai food. Went here last night and had a delicious meal. Pad Thai and pad see ew were spot on. Staff was very friendly, decor is nice and music was different than what everyone else plays. A must try!!

19.description: The shrimp pad Thai is delicious! Definitely recommend it. My husband had the chicken fried rice so good. Everything is so fresh. Definitely recommend the sushi the dragon roll is my favorite.

28.description: The shrimp pad Thai is delicious! Definitely recommend it. My husband had the chicken fried rice so good. Everything is so fresh. Definitely recommend the sushi the dragon roll is my favorite.

45.description: Love this place the sushi is very fresh and they will make it with soy paper when requested. I went on Monday and again on Tuesday I love the glass noodles here as well... It is byob so bring your favorite drink and enjoy. I will definitely be back the noodle dishes are a good size so you can share them. Very attentive service throughout our entire meal. Love having this place in the neighborhood.

33.description: First time ordering.. Had the chicken pad Thai, crab Rangoon and a California roll. The pad Thai was pretty tasty.. I've had better... But it was eatable, hit the spot. The crab Rangoon was completely different than the traditional crab Rangoon, maybe it was the curry sauce def not a fan.. Tastes like mustard instead of cream cheese. California roll was pretty good.. I'll order again but won't order the rangoons. & maybe I'll make the pad Thai spicy the next time around. Good delivery time and nice service when I ordered they get a 5 for that.

43.description: My wife and I love this place for delivery. I have never been there but it's the best Thai and sushi spot that we have found in the area. We order there at least once a week.Delivery usually takes about 45 minutes to an hour which is not badFor the sushi I get spicy tuna and it's delicious. My wife gets the pyramid which is expensive but she can never finish the roll. The Asian salad is fantastic. For Thai we get pad Thai and it's great.

2.description: This place is fantastic. The food is top notch, the service is attentive, the restaurant is clean and well maintained, and it's BYOB which is a total bonus. I've had a couple of their Thai dishes and they have all been solid. Only had their sushi once but it was fresh and delicious. The miso soup is very good and I'd recommend starting with that. The Crab Rangoon is different than your typical 'Chinese restaurant' fried frozen junk, I'd give them a shot if I were you. My only complaint, and really this is just a personal thing, is that the dining room can be a bit warm at times. I prefer a cooler temperature room myself, but this place is so good I don't care about being a little warm.

18.description: We went on july 4th and they were open. Food was fresh! Service was good. We ordered a godzilla, spider, California and spicy tuna. I will definitely go back.

41.description: Amazing sushi!!!!!! Customer service is good too they are incredibly nice! Definitely order the pyramid of Giza and dragon roll! So tummu

52.description: Nice service (thus the extra star). Food was all right. I had the wings - they we all right. The teriyaki chicken wasn't my favorite. Ice tea seemed a little on the short side.

50.description: This sushi is some of the best I've had. It's a quaint interior and the staff is very friendly. Order ahead and pickup, it's ready in 20 minutes. Try them, you won't regret it!

4.description: I love eating sushi and Spicy food , theres great selections from this place! it tastes so fresh and its not far from house. Definitely recommend it!

6.description: Hands on is a simple Asian restaurant located in Dunning. We made reservations on Open Table. They were not necessary for a Saturday night which was surprising, we were the only people there. It is not only a takeout place. There is plenty of seating but it was kind of nice being the only people there that night. They have a good menu and be sure to use the Yelp check in discount. We had the edamame, tofu frito, gyoza, and some sort of seafood dish. They were all good and will fill you up for sure.

22.description: Great food, I highly reccomend the basil fried rice! I also love the fact that Hands On is BYOB.  The service can be slow sometimes, but they are always friendly.

15.description: My boyfriend and I have been here a few times and each time, we have had a great experience. It's small and has a great vibe (acapella covers play in the background) and the sushi is amazing! It can't be beat, in my opinion. Their wasabi mayo is the bomb!!However, I wouldn't recommend the crazy noodles, because the texture is slimy and off. The veggies on it did taste good though.

57.description: By far this is the best Thai food I have had in Chicago. Food is just amazing - you can't go wrong with the menu. Customer service is excellent and you get your moneys worth with the size portions you given.  I am addicted to this place. Love, love, love.

20.description: This place is the epitome of chic dining! The restaurant have a very mellow vibe to it. But most importantly, the food is beyond delicious. The presentation of the food is flawless. The taste is also some of the best sushi I have had. Ten points to Hands on!

36.description: Super friendly staff ... Byob .... Basil fried rice is to die .... Sushi super fresh ... Golden gate roll is my fave

14.description: I literally made a yelp account solely for the purpose of reviewing this place. Besides the fact that service was incredibly poor, the mediocre sushi was over priced and gave me food poisoning within six hours of eating. If I could give no stars I would. Back to shitting my pants.

1.description: This review is my review for the Fullerton location only.Buyer Beware!!!! Ordered a sausage and pepperoni football pizza for delivery. Delivery person dropped off a roast beef and pepperoni pizza. Called them before the delivery guy was off the block to tell them about it and said we haven't eaten any of it and don't want it.Aparently, I sound like I have to much Melanin in my skin because she replied if you ate out of it we can't do nothing about it. I replied, I already told you we didn't eat it. Their reply was.... well your order says roast beef and pepperoni so that's what you got. After arguing for 5 minutes. I said ok. Nevermind. Just lost a good paying customer and good delivery tipper :(

9.description: I have been going to Mama Luna's for years on Fullerton, this new location is near my home very happy for that. The custermer service much better and great tasting pizza just like the original Mama Luna's, # 1 thin crust pizza in Chicago if you ask me. "It's a MUST try"

12.description: HORRIBLE PIZZA AND TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICEEven giving them one star is too much. The pizza is terrible! The sauce tastes terrible and the cheese is rubber. It left a terrible after taste in our mouths. After calling to complain that no one was touching their pizza we were put on hold 3x and a half hour later they finally came to a resolution which they were extremely rude about. Not to mention they said our pizza would arrive in 45 mins to an hour. Almost an hour and a half later we  received our order and it was ice cold. NEVER AGAIN! To say they have award winning pizza is a joke. I've had better frozen food than this.

21.description: Great food great prices, fresh and fast love it! Pizza was great thin crust, and also order a double cheese burger, was also very good.

16.description: The pizza is great. We used to order from the Fullerton location a long time ago. Great to have them in the neighborhood now. We've been ordering from here the last couple of times we've had pizza. Nothing out of this world, but definitely a solid pie.

17.description: I tried the pizza here tonight. It was quite good! This will probably be my new go to neighborhood pizza joint. I'm curious to how the rest of the menu fares. Heed caution, there's no seating area. It's just pickup and delivery, which is fine. We needed some solid pizza in this neighborhood. Glad to see that they've moved in!

10.description: Great pizza! Great price! The Mama Luna's Special is great! Free liter of Pepsi with order...yes it's hot...but it's at no additional charge to you. Will order from here again. On a side note I hope the staff can be a little friendlier next time.

5.description: Delivery was fast. Driver delivered pasta to us and not pizza they came back right away fixed the mistake. Pizza was salty. Does not taste the same as the Mama Luna's on Fullerton.

11.description: Their pizza is really good!  Whenever I don't have time to cook, they are my first choice for a take-out.

3.description: The guy on the phone was rude and acted like he was doing me a favor.  He tells me it's cash only, which I didn't have on me so I called back once I got it.  I place my order and am told it will be one hour.  50 minutes later I get a call telling me that they are out of chicken wings and  that the kitchen is backed up.  They had no offer for, nor compensation for inconveniencing me and my friends.  How can a restaurant that's been in business so long not have a way of appeasing customers under these circumstances?!  It was almost 1 a.m. when they called. No place was left open near me to order from.  I cancelled the order and will NEVER give them my business again.

0.description: Great pizza place for the neighborhood. Everything is prepared with good gradients. The chicken and bread was a little bit greasy. The service was polite and friendly. Much better than Domino's or Pizza Hut.

20.description: HORRIBLE PIZZA AND TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICEEven giving them one star is too much. The pizza is terrible! The sauce tastes terrible and the cheese is rubber. It left a terrible after taste in our mouths. After calling to complain that no one was touching their pizza we were put on hold 3x and a half hour later they finally came to a resolution which they were extremely rude about. Not to mention they said our pizza would arrive in 45 mins to an hour. Almost an hour and a half later we  received our order and it was ice cold. NEVER AGAIN! To say they have award winning pizza is a joke. I've had better frozen food than this.

19.description: I was almost not going to get pizza from here because of that bad review but I'm glad I did. I ordered a large pizza and spaghetti and it was delicious.  This is my new pizza spot. ..

2.description: Received the wrong order for delivery and they refused to replace it.

18.description: Great food great prices, fresh and fast love it! Pizza was great thin crust, and also order a double cheese burger, was also very good.

13.description: Like this new spot. Really convenient for this neighborhood. Pizza is good nothing that's gonna wow you, but it's fast and prices are very decent. When you have a house full of young kids and friends I can feed them all for under 25 dollars with there mega ball pizza. This place definitely has better costumer service than the one on fullerton ave. Warning the pizza is extra greasy but if I wanted something not greasy I might as well just get a salad.

4.description: We live in the neighborhood & have ordered from here almost weekly. Pizza has been really good. Then last weekend for the Super Bowl we ordered a pizza.  They say it's an hour wait if we pick it up & 2 hours for delivery so my BF goes to pick it up over an hour later & there are 10+ people waiting for their pizzas as well.  They can't tell my BF when our pizza will be ready & since we had people over my BF tells them to cancel the order & we'll figure it out. Over 2 1/2 hours later they call to say our pizza is ready. Really???!! It's the Super Bowl & they knew that so they should've been more prepared. Customer service leaves a lot to be desired.

6.description: I love this place for their mega size pizza!! It's a great buy for a party... the staff is always friendly and courteus. I have also tried their buffalo wings, but they are not that great... which is why I stick only to the pizza...

15.description: Good pizza and the sausage on the pizza is very good and the extra perk of soda makes it a better deal. Will order again

7.description: Recently ordered a football size pizza and was completely satisfied.  I mean the pizza was enough to feed our party of 20 people and was very reasonably priced.  We also ordered a small order of wings,  I wasn't able to try one,  but those that did said it was really good. So if your looking for some good and reasonably priced pizza,  I suggest giving this place a try.

8.description: The pizza is just below a frozen pizza . It came before delivery time yet was only lukewarm? We ordered potato skins that were warm but yet not cooked? Then the delivery charge yes I know normally about 3.50 for some joints but because we live a block past Austin it's another 1.50? Really we are right down Addison. You only have to make 1 turn. This place wasn't horrible but somehow it wasn't good. This has been a very confusing meal. Maybe an off day because I ordered from here because of all the good reviews....

14.description: Huge fan of mama lunas especially this location delicious thick pizza and thin pizza no complaints. Soda is hot but that's why we have ice ladies and gentleman.

1.description: Great spot for shoes of any style. Unfortunately they often don't have extras of sizes, so whatever is out there is what is available. The employees are friendly and help keep the store neat. Would definitely return to get cute comfy shoes

0.description: I do Love my Skechers, and when I am lucky enough to find an OutletStore I feel like I hit the lottery.. okay, not really but it sounded really good!And, up until yesterday I had only been in one other Skechers Outlet Storehere in the city and Boy, was that one in a bad hood, located at North Aveand Cicero, kinda scary!But then I found this Outlet Store located in a good hood, located on theNorthwest Side of Chicago and Boy, was I loving this!Yes, I do love my Skechers, and even though that lame Brooke Burke Charvethas been their Spokesgirl for like forever, damn, I want to apply for this job!I would praise my Skechers, indeed I would.. okay enough about that!Skechers are some of the most comfortable athletic shoes I have ever worn,and they have gotten me through a lot, many trips to Petsmart, and manyother places I have gone exploring.. However, my place of employment willnot let me wear them to work, which in the future I may feel the need torebel against.,. That's me.. always a Rebel with a Cause!Now, this particular outlet/location was pretty great, they had some greatshoes and styles in stock at low prices and then they always have a buy 1pair get the 2nd. pair 50% off deal going on.The store associates were walking around asking everyone if they neededhelp, yadda yadda.Now, I will admit, sometimes this bugs the hell out of me because I feelthat if I need help I will ask for it.. Sheesh....But, can't blame these guys for trying to make a sale I guess...So, if you haven't tried out a pair of Skechers yet, you owe it to yourselfto do so.And, I found this gorgeous pair of Suede Boots with Fringes for $29.99!I Love Suede, Fringes and I Love You Skechers!Brooke Burke Charvet..Not so much....
